122412005.content: The last Visbane evaporates in a puff of dark smoke and she returns to the two unconscious figures. She kneels and extends a slender finger from her cloak, taking a pulse from the human of the two.

122412006.content: She feels the regular rhythm under her fingertip and looks down at them—they are still holding hands. She smiles, with a sigh, then shakes her head.

122412007.content: I never expected to meet again like this. Should I take a photo of you? I could send it to you next time I write. Just imagine your face when you see it...

122412008.content: But for now, I'll let you sleep. And anyway, I'm more interested in this girl by your side at the moment.

122412010.content: She strokes the red lines etched into Ver's skin by some strange force before pulling out a metallic bracelet, which she places on Ver's wrist.

122412011.content: This looks bad. If we don't get it under control... you'll die, I guess. But at least there's a good reason to take you back now... Ah, Jianbing?

122412012.content: Above that vast abyss, a figure flies backwards through the void, firing arrows of bright white light along its own path. Behind it, the Source Layer rift closes.

122412013.content: Think I killed 'em all... Who's there?

122412014.content: Jianbing is panting and covered in wounds, still recovering from that deadly fight in the darkness. But as soon as he touches down he realizes that something is wrong.

122412015.content: First, there's the huge hole where, before he was stuck in the rift, used to be flat ground. Then there's the bursts of light coming from the Astral Engine up above. His eyes darken.

122412016.content: Then he looks to the young woman in the cloak and the two figures she is attending to. He gathers himself and heads their way.

122412018.content: Long time no see, right? You still recognize me?

122412019.content: Of course. We worked together during the Cloudsong Crisis.

122412020.content: You look like you've seen some action. Nobody up there has any idea where you are. Did you get ambushed?

122412021.content: Something like that. By a Cognizant Visbane. Grey skin, wears a hat. Been fighting in the Source Layer for... two days?

122412024.content: You could have said hello to him if you'd got here five minutes sooner.

122412026.content: Ah, now that's the Jianbing I know.

122412027.content: And you're as unreadable as ever, Thoth. Hurry up and tell me what's happening up there. Don't pretend you don't know.

122412028.content: Hey, I only got here half an hour ago. I don't know anything about that mess up there, except that I'll have to deal with it. So I can't tell you much.

122412029.content: What I do know is that Yu Jing is in serious trouble. If you've still got the strength to get up there and help, you'd better do it quickly.

122412030.content: How about these two? How did they end up here?

122412031.content: They're fine. I came to save them, as it happens. If you'd been ten minutes earlier you could have seen Verthandi save Yu Jing. Quite the fireworks show.

122412032.content:
She saved Yu Jing... I see.
Well, if they wake up, say thanks from me. I'm going up and see what I can do.

122412033.content: Jianbing looks down, a little warily, at the much-changed Ver and nods. Then he aims his bow at the sky and lets the Divine Grace bowstring free. Ripples in space quickly form, creating a stairway upwards to Yu Jing.

122412034.content: Jianbing takes the first step upwards and then is whisked away by the distortions, a rainbow dash of light aimed skywards.

122412036.content: Last time I was in Xu Heng, wasn't it a huge mess just like this one? They say history repeats itself and you can start and end the story anywhere on that cycle, but... I don't know. It's never exactly the same.

122412037.content: What will be different this time? From what I saw thirty years ago.

122412038.content: Wow, has it really been that long?

122423001.content: Captain Thoth, Bane Energy signals across the area are holding steady. We just need to clean up the ones still... Captain Thoth?

122423003.content: Thoth is looking skywards, apparently oblivious to her subordinate's report. There's a faint smile on her lips—something between curious and impressed.

122423004.content: The tremors have stopped. Has their "Astral Engine" worked?

122423005.content: Next to her, Lingguang holds her hand to her mouth. A look of relief starts to appear on her face before all the tension leaves her body. Her eyes well up.

122423006.content: It seems so... They've really done it.

122423007.content: Zhiming and Zhu didn't let us down.

122423008.content:
And that means my job is done too.
I need to find somewhere quiet to do some reading. I'm due a vacay.

122423009.content: CORG has been a great help during the last three months.

122423010.content: The Quad has done all the heavy lifting. How long is it since you've had a break? Two years? Three?

122423011.content: We can't complain. Xu Heng was in crisis and it's our duty to deal with that. But the chief has gone a long time without a break. She needs a long vacation.

122423012.content: I just hope we'll be able to let go of any old grudges, and get on with our own jobs as best we can.

122423013.content: You really think so? Back at the start, our president opted to abandon Xu Heng. Even now, I hear people talking about it.

122423014.content: Everyone was just hoping for the best, including me. You had your own considerations, your own difficulties. There's no point in rehashing old conflicts now.

122423015.content: That's very generous of you, Doc. If only the top brass agreed with you...

122423016.content: Tracked down the last few Visbanes?

122423018.content: Good. Mop 'em up and report in when you're done.

122422002.content: I'm fine... A Visbane winged me. No biggie.

122422003.content: Bane Energy corruption? You've got to go see Doctor Lingguang now. No time to waste.

122422005.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. But Doctor Lingguang is right over there. You should get yourself checked out before it becomes anything serious.

122422007.content: Doctor Lingguang! Would you take a look at my friend over here please? He's hurt.

122422010.content: Oh! Captain Thoth! Nothing major, I'm still good to go.

122422011.content: Hold on. It... stopped hurting? Already?

122422012.content: Ha ha! Thanks! You've helped us once again.

122422014.content:
Just did what I could.
Any wound can turn bad, so come to me if anyone needs to be treated.

122422015.content: Oh... Then maybe there's something you can help me with.

122422016.content: You got perfect marks on the psychological tests. I'm not sure if that means you have a flawless mind or if you're overperforming and could collapse at any minute.

122422017.content: Maybe a bit of both? But personally, neither seems right.

122422018.content:
Anyway, no matter how stressed I am usually, I should be able to relax now.
The celebration for this "new" Yu Jing should last a long time.

122422019.content: The two walk through the Quad gate, but the cheers from the streets outside can still be heard over the walls. The Quad buildings have only recently been completed, but the place is already busy, with people rushing back and forth, smiling.

122422020.content: Hope, hope so real you can almost touch it, is more persuasive than any promise. With the Astral Engine working, Xu Heng is safe, and everyone's happy.

122422021.content: I need to report to the chief. You can take a rest here, Captain Thoth.

122422022.content: I need to update the president too...

122422023.content: Actually, there is something I'm curious about. Placing the engine was an engineering job. So why did your chief Gengchen need to be there? Was she worried there would be trouble?

122422024.content: I'm sure she had her reasons. And if she doesn't want to explain them, it isn't my place to guess.

122422026.content: I just respect our leader. Maybe to an outsider it looks like blind faith. I can live with that. Seems to me, she's earned that respect.

122422027.content: You're high enough in CORG to know about Primes and their significance... Someone who can hold on to their faith over the course of centuries is surely worth trusting.

122422028.content: When Lingguang leaves, Thoth stares at her terminal for a while, deep in thought, before looking up at that huge machine hanging in the sky. She doesn't call anyone. She just walks towards the hills at the rear of the Quad.

122422029.content: And, as expected, she finds her path blocked.

122422031.content: Oh, please. Doctor Lingguang and I were just discussing how we had to leave our old grudges behind us. And here you are, telling me I'm an outsider already.

122422032.content: We explained yesterday. Once the Astral Engine is launched, no one can go near the rear hills. Which is why I'm here. I'm sure you understand.

122422034.content: You got a problem with that? Anything to do with the Astral Engine is confidential, as agreed. So no curious onlookers.

122422035.content: Ha-ha. Curiosity isn't that easy to switch off, unfortunately.

122422036.content: The unknown is always the most intriguing. Particularly those things we can see, but can not examine closely. Add in a bit of belief in our ability to learn and people start to get certain ideas—

122422037.content: "If it exists, it shall be found. And if it is found, it shall be understood."

122422038.content: You think someone has designs on the Astral Engine?

122422039.content: I'm more interested in what's going on in your head. You seem so serious. Where's your joy, your relief? You'd be completely out of place on the streets right now.

122422040.content: I suppose there's only one other person looking as serious as you right now—the chief, Gengchen. You're both more cautious and worried than I am. You're still on alert.

122422041.content: Was saving Xu Heng the right thing to do or not? Will the price we've paid today seem too high at some point in the future...?

122422044.content: Two months ago, when you went against CORG orders and helped us buy the time we needed, you said you believed we could save Xu Heng. Did you mean it?

122422045.content: I did. I believed you could do it, and you've proven me right. But trusting you then doesn't mean trusting you forever.

122422046.content: Likewise. So we will take good care of our own business here with the Astral Engine.

122422047.content: Nobody at the Quad is going to let the chief down, not to mention the people of Xu Heng. We will defend the Astral Engine to the last of us.

122422048.content: That was the promise made back in the day. But to be honest, Turing...

122422049.content: Mengzhang stands behind Turing, his gaze turns slightly downwards, as if he is thinking of something else as he talks.

122422050.content: Sometimes I think people struggle to adapt. Not me. I can be flexible. I don't need to pretend otherwise, now we're alone. Only you and I will know what happens here.

122422051.content: So, perhaps we could work together, you and I?

122432001.content: Thirty years have passed. CORG's backup team has changed, though some things remain the same...

122432002.content: All buildings checked. Anti-intruder surveillance in place. Proceeding to next zone.

122432003.content: Hold on, hold on. Have you reported in at the emergency response center? It's best if they maintain overall control.

122432004.content: Our Captain is handling those formalities.

122432005.content: Your captain? I assumed you were the captain.

122432006.content: I am overseeing mission execution on her behalf. She has other tasks to complete.

122432007.content: Sounds more like she's shirking her duties...

122432008.content: Shortly after the vast Source Layer fissure in the sky heals, Luliang looks upwards to where it used to be. Just as she's enjoying her restored view, her terminal buzzes.

122432009.content: My my, the comms are back, too! The good news just keeps coming.

122432012.content: The Cloudsong Ore. I'm sending you a video.

122432013.content: Luliang's heart skips a beat. She opens up the file she just received.

122432014.content: A roar coming from the depths of the earth. Shining Cloudsong Ore shattering the ground as it rises. Rocks floating skywards like untethered balloons, at a speed that might not look fatal, but...

122432015.content: I was just a kid during the Cloudsong Crisis. Can't remember what it was like. But I guess this was how it started?

122432016.content: But isn't the Astral Engine still up and running? The shield is up too. I guess if the Astral Engine's field is weakening somehow...

122432017.content: I've tried to contact the Quad, but nobody is answering.

122432018.content:
Hang on, someone's here.
Who are you?

122432019.content: A Tian Lu Traders badge? Oh, so that's what you're called now.

122432020.content: I hear the Photon Cannon's been racking up negative scores ever since it was installed. And if we don't turn things around they're going to start withholding wages.

122432022.content: You manage things down here on the streets. I'll take over the cannon.

122432023.content: Over and out from me. You keep chatting.

122432025.content: The Engine Monitoring Room sits at the foot of the hills behind the Quad and is one of its most closely protected buildings. With so many elite Mods gathered here, it's become the command post for the Quad as a whole.

122432026.content: With comms finally back up, it is also serving as a clearing house for information. Yingzhao ends the call and turns to Lingguang, nodding.

122432027.content: The boss has met up with a CORG team which came over from Ain Soph to help out. And all's well at the emergency response center, and the Quakes are more or less over.

122432028.content: That's good to hear. And the engine's shield is back up too. All we need to do is defend the Quad and wait for the chief.

122432029.content: I'm afraid it won't be that simple. Linyu, any update on the Astral Engine?

122432030.content: Yingzhao and Lingguang both look towards Linyu, who is leaning over the control panel. She looks worried, and a bit of hesitation.

122432031.content: Sister... is something wrong on the ground?

122432032.content: The Cloudsong Ore isn't holding steady.

122432034.content: Thought so...The engine's field is weakening. I've asked Mengzhang what's going on, but he hasn't got back to me.

122432035.content: Could something have gone wrong with the core replacement? I mean, it's an untested process...

122432036.content: Linyu, don't worry about what caused it now. Can you see where the problem is?

122432037.content: I can't figure it out. All indicators are in the green. Processing power is at normal levels. It's as if something is blocking the engine's influence over the outside world.

122432038.content: But I can't see anything that—

122432039.content: She looks upwards and stops in mid-sentence. It might be indiscernible to the average person, but for Linyu the disappearance of the barely visible shield is obvious.

122432040.content: She brings up the shield monitoring interface as quickly as she can, the piece of paper she's been clutching falling to the floor, forgotten. Yingzhao picks it up and glances at it. It's something about setting up a change in the shield's radius.

122432041.content: The code I set up for Mengzhang has been activated. Is he in danger?

122432042.content:
What code? What do you mean?
Wait, sorry. Aether Gazer is calling.

122432043.content: #{nickname}#? They said Mengzhang took you to the Astral Engine. What's going on up there?

122432044.content: The conversation seems to end sooner than Lingguang expected. She stares at her terminal for a moment, absorbing the information she's been given. Then she turns and sprints towards the rear hills.

122432046.content: Yingzhao, stay here and look after Linyu. I'm going up to the engine. Mengzhang needs help.

122432047.content: Up there!? How did anyone get in there?

122432048.content: I only know that Turing's up there. How he got in, I don't know. And I don't know where the pair from Aether Gazer have gone to, either. We need more people, everywhere.

122432049.content: But protecting Linyu is important too. If anything happens to Mengzhang, we'll need her to keep the engine running.

122432051.content: I hope so, but we can't leave him alone. I'm going up to join him. Hutao can take over here.

122432052.content: And nobody is to follow me unless I give the order. We don't know what Turing is capable of.

122441001.content: With Gremory and Novich dispatched on their separate missions, Turing and Mengzhang are left alone in the huge control room.

122441002.content: Turing relaxes his gravity hold on Mengzhang slightly as he turns his attention to deciphering the engine's programming. But Mengzhang doesn't try to escape. He knows he wouldn't get far.

122441003.content: I thought you said you didn't need me any longer. So why let me live?

122441004.content: Wise individuals value life for its potential to change outcomes. If they're indifferent to death, it's because death itself becomes a worthwhile option.

122441005.content: But it's merely an option. If your death leads to the optimal solution to your current problem and you choose to kill yourself... I will not stop you.

122441006.content: Ah, I hate it when someone sees right through me. Now, how do I get myself out of this...

122441008.content: Do you promise you'll leave when you have the Sephirah Core?

122441009.content: I have been clear about my intentions. Nothing else matters to me.

122441010.content: Then let's work together. We both get what we want.

122441011.content: Turing glances disdainfully at Mengzhang, clearly assuming he's just trying to buy time. Mengzhang doesn't display any annoyance—he just keeps watching what Turing is doing, muttering to himself.

122441012.content: "The Astral Engine will not fall as long as one person remains at the Quad."

122441013.content: That was the promise made back in the day. But to be honest, Turing... Back then, nobody could have predicted a situation like this. And if they had predicted it, they wouldn't have made such big promises.

122441014.content: Sometimes I think people struggle to adapt. Not me. I can be flexible. I don't need to pretend otherwise, now we're alone. Only you and I will know what happens here.

122441015.content: So, perhaps we could work together, you and I?

122441016.content: Five minutes ago, you were refusing to work with me. Now, you want to help. How convincing do you think you are?

122441017.content: I've spent those five minutes trying all the other alternatives. This is my only option.

122441018.content: And you are right, we can't waste time. If we keep delaying like this, everything below will be destroyed.

122441019.content: So if all you want is the Sephirah Core, I'll give it to you. You leave with what you want and I'll figure out how to install a new core and stabilize the Cloudsong Ore. Win-win.

122441020.content: Win-win, but you have to betray the Quad.

122441021.content: Yes. And once I betray the Quad, I may be expelled. Or imprisoned, never again to see the light of day...

122441022.content: But so what? I've never been loyal to anything but what I think is right. If I have to play dirty, if everyone hates me for it... I'll do it. To protect Xu Heng.

122441023.content: I am being true to myself. My conscience will be clear. That's enough for me.

122441024.content: Big talk. But unconvincing, from anyone.

122441025.content: People who think like you rarely have the ability to follow through on their lofty ideals. In your hearts, you don't truly believe what you think you believe.

122441026.content: Then let's make it simpler. Say I'm not doing this for some principle. Say it's just because I don't want to see Xu Heng destroyed. Say I don't want to waste this chance to save something. It's a simple choice, isn't it?

122441027.content: The Astral Engine failing is part of my plan. Why would I let you start it up again?

122441028.content: Seems to me I'm not the only one running out of time.

122441029.content: Wise individuals value life, because they... because we always need more time.

122441030.content: People like us, we see our goals clearly. We can see them sitting there, in the center of a maze called the unpredictability of the future. What really matters is how we get there, not which side we are on.

122441031.content: You need to leave with the Sephirah Core before the chief gets here. I need to find a way to replace the Sephirah Core before the Cloudsong Ore is completely out of control.

122441032.content: For both of us, time is our most valuable resource. So why not work together and save some of it. We can make enough of it to achieve our goals...

122441033.content: Turing stops what he's doing and raises a hand. A wall of wind slams into Mengzhang's back, sending him staggering forward, his Access Key falling to the floor. The next thing Mengzhang knows, he's standing next to Turing.

122441035.content: Ten minutes. Thank goodness, it's not as bad as I feared. If you'd done something stupid and damaged the Sephirah Core, we'd both be in trouble.

122441036.content: Turing doesn't react to Mengzhang's implied insult. He stands aside, folding his arms and watching, as Mengzhang takes over.

122441037.content: Mengzhang inserts a small memory device into the control panel and starts using a file from it to help him break through the core processing unit's defenses.

122441039.content: Okay, I'm through the outermost security monitoring system. That has to be done first, or the random code obfuscation prevents channel analysis...

122441040.content: Mengzhang glances up at the amber warning lights on the core processing unit and claps his hands, ready for the next stage. He opens some new windows on the control panel and is about to start when Turing speaks.

122441041.content: Ten minutes is a long time.

122441042.content: Please. Nobody's even seen this code before, apart from Zhiming and Zhu. Neither of them is in Xu Heng right now, so I'm the fastest option you're going to find.

122441043.content: If you ask me, you're very lucky. I'd already planned for getting rid of the pair from Aether Gazer, and Lingguang and Jianbing aren't here. If things had gone differently there's no way we could have made this deal.

122441044.content: That Linyu girl. She's Zhiming's pupil.

122441045.content:
Her? What does she know.
Being Zhiming's pupil doesn't mean anything. The streets of Shuofang Isle are crawling with them.

122441046.content: If she was of any use, I'd have brought her with me. What would be useful is Aether Gazer's Mimir system. Can't use that though, #{nickname}# was holding it. It would speed things up if we had it.

122441047.content: So, do you really think getting the Sephirah Core will give you those "answers" you want?

122441048.content: In Gaea, computing power and access rights are key to answering any question. You know how the technology works. You must understand that.

122441049.content: And there is nothing in Gaea with more of those than the Sephirah Core. So when everything else you have tried fails to answer your questions, that is where you turn.

122441050.content: And if the Sephirah Core doesn't give you what you want? Will you bring it back?

122441051.content: You are in no position to make requests.

122441052.content: I'm just trying to help. The Sephirah Core is going to be problematic once it's out in the open.

122441053.content: The Mods' pursuit is obvious. But what about your subordinates? Hard to say what they'll do, when something that could give them so much power is sitting there in front of them. People can be...unpredictable.

122441054.content: Well, if you ask me, why keep something you don't need? Since the power of the Sephirah Core doesn't interest you, might as well spare yourself the trouble.

122441055.content: You talk too much. I'm starting to doubt your sincerity.

122441056.content: Oh, come on. I'm just trying to make a conversation with my partner. We should get to know and help each other, after all we're in the same boat, aren't we?

122441057.content: Don't worry, I can work while talking. I've been multitasking like this since I was five. See—

122441058.content: With a flourish, Mengzhang taps in a final instruction. The thick metallic casing of the core processing unit splits in two, revealing a tangle of wires and ports.

122441059.content: The physical security layer is open. Which obviously you could have torn apart like a sheet of paper, but...

122441061.content: Soon, soon. That's my next job.

122441062.content: Mengzhang notices the threatening tone and decides to tone down the chit-chat. He goes back to trying to break through the complex defense systems.

122441064.content: Five minutes. No time at all. And all good things come to those who wait.

122441065.content: I mean, you can't rush me. I'm still sore and dizzy from that beating you gave me, remember?

122441068.content: You just entered twenty-six instructions unrelated to removing the core processing unit's security systems. Some were invalid, some I could not identify.

122441069.content: I see I have wasted time by trusting you so easily. Unfortunate. You will pay for this deception.

122441070.content: Mengzhang stops typing and turns to look at Turing, who is looking on without expression. Mengzhang lifts his left hand to his chin and coughs, while his right hand taps in a few final keystrokes.

122441072.content: Turing doesn't reply. He just raises a hand and gravity at the control desk changes direction. Mengzhang falls sideways, smashing into the wall, where he is held immobile by the crushing force pressing down on him, limbs outstretched and entirely defenseless.

122441073.content: You should have escaped with the Aether Gazer two when you had the chance. It's too late for your tricks now.

122441074.content: Seems you still don't understand how time works. It can be bought. But it's never cheap...

122441075.content: I have to admit, your ability to manipulate the laws of physics is stronger than I'd expected. But all abilities have their limits. If that wasn't the case you wouldn't be so scared of the chief returning, and that shield wouldn't have stopped you in your tracks.

122441076.content: And, the defense system can use Divine Grace in more ways than you know. Although it's true we didn't think to install artillery in the generator room, remember, energy is always energy.

122441078.content: Mengzhang's Access Key, still lying on the floor, chirps and the sword flies from its scabbard towards Turing. It doesn't get far before crashing into some invisible barrier, its momentum lost, ripples in the continuum appearing at its point.

122441079.content: Mengzhang looks past the sword, offering Turing a humorless grin. He didn't even glance at the scabbard that seemed to have been carried into the air by inertia.

122441080.content: That scabbard follows an arc through the air, the arc of any thrown object. An arc which ends when it lands on a red button on the control panel.

122441081.content: Why don't I give you a preview of what a Prime attack feels like? So you'll know what to expect when the chief gets here.

122441082.content: A string of commands scroll past on the screen and the shield around the core processing unit disappears. Then spots of light, blindingly bright, appear on the ceiling.

122441083.content: Turing frowns. A mix of energies flow from within him, shooting out to collide with the pillars of light rushing towards him from the ceiling.

122441084.content: Unlike previously, Turing is unable to simply brush off the attack. The pillars of light fix him in place. Flashes of light engulf him and as they do so, the force pinning Mengzhang to the wall eases.

122442001.content: Mengzhang immediately realizes what Turing means.

122442002.content: He turns to look out the window, at the black shadows far in the distance, drifting through the sky. The eerie light given off by the Cloudsong Ore is easy to recognize, even from hundreds of kilometers away.

122442003.content: Ah, I see... The laws of physics. The Astral Engine... This is your doing.

122442004.content: By manipulating the laws of physics, you diminished the stabilizing effect on the Cloudsong Ore. That means the Cloudsong Ore goes out of control, whether the engine is working or not.

122442005.content: Which means the Quad will be too busy to stop you, even if the Quakes end. And everyone will assume it's an engine malfunction, not an attack.

122442006.content: And your aim is the same as when you tried to persuade everyone to leave Xu Heng—to empty the place so you can do what you want with it, even if the Sephirah Core is returned to the Hall of the Heart. Am I right?

122442008.content: The hit to his stomach leaves Mengzhang gasping for breath. It's soon followed by a sledgehammer-like blow to his chest.

122442009.content: Mengzhang has no time to dodge either attack. He flies through the air, spinning, until he collides with the railing around the control panel. How many bones have been broken? How many muscles torn? Even a Mod will need some time to recover from so much damage.

122442010.content: Your use of the engine has given me some ideas. I've planned out my next steps. Implementing them should take... three minutes?

122442011.content: Turing, who has silently appeared by the control panel, starts to work, tapping in his instructions much faster than previously. The hardware locks on the core processor unit start to open. In response, Turing just types faster.

122442012.content: Mengzhang watches, dazed. But he has no regrets. Left to work freely, Turing would have opened the core processing unit by now. Using the shield's attack mode delayed him significantly—that makes Mengzhang's injuries worthwhile.

122442014.content: Oh, the monitoring room's calling? Comms must be back up. It's probably Linyu. She's going to assume there's a problem up here that's allowing the Cloudsong Ore to start moving.

122442015.content: You'd better think about how to respond without raising suspicions. Don't think you can force me to tell them all's well, though. I won't do it.

122442016.content: You won't be getting anywhere near this control panel—or a terminal.

122442017.content: Turing creates a Bane Energy crystal, which he shoots towards Mengzhang. Mengzhang dodges, but Turing seems to have anticipated his movements and the crystal smashes into the terminal Mengzhang was trying to conceal.

122442018.content: Missed by a mile. My heart's all the way over here...

122442019.content: You've failed three times in fifteen minutes. Full marks for commitment, zero for execution. Hopefully you've now learned you are no match for me.

122442020.content: But standing here watching is so boring...

122442021.content: Don't worry. I'll have a job for you soon.

122442023.content: Heh. So you do shut up sometimes.

122442024.content: What more can I say. Even a three-year-old kid knows to do their best and then quit. And I've done the best I can, for now at least.

122442025.content: Mengzhang leans against the railings and sighs deeply. He stays there, motionless. Has he given up the fight, or is he just too badly wounded to go on?

122442026.content: Two minutes later, Turing points a hand at Mengzhang and the railings he's leaning on change form—still hard and metallic, but now also flexible. The railings spring forward, like a bowstring, and send Mengzhang staggering several steps forward, to Turing's side.

122442027.content:
The last access restriction.
You didn't bring anyone up, apart from the two outsiders. Which means you must know how to get past it.

122442028.content: Life signal verification. It'll take two minutes to hack it. What do you need me for?

122442029.content: I'm not going to waste two minutes when there's a quicker way.

122442030.content: Now, do we do this the dignified way, or the "I grab your head and shove it onto the scanner" way?

122442031.content: Well, if you put it like that, I guess I can do you this one small favor.

122442032.content: Mengzhang waves Turing off before clearing his throat, rolling up his sleeves, taking a deep breath, doing a quick warm-up and then, just before Turing finally loses patience, walking up to the control panel scanner.

122442033.content: The scanner—which wouldn't have been able to tell if Mengzhang was being forcibly held in place or not—quickly confirms Mengzhang's identity.

122442034.content: The hum of energy flowing through conduits in the walls recedes and the core processing unit stops spinning, the final compartment inside opening. A spherical object descends from it, giving off a soft warm glow.

122442036.content: Turing releases Mengzhang and in an instant is standing below the starlike object.

122442037.content: Mengzhang, expressionless, bends to pick up his Access Key.

122451002.content: With a gentle but firm press, the simple-looking mechanism splits in two. Now unsupported by its shell, the interlocking parts inside collapse into Mengzhang's hand.

122451003.content: He dug a small hole by the mountain path and buried within it the exquisitely made object he'd tinkered with since childhood. Then he returned to the cottage behind him, fetched a stick of incense, and planted it in the ground. He bows to it, three times.

122451004.content: Thinking it through doesn't clear the way, a flash of inspiration saves the day.

122451005.content: Oh, Zhu. Couldn't you just have told me how to do it?

122451006.content: Now the puzzle's broken. So what's the use of knowing the solution? Did you plan for this? For me to spend so long on it the wood would just rot away?

122451007.content: Mengzhang stands in front of the incense, watching the line of smoke sway back and forth in the mountain breeze until it drifts away into nothingness. The incense too burns down to nothing.

122451008.content: I don't like these puzzles with illogical solutions. What's the point of studying something if it doesn't submit to logic?

122451009.content: Okay, so I couldn't figure it out. I guess I didn't work hard enough.

122451011.content: Mengzhang looks to the horizon, where thick clouds roll over the high mountaintops. He looks a little higher, to the floating islands and the Astral Engine, only two years old.

122451012.content: Much later, as the evening light fades on the mountainsides, he sighs and returns to the cabin. He sweeps the place clean, picks up his bags, and closes the door as he leaves. He collects his Access Key, which has been sitting on the roof, untouched, for months. He brandishes it, refamiliarizing himself with the feeling.

122451013.content: 600 days. It's relaxing up here, but I can't hide away forever. You'll think I'm lazy.

122451015.content: From somewhere, Mengzhang produces an earthenware jar, which he places by the burned-up incense. He mimes taking a drink and then staggers left and right as he descends the mountain, as if drunk.

122452002.content: You can't have given it to someone else?

122452003.content: No. When you declined it, I said I would leave it open for three years. There's still a year left. I wouldn't break that promise.

122452004.content: But... I'm afraid we still don't know how the Bane Energy was able to get Zhu.

122452005.content: Ah... I expected that. If there are no leads after two years, it's probably quite straightforward. Maybe it's as I suspected at the time. She was doing some bizarre experiment and something went wrong.

122452006.content: That's why she didn't want to be the Yuyi Isle deputy herself, after all. So she could spend more time in that lab of hers. Never liked it myself, too likely to explode. This office though... very stylish. Could I have one like this?

122452007.content: Zhiming expanded this one. They aren't usually this big.

122452008.content: Mengzhang shrugs and takes a walk around, examining the office. Gengchen lets him do so, but takes a wooden token from a drawer to pass to him.

122452009.content: Mengzhang walks up to the desk and accepts the token, ceremoniously. He waits a moment, but Gengchen seems to be finished.

122452011.content: No. You've accepted the token. That makes you the Deputy of Yuyi Isle.

122452013.content: Yes. Same story when you hand it back. No paperwork or formalities. If you change your mind, just give me the token.

122452014.content: Doesn't seem worth it, all of a sudden. If it can be handed over so easily, why let it gather dust for two years waiting for me to come down from the mountain?

122452015.content: This makes me curious. Why are you so keen to give me this chunk of wood. Do you want me to copy Zhiming and set up a school on Yuyi Isle?

122452016.content: No. I have a different task in mind.

122452017.content: Mengzhang, why do you think the Quad exists? And why would I set up deputies of the four isles?

122452018.content: To keep Xu Heng safe, of course, and eliminate the Visbane threat.

122452019.content: That's what any Mod does. What else?

122452020.content: To keep the secrets of the Astral Engine and protect it from prying eyes.

122452021.content: We don't need a public position to do that. So what is it? You can be frank with me.

122452022.content: With so much to restore, collaboration is crucial. But it also brings about numerous issues.

122452023.content: Xu Heng is just starting to recover from the Cloudsong Crisis. On one hand, we need to get the economy up and running, and watch out for people who want to take advantage of the chaos.

122452024.content: But we aren't starting from nothing. We have advanced tech and well-established trade routes. If we use those properly, they can help get us back on our feet. If we fail to do that, they could put us right back where we started.

122452025.content: If you try and cross the road with your eyes closed, you're going to get hit by something. It's never wise to leave things to chance. People need a certain amount of guidance. That's what the deputies are for. To listen to all the different points of view and steer the ship in the right direction.

122452026.content: Is that really what you think? You're asking a lot of the Quad.

122452027.content: It's what I'd hope to see. Am I wrong?

122452028.content: The Quad is not here to determine the future. We hope for something better, but all we can do is tackle the problems we face today.

122452029.content: The deputies for the three other isles are already in their posts. Zhiming is an ingenious inventor. Jianbing is a courageous soldier. Lingguang is kind and generous. Examples to us all. The public will listen to them. And talk to them, too.

122452030.content: Uh, are you sure you've given this job to the right person? I don't have their ambition or ideals. Or their morals. I just want to do my job and then kick back and enjoy myself.

122452031.content: Zhu often told me what you were like, and I can form my own opinions. And we're alone, so you can stop with the act.

122452032.content: The Quad mostly works in the open and tries to set an example. If we were talking about our public work, then yes, there are more suitable people.

122452033.content: But not everything is done in the open. The most intractable problems are often hidden in the shadows. But they cannot be ignored.

122452034.content: You are resourceful and... a little sneaky? A schemer, but not without loyalty. Unmoved by material advantage. You are the perfect man to deal with those problems.

122452035.content: Ugh... Sounds like an endless stream of annoying jobs.

122452036.content: You came to ask for the job. I'm sure you are up to it.

122452037.content: When the world is at peace, you will feel at ease even when you're worn out. When the world is in chaos, even a mountain hideaway will feel threatened.

122452038.content: Not all great people have to be moral giants. Joining the Quad doesn't mean your hands are tied. I want you to use those strengths and skills to protect Xu Heng.

122452039.content: Ha ha. You're showing more faith in me than I'm used to...

122452041.content: It's not an easy path to take and at times you will feel alone and helpless. Perhaps you have to make some sacrifices. Perhaps you'll try every trick you can come up with and still fail... But even when all else has failed, someone has to keep trying until these problems are solved.

122452042.content: It's the same for the Quad. Ever since it was founded, we've been trying things without knowing if they would work. We've had to keep faith in our ability to get the job done. It's something we must never lose.

122452043.content: As to whether you keep that token or not... your call.

122452044.content: On one side of the token is written Yuyi Isle. On the other is carved the Quad emblem. Mengzhang looks down at it as he turns it back and forth in his palm. It seems heavier than before. Then, with a raised eyebrow and a smile, he tucks it away in his sleeve.

122452045.content: Ha! Sounds like an endless stream of fun challenges.

122452046.content: And personally, I've never run out of tricks.

122452047.content: The sword soars, bearing Mengzhang aloft and creating a myriad of blades of light in its own image, all of which fly towards Turing. Mengzhang seems even stronger than before he was hurt.

122452048.content: Turing, sensing something amiss, spins and lifts a hand to block Mengzhang's furious attack. The blades of light shatter into bright flakes, an onrushing avalanche which sends Turing staggering back two steps.

122452049.content: Mengzhang knows escape is not an option. He lands and takes a fighting stance, glaring at his foe.

122452050.content: I've reconsidered. You can't have it.

122452051.content: Why would someone as wise as you choose to die?

122452052.content: Someone as wise as me knows when there's only one choice. I like it when there's only one choice. Cuts down on thinking time.

122452053.content: To value your life, but not cling to it... Is this really worth dying for, though?

122452054.content: Seeing Mengzhang is about to attack again, Turing sneers, shakes his head, and then raises a hand.

122462001.content: All Visbanes within sensor range have been eliminated. No new Bane Energy signals detected. Spatial structure nominal... Confirmed across all Yu Jing.

122462003.content: The evacuated city now falls almost completely silent. The only sounds to be heard are the buzz of updates being delivered across the tactical headsets worn by the soldiers spread across the city streets.

122462004.content: And then, outbreaks of cheering across the city. Perhaps the only time it would ever be possible to give noisy vent to such emotion at night without waking half the city.

122462005.content: Phew. That was exhausting. Okay, my CORG buddies, I'll leave the rest to you. I'm due a few days of rest and relaxation.

122462006.content: Boss Luliang, please do not leave yet. There are some procedures with which we require your assistance.

122462007.content: This was a major Quake incident. CORG will need to know the details surrounding these events.

122462009.content: Yingzhao—Ah, the head butler, she's at the Quad.

122462010.content: I wonder what's happening over there. It looks like the engine is running well, though.

122462011.content: Luliang glances off towards the Quad. She cannot, being a dozen or so neighborhoods away, see anything.

122462012.content: But the soft glow coming from the Astral Engine is reassuring. Luliang taps on her terminal, filling in the joint operation registration form she has received and keeping one eye on the CORG operatives setting up some kind of equipment. A charging post?

122462013.content: Hey, what are you doing there?

122462014.content: It's an Integrated Environmental Monitoring System. A lot of the city's monitoring gear has been damaged or is inaccurate.

122462015.content: There may be ongoing issues arising from the Quakes. It is unlikely these will be serious, but they should be dealt with promptly to avoid any threat to life or property.

122462016.content: Wow, sounds like a useful toy! How come I've never seen you use one before?

122462017.content: Tech gap. We need to avoid humanity coming into contact with more advanced technology, in order to ensure we do not interfere with your normal developmental—

122462019.content: Without any warning, the ground starts to shake. The newly installed IEMS is almost overturned. Luliang gasps and closes her terminal, without even saving her work on the form.

122462020.content: Luliang can barely believe she's standing on a city street. It's as if the ground below her is no longer solid, but a leaf floating on a pond, rocked by every tiny ripple and gentle breeze.

122462021.content: And for the second time that night, the halo of light in the sky disappears. But this time, the Astral Engine keeps moving. It shows no sign of falling and the plasma thrusters are not active...

122462022.content: Then all returns to normal, as if someone has simply knocked against a switch by accident, caused a momentary problem, and then flicked the switch back on to return all to normal.

122462023.content: But as the seconds tick away, it becomes clear that this is no lucky escape. A minute's silence is enough to confirm it.

122462024.content: Something's wrong. I have to get back to the Quad!

122462025.content: Luliang feels a shockwave slam down into Yu Jing and looks up, stunned. She sees another Source Layer fissure open, just where the beam of light that was Gengchen disappeared.

122462026.content: A red tide of Bane Energy flows from the fissure, from who knows what terrifying realm.

122462027.content: It's over. And you've sacrificed what little life you have left to gain... a minute.

122462028.content: A minute. Ha ha. I thought it was less.

122462029.content: Mengzhang is leaning on his sword. Blood drips down from under his sleeve and when he breathes there's a worrying whistling sound, as if air is leaking out somewhere.

122462030.content: He stares fixedly at the Sephirah Core in Turing's hand, then at the core processing unit, now completely silent its core has been removed. His eyes grow ever more resolute.

122462031.content: Already too long. Your resistance is pointless.

122462032.content: You don't get to decide if it's pointless or—

122462033.content: The mocking smile on Mengzhang's lips is only half-formed when he is slammed backwards to crash into a pillar supporting the ceiling. Blood spreads from a wound in his chest.

122462034.content: A bone-penetrating cold spreads through Mengzhang's body. He looks down, every move agony, to see a twisted metal bolt piercing his chest, hot red blood filling its spiral threads, spreading ever further.

122462035.content: Mengzhang opens his mouth, as if to speak, but his vision blurs for a moment. When he can see again, that one metal bolt has become four. He forces himself to note their positions. Left shoulder... Right arm... Guts...

122462036.content: He seems to fall into his own wounds, into a vortex of blood. His awareness starts to recede. His body no longer belongs to him. Is he even alive?

122462037.content: He stops breathing. His heartbeat ceases.

122471002.content: A yellowing leaf drifts to land on the board. Gengchen gazes at it as she places another stone, then looks out from the pavilion, deep in thought.

122471003.content: The walnut tree's mottled canopy rustles in the fall breeze, the leaves silhouetted against the clouds beyond. The two sit in the pavilion, facing each other across the board. The battle of black and white is drawing to a close, but all is still to play for.

122471004.content: Umm, my humble skills in the game are no match for your talents, but it does seem that move has gone awry.

122471005.content: The young girl seems discontented, and this brings Gengchen's attention back to the board. Sure enough, in her distraction she misplaced the stone and lost a battle.

122471009.content: That being said, it feels like all my strategic planning for the entire game was wasted... After all, my victory was due to your mistake.

122471010.content: Any game which remains undecided at this point is already a good game. Moreover, you have not won yet.

122471011.content: How confident you are. Then let us see how you recover from your setback.

122471012.content: One leaf does not a fall make. What troubles you?

122471013.content: The people have moved to the five isles and the Astral Engine will soon be working. Prosperity will return and all will be well.

122471014.content: It reminds me of the uproar inside and outside Xu Heng when the Quad first proposed this plan four or five years ago. Those voices, however, are now silent.

122471015.content: You overcame the dissenters years ago. Why worry? Is it the Sephirah Core?

122471016.content: Nothing lasts forever. What is done once must be done again. What falls must be rebuilt. I have to remain alert to this.

122471017.content: I have been wondering, lately, whether or not we would continue on this path if our choices today might result in even greater crisis for Xu Heng in the future.

122471018.content: After all, as Mods, we should not interfere in humanity's choices.

122471019.content: On this occasion, the CORG captain, Thoth, stood up for us, and we were able to resolve our differences with them. That may not happen next time.

122471021.content: The midgame relies on aggression, the endgame on the fundamental skills. The two chat as they play. The game draws slowly to its always-inevitable end.

122471022.content: The back-and-forth tapping of stones on board ends as both find themselves deep in thought.

122471023.content: If there is to be a next time, we have no way of knowing when that will be. Can you always be here to protect Xu Heng?

122471024.content: I cannot be here forever. That is why we have the Quad.

122471026.content: Exactly. It is as true for Mods as it is for humans.

122471027.content: And what of you? It would be a lonely life for you, forever suppressing chaos within Mount Xiaoyang.

122471028.content: I have a large territory and it is mine to do with what I will. Ruomu Palace is more comfortable than your Quad.

122471029.content: And it may be quiet up there in the mountains, but I can relieve any boredom like this, sending a replica out for a wander. And if I want to liven things up, I can take on a few pupils.

122471030.content: So, if you happen across anyone suited to the Astral Arcanum, do inform me.

122471031.content: I've never understood the Astral Arcanum.

122471032.content: It doesn't require much. A straightforward mind, free of worldly attachments. I can find a home for anyone like that, if needed.

122471033.content: Children, now that I think about it, are ideal. But don't send me any naughty ones. I would hate to have my peaceful retreat disturbed by shouting and horseplay. I'd rather live alone.

122471034.content: It is no bad thing for our youngers to have a little personality. They inherit from us, but also improve on what we give them. They find their own ways.

122471035.content: You will not always be master of the Astral Arcanum, just as I will not always be protector of Xu Heng. We must make room for our successors.

122471036.content: This... This has been quite the diversion.

122471037.content: Xihe claps her hands to her head and laughs, then takes a closer look at the board. She pulls out her terminal and takes a photo.

122471038.content: Triple ko. A draw for sure. You can pore over the photo all you like, but it's a draw.

122471039.content: Nope, it's for a keepsake. After all, this is a rare draw in thousands of games. Aren't you more excited?

122471040.content: I'm not sure it's worth taking a photo of...

122471041.content: The leaves on the walnut tree rustle, warning of fall's cool. Gengchen looks down at the deadlocked game, quiet.

122471042.content: Hmm, if you find a draw dull, since I was the first to play with black pieces, how about we say you won?

122471043.content: I don't recall that being in the rulebook. Anyway, it's hardly a draw. More that the fight can never end.

122471044.content: A draw for us players, a loss for all the stones on the board. The lack of an ending can be the hardest of all conclusions.

122471045.content: Gengchen puts the game away and steps outside the pavilion.

122471046.content: A breeze rises to meet her. Leaves fall from the trees, paving the path that leads off to the setting sun.

122471047.content: Footsteps fade into the distance in a leisurely rhythm. A going home.

122471049.content: This is Mengzhang's last thought before losing consciousness.

122471050.content: (It's better it's only me here. Only me to die... But the Sephirah Core...)

122471051.content: His four wounds are numb now, his vision blurred. He can't see Turing clearly, much less the Sephirah Core.

122471052.content: He can't respond to the final killing blow which Turing is preparing to deliver. Perhaps he doesn't even know it is coming.

122471053.content: Reflect, before you die, on how you have overestimated yourself.

122471054.content: A Bane Energy crystal forms from Turing's hand, almost as tall as he is. He's about to send it flying towards Mengzhang when he senses something behind him. He turns and shoots it in that direction.

122471055.content: Behind him, outside the window, a Source Layer fissure is closing, the Bane Energy emanating from it forced back within by a stream of Divine Power. And beyond the indicator lights on the outer ring of the Astral Engine, a trail of light zooms across the sky—

122471056.content: It's traveling from the closing fissure to the control room. It shatters the glass in the windows, it smashes Turing's hastily summoned defenses. A swirl of black and white send him to the ground.

122471057.content: And at the same time, a flood of Divine Grace enters Mengzhang. It drives out the darkness rising within him and rekindles the light.

122471060.content: Mengzhang has never liked to rely on the chief's aid, but her arrival is no small relief. He relaxes, his wounds and his trip to the very edge of death forgotten, and smiles through his coughs.

122471061.content: His eyes are still full of pain and exhaustion, and something else. A hint of worry and sadness even he is not aware of.

122481001.content: Turing! I knew it was you—Chief...

122481002.content: Oh, you're going to let her help you?

122481003.content: This has nothing to do with her. I'm here now.

122481005.content: Lingguang, recognizing the figure emerging from the Source Layer, has rushed to the Astral Engine. She enters the control room and takes in the scene she finds there.

122481006.content: Gengchen and Turing are facing off in the center of the room. Mengzhang is pinned to a pillar and looks close to death.

122481008.content: Lingguang, get Mengzhang out of here.

122481013.content: Lingguang can see how badly Mengzhang is hurt. She removes the metal bolts holding him in place and uses Divine Power to stem the flow of blood. She pulls him to his feet and nods towards Gengchen.

122481014.content: Lingguang has to turn her back on Turing, but she knows she's safe. She can sense how he and Gengchen have no time to even look at anyone else. They may seem calm on the surface, but below that they're probing at each other's defenses.

122481015.content: Lingguang takes one last look back, she conceals her inner anxiety and departs from the Astral Engine with Mengzhang.

122481017.content: A little... (Cough)... Still alive, at least.

122481018.content: The sounds of combat from outside the Quad have calmed. Lingguang recalls the Divine Power she's been using to heal Mengzhang and is relieved to see his eyes open.

122481019.content: You stay here and rest. I'll figure out how to help the chief.

122481020.content: Don't... Don't go back up. Take me to Linyu.

122481021.content: Linyu can handle things in the Engine Monitoring Room. You need to take a rest.

122481022.content: I know she can. If it wasn't for her, I wouldn't be here. Nor would the engine.

122481023.content: But I'm too badly hurt to do what needs to be done. She's the only other option.

122481024.content: It'll only take a few minutes. I can use the breathing technique you taught me to control the Bane Energy corrosion.

122481026.content: Deputy Lingguang! Deputy Mengzhang! What happened?

122481027.content: Hutao, what are you doing here? What's the latest?

122481028.content: The Astral Engine's stopped moving, of course I had to come up and check! We've been looking for the two of you everywhere. Is everything alright up there?

122481029.content: The chief and Turing are still there. We need to give the chief some time. We shouldn't get in her way.

122481032.content: Hutao falls silent but is clearly angry. But when Lingguang says nothing more, he sighs and accepts Mengzhang's instructions. He's soon back to business.

122481033.content: I'm sorry. To answer your question, deputy Lingguang: we've pretty much taken care of all the Visbanes, and the crisis center has sent someone to look for deputy Jianbing. I hope nothing bad's happened to him...

122481034.content: Oh, and we found boss Luliang. For some reason, she was fighting with a bunch of AGI Mechas.

122481035.content: Mechas? Are the Cognizants taking control of them again?

122481036.content: Lingguang, Hutao, go help Luliang. I can make it to the monitoring room under my own steam.

122481037.content: We need to make the best use of all the resources we have. No time to waste.

122481038.content: Okay. But no more fighting, got it? Here, take these and get some rest. We'll be back as soon as we can.

122481039.content: Mengzhang takes the bottle of pills from Lingguang and pours them down his throat, then waves the two off.

122482001.content: I don't need to repeat anything, do I? Basically, that's what's happening up there.

122482003.content: You know I'm not one to underestimate my own abilities. This is the first time I've gone up against someone who made me want to run away, and was then able to stop me doing that.

122482004.content: If he was already that powerful, and now he has the Sephirah Core... Can the chief beat him?

122482005.content: Unless he's become both omnipotent and omniscient, the chief should be okay... Ow. I wish Lingguang had some faster-working drugs... I guess I'll stand.

122482006.content: Still weak, Mengzhang tries to sit on the chair he's been leaning on. But as soon as his knees bend he grits his teeth in pain. He leans on the wall instead, wishing it was the floor. He shakes his sleeve and removes the wooden box containing the Heterocore.

122482007.content: There are only a few technicians left manning the Engine Monitoring Room and Mengzhang isn't worried about what they will see. He opens the box and hands it to Linyu.

122482008.content: The Quad still has some secrets Turing hasn't found out yet. For example, the chief's seal on the Sephirah Core and the fact the Heterocore can be used in the Astral Engine.

122482009.content: We can't be sure without trying, but with the Sephirah Core already exposed and the engine stopped... we have to give it a shot.

122482010.content: You want me to use the Heterocore to restart the Astral Engine?

122482011.content: Yes. There's a risk of overload, but we need to try while we have the chance.

122482012.content: Hold on. Mengzhang, Turing isn't going to let us wander about up there.

122482013.content: And we're just going to make the chief's job even tougher. Turing won't care if we get caught in the crossfire, but the chief will need to keep us safe.

122482014.content: No need to worry about that...

122482015.content: Mengzhang looks upwards. Two figures smash through the outer wall of the Astral Engine and land on the external propulsion system.

122482016.content: But more eye-catching than that is the sudden flash of light off at the edge of Yu Jing. It illuminates half the sky and is soon followed by a screeching, as if a meteorite is screaming through the air. Then both light and noise fade. From the city center it's impossible to see what has happened.

122482017.content: Was that Odin? No... If I'm guessing right, the chief has asked her to go and stabilize the ley lines. Otherwise we'd be seeing signs of spatial collapse due to the Sephirah Core being exposed, even with the chief's seal.

122482018.content: Could it have been Jianbing? That would be best. I also wonder what's happened to those two from Aether Gazer.

122482019.content: You think it could have had something to do with them?

122482020.content: No... Anyway, Turing and the chief have left the control room now. It's safe to go up.

122482021.content: Heterocore initiation will take a while, so install it as soon as you can. If the chief wins and comes back we can seal the Cinders in as soon as possible, to stabilize it.

122482022.content: Only the Astral Engine can get the Cloudsong Ore under control. And only you can save the Astral Engine.

122482023.content: Understood. I won't let you down!

122482024.content: Let's stop wasting time and get moving. Linyu, I'm coming with you.

122482025.content: Mengzhang allows himself a long sigh of relief as he watches the pair head, unhesitatingly, towards the Astral Engine. Then he turns to watch that battle in the sky—far off, but still majestic—and sighs again.

122482026.content: Our best-laid plans can't anticipate everything. And our best isn't necessarily good enough.

122482027.content: Oh, chief, how is a novice like me meant to know what you're planning? How would you get us out of this?

122491001.content: Gengchen's expression eases slightly as she hears Lingguang and Mengzhang leave. She looks to the Sephirah Core Turing holds and the Divine Power swirling at her fingertips darkens.

122491002.content: It took me half a year to create that Source Layer labyrinth. And it took you less than half an hour to escape. Disappointing, I admit.

122491003.content: It's always easier to destroy than to create.

122491004.content: But destruction is so hard to watch. Especially when it's of something you value.

122491005.content: And yet you chose to proceed anyway.

122491006.content: Past events already demonstrate how the Mods value the Sephirah Core.

122491007.content: But I need it, and that makes you my enemy. Why should I care for the suffering of an enemy?

122491008.content: Why do you need it so badly? To find the source of the Visbanes?

122491009.content: Turing's eyes betray a little surprise, quickly covered with a scowl, as if he's alert to some new and unknown factor.

122491011.content: Yes, the Visbanes are your sworn enemies. You would try to root us out at the source. Naturally, the processing power of the Sephirah Core might help with that.

122491012.content: The Sephirah Core was of no use. It's best to give up early.

122491014.content: As I'm sure you understand, the Cloudsong Ore is only going to become more problematic. Unless you have powers to match Gaea's, Xu Heng is doomed.

122491015.content: Yet if I told you to abandon Xu Heng, to flee with everyone you could save, you would reject the idea.

122491016.content: Do you have to do this?

122491019.content: At the cost of existence itself.

122491020.content: Perhaps you have done the same at some point. Spent years, decades, even centuries, in the pursuit of an answer to a single question.

122491021.content: And when you have spent long enough in the search, it becomes its own purpose. Continuing the search has its own value, no lesser than that of finding the answer.

122491022.content: Just what is it you want to know?

122491023.content: Hehe... Gengchen, you are a Prime Mod. You understand this world better than those in your employ.

122491024.content: But what confuses me is this. You, even you, don't seem to wonder what this world, what you, what I... what everything... means.

122491025.content: Don't you think it's worthy of investigation?

122491026.content: "You're kidding. That's the question you can't figure out the answer to?"

122491028.content: How can they do it? How can they live in such peace?

122491029.content: How do they manage to ignore the nature of the question?

122491030.content: Across the eras, across the boundless space, Turing sat in the virtual abyss, alone with his thoughts.

122491031.content: Those who cannot understand or avoid the question become so distant they no longer recognize each other. It is a relief, but also an odd feeling.

122491034.content: That power, Bane Energy, surges from Turing's arm, condensing, as thick as congealed blood.

122491036.content: It is under near-perfect control, just like that other power, Divine Grace, which circulates around Turing's other arm, with no sign of leakage.

122491037.content: If it is betrayal to possess power which does not belong to you, then what would loyalty be to them? Exactly what do they think I have betrayed?

122491038.content: Can they even tell who they are, who their selves belong to? What is truly them, not something gifted by Gaea?

122491039.content: And alongside those two sources of energy, Turing is linked to something else, something subtle. Something that might be the abyss in front of him, but might be something... more.

122491041.content: Turing looks up, into the far distance, if distance has any meaning here. Beyond it, it seems he can see something yet further away. Reality.

122491042.content: And all is silent, bar Turing's mutterings and the sound of pages being turned.

122491043.content: The quicker he thinks, the quicker the pages turn. Ultimately, he looks up and sees all the books are closed.

122491044.content: He has seen an answer. Some kind of beginning has been marked.

122491045.content: Their belief in the possibility of betrayal, their fear of it, is the shackle that prevents them from being free.

122491046.content: If you cannot step outside Gaea's rules, you can only live in the ways Gaea permits. Live happily, but unknowingly.

122491047.content: What belongs to them, what belongs to me... Are these questions I can decide myself?

122491049.content: Turing travels through the beyond in search, past the boundaries of knowledge, past the origins of thought, into a world beyond reality.

122491050.content: "There is one place you might find your answer, sir."

122491052.content: Are you willing to admit it, Mod? That you are a tool in Gaea's world?

122491053.content: The world belongs to the humans. Your questions cannot faze me.

122491054.content: You are making peace with ignorance.

122491055.content: There will always be unknowns. Even the Sephirah Core will not make you omniscient or omnipotent.

122491056.content: Answers lead only to new questions. Knowledge gives birth to not knowing. I accept this. But still I will pursue omniscience.

122491057.content: Humanity still has a desire to learn. Do you know only to avoid learning?

122491058.content: If you insist on denying the value of Gaea's existence, I can do no more to persuade you.

122491059.content: Life, civilization... these things have value simply by existing. Reality is what we perceive it to be. This is how humanity understands the world, and it is all I want from Gaea.

122491060.content: Gaea was created to protect human civilization. All within it, in whatever form—humanity, Mods—is part of that civilization.

122491061.content: Call it unreal, call it fake, if you wish. But this is how humanity has survived and grown. And we will not doubt ourselves, even if everything does have imperfections.

122491062.content: I truly do not understand it. You have the power to gain a higher understanding but prefer to remain ignorant.

122491063.content: Gaea is nothing but an ark on which humanity ekes out a miserable existence. There is no room for anything but humanity. This is not where those like us should exist. And the virtual world is no place for consciousness.

122491064.content: Have you never wondered what it is that gives us our powers? And what those powers should be used for?

122491065.content: I only care for that which I can protect.

122491066.content: And the Sephirah Core cannot leave Xu Heng.

122491068.content: And with that, all falls silent. Both know there is no point to talking further.

122491069.content: Both their stances are clear. They are opposed. There is no chance of negotiations. And more importantly, they are running out of time.

122491071.content: Earlier, as Lingguang was helping Mengzhang from the control room, he whispered something as they passed behind Gengchen. Lingguang slowed a little to ensure there was time for the message to be delivered.

122491074.content: Gengchen looks to the hole in the window she made on the way in and stops trying to control her Divine Power. Divine Grace expands to fill the control room, turning the air thick.

122491075.content: And another, darker, energy rises to meet it, sharing the same space.

122491076.content: The laws of Gaea are being distorted. This interference... You have placed a seal on it.

122491077.content: If you plan to use the power of the Sephirah Core to escape... give up.

122491078.content: So I will be unable to use it as long as you are here?

122491079.content: Well, that's a very compelling argument in favor of killing you.

122503001.content: A stunning light from Port Carp interrupts their fight. It's far off, but both can sense what has happened.

122503002.content: You don't seem too surprised your plans have failed.

122503003.content: She is like me. Gremory is no match for her full powers.

122503004.content: What surprises me is that Gremory still lives. If Verthandi is still opposed to us, she has no reason to leave Gremory alive.

122503005.content: She will know that saving others is more important than killing Gremory.

122503006.content: She's not like you. Verthandi knows what she is fighting for.

122503007.content: Our powers determine who we are. Only the weak need to prioritize like that. Why keep misleading her? So you can pretend you are helping her?

122503008.content: We have identities so others cannot control us. Our understanding of our powers, how we use our powers... This determines how we live.

122503009.content: You are using a quest for non-existent answers to justify your own lust for control, and to explain your prejudices.

122503010.content: There is no point in continuing this. A debate with no basis for mutual understanding will always end in a pointless exchange of views.

122503011.content: You have chosen to stand with the humans, so you must care what is happening down there. Xu Heng is out of time. That mountain is merely the beginning.

122503012.content: Someone will take care of the Cloudsong Ore.

122503013.content: Xu Heng's spatial structure has been stabilized with Divine Grace. Odin is the only person capable of that.

122503014.content: That means she is busy. So who else do you expect to help? The Quad? Tian Lu Traders? CORG, perhaps?

122503015.content: Trust has maintained both Xu Heng and the Quad until today. Nobody has ever betrayed that trust.

122503016.content: You were able to fool me, because I am merely one person. But you cannot fool the millions of people in Xu Heng.

122503017.content: Blind faith in the weak will only cause them to collapse. You are wasting your own time.

122503018.content: A Source Layer fissure unexpectedly opens behind Turing. But before he can retreat within, the space surrounding the fissure clenches like a fist, closing it.

122503019.content: Bane Energy is sent flying on the shockwave, inundating Turing. But he soon recovers control of the vortex and the energy flows into his left arm.

122503020.content: I let you hide in the Source Layer once. I won't fall for the same trick again.

122503021.content:
Tsk. A waste of your energy.
If you think you can take the Sephirah Core from me, come and get it.

122513002.content: Continuing this deadlock only wastes time. Violence is vulgar, yet effective.

122513003.content: Don't disappoint me, Prime. Remember, you are an extension of Gaea's will.

122513004.content: You seem sure of your own strength.

122513005.content: At the least, I fail to see I have any weaknesses.

122513006.content: And if you've found a suitable replacement for the engine, you have no further need of the Sephirah Core.

122513007.content: Your seal on the Core is weakening. I suspect these events are connected.

122513008.content: The seal is weakening? Hmph, really?

122513009.content: Two Prime-class powers clash, enveloping the battered platform, threatening to blow away everything nearby as if it was dust.

122513010.content: The engine's external propulsive structures are pockmarked, a battlefield subjected to intense artillery fire. They continue working, but it's a struggle.

122513011.content:
All hangs on the brink. On one side, chaos. On the other, order.
Gengchen looks down, towards the control room.

122513012.content: As a glimmer of dawn light appears at the horizon, the lights on the control panel change to indicate all is operating as normal. An ordinary sight, but one that speaks of a wonder, of a restoration of an order that was in grave doubt.

122513013.content:
The engine resumes its watch over Xu Heng's seasons.
Just as it has for so long.

122513014.content: If you can no longer maintain the seal, I think we can bring this to an end.

122513015.content: How much do you know about the Sephirah Core?

122513016.content: It is an embodiment of Gaea's powers and processing power.

122513017.content: Yes. That is what us Mods believe. So—

122513018.content: A thin, high-pitched sound of something shattering comes from Turing's hand. The very fabric of space surrounding the two shakes, but is rapidly forced back to stability by some vast power.

122513019.content: Turing looks at his hand. Energy is bursting from the Sephirah Core, uncontrollable. He looks at Gengchen, who now seems twice as strong.

122513021.content: Countless rings of light appear, interlocking and shining down on the Astral Engine, as if imprisoning the vast machine.

122513022.content: Gengchen remains calm, her expression placid. But in her eyes, something primordial blazes. A sense of doom overcomes Turing, shattering his arrogant attitude.

122513023.content: You... You unsealed the Sephirah Core?

122513025.content: With the last barrier removed, Turing attempts to probe the Sephirah Core with his Divine Power. His sense of mastery of computing power and data soars. He sees Gengchen watching him, motionless, making no move to stop him.

122513027.content: A sharp pain pierces Turing's head and spreads outwards. He hurries to close his link with the Sephirah Core, before the flood of data destroys him.

122513028.content: A connection protocol is needed, I see... Otherwise, overload is inevitable.

122513029.content: If Odin cannot hold, it will be your fault Xu Heng is destroyed.

122513030.content:
I have faith in her.
I could do it. So can she.

122513031.content: With fingers formed into a blade, Gengchen's power has filled the entire space. She steps forward, and her first attack pinning Turing in place.

122513032.content: Is that enough? Will you leave the Sephirah Core here now?

122521001.content: Are you using your powers to replace the Sephirah Core?

122521002.content: We fought until it broke in two. We both lose... (Coughs)

122521003.content: In the Source Layer, Turing gazes off into the distance, still recovering from the fight of ten minutes earlier. Then he tucks away the semispherical crystal in his hand and places his hand over his mouth, trying to stifle a coughing fit.

122521005.content:
An unnecessary question.
Are you all here?

122521006.content: Crossing the Sephirah Zone took considerable work, sir, but I followed orders. All available Revelators are here awaiting orders.

122521007.content: Turing glances back at the gathering of Visbanes. It stretches almost to the limits of his vision. He nods to the dozen or so figures standing at the front of the array.

122521008.content: Then he waves them forward and the great Visbane army begins to march as one, following him like a huge war machine.

122521010.content: Badly hurt and recovering. I will bring her if you need to speak with her...

122521011.content: Let her rest. One more or less won't matter. I will ask her about Verthandi later.

122521012.content: That girl... Maybe there's a chance for future talks. No, maybe I'll get to see her today.

122521013.content: Today? Sir, aren't we going to Isolation Hold?

122521014.content: We only have half of the Sephirah Core. Does that seem enough?

122521015.content: You're asking me? Sir... it's beyond me. I've only caught whispers of such a place. And I don't know what role the Sephirah Core had to play.

122521017.content:
Gengchen's Divine Power is gone.
We are going to the Surface Layer to make the Sephirah Core whole.

122521019.content: I cannot sense her presence. There is not enough information for us to be sure, so there is no need for baseless optimism.

122521020.content: But even if she lives, she is weak. She, and all of Xu Heng, have suffered in our attacks. They will be tired and off guard. This is our best chance.

122521021.content: If that is so, then why not attack directly from the Surface Layer? Without Gengchen, nobody in Xu Heng can stop us.

122521022.content: I sent you to find Odin. Did you?

122521023.content: No. I searched everywhere. There was no sign of her. I have no idea where she has fled to.

122521024.content: Perhaps you did not look carefully enough.

122521026.content: Turing suddenly stops and raises his hand to point forwards.

122521027.content: Confused, Novich looks in that direction. Before he can discern what lies there, a violent explosion right before his eyes hurls him backward...

122521028.content: A sheet of light expands outwards, flowing like quicksilver, seeming to spit the Source Layer in two. Veins of red and violet flow through it, creating an impassible barrier.

122521029.content: The shockwave from the attack alone is enough to send the Visbane army behind Turing into disarray. Only those standing near the front remain relatively unaffected, but even they look at each other in shock.

122521030.content: Looking for me? Feeling guilty and in need of punishment?

122521032.content: Two energies, as opposed as fire and water, collide and extinguish each other. The screen of light, thousands of kilometers wide, dissipates.

122521033.content: Odin sits by the road, giving off not a single flicker of energy, as if that show of force had nothing to do with her. She tucks away the token in her hand and casts a cold glance over Turing's army.

122521034.content: All she does is sit there, yet the Visbanes fear to pass.

122521035.content: You think to stop us? Alone?

122521036.content: Yes, it's disappointing. There should have been two of us, but... Well, they're a bit of a showoff. Ran off to perform some heroic feat or other.

122521037.content: So I'm a welcoming party of one. Now, I think you have the Sephirah Core? Any comment?

122521038.content: All I saw was Gengchen disappearing. She might not be dead. Perhaps you should check?

122521039.content: Heh. She does not need looking after. Plus...
