122521040.content: She won, didn't she? So I'll do what she wants. Protect Xu Heng. Protect the land she cares so much about, and the humans...

122521042.content: You truly plan to stand against us, alone?

122521045.content: I mean, a million ants are still... y'know. Ants. That handful up at the front might be worth mentioning. What are they? Not human, not monsters... Cognizants?

122521046.content: The Cinders would be wasted on you. And after all that time spent looking for it... Anway, we worked that out together today, so that's good.

122521047.content: As for you, Turing, remember you couldn't even beat a weakened Gengchen. Don't go holding out any hopes.

122521048.content: I can't see your future. At first, I was curious. But now, I realize making you vanish solves the problem. Completely and utterly... gone.

122521049.content: I didn't expect to see you so soon. I thought we'd meet when I found the other half of the Sephirah Core.

122521050.content: And as you're so sure of yourself, I think it's time I ticked you off my list of people to destroy.

122521051.content: Wait. The other half of the Sephirah Core?

122521052.content: Hahaha! You think you can get the other half!?

122521053.content: Odin shakes her head in surprise and amusement. Then, looking down, she gives a tired sigh and summons up a lance, which she uses to lever herself upright.

122521054.content: The entire Visbane army falls silent and takes several steps backwards, as if intimidated by a powerful foe. The Cognizant Visbanes in the vanguard draw their weapons and glare at Odin and the countless purple black spheres that have appeared by her side.

122521055.content: Space folds. Mass fluctuates. Energy bursts like lava from a pent-up volcano, spreading an instinctive terror through the Visbane ranks. And in Odin's gaze, a coldness that leaves all it touches hopeless.

122521056.content: Sir... This is... Are we really going to fight her?

122521057.content: What do you suggest. Leave, and wait for her to come and find us another day?

122521058.content: Ammit, Agares, Focalor, Botis... The enemy you hoped for is here. Stop her at any cost.

122521059.content: Spare no cost... then brace yourself for dying right here, all of you.

122522001.content: A black hole sweeps silently through the massed Visbanes. Its powerful gravity field tears everything in its path to pieces and swallows it all up. Even the cries of pain do not escape its pull.

122522002.content: Like a dense rain of bullets, countless simulated Access Keys made of Divine Grace sweep across the battlefield, crushing even isolated traces of Bane Energy without mercy.

122522003.content: The Cognizant Visbanes are able to block such attacks, but even they fall to Odin's whirling lance. Odin's foes had the advantage of numbers—but when you are so much weaker than your foe, having numbers on your side means little, beyond a chance to choose which order you die in.

122522004.content: As the first Cognizant is wiped out by a wave of Divine Grace, the line starts to collapse. Odin moves ever forward, slow but constant, as if the Visbanes present no threat at all.

122522006.content: How many Revelators can it take to stop one person!?

122522007.content: Are you enjoying watching your minions die, Turing?

122522010.content: How much effort do you think it would be to wipe them all out?

122522011.content: If you are so weak and cowardly, perhaps you need to find a hiding place? Walking around in the open like this—

122522012.content: Odin doesn't finish her sentence. Her black hole, her simulated Access Keys and she herself disappear as one.

122522013.content: Turing's expression suddenly changes. He throws up a twin defense—Bane Energy and Divine Grace—and hurries backwards.

122522014.content: Hundreds of meters away, a rift opens and Odin's lance flies out. It accelerates, leaving a sonic boom in its wake, before embedding itself in Turing's arm. The sound of something—and it's not Odin's lance, which remains unbroken—cracking echoes across the now deathly quiet battlefield.

122522016.content: Let the rodents who follow you see how pathetic you are.

122522017.content: Within the space of a moment, twenty miniature black holes appear around Turing. The black holes link up to form a twenty-sided cage. Turing attempts to charge through the cage, fleeing Odin, but the simulated lances which shoot from the black holes are much faster than he is.

122522018.content: Turing manages to block the lances, but the onrushing wave of Divine Grace pierces him from all angles like a thousand arrows of light.

122522020.content: Don't forget that you are no more than a stray dog to me. And stray dogs don't speak.

122522021.content: Stray dogs lie down and beg. They wag their tails and know when to be quiet.

122522022.content: Odin looks on with contempt as Turing tries to use both types of energy at his disposal to recover, then shakes off some Bane Energy clinging to her lance. She takes a step towards the Visbanes behind Turing, who are trying to form up again.

122522023.content: The new wounds reopen the old ones from his fight with Gengchen. Turing coughs several times and gestures for the other Visbanes to stop.

122522025.content: We're leaving? Just like this? What about the Sephirah Core?

122522026.content: If you're looking to court death, I won't stop you.

122522027.content: Novich looks at his scared Cognizant comrades. He swallows, laughs awkwardly, and falls silent.

122522028.content: Odin sees Turing is preparing to open a portal and escape. She lifts her hand and forms a giant lance, a hundred meters of condensed energy. And then, a bow large enough to use that lance as an arrow.

122522029.content: Unadulterated Divine Grace gathers into unadulterated force. It might not be as visually impressive as some other attacks, but all the Cognizant Visbanes—Turing included—all see their impending doom in that lance.

122522030.content: Don't let her fire! Take her out!

122522031.content: With death imminent, the Cognizants know they can't hold anything back. Streams of terrifying Bane Energy attacks form into a single torrent, landing one after the other on Odin as she hovers in the air.

122522032.content: But Odin shows no signs of dodging. She lets those attacks rain down on her and looses the invisible bowstring, sending the lance flying towards Turing, powering it with every ounce of her Divine Power.

122522033.content: The lance shatters space along its path, destroying the Visbanes it passes over with a blast of Divine Grace. Odin assaults the Visbane lines, ignoring the countless attacks she suffers, the black hole in her hand aimed at a single target.

122522034.content: Kill me and you die here too!

122522035.content: You won't live to see it!

122522036.content: When the lance is a mere two hundred meters away, Turing can wait no longer. He starts to fall back.

122522037.content: Hordes of Visbanes throw themselves into the path of the lance, hoping to win Turing the seconds he need for his final defense.

122522038.content: The lance passes through the Visbanes, but at the cost of some speed. It pierces a red mist, then collides with a crystalline barrier. Lance and barrier push against each other for half a minute, then both shatter.

122522039.content: Through the red mist, Odin can see a portal behind Turing. She ignores the Bane Energy blades he aims at her and throws her black hole towards him and his portal.

122522040.content: Hmph, fleeing so fast. Finally learned to keep quiet, I see.

122522041.content: One of those blades slices into Odin's shoulder. As Turing steps into his portal, the black hole strikes, flattening everything. Odin sees the blast strike her foe, but... it doesn't look fatal.

122522042.content: Odin's Divine Grace roots out the Bane Energy entering through the wound in her shoulder. Her breathing calms and soon all is silent.

122522044.content: The other Cognizant Visbanes have taken advantage of Odin and Turing's duel to retreat. The ordinary Visbanes have been almost wiped out by the shockwaves from the fighting.

122522045.content: Odin lowers her right arm, which is covered in tiny wounds from the almost uncontrolled release of Divine Grace.

122522046.content: But she shows no signs of feeling any pain and simply lets her Prime Mod powers restore her. A wry smile slowly forms on her lips, then she turns and leaves the Source Layer.

122522047.content: The Visbane signature disappeared?! But we were so close! How did we lose them?!

122522048.content: Where are you going, Cangfeng? Relax.

122522050.content: ...Damn it. I can't believe the chief...

122522051.content: Just focus on the mission at hand for now. The chief will be alright.

122522053.content: Is that a civilian who snuck back to Yu Jing? As far as I know, the Quake alert is still active...

122522054.content: The two Mods, out hunting Visbanes, stop and look up at the woman leaning on the bridge railing, half-wary, half-curious.

122522055.content: The woman seems to slip something into her pocket before turning her head slightly to look at them. The two startle, but nothing unexpected happens.

122522057.content: If you're looking for Visbanes, there aren't any left here. Mission accomplished. You can go back.

122522059.content: Could you tell us your name please? So that we can make a complete report when we get back.

122522060.content: Report to who? Gengchen has disappeared. Do you plan to find her?

122522061.content: Hey, the chief disappeared because she was trying to protect Xu Heng. Have some respect, will you?

122522064.content: I apologize for that. But everyone's worried about the chief.

122522065.content: But the chief often tells us that we must keep a cool head no matter what happens. So we must continue with the Quad's business even if she isn't with us... No, we must work even harder in that case.

122522066.content: The most important thing now is to clear out the Visbanes and restore order to Yu Jing. The sooner the evacuated residents come back, the sooner we get to the task of recovery.

122522067.content: We can't let the chief down. And neither should we disappoint the people who trust the Quad...

122522068.content: I'm sorry about just now... Now that deputies Mengzhang, Lingguang, and Jianbing are all at the Quad, naturally they have to know what's going on.

122522069.content: Given the present situation, I'd appreciate it if you didn't hide your true identity.

122522070.content: Odin watches the two amazed Mods walk off and pulls the sandalwood token, engraved with the Quad emblem, from her pocket.

122522071.content: The waves came and all was lost. But now all is calm and the stream flows on.

122522072.content: Fingers of moonlight play across the river's ripples and shine on Odin's hand, highlighting the edges of that token.

122522073.content: I still don't get it. What were you thinking?

122522074.content: With everything in this state, what choice do I have but to trust in my visions?

122522075.content: And you said something about changing the outcome of those visions...

122522076.content: The aura from the Astral Engine's field is back to normal. Odin gazes up at it for a moment before smiling and shaking her head. Then she tosses the token into the stream.

122522077.content: All the Quad kids are as grumpy as you are. I feel tired just thinking about it.

122522078.content: ...Since you've said to trust the next generation, stick with that trust until the end then, huh.

122531001.content: Gengchen is missing... and Ver is badly hurt?

122531002.content: CORG have taken Ver back to Ain Soph. Someone we can trust says they'll heal her. There's no need to worry.

122531003.content: When I wake, it is already daylight—noon, to be precise. Odin tells me I've been out since the previous night. I'm not badly hurt, luckily. Just knocked silly by the impact.

122531004.content: But the news waiting for me—Gengchen's absence, Ver's injuries—is shocking. Even watching the news and seeing how Yu Jing is putting itself back together after the crisis, I don't feel any sense of joy in having survived.

122531005.content: CORG? I remember seeing Novich before I lost consciousness. So who saved us?

122531006.content: A captain from CORG's Egregious Crimes Department. Thoth, her name is.

122531008.content: "Makes sense?" Anyway, hope you can cope with the news.

122531009.content: Stay at the Quad for a while. I'll come to get you after I finish some business.

122531011.content: Relax. Nothing for you to concern yourself with.

122531012.content: And don't make me repeat myself. Stay at the Quad. No wandering off.

122531013.content: Odin sounds less cheerful than usual, and a lot more tired. She doesn't seem to have the energy to hide her feelings. I don't ask any questions. We end the call.

122531014.content: I get dressed and stretch my limbs—still stiff, still sore—and check myself over for injuries. It seems ridiculous to do this. I know these barely even count as wounds...

122531015.content: I need to get some air. Feel trapped in here.

122531017.content: What are you sitting here for?

122531018.content:
Waiting for Odin.
Anything I can help with?

122531019.content: Help? You did more than enough yesterday. Can't thank you enough. Mind if I take a seat?

122531020.content: It's not a question that needs an answer. First off, this is the Quad, not my house. And second, he sat down before even asking.

122531021.content: I guess you're kinda busy. Probably don't even get time for lunch.

122531022.content: Busy and bothered. I'd love to find some time to chat, but I can't stop thinking about things.

122531023.content: About what? Are there any leads on Gengchen?

122531025.content: But you're so... Don't you ever look worried?

122531026.content: What's the point? I could frown all day, won't bring her back.

122531027.content: The Sephirah Core, the Heterocore, and the chief's own Divine Power have left an indiscernible energy trail. Only luck could help us follow it...

122531028.content: I figured using the Cinders to balance the Heterocore's processing power wouldn't be easy. But there wasn't much point in me trying to persuade the chief on something she'd decided to do.

122531029.content: And the chief knew what she was doing. She'd had time to prepare. So all I can do is hope she turns up safe and sound.

122531030.content: How come you're calling her the chief now?

122531031.content: "Even if something is impossible to achieve, that shouldn't stop us from trying."

122531032.content: It's only now that I'm starting to understand the kind of mindset you need to think like that.

122531033.content: The best outcome, huh... that's quite idealistic.

122531035.content: But her decision doesn't surprise me, because I know that's how she thinks. In fact, I'm not even sure I'm sad she's missing.

122531036.content: It's ridiculous, isn't it? We haven't got a single lead on where she might be. Maybe she walks through the door tomorrow, maybe we never see her again. And... I'm fine with that.

122531037.content: It's as if I always knew what she would do, and I always knew what I should do in response. If you respect someone's ideals, you have to accept the situations they lead to.

122531039.content: Yeah? Hehe. Maybe people just see me as uncaring.

122531040.content: Not at all. And I need to thank you for something. The Delusion Buster got Ver and me out from Gremory's dreamworld. I'm not sure we'd have made it otherwise.

122531041.content: I should return it to you.

122531042.content: I give the little black box I have with me to Mengzhang, who refuses it with an expansive gesture.

122531043.content: I told you it was compensation for what happened at Mount Jingdu, and I meant it. You should keep it. Use it as an ornament, whatever.

122531044.content: Now, as we're talking about lunch... Join me?

122531046.content: I don't feel like eating. I'm too worried about Ver.

122531047.content: Yeah, I understand. I heard she was hurt badly.

122531048.content: I have no idea. Odin said CORG took her, which is reassuring. But how can I...

122531049.content: My memory drifts back to the moments before I lost consciousness. Ver was collapsed by my side, unconscious. Her skin was covered in those strange red lines, she was bleeding from wounds I couldn't even begin to count.

122531050.content: I don't know how to not worry about her.

122531051.content: Weird, isn't it? We both got saved and here we are, comparing notes.

122531052.content: Mengzhang pats me on the shoulder, but I'm not in the mood for jokes. I turn to look at him. He's staring off into the distance, as if he's seeing some hoped-for scenario.

122531053.content: I don't know the details, but I know it must have been tough.

122531054.content: But we're the ones who survived. The ones who are safe. So let's keep going, like they'd want us to.

122531055.content: I'm not going to try to stop you worrying, but you should talk about it if you need to. Remember, we still have jobs to do. We can't let our emotions get in the way of that.

122531056.content: ...I shall take it as a compliment.

122531057.content: No need. We're in the same boat.

122531058.content: No chance to dine out, but we'll need to eat something. Half each?

122531059.content: Mengzhang pulls out a greaseproof bag and hands it to me. There are several white steamed buns inside. I take a deep breath of steam and smell the bread. Only then do I feel the usual post-battle hunger.

122531060.content: But before I can take a bite, I hear familiar footsteps approaching from behind. Mengzhang and I turn in unison and greet Lingguang.

122531061.content: We don't see the redness in her eyes until she's up close. We don't need to ask how she's feeling—it's plain to see. It makes Mengzhang's calmness seem odd in comparison...

122531064.content: That's good. When CORG brought you here you looked more asleep than injured, so I didn't arrange medical care. Hope you don't mind.

122531065.content: Unless I imagined last night's Quakes, there will be plenty of people in need of that assistance. I don't have any injuries I can't walk off.

122531066.content: Wait. When CORG brought me here, did you see Ver?

122531067.content: No. You were the only one with them. Apparently, Ver's injuries were... different. CORG will need to use a special treatment. I don't know exactly what...

122531069.content: If you're here for a sick visit, I'll take my leave. Want a steamed bun?

122531070.content: Just had lunch, thanks... But this isn't a sick visit.

122531071.content: You're the one I need to visit, Mengzhang. Come with me.

122531072.content: #{nickname}#, you come too. You're hardly an outsider now.

122531073.content: Curious, we follow Lingguang to a stylish office—although it feels a little empty, as its occupant is not home. The four of us are not enough to make up for that feeling of absence.

122531074.content: Four, because Jianbing is waiting for us. He's standing as we walk in, looking at an envelope on the desk.

122531075.content: Jianbing is a little surprised to see me, but in the end he doesn't comment on my presence. He just nods.

122531077.content: I was cleaning the chief's office this morning when I found it. It was on the desk.

122531078.content:
"To Mengzhang"
The chief's handwriting. You should open it.

122531079.content: Mengzhang looks grave as he takes the envelope, breaks the wax seal, and pulls out a sheet of paper.

122531080.content: "Mengzhang, if you read this, I am no longer in Xu Heng."

122531081.content: There's a tremor in Mengzhang's hand, a sad smile at the corner of his lips. Then, his emotions back under control, he keeps reading.

122531082.content: "The Sephirah Core has always been taboo for the Mods. I knew when sealing it that the road ahead would be a difficult one and I prepared for the worst."

122531083.content: "Now we have found the Cinders, we have a safer way to run the Astral Engine. This is a great blessing. No matter what happens to me, you must not mourn. The Quad will run as it always has, with the most important matters being decided..."

122531084.content: "...the most important matters being decided by you."

122531085.content: "On the day you became the deputy for Yuyi Isle, we discussed our hopes for the Quad. I know you will be able to listen to all sides and see the correct way forward, as this is what you have always done."

122531086.content: "But storms are approaching. External threats and internal dissent. Xu Heng needs more flexible decision-makers. Schemers."

122531087.content: "If crisis again befalls Xu Heng, act as you see fit. Say what people fear to say. Do what people fear to do."

122531088.content: "You are the best suited to this task. Fear no storm, bend to no wind. Do not cower, do not doubt. Show no favor, do not waver."

122531089.content: "I will have Odin act as overseer. She is not suited to the daily business, but when the Quad needs help, look to her."

122531090.content: "The eras pass, the world changes. It has always done so, and I remember it all."

122531091.content: "We were born from Gaea's crisis and are fated to live through disaster, suffer wounds, face difficult choices. We sacrifice to protect. Sometimes we make errors and carry those regrets."

122531092.content: "Those regrets remind us of the prices we must pay to make the right choices, in service of the right results. They must not be concealed or forgotten, no matter how distant they now seem."

122531093.content: "I am sorry I have to tell you this by letter. It was only when I obtained the Cinders that I realized they were likely the cause of the Bane Energy corrosion Zhu suffered."

122531094.content: "Some of her awareness remained when I killed her, so I know what the symptoms are like."

122531095.content: "I have never told you that before, as I did not wish to upset you. This was wrong of me and you have every right to be angry. I deserve it."

122531096.content: "Finally, I have noticed that lately everyone is adding more spice to the food. I don't know if this is because I like it, or because they do."

122531097.content: "Regardless, I hope that from now on, you will all flavor your foods as you wish, and enjoy them. I owe you all a meal. I hope one day to repay that debt."

122531099.content: The handwriting becomes more scribbled as the letter goes on. It is easy to imagine Gengchen was likely disrupted by urgent matters in this room, rushing to finish and then placing the letter in its envelope.

122531100.content: Mengzhang carefully folds the letter and places it back in the envelope. Then he seems uncertain for a moment and he offers it to Jianbing and Lingguang. Neither takes it, so he puts it back on the desk.

122531106.content: Pretend what? I already knew. I've known for a long time. You think I'm the person who can let something he doesn't understand just sit there? That I could have let it go?

122531107.content: Zhu found the Cinders, but since nobody had seen such a thing before, she kept them in her laboratory and studied them. But they corroded her. And if the chief hadn't turned up, things would have been even worse.

122531108.content: And you know what Zhu was like. She would have hated turning into a Bane Energy corroded monster. She would have begged the chief to end it. I can't blame the chief for that...

122531110.content: Mengzhang stops talking, his lips quivering and his breath ragged. He hurries to the window, faces outward, yet ends up closing it.

122531111.content: I slip silently out of the office and find Odin has been standing outside. I shake my head at her.

122531112.content: But as I close the door, I can hear Mengzhang, laughing through his tears.

122531113.content: I don't know why, but... I suddenly...

122531114.content: I suddenly just... I miss her a little...

122531115.content: Odin and I are unusually quiet on our way to Port Carp. The only thing she talks about during the half-hour journey is how she came to fight with Gengchen the previous day.

122531116.content: We cross neighborhood after neighborhood on our way to the Photon Rail station. The city, now busily rebuilding and restoring order, seems very distant. It's a comfort to see, but I feel a certain melancholy.

122531117.content: I haven't heard a single person mentioning the names I know so well. Nobody knows what happened last night. The Visbanes, Gremory, Turing, Ver, Gengchen... nobody knows of the battles and sacrifices that were made to save the city from disaster.

122531118.content: Is this the right thing to do?

122531120.content: Can't we tell people about us? About what we do?

122531121.content: Isn't it unfair to conceal the truth from them? They don't know how dangerous their world is. Nobody knows the Mods or what we do.

122531123.content: I guess humans wouldn't want to hear it.

122531124.content:
That's the truth of it.
But is that what you think we protect? Humanity?

122531125.content: That's funny. What we protect is order. Gaea's order. Regardless of who thinks that's right or wrong. Don't get things backwards.

122531126.content: #{nickname}#, do you think the humans of Gaea really need to face up to their fates? Or can they just live happily, but in ignorance?

122531127.content: Perhaps it's best someone else makes that decision for them.

122531128.content: Humans enjoy happier lives and our mission remains simple.

122531129.content: Eliminating Visbanes is clearly a good thing. You don't even need to think about it. I don't want to see things get confused by talk of right and wrong.

122531130.content: But what if humanity could help?

122531131.content: You think we haven't tried? The results were... disappointing. I don't like to discuss it.

122531133.content: Odin looks at me, making it clear she does not want to discuss this further.

122531134.content: But that helps me calm down. Nobody is more focused on eliminating the Visbanes than Odin. She's so focused. I don't know what she's been through. I doubt I could even imagine it all.

122531135.content: And as far as the Mods are concerned, nobody has any right to question her.

122531137.content: What comes next isn't Division Nine business.

122531138.content: CORG did a survey of the city early this morning. Despite all the chaos last night, the actual damage isn't as bad as it could have been. There's no need to hang around trying to help.

122531139.content: If you'd like to stay for a vacation, though, be my guest. Shu can continue managing the General Office.

122531140.content: A vacation? Don't even joke about it.

122531141.content: And Ver's in Ain Soph. I want to see her.

122531143.content: How badly was she hurt? Why is CORG looking after her?

122531144.content: She's not well. But getting upset about it won't help. CORG has an energy calming device. She'll be safe there, no matter what state she's in.

122531145.content: Red Fox promised me they would do everything they can for her. And if he doesn't keep that promise, I'll be adding CORG to our block list.

122531146.content: Red Fox? The head of the CORG Supreme Directorate?

122531147.content: Oh, you've met? I'm meeting him for a meal when I get back to Ain Soph. You can join us.

122531148.content: I've heard of him, that's all. I don't think I need to come to listen to the top brass discussing their affairs. I'll just get in the way.

122531149.content: As long as Ver is safe. That's all I need from CORG.

122531150.content: You shouldn't worry. There's plenty of work to deal with at Aether Gazer already. Hope you're ready for it.

122531151.content: I smile at Odin. Her words might sound harsh, but I know she's trying to make me feel better.

122531152.content: But what is she feeling right now? Gengchen and her have known each other over a period of time I can't even begin to conceive of. I can't believe she's as calm as she appears. Perhaps, like Mengzhang, she controls her emotions, keeping them buried deep inside.

122531153.content: But who will comfort her? I have no idea. She seems somewhat distant as we walk and even though I want to offer her a friendly word of reassurance... what would I say?

122531154.content:
"She's used to walking much further ahead than the rest of us."
Further ahead than everyone. Laughing about loneliness in a crowd.

122531155.content: I don't usually see you carrying anything. What's that you've got with you?

122531156.content: This? I've had this since we set out. Why are you asking now? Worried I'm going to make you my porter and tell you to carry it?

122531157.content: Carrying things for the boss seems normal enough. I'll take it for a while if it's annoying you.

122531159.content: It is. Reading broadens the horizons, as they say in Xu Heng. I spotted an interesting looking book so I bought it to read back home.

122531160.content: And don't go thinking of ways to make me feel better, rookie. I've been through all this before.

122531161.content: The train's here. Let's get on.

122531162.content: I stop for a moment as I get into the Photon Rail passenger car and look back into the Xu Heng sky, thinking of all the people who live under it.

122531163.content: We agreed on the first day, to come back here together, right? Don't forget...

122531165.content: The sun is far off, casting shadows on me.

122541002.content: The waiter bows slightly then leaves, closing the door as Odin instructed.

122541003.content: And as soon as the door closes, Divine Grace fills the room, creating an ephemeral barrier that prevents any sound escaping.

122541004.content: The food's all here, please enjoy.

122541005.content: The two people sitting with Odin glance at each other. The dishes are there, but only the dishes. There is no food on them. There aren't any traces of food. They don't even need washed.

122541006.content: But there is a cup of tea in front of each of the three, hot steam rising and forming little clouds. Too hot to drink, it seems.

122541007.content: Nobody in attendance was expecting a relaxing meal. But nor were they expecting Odin to be this... blunt.

122541012.content: I invited you for a chat. If you aren't going to talk... well, that would be quite dull, wouldn't it?

122541013.content: No need for nerves. CORG saved one of my subordinates. I owe you a favor now.

122541014.content: Paracaesar looks to the old man sitting opposite her in surprise—this is clearly new to her. Red Fox gives her a subtle shake of the head as he sits up straight and rubs his forehead in exasperation.

122541015.content: This tea looks great, thanks for hosting.

122541016.content: I got it in Xu Heng. My only souvenir.

122541017.content: It was a rushed trip for everyone. I should visit there sometime. Have a look around.

122541019.content: I don't know. Tea needs sipping, not just looking. I'll make up my mind when I'm there.

122541020.content: You don't know? Or you don't want to risk giving anything away?

122541021.content: You know what I'm asking about, you old Red Fox. Don't tell me you don't know what CORG is doing.

122541022.content: If I knew everything, I wouldn't need to be here, would I? Though perhaps I'd be here anyway. Maybe even with actual food and a pleasant conversation about the future of Gaea.

122541023.content: You're the boss of CORG. Observators might not speak, but you... you know everything.

122541024.content: You can't delegate everything down the chain, can you? Otherwise you'd have nothing left to do.

122541025.content: Odin gives Paracaesar a sideways glance. She seems a bit ill at ease, the fingers of the left hand tapping out a rhythm on her teacup, her gaze on the ripples the tapping causes in the tea.

122541026.content: (Sigh) We all have our headaches. Complaining about them to each other won't solve anything. If you don't feel like eating, I don't see any need to sit here talking.

122541027.content: We discussed what happened in Xu Heng yesterday. Our oversight was lax and Turing was able to disguise himself as Khnum. We accept our failings.

122541028.content: We have already done as much as we can to help. Rebuilding Yu Jing, the Turing investigation, helping the Quad set up defenses in Xu Heng...

122541029.content: But we have to remember, this is the first time any of us have seen a being capable of using Divine Grace and Bane Energy at the same time. This is not a threat our current intelligence prepared us for.

122541030.content: So if you're still disappointed, or think we're careless or sloppy... I have nothing more to tell you.

122541031.content: If you were sloppy, so was I.

122541032.content: But I do think you could keep a closer eye on your assets. Khnum has been dead for over two weeks.

122541033.content: Khnum was a person, not an asset, Odin. You may have your opinions on how we manage our Mods, but let me remind you of something. At CORG we are soldiers first, Mods second.

122541034.content: We have never restricted the freedoms and rights of our soldiers when they are not on duty. And we certainly will not treat them like criminals or keep them under constant surveillance.

122541035.content: Freedoms and rights... I'm not sure all would agree.

122541036.content: You could carry out a few interviews. With Anubis, perhaps? Marduk? Or those mutant creations in your lab, the ones designed to mimic Mods?

122541037.content: Red Fox raises an eyebrow, but doesn't reply. He takes a sip of tea, which is now cool enough to drink. Then he turns to Paracaesar.

122541039.content: How did I know? Is that important?

122541040.content: Would you like to explain why I'm only learning of these names now? And what about the source of the Quake in Rostach?

122541041.content: ...This is a CORG project. If I recall correctly, our agreement doesn't require us to share the information with you?

122541042.content: True, you don't have to tell me. And to be honest, I don't care how many have died. You do what you want. It's nothing to do with me.

122541043.content: But when you ask me to send my people to Rostach to clean up your mess, to recover the artificial lifeforms you lost, then... you kind of owe me an explanation, maybe?

122541044.content: To prevent escalation, we'll certainly use all available resources—this is emergency protocol.

122541045.content: At my age the memory can start to fail, but I think that's in our agreement, isn't it?

122541046.content: Well, if we're quoting the agreement... perhaps I might join in?

122541047.content: The team headed to Rostach got their orders revoked; and 0705? Taken care of by someone else...

122541048.content: "If a joint project or commission is cancelled due to unexpected events, the originating party should inform the other party of the reason for the cancellation and produce a report on the unexpected events."

122541051.content: Look, we'd like to know all the details ourselves. But things had already gone out of control at the time...

122541052.content: And that makes it okay? I'm not here to listen to excuses.

122541053.content: Hearing Odin's icy tone, Paracaesar realizes what she's referring to. The redhead researcher looks to her superior, pleading for help. When silence is her only reply, she sighs in resignation.

122541054.content: What do you want to know?

122541055.content: Your aims. Your progress. And how much trouble those freaks you're making are going to cause.

122541056.content: ...As you've already dug up our plan of artificial Modifiers, surely you understand the motive, too?

122541058.content: I'm not sure you should comment on technical issues like that.

122541059.content: As I often say, the results are my only concern. And your results are a disaster.

122541060.content: You've produced second-rate goods which gobble up Access Keys to charge up their Divine Grace. What are they even meant to fight? Visbanes? Humans? Mods?

122541061.content: Prototypes are never perfect. Odin, Visbane activity is on the rise. And nobody knows the problems Gaea faces better than you.

122541062.content: I have to say, at the current rate of evolution of the Visbanes, the Modifiers are no longer a match for them. Not even you.

122541063.content: This is a war. We need weapons that can be manufactured at scale and upgraded when needed. Just like Visbanes.

122541064.content: You seek to protect the Modifiers. Aren't our goals aligned then? If my plan succeeds, none of you will ever have to fight again...

122541066.content: I'm just reminded of those kids in the Cryptics. When they talk about all their high hopes for their research, they get so excited they just go on and on.

122541067.content: Sounds like you're not entirely confident in your research, huh?

122541068.content: Replicating the Access Keys and Divine Grace isn't easy—they contain certain Gaea permissions.

122541069.content: As it stands the artificial Mods are unstable and the artificial Access Keys require an external source of power. However, I have ideas for how to fix these problems. All I need is a little more time...

122541070.content: And how long is a little more time? If the intel I've got is correct, it's been sixteen years since the Rostach Quake. Would you call that a "little more time"?

122541071.content: Paracaesar, I just want to be sure what I hear is true—like I said yesterday.

122541072.content: My experiments are already underway. I will succeed.

122541073.content: I don't care if you believe me. All I want is to end this conflict as soon as possible. The world has no need for it.

122541074.content: Paracaesar clenches her teacup and stares, distracted, into the liquid within. It's as if she's hoping to find the answer to some question floating in there.

122541075.content: This should be Gaea's problem. And now I'm the one who's dealing with it...

122541077.content: Things would be so much easier if I were.

122541079.content: Odin's eyes narrow for a moment, then she relaxes and, with a wave of her hand, removes the Divine Grace shielding the room.

122541080.content: This will be my final reminder: Trying to be clever only puts everyone at risk.

122541081.content: There are fundamental differences between you and Gaea. You will never be, nor do you need to be, the same.

122541083.content: The room falls silent for a moment. Odin waves a hand, indicating how utterly bored she is, then picks up her teacup.

122541084.content: Drink up. It doesn't taste as good cold.

122541085.content: Leaving the high-end Aether Gazer-run restaurant, Red Fox and Paracaesar can't even remember if they finished their tea.

122541086.content: They say no farewells. Odin goes her way, the other two go theirs. But as they walk away from each other, Odin calls out.

122541088.content: We'll tell you if we hear anything of Gengchen.

122541090.content: Paracaesar sighs in relief as she watches Odin disappear down the street, but she still looks unhappy.

122541091.content: We've shared intel with her now, despite our agreement... She might think we've set a precedent, and demand even more in the future.

122541092.content: Were you reluctant to tell her, or me?

122541094.content: CORG isn't a lab. You are not your researchers, Miss Paracaesar. If an old man like me can remember that, I'm sure you can.

122541095.content: It seems there has been a lot going on behind my back while I've been absent.

122541096.content: You put me in full control of those projects, and I acted within the limit of my authority at all times.

122541097.content: In full control, yes, but clearly, things have gotten out of hand.

122541098.content: Things aren't that serious. Odin just wanted an explanation.

122541099.content: Explanations are often harder to come up with than simple facts. Facts just exist. Explanations need to be convincing.

122541100.content: I'm putting a hold on all your secret projects until I can carry out a full review.

122541101.content: Our partnership with Aether Gazer has to continue. Our troubles are already mounting. We can't add to them by causing ourselves problems.

122541104.content: My office looks exactly as it did before I left for Xu Heng. But I don't feel as comfortable behind the desk as I used to.

122541105.content: I stare endlessly out the window at the bustling streets of Core City, then turn on my terminal. I find the first name I ever saved in my contacts. I hesitate for a while and, in the end, do not call.

122541107.content: I put the terminal down and notice the jade pendant on my desk. No matter how I hold it, it gives no indication of which direction Ver is to be found.

122541108.content: I open my desk drawer and find a lucky charm hidden under a pile of paperwork. It's silver plate, in the shape of a shield.

122541109.content: I put the lucky charm and the pendant together and think of the adventures Ver and I had together. That brings to mind some more distant memories. Those are vague, but I'm sure also real.

122541110.content: If you're not in the mood for working, ask for a day off.

122541112.content: I don't bother trying to hide the objects on my desk. I'm not a child, caught playing with toys in class. I watch as Odin walks in. This is new.

122541113.content: This is the first time I've come to visit since Shu handed the General Office over to you. Not going to welcome a guest?

122541114.content: The couch is comfy. There are paper cups by the water dispenser.

122541116.content: So, what brings the boss to a humble employee's office? Important news? A new mission?

122541117.content: Missions aren't my department. Shu will tell you if anything comes up.

122541118.content: CORG have told me where Ver is. You can go if you want. But...

122541120.content: But don't get your hopes up.

122541121.content: Her condition is worse than I hoped. You should prepare yourself.

122541123.content: We're all hoping that's the case. But that's all it is. We can't give ourselves false hope.

122541125.content: But let me believe she's going to be okay? Just let me do that, this once?

122541127.content: I just want to say hello to her again.

122541128.content: "Hey, how could you sleep for so long?"

122541129.content: I just want us to tease each other again.

122541130.content: Just like we used to, in the days things were normal.

910201001.content: How do you like it, Admin? Super tasty, isn't it?

910201003.content: I could only respond with primitive sounds of agreement as I had stuffed my mouth full of tasty barbecue.

910201004.content: Hehe. Glad you like it too.

910201005.content: Took me quite a bit of effort to uncover this joint. I love the unlimited buffet!

910201006.content: Hi, here's more water for you. Want me to flip the meat?

910201008.content: They seem to have great service here too... I suppose that's the secret to running a successful restaurant, right?

910201009.content: No, no, Admin. If we wanna talk about good service, then you should know that this restaurant—

910201010.content: Ah. Looks like they're just getting started over there.

910201011.content: Before I could turn my eyes to where Ver was pointing, I heard a rather familiar melody.

910201012.content: ... Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you...

910201013.content: A couple of servers wearing some rather exaggerated accessories were singing at a table while holding a cake.

910201014.content: The customer's face had a warm glow from the candlelight, and surprise was written all over it. But for some reason as I observed the scene, a searing pain burned through me, as if I was being torn apart.

910201017.content: ... Admin! Admin! What's the matter with you?!

910201019.content: Ver, what... what are they doing over there?

910201020.content: Huh? What? They're celebrating the guest's birthday, that's what.

910201021.content: That's what this restaurant is best known for. Although that can make you want to disappear into your seat sometimes...

910201023.content: Ah, yes, you don't have a birthday, Admin... Oh, I'm so sorry! I totally forgot about your amnesia!

910201024.content: Ver clasped her hands together with great sincerity, and lowered her head in a gesture of apology.

910201025.content: Oh, it's okay. It just seems that I recalled something from the past, though I'm not sure if it's really my memory...

910201026.content: Then let's talk about birthdays, Admin. Who knows, you may recall something else.

910201027.content: Usually on someone's birthday, everyone gets together to sing and celebrate the occasion.

910201028.content: The birthday boy or girl will get a cake and lots of gifts, and eat a lot of delicious food too...

910201029.content: Oh, that's right! They have to blow out the candles on the cake, too. They say that all the wishes you make when you do will come true...

910201030.content: Hmm... Anyway, that's about it. Anything come to mind, Admin?

910201031.content: I'm sorry... I know you said a lot, but I don't remember anything else.

910201032.content: To me, my birthday is just another date. As for whether I've experienced what you mentioned...

910201034.content: It's alright Ver, you don't have to look so sad. Let's put this matter aside and focus on the meat. It'll all burn soon if we don't eat it!

910201035.content: Yikes! No way I'm letting that happen! Admin, eat more!

910201036.content: I got this... Ouch! It's hot!

910201037.content: Hmm... I see. Okay, this operation's a go.

910201038.content: Just don't go overboard... You know what I mean.

910201040.content: And that was the analysis of all your battles from that period. Overall, I can only give your performance as an Administrator a weak pass.

910201041.content: There is room for improvement in terms of your command ability and adaptability. There's also more work to be done in terms of your control of Mimir.

910201043.content: Stop your work for today. I'll take over the rest.

910201046.content: Administrator, you must understand that in our job to fight the Visbanes, there is zero room for error.

910201047.content: I know that you didn't join Aether Gazer on a whim. But maybe you've been under too much pressure lately.

910201048.content: Go have a good rest. Oh, and by the way, this is for you.

910201050.content: (Coughs) Um... it's nothing special. I hope it makes you feel better.

910201051.content: Oh, okay. Thank you, Miss Shu.

910201052.content: I walked out of the command room holding the bag Shu gave me. However, I wasn't sure what to feel about my sudden suspension from work.

910201054.content: Hmm? Oh, hi Poseidon. Um, nothing. I was just thinking...

910201056.content: Yeah. Shu said I should stop working and take a break... Hey, hold on, are you telepathic or something, Poseidon?

910201057.content: Heh, if only! I don't think you should take what you heard to heart, Admin.

910201058.content: You have the face of every single other person who's come out from Shu's office lately. They were probably troubled by their performance evaluations, too.

910201059.content: I don't think she's picking on you. I think this just shows how responsible she feels for everyone.

910201060.content: If she says you should go on a break, it's because she thinks you need one.

910201061.content: Thanks for saying that, Poseidon. I'm just not sure if I'm still needed around here...

910201063.content: Oh, anyway, Shu gave me this. Wanna share it with me?

910201064.content: Hey, isn't this that famous dessert from the shop next to Ocean World?

910201065.content: It sells out really quickly because it's so good. You have to get in line really early to be able to get your hands on it...

910201066.content: For some reason, Poseidon seemed really familiar with the dish.

910201067.content: Admin, do you think I can take this to the restaurant first for some prep work? It'll taste even better after.

910201070.content: In case I can't find you later, would you wait for me in your office?

910201071.content: It felt a little odd to be in the office with no tasks on hand. A little too tranquil.

910201072.content: (I suppose everyone could do without me just fine.)

910201074.content: Some unusual thoughts about to surface in my mind disappeared into the murk again.

910201078.content: No, no, I meant... I haven't thought this through yet... I wasn't sure whether I should ask you for help... Yep! That's what's happening!

910201079.content: But since you're already here... What is it that you need my help with?

910201080.content: Oh, that... Could you open this bottle for me, please?

910201081.content: You want my help with that?

910201082.content: I cast a glance at the Access Key on Asura's back.

910201083.content: I feel like I should be the one asking you to open bottles for me...

910201084.content: Ahahahaha! Well, guess I pushed a little too hard at training yesterday. Now I'm sore all over and can't quite muster the strength.

910201088.content: Oh, here's a token of my thanks! See you around, Admin!

910201090.content: Asura ran out in a flash, and nearly knocked over the bookshelf by the door along the way. Thankfully, she was quick enough to stop it from hitting the floor.

910201092.content: So... What is this thing, and why did she have to go to such lengths to give it to me?

910201093.content: I was about to open it when someone else entered the office.

910201097.content: Hmm? You need my help too?

910201099.content: Never mind. So, how can I help you?

910201100.content: I... Um... Would like to have a cold drink...

910201101.content: Is that hot soup you have?

910201102.content: Yeah, I meant to order the cold one...

910201103.content: I don't think this was ever sold chilled.

910201104.content: No, but I must have something cold right now.

910201105.content: Alright, I can add some ice cubes to it if you like. But I must warn you, the soup won't taste good that way.

910201107.content: Let's stir it a little and... Done. You okay with this?

910201108.content: Yeah. Thanks, Admin... And this is for you.

910201109.content: Vidar quickly took out a puppy ornament from her pocket and placed it in my hand.

910201110.content: Hmm? Isn't this a Fenrir ornament? I remember this is a limited-edition item for employees only... Why...

910201112.content: All that was left at the open door was a slightly chilly breeze...

910201113.content: (Hang on a sec. Vidar's room should be as frosty as an igloo, no?)

910201115.content: Hermes... What's the matter? Do you need my help too?

910201116.content: Help? No, no. I'm here to hand you your packages.

910201117.content: You mean this pile of packages is all mine?!

910201118.content: That's right! I could hardly see the way when I was carrying them! I had to ask someone to guide me to your office.

910201119.content: We received all these packages all of a sudden today, and we've run out of room at the warehouse. That's why I brought them here. Please sign for them.

910201120.content: But... I don't think I've purchased anything recently.

910201121.content: Hmm? Are you sure? But look here, it reads "The Administrator, Division Nine".

910201122.content: And judging by the packaging, it's something branded, too! Have a payday recently?

910201123.content: Unfortunately, no. Hermes, may I open them to take a look?

910201124.content: Of course. These are all addressed to you, anyway.

910201125.content: I opened every box, big and small, with much trepidation. As I did so, all kinds of bright and beautiful items filled the room.

910201126.content: A high-end shirt... a high-end suit... and there's this pen. These all look rather pricey to me.

910201127.content: Wow, I'm looking at a baller here!

910201128.content: The good news is, this doesn't look like a prank by someone... But the bad news is, I now have more questions than ever.

910201129.content: Did I really deliver these packages to the wrong recipient?

910201130.content: No... Look at this custom order with the tailor's instructions on it. The measurements on it indeed appear to be mine... but I've no idea what...

910201131.content: Um, aren't there a few more boxes left? Maybe if you open them you'll find some clues.

910201132.content: For example, this one... Um, Aether Gazer's specially designed photography equipment. But it feels a little different from the previous packages.

910201133.content: This box... feels really light. What kind of new-fangled photography equipment is it?

910201134.content: Um... The security sticker's torn, too. This looks like an empty box.

910201136.content: Hermes grabbed the box from my hand for a closer look.

910201137.content: That's impossible! I checked the security sticker before I left! Please don't tell me whatever's inside is lost!

910201138.content: Calm down. Did you ever look away from the packages on the way here?

910201139.content: Nope, I was carrying them the whole time, so... Ah! I remember now. I did put them down for a while when I asked for directions.

910201144.content: Hermes shook the box again, as if she could not believe what'd happened. Just then, a card with slanted handwriting fell from the empty box.

910201145.content:
Zenkibo has taken delivery of the contents of this box!

Come to the restaurant if you want the stuff back! Heh!

Yours truly, Zenkibo!

910201148.content: There seemed to be something else written below, but it was all crossed out.

910201149.content: What kind of a crazy message is this?

910201150.content: Mmm... Sounds like something Zenkibo would do, alright. Let's just head over to the restaurant and see what happens.

910201151.content: (Poseidon's been doing some prep work in the kitchen anyway. I should see if she needs help.)

910201152.content: We went to the restaurant as instructed. Though it was dinnertime, usually the busiest time of the day, we were greeted by a closed door at the entrance instead.

910201153.content: Strange, it seems... is the restaurant not open?

910201154.content: The lights aren't turned on, either. Food isn't being served yet?

910201155.content: Something's not quite right! I don't think we've seen anyone else on the way here.

910201156.content: You're right! It's really quiet, isn't it?

910201157.content: Could this also be part of some prank?

910201164.content: A chorus of voices suddenly rang in my ears, and then the lights came on. I saw that someone had decorated the restaurant in a rather unique way.

910201166.content: Admin, thank you for always putting your trust in the Intelligence Office. Here's something from Hodur and I. I look forward to working with you in the future!

910201168.content: Here, this is your reward for always being my lab rat: the all-new BunBun Massage Gun! I used up all my remaining funds to come up with this invention here!

910201169.content: Apart from its basic massage function, there's also a weapon mode. You can use it to protect yourself.

910201170.content: Admin! Admin! I have something for you too!

910201171.content: I thought for a long time. Fenrir can't wear this chain anymore, but it seems to be just right for you.

910201172.content: So, this is my gift to you.

910201173.content: And this is what I have for you...

910201174.content: Just a short while later, the mountain of boxes in my hands was tall enough to obscure my vision.

910201175.content: Admin, I also have a gift for you...

910201176.content: Ver.... just what is going on here?!

910201177.content: Well, obviously... it's because it's your birthday, Admin!

910201179.content: That's right! This is the day you put down as your birthday, Admin, isn't it?

910201180.content: But... This is all so sudden...

910201181.content: Oh, remember what you told me at the BBQ joint? That you don't remember what it's like to celebrate your birthday?

910201182.content: I thought it might help you if we put together a birthday celebration for you. Figured you might remember something that way.

910201183.content: And it doesn't matter if you don't! After all, we should all be celebrating our birthdays with everyone anyway...

910201184.content: I talked it over with everyone, and all of them liked the idea. We all want to do this for you, Admin.

910201186.content: Ah. That's because as soon as she heard the plan she decided to go see you with your gift.

910201187.content: But... it feels a little anti-climactic to tell you like this.

910201188.content: And what about Vidar and her soup...?

910201189.content: Um... I really did make a mistake...

910201190.content: I don't think she's caught up yet.

910201192.content: And the branded clothing must be...

910201193.content: Well, as the Administrator, you must present yourself in the most dazzling clothes.

910201194.content: And mind you, these are from the best brands in Omorfies. May you recall the sunny weather of Omorfies every time you wear them.

910201195.content: Thank you, Apollo... But this must have cost you a lot of money... Are you sure it's okay to give me something so nice?

910201196.content: The clothes did cost a pretty penny indeed. But don't worry, we have my sponsor Tyr to thank this time...

910201198.content: Hmm. No need to thank me. I haven't done very much. Besides, Division Nine's affairs aren't really my concern anyway.

910201199.content: But for you humans, birthdays are more important than most other occasions. So enjoy this moment.

910201200.content: Alright, then. The only thing left is...

910201202.content: Look over here, Admin! Say cheese!

910201203.content: Seeing as we managed to get this whole shebang together, let's make this party an unforgettable one!

910201204.content: As for this... Actually, I'd only planned to write you a note.

910201205.content: But Ver thought it wasn't enough. So I decided to break this new video camera out of its box just for you.

910201206.content: I'll record the whole party so if you lose your memory again you can watch the video!

910201207.content: Oh, by the way, I also took pictures as we were preparing for your birthday party. You can look at them later if you like.

910201210.content: That is an important piece of company equipment. Do you know what the consequences will be if you lose it?

910201211.content: Hold on, Miss Shu! I can explain! There's a reason for this!

910201212.content: Heh heh, we have quite the lively gathering here as usual. Looks like my plan to keep Admin in the office today worked...

910201213.content: We took advantage of the opportunity to prepare this surprise party for you.

910201214.content: Poseidon? Please tell me you didn't already know about this...

910201216.content: Heh, not really... What do you think, Admin? Do you remember anything yet?

910201218.content: You know, I've asked myself what kind of life I would be living now had I not joined Aether Gazer back then.

910201219.content: But I feel that I did make the right choice. After all, past memories are just snapshots. They may be important but...

910201220.content: The memories I've created with all of you here at Aether Gazer are even more important. Thank you!

910201221.content: I will continue to do my best working with you as we move forward!

910201222.content: Yes, we'll always be the best partners!

910201225.content: Oh! Oh! Oh! We mustn't forget! Admin, it's time to sing the birthday song and for you to make a wish!

910201226.content: Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you...

910201227.content: And tomorrow will be another brand new day, I guess.

910202001.content: I'm surprised there isn't more work today. I'm done already!

910202002.content: I finish putting away the things on my desk and look up at Ver, who's sitting across from me.

910202003.content: Already? Perfect! Then you can do what you want for the rest of the day.

910202004.content: So do you have any plans for this evening?

910202007.content: When I see Ver's eyes widen, I hold back a smile and pretend to continue thinking.

910202010.content: Why? Did you want to ask me to do something?

910202013.content: Besides, you marked out today on my planner. I see it every time I sit down. Plus—

910202014.content: Well, hey, I did wish you a happy birthday this morning.

910202015.content: It's not a surprise if you tell me!

910202017.content: (Sigh) It's already turning into a guessing game with you.

910202018.content: But that's okay. You can guess whatever you want, because whatever you think we're planning, it's going to be even better! Everyone wants to celebrate with you!

910202021.content: So if you don't have any plans, come with me!

910202022.content: I was expecting you to just take me to a big room...

910202024.content: Write your thoughts down on these, then put them in the box. Ookuninushi and Heimdall came up with this idea.

910202025.content: Ver pulls out a stack of leaf-shaped cards.

910202026.content: Write down your hopes, your troubles, what you're thankful for... Anything! Then put them all in the box!

910202027.content: You can take your time with them. I'll leave you to it!

910202028.content: Anything, huh... Well, let's give this a try.

910202029.content: I pick up the first card and write on it, then place it into the box.

910202030.content: After a moment, a bright projection appears.

910202032.content: We made the system, and apparently we're the first to test it out. Is that a good sign or not? Let me check the Tarot...

910202033.content: You two? Why are you projecting when you could just take a few steps and walk over here?

910202034.content: It wouldn't have the same effect. Let me see what you wrote... "The air conditioning in my office is hard to adjust."

910202035.content: It sounds kind of silly when you read it so seriously...

910202036.content: It sure does. The system automatically adjusts to the outside temperature, and sometimes it doesn't account for individual preferences. You could control it manually, but that's less precise.

910202037.content: You do occasionally secure funding for the Cryptics. We could make you a personalized system.

910202038.content: Would it be a lot of work?

910202039.content: Technologically, not at all. It would be much simpler than my BunBun series.

910202040.content: And besides, it's your birthday. You always take good care of the Cryptics, and we want to do something for you today.

910202042.content: And speaking of work, a birthday wish for you: May you have many, many days off, and may you never work overtime!

910202044.content: After saying goodbye to Heimdall and Ookuninushi, I think for a moment, then fill out my second card and put it in.

910202045.content: Here I am, here I am! Can you see me?

910202046.content: Try to find the camera, Jinwu.

910202047.content: Why? Did somebody lose it? Not on your birthday!

910202048.content: Jinwu, honestly! Just come over here.

910202050.content: Oh, now I see you, Admin! You, and me, and everybody else, all together in this magical place! Isn't it wonderful?

910202051.content: I suppose so. You can thank the Cryptics for that.

910202052.content: Let's see what you wrote! "There have been many challenges in the past year."

910202053.content: Don't I know that! All heroes have to go through difficulties. I had a lot of trouble when I came down the mountain. I had to destroy a whole bunch of Yaoguai!

910202054.content: The moon has its phases, and the sea has its tides. Whether on the road to Xu Heng or to Tian Lu Traders, no one arrives without encountering challenges. But though you may not see any way forward, when you look back, your path will appear straight and smooth.

910202055.content: No matter how hard the journey is, always take care of yourself. Worrying doesn't do your body any good. Here, I've got a few words from the chief.

910202056.content: Joy beyond measure forever and ever!

910202058.content: Always make time for your friends, no matter how busy you are. Life is about balance! You shouldn't work yourself to death.

910202059.content: The mountain people have a fortune for you.

910202061.content: I happen to know a little bit about everything. Just sit back and listen... "Dark clouds are coming, but so are friends. Wait a while, and the storm will pass." A good fortune! You just need a little rest, and everything will start going smoothly.

910202062.content: Sounds like a good sign. Thanks, everyone.

910202063.content: If you need anything, just ask. You've been a huge help to the Quad and Tian Lu Traders, and we haven't forgotten it.

910202064.content: That's right. Remember we're here for you.

910202065.content: After the projection fades and the laughter dies down, I write in silence for a while, then put in the third card.

910202067.content: You haven't been to Ain Soph in a while. Do you miss me, Admin?

910202068.content: I miss everyone in Pheasant Squad!

910202069.content: A clever response, Admin. You haven't answered my question.

910202070.content: You're a member of Pheasant Squad, Kuninotokotachi. I know what I said!

910202071.content: Let's see what you wrote, Admin. "We've made so many memories together."

910202072.content: I've known you for some time, Admin. This is the second birthday you've had since joining Aether Gazer. We've been through so much together, it would take more than just one day to celebrate it all.

910202073.content: You're a dear friend to us. I've learned so much from you.

910202074.content: And I've made so many new friends.

910202075.content: Why does it seem like whenever we meet one of those Sasanami fellows, it's during some sort of calamity? ... Well, they are interesting people. You could call those memories good, too.

910202076.content: But there's no need to be so serious. We've done more than just fighting together! Eating together, going to festivals, training, drinking the night away...

910202077.content: Wait, I don't remember drinking with you.

910202078.content: So when do you want to join me? Just you and me... There's nothing to be afraid of. I won't let you do anything stupid!

910202079.content: Drinking is unhealthy. It's not the best example, but the principle is sound. We have many days ahead of us and plenty left to do together... plenty of memories left to create.

910202080.content: I want to meditate with you, Admin, and train, and do so many other things...

910202081.content: Me too. There's so much I want to do with everyone.

910202082.content: It's settled, then. Let's not forget each other!

910202086.content: The projection ends, and the room reappears. I get back to work and then place the fourth card in the box.

910202088.content: Hel? I can barely see anything.

910202089.content: You're too close to the camera.

910202091.content: After a few tottering footsteps, Hel's entire body finally appears in the projection.

910202092.content: Can you see me now, Admin? I thought it would have been clearer before...

910202093.content: It's strange meeting like this. I feel close to you, and yet not close enough...

910202094.content: Let me read what you wrote: "You've become one year older, and hopefully, it's been a year of growth."

910202096.content: It's in the dictionary. "Growth" means "development towards maturity."

910202097.content: Does everyone mature as they get older?

910202098.content: Everyone's ages are always going up, whether they want it to or not—even Modifiers'.

910202099.content: Sometimes people think they can stay young and carefree forever, but everyone has to grow up some time.

910202100.content: Not all children are carefree... When I was a child, I wanted to grow up.

910202101.content: Does growth mean becoming better and happier?

910202102.content: A better person, and a happier life.

910202103.content: I see... Then I've experienced growth since I met you, Admin.

910202104.content: Hel smiles bashfully, as though she's just said something with extra meaning.

910202105.content: Happy birthday, Admin. May we both experience growth and happiness in our futures.

910202107.content: After thinking for a while, I place the next card into the box.

910202109.content: Anubis! Long time no see. You're free, too?

910202110.content: It is your birthday, after all. Happy birthday, Admin.

910202111.content: Let's see here: "I hope everyone important to me is happy and healthy." What a beautiful sentiment.

910202112.content: It's a bit trite, but it's how I feel.

910202113.content: Figuring out the right thing to say can be tricky. Oh, sorry—I don't mean you did badly or anything. I'm just saying, it's the thought that counts.

910202114.content: Admin, do you often think about... the things you did wrong? Or things that you've lost?

910202115.content: I think everybody does. I always hope things will turn out perfectly, and I always imagine I can save something.

910202116.content: That's normal. There's no need to blame yourself.

910202117.content: But that's why wishes matter. They remind us to move towards the future and cherish the present.

910202118.content: Anubis looks directly at my eyes through the projection as he says this.

910202120.content: Let go of those unhappy memories and enjoy today.

910202121.content: I'm quite happy I've been able to see everyone like this, even though you're so far away.

910202122.content: Yes... It's not easy to get us all in one place, unless something important is happening.

910202123.content: Well... "I hope everyone important to me is happy and healthy." I hope you're happy too, Admin.

910202124.content: Wishes remind us to cherish the present... Well said.

910202125.content: I look out the window. It's almost night, and the sky is a blanket of sleepy blue. Suddenly, I get a burst of inspiration and write the next card.

910202126.content: You finally got to us, Admin.

910202128.content: Me and Drowsie are here too...

910202129.content: It's been quite some time. I'm curious what you wrote today.

910202130.content: Let me take a look: "The sky is beautiful."

910202131.content: I've already spoken to so many people, and I happened to look up at the sky outside while I was feeling so good. I just had to write something about it.

910202132.content: I didn't think I'd get the experts on aesthetics, though. Now I feel like I should have written something nicer...

910202133.content: Everyone has the right to seek and admire beauty.

910202134.content: On the topic of aesthetics, there is not necessarily a difference between you and me.

910202135.content: I know. There's lots of pretty stuff in dreams.

910202136.content: Ha. Beauty is created by artists, and it is also found by chance as one travels through life. Both kinds of beauty bring us joy and move us to tears.

910202137.content: And what's more, this is the sky.

910202138.content: The sky... It looks like a dreamscape.

910202139.content: Shifting light, rolling clouds, dazzling colors, and the brief glimmer of the moon and stars before they are swallowed up by the sun. The sky has endless potential for beauty, and it is with us every day.

910202140.content: The sky changes unpredictably, and its rays create light and dark as they fall upon the world. Both are valuable sources of artistic inspiration.

910202141.content: We're fortunate to be able to see such thrilling beauty every now and again.

910202142.content: That applies to more than just the sky. There are plenty of beautiful things people don't pay attention to because they see them every day.

910202143.content: I just wish I could see them alongside everyone.

910202144.content: Even though we aren't seeing the same part of the sky, right now, you and I are responding to the same beauty.

910202145.content: Happy birthday, Administrator. May beauty always follow you.

910202146.content: Happy birthday. May you always have a sky to look upon.

910202147.content: Admin... Remember to have beautiful dreams.

910202148.content: Still, it would be better if we were all looking at the same piece of the sky.

910202149.content: But as birthdays go, I can hardly ask for more.

910202150.content: Unsure if I'm feeling peaceful or melancholic, I write out another leaf card and stick it in the box.

910202151.content: A deep whistling echoes through the projection, reverberating in my ears.

910202152.content: Happy birthday, Admin! Snowflake 2 wishes you a happy birthday, too!

910202153.content: Well, that explains things... Thanks, Snowflake 2.

910202155.content: Oh yes! I never get tired of it.

910202156.content: "There's so much I want to do." So you've been thinking it, too, huh?

910202158.content: Yep. I want to see all kinds of seas. Clear ones, cloudy ones, rainy ones, seas at different times and seasons. The sea is always changing, and you never know who or what you'll run into on it.

910202159.content: And there's lots of other interesting, wonderful things I haven't seen yet, and places to journey to. I want to see them all!

910202160.content: I just spoke to everyone and suddenly had a whole lot of ideas. I wish I could duplicate myself and go see them all. Who knows what sort of interesting thing we would do?

910202161.content: But at the end of the day, I still have to sit in my office and do work tomorrow.

910202162.content: Then you'll have something to look forward too!

910202163.content: You'll never finish doing everything you want to do. Sometimes a storm keeps you in one place. All you can do is wait and keep your eyes on the prize!

910202164.content: On the sea, the sky, the beach—on tomorrow and the day after, and all the surprises they'll bring.

910202165.content: Get used to looking forward, and you won't miss the time you can set out!

910202166.content: Like right now, I'm looking forward to the next time you and I meet...

910202168.content: Everything we're looking forward to will come about eventually.

910202169.content: The projection ends, and the room is plunged into silence. Only then do I realize the sky has gone dark.

910202170.content: Phew—I've been talking for a while.

910202171.content: What's this? No more cards? Well, that's okay. There are still some people I haven't spoken to, but I'll contact them later or wait until I can see them in person.

910202176.content: Is there a party after this? Everyone seems busy, so I don't know how many of them can come. At least I managed to talk to a bunch of people just now.

910202178.content: Thanks for what you did, Ver.

910202179.content: The idea came from everybody. Although, I did choose this next location.

910202182.content: I'm in luck. I've managed to run into you as soon as I arrived.

910202183.content: I came to wish you a happy birthday.

910202184.content: Go spend time with your friends. I'll hang back—I don't want to spoil your fun. It's just unfortunate I won't be able to hear what your wish at the party is.

910202185.content: But you can tell me in secret later.

910202186.content: It's your birthday, after all. No matter what you wish for—whether it's a homemade dessert or world peace with no Visbanes—I'll make it happen.

910202187.content: You already do so much, Odin...

910202188.content: Don't refuse it now! Give it some thought. I've got time—really.

910202190.content: We sent Odin an invitation as well, but she didn't respond. Now I see why.

910202191.content: Oh, it's getting late! Come on.

910202192.content: So who is going to show up?

910202193.content: We turn a few corners, and the bright lights and loud voices are getting closer...

910202194.content: Don't touch that, Poseidon. Goki and I took forever to... Captain! Over there!

910202195.content: Ah! I'm sorry for bumping into you!

910202199.content: Admin! I'm here! Oh, did I knock something over?

910202200.content: Well? Say something! Or have I rendered you speechless?

910202201.content: You're... all here? You're not all over the world? How?

910202204.content: Friends, bright lights, the smell of food, and many smiling faces.

910202205.content: So the projections were to make me think you were all back home or on business...

910202206.content: I thought I had already figured it all out... Turns out you were right. You guys surpassed my expectations!

910202207.content: You see? Everything that hasn't happened yet is a surprise!

910202208.content: Admin, try the skewers! My master taught me how to make it. I had to wait for you to get here before I could eat it, so I fed the pieces I made for practice to Fenrir.

910202211.content: So it's a barbecue... This had to have been Ver's idea.

910202212.content: They do barbeque in Xu Heng too, but the process and the seasonings are a bit different from Ain Soph... It's truly remarkable.

910202213.content: I've never even seen some of these plants they use for spices.

910202214.content: As soon as Chief Gengchen learned it was your birthday, he got you a gift. We've put it with all the others.

910202215.content: A gift from Gengchen... That's amazing.

910202216.content: I know you're all very busy. Thank you for coming to my birthday party.

910202217.content: It's nothing—Xu Heng can survive a day without us. And besides, we could use a break.

910202218.content: As soon as everyone heard it was your birthday, they wanted to come. Even those who really couldn't get away sent you birthday wishes.

910202219.content: Even I didn't think your birthday would bring so many people from different Sephirah Zones together.

910202220.content: All the gifts are over here. Do you want to open them? Guess who gave you which one!

910202222.content: One good turn deserves another. You've done so much for us.

910202223.content: Do I eat first, open presents first, or catch up with everyone? It's a good choice to have to make.

910202224.content: A loud noise rends the air, and everyone stops.

910202225.content: You've got to have fireworks at an outdoor party. I made these with a little help from my friends. Hope you enjoy them!

910202227.content: The colors fly into the quiet night sky, rising as they twist through the air.

910202228.content: The different shades flow, split apart, and converge again. They are just like countless wishes, countless voices, and countless smiles.

910202230.content: It's beautiful... A day just for you...

910202236.content: Never mind. I must have misheard.

910202237.content: I was just thinking... This is so beautiful—everyone's all together, and so happy... It's like a dream.

910202238.content: Thank you. Thank you all for coming.

910202239.content: Cake's here! Make a wish, Admin!

910202240.content: I wonder what you'll wish for this year?

910202246.content: You're a coworker, a pillar of support, a memory, and a source of joy—you're an important person.

910202247.content: You're the thrillingly beautiful sky, the tomorrow that everyone looks forward to.

910202248.content: You're the reason everyone is gathered together.

102801001.content: Phew! That should just about be it for this file. I'm finally done!

102801002.content: (I bet there aren't many people like me who'd work overtime on the weekends nowadays...)

102801003.content: I look out the window at the clear blue sky, and imagine how everyone else has been spending such a glorious weekend.

102801004.content:
Going for picnics with their families, spending a day at the beach with their partners, feeding the pigeons in a quiet park, watching Apollo's concert in the square...
Wow, I must be really frazzled to have thought of that last one!

102801005.content:
...Okay, that's it for today.
I've done my bit to safeguard the peace in Ain Soph.
