102801006.content: I switch off my computer, and clean my coffee-stained mug as best I can.

102801007.content: Aether Gazer Division Nine is much quieter on the weekends than it normally is.

102801008.content: I hope everyone had a fun weekend...

102801010.content: (It's so quiet I can hear my own footsteps. Wait a second...I don't think those are my footsteps!)

102801011.content: Huh? Administrator? W-what are you doing here?

102801012.content: I bump into someone unexpected as I turn the corner in the corridor.

102801013.content: Thor! Are you working overtime too? That's not like you...

102801014.content: I barely recall having ever seen the Thunder Squad captain in Aether Gazer even on weekdays. I don't know why, but she looks slightly panic-stricken to me.

102801015.content: Overtime..? Oh, no no no, I just had to talk to the fat cat about something... But sure, I guess you can call that overtime, too.

102801016.content: You're here to speak to Lord Mimir? That's even weirder... I thought you two hated each other.

102801017.content: Trust me, I'd have avoided talking to him if I could. But I have no choice...

102801019.content:
N-nothing...
I'm sorry, I really don't have time to chat. If I don't hurry up, those two will...

102801020.content: What's wrong with Apollo and Zenkibo?

102801022.content: How did you know that's who I was talking about?

102801023.content: I can't help but laugh at the shock on her face.

102801024.content: It's not that surprising, to be honest...

102801025.content: I mean, you're this anxious about "those two"—who else other than them would you be talking about?

102801027.content: Everyone knows that you put your team above everything else.

102801029.content: So, what's wrong with Apollo and Zenkibo?

102801030.content:
Shh.
Can you keep a secret, Administrator?

102801031.content: Thor clearly doesn't plan to tell me what's going on, but realizes that she can't get out of it.

102801032.content: I sent those two off on an easy guidance mission to the Peripheral Sea, and they should've been back by now...

102801033.content: The Peripheral Sea. Even the mere mention of it brings breathtaking memories back to me.

102801034.content:
Whenever anyone approaches the Peripheral Sea, it suddenly whips up a wild storm to prevent them from going any further.
But there are always some stubborn sailors who go headfirst into danger regardless.

102801035.content: They always survive, of course, and make their way through the storm to calmer waters. However, in order to prevent the worst from happening, whenever a boat is detected approaching the Peripheral Sea, someone will appear from nowhere and try to "persuade" them into leaving.

102801036.content: A guidance mission, huh? That should be a piece of cake for them.

102801037.content: Apollo sent me a message saying, "When sailing back to port, the trade winds will bring gifts from the ocean."

102801038.content: It sounds like they've found something valuable out there and they're bringing it back to me as a surprise.

102801039.content: But those idiots forgot to mark the mission as "Complete" in the system first!

102801041.content: And now I can't get a hold of them. I bet they're chasing after whatever this surprise is. But they should know that Shu will see if a mission isn't marked as complete on time!

102801042.content: Just you wait till they get back. Shu is gonna come down on them like a ton of bricks if she finds out they didn't follow procedure because they got distracted doing something else.

102801043.content: I know I'm the captain and could just click it for them, but I still have my principles.

102801044.content: So you've lost comms with them?

102801045.content: ...Basically, yeah. So I came to ask Mimir what their last known coordinates are.

102801046.content: And I had to bring him three pouches of cola coolant to keep his mouth shut. He really has no shame.

102801048.content:
Why would you want him to—It dawns on me as soon as the words leave my mouth.
Although I get what Thor is thinking, I'm still worried.

102801049.content: I mean, if you've lost contact with them, wouldn't it be best to notify Shu so she can send a search party out?

102801051.content: Administrator, if you're going to tell others...

102801052.content: Thor clenches her fists. Even though her Access Key doesn't appear, the pressure building in the air is palpable.

102801053.content: I'm just worried about them, that's all...

102801055.content: My hurried explanation seems to have angered her even more.

102801056.content: Are you saying I'm not capable of looking out for my own team?

102801058.content: You've got the wrong end of the stick. Thor, trust me, no one in Aether Gazer questions your strength...

102801059.content: I want to say "but fighting and finding are two different things"; however, I doubt it would appease the already riled-up Thor.

102801061.content: I won't say anything, even though it is against protocol. But only on one condition...

102801063.content: I want to go with you.

102801065.content: Are you joking? This isn't a cruise, it's the Peripheral Sea! It's a rescue mission!

102801066.content: I know. And I just so happen to have been to the Peripheral Sea. I once got... trapped there.

102801067.content: So I think my experience will come in useful.

102801069.content: Also, two pairs of eyes are better than one. I mean, that's what I wanna say, but what I'm really thinking is...

102801070.content: Now that I know what's going on, I can't just sit here and do nothing. I'll get so restless, I might end up going to Shu to ask her what to do.

102801073.content: I look into Thor's eyes seriously.

102801074.content: I feel the same as you. I'm just worried about them.

102801076.content: You're not going to take no for an answer, are you?

102801077.content: Thor doesn't want to let me come along, but I haven't left her any choice.

102801078.content: But listen to me. If you come with me, that means you're a temporary member of the Thunder Squad.

102801079.content: And that means you obey my orders! You are NOT to go off on your own. Is that clear?

102801081.content: Okay, we're all good. The sun has chased away the storm and the haze.

102801082.content: Alright alright, it was just the sea playing a prank on you. The water can be a little playful sometimes, hehe.

102801084.content: The sailors they'd saved from the turbulent waves are sprawled on the ship's deck, gasping for air.

102801085.content: We... w-won't come this way... again...

102801086.content: What were you doing around here anyway? There aren't any routes that pass this way.

102801087.content: We were looking for silver dragonfish! Not that we had any luck...

102801088.content:
Silver dragonfish?
Er, you mean the ones from the fairytales?

102801089.content: They've been spotted, right here in these waters. Maybe you haven't heard the rumors, but I assure you every single sailor out there has!

102801090.content: Even so, it can't be worth risking your lives for...

102801091.content: Of... of course it is... Cough! Cough!

102801092.content:
Calm yourself, brother. You've swallowed a lot of seawater. Let me explain...
Every part of a silver dragonfish is priceless.

102801093.content: Its oil is said to even be able to remove any scars...

102801094.content: Remove scars? That does sound very useful. Especially for people who are consistently conscious about their look.

102801095.content: Hey Pineapple, are you thinking what I'm thinking?!

102801096.content:
Great minds, Zenki.
Are we both in agreement?

102802001.content: So, you wanna borrow my ship?

102802002.content: Please, Skadi... We didn't have time to file an official rescue application, so you're the only hope we've got.

102802004.content: Well then... Since it's the Admin who's asking, Snowflake 2 and I will always agree. Last time we had quite an adventure together!

102802006.content: But... I have an urgent mission at hand, and I can't just abandon my mission... What? You can handle yourself, Snowflake 2? Well... (uh-hm)... Alright then...

102802007.content: Skadi communicates with Snowflake 2 in a way we cannot perceive, and then turns back to us.

102802008.content: Snowflake 2 says you should wait for her at this location at the port. Here're the coordinates.

102802010.content: ...Wow, the bond Skadi has with Snowflake 2 is incredible.

102802011.content:
Oh yeah, I was surprised too when I first saw it.
I wish I could have that with someone, too.

102802012.content: Well, you're about to find out about the bond we have with each other in the Thunder Squad!

102802014.content: Just wait for it. Even though my team might have literally disappeared off the end of the world, I'll still find them!

102802015.content: Thor has been standing holding the ship's guardrail since the moment we departed, silently gazing off in the direction our rescue ship—that is, Snowflake 2—is traveling.

102802016.content: The fierce sea wind blows her red braids high, like flickering flames.

102802017.content: (Surely it must hurt her face to stand there facing the wind like that?)

102802018.content: Without really thinking, I find myself walking over to join her.

102802019.content: What is it? Is there something on my face?

102802020.content: It seems like minutes pass before Thor notices me staring at her.

102802021.content: No, I was just wondering if you were a little chilly from the wind.

102802023.content: She turns her head, slightly embarrassed, and starts to rub her cheeks.

102802024.content: Thor... Why is it that you don't want any help with this mission?

102802026.content: I see her eyes dim a little.

102802027.content: Because even I have to admit that making such a request would be too much.

102802028.content: If Shu were to find out, she'd go ballistic. I'm talking two-hour-long tirades. Even thinking about it makes me shudder.

102802029.content: Yeah, I think she'd probably lock you up until you've copied out the Aether Gazer Division Nine Code of Practice 100 times.

102802030.content: Oh heaven forbid! I don't want to spend half my time in detention like Zenki...

102802031.content: Speaking of which, how does Zenkibo make it through being locked up by Miss Shu so often?

102802032.content: Apollo keeps smuggling her video games in there for her... Oops.

102802033.content: Thor realizes she's accidentally revealed one of her team's little secrets, and covers her mouth as though it would stop the words from coming out.

102802034.content: It's all right, I won't tell anyone.

102802036.content: Of course. I'm a member of the Thunder Squad too, aren't I?

102802037.content: As long as it doesn't go against my principles, your secrets are safe with me.

102802039.content: Thor's laughter chimes out, and she pats me firmly on the shoulder. She's so strong I feel like my shoulder's about to dislocate.

102802041.content: I have my reasons for doing this, even if Shu does find out.

102802042.content: Thor doesn't evade my initial question. She stares at the distant horizon, as if willing the sea to dry up so she could find her teammates.

102802043.content: I know Apollo and Zenki have been with me for ages, but they're not actually my first team members.

102802045.content: I thought Apollo and Zenkibo were the only Thunder Squad members there had ever been. Does that mean there were other team members who had quit before I arrived at Aether Gazer?

102802046.content: Before the Thunder Squad was officially established, I was the head of a temporary team. Being a rookie, I didn't understand what being a captain truly entailed—I only knew how to fight on my own, not as part of a team...

102802047.content: Let me guess, you're thinking that's exactly how I am now, aren't you?

102802049.content: (Okay okay, I did think it for a second. Was it that obvious she could tell from my face?)

102802051.content: Luckily she isn't in the mood to argue with me. Instead, she crosses her arms over her chest and returns her gaze to the horizon.

102802052.content: Anyway... My immaturity drove my team away.

102802053.content: Since then, I've been determined not to let a single person leave the Thunder Squad ever again.

102802055.content: For a split second, it seemed as though the girl with her arms crossed over her chest was hugging herself in the face of the gust. But it was just a fleeting impression, or perhaps my misunderstanding.

102802058.content: Captain! It could be a trap!

102802059.content: I don't care what it is, there's nothing my hammer can't take care of! Yahh!

102802062.content: Stay back! W-where's my Access Key? Argh!

102802063.content: The Visbane that had been lying in ambush is blasted to pieces by an electrical storm the second it gets too close to Thor. Her teammates aren't so lucky, though.

102802066.content: In the end we managed to fight our way out, but it wasn't easy.

102802067.content: I was too engrossed in my own battle, completely forgot about the rest of my team and put everyone in danger. When we got back, some had to be admitted to the Medical Department, and some had to write self-disciplinary reports... I'm a terrible captain, aren't I?

102802069.content: It had never occurred to me that the almighty Thor could have vulnerabilities and regrets.

102802070.content: Come on, don't look at me like that... I don't want your sympathy.

102802071.content: Thor raises an eyebrow at me as she says this.

102802072.content: It's all in the past now.

102802074.content: For a long time after that, no one wanted to be on a team with me. And, to be honest, I found it a relief.

102802075.content: I thought I'd always be the lone Modifier, fighting out there on my own. But then those two idiots just kind of attached themselves to me. No idea why, haha.

102802077.content: Yeah. So me teaching them a lesson like they were naughty school kids is better than them getting in trouble with Shu.

102802079.content: ...You sort of sound like one of those parents who dotes on their children so much that she gets into arguments with the teacher.

102802080.content: What? Hahaha! What a weird analogy!

102802081.content: If that's what it looks like to you, then maybe I have grown as a captain after all...

102802082.content: Thor rests her arms on the guardrail and arches her back like a cat, dipping her head down until it almost touches her chest.

102802084.content: The sea wind blows Thor's hair upwards, revealing the hidden scar that winds its way down her back.

102802086.content: What are you looking at? Huh?

102802087.content: I'm sorry... I didn't mean to...

102802088.content: In the face of Thor's sudden rage, I bow my head and apologize as she hastily straightens up.

102802089.content: It's nothing. I got it this one time I was helping save those idiots' asses.

102802090.content: I kind of think of it like it's my captain's medal.

102802091.content: Oh! You'd better not tell them I've said that! Don't tell anyone!

102802094.content: I've always felt like there's something a bit extreme about Thor. There's a lingering, subtle vibe about her. But...

102802095.content: Those two are very lucky to be part of the Thunder Squad.

102802096.content: Huh? Did you say something, Administrator?

102802097.content: My words must have been swallowed by the wind.

102803001.content: These are the coordinates that Mimir sent.

102803002.content: We scan the surrounding waters, but see nothing out there apart from Snowflake 2.

102803003.content: The only living thing we see is a flock of dumb seagulls circling above us, probably hoping to steal some food.

102803004.content: Look how calm and sunny it is. Surely they couldn't have run into any trouble?

102803005.content: Who knows? The sea is as inconstant and fickle as the Source Layer... But I'm sure a little storm is nothing to Zenkibo and Apollo though they're not the strongest among all.

102803006.content: I'm just worried they might have come across what you did last time... We don't know all of the nasty little surprises the Peripheral Sea might have in store.

102803008.content: I gulp upon being reminded of what happened the last time I was here. Terrifying memories buried deep in my subconscious begin to stir.

102803009.content: So where do we look? We've got an entire ocean to search—if we start off going in the wrong direction, we'll never find them!

102803010.content: Thor seems distressed, so I offer up an idea of my own.

102803011.content: We could simply circle out, using these coordinates as a starting point. As we expand the radius, we'll get further and further out without needing to worry about missing them.

102803012.content: You're right! That's the only useful thing you've said all day, Administrator.

102803015.content: Thor pats me playfully on the back. It's so hard that I nearly throw up.

102803016.content: That's our plan, then. Let's head out!

102803020.content: After fruitless hours scouring the boundless sea, I finally spot something other than seagulls with the telescope.

102803022.content: Thor leaps to my side, and presses her cheek against mine so she can also see through the viewfinder.

102803024.content: I can't imagine why they'd go AWOL just for some fishing... Wait, do you think that sounds like something Apollo would do?

102803026.content: (Jeez, try having a little faith in your team, Thor.)

102803027.content: I wonder... If they were operating near here earlier today, maybe these fishermen might have seen them.

102803030.content: Thor hops up onto the guardrail and calls out to the fishing boat.

102803031.content: We can just use the ship's radio.

102803032.content: I hope you don't think I don't know how to use a radio. I just thought this way would be quicker!

102803033.content: We approach the boat as fast as possible.

102803034.content: Yes, yes! A girl with double braids and roller skates, and a boy with a pineapple hairstyle. Have you seen them?

102803035.content: Huh? Yep, right... Cough! How about... Cough!... Bleugh!

102803036.content: Whoa, are you still feeling sick? Make sure you do it over the side! Fine, I'll do the talking.

102803038.content: Yeah... Technically speaking, they saved us. We had this idea to chase these fish, and before we realized it we'd gone off course. To top it off, the navigator's busted and we lost connection...

102803039.content: It was just then that we sailed into the eye of a storm. I thought we were fish food, but then those two came out of nowhere and saved us like godsends. They brought us from despair back into the light!

102803040.content: Wow, you sound exactly like Apollo. That guy does astound me sometimes...

102803041.content: (This must be the boat from the Peripheral Sea that triggered the alert they went to investigate.)

102803043.content: Do you know where they went afterward?

102803044.content: The sailors shake their heads. They were in a state of shock after their ordeal and didn't see which way the "godsends" went.

102803046.content: Oh, wait a second! They asked to borrow some of our deep-sea fishing gear. I wouldn't be surprised if they've gone after the silver dragonfish too...

102803047.content: Huh? They did? Sorry, I must have been too busy throwing up seawater to notice...

102803049.content: A silver what? Is that the fish you were chasing that brought you all the way to the Peri... to such a remote part of the sea?

102803050.content: Silver dragonfish. They're crafty devils! As soon as they sense danger—be it a predator or a boat—they swim straight for the high winds and rough seas to try and put their attackers off.

102803051.content: They're deep-sea fish, so they can dive down deep where the wind and waves don't affect them.

102803053.content: Why did you risk all that to catch them? What's so great about these silver dragonfish?

102803054.content: Everything! Let me tell ya, every part of that fish is priceless. Especially its oil—it can even make scars disappear!

102803055.content: Scars... I unconsciously look at Thor's back.

102803058.content: Wait, those two people who saved you—did you tell them what you said about the silver dragonfish?

102803059.content: Huh? Yeah, a little... They also asked what we were doing in this part of the ocean, so we told them.

102803062.content: Thor's expression brightens as she turns to me.

102803063.content: Administrator, I've figured out how we can find those two trouble makers.

102803064.content: ...You're not going to say they've really gone fishing, are you?

102803065.content: No one knows my teammates better than me.

102803066.content: Those idiots will do anything for me, no matter how dangerous.

102803067.content: She smiles confidently, as though all of the world's truths lay in her hands.

102803068.content: It sounds like you have a plan, so let's get going! What's the next step, captain?

102803070.content: She slaps my shoulder again, but this time it doesn't hurt.

102803073.content: I'm good. I think it's more important that we get to Apollo and Zenkibo...

102803075.content: My stomach chooses this moment to betray me. It's as though Thor's suggestion reminded my body that I've been too anxious to eat since we left.

102803076.content: Ha, I knew it—we've been out most of the day without any food, and you are human after all...

102803078.content: Trust me, I already know how to deal with those two later. Besides...

102803079.content: You're a member of the Thunder Squad now. That makes you my responsibility just as much as they are.

102803080.content: I'm just slowing you down, aren't I?

102803082.content: Thor wags her finger in my direction.

102803083.content: Now we need to prepare for the next stage of the mission, and that involves making sure you've got the strength for it. I'm not about to let you back out now.

102803084.content: While you're getting ready, I'll grill some fish for us to eat. I'm sure we've got all the gear we need right here.

102803085.content: The Snowflake 2, which has accompanied Skadi on many a distant journey, is fully equipped with fishing gear, kitchen equipment and refrigerators—Everything you'd need if you found yourself stranded.

102803086.content: After explaining what I need to do to prepare, Thor takes out a grill and places it on the deck, then takes a fishing rod and bucket to the side of the ship.

102803087.content: I'll leave all of that up to you, Administrator. Leave dinner to me!

102803088.content: Hey! I'm pretty sure there are rules about making me work on my day off.

102803089.content: I'm sorry, Lord Mimir. I'll make sure I'll bring some cola coolant back for you...

102803090.content: You'll bring thirty bags, you hear me? Thirty and no less!

102803091.content: Sure thing. As long as Miss Shu doesn't find out...

102803092.content:
That's your business, rookie.
If word gets out, I'll just tell them it's your own doing.

102803093.content: (Glug, glug, glug... Ahh!) Alright, I've sent you what you're after.

102803095.content: I cut the line before he even answers, and hurriedly open the file he just sent me on the terminal.

102803096.content: Captain Thor had asked me to get Lord Mimir to send us a detailed weather chart for the region.

102803097.content: The problem is, I really don't understand what I'm looking at... What's with all these circles and arrows?!

102803098.content:
To be honest, I don't usually bother with this kind of stuff either.
But this isn't a combat mission so I'll leave this up to you, Administrator!

102803100.content: I'm no meteorologist, either. But I try and think back to what I learned about weather charts during my training.

102803101.content: Eventually, among the mess of lines and arrows, I figure out the point where the winds are converging.

102803102.content: According to Thor's theory, Apollo and Zenkibo are trapped somewhere around here.

102803103.content: Hey! You all good? I've made fantastic progress over here!

102803104.content: So soon? Did you cheat and use lightning?

102803105.content: What, are you questioning my skills? I said I was going to grill the fish, not fry them!

102803106.content: I was only kidding. Mmm, smells delicious!

102803107.content: A golden, perfectly cooked mackerel is lying atop the grill.

102803108.content: Not bad, huh? You learn these kinds of survival skills when you're out in the field a lot.

102803110.content: You can give Snowflake 2 the coordinates you found, and we'll eat on the way. Dig in!

102804003.content: The closer Snowflake 2 gets to its programmed destination, the stronger the wind becomes.

102804004.content: The ship's dashboard is showing force 9 winds already.

102804005.content: I think we're heading straight for a storm.

102804009.content: Thor, since when have you developed such a good rapport with Snowflake 2? Skadi will get jealous!

102804010.content: Haha, anyone who fights by my side is a member of my team! So of course we're getting on well!

102804012.content: Definitely! The same goes for you, Administrator!

102804014.content: Thor's frankness makes me feel even a little embarrassed.

102804015.content: Black clouds obscure the sky, and the wind whips the sea into formidable waves. It begins to look like the entrance to a demon fortress from a movie.

102804017.content: The dashboard sounds an alarm signal.

102804018.content: I don't know if we're going to be able to make it to the eye of the storm...

102804020.content: Visibility is near zero. We're going to have to use radar to find our way.

102804023.content: The indicator on the radar detector begins to spin like crazy. Thor huddles over the console, clenching her fists as she watches the display.

102804026.content: 30 degrees east by south, 0.8 nautical miles from our present location—there's something out there that looks like a boat!

102804027.content: It must be them... Right, let's go!

102804028.content: Although it isn't far to travel, given the current winds it would be too dangerous for even Snowflake 2 to go straight there.

102804030.content: Snowflake 2 signals its determination. Huh? Since when I've been able to read its emotions, too?

102804032.content: Thor clenches her fists and stands in silent thought.

102804033.content: If I'm not mistaken, Snowflake 2 is equipped with a rescue skiff, right?

102804035.content: I'm just thinking, going through a storm like this might not be a good idea for a human like you, Administrator...

102804036.content: As team captain, I can't put you in that kind of danger.

102804037.content: So I'm going to take the skiff and find them myself. Administrator, Snowflake 2, I want you to stay here and wait for us.

102804039.content: I grab Thor's arm before she can leave.

102804040.content: Even a large boat would struggle to stay afloat in this weather—how do you think you're going to manage in a skiff?

102804041.content: It's fine—as long as I keep going fast enough, it won't overturn. It's like riding a bike! I suppose...

102804042.content: I don't think it's the same at all! Also, the skiff doesn't have any kind of cover—what's to stop you from getting blown overboard by the wind?

102804043.content: Even though I understand that Thor is a Modifier, and she can use her Divine Power to keep the boat and herself stable, she still appears to be just a petite young girl... on the outside.

102804044.content: Don't you underestimate me! And what would you rather have me do? Just stand back here and let my teammates die?

102804045.content: Er, that's not what I meant...

102804046.content: I can tell from Thor's tone that she's losing patience. But eventually, she drops her head and takes a deep breath.

102804047.content:
I'm sorry, I shouldn't have flown off the handle like that.
I just can't wait any longer.

102804048.content: Even though she's lowered her voice, her determination to save Apollo and Zenkibo is crackling off her like static electricity.

102804051.content: I grab her wrist as she goes to open the hatch. An electrical current that's definitely not just static electricity jolts through my arm and makes it numb.

102804054.content: She turns to look at me, her gaze both surprised and accusatory.

102804055.content: What do you think you're doing? Have you forgotten our deal? I said you could only come if you obeyed my orders!

102804056.content: Don't try my patience. I'm going to give you until the count of three to let me go. 1... 2...

102804058.content: It takes everything I have to withstand the power surge running through my arm, but I refuse to release my grip on Thor's wrist.

102804059.content: A suggestion? I just told you I don't have time...

102804060.content: Don't you think the reason why Apollo and Zenkibo ventured into danger without hesitation is that they know no matter what happens, you'd come to their rescue?

102804061.content: Of course! That's why I need to go now!

102804062.content: Hear me out, captain. Why don't you try just trusting them? And for once, how about trusting me too, your new temporary Thunder Squad member?

102804064.content: The electricity emanating from Thor's palm begins to dissipate, and I'm finally able to tell her my idea.

102804065.content: You really are something, aren't you? I'm beginning to see why Shu and Odin hold you in such high regard.

102804066.content:
That plan is just a possibility.
You're the only one who can make it a reality, Captain Thor.

102804068.content: Were it not for you, I would have just rushed over there to save them myself. So I think you deserve the best seat in the house to watch my moves!

102804069.content: Thor exits the cabin and walks to the deck. To be safe, I stay in the cabin—on the "best seat", as she called it—and watch.

102804071.content: Facing the brooding sky, Thor holds aloft her Access Key—the incredible hammer known as Mjölnir—wrapped in lightning.

102804073.content: What looks like a reverse lightning strike shoots up from the deck, illuminating the dark sky.

102804074.content: However, unlike lightning, it doesn't disappear. It stays there, shooting into the sky like a lighthouse beam.

102804075.content: No matter how dark the clouds get, no matter how big the waves, there's no way this light can be obscured.

102804076.content: It's a signal for our friends to follow.

102804077.content: And it's a signal that's sure to be answered—Thor's confident grin is already telling me so.

102804079.content: Yes. Your Access Key must be the brightest flare ever known to man.

102804080.content: At least, it needs to be for the two of them.

102804081.content: No matter how impenetrable the darkness, no matter how strong the sandstorm, when that light pierces the sky...

102804083.content: As if an echo, two golden arrows arch through the southeastern sky like shooting stars. That's the direction we'd thought they'd gone.

102804085.content: Yes, that must be Apollo's solar arrows! He's smart when he tries, you know.

102804086.content: And just like you predicted, they haven't moved far from their starting point.

102804087.content: Without any weather charts, it wouldn't have made sense for them to go sailing off anywhere, in case they ran into even worse storms or whirlpools. Staying in the eye of the storm was the safest thing to do.

102804088.content: Provided that they knew someone would be coming to rescue them, of course.

102804089.content: So now we want to use my "flare" to guide them out of the storm, right?

102804090.content: Yeah. I'll get Snowflake 2 to move as close as it can to the edge of the storm.

102804092.content: Hey, look at me being ordered around by this newbie! Hahaha!

102804093.content: Most leaders would not like this role reversal, but Thor simply laughs.

102804094.content: Finally, our two ships meet in the calm waters outside of the storm area.

102804095.content: Captain, captain! I knew you'd come! Pineapple and I even had a bet on which direction you'd come from!

102804097.content: Oh look, the Administrator's here as well. Please, forgive our unseemly appearance.

102804098.content: Zenkibo throws herself into Thor's arms, talking nonstop, while a disheveled Apollo smiles apologetically for his appearance.

102804099.content: You guys really had me scared for a minute, you know that?

102804100.content: How many times would you have died by now if you didn't have a captain like me, hmm?

102804101.content: But I'm so glad you're safe...

102804102.content: Thor scolds her teammates, but pulls them in for a hug as she does so.

102804103.content: All three of them are drenched, and their faces are wet with tears, but they still hug each other without embarrassment.

102804104.content: Oh, Zenki, where's the present we got the captain?

102804105.content: Ah, I almost forgot! That's the whole reason we got into this mess in the first place!

102804106.content: Zenkibo pulls out a bucket from somewhere.

102804107.content: Ta-da! I bet you've never seen a fish like this before, have you captain? It's a silver dragonfish, like the ones in the fairytales!

102804108.content:
It's said that its oil can remove all physical scars.
Captain, if you rub this over the scar on your back, then you'll be as perfect on the outside as you are on the inside.

102804112.content: I've told you guys I don't care about that! And I've never said that I...

102804113.content: You think of this thing on my back as a scar, but I see it as a medal. The last thing I want to do is get rid of it.

102804114.content: Hey, you swear me to secrecy, but then you tell them anyway?

102804115.content: It just felt like the right time. You get that, right?

102804117.content: Zenkibo and Apollo stand there stunned, their eyes brimming with emotion.

102804119.content: So! As to what to do with this precious fish, I say—let's cook it up and eat it! I believe this will make us the first people in history to taste the legendary silver dragonfish!

102804120.content: Just as Zenkibo and Apollo are about to pounce on Thor, she lifts up the bucket of fish and makes a suggestion I very much agree with.

910301002.content: Whoa, slow down over there! No need to run over like this. What are you so excited about?

910301003.content: Hehe. Remember the Cryptics' Dorm 1.0 Project?

910301004.content: The Dorm Project... Um. I thought it was just an idea Ookuninushi was toying with.

910301005.content: Oh, it's an actual project alright. The Cryptics remodeled an unused floor of Aether Gazer into a new dorm and outfitted it with cutting-edge smart furniture. It's had Ookuninushi working overtime for three or four months!

910301006.content: I just heard from Miss Shu that the building and installation of the Dorm has been completed. Wanna come with me for a look, Admin?

910301007.content: Ver, with her hands on the table, looks at me with much excitement.

910301008.content: A petite girl with twin ponytails pokes her head in through the door, anticipation just faintly visible in her eyes. When our eyes meet, however, she lets out a soft "hmph", turns around, and leaves.

910301010.content: Although I was mentally prepared, seeing the Dorm for myself is an experience so beyond my poor imagination.

910301011.content: For a dorm where Modifiers would ostensibly do nothing but rest, the Cryptics tech installed everywhere is true overkill.

910301012.content: This must've been pricey. But the Cryptics always have a reason for lauching a new project. So what's their motive with the Dorm...?

910301013.content: I heard that the aim is to relieve fatigue and improve partnership dynamics among Modifiers... but that's just the official line!

910301014.content: If you ask me, when people from different squads live together, isn't it like a shared home?

910301015.content: Pillow fights, slumber parties, late-night chit-chat sessions... I can't wait!

910301016.content: No, no, what I'm saying is, this can't simply be a dorm for the Modifiers, right?

910301017.content: Hehe, sorry, I got carried away with the thought of slumber parties. As for the other facilities... Hmm. I can't seem to turn on this electronic screen... Maybe it's just for day-to-day use?

910301019.content: Ookuninushi's voice rings out behind us. Guess she is not too satisfied with our explanation. She walks toward us with her cheeks puffed out.

910301020.content: The robot guide on this floor is out of action. I... Um, I'm here to retrieve it. I can lend a hand if you need any help.

910301021.content: That'd be awesome! Thanks so much in advance, Designer-in-Chief!

910301022.content: To ensure the stability of the Dorm system, all rooms are currently equipped with standard furniture, which are limited in terms of their learning and self-repair capabilities... And they don't look very good either.

910301023.content: Our Modifiers are free to decorate their rooms to their own liking. Of course, if you ask me, the natural choice would be the BunBun furniture serie—

910301026.content: To help our Modifiers better integrate into human society, Aether Gazer has decided to open a store at Valleyrand Theme Park—that's the one you're looking at right now.

910301027.content: Considering your physical characteristics, the Cryptics have developed an online management system for you, so that you can set up the store remotely.

910301028.content: You have the important task of deploying our Modifiers to the theme park, Admin. Of course, this was Shu's decision, not mine!

910301029.content: Whatever income the Modifiers earn through this part-time gig will come in the form of Park Stamps, which can then be used to expand the store or purchase furniture items.

910301030.content: However, since everyone here likes to be the best, they may end up working more hours than advisable. Remember to pay attention to their fatigue level, and make them come back for a break when they get too tired!

910301031.content: You. Must. Make. Them. Come. Back. Okay?

910301032.content: But I don't really have a knack for business... Why don't you go get some advice from Tyr instead?

910301033.content: Hmph. That stupid cat was right.

910301035.content: The Cryptics spoke to Mi.UU, the central control AI at the theme park, just this morning. It told us that it's been asked by someone to assist you in the management of the store.

910301036.content: Although he didn't say who, he was pretty convincing with his offering of cola-flavored coolant. There's only one stupid cat in Aether Gazer, right?

910301037.content: Mi.UU has been planning and managing the many affairs of Valleyrand Theme Park. Anyone can run a thriving business there with his help.

910301038.content: How should I put it... this makes me feel both a little excited and uneasy at the same time... All these plans so nicely laid out for me... I'm not allowed to say no to you folks, am I?

910301039.content: Mmm. More accurately speaking, you can't say no to Shu. As you know, at the armaments factory in Neuhansa that one time, she—

910301040.content: Ookuninushi begins to dredge up the old scores. It is time to change the subject.

910301041.content: Fine, fine! I accept! I won't let Ms. Shu down. Now let me take a look at how to operate this thing...

117011001.content: Thick smoke blots out the sunlight, and the windows glint red from the roaring flames.

117011002.content: A horrifying, fiery monster throws its head back in a roar. Its body barely fits in this cramped indoor space. As the tiles are peeled away, a young man holding his unconscious younger brother to his chest stares down his opponent with eyes that burn even more fiercely than the flames.

117011003.content: More fiery breath streams from the corners of the beast's mouth, and the youth once again clenches his burned fist—

117011005.content: The two flaming auras violently collide. The beast howls shrilly, obliterating everything around it in flames...

117011006.content: The recent collapse of the tranzist ore trade dealt a massive blow to every one of Valleyrand Group's business operations.

117011007.content: Eirikr Valleyrand, the former head of the Valleyrand family, put long hours into overseeing a great many onerous enterprises until he tragically succumbed to exhaustion.

117011008.content: With no one left to manage the company, the remaining family members intervened and began planning for equity restructuring.

117011009.content: Before the Valleyrand family could formally address the issue of succession, their attention was consumed by the sudden outbreak of a fire.

117011010.content: According to front-line reporters, the fire occurred in the Valleyrand mansion. The steward sustained serious injuries and was rendered unconscious, while the former head's eldest son suffered severe burns to his right hand.

117011012.content: Images of the fire begin to flash on the screen when Odin suddenly hits the pause button, freezing the broadcast at the moment firefighters enter the scene.

117011013.content: This is a news broadcast from a couple of weeks ago. Look carefully at this scene.

117011014.content: Hmm... Those aren't ordinary scorch marks.

117011015.content: Judging from the color of the flames, their temperature must be around 800 degrees—much too low to inflict damage of that severity to marble texture pillars.

117011016.content: From this, we can speculate that some external energy altered the temperature of the blaze, but that would defy Gaea's basic laws of physics.

117011017.content: The only thing capable of doing this... is Bane Energy!

117011018.content: Are you suggesting that a Visbane was present at the scene of the fire?

117011019.content: Heimdall doesn't respond immediately, but ponders the question for a while.

117011020.content: That is the most likely explanation.

117011021.content: Looks like I was on the right track then...

117011022.content: Tearing a rift from the Source Layer to the Surface Layer is beyond the abilities of an ordinary Visbane. We're looking at someone dangerous, and they just so happened to be involved with this fire...

117011023.content: Odin frowns slightly, seemingly recalling something loathsome.

117011024.content: Visbanes capable of tearing a rift from the Source Layer to the Surface Layer are very rare, and very dangerous. Whatever did this must be exterminated immediately.

117011025.content: Also, if sufficient samples could be retrieved from the scene of the fire, it would greatly aid my current research...

117011026.content: That makes you perfect for the upcoming mission then.

117011028.content: You don't think I'd pull you away from your busy schedule just to have you analyze a video, do you?

117011030.content: Heimdall, I've decided to entrust you with the task of investigating this fire.

117011031.content: But, according to company regulations, field missions are under the purview of Shu's field squad. Besides, I don't have any experience with fieldwork...

117011032.content: Shu has to go to Omorfies on another important mission. Besides, this won't be your garden-variety Visbane extermination mission.

117011033.content: I have a feeling that the Visbane that appeared at this fire is unlike any we have on record. So, I need someone who's done their research on unusual Visbanes on the case.

117011034.content: And we both know that person isn't Ookuninushi.

117011036.content: It would be best if you set out today.

117011037.content: Odin's leisurely expression suddenly turns deadly serious.

117011038.content: I don't want to see another fire in the news.

117011039.content: I'm going to go find them then.

117011040.content: After Heimdall rushes out, Odin continues watching the news report. Before long, a brief sound bite catches her attention.

117011041.content: I wouldn't have expected a fire like that to leave any survivors...

117011042.content: Excuse me, Mr. Valleyrand! What are your thoughts on the fire? Is there any truth to the rumor that it was arson?

117011043.content: The youth being questioned doesn't respond. He silently grips his thoroughly bandaged arm, submitting to the barrage of camera flashes in a business-like manner.

117011045.content: I'm only here to confirm one matter to the public: I am due to assume the role of the next chairman of Valleyrand Group.

117011046.content: After dropping this deceptively compact bomb, the young man turns and leaves.

117011047.content: Breaking news just in! Tyr Valleyrand, the eldest son of Valleyrand Group's former chairman, has confirmed that he is set to succeed his father!

117011048.content: The reporter goes on to repeat some insignificant claptrap regarding the news, but Odin's attention is already elsewhere.

117021001.content: Currently, the fire that occurred in the Valleyrand mansion is still under investigation. Police say they've gathered a lot of evidence and testimonies, but still can't get to the bottom of the fire's true cause.

117021002.content: The scene of the fire has been cordoned off, and the Valleyrand family has relocated to another one of their properties in Init...

117021003.content: Heimdall pauses the news report. She sets down the field manual in her hands and looks on at the mansion through the blockade.

117021004.content: —She's now outside of the sealed-off Valleyrand mansion.

117021005.content: The fire may have laid waste to everything, but it's clear from the ruins still left standing that this was once a magnificent estate.

117021006.content: Assuming there was nothing left in the rubble to entice thieves, the police secured the manor with nothing more than police tape wrapped around its perimeter.

117021007.content: Street CCTV blind spot—check. Necessary counter-surveillance measures—check. Eyewitnesses removed—check.

117021008.content: White gloves—ready. Recording equipment—ready. Sampling equipment—ready.

117021010.content: As if conducting an experiment, Heimdall confirms each important item on her list one by one. Then, she gingerly weaves through the "seal" and enters the manor's interior.

117022001.content: The corridor seems to stretch on endlessly. In an all-out effort, Heimdall makes it back to the corner she arrived from, but another group of Visbanes block her path.

117022002.content: Looks like the mission file wasn't as airtight as we thought. The optimal strategy in a situation like this is to...

117022003.content: Suddenly, a wave of heat billows in from one side, erupting into flames that instantly incinerate half of the Visbanes surrounding Heimdall while driving back the surviving half.

117022005.content: Stunned, Heimdall whips toward the direction the heat came from. There, she sees a stern-faced young man standing atop a broken wall at the corner of the corridor.

117022006.content: The reddish armor on his right arm exudes a searing heat palpable even from a distance.

117022007.content: Recalling the news report she studied several times over, Heimdall instantly recognizes the youth as the eldest son of the late lord of the Valleyrand family.

117031001.content: Tyr is clearly more surprised than Heimdall by this "chance encounter."

117031003.content: Heimdall doesn't answer him as her gaze falls to his vambrace.

117031004.content: The device detected a Divine Grace signal, and that's an Access Key... You're a Modifier?

117031005.content: Heimdall remembers something. According to the news report, two people were seriously injured in the blaze, but no one died.

117031006.content: If there was truly a Visbane capable of tearing a rift in the Source Layer at the fire and no Modifiers there to help, the chances of an outcome that fortunate would be slim to none.

117031007.content: Well, that does clear a few things up...

117031008.content: Are you a Modifier as well?

117031009.content: Since we can confirm that we are who we say we are, I don't think there's any need for tension between us. I'm not your enemy.

117031010.content: Tyr nods, but that heat continues to emanate from his vambrace.

117031011.content: Whoever you are, now isn't the time for introductions.

117031012.content: So, you're capable of fighting those monsters too? Let's work together. First, we'll clean up this room, then we can discuss topics of mutual interest to us.

117031013.content: Right. That would be the optimal solution to our current situation.

117032001.content: Now faced with a joint attack, the once rampant Visbanes soon retreat in defeat, fleeing into the shadows.

117032002.content: Strange, where's the Source Layer rift?

117032004.content: Presuming you've awakened only just recently, lacking key information is a perfectly normal phenomenon.

117032005.content: Heimdall takes out a portable electronic device and shows it to Tyr, bringing him up to speed on the relevant data.

117032006.content: I feel like... I've seen this information in my mind before... But I'm not sure...

117032007.content: So, we have to seal the rift in the Source Layer to stop more of those Visbanes from coming through? That does explain a few things.

117032008.content: After being bombarded with a slew of new information, Tyr's voice finally steadies.

117032009.content: I think introductions are in order. I'm Heimdall, I'm with Aether Gazer...

117032010.content: This is hardly the place to receive guests. Come with me.

117032011.content: Tyr leads Heimdall to a clearing outside. The only place on the estate left untouched by the flames, the grass here is still a lush green.

117032012.content: A tent was pitched in this clearing at some point. Based on the supplies scattered around it, someone has been staying here by themselves for a while.

117032014.content: I keep an eye on things from here. I need to sleep somewhere, don't I?

117032015.content: I don't know why, but I decided subconsciously that I couldn't let those Visbanes get anywhere near humans.

117032016.content: That's the duty of all Modifiers. If you'd made contact with Aether Gazer a bit earlier, you wouldn't have had to go to all this trouble. Aether Gazer should be handling this sort of thing.

117032017.content: Tyr doesn't respond at first. He seems to be considering the information contained in Heimdall's words.

117032018.content: I remember now, Aether Gazer is that new company that sprang up recently.

117032019.content: That's our public-facing image, yes. In essence, Aether Gazer is a Modifier-led organization dedicated to mitigating the Visbane threat.

117032020.content: You mentioned "Modifiers." When I acquired this power a few days ago, a similar concept appeared in my thoughts.

117032021.content: So, you and I are the same kind of person then?

117032022.content: "Person" isn't an accurate definition of a Modifier. We're dedicated anti-Visbane program modules autonomously derived from Gaea. From the moment we awaken, we shoulder the mission of fighting the Visbanes.

117032023.content: Tyr is silent for a while, neither accepting nor rejecting Heimdall's explanation.

117032024.content: Now that we've each confirmed our identities as Modifiers, it's my duty to invite you to become a member of Aether Gazer.

117032025.content: Are Modifiers required to join Aether Gazer?

117032026.content: Well... no, of course not. But Aether Gazer's founder believes that we can fulfill our mission more efficiently together.

117032029.content: If you've been keeping up with the news, you should know that I'm about to become the chairman of Valleyrand Group. My only mission is to save the family business from crisis.

117032030.content: I see... I have no right to interfere with your decision, of course.

117032031.content: But even if you decline our invitation, due to the involvement of Visbanes in this fire, Aether Gazer will still be intervening in the investigation.

117032032.content: I hope we can exchange intel on the matter.

117032034.content: Seemingly arriving at last at some sort of consensus, the veneer of courtesy that was previously hampering progress between the two finally comes away.

117032035.content: I've been keeping watch from here ever since the fire.

117032036.content: The Visbanes appear at the same time every day. No matter how many times I fight them off, they always return at the same time the next day.

117032037.content: A rift that appears in the Source Layer at a fixed time? That doesn't match anything in our case files...

117032038.content: Seems like you've done your research. It's your turn to tell me what you know.

117032039.content: Well... the only possible explanation is the existence of a unique, high-level Visbane that opens a rift from the Source Layer to the Surface Layer at a fixed time—

117032040.content: According to the news reports, you were a witness to the fire. Did you see a Visbane matching that description?

117032041.content: Suddenly, Tyr winces slightly, as if recalling a bad memory.

117032042.content: Oh, I'm sorry. It was rude of me to ask you something like that... But I don't have enough evidence to draw any conclusions. If I could investigate further...

117032043.content: Before Heimdall can finish her sentence, she's interrupted by a shout coming from the distance.

117032045.content: A youth heavily clambers over the broken wall wrapping around the manor, then runs toward Tyr.

117032047.content: A real estate agent. She came to inquire about our intention to transfer ownership of the property. That's all you need to know.

117032050.content: Heimdall gives Tyr a strange look, then quickly discovers the crux of the situation at hand from the look Tyr gives her in return—Edward is an ordinary human who must be kept from the truth.

117032051.content: Ahem...! Correct, I'm a real estate agent... Would this be the second young master of the Valleyrand family? I've seen your name in the file... Uh, I mean, the news.

117032053.content: No need. This won't take long, and we still have business to discuss.

117032055.content: Do you really have to discuss your business here? You know we've rented a new apartment.

117032058.content: Edward clearly has more to say, but he holds back, seemingly deterred by the presence of an outsider like Heimdall.

117032059.content: Hoenir was released from the hospital today. I wanted to ask you to come back so we could have a meal together.

117032060.content: I know a lot's happened with the company and the house recently, but we should at least sit down to eat together, don't you think?

117032061.content: Tyr is silent for a while, then nods.

117032064.content: Seeming to know very well that no amount of continued pleading would yield a satisfactory response, Edward hangs his head and slowly leaves the way he came.

117032065.content: What are Modifiers supposed to do about their former lives once they've awakened?

117032066.content: Why do you ask that all of a sudden?

117032067.content: If I had to give an answer, it may involve a complex combination of philosophy and the theoretical structure of consciousness...

117032068.content: You don't need to answer, I was really asking myself. Is Aether Gazer certain that it can get to the bottom of the fire?

117032069.content: As long as we can collect enough information, we can devise a solution for any Visbane threat—of that I am certain.

117032070.content: Tyr looks in the direction Edward left, seemingly considering something. Finally, he comes to a decision.

117032071.content: I see. I'll cooperate with you.

117032072.content: But you haven't changed your mind about joining us, I take it.

117032073.content: Indeed, I have no intention of joining Aether Gazer—but that doesn't mean we can't work together.

117032074.content: Consider it a joint venture between Valleyrand Group and Aether Gazer. I'll get to learn the truth about the fire, and you'll get to eliminate the Visbane threat. Everyone gets what they're after.

117032076.content: We'll meet here tomorrow, same time.

117032077.content: A brief, but clear verbal contract now made, Tyr takes an overcoat out from the tent. He then leaves without saying a word, apparently having an important function to attend.

117041001.content: According to inside sources, Valleyrand Group is now in the final stages of its equity restructuring. Grandet Valleyrand, the eldest brother of the former family head, is now the largest shareholder second only to the immediate Valleyrand family.

117041002.content: Prior to this, Grandet Valleyrand was a staunch supporter of the Valleyrand family, even helping quash dissent on numerous occasions. After the equity restructuring, however, his intentions seem to have changed.

117041003.content: It was recently confirmed that Tyr Valleyrand, the heir of the former head of the Valleyrand family, will serve as the next chairman of Valleyrand Group. Grandet Valleyrand, however, has not explicitly expressed his support.

117041004.content: Odin pauses the news report, then resumes her conversation.

117041005.content: I've read your report. So, Tyr's a Modifier after all.

117041006.content: You knew? How did you arrive at that conclusion?

117041010.content: I extended the invitation to him, but he declined.

117041011.content: Declined...? Never mind. You confirmed that there was Visbane involvement in the fire—Have you determined the exact cause?

117041012.content: The investigation didn't reveal the presence of a large Visbane as we'd previously surmised. I can't draw a sufficiently robust conclusion without the facts to support it.

117041013.content: I'm hoping you'll be able to reach a definite conclusion as soon as possible. Also, keep an eye on that Tyr.

117041015.content: Based on the rumors circulating online and information I've gotten from insiders, the power grab he's facing now is of far greater concern than regular old Visbanes that respawn like clockwork.

117041016.content: And yet, at such a critical juncture, he's opted to make time to cooperate with you. There has to be more to this than he's letting on.

117041017.content: But he is a Modifier. Wouldn't it be normal to decide to undertake his innate mission after some consideration?

117041018.content: Heimdall, we can't draw this sort of conclusion about all Modifiers. There are always "exceptions."

117041019.content: Oh... then it will indeed be necessary to exercise additional caution.

117041020.content: Continue with your investigation, and keep me posted.

117041022.content: Mr. Valleyrand, they say that Valleyrand Group will undertake an equity restructuring. Is that true?

117041023.content: I'm under no obligation to disclose internal company affairs.

117041024.content: Just a moment please! They say you'll replace Tyr as the chairman of Valleyrand Group. Is that true?

117041025.content: That position has always belonged to the most capable member of the family. It's not up to me.

117041026.content: However, I am skeptical about Tyr's fitness for the role. I'm not convinced that he'll be able to lead the company out of this crisis as its next chairman.

117041027.content: Does that mean that you intend to challenge Tyr?

117041028.content: What do you mean "challenge" him? I only want the next leader of the company to be sufficiently qualified to assume the role. That's the concern of every investor with shares in Valleyrand.

117041029.content: While the news plays on the TV, Edward set out food on the table. He doesn't know whether his invited guest will show up, but he's still set a place for him at the table.

117041030.content: Growing seemingly more dispirited the more he listens, Edward's hands gradually slow down as he lays down the silverware.

117041031.content: Hmph, that old fox! He hasn't said a single meaningful thing, but the message to the shareholders is crystal clear!

117041032.content: (Sigh) I was against Tyr using his assistance to gain ground. The way I see it, he just wants to use Tyr's position as the family heir to eliminate the competition before he kicks down the ladder!

117041034.content: Come on, Hoenir. You've only just gotten out of the hospital, don't get yourself all worked up.

117041035.content: I know. I just can't stand it when people bite the hand that feeds them, and venting is better than bottling things up. Besides, I'm worried that Tyr's been having a tough time lately.

117041036.content: I do know a little bit about what's happening with the business.

117041037.content: I know there's nothing I can do to help Tyr besides making sure dinner's ready on the table for him, but...

117041038.content: Edward looks over at the empty seat and says nothing more.

117041039.content: Uh... I'm sorry, I shouldn't have brought it up. Let's talk about something else... (Cough! Cough!)

117041040.content: Hoenir, you're coughing again! Has your injury not fully healed yet?

117041041.content: I'm certainly not in prime health at the moment, but it's nothing some more recovery time won't fix.

117041042.content: The fire... All I remember was being hit by a falling board when I was trying to escape... And yet, in the end, I came away from it the least injured.

117041043.content: You and Tyr must have put yourselves in a lot of danger to save me.

117041044.content: What kind of talk is that? Do you really think Tyr and I could have just left you there?

117041045.content: I know. That's why I wish I could help take some of the pressure off of him...

117041046.content: How did we end up back here again...? Anyway, don't worry. Once this is all behind us, he'll at least be able to make the time to come back and eat dinner with us.

117041047.content: And what if I have time now?

117041048.content: Startled, Edward and Hoenir turn to look at the door and discover that Tyr has already arrived.

117041049.content: We were just talking about you!

117041051.content: Work wasn't too busy today, so I was able to slip away and come see you and Hoenir.

117041053.content: Edward looks doubtfully at the news. Noticing this, Hoenir quickly turns off the TV.

117041054.content: We're just glad you're here, so let's leave our troubles at the door for now. I'm ashamed to admit it as the steward around here, but Eddie prepared tonight's dinner. So, make sure you get a good taste of everything!

117041055.content: I picked up a few things from watching TV. I've been home this whole time with nothing else to do anyway...

117041056.content: The police haven't ruled out arson as the cause of the fire. We had to keep you somewhere safe.

117041057.content: Then why aren't you somewhere safe with me?

117041058.content: Seeming to sense the awkwardness bound to arise from this question, Hoenir quickly uncovers the food.

117041059.content: Eddie, it's not every day we have your brother here with us. Let him be. Tyr, go on and give Eddie's hard work a try!

117041060.content: At the urging of a frantic look from Hoenir, Tyr sits down at the table, then takes a bite of his meal under Edward's nervous gaze.

117041061.content: It would seem there's no need to hire a chef while Hoenir recovers.

117041062.content: Right, that's exactly what I was thinking! We should be cutting down on expenses right now.

117041063.content: I learned a few midnight snack recipes as well. If you'd like, tonight I could...

117041064.content: I won't be spending the night here. I'll need to return to the office later.

117041066.content: The once convivial atmosphere between the brothers grows heavy again. Just as Hoenir is about to step in to mediate, Edward speaks up.

117041067.content: I understand that a lot's been happening with the company recently. It would be strange if you weren't concerned at all.

117041068.content: So, of course you've been busy, just like... just like Father was.

117041069.content: We've discussed Father's situation before. It's important that we understand the sacrifices he made.

117041070.content: I understand them! I just don't agree with them!

117041071.content: The atmosphere between the brothers instantly drops to a freezing point—even the food cools a few degrees.

117041072.content: (In a low voice) Tyr, don't make me angry.

117041074.content: I'll leave after a midnight snack.

117041075.content: Edward is silent, seemingly not buying Tyr's lip service.

117041077.content: ...I'll be sure to make it a good one then.

117041078.content: The tension finally softens, and Hoenir breathes a sigh of relief.

117041079.content: Later that night, Tyr watches as Edward gradually drifts off to sleep in his bed, then gently closes the door behind him.

117041080.content: Considering all that's happened recently with the company and the house, I'm impressed that you remembered to make the time for your family... You've grown.

117041081.content: ...Actually, the main reason I came back was to ask you a few things. You could say I'm here on business.

117041082.content: You... Can't you just pretend even a little?

117041084.content: You and I... We're both "Modifiers," correct?

117041085.content: Yes... Since you awakened in the fire, it would make sense that you've learned these concepts.

117041086.content: I met another Modifier at the house today. She's from an organization called Aether Gazer. They sent her to investigate the fire.

117041088.content: ...to be expected. The fire caused a massive stir, and a big fellow capable of tearing a rift in the Source Layer even showed up. Of course that would catch their eye.

117041089.content: It seems you know of this organization.

117041090.content: From long ago, yes... but I'm certainly not one of their members. I'm not a member of any Modifier organization.

117041091.content: Is that so... Based on the information she provided, the majority of Modifiers operate within fully-formed organizational structures now. Unaffiliated Modifiers like us are rare.

117041092.content: If you must ask, you're correct.

117041093.content: It was never my intention to hide anything from you. I just wanted you to find out on your own and make your own decision.

117041094.content: In that case, if I end up being kicked off the board of directors, at least I could find a job with that organization.

117041095.content: Protecting humanity, exterminating Visbanes... Sounds much simpler than fighting and scheming against a bunch of old men.

117041097.content: I haven't made a decision, Hoenir.

117041098.content: Tyr glances toward the door to Edward's room as he says this.

117041099.content: At least, I can't make that decision right now.

117041100.content: Hoenir, now that you've been released from the hospital, isn't it time for you to tell me what I need to know?

117041102.content: Motioning for Tyr to follow him, Hoenir leads him into a secret storage room.

117041103.content: Valuable items rescued from the fire fill the room. The most conspicuous among them is a large sword lying across a wooden shelf.

117041106.content: It's been with you since I found you. It's definitely your Access Key. I would have told you as soon as you awakened if that tough customer hadn't landed me in the hospital for the last two weeks.

117041107.content: If you want to be able to fight the Visbanes, you'll need to activate your Access Key. Aether Gazer might have gotten involved in this affair as well, but I imagine that, like me, you're not willing to rely entirely on others.

117041108.content: Tyr unconsciously touches the vambrace on his right arm.

117041109.content: If I don't activate my Access Key... I won't be able to fight the Visbanes?

117041110.content: That vambrace is my Access Key, you knucklehead. It's called Firebrand. I'm just lending it to you for the time being to help suppress the Bane Energy that big guy left on your arm. You won't be able to use it to fight.

117041111.content: Tyr falls silent. Perhaps to avoid making Hoenir worry, Tyr doesn't tell him about how he's been fighting off Visbanes the last few days. Still, there's a flash of doubt in his eyes.

117041112.content: As I just said, this sword called Tyrfing is your Access Key. Go on, give it a try.

117041113.content: Tyr attempts to touch the huge sword, but it continues to lie silently on the shelf, not responding to its wielder.

117041115.content: Strange, how could an Access Key refuse to respond to its own user? Did we miss a step? I'm not an expert when it comes to this...

117041116.content: Never mind. I still don't know why those Visbanes would attack us, but if they show up again, I can take them!

117041117.content: Don't worry about them, they... haven't come back.

117041120.content: Well, that's good. You can take your time with Tyrfing then.

117041122.content: Tyr casts another glance at Tyrfing, and manages to hold back his doubts.

117041123.content: After they leave the storage room, the landline in the living room rings abruptly. With lightning-fast reflexes, Tyr swiftly grabs the receiver before the sound can reach Edward's room.

117041125.content: Who's that calling at this hour?

117041126.content: An auctioneer. It would seem someone's sabotaged the financial settlement in the aftermath of the fire. The estate's land has been mortgaged to an auction house.

117041127.content: What? They started with the family's property? Those guys weren't bluffing after all. How can you be so calm after something as major as this?

117041128.content: The words fire out of Hoenir's mouth, but halfway through, he remembers that Edward is asleep in the other room and quickly lowers his voice.

117041129.content: I was expecting this. I'll take care of it.

117041131.content: (Sigh)... It's been all these years since Eirikr took you in, and you really do act more like him by the day.

117041132.content: We can keep this from Edward, of course, but you can always talk to me. I know it must be an uphill battle with the company right now, but I can still help!

117041133.content: Hoenir, the greatest help you can give me is looking after Edward.

117041136.content: Already? Well, do try and find the time to come back more often!

117041137.content: Tyr flashes a smile as he reaches the door, tacitly acquiescing to Hoenir's request.

117041138.content: He quietly shuts the apartment door behind him, then disappears into the darkness of the night.

117051001.content: Heimdall, laden with detection equipment, waits for a long time under the shining sun. Finally, she sees that figure in the flowing clothes again.

117051002.content: Hello! I've made all the preparations for the investigation!

117051003.content: What did you bring so many devices for?

117051004.content: Last night, I came up with various theories on the connection between the fire and those Visbanes. To verify each one of them, it'll be necessary to collect sufficiently exhaustive data.

117051005.content: I'm compelled to inform you that we only have one day left.

117051006.content: What? Why? Shouldn't you have told me something so important earlier?

117051007.content: It was an unexpected development. Some family infighting has caused a bit of a stir, and someone handling the financial settlements after the fire privately mortgaged the land to an auctioneer.

117051008.content: Someone will come to requisition the land tomorrow. We won't be able to bluff our way in here when that happens, so we'd better wrap this up quickly.

117051009.content: I can't believe it... Alright, let me just select the equipment I'll need. If we're going to juggle combat and making quick work of the Visbanes, I'll need to narrow down my agenda...

117051010.content: You can bring more of your things if it'll help us uncover the truth faster. Just leave all of the fighting to me.

117051011.content: That won't do, I'm the investigator here...

117051012.content: Your research is also important to me.

117051013.content: Without waiting for Heimdall to respond, Tyr has already changed into lighter clothing and is making his way toward the remains of the house.

117051014.content: Fine... this is also a logical strategy.

117052001.content: Just as the Visbanes occupying the room are driven out, one of Heimdall's devices emits a piercing warning tone.

117052002.content: Spatial distortion at critical levels... It's a Source Layer rift!

117052003.content: As if defeating these Visbanes triggered some sort of switch, one of the walls suddenly contorts and the temperature within the room skyrockets.

117052004.content: This room itself is the Source Layer rift!

117061001.content: The scene before them is instantly plunged into a fiery blaze, and searing waves of heat surge toward them.

117061002.content: Before they know it, Tyr and Heimdall have entered a space enveloped by flames. It's like the inside of an oven—each breath they take here feels like it singes their insides.

117061003.content: The Source Layer? No, that's inconsistent with the data...

117061004.content: Tyr's gaze is fixed on the depths of the space, as if he's locked eyes with something in there.

117061006.content: We seem to have strayed into some sort of closed data space. The Bane Energy signal here is really strong...

117061007.content: Is the data you want here?

117061008.content: A lot of it is here, but we'll need to go a little deeper to get the rest...

117061009.content: Heimdall suddenly freezes. Casting aside the suffocating heat, she looks ahead and sees that the space is crawling with roaming Visbanes—going "a little deeper" isn't a decision to be made lightly.

117061010.content: But considering the danger level here, going in deeper would be anything but sensible.

117061011.content: In that case, we'd better wrap up the investigation in one go so that we don't have to make a second trip. I'll handle anything that gets in our way.

117061012.content: A wave of heat immediately bursts forth, and the Visbanes drawn to the sound are all repelled by the flames surging out from his right hand.

117062001.content: The depths of the space are like hell itself. Even Tyr, who has been a force to be reckoned with up until now, starts to falter.

117062002.content: I don't think any Visbanes have chased us here.

117062003.content: Based on the heat map, this should be the center.

117062004.content: Are you able to see any connections between this place and the fire that happened outside?

117062005.content: There seems to be something here capable of converting Bane Energy into thermal energy. If it can connect directly to the Surface Layer through Source Layer rifts, then a small amount of thermal energy overflow could cause a fire.

117062006.content: The point is, Bane Energy this strong must have a source...

117062007.content: A roar suddenly resounds, and Tyr's right arm immediately burns with a pain so searing that it forces him to his knees.

117062009.content: As she goes over to help Tyr up, Heimdall discovers something strange about his right arm. She looks in shock at the scan on her device.

117062010.content: Along with the Access Key's Divine Grace signal, Tyr's arm is also emitting an intense Bane Energy signal—and it seems to be resonating with something in this space.

117062011.content: Don't worry about me right now!

117062012.content: The nearby flames suddenly coalesce to rapidly form an entity as blazing hot as lava. Spewing waves of heat, it twists and contorts until it finally reveals a hideous face—

117062013.content: It's a giant beast covered in flames. Hot, fetid saliva drips incessantly from its gnarled, fang-filled maw, igniting everything it touches.

117062015.content: Heimdall's portable device wails shrilly, like the primal scream of prey in the face of danger.

117062017.content: That's the big one I mentioned earlier.

117062018.content: I should have known all along—to find out the truth once and for all, an encounter with this Visbane was inevitable. It's just that the strength of this Bane Energy...

117062019.content: I think we should retreat at once and go back the way we came. As long as the Source Layer rift we came through hasn't disappeared yet, we should be able to get out of here!

117062020.content: Have you collected all the data you need?

117062022.content: To get the whole truth, won't you need this Visbane's data as well?

117062024.content: I'll stall it while you extract the rest of the data you need. Then we can retreat!

117072001.content: The warped room walls finally reappear. The deadly blazing sun hasn't followed them—all that remains of it is a trace of residual scorching heat.

117072002.content: The spatial distortion parameters are a match. We made it back...

117072003.content: Tyr grips his right arm. The intense battle just now seems to have taken a lot out of him.

117072005.content: I'm fine. What I need is a conclusion.

117072006.content: Right... I haven't run an in-depth analysis on the data yet, but the facts are basically clear.

117072007.content: The Bane Energy scorch marks left behind at the scene of the fire match that Visbane's Bane Energy signal. It is the primary culprit.

117072008.content: However, I'd incorrectly assumed that the Visbane actively forced its way to the Surface Layer.

117072009.content: I took note of the energy gradient from the space's margins to its center—it was a seamlessly sealed space. Not even that Visbane has the power to open it from the inside, unless...

117072010.content: Unless it had an external medium... That's it! That explains why the Visbanes that escaped the space always converged here to attack—there's a medium here leading to it!

117072011.content: Could this medium have been placed by a person?

117072012.content: Heimdall is taken aback—she didn't expect that Tyr would ask this all of a sudden.

117072013.content: The medium is essentially an anchor point connecting the Source Layer space to the Surface Layer. It may take the form of an ordinary object in the Surface Layer, so it is possible that a human has it...

117072015.content: Several members of the Valleyrand family died in bizarre fires well before this one.

117072016.content: These family members were all, without exception, my supporters. Moreover, the fires they lost their lives to were all extremely similar both in terms of timing and intensity to the one that happened here.

117072017.content: Are you suggesting... that there's someone who knows what the medium does, and that they used it to start the fires?

117072018.content: The police weren't able to pinpoint the cause of the fire, so they just closed the case... If someone could control a fire like this, it would be the perfect way to eliminate opposition.

117072019.content: Someone wants me gone, and not just from the company.

117072020.content: How could an ordinary human have even gotten their hands on this medium, let alone abuse it like this?

117072021.content: Based on the data I've just gathered, this Visbane feeds on soul data. If it already consumed large quantities of soul data after someone opened a medium before...

117072022.content: If it gets another chance to invade the Surface Layer and consume more soul data, it will likely be able to breach the confines of that space—which means we need to recover that medium before it's misused again!

117072023.content: The medium isn't the point here—If the Modifiers' objective is to protect humanity, then the malefactor misusing the medium must be brought to justice first!

117072025.content: The human police force can't determine the cause of the fire, but you can prove the connection between the fire and that medium, right?

117072026.content: With that proof, I can lock the person abusing the medium behind bars.
