117072028.content: Everything is sustained by Gaea's stability. Revealing the existence of the Visbanes to human society would risk significant deviation to Idealbild.

117072029.content: The correct course of action is to confiscate the medium, eliminate the Visbanes, and then... wipe the perpetrator's memories of anything related to the medium.

117072030.content: And after their memories are wiped?

117072031.content: After that, the perpetrator will resume being an ordinary human with no effect on Idealbild, and their fate will be decided by human society.

117072032.content: As Modifiers, our missions are carried out on the premise that we do not influence the normal workings of human society in any way.

117072033.content: The normal workings of human society...

117072034.content: Tyr silently contemplates these words, unsure whether they're an expression of helplessness or a kind of mockery.

117072035.content: According to the normal workings of human society, someone will come tomorrow to requisition this land, and your mission will be dead in the water.

117072036.content: I almost forgot about that... How could this have happened? This is clearly still a crime scene that's been cordoned off by the police! Not that either of us can talk, I guess... But still, how could it have been mortgaged off like that?

117072037.content: The culprit obviously has the police in their pocket. They certainly covered all their bases.

117072038.content: Saying this, Tyr suddenly glances at Heimdall's Access Key.

117072039.content: But they only covered their bases in terms of the rules of human society.

117072040.content: If secrecy is all that matters, you have plenty of Modifiers in Aether Gazer—you must have someone who could take out the culprit undetected. Then all our problems will be solved.

117072042.content: Gaea runs a set of complex decision-making systems that are used to limit Modifiers' access permissions and prevent them from doing anything that may harm the order of human society.

117072043.content: Even if it simply detects a Modifier's intent to do some sort of harm to this order, Gaea will unlink that Modifier from their Access Key to restrict their activity.

117072045.content: Tyr wordlessly walks over to the charred windowsill. Looking at the ruined estate, he heaves a sigh.

117072046.content: Sorry... I learned about the Valleyrand infighting while studying the press materials over the last few days. I'm afraid I don't have any advice I can offer on that.

117072047.content: But I've done extensive research on Visbanes and Gaea, so I can vouch for the conclusions I've just stated.

117072048.content: As for the land issue... I'm afraid that's also beyond my area of expertise...

117072049.content: The silent Tyr suddenly clenches his right fist—he seems to have made up his mind about something.

117072050.content: There is one way to keep the property without disturbing the "normal workings of human society."

117072051.content: Aether Gazer is essentially a Modifier organization, but to integrate into human society, you still have a complete corporate structure and assets under your control, correct?

117072053.content: The ownership of this plot of land has been transferred to the auction house as a fixed asset to settle the debt. But if you track down whoever's in charge of the auction house and make a sufficiently attractive offer, you could buy the land outright.

117072054.content: The only thing is, the offer Aether Gazer makes must exceed the anticipated auction price, which will certainly be steep.

117072055.content: That would work! I'll report this back to Aether Gazer.

117072056.content: I'll have an answer for you by tomorrow at the latest. Then we can continue our investigation. The first thing we need to do is find the medium...

117072059.content: Sorry. But as I previously stated, my mission is to save my father's legacy. If the investigation doesn't serve this objective, then I won't waste any time on it.

117072060.content: The estate is at the sole disposal of Aether Gazer.

117081001.content: According to reporters on the scene, several of Valleyrand Group's senior directors have called for a new board vote to restructure the board of directors in a bid to tackle the company's current financial crisis.

117081002.content: Meanwhile, Tyr Valleyrand re-entered the public eye after a long hiatus tonight, attending a board of directors meeting as the acting chairman.

117081003.content: According to the announcement Valleyrand Group published after the meeting, Tyr Valleyrand's formal appointment as chairman has now been deferred.

117081004.content: While we don't know what specifically was discussed in the meeting, based on the directors' expressions afterward, the conflict must have been intense...

117081005.content: The newscaster's voice is soft and clear, but to Edward, it sounds like an indescribable, chaotic whisper stirring up his mind. Still, he continues to listen.

117081006.content: Eddie, why don't you turn that off? Just listening to this is excruciating.

117081007.content: But I... I want to know more about what's going on.

117081008.content: If Tyr's exhausted and needs someone to unload to, I want to at least have an understanding of what's bothering him.

117081009.content: Unload? That kid unloads to other people?

117081010.content: Before Hoenir finishes speaking, there's a familiar, timely knock at the door.

117081013.content: —Tyr enters and leans back on the sofa, and Hoenir promptly turns off the TV. Seeing Tyr's weary face, Hoenir and Edward look at each other, speechless.

117081014.content: Ahem... Is everything wrapped up with the company, Tyr?

117081015.content: Um, shall I make a pot of tea?

117081016.content: Tyr is silent for a while. This sort of familial attentiveness seems to be blurring his thoughts. When the concern overcomes the care in Hoenir's and Edward's eyes, he finally speaks.

117081017.content: The company matter will conclude tonight.

117081019.content: Tyr, those old-timers on the board didn't give you any trouble, did they?

117081020.content: A massive concession will need to be made, even a sacrifice... But I'll be able to preserve everything that Father left behind. Valleyrand Group won't fall into the wrong hands.

117081021.content: What kind of concession and sacrifice?

117081022.content: The kind I must face myself.

117081023.content: Hoenir's impulse is to chide Tyr, but the stream of words hardens into a lump in his throat. All that ultimately escapes his lips is a labored sigh.

117081024.content: I know things have been difficult for you recently, so let's not talk about the company.

117081025.content: Does this mean you can finally spend the night here and get some decent rest in?

117081026.content: ...I still have to finish off a few things to do with the board reorganization. I won't be eating here tonight either.

117081027.content: You... Then why come back at all?!

117081028.content: As Hoenir finally snaps, Edward hangs his head and silently heads for his room when Tyr stops him.

117081029.content: Eddie, I know I promised that we would go through everything we salvaged from the house together. It's all still piled up in the storage room, I take it?

117081031.content: That was weeks ago... Why are you bringing this up now all of a sudden?

117081032.content: I seem to recall saying that I'd make good on that promise after the equity restructuring and debt settlement was over with. But even with all that taken care of now, it's looking like more challenges may soon await me.

117081033.content: Still, a promise is a promise.

117081034.content: So, even though I was only able to manage an afternoon, I still came back. I fear I won't be able to make time again for a while after this.

117081036.content: For the love of... Why didn't you say so?!

117081037.content: The yellowish light flicks on in the storage room, illuminating the stacks of objects, books, furniture, and toys filling the space... like a lifetime of memories rescued from the fire.

117081038.content: Each with a cardboard box, Tyr, Edward, and Hoenir sort through the items in silence, seemingly recalling these memories in detail.

117081039.content: Come on, lighten up! Why don't we chat about this stuff? A lot of it was dug out from the nooks and crannies of the house and is actually pretty neat. We've got building blocks, picture books, old cameras, and... a rocking horse?

117081040.content: When the fire first broke out, I actually ran into that room to try and save some of the valuable stuff, but I was too late.

117081041.content: That's not what I meant! It's got nothing to do with how much money this stuff is or isn't worth.

117081042.content: The family finances have been in trouble since even before Father died, and the company's not doing well either. If I'd been able to save a couple famous paintings from the fire, Tyr would have slightly less pressure on him now.

117081044.content: Do you guys think I think I'm completely clueless?

117081045.content: It's good that you understand the situation, Eddie.

117081046.content: Tyr's unexpected comment leaves Hoenir and Edward momentarily stunned. They look at Tyr, and see that he's holding a picture frame fished out from one of the boxes.

117081047.content: In the frame is a family photo of Tyr, Edward, their father, and Hoenir standing in front of the estate's fountain and making exaggerated gestures at the camera. They don't look their most proper, but the warmth is palpable.

117081048.content: That was from two years ago with Father... It's a shame we didn't get another chance after that.

117081049.content: The servants were dismissed one after another after that, until it was just the three of us left.

117081051.content: I also remember that Father was so busy working then that he didn't even come home for six months. Like you, I complained about it to him, and even thought about asking him to give up the company and set aside some money for retirement.

117081052.content: Hearing Tyr bring up the past like this, Edward hesitates for a long time before finally plucking up the courage to speak.

117081053.content: I've always believed that there's no reason to give up your family for the sake of your responsibilities. So then, afterward, why did you...

117081054.content: Because I really did make this suggestion to Father.

117081056.content: He was already seriously ill by then. I stood in front of his bed and listed each and every one of the company's debts to show him that he couldn't hide anything from me.

117081057.content: I told him I could help him file for bankruptcy and sell the company so that he could finally be free of it all.

117081058.content: But in the end, he just looked at me, delighted, and said that since I already knew this much about the company's affairs, he didn't need to worry about arranging for me to take it over.

117081059.content: How could Father do that at a time like that?

117081060.content: Tyr suddenly turns to Edward with a serious look on his face—more serious than Edward had ever seen him before.

117081061.content: I expressed the same doubts, but Father explained everything to me.

117081062.content: When financial crisis befell the company the year before, the Valleyrand family inner circle started to splinter, and the family members who supported Father were murdered one by one.

117081063.content: Our family had also long been in someone's sights. The reason we were left unharmed is that any move against Father would lead to the immediate collapse of the company's power structure, a stock price crash, and the breakdown of Valleyrand Group—a loss too great even for those hoping to seize power from behind the scenes.

117081064.content: If Father had given up the responsibility bound to that power of his own initiative, we would have instantly found ourselves next on the chopping block and at the mercy of butchers.

117081065.content: Edward and Hoenir are stunned by Tyr's sudden revelation. Silence falls over the huge storage room.

117081066.content: Then, the reason the fire happened so soon after Father died... and the reason you were in such a hurry to become the next chairman...

117081067.content: You...! Why didn't you tell me about this sooner?!

117081068.content: Tyr, however, appears perfectly calm. He lowers his head and resumes going through the contents of the box before him.

117081069.content: Eddie, Father never abandoned his family for the sake of his responsibilities. Just the opposite—he chose to shoulder those responsibilities for the sake of his family.

117081070.content: I hope you can understand his choice. That way, in the future, you'll understand mine.

117081071.content: I... I do understand. I could vaguely sense the hardship you and Father experienced, and I want to help somehow too... But I couldn't even save a few oil paintings from a fire...

117081072.content: Eddie, I'm not asking for any help from you. Your understanding is enough.

117081074.content: The alarm of a digital clock suddenly sounds—the time has come for Tyr to get moving. The ringing continues, pushing the words Edward wanted to say back down his throat.

117081075.content: Tyr meticulously wipes the dust from the photograph, then carefully places it on the table.

117081076.content: Hoenir, look after Edward for me while I'm gone.

117081078.content: As he leaves the apartment, the tenderness left in Tyr's eyes gradually vanishes, and a chilling severity takes its place.

117081079.content: He takes out his phone and dials a number.

117081080.content: Hello, Uncle Grant. I presume our exchange tonight will proceed as scheduled?

117081081.content: Heh... I'll be there at the time we discussed.

117091001.content: The tape around the Valleyrand estate now replaced by construction signage, a team of people in Aether Gazer work clothes ready the site for construction while covertly sealing off all routes to and from the property.

117091002.content: After scrutinizing the means taken to isolate the site, Heimdall breathes a sigh of relief, then contacts Odin on her communicator.

117091003.content: The site is basically sealed off now. I assume everything went okay with the creditor? We'd find ourselves in a difficult situation if someone were to come barging in halfway through the investigation.

117091004.content: They didn't give it up without a fight, that's for sure.

117091005.content: The asking price was higher than expected, but we got it. Likewise, this investigation had better bear fruit.

117091007.content: Also, you said in your report that the Visbane lost one front limb and both back limbs. Did it sustain these injuries during its encounter with Tyr?

117091008.content: No. From the intel Tyr gave me, its front limb was severed during their initial encounter, while the wounds to its rear limbs were already present at that time.

117091009.content: It converts Bane Energy into heat energy, its rear legs were wounded, and it was sealed in an individual data space...

117091010.content: Did anything else about this Visbane strike you as suspicious?

117091011.content: All the details pertaining to the Visbane are in my report. That said, there was something else that was slightly suspicious, but I didn't consider it sufficiently conclusive to mention.

117091013.content: When Tyr and I were engaging it, I happened to notice that he uses his Access Key in an odd way.

117091014.content: Rather than use his Access Key to fight, it would be more accurate to say that he used his Access Key to suppress the Bane Energy emanating from his arm.

117091016.content: There's a substantial amount of residual Bane Energy there, and its signal is an exact match for that Visbane's Bane Energy. My guess is that it's a corrosive wound left by that Visbane during their first encounter.

117091017.content: During the battle, he used the majority of his Access Key's Divine Power to inhibit this Bane Energy, but he demonstrated formidable combat ability as well.

117091018.content: Could this Visbane be an Encroacher Type then? And why hasn't Tyr asked you for help with his wound?

117091019.content: That was another thing that seemed odd to me, but I didn't get the chance to examine it deeper, unfortunately.

117091020.content: Odin is silent for a while.

117091021.content: Now things are really getting interesting. Be careful during your investigation, and contact me the second anything strange happens.

117092001.content: Attention all on-call personnel: the time is now 11:19 AM. Please proceed to the second-floor hall within the next four minutes and prepare for combat.

117092002.content: Heimdall issues this warning as she rushes to the coordinates determined by the locator.

117092003.content: I've wasted too much time. The spatial distortion signal of a medium capable of opening a rift in the Source Layer shouldn't be this weak.

117092004.content: I hope the others can buy me a little time...

117092005.content: After a moment's grumbling, Heimdall finally reaches the position of the signal. But all she discovers there is an opened wall compartment with nothing inside.

117092006.content: Meanwhile, the combat personnel have rushed up to the second floor. The appointed time has come and gone, but not a single Visbane has appeared. Heimdall and the others exchange dismayed glances.

117092007.content: Someone's taken the medium... No wonder the signal was so weak, all I was picking up on was its residual signal... Who could have done this?

117092008.content: Heimdall's communicator suddenly chimes, and she hastily answers it. Odin's voice immediately comes through.

117092009.content: Did you have another run-in with that Visbane?

117092013.content: A long time ago, a squad under my command encountered that Visbane. They named it "Garmr."

117092014.content: It was the most vicious Encroacher Type I'd ever seen. Even Modifiers with Aether Codes struggled to resist being corrupted by its Bane Energy. Whether it was on the Surface Layer or the Source Layer, engaging it came at a grave cost.

117092015.content: The squad came up with a bold plan: they'd isolate Garmr in a separate data space, then use all of their power to destroy it.

117092016.content: Before they set off, they left a medium behind that could be set up in advance and open a passage to that space at a fixed time—allowing them a means of escape.

117092019.content: Not a single member of the squad made it out. From the mission recording they sent back, someone on the squad was profoundly corrupted by Garmr's Bane Energy. The more they fought, the harder it was to recover, until finally the entire squad was wiped out.

117092020.content: Meanwhile, with no one to retrieve it, the medium they left behind disappeared into human society. It was never found.

117092021.content: So, did you find the medium? Based on the information the squad left behind, it should be a clock.

117092022.content: A clock? No wonder I heard ringing then... Unfortunately, I didn't find it. Someone took it.

117092023.content: Odin ponders this for a while.

117092024.content: Have you been in touch with Tyr?

117092026.content: If it's really as Tyr said, his adversary in the family struggle deliberately placed the medium in the mansion to start the fire. They'll definitely think of a way to retrieve it.

117092027.content: Find Tyr and confirm the identity of his adversary. That will lead you straight to the medium.

117092028.content: Then the Bane Energy corruption on Tyr's body... Is there a way to treat it? We can't let what happened to the squad repeat itself!

117092029.content: Oh yeah, we should definitely be worried about the guy who's weathered Garmr's corruption and regular Visbane attacks for two weeks straight...

117092030.content: Is this really the time for sarcasm?

117092031.content: I'm just concerned that you'd be wasting your time...

117092032.content: Odin pauses abruptly, seemingly in an effort to conceal some sort of speculation.

117092033.content: Fine, fine. I'll send you the squad's remote data transmission. You can refer to it while you deal with the Bane Energy on Tyr.

117092034.content: There's something else I need to tell you.

117092035.content: When I was settling the debt owed on that land, I happened to get a peek behind Valleyrand Group's curtain. At this morning's board of directors' meeting, Tyr lost his majority and was ousted.

117092036.content: Does... Does that have anything to do with the mission?

117092037.content: Think carefully about the conversation you had with Tyr before. He's a Modifier who's made protecting the family estate his mission while eschewing the constraints that come with being a member of Aether Gazer. How do you think he'd respond to a development like this?

117092038.content: That's... That's speculation of the worst kind! Sufficient evidence is required before...

117092039.content: Heimdall, there's no time for academic rigor right now. Our goal is to find whoever has that medium. Think of a way to get Tyr to join you in the search, before he does something rash.

117101001.content: The apartment has been sapped of even more cheer with only two people left in it, but Edward continues to earnestly prepare supper.

117101002.content: Somehow, he's become much more grown up than he was before.

117101003.content: Suddenly, there's another knock at the door.

117101006.content: Edward is taken aback. Instead of his strapping elder brother, a bookish girl in glasses stands before him.

117101008.content: I'm sorry to bother you. Is this the new apartment where Tyr Valleyrand now resides?

117101009.content: Heimdall looks into the apartment, and she and Hoenir immediately notice each other.

117101010.content: Edward, I'll see to our guest. You return to your room.

117101012.content: Some things are best left to the adults.

117101013.content: Edward astutely senses Hoenir's discomfort. Rather than ask more questions, however, he obediently returns to his room.

117101015.content: Come in. You're a Modifier with Aether Gazer, I take it? I saw the symbol on your clothes.

117101016.content: You're... a Modifier as well? An independent Modifier, like Tyr...

117101017.content: Now that we've made our introductions, we can dispense with the small talk. Does the reason you're looking for Tyr have to do with the fire?

117101018.content: Yes. Much is at stake, and I was hoping Tyr could help with the investigation.

117101019.content: Since when is there a situation Aether Gazer can't handle? Tyr's occupied with company matters.

117101020.content: Company matters? Why? He's already been ousted. There's nothing more he can do for the company.

117101021.content: What? But Tyr clearly said that everything would be resolved after tonight.

117101022.content: Heimdall is perplexed. Suddenly, she remembers Odin's warning and her heart quickly seizes.

117101023.content: I'm sorry, but I believe you must consider the possibility that Tyr has concealed a portion of the truth from you both.

117101024.content: Hoenir is about to refute the suggestion when he suddenly remembers the strange way that Tyr's been acting the last few days. He's silent for a moment.

117101025.content: As I said, much is at stake. I hope you can believe me.

117101027.content: I want to find Tyr as quickly as possible and ask him to take some time to help me investigate the whereabouts of a medium.

117101029.content: Yes. It was the cause of the fire. It can open a rift in the Source Layer and allow Visbanes through to the Surface Layer. It should look like a clock.

117101030.content: So, that's how the fire started... But I don't remember anything about a clock.

117101032.content: At some point, Edward apparently returned to the living room.

117101033.content: Edward, this isn't something you should be getting yourself dragged into...

117101034.content: According to field regulations and confidentiality protocols... No, but this mission takes precedence! Tell me about this clock.

117101035.content: When we were cleaning up the scene of the fire, the only thing there that hadn't been burned was this clock. Later, Tyr took it away, saying he had some other use for it.

117101037.content: The gears in Heimdall's brain start spinning rapidly. Tyr's desire to punish the culprit, his being ousted, Odin's warning, the story Tyr told Hoenir...

117101038.content: These points all converge to form a conclusion that, while well-founded, is far beyond anything that Heimdall could have imagined—

117101039.content: Tyr knew about the medium and had been guarding it alone. When he agreed to help Heimdall with the investigation, it was only for proof of a direct link between the fire and the medium, and to use this information to bring down the would-be assassin.

117101040.content: But Heimdall herself vetoed this plan as unfeasible, leaving Tyr with only one choice.

117101041.content: It was Tyr who took the medium. He's planning to use it to start a fire to get rid of his adversary in the company...

117101042.content: As a Modifier, Tyr can't harm a human directly. Or, rather, not without arousing suspicion. But Visbanes aren't constrained like this, so he...

117101043.content: Heimdall hesitates before reaching her conclusion. But Hoenir reads it in her eyes.

117101044.content: You mean, he intends to use that Visbane to get rid of them?

117101045.content: We can't rule out the possibility.

117101046.content: But innocent people would get hurt if that Visbane is set loose. Tyr would never do something like that!

117101047.content: He wants to take all this on alone. So, he'll unleash the Visbane on his enemy, then destroy it himself afterward!

117101048.content: That's absurd. That kid hasn't even activated his Access Key yet. That's my Access Key on his arm, which he can only use to suppress the residual Bane Energy. How would he fight the Visbane?

117101049.content: What? But he and I have been fighting Visbanes together for the last few days...

117101050.content: Hoenir freezes in place, as if thunder just cracked overhead out of the blue. Remembering Tyr's strange behavior over the last few days, Hoenir finally realizes how many fictions this stubborn kid has woven to keep his family from harm.

117101051.content: Then... how does he fight them?

117101052.content: ...It's the worst possible scenario. From the footage, it appears what Tyr fought with before likely wasn't Divine Grace, but Bane Energy...

117101053.content: He's already entered the final phase of corruption described in the data. Frankly, it's miraculous that he's held on this long. If he faces Garmr again, however...

117101054.content: Just tell me what to do!

117101057.content: Right now, I need your help to find Tyr as quickly as possible, stop him from using the medium, and figure out how to get him to use his own Access Key. It's the only way to dispel the Bane Energy corruption from his body.

117101058.content: Otherwise, I'll be compelled to stop Garmr from entering the Surface Layer... by any means necessary.

117101060.content: Hoenir picks up the phone and dials, but all he hears is a busy tone.

117101061.content: I couldn't reach him either. That's why I came here...

117101062.content: The tense atmosphere is instantly plunged into a deathly stillness. Then, Edward suddenly speaks, breaking the silence.

117101063.content: I... I think I know where Tyr went. Take me with you.

117101064.content: Edward... I don't want you getting involved in this!

117101065.content: It would be best if you could provide a precise location. Taking an ordinary human to a place where Visbanes are expected to appear is forbidden by our confidentiality protocol—which this conversation has already breached!

117101066.content: In contrast to his two anxious elders, Edward appears calm, as if he's finally made up his mind about something. His eyes glint with an irresistible determination.

117101067.content: It's a remote location—I wouldn't even be able to mark it on a map for you. The fastest way to get there is to let me lead the way!

117101068.content: Heimdall's brows knit together. Seemingly unable to come up with a sufficiently indisputable rebuttal, she activates her direct channel to Odin.

117101069.content: Yes, so that's the situation—Huh? Really? Are you sure?

117101070.content: Heimdall puts away her communicator and turns to look at Edward with a serious expression on her face.

117101071.content: My superior has agreed to your request. I'm Heimdall. I look forward to working with you, Edward.

117101072.content: Are you joking? Do you really plan on bringing him somewhere like that? Then... I'm going with you too!

117101073.content: Hoenir, your... Access Key—you know, your means of fighting—you loaned it to Tyr, didn't you?

117101075.content: If Tyr really does something like that and the news gets out, it'll send shockwaves through the company tonight. I want someone who can be there on behalf of the Valleyrand family to keep an eye out for anyone who might take advantage of the turmoil to undermine the company.

117101076.content: As for me, I have my own responsibility to bear.

117101077.content: Hoenir falls into a brief, but weighty silence. Finally, he reaches out and gives Edward a firm pat on the shoulder.

117101078.content: Tyr's Access Key is in the storage room. Let's do this!

117101079.content: As the night deepens, a beam of light shines in an abandoned warehouse on the outskirts of the city.

117101080.content: Tyr has come to the warehouse alone. He sets down a suitcase beside him, then sweeps his flashlight over the warehouse's interior.

117101081.content: A big light abruptly flashes on in the warehouse, shining as brightly as the midday sun. Grandet Valleyrand steps out from the shadows of the shelves and walks up to Tyr with an insidious smirk on his face.

117101082.content: This place sure is well hidden. If you hadn't given me the exact coordinates, I don't think I ever would have found it.

117101083.content: My dear nephew—the board of directors' decision is in compliance with the articles of association. I won fair and square, just accept it. No one likes a sore loser.

117101084.content: If all the family members that supported me hadn't died in "mysterious" fires, you never would have won the majority.

117101085.content: Heh... After the meeting adjourned, you sent me that message out of the blue saying that I had something to do with those fires and you had proof... Baseless slander won't reverse your defeat, you know.

117101086.content: If you were really that self-assured, you wouldn't have come here.

117101087.content: ...There's no point in continuing this conversation. Show me your "proof." Otherwise, you can expect your official expulsion from the board to be followed by a defamation charge.

117101088.content: I take it you have people lying in ambush around the warehouse? The moment I take out my evidence, I suppose they'll come out to destroy it?

117101089.content: Quite the miscalculation for someone normally so cunning. Looks like your conscience really is weighing on you.

117101090.content: As he speaks, Tyr opens up the suitcase and produces a clock. The moment he lays eyes on it, Grandet is visually rattled.

117101092.content: On Edward's first birthday in the wake of our father's death, everyone in the family sent gifts to express their condolences. Your gift was this clock.

117101094.content: Ridiculous... You really think you can prove that had anything to do with the fire?

117101095.content: Originally, yes. But unfortunately, a responsibility granted to me in another capacity has left me with no choice but to resort to extreme measures.

117101096.content: Once it's placed, this clock can start a fire at a designated time. But you know that, don't you?

117101097.content: This time, it's been set to... one minute from now.

117101099.content: The guards that had been lying in wait around the warehouse now pour in, only to be met with the puzzling sight of the lone Tyr and their panic-stricken employer.

117101100.content: A second later, the ringing of the clock echoes throughout the warehouse. The surrounding walls begin to contort and distort, and a searing heat fills the air that instantly turns the place into a sea of fire.

117102001.content: Stepping over the rubble, Tyr makes his way into the heart of the scene of the fire. The walls around him continue to warp from the heat of the flames, and Tyr is suddenly struck by a familiar feeling.

117102003.content: —At some point, the space had taken on the appearance of the Valleyrand mansion after the fire.

117102004.content: Restoring the battlefield of our first encounter? I didn't know your taste was this morbid.

117102005.content: Grandet—who somehow survived thanks to the desperate efforts of his security detail—trembles violently in the corridor where the raging flames have him cornered.

117102006.content: This is the end for you, Uncle Grant.

117102008.content: That's right, you survived the last fire too. You know how to escape a fire like this?

117102009.content: I'll pay you! I'll make you the chairman again! Just get me out of here...

117102010.content: Tyr cuts Grandet off with an icy stare.

117102011.content: You have always been the greatest threat to Edward. I can't let you leave here alive.

117102012.content: Your executioner, however, will not be me.

117102013.content: Just then, a heart-stopping howl resounds from the depths of the corridor, followed by a scorching wave of heat.

117111001.content: A car hurtles down a highway on the outskirts of the city, seemingly with flagrant disregard for the recently enacted speed limit regulations.

117111002.content: Based on Tyr's modus operandi, if he was really going to do something like that, he'd never do it at the target's residence. He wouldn't want innocent people to get hurt either... So, he'd definitely pick a concealed location.

117111003.content: Back when the company was still doing well, Father bought several lots and locked them down with the intent to develop them in the future. Later, Tyr and I found a secret base among the lots.

117111004.content: It's a warehouse zone that was abandoned a long time ago. It's in a completely isolated area and it's not on any police patrol routes. Anything could happen there, and the outside world would never know.

117111005.content: I couldn't even find it on GPS. Bringing you was the correct choice after all...

117111006.content: Is that... the house during the fire?

117111007.content: Puzzled, Heimdall follows Edward's gaze until she sees a mansion engulfed in flames rising up from a barren clearing. The space around it is also highly distorted.

117111008.content: This level of spatial distortion... Has it already made it to the Surface Layer?

117111010.content: If we go into the space to look for Tyr now, there's a good chance we'll make it in time.

117111011.content: Then what are we waiting for?!

117111012.content: Heimdall abruptly pauses, and her face darkens.

117111013.content: Edward, if Tyr really did something like that, I don't know whether his Access Key will be able to fully attune to him.

117111014.content: So... please prepare yourself for all possible outcomes.

117111016.content: Heimdall nods, then expertly parks the car.

117111017.content: This is Heimdall. I've confirmed Tyr's location, and the Source Layer rift has opened. I'm taking immediate action, so please send backup to my coordinates right away!

117121001.content: In the midst of the blaze, Tyr's expression is as cold as ice. He looks indifferently at the hideous beast and the petrified Grandet.

117121002.content: Garmr's gruesome jaws snap open and devour Grandet whole. Before this victim of his own evil deeds can even cry out in terror, he's reduced to nothingness by the fires raging in Garmr's maw.

117121003.content: After swallowing up Grandet, Garmr lets out an ear-splitting howl. It grows slightly in size, and the distorted walls surrounding it gradually become more defined and stable, as if the entire space is settling into its form.

117121004.content: Garmr then lowers its head and looks at Tyr with a mixture of confusion and contempt.

117121006.content: I released you because of a duty I have to uphold. That same duty compels me to stop you.

117121007.content: Now that you've eaten him, it's time for you to die.

117121008.content: Tyr halts Firebrand's suppression of the Bane Energy. A beam of incandescent energy every bit as potent as Garmr's bursts from his arm—this is how he's fought the last several days.

117122001.content: Identical flaming energies collide and tear into each other until one side finally withdraws, defeated.

117122002.content: Not even Garmr's innate ferocity could subdue Tyr's determination in this pure, but brutal clash of wills. It dissipates in a crackle of furious flames, leaving behind only the echo of its roar.

117122003.content: Having reached his own limit, Tyr staggers and falls to his knees. He hastily reactivates the Access Key on his right arm, but it can do nothing to suppress the Bane Energy now.

117122006.content: Finally making it to the scene, Edward immediately tries to rush over to Tyr, but Heimdall holds him back.

117122008.content: But I just saw it! Tyr already destroyed that monster, didn't he?

117122010.content: Edward freezes in shock while Tyr's face breaks into a helpless smile.

117122011.content: Heimdall places Tyrfing before Tyr, eyeing him as warily as she would a foe.

117122012.content: Looks like we were too late to stop you from using that Bane Energy to fight Garmr...

117122013.content: From the information I acquired, Modifiers afflicted with Garmr's corruption can obtain a portion of Garmr's power from the same source, but they will also gradually transform into a copy of Garmr.

117122014.content: The harder you fight, the harder it is to reverse this phenomenon. The first Modifier squad to engage Garmr severed their own escape route once they realized this... But since you defeated Garmr, there's still a chance!

117122015.content: Tyr, your actions may be in serious violation of at least a dozen rules, but based on our work together these last few days, I don't believe that you're some heinous criminal.

117122016.content: So, I still want to give this a try. I hope that, in the end, we'll become comrades instead of enemies!

117122017.content: What do you want me to do?

117122018.content: You must try to obtain Gaea's acceptance and activate your Access Key to dispel the Bane Energy from your body.

117122019.content: How do I get Gaea to accept me?

117122021.content: Do you want me to admit that what I did before was wrong? Sorry, but I can't admit what I don't believe.

117122022.content: From my perspective, exterminating Visbanes was never my goal—it was only a means of protecting my family.

117122023.content: According to your regulations at Aether Gazer, I'd have to give up my goal of protecting my family for the sake of exterminating Visbanes... I refuse to do that.

117122024.content: ...Get ready to touch your Access Key. If Gaea accepts you, you'll be able to activate your Access Key and use Divine Power to dispel the Bane Energy corruption from your body.

117122025.content: Otherwise, you'll be designated as an enemy target, and I'll have to take necessary action.

117122026.content: Then do it. I've already made my stance clear, why should I submit to another trial?

117122027.content: Tyr placidly lowers his head. He seems to have already accepted this outcome well in advance.

117122028.content: Get on with it. I'm worried I'll hurt Eddie.

117122029.content: I... I refuse! A conclusion that hasn't been subject to review isn't reliable!

117122030.content: Ignoring Heimdall's insistence, Tyr shuts his eyes and silently awaits his end. But then, he hears a voice he can't ignore.

117122033.content: You shouldn't have come! It's too dangerous for you here.

117122034.content: How can you say that at a time like this? At the very least, families should make decisions together!

117122035.content: Tyr's head jolts up in astonishment. To his surprise, Edward's eyes are overflowing with tears—tears glistening with a determination so unshakeable that not even Tyr can refuse them.

117122036.content: I don't know what this "Gaea" Heimdall talked about is, but when it comes to acceptance, I accept you, Tyr. And Father definitely would too.

117122037.content: I know you're a hero. There's no way you're a bad person.

117122038.content: Is our acceptance enough for you to try? To try considering the possibility that you don't have to leave?

117122039.content: Tyrfing stands there silently. Although the surrounding space is slowly crumbling in the flames, it remains unmoved, as if to convey the weight of this "acceptance."

117122040.content: Looks like I nearly made the same mistake Father made, Eddie.

117122041.content: If you're asking me to, then...

117122042.content: Tyr extends his hand and slowly places it on Tyrfing's broad spine.

117122043.content: Before he realizes it, Tyr seems to have entered this world's origin plane. This vast space is empty save for Tyr and Tyrfing on one side, and Edward and their father on the other.

117122045.content: Why are you keeping everything you'd like to say to me bottled up inside?

117122047.content: There's a lot you'd like to say to me, isn't that right?

117122049.content: His dispassion and obstinance dissolved by Eirikr's question, a rare expression of grief materializes on Tyr's face. Suddenly, he resembles a child wanting desperately to atone for his regrets.

117122050.content: I did what you asked of me, right?

117122052.content: And I... I haven't disappointed you?

117122053.content: Eirikr slowly bends down the way a parent does to console a child. He reaches out and strokes Tyr's hair.

117122054.content: Thank you, Tyr. You did very well.

117122055.content: Entrusting you with these responsibilities was the best decision I ever made.

117122057.content: Tyr doesn't ask for further responses like a willful child might. This "acceptance" is already enough for him.

117122058.content: Tyr's consciousness suddenly returns to his body. He opens his eyes and sees that Tyrfing has begun to emit a soft, shimmering light.

117122059.content: Your Access Key has been activated. Gaea accepted your actions?

117122060.content: A ray of Divine Power slowly flows from Tyrfing to Tyr's body, helping him to quell the increasingly turbulent Bane Energy on his right arm.

117122061.content: As if all his energy left his body the moment he reached this long journey's end, Tyr's knees suddenly buckle under him. Edward quickly props him up.

117122062.content: Sorry, I... I'd like to find a place to rest now.

117122064.content: Let's go home. To our new home.

117131001.content: Heimdall didn't wrap up her investigation report until close to two weeks later. Her report seemed to undergo several revisions before she finally had a version she was satisfied with.

117131002.content: But the pages of technical jargon still give Odin a headache when she reads them.

117131003.content: The final loose ends have now been tied up. With Tyr's consent, the Cryptics wiped the memory of his younger brother, Edward.

117131005.content: In fact, he was the one who requested it.

117131006.content: After learning that we have this capability, he was the first to propose clearing his brother's memory of anything to do with Visbanes.

117131007.content: Not bad, so he does have some sense. And what's this here in your report about the residual Bane Energy?

117131008.content: It really is bizarre—I examined Tyr's body again afterward and discovered that the Bane Energy on his arm wasn't completely dispelled when he activated his Access Key. A portion of it still remains, and in a relatively stable form.

117131009.content: It could have something to do with the Access Key another Modifier loaned him. In the process of using it in combat multiple times, that Access Key seemed to adapt to the Bane Energy. Over time, it went from being used to suppress Bane Energy to being used to wield it. It's unheard of.

117131010.content: If Tyr uses it to fight, his Bane Energy utilization rate will exceed even that of Garmr, its source...

117131011.content: But you nonetheless recommend that the residual Bane Energy on his arm be sealed away, yes?

117131012.content: Of course! I even specially fabricated a glove for him that's capable of preventing Bane Energy leaks.

117131013.content: After all, who knows what terrible consequences his continued use of that residual Bane Energy could have. Besides, the idea of a Modifier using Bane Energy would surely come as an unnecessary shock to other Modifiers.

117131014.content: Very good. This matter will be classified as top secret. Not even Division Nine can know about it.

117131016.content: Also, what's this paper attached to your report? It's over a dozen pages, I don't have the time to read all that.

117131017.content: Huh? But that paper is a treatise on a huge discovery regarding Gaea's authorization logic. I believe it's crucial that you learn about it!

117131018.content: Can you summarize it for me now?

117131019.content: Ahem... In brief, I used to believe that Gaea actively evaluated Modifiers' actions and would restrict Modifiers that posed a threat to the normal workings of human society.

117131020.content: But after traversing our current database, I discovered that there are many Modifiers that have continued to operate independently following their awakening. Some carry out commercial activities, some travel, some are performing artists, others are detectives... Some are even mercenaries engaging in direct combat with humans.

117131021.content: Many of their activities go against the regulations I derived before, but Gaea still permits them. Tyr is probably another example of these special cases.

117131022.content: As such, I believe that conclusion might merely be a statistical result based on a sample pool comprised of all current Aether Gazer Modifiers, rather than a self-evident theorem.

117131023.content: Odin raises an eyebrow. Heimdall's treatise has apparently penetrated her impatience and piqued her interest.

117131024.content: Perhaps, rather than have us continue to serve as perfectly encapsulated weapons, Gaea has already begun attempting to truly integrate us into human society.

117131025.content: Heimdall is flabbergasted for a few seconds. Then she grows eager.

117131026.content: This hypothesis is definitely worth examining further! Do you also think this relates to Gaea's underlying architecture—

117131027.content: Ahem! I'm very pleased with how you executed your first field mission. As it happens, Shu has run into some technical difficulties on her end. Would you consider going to Omorfies to assist her?

117131028.content: You mean, there's a new topic to research? Of course!

117131030.content: Heimdall's ravenous academic appetite now artfully diverted, Odin's gaze once again falls on the investigation report, landing on the name "Hoenir."

117131031.content: In the bustling park, Hoenir sits on a familiar bench after completing his daily jog. But then, he notices someone else sitting beside him.

117131032.content: How long has it been since we saw each other last? A few decades?

117131033.content: You... When I heard Aether Gazer was investigating the fire, I knew you'd find me sooner or later.

117131034.content: So? Still angry that I refused to join your organization back then?

117131035.content: Water under the bridge. What I am angry about, however, is that you took it upon yourself to adopt a Modifier, hide away his Access Key, and raise a promising Modifier into a massive nuisance.

117131036.content: Raise? I had nothing to do with his upbringing after I suggested Eirikr adopt him. He grew into the person he is now all on his own. And frankly, I quite like the person he's become.

117131037.content: I won't ask about his life before he awakened. But once he did, you should have immediately made him understand what it means to be a Modifier!

117131038.content: Tyr is just Tyr. Awakening doesn't turn you into a whole different person, like the life you had before never even existed!

117131040.content: Maybe it's because I'd basically already grown old as a human being by the time I finally awakened, but to this day, I still think of myself as human.

117131041.content: I admit, I had selfish motivations when I found Tyr. I wanted to see what a Modifier would choose to do if they awakened early on and free from organizational constraints. I wanted to see if he'd be like me...

117131042.content: In the end, he wasn't like me. But he isn't like you either.

117131043.content: Heh... That kid is an interesting one, I'll give you that. I'll be keeping an eye on him. As for you...

117131044.content: Relax, I won't be giving the great Odin any more trouble. After lending my Access Key to Tyr, I haven't had any desire to get it back. I'm just an ordinary old man who likes to stay in shape now.

117131045.content: Hoenir rises back up and resumes his jog along his previous path. Odin watches Hoenir disappear into the crowd. She lets out a sigh, then gets up to leave.

117131046.content: A year has now passed since Grandet Valleyrand perished in a bizarre fire, and Tyr Valleyrand, the eldest son of the former family head, has officially succeeded him as chairman of the board.

117131047.content: Previously as acting chairman, he completely settled the company's long-standing debts in just six months, while also helping Valleyrand Group to pivot to new business directions. Unsurprisingly, his official appointment as chairman was well received by shareholders.

117131048.content: However, Tyr Valleyrand recently made a startling decision—he's officially set a merger process between Valleyrand Group and the start-up company Aether Gazer into motion.

117131049.content: The decision was met with opposition by many senior figures in the company. At present, we do not know what led Tyr Valleyrand to make this decision, nor how he intends to push it ahead.

117131050.content: I'm still waiting for your answer. Have you made up your mind yet?

117131051.content: I made up my mind ages ago, but I've only just reconciled my relationships with the board members. At the next board meeting, my proposal will pass with a majority.

117131052.content: A bait and switch? Nice tactic.

117131053.content: We can look at this meeting as a rehearsal for the company merger negotiations. We need to make each of our bottom lines clear.

117131054.content: No need for the formalities. Since you want things clear-cut, then let's just get down to brass tacks—our objectives and mutual benefits.

117131055.content: In the process of dealing with and researching Visbanes, Aether Gazer is bound to derive a great deal of technology that can be implemented in human society. Valleyrand Group wishes to benefit from these technologies.

117131057.content: In exchange, Valleyrand Group will integrate its capital reserves into Aether Gazer's financial system to fund research and counter-Visbane operations.

117131059.content: What happens to the power structure following this financial merger?

117131060.content: Odin has pointed out the most critical point. Tyr gets slightly more serious.

117131061.content: If Aether Gazer's goal is to save the world, then the decisions of the entire company post-merger naturally can't be left in the hands of ordinary human board members. I consent to the reorganization of the power structure based on Aether Gazer's current hierarchy.

117131063.content: However, I will need to lead a relatively independent department. Furthermore, I refuse to accept direct orders from Aether Gazer's higher management.

117131065.content: With all due respect, Aether Gazer was the one to propose the merger in the first place—surely it's not crossing the line to expect a show of good faith on your part? It would merely be a partial devolution of power.

117131066.content: I was the initiator, you say? Funny you should paint me as the one begging for the merger, when I suspect you already had this in mind when you lured me into your debt trap last year.

117131067.content: The truth is, the research Aether Gazer conducts and the businesses it develops all represent the future of this world to one degree or another. Seizing this future is the key to getting Valleyrand Group through this crisis once and for all. That's the main reason I made this decision.

117131068.content: Besides, Aether Gazer didn't decide to merge with Valleyrand Group out of the kindness of its heart, did it?

117131070.content: Gaea doesn't specifically allocate resources to Aether Gazer as a Modifier organization. In order to blend in with human society and for the sake of its continued existence, Aether Gazer must don the facade of a company and come up with business ventures to undertake.

117131071.content: But as the organization expands in scope, Aether Gazer's original structure is no longer able to sustain its new demands.

117131072.content: Providing fake identities for Modifiers in the organization, raising funds for its research, finding downstream industries for its new technologies, coordinating counter-Visbane operations with CORG...

117131073.content: With its ample network of contacts and vast range of business ventures, Valleyrand Group is the only company up to the task of covering all these requirements for Aether Gazer.

117131074.content: After Tyr directly lays down both sides' cards, Odin's face gradually forms a relieved smile, as if she's looking at a student who finally passed their test.

117131075.content: Looks like I was right to keep an eye on you.

117131076.content: My proposal remains unchanged. What is your answer?

117131077.content: Young man—you can go and ready the merger agreement.

1109601001.content: Recently, a large-scale sales event kicked off on Core City's main shopping street, with a number of pricey items marked down with hefty discounts. Needless to say, this has set off a shopping frenzy in the city.

1109601002.content: As for the request you submitted... we have personnel who take care of supplies procurement. You don't have to trouble yourself, Administrator.

1109601003.content: Um... well... there are a few things I'd prefer to get myself, if you don't mind.

1109601004.content: Shu, her eyebrows knitted together, looks me up and down for a moment. Feeling uneasy, I stick my hands in my pockets. In one of them, there's a shopping list of myriad wants consolidated from the various Modifiers.

1109601005.content: ... Alright, then. The training schedule's been rather packed, and I'm sure our Modifiers would hate to miss out on the good deals. Just know that it is alright to say no to their requests, Administrator.

1109601006.content: But I'm happy to be of help. I take it that you consent, then?

1109601007.content: Yes. I'm unable to spare one of our Modifiers to go with you at this time, however. I'll have to send someone else.

1109601009.content: The question I'm about to ask is interrupted by a gust of wind brought on by a blonde girl who appears suddenly in front of me.

1109601010.content: Ta-da! It's me, the star courier of Olympia Express!

1109601013.content: Although a number of the higher-ups have been thinking about this, unfortunately she's only here on vacation.

1109601014.content: Haha, you don't have to be so surprised!

1109601015.content: Let's just say that... circumstances have forced me to take an involuntary vacation here.

1109601017.content: Well, the recent sales have sent the delivery volume at Olympia Express skyrocketing, and our friend Hermes here was secretly taking on the extra work until she overloaded her Access Key. She's here to get it retuned.

1109601018.content: We're done tuning the Access Key, but it'll need a couple of days to stabilize, so Iris wants her to take a break here with us in the meantime.

1109601019.content: (Sighs) Looks like Iris is really mad this time. She's said that if she catches me making deliveries during this time she'll override me with her super permissions and stop me from working altogether. Looks like I'll have to do as I'm told...

1109601020.content: Well, I can walk you through our employee remuneration package and benefits if you like...

1109601021.content: Administrator! Please don't make jokes like this! Hermes might get the wrong idea!

1109601022.content: Ha ha! Thanks for offering, but I like my current job better.

1109601023.content: Are you ready? Let's go shopping, then!

1109601024.content: I nod my head slightly, and Hermes dashes off in the direction of the exit. Although we aren't supposed to run in the lobby, I don't have the heart to stop her. It looks like she's been feeling cooped up for a while now.

1109601025.content: Please keep a close eye on Hermes, Admin. Her Access Key could crash if she overuses it before it is fully stable. Be careful, and stay safe. I'll see you soon.

1109601026.content: I bid goodbye to Shu and walk over to the bustling shopping street with Hermes. Unsurprisingly, we are met by a sea of people. Even though the delivery services are great in Core City, people here still love the experience of shopping.

1109601027.content: Products are everywhere, placed in full view and within easy reach. Even I am a little tempted by the generous discounts. However, I recall my long shopping list and the faces of the Modifiers who entrusted me with this task. I let out a long sigh and move on.

1109601028.content: I'm beginning to understand what the Olympia Express slogan, "Delivering love and hope," means now.

1109601029.content: Hmm? Don't tell me you're interested in joining us too, Administrator? I can walk you through our employee remuneration package and benefits if you like...

1109601030.content: Certainly! It'll definitely be an option if I were to lose my job at Aether Gazer some day.

1109601031.content: I look up at the drones bearing the Olympia Express logo buzzing in the sky above me. I wonder if a bigger sales event could cause an aerial traffic jam.

1109601032.content: Almost all of them belong to Olympia Express! Impressive.

1109601033.content: I must say, it must have taken Olympia Express some time to get to this scale?

1109601034.content: Since the time I was still in school... It's been, what, three or four years now?

1109601035.content: Huh? You mean to say you founded the company when you were still in school?

1109601036.content: Oh, no, we started off by running a package pick-up service on campus. It was Iris, who was still a student then, who realized that there was money to be made there. That's how we came to start Olympia Express.

1109601037.content: Although campus was only a few hundred meters away from the courier point, we received nearly 300 orders per day. We weren't expecting that at all!

1109601038.content: Later on, Iris obtained patents on our winged boots and delivery boxes. That's when Olympia Express officially became a company. And the rest is history.

1109601039.content: Amazing. That makes you one of the founders of Olympia Express!

1109601040.content: Heh, I suppose you can say that.

1109601041.content: Say, it seems like all these people are looking at us for some reason...?

1109601042.content: Well, didn't I already tell you that I'm a star courier? I'm not kidding when I say that I've delivered packages for just about every store on this shopping street! And always on time, too!

1109601043.content: Hermes looks pretty proud of herself, with her hands on her waist and her chest all puffed up.

1109601044.content: And sure enough, as soon as we finally squeeze into a record store, I see the store owner approach Hermes and speak with her with great friendliness. The owner even insists on giving us additional discounts!

1109601045.content: This plays out again and again in several stores along the stretch. As one of the store owners says, these owners are not only grateful to Olympia Express for their efficient service. Even more importantly, the longer they are seen with Hermes, the more publicity they generate for their stores.

1109601046.content: After some time, I end up with far more than is on my list, and my burden becomes quite unbearable. Not only do we receive additional discounts at the stores we visit, we are also showered with freebies...

1109601047.content: Um, Admin... what about I give you a hand with those? You don't have to carry everything by yourself...

1109601048.content: No, no, I must! I've already benefited so much just by coming here with you. I'd feel so guilty if I let you carry these for me!

1109601049.content: Well, what about just a little something here and there? You know, it feels so weird to have nothing in my hands!

1109601050.content: Hermes is about to grab a couple of shopping bags from me when we hear the sound of tires screeching somewhere in front of us.

1109601052.content: Approximately 50 meters away from us, a truck laden with goods skids out of its lane and barrells toward a crosswalk to the side.

1109601054.content: Before I can even react to Hermes' exclamation, I feel a sudden gust of wind blowing past me. I look, and Hermes has disappeared.

1109601055.content: Then, I hear a great crash, and I see a few people sent flying into the air by the truck, which is also on the verge of tipping over. I can feel the ground beneath me shake a little from the impacts.

1109601057.content: When the truck tips over, the ensuing noise assaults my eardrums like a series of hammer blows, and there is dust everywhere. I can hear cries of terror from all around me.

1109601059.content: I run toward the truck as fast as I can.

1109601061.content: Is my leg still there? Am I still alive?!

1109601062.content: I see several passers-by lying on both sides of the road, all pale-faced and staring at the box compartment of the truck, which should have landed on them.

1109601063.content: After making sure there is no blood around me, I start running toward the overturned truck. On the other side of the truck I finally find Hermes, her face covered in a layer of gray dust and her arms and legs full of abrasions.

1109601065.content: (Coughing) I'm fine... I'm Olympia's star courier, remember...? I-I... can handle... this.

1109601066.content: I find Hermes lying in a rather unnatural-looking position, and I can see wisps of smoke and hear buzzing noises from the Access Key lying on her thigh. Her Access Key is broken for sure.

1109601068.content: Relax, no one's hurt. Well, no one except you. Give me a minute, I'll call Aether Gazer for some help.

1109601069.content: Oh, no, don't do that! I'm not hurt too badly. If you call, Iris will hear of this, and I'll be in big trouble with her!

1109601070.content: I watch Hermes struggle to her feet, and I carefully examine her wounds. Thankfully, they are all just plain old abrasions. I let out a sigh, bend over, and put her on my back.

1109601072.content: What is it, Admin? Are you all right? I must be too heavy for you... It's okay, I can walk.

1109601073.content: It's... okay... You're much lighter than all that shopping...

1109601076.content: I nod earnestly without answering either way and start trudging back toward Aether Gazer's Medical Department.

1109602001.content: After what happened on the shopping trip, I decide to work on my physical fitness so that I'll be better equipped to handle whatever comes my way.

1109602002.content: (Panting) Now it's time for ten sets of push-ups.

1109602003.content: That's enough for today, Admin. This is a little too much for a non-Modifier like you.

1109602004.content: Going on missions with the Modifiers has made me grossly overestimate my own physical abilities. Despite Shu's words of caution, when I see Asura doing one-armed push-ups without breaking a sweat, it brings out my competitive side once again.

1109602005.content: Let's go to the sick bay and get you some heat therapy patches, or you're going to have a really hard time tomorrow.

1109602006.content: Don't worry, Shu, I'm alright. You've already spent this time training me. I shouldn't take up more of your time. I can head over there myself.

1109602007.content: I decline Shu's kind offer. As soon as I leave the gym, the brave face I put on starts to crack, and rather quickly at that.

1109602008.content: Ow, ow, ow... This is payback for not working out regularly, isn't it...

1109602009.content: To ensure that I'll actually be able to get out of bed the next day, I head over to the sick bay to get myself some heat therapy patches. As I walk in and the smell of disinfecting alcohol fills my nostrils, I spot a girl with flaxen hair waving to me from a bed.

1109602010.content: Fancy seeing you here, Admin. Did you hurt yourself?

1109602011.content: No, I just finished my workout. I'm just here to take a rest.

1109602013.content: I'm as good as new now. But...

1109602014.content: Hermes leans back onto the head of the bed, looking rather despondent. I've never seen this expression on her face before.

1109602015.content: Because of what happened at the shopping street, the Cryptics are concerned that my Access Key may become unstable again, so I had to send it in for a full examination.

1109602016.content: Plus, Iris got really mad when she heard what was going on. She ordered me to take a full rest at Aether Gazer while waiting for the examination to be completed.

1109602017.content: I'm never gonna hear the end of this from Iris when I go back...

1109602019.content: Heh, I know. Iris is just worried about me... She's always been like this.

1109602020.content: You must know that I'm innocent this time, Admin. It really was an accident that nobody saw coming!

1109602021.content: (Sighs) One time, as Iris was lecturing me, someone did speak up for me like this.

1109602022.content: They had no idea it would get Iris even more worked up. She started yelling about how Olympia Express isn't a company that "trades the health of our employees for buzz"...

1109602023.content: Since then, I don't dare to defend myself in front of Iris. I know that she means well, but...

1109602024.content: Anyway, I have to stay here and recuperate. I can't even walk without my Access Key, so all I do is lie in bed all day long. It's been so boring, ugh!

1109602026.content: I look over at Hermes' legs, covered by a blanket, and I see for the first time that they are straight, unnaturally straight, without a hint of bend in the knees.

1109602027.content: Without the Access Key, I can't move my legs at all.

1109602028.content: Hermes, noticing my gaze, breaks out into a smile and sits up in the bed. She then places a hand on her thigh.

1109602029.content: I was in a traffic accident when I was a child and lost the use of my legs. If I were to lose my Access Key, I wouldn't be able to walk at all, let alone run.

1109602030.content: I'm so sorry, Hermes, I didn't mean to——

1109602031.content: You don't have to apologize, Admin!

1109602032.content: Ugh, I need to get out of this bed soon. Lying here for so long is really getting me down.

1109602033.content: Anyway, that's all in the past. Once my Access Key is repaired, I'll be up and running again!

1109602034.content: Yeah. You should take a good rest here in the meantime then.

1109602035.content: ... Hmm, what about this. Since you can't move about, what if I hang back here with you, Hermes? I'll take care of you, since I do owe you a huge favor from that outing to the shopping street.

1109602036.content: Ugh! No, no, no! I can't stand being taken care of!

1109602037.content: But I'm happy to chat with you, Admin, if you want to. It'd be a good way to pass the time.

1109602038.content: Let me peel an apple for you.

1109602039.content: I pick out an apple from the fruit basket at her bedside. I'm about to look for a paring knife when I suddenly hear a heavy thump on the floor behind me.

1109602041.content: I turn my head to see Hermes on the floor, groaning in pain.

1109602043.content: Owwwww... I'm so sorry. I forgot that I didn't have my Access Key. I was going to get up to get the knife myself.

1109602044.content: I hurry over to Hermes and reach out my arms to carry her back to bed.

1109602045.content: Carrying Hermes isn't that much of a challenge for me, usually. But after the workout I just had, I find myself struggling to pick her up.

1109602047.content: I can feel my arms and legs burning when I finally get Hermes off the floor. Beads of sweat form on my forehead, and I start shaking.

1109602048.content: ... Why are you shaking, Admin? I'm not THAT heavy, am I?

1109602050.content: With all the strength I have left, I let out a grunt and move Hermes back to her bed.

1109602052.content: Surely I'm not that heavy, Admin... You look like you just moved a bag of cement.

1109602053.content: (Panting) No... no... Hermes... It's me... It's my... my... new training regimen... (Pants)

1109602054.content: My muscles ache all over as I help Hermes with her blanket. For some reason, I see her eyes glimmer with what looks like tears.

1109602055.content: She shakes her head vigorously, as if trying to shake away some terrible thought. Then, she starts mumbling to herself with a deadened expression on her face.

1109602056.content: I know I've been doing nothing in bed all this time. But surely I haven't put on that much weight...

1109602057.content: Hermes, no! It's just that I've been ramping up on my training recently and I haven't quite recovered from today's sets yet!

1109602058.content: (Though admittedly, one major reason for the recent ramp-up was that I could barely carry Hermes on my back the last time...)

1109602059.content: Come on, let's talk about something else. I'll cut you some fruit, so just stay there in your bed. Don't you move again!

1109602060.content: Hold on, Admin! I have an idea!

1109602061.content: I'll listen to you even if you have a hundred ideas, as long as you stay still...

1109602062.content: And so, as a form of compromise, I accept Hermes' suggestion. I find a paring knife and walk to her bedside with the knife and the fruit basket.

1109602064.content: Hermes, have you seem the results of the adjustments we made——

1109602066.content: Ookuninushi, who has just walked into the sick bay, frowns and starts pulling at her hair.

1109602067.content: What are you doing here, Admin?

1109602068.content: (Chewing) As you can see, I'm taking care of Hermes.

1109602069.content: And why is our patient peeling an apple for you...?

1109602071.content: Hermes was the one who suggested this. She says she has to get some activity in somehow, so I handed over the task of peeling the apple to her.

1109602072.content: I'm not quite sure what this does, really, but anything to stop Hermes from trying to get out of bed.

1109602073.content: Heh, I get to eat some apple and get in some exercise to boot. It's the perfect solution! Here, have a slice, Ookuninushi!

1109603001.content: Are you free these days by any chance, Admin?

1109603003.content: Zenkibo has her hands behind her back, like she's hiding something.

1109603004.content: Whenever I see Zenkibo approach me with the sort of smile she has on right now, I know it's time to brace myself for another prank.

1109603005.content: Remember how Hermes was recuperating here with us some time ago and zoomed back as soon as her Access Key was fixed...? Shall we visit her?

1109603006.content: I'm not sure if it's a good idea to do so without asking. Who knows, Hermes may be busy right now.

1109603007.content: Heh, don't you worry about that! It'll be break time over at Olympia Express in a bit. We'll get there just in time.

1109603008.content: I'm warning you: Hermes is not one of us, so don't you even think about pulling a prank on her.

1109603009.content: Oh, please! I know that! Besides, didn't Hermes say something about wanting to thank you for taking care of her, Admin?

1109603010.content: Um... I'm not sure who was taking care of whom, really...

1109603011.content: Let's go, let's go! Enough talking and waffling!

1109603012.content: Zenkibo's motives seem innocent enough, though that in itself can be considered rather fishy. Nevertheless, I give in to her entreaties in the end.

1109603013.content: We arrive at Olympia Express and ask one of the workers there where we can find Hermes.

1109603014.content: Inside a shed, Hermes and some other workers are counting packages. As I look at the mountains of packages around her, I begin to think a little more about Hermes' job.

1109603016.content: Hermes says a few words to her co-workers after she spots me, and then dashes over.

1109603017.content: Good afternoon! What are you doing here, Admin?

1109603018.content: Well, you left in a hurry after getting your Access Key fixed, so Zenkibo and I decided to drop in on you to see how you're doing.

1109603021.content: I nod my head and watch an Olympia Express staff member walk over to Hermes.

1109603023.content: They look a little lost about what to do, and Hermes takes a quick look at the shipping label on it.

1109603024.content: Hmm. Let's treat this like we normally would, so place it over there.

1109603025.content: Yeah, that's the best we can do, I guess.

1109603026.content: They walk over to a corner of the shed and place the package on a pile of boxes and envelopes there.

1109603028.content: Heh, I knew you were gonna ask me about them, Admin.

1109603029.content: Hermes looks over at the pile and her face falls a little. Then, her smile comes back and she scratches her head.

1109603030.content: These were returned from the pick-up points by our couriers because nobody ever picked them up.

1109603031.content: Although Olympia Express has a delivery success rate of almost 100%, not all packages make it to their intended recipients.

1109603032.content: Typically, packages like these get returned to the sender. However...

1109603033.content: Hermes' voice trails off, and it is as if Hermes' usual cheeriness has been suddenly switched off. It looks like she's had some unhappy experiences returning packages like this.

1109603035.content: Heh, it's nothing. What Olympia Express does in these cases is that we check in on the recipient and find out why they did not manage to pick up their package. Most of the time, they are either just too busy or have forgotten about their package.

1109603036.content: Huh? You even check on the recipients? Isn't that a great deal of work?

1109603037.content: What Olympia Express delivers is love and hope, and as much as possible, we want to see a smile on the face of each and every one of our customers.

1109603038.content: Hermes returns to her usual cheerful self. I must say, her smile is so infectious. Just looking at her will lift your spirits, too.

1109603039.content: You truly are the star courier of Olympia Express, Hermes.

1109603040.content: Huh? Why are you saying that out of the blue, Admin...

1109603041.content: Hermes' cheeks instantly flush into a rather visible red.

1109603042.content: Have you had lunch yet, Admin?

1109603043.content: Oh, it looks like we don't have enough time now. Are you free tonight? I'll buy you a nice dinner, Admin!

1109603045.content: Hmm, I don't have anything in particular in mind. Let's ask Zenkibo!

1109603046.content: By the way, where is Zenkibo?

1109603047.content: Zenkibo, is there anything in particular you want for dinner?

1109603049.content: I'm not quite sure when it happened, but it appears that Zenkibo has pulled a disappearing act on me.

1109603050.content: Hermes and I embark on a search around Olympia Express, but it turns up empty. We spot a new shipping order on the table when we return.

1109603051.content: "Please deliver the Administrator back to Aether Gazer HQ. Sender: Zenkibo."

1109603052.content: So I guess I'm the target of Zenkibo's prank today!

1109603053.content: Let me see... Ah. Say, Admin, so you were dropped off here as a package?

1109603055.content: Curious how it feels to be an express package? I guarantee you'll like it, Admin.

1109603057.content: As I consider it, Hermes quickly puts on her courier's backpack and looks at me expectantly.

1109603058.content: Hold on tight, Admin! Here comes Olympia Express, delivering love and hope to everyone!

1109603059.content: I can barely get a word in before Hermes grabs my arm and turns on the thrusters. And... we're off, like a race car.

1109603060.content: I'm assaulted by a gust of wind in my face so strong, I can hardly open my eyes.

1109603062.content: As the world around me quickly becomes this great blur, I see in the corner of my eye Zenkibo, who is sneaking toward the pile of packages and envelopes in the corner of the shed...

1109603064.content: I can hear the wind roaring in my ears. I'm not running alongside Hermes, but rather she has picked me up like a package and is dashing toward her destination. I start to see stars.

1109603065.content: Wait!!! I haven't thought this through. Put me d——

1109603067.content: What would have been a scream of pure terror emanating from my parched mouth has been forced back into the pit of my stomach by the sheer force of the wind.

1109603068.content: Like a theme park visitor who, gleefully unwitting, has just embarked on their first roller coaster ride ever, I spend the afternoon after marinating in a mixture of shock and regret.

1109603069.content: It takes Hermes a mere ten minutes to "deliver" me to Aether Gazer HQ.

1109603071.content: I gasp for air with my hand at my neck. Hermes hands me a bottle of water with a smile.

1109603072.content: So, what do you think? It's fun being a courier, isn't it?

1109603073.content: If I ever want to go on a roller coaster, Hermes, I'll bring you along...

1109603074.content: Sure! Let me know when you're free, Admin!

1109603075.content: You know, I keep having this feeling that I'm missing something...

1109603076.content: Did you forget something at Olympia Express?

1109603077.content: No... It's Zenkibo. Zenkibo isn't back yet.

1109603078.content: Oh, I totally forgot about her! Shall we go back for her?

1109603079.content: Yeah, let's head back. Who knows what trouble Zenkibo has caused there.

1109603080.content: Alright, Admin! Ready yourself, we're going back the same way we came!

1109603082.content: No, NO! Hold on! Put me d——

1109604001.content: It's been three days since my "express" experience with Hermes.

1109604002.content: It is evening. I've just cleared a backlog at work and am finally leaving the office, exhausted.

1109604003.content: I should have a quick meal, then go to bed...

1109604004.content: I shuffle into the restaurant, my eyelids heavy with fatigue. I feel a breeze from the side, and I look up to see Hermes standing right in front of me.

1109604006.content: Did you break your Access Key again???

1109604007.content: No, it's not that! I found a rather odd package at Olympia Express.

1109604008.content: Hermes hands me a package the size of a shoe box. The sender's address on the label points to Aether Gazer HQ.

1109604009.content: Huh? I... don't recognize the sender's name.
