1109604010.content: This is a package that's been unclaimed for quite some time. As I was trying to process the delivery info like I always do with such packages, I realized that the contact information for both the sender and recipient were wrong.

1109604011.content: We check packages addressed to Aether Gazer more thoroughly as they tend to contain special shipments. Our checks have not revealed anything dangerous inside this package.

1109604012.content: Oddly, when I got in touch with the person in charge of the mailroom at Aether Gazer, they had zero recollection of this package. So there's no way to find out who the sender is.

1109604014.content: I'm sorry. This is clearly an error by one of us at Olympia Express, but do you think you could help me find out who this belongs to, please?

1109604015.content: Relax. Let me look at that name again...

1109604016.content: Hermes is clutching the package with a look of anxiety on her face. It's an expression that I rarely see on her.

1109604017.content: I'm guessing you've been asking around Aether Gazer for some time?

1109604018.content: Yeah, I've asked quite a few people. But there are a few places I can't access, which is why I need your help, Admin.

1109604019.content: Hmm. So, tell me: what happens to packages like this that can't be returned to the sender?

1109604020.content: We usually treat them as abandoned. And that's the last thing I want to do.

1109604021.content: But at least this time around we know that the package should be sent to Aether Gazer, so it'll be placed at Aether Gazer's package pick-up point for a while.

1109604022.content: But since the sender's info isn't correct, I'm guessing that it'll be discarded after some time...

1109604023.content: Do you know what's inside this package, by the way?

1109604024.content: Our couriers never open a package as doing so would infringe on the customer's privacy. But based on our scans, whatever's inside this package should be something made of plastic or wood.

1109604025.content: Hmm. I think to track down the sender or recipient, we must go back to the package itself.

1109604027.content: This is the most direct way. After all, it's the sender's fault for putting down the wrong delivery info.

1109604028.content: Alright. I guess that's the only thing we can do now.

1109604029.content: I tear open the package to find a wooden box inside.

1109604030.content: 1. I seem to have seen this wooden box somewhere before... I place a hand on the box, and with a sudden BOING!!! a clown springs out of it and some strange music starts playing.

1109604031.content: I take a closer look at the handwriting on the shipping label. It looks kind of familiar...

1109604032.content: I have a very good idea of who the sender is. It can only be her, in fact.

1109604033.content: Really? That's great! I knew you'd be able to help me, Admin!

1109604034.content: Um, first, I must apologize to you. I'm guessing that this wasn't an innocent mistake on the sender's part. This was all quite deliberate.

1109604035.content: I'm really sorry that you had to spend so much time on this. I'll try to get the sender to make it up to you and Olympia Express.

1109604036.content: What do you mean, Admin... Whose package is this???

1109604038.content: Hermes follows me into the elevator. We arrive at Zenkibo's dorm room, and I knock on the door gently.

1109604039.content: At this hour? Who's there? I'm coming!

1109604040.content: Is this Miss Zenkibo? I have a package for her.

1109604041.content: It's pretty late for a delivery... Oh, Admin! Are you moonlighting or something?

1109604042.content: Yes, Miss Zenkibo. I need you to sign for this.

1109604043.content: I hand Zenkibo her package. She looks a little uneasy.

1109604045.content: You brought this along when we visited Hermes, didn't you?

1109604046.content: Zenkibo avoids looking me in the eye.

1109604047.content: Your true purpose for visiting Olympia Express that day was not to visit Hermes or prank me, but to somehow drop this package at their processing shed.

1109604048.content: I... must say, you're pretty smart, Admin.

1109604049.content: You wrote a fictitious delivery address so that the package would eventually be re-routed back to Aether Gazer HQ. But because the sender's information is also incorrect, it would end up sitting in the office for a while.

1109604050.content: Heh heh, I was going to pick it up myself, but thanks for saving me the trouble, Admin!

1109604052.content: Zenkibo reaches over for her package. But I'm not about to just hand it over.

1109604053.content: Relax. I'm curious about why you went to all this trouble. I'm not giving this to you until you tell me why.

1109604055.content: (Sighs) It's all because Shu wanted to take away my prank toys! I didn't care about the other ones, but I'd just gotten this scare box!

1109604056.content: I looked for ways to store the box in a place where no one would find it, at least until Shu stopped looking...

1109604057.content: I see. Everything makes sense now.

1109604058.content: ... You know, you've been interrogating me like some detective, Admin. You're not going to rat me out to Shu, are you?

1109604059.content: I haven't told Shu about this yet. But it all depends on how Hermes wants to handle this.

1109604060.content: I ask the biggest victim in all this, Hermes, to step forward.

1109604062.content: So you're telling me... all this is the prankster Zenkibo's doing.

1109604063.content: Well, no one's missing this package, then! That's great.

1109604065.content: To my surprise, Hermes doesn't get mad. It's as if all the tension that's been holding her up leaves her body in a flash. She staggers a little and nearly falls on me.

1109604066.content: It's okay to get angry, Hermes! I mean, I'm sort of an accomplice as well here. You can yell at Zenkibo and I all you want!

1109604067.content: But if possible, maybe just at the Admin please...

1109604069.content: It's really alright. The important thing is that the owner of the package has been found. Olympia Express delivers again!

1109604070.content: I'll talk to Iris and the rest about this and offer them my apologies.

1109604072.content: If it hadn't been for you, I would still be running around Aether Gazer like a headless chicken.

1109604073.content: Heh heh. I guess this makes you as trustworthy as Iris, doesn't it, Admin?

1109604074.content: Hermes flashes me a wan smile and reaches out at the same time to catch hold of Zenkibo, who is trying to sneak away.

1109604075.content: As for you, Miss Zenkibo, I think we have a lot to talk about regarding the correct and appropriate use of courier services. This is going to take up the rest of your evening.

1109604076.content: Noooooooooooo! Admin! I, too, think you're trustworthy! Please save me!

1109604077.content: Hmm, I can't quite remember the number for the office of Olympia Express's managing director... I really should give them a call soon, before it gets too late...

1109604078.content: Take your time, the two of you. I'll bring you some snacks after I'm done with the phone call. But don't tire yourself out, Hermes.

1109604079.content: Don't worry, it's just a friendly chat.

1109604080.content: Hey! What was that smile about?? Do you know how creepy that looks?!

1109604081.content: I'm sorry, Admin! I know I made a mistake! Save me, please!

1109604082.content: Zenkibo's cries for help fade as I walk away from the two of them.

1109604083.content: Hmm, I wonder who's faster, Hermes or Zenkibo? Maybe I'll find out in a little while.

1109301001.content: It is dusk at the training ground. The warm rays of the setting sun have given the facility a tender, even romantic look.

1109301002.content: This is the first time the Pheasant Squad is sitting down for a post-training debrief after the tuning of Shinri. It's been a few hours since the meeting started at noon.

1109301003.content: And that's all for today. Thanks for the hard work, you two.

1109301005.content: Tsukuyomi, who is seated opposite me, reaches for the folder I hand over to her. Buzenbo, seated next to her, takes a few good stretches.

1109301006.content: It's just the three of us for the meeting today. Kuninotokotachi is away on a mission. She'll be back later.

1109301007.content: Hmm, shouldn't Kuninotokotachi have completed her mission by now?

1109301008.content: She just sent a message saying that she'll be back soon.

1109301009.content: Hmm. Her training stats have been pretty consistent, and she's reliable as always. Please hand this to her when she gets back.

1109301010.content: Reliable... So that's how you see Kuninotokotachi, Admin.

1109301011.content: You find something weird about that?

1109301012.content: My ears are tingling. Is someone talking about me over there?

1109301013.content: Kuninotokotachi's voice rings out from somewhere behind me. A moment later, I find our white-haired ninja seated opposite me with a grin, her hand already on Buzenbo's shoulder.

1109301015.content: I've got some tickets to the food fair at the upcoming Yamanokami Festival. Care to join me the day after tomorrow?

1109301017.content: Ooh, your ears are red! You're so adorable when you're serious, Buzenbo.

1109301018.content: I can't help but tease you when you're like this.

1109301019.content:
Kuninotokotachi gently strokes Buzenbo's cheek with her index finger as she speaks.
Buzenbo, brows firmly knitted together, finally manages to get Kuninotokotachi's hand off her after much effort.

1109301020.content: I can smell the alcohol on you, Kuninotokotachi. You must have stopped by the bar on your way back again.

1109301021.content: Oh? You got me! But I only had two drinks!

1109301022.content: Please, take your missions more seriously.

1109301023.content:
Fine, fine! You win.
And now, I'm seriously extending an invitation to you.

1109301024.content: So, the day after tomorrow. How about it?

1109301025.content: Buzenbo lets out a sigh, and gently shakes her head at Kuninotokotachi.

1109301026.content: I can't. We just worked out a new training plan with the Admin today, and I start my retreat tomorrow.

1109301027.content: What am I going to do, then?

1109301028.content: Please enjoy yourself at the festival, Kuninotokotachi.

1109301029.content: Kuninotokotachi tilts her head, and starts chuckling. She's clearly used to getting the cold shoulder from Buzenbo.

1109301031.content: You know, life is long. While it's good to stay focused on the destination, sometimes it's also nice to just smell the flowers along the way, you know?

1109301032.content: I just wanted you to take some time off for yourself. It's not good to be so wound up all the time.

1109301033.content: Mastering the sword is all about the mind... Being too relaxed will cause me to be careless, and a wandering mind births a trembling blade. This is what my master has taught me.

1109301035.content: She turns to look at Tsukuyomi.

1109301036.content: What about you, Tsukuyomi? I know a place that serves really great miso soup!

1109301037.content:
Tsukuyomi, who is now on her feet, waves the folder in her hand.
Apart from the new training program that we just came up with, it also contains a mission brief for Tsukuyomi.

1109301038.content: I've got a mission to attend to. I was actually going to ask you to watch over Buzenbo while I'm out.

1109301039.content: Please. It'll be good enough if she can watch over herself.

1109301041.content: What am I gonna do with my tickets, though? It's strictly one per person only. It'd be a pity to let the second ticket go to waste...

1109301042.content: Kuninotokotachi pulls two pink tickets out of nowhere, and places them on the table with a look of regret. Just as soon as she does, however, she turns her attention to me.

1109301043.content: Ooh. I forgot that the Admin's here, too.

1109301045.content: Uh-oh. Why are Kuninotokotachi's eyes on me now?

1109301047.content: Hahaha! Abducting you, of course, if you have the time!

1109301048.content: I've been feeling lonely lately since Buzenbo keeps turning me down.

1109301049.content:
Well, don't make me say it out loud, Admin.
Good thing I remembered you're here. I was about to take off my armor and relax.

1109301050.content: You know, I'm not wearing anything underneath! For ease of movement and all that.

1109301051.content:
Please stop that!
For goodness' sake, stop fooling around, Kuninotokotachi.

1109301052.content: Hahaha, just look at the two of you.

1109301053.content: Kuninotokotachi shakes her head, albeit with a glint in her eye. She then casually looks in my direction.

1109301054.content: So, Admin, are you free the day after tomorrow? Come with me to the festival?

1109301056.content: Two days later, at four in the afternoon.

1109301057.content: The last item on my agenda for the day reads: "Go to festival with Kuninotokotachi." I'm suddenly reminded of what happened two days back, and can't help but sigh.

1109301058.content: I said yes to Kuninotokotachi in the end.

1109301059.content: I mean, surely it's normal for a person to get flustered if a lady ninja made of pure chaos suddenly approaches you... right?

1109301060.content: Besides, I was planning on heading out for some fun anyway. That festival sounds like a good idea, actually... Yes, I agreed because I'm free, not because I was flustered... And that's the truth!

1109301061.content: I get up from my desk to stretch and move my limbs a little. The game plan is to go back to my room to freshen up, then head over to the festival to meet up with Kuninotokotachi.

1109301062.content: I'm at the door when I bump into an unexpected visitor.

1109301064.content: Poseidon looks rather unsure, as if she's been standing at the entrance to the office for a while. She's holding a folder in one hand, and right behind her is a travel assistance robot.

1109301065.content: Oh, Admin. I... Are you going somewhere?

1109301066.content: Yeah, I'm heading over to Sasanami. Is anything the matter?

1109301067.content: I'm sorry, Admin, but I need you to take a look at this document.

1109301068.content: This is from Mimir... it's about the Cryptics' R&D budget for the next quarter. The review has to be finished by today...

1109301069.content: She hands the folder over to me, and a long list of to-do items from the Cryptics flashes on the screen. In the bottom left corner, it reads: "Manager responsible: Shu."

1109301070.content: Hmm. Miss Shu's the one who handles budget matters. Besides, she's also identified as the manager responsible here...

1109301071.content: Yes. To be honest, it was my idea to... intercept this.

1109301072.content: Shu is supposed to go on vacation starting tonight. We've made plans to go to the beach, actually... If this folder gets to her, she'll definitely take a rain check on her break...

1109301073.content: Mimtastic has already warned her that her body is showing abnormal signs because of overwork. If she continues down this path...

1109301074.content: Now that you mention it, I don't think I've ever seen Shu go on a real break before...

1109301075.content: I can't help but recall how during the Masson-Nalen incident Shu ended up not having a single day of rest despite the fact that she was technically on leave.

1109301077.content: I'd feel really bad about troubling her with something like this.

1109301080.content:
You know, "Worker at Company X has succumbed to overwork after years and years of non-stop work..."
If that got out...

1109301081.content: Even Modifiers can fall ill from overwork.

1109301082.content: I'm so glad we're on the same page here, Admin.

1109301083.content: Hmm, leave this to me. I'll handle this on her behalf.

1109301084.content:
I take the folder from Poseidon, who returns my gesture with a smile of gratitude.
Judging by the travel robot trailing behind her, I'm guessing she must be off to her vacation now.

1109301085.content: I feel an inexplicable weight in my hand as soon as the folder lands in it. I mean, we're talking about Miss Shu's precious vacation here, after all. There really was no good reason to say no to Poseidon.

1109301086.content:
But... what am I going to tell Kuninotokotachi?
She's probably about to reach the festival venue by now.

1109301087.content: I'm so sorry about this, and thank you.

1109301088.content: Have a great time with Miss Shu!

1109301089.content: Sure, that you can leave to me!

1109301091.content: As soon as Poseidon leaves, I get in touch with Kuninotokotachi and explain what just popped up while apologizing profusely.

1109301092.content: Kuninotokotachi doesn't complain. She simply teases me a little like she always does. Still, I can't help but feel a little guilty.

1109301093.content: After I hang up, I briskly make my way to the Cryptics for a rather... energetic and robust discussion with Ookuninushi and Heimdall about the budget.

1109301095.content: So this is what Miss Shu experiences every time the Cryptics' R&D budget comes up for review.

1109301096.content: Night has fallen, and I find myself looking down a dim hallway with no one else in sight. What I originally estimated would take half an hour at the most has kept me at the office till nearly midnight.

1109301097.content:
"Ding-dong!"
I see a request to start a call from Buzenbo on my communicator.

1109301098.content: Buzenbo? What's the matter? Why aren't you in bed yet?

1109301099.content: Kuninotokotachi made a ton of noise and woke me up. Did something happen at the festival today, Admin?

1109301101.content: Yes. She just returned from the festival reeking of liquor.

1109301102.content: She looks really, really glum. That's why I'm wondering if something went wrong.

1109301104.content: I hesitate for a brief moment before I tell Buzenbo about how I didn't make it to the festival because of the last-minute assignment

1109301105.content: I'd thought that it'd be possible to wrap things up quickly and maybe still make it to the festival...

1109301112.content: I bailed on her at the very last minute after all. She may be unhappy about that. I should apologize to her in person.

1109301113.content: Go back to bed, Buzenbo. I'll go see how she's doing.

1109301114.content: Thanks, Admin. Sorry for the trouble.

1109301115.content: It's a quarter past midnight and I'm standing at Kuninotokotachi's door.

1109301117.content: It's a bit late. Maybe I'll just come back tomorrow...

1109301118.content: But I always see Kuninotokotachi posting pictures of her festival outings as late as two or three in the morning. Maybe she's passed out from the drinks?

1109301119.content: I knock on the door again, and I hear a barely audible reply from the other side of the door.

1109301120.content: ...Looks like she really went for it at the bar.

1109301121.content: I open the door and step into her room. Strange. The lights are on, but Kuninotokotachi is nowhere to be seen.

1109301123.content: My world is spinning all of a sudden. Before I can understand what is happening, I feel a strong compressive force on my neck.

1109301124.content: My joints are screaming as my limbs are twisted in every direction imaginable, most of them unnatural, and the smell of alcohol envelops me. I can't breathe.

1109301125.content: I hear a familiar voice from behind me. It's very close to me, in fact.

1109301126.content: You stinking thief! How dare you try to steal from me?!

1109301129.content: I can feel her grip on me loosen. Kuninotokotachi shifts a little, and stares at my head for a really long time.

1109301130.content: You really are drunk, aren't you? You can't even open your eyes.

1109301132.content: Yes, yes, it's me. Would you let me go now?

1109301134.content: Kuninotokotachi finally takes her arms and legs off me, then gets up rather languidly and walks over to the couch as if nothing had happened.

1109301135.content: Her inebriated state aside, she does not appear glum to me at all.

1109301136.content: What are you doing in my room at this time of the night, Admin?

1109301137.content: Don't tell me you've come looking for something?

1109301139.content: Here's a piece of advice for you: don't mimic Buzenbo if you don't want to make her angry.

1109301140.content: I mean, you sneaked into my room while I was asleep... Don't make me say what, you're gonna make me blush!

1109301141.content: The conversation has taken a rather uncomfortable turn, and I quickly sit up straight.

1109301142.content: (Coughs) I spoke with Buzenbo and she told me that you were in a bad state when you returned earlier.

1109301144.content: Did something bad happen at the festival? Or... are you still mad that I bailed on you? I'm really sorry about that.

1109301146.content: The room is suddenly dead quiet. Although Kuninotokotachi's eyes are fixed on me, I can sense that her mind is also somewhere else.

1109301148.content: Do you want to talk about it?

1109301149.content: You're a sweet one, aren't you, Admin? This isn't a feel-good story, though. You sure you wanna hear it?

1109301152.content: Kuninotokotachi takes a deep breath, and her usual languorous manner vanishes.

1109302001.content:
Shimogyou district in Sasanami: a relatively backward and impoverished place where lawlessness and disorder thrive.

Hoodlums, thieves, robbers, and even assassins... the five families of Sasanami, the Sasanami Five, have been scheming against each other since the beginning, throwing the district into even greater disorder.

The district's many festivals also draw large crowds that criminal elements prey on. Something awful always happens to someone at these events.

Kuninotokotachi is always the nemesis of these criminal elements. Every time she goes to a festival, she helps "take out the trash," so to speak.

"I don't really have a goal or anything. I just hate seeing people getting the short end of the stick." That's what she always says.

……

1109302007.content: So there was trouble tonight at the festival too, because of those bad guys?

1109302009.content: It may be the drink, but Kuninotokotachi is showing more emotion than usual. She gazes at the ornaments on the table a little absentmindedly, as if she is recalling what happened at the festival.

1109302010.content: So, there's this stall owner who has a seven-year-old daughter. His life is ruined now, through no fault of his own.

1109302012.content: No, it wasn't a robber. It was a killer sent by an organization that does assassinations. I discovered them when they were about to commit the deed, and they took off. I ran after them, and they knocked over a lighting rig by the stall to slow me down.

1109302013.content: There were people all around when the rig came down. The stall owner tried to save his daughter from the falling rig, and ended up getting his legs pinned underneath.

1109302014.content: I managed to catch the assassin, but the stall owner's legs were broken. There was no way to save them.

1109302015.content: Kuninotokotachi lets out a long sigh. I can see traces of regret on her face.

1109302016.content: I nod my head, but immediately realize that although she's told me what happened earlier, she hasn't told me why she's feeling so glum.

1109302017.content: Are you upset because... you weren't able to save the stall owner?

1109302018.content: If his legs are broken, surely he can be fitted with prosthetics? While the standard of medical care in Sasanami is slightly lower, that sort of procedure still shouldn't be a problem there...

1109302020.content: You don't understand how things are in Sasanami. The people of Shimogyou... they can't quite afford things like prosthetic limbs.

1109302021.content: Kuninotokotachi shakes her head helplessly, and points at the buildings around us.

1109302022.content: This room here, this property we're in, they look great because this is where the Sasanami Five live. But what about those people who live in Shimogyou?

1109302023.content: They live from paycheck to paycheck, with hardly any savings to speak of. And they still have to pay exorbitant taxes to support the five families in Kamigyou.

1109302024.content: For many households, the financial consequences of just one unexpected event are enough to ruin them.

1109302025.content: So you're saying that they're already stretched thin just surviving.

1109302027.content: I sigh, and shift in my seat a little to find a more relaxed sitting position.

1109302028.content: The medics came, and I asked them about the stall owner. They told me that he has only two choices.

1109302029.content: With his limbs amputated, he can either spend the rest of his life in a wheelchair, or be fitted for prosthetics in exchange for 30 years of debt. This is debt that will leave nothing for food on the table.

1109302030.content: 30 years? Which means he'd be paying off the prosthetics until... what, 2345?

1109302031.content: Mm-hmm. And we're talking about the most affordable prosthetic legs here, the ones that are rated for body weight and nothing more. Which means he wouldn't be able to run his stall anyway.

1109302032.content: But if he doesn't get fitted for prosthetics, he won't have an income for him and his daughter.

1109302033.content: I know you're thinking about grants. But he's three years away from becoming eligible for those.

1109302035.content: 30 years' worth of debt... Do you know what the stall owner said when he heard that?

1109302036.content:
He asked if it'd be cheaper if he were to get just one prosthetic limb instead.
He told the medics that with one prosthetic limb, he could use a walking stick and still make a living of sorts for his daughter.

1109302037.content: Kuninotokotachi's voice is even, despite the fact she's telling the story of an ordinary family whose lives have just been turned upside down.

1109302038.content:
Hmm, think I've blabbed a little too much. Are you hearing about stuff like this for the first time?
You don't have to worry too much about this. I've seen stories like this play out again and again throughout my life.

1109302039.content: I probably drank a little too much today because I got emotional. That's all.

1109302040.content: After all, the world isn't as wonderful as we hope it to be. The only thing we can do is treasure each and every day that we have, right?

1109302041.content:
I nod in agreement.
What Kuninotokotachi witnessed today is unfortunately a story all too commonplace in Sasanami.

1109302042.content: The answer to problems like this is neither indignant posturing nor one-off, sporadic assistance.

1109302043.content: Besides, I made my way here not to discuss the people's hardships but to look in on Kuninotokotachi... I can rest easy now that I know that she's not in trouble of any kind.

1109302044.content: I agree with you. And I'm glad you're okay.

1109302045.content: Don't you worry. I got used to this a long time ago. But you, Admin, don't let this story get you down.

1109302047.content: The reason I came to see you was actually to tell you that you can always come talk to me if something is bothering you.

1109302048.content: And as the Administrator, I'd also like to get closer to you, so th—

1109302050.content: There is a glint in Kuninotokotachi's eye. I sense that I've just stepped into another landmine of some sort.

1109302051.content: I feel a breeze. Kuninotokotachi, who'd just been seated opposite me, is next to me in a flash.

1109302053.content: Why are the lights off?! Kuninotokotachi?

1109302054.content:
Oops, I must have turned them off by accident.
More importantly, Admin, you were saying something about "getting closer?"

1109302055.content: How do you propose we do that, hmm?

1109302057.content: ENTRANCE TICKET TO THE MT. KAZABUMI SUMMER FESTIVAL & FIREWORKS SHOW

1109302058.content: Oof. Well, I had to stand in line for two hours to get this, but surely it'll make up for bailing on Kuninotokotachi last time?

1109302059.content: Promises made, promises kept—and when they can't be kept for whatever reason, you've got to at least make up for it...

1109302060.content: As I gaze at the two tickets in my hand, I'm haunted by what Kuninotokotachi said to me a few days ago.

1109302061.content: "I'll let you go, Admin, if you promise to make up for bailing on me."

1109302062.content: My thoughts are interrupted by a hand waving in front of me.

1109302064.content: Yeah, I'm done over here. Let's head back.

1109302065.content: I'm sorry you had to wait so long here with me.

1109302067.content: Master says that to practice is to quiet the mind. To try and quiet the mind in a noisy place like this is good training.

1109302068.content: Such admirable effort, Buzenbo. Seems like you're always on high alert.

1109302069.content: Only when you can maintain watchfulness can you see all that is around you.

1109302070.content: Um, Admin, the next time you go to a festival with Kuninotokotachi, how about you tell her not to... No, tell her to drink less?

1109302072.content: ...If you really can't stop her, please inform my master as soon as you can.

1109302074.content: Three days later, at the meeting point for the Mt. Kazabumi festival.

1109302075.content:
Let's check one more time... the tasks for this week.... all completed.
And I see that my leave request has been approved... Hmm?

1109302076.content: I see an additional note scrawled in the document: "Enjoy yourselves! Shu."

1109302077.content: Miss Shu really is a sweetheart.

1109302078.content:
"Beep! Beep!"
I initiate a call with Kuninotokotachi.

1109302079.content: I'm already at our meeting point.

1109302080.content: You sure are early, Admin! Are you dying to see me, perchance?

1109302081.content: I was worried that I'd get caught up in something else again. How are things going on your end?

1109302082.content: I'll be there in a bit. If you're feeling bored, how about you guess what I'm doing right now?

1109302085.content: Wow, are we just skipping the courtship and going straight to the important stuff now, Admin?

1109302086.content: (Coughs) N-no, I was just... Please don't take it that way.

1109302087.content: You know, not many people say what's on their mind. I'm beginning to really like you, Admin.

1109302088.content: Huh? Why would you say that?

1109302089.content: Well, you did mention before that you like to "take out the trash..."

1109302091.content: Yes, I'm "taking out the trash" right now.

1109302092.content: After all, I'm having a date with the Administrator tonight. I'm not gonna let a bunch of stinking thieves ruin it.

1109302094.content: How about you take a walk with Buzenbo first, Admin? It'll be some time before I'm done.

1109302097.content:
I get off the communicator and turn to look at Buzenbo, who's meditating in a chair next to me.
Buzenbo has been following me around for the past two days. The rules state I must be accompanied by a Modifier whenever I leave Aether Gazer.

1109302098.content: Kuninotokotachi says she'll be a while still. Do you want to take a walk?

1109302099.content: No, thank you... But if you wish to do so, Admin, I'll come with you.

1109302100.content: Forget about it, then. I'll just sit here with you.

1109302101.content:
I sit down next to Buzenbo and idly watch groups of festival-goers dressed in summer outfits walk toward the festival square.

"She's probably just half an hour away..." I close my eyes for a bit as I wait for a message from Kuninotokotachi.

Little did I know that the wait would go late into the night.

...

1109302105.content: A quarter past nine in the evening, at the meeting point on a street in Sasanami.

1109302108.content: Can you believe it? Even in 2315, the weather forecasts are still so unreliable.

1109302109.content: The rain has really taken me by surprise. I'd checked the weather forecasts before heading out the door earlier today. We were supposed to be in the middle of a three-day sunny streak.

1109302110.content: Rain on a festival day isn't good news at all, even if it isn't exactly pouring.

1109302111.content: Have you not heard from Kuninotokotachi yet?

1109302112.content:
Not yet.
I tried contacting her but it didn't go through.

1109302113.content: She must be on some secret mission.

1109302114.content: How about we cross the street and wait in that shop over there, Admin? The rain's getting pretty bad.

1109302116.content:
"Beep! Beep!"
I've just gotten to my feet when I receive a call request on my communicator.

1109302117.content: I see the name Tsukuyomi flash on the screen, and a bad feeling forms in the pit of my stomach.

1109302120.content: On the main street, with Buzenbo.

1109302121.content: I need you to come back now.

1109302122.content: Kuninotokotachi is hurt. We just linked with Mimtastic to perform emergency treatment on her.

1109302124.content: Master! Is she hurt very badly?

1109302125.content: We've dealt with the external injuries. But she is unable to move now due to damage from a neurotoxin. She'll need some time to recover.

1109302126.content: Buzenbo and I look at each other, and sense worry in each other's eyes.

1109302127.content: Got it. We're heading back right now!

1109302128.content: I get off the communicator and gaze at the hillside in the distance. Looks like the festival is still in high swing.

1109302129.content: If Kuninotokotachi hadn't encountered a powerful Visbane... just what happened to her? How did she get hurt so badly?

1109303003.content:
My gaze follows Buzenbo's and falls on Kuninotokotachi, who is leaning by the wall-to-ceiling window.
She looks rather unafflicted apart from a tinge of tiredness in her eyes.

1109303004.content: Mimtastic has finished treating her wounds. But the neurotoxin's the more serious problem here.

1109303005.content: While the impact is not grave, Kuninotokotachi will be experiencing general weakness for some time, which means she'll be out of action for a while.

1109303006.content: I'm sorry, Admin... I'm sorry to you too, Buzenbo. Sorry for making you worry.

1109303007.content: It looks like I won't be able to make the festival today...

1109303009.content: But you spent so much time on it, Admin!

1109303010.content: Oh, did it rain? I must say, in all my years of attending festivals, I've rarely seen one actually get rained out.

1109303011.content: I'm glad you're okay. Just focus on getting better, okay?

1109303012.content: Mimtastic's analysis indicates that the poison affecting Kuninotokotachi is rather potent. An ordinary human attacked with this would have been asphyxiated within seconds.

1109303013.content: Rest up. It'll take at least a week for you to be in fighting shape again.

1109303014.content: I'm sorry for causing you trouble, Tsukuyomi.

1109303015.content: Don't say that. The most important thing to me is keeping you and Buzenbo safe.

1109303016.content: You must let me know the next time you're in a dangerous situation like this.

1109303019.content: Don't you need to rest, Admin?

1109303020.content: I'll sit with you for a while.

1109303021.content: Hmm? I can't even lift my arm right now.

1109303022.content: Perfect chance for you to do whatever's on your mind, Admin.

1109303025.content: I asked you to make up for bailing on me the last time around, and now, you can do the same with me.

1109303026.content: I'm all yours now, Admin. What do you want to do?

1109303028.content: (Coughs) Okay, no more joshing around now.

1109303029.content: I sit down next to Kuninotokotachi and look at her. She seems a bit tired.

1109303030.content: I saw the treatment report. Your wounds were pretty serious. What happened?

1109303031.content: You're a key member of the Pheasant Squad. Given your skills, most people would never have seen you coming. Who was able to hurt you like this? Was it a Visbane?

1109303032.content: Um... is it okay if I don't answer that?

1109303033.content: Of course. I'm just concerned about you. I won't force you to tell me if you don't want to.

1109303034.content: You really are the sweetest, Admin.

1109303035.content: ...It's my fault that I got hurt today.

1109303036.content: Remember the killer I told you about last time, Admin?

1109303038.content: Yeah. The organization the killer belongs to started out without a name, and later became known as "Mumei." They started their operations in Sasanami a few decades ago.

1109303039.content: They adopt orphans and train them into ruthless assassins, then send them to gather intelligence and conduct assassinations for the Sasanami Five.

1109303040.content: They're the best in the trade when it comes to schemes and assassinations.

1109303041.content: So, they took revenge on you for messing up their operation before?

1109303043.content: But how did they know where to find you?

1109303044.content: You don't need to know your target's whereabouts if you lay a trap. All you have to do is to have everything in place, then create an opportunity for them to walk right into it.

1109303045.content: In terms of results, a trap is the easiest, most effective, and most foolproof way to get the job done.

1109303046.content: I mean, if at first you don't succeed, you can try again later, right?

1109303048.content: At the end of the day, we Modifiers are just more physically capable humans who can use Divine Grace to destroy Visbanes.

1109303049.content: Even with tricks like Zero Time up our sleeves, there are only so many traps we can get out of.

1109303050.content: I know you want to ask why I didn't get Tsukuyomi and Buzenbo to come along with me, Admin.

1109303051.content: I hope it's clearer to you now. If even I couldn't get out of a situation like that unscathed... I could never ask them to risk their lives like that.

1109303052.content: Besides... this is between me and that organization. I have to do this myself.

1109303053.content: This is about being responsible for my own problems.

1109303055.content: You seem to know quite a lot about Mumei, though.

1109303056.content: Shh... every lady has secrets to keep, Admin. To be gallant is to be discreet.

1109303057.content: ...I'll stop here, then. Right now, you should just focus on getting better.

1109303058.content: You really know how to care for a girl, Admin! I like that about you.

1109303059.content: I'm simply doing what I should.

1109303060.content: I hear a musical tone coming from the clock in the sitting room. Wow, it's midnight already.

1109303062.content: I'm sorry to trouble you again, Admin.

1109303063.content: Since this damsel in distress can't quite move herself, I'll have to ask you to carry me back to my room.

1109303065.content: I hesitate a little as Kuninotokotachi strenuously tries to lift one arm, and finally get to my feet and lift her from her position.

1109303066.content:
I'm not sure if this is deliberate on her part, but as soon as I have her in my arms Kuninotokotachi leans into me rather naturally.
As I feel her hair and breath on my face, I become keenly aware of just how close we are at this moment.

1109303070.content: Don't you think that... an embrace is called for in this very moment, Admin?

1109303072.content: You're a patient now. You should take a break from teasing me for a minute.

1109303074.content: But you know what? I kinda like that about you.

1109303076.content: A fresh set of confidential intel has appeared on my desk.

1109303077.content: This precious intel from Baldr has come at the cost of a luxury set meal.

1109303078.content: Well, well, well. I was wondering why Admin would take so much effort to ask me for the favor.

1109303079.content: So, are you obsessed by our... Miss Ninja?

1109303080.content: No, no it's not. Don't be silly.

1109303081.content: Hahaha! However, Admin, I have to tell you: although we are at the so-called Intelligence Office, our expertise is in Visbane intel.

1109303082.content: I understand... it's just that I don't know anyone more suitable to ask for this than you, Baldr...

1109303083.content: Alright, alright. I know you have your difficulties.

1109303084.content: However, if you really want some decent intel, you should go to those underground intel brokers. That may be more efficient.

1109303085.content: Underground intel dealers? And how in the world would I even begin to get in touch with them?

1109303086.content: Well, you're right. That is the expertise of intelligence personnel.

1109303087.content: I hear peals of laughter on Baldr's end, and we make a little more small talk before we end the call. I pick up the folder on my desk and start reading.

1109303088.content:
"Organization: Mumei"

"Brief: An organization of killers that operates in Sasanami's Shimogyou district. Serves the interests of the Sasanami Five primarily through surveillance and assassination..."

"Known Cases: In the year 2268..."

...

"List of Key Members"

"Seven, real name unknown. A jonin ranked no. 7 in the Mumei hierarchy."

"Disappeared after a failed attempt on the Sansaru clan during the Yamanokami Festival of 2308..."

1109303095.content: "Based on the intel on hand, the jonin known as Seven who went missing in 2308 may be Kuninotokotachi." I pause my reading at Baldr's conclusion, and fall into deep thought.

1109303096.content: I suppose... the only way to find out the truth is to ask the subject herself?

1109303098.content: Kuninotokotachi is leaning languidly against the window in her room and gazing at the courtyard outside.

1109303101.content: I must say, I'm beginning to really like just sitting here and doing nothing but watch the flowers and birds in the courtyard...

1109303104.content: Maybe I've come to realize that my time is only truly mine if I can afford to while it away...

1109303105.content: I take a seat next to her and produce the Mumei folder. Kuninotokotachi takes a casual glance at it, and continues talking without so much as missing a beat.

1109303106.content: You know, I saw on the news the other day that over half the population of Sasanami actually choose to stay up late even after a long day's work.

1109303107.content: It's not that they aren't tired. Most of them say that sleep is just a waste of time. It's only at night they can actually choose what they want to do...

1109303108.content: Everyone's struggling to get by, after all.

1109303109.content: So, what's up, Admin? I know how busy you are, so you aren't just here to shoot the breeze, are you?

1109303110.content: Funny. I thought you'd ask me if I was lonely and needed your companionship.

1109303111.content: Oh, so you are feeling lonely again, eh? Hahaha.

1109303114.content: For looking into the organization behind my back, is that it?

1109303115.content: Huh? How did you know that?

1109303116.content: It's written all over your face, Admin.

1109303117.content: So you've looked into the organization, but there are some things you haven't quite figured out yet...

1109303118.content: Huh? How did you know that?

1109303119.content: Please. One look at you is all I need.

1109303120.content: Besides, I don't think you'd hide something like that from me, would you, Admin?

1109303122.content:
I'll ask you straight, then.
Am I right to say that you were a member of Mumei?

1109303123.content: That's right. I was a jonin there, to boot.

1109303124.content: And if I'm not wrong... I'm probably the only one declared as a traitor in the organization's history, too.

1109303125.content: So our lady has no secrets to keep today?

1109303127.content: I know that you'll keep asking until you get the answer anyway.

1109303128.content: ...I only do that with people I know well enough.

1109303129.content: Fine, fine. So now you know the truth. All the skills and methods I know, I learned from Mumei.

1109303130.content: And I got hurt this time... because they were trying to get back at someone whom they regard a traitor. I guess that's to be expected.

1109303131.content: I've gotten in their way a number of times since I left the organization.

1109303132.content: You're telling me that this isn't the first time something like this has happened to you?!

1109303133.content: Of course. I was just a little hasty this time, that's all...

1109303134.content: Come to think of it, I must have been thinking about our date! Hahaha...

1109303135.content: Is there any way I can help? You know, to get rid of them once and for all.

1109303136.content: Oh no, please don't. I already told you, I have to do this myself.

1109303137.content: But it's too dangerous for you to deal with this on your own.

1109303138.content: It's precisely because it's so dangerous that I can't allow the people I care about to get involved.

1109303139.content: I can deal with this myself.

1109303140.content: You're not dealing with this on your own.

1109303141.content: I turn my head at the sound of footsteps behind me to see Tsukuyomi and Buzenbo, who've just finished their training, walking toward us.

1109303142.content: Tsukuyomi... Oh no. This is not good.

1109303143.content: Now that I know about what's going on, I won't just sit back and watch.

1109304001.content: As a result of this unexpected occurrence, we end up planning an operation...

1109304002.content: At a street intersection in Kamigyou, not far from a certain restaurant.

1109304003.content: I've been wanting to ask: isn't this where we were supposed to meet the other time?

1109304004.content: You're right! Talk about coincidences, am I right?

1109304005.content:
But this time, the goal is to get Mumei in one fell swoop...
My hope is there won't be any more "coincidences" like this in the future.

1109304006.content: That'd be a challenge. In Sasanami, assassination and intel-gathering organizations like this are a dime a dozen. As long as the Sasanami Five are scheming against each other, these organizations will always be around.

1109304007.content: Look, even though the organization is in decline, there are still people from the Sasanami Five here to discuss a job with them, aren't there?

1109304008.content: Would you know by any chance which family is the target this time?

1109304009.content:
How would I know? We're working off your intel, aren't we?
It could be the Sansaru or the Akishika clans... or even the Izuru family. Who knows?

1109304010.content: But for them to gather all of Mumei's jonin in one place, I'm guessing they're planning a big job.

1109304011.content: Just as we're planning to take them out, they hold a high-level meeting... What would you call this? A "fortuitous wind?"

1109304013.content:
"Beep! Beep!"
The other two members of the Pheasant Squad come online on the communicator.

1109304014.content: In position at the side door, Admin.

1109304015.content: I'm in position at the rear exit as well.

1109304016.content: The Sasanami security team is on the move. They'll be here in a few minutes. Once again, the task for the two of you is to stop anyone from Mumei from escaping the security dragnet.

1109304017.content: Our targets are most adept at using the element of surprise, so if you encounter any issues, remember that your safety is the top priority.

1109304020.content: Just as I get off the communicator, Kuninotokotachi comes up to me and starts leaning onto my shoulder.

1109304021.content: I gotta tell you, Admin, I'm really mad at you about this.

1109304023.content: I can't believe that you were so thoughtless, barging into my room and blabbing about my secrets like that! And now everyone knows them...

1109304024.content: Sorry for the indiscretion... But Tsukuyomi, Buzenbo, and I, none of us want you to take this on by myself.

1109304025.content: (Sighs) I can't believe you all. Tsukuyomi and Buzenbo have a lot on their plates, too.

1109304026.content:
Let's talk about something else.
Will you tell me your plan for this operation now, Admin?

1109304028.content:
A few days prior, after Tsukuyomi and Buzenbo overheard the conversation I was having with Kuninotokotachi, the two of them started arguing.

Kuninotokotachi was adamant that Tsukuyomi and Buzenbo should not get involved because of how dangerous Mumei was.

On the other hand, Tsukuyomi and Buzenbo were worried about Kuninotokotachi. And so the argument slowly morphed into a discussion about how best to get rid of Mumei...

I piped up with a suggestion which I believed to be the path of caution.

"How about we wait for Mumei's leaders to gather at one spot and then call in the Kamigyou security team to arrest them all?"

...

1109304034.content: I'm not fishing for compliments here, but you know, I've spent half a year's worth of wages on you.

1109304036.content: Yeah, just to get intel on this Mumei meeting... The intel dealers in Sasanami sure don't do business cheap.

1109304037.content: Haha, you poor thing! But I have to tell you, I've made quite a bit of dough on my missions.

1109304038.content: So if you like, I can be your sugar mommy...

1109304040.content: You're getting a little less adorable now...

1109304042.content: Why, so that you can take care of me? Hold on... is this a confession of love, Admin?

1109304043.content: No, no it's not. Don't be silly.

1109304044.content: (Sighs) Now that you can banter with me, Admin, my life's become a little more boring.

1109304046.content: Fine, fine. You know what, I still have no idea what your plan for today is.

1109304047.content: It's actually quite simple: I made a call to the authorities as a "concerned citizen," saying that I was abducted by someone with a gun and that someone is hiding out in the restaurant now.

1109304049.content: Just as well. The Kamigyou security team is always twiddling its thumbs anyway. They must be so excited to get a call about an armed abduction for once.

1109304050.content: Like... "Ooh, now we can fulfill our KPIs?"

1109304051.content: Mm-hmm. At any rate, it's gonna get busy around here soon enough.

1109304052.content: Mmm... So our task is to work with the security team and make sure that none of Mumei's members escape. There are three exits to watch out for. Tsukuyomi is at the side door and Buzenbo's at the rear exit.

1109304053.content: All I have to do is to keep watch at the front door. After all, the front door is usually the best covered anyway. Though I wasn't expecting you to follow me here.

1109304054.content: This is my problem to deal with, after all. Now I've gotten all of you caught up in it, the least I can do is be here. Even if I'm not part of the operation.

1109304055.content: You don't mind dragging me along, do you, Admin?

1109304056.content: Of course not. I just think we'll probably be able to wrap this up quickly, that's all. Didn't want you to waste a trip.

1109304057.content: You make it sound so easy! You're dealing with the biggest underground organization in Sasanami after all.

1109304058.content: That may be true for the average Joe, but just look at all the adventures I've had so far. These are all stories that you usually only see in TV shows and movies.

1109304059.content: That's true... All things said, Mumei is just an organization made up of ordinary people. The only reason we run into so many strange things is that we're Modifiers.

1109304060.content: You know, you're always saying something that sounds so out of left field, but makes so much sense at the same time. I'm growing fonder of you by the day.

1109304061.content: I appreciate the sentiment, but you don't have to keep getting closer to me...

1109304062.content: Haha! Why, too tempting for you?

1109304063.content: How about you forget about heading straight back to Ain Soph after this, and have a couple of drinks with me instead? The weather's gotten cooler now, so whatever we get up to after, we won't feel the heat...

1109304065.content:
I'm still thinking about a suitable riposte to Kuninotokotachi's vague proposal when the silence of the night is pierced by blaring police sirens.

In the blink of an eye, a swarm of security vehicles and uniformed personnel appear, along with AGI mechas armored to various degrees. They quickly surround the restaurant.

1109304068.content: Hmm, and looks like they're well-prepared, too... If I didn't know better, I'd think this was a military exercise of some sort.

1109304069.content: My commentary comes to a halt when a middle-aged person suddenly appears in front of us, and quickly gestures for us to produce our IDs.

1109304070.content: Hello, are you #{nickname}#? I'm an officer from the precinct. Were you the one who called our hotline about an armed abduction?

1109304072.content: And the one who was abducted is your partner?

1109304075.content: He looks at Kuninotokotachi, who has chosen to stand very, very close to me, with some uncertainty.

1109304076.content: She's... (Coughs) Anyway, my partner is still in the abductor's hands. I'm really worried! Please make sure that they're safe!

1109304078.content: Yes, yes, of course. As for the two of you... um... please watch out for your own safety.

1109304079.content: Quite a bit of time passes after the officer leaves before Kuninotokotachi finally bursts into laughter.

1109304080.content: Heh heh, looks like we're a real headache for this police officer, huh?

1109304083.content: Besides, we're here to catch the baddies, aren't we?

1109304084.content: Really? You looked like you were enjoying it when I was right next to you.

1109304085.content: Don't tell me you're about to ghost me after that moment of intimacy, Admin...

1109304088.content: It all happens so fast, I crash into the ground before I realize what is happening.

1109304089.content: I hear a clang very close to me, and then sense Kuninotokotachi falling into me.

1109304094.content: Don't underestimate us Modifiers. I've long recovered.

1109304095.content: That was a pretty deep blade wound after all.

1109304096.content: And now you can't even see a scar, can you?

1109304097.content: Remember to thank Tsukuyomi and Buzenbo properly tomorrow.

1109304099.content: But why does it feel like I'm being nagged by a family member?

1109304101.content: ...I'm not sure how to answer that, Admin.

1109304102.content: Come to think of it, I've never really known what having "family" feels like.

1109304103.content: No, this is a rather novel experience for me, in fact...

1109304104.content: I've never been nagged before my entire life in the organization.

1109304105.content: But what about Tsukuyomi and Buzenbo? I'm sure that Buzenbo nags at you a lot.

1109304106.content: It doesn't quite feel the same. Tsukuyomi and Buzenbo are more like... my comrades-in-arms?

1109304107.content: But having someone like you, Admin, who's clearly so weak but nags so much, feels even closer somehow...

1109304108.content: What do you mean by "clearly so weak?!"

1109304109.content: Haha, isn't it the truth though? Just look at what happened just now! Had I not taken that hit for you, you'd be with Gaea by now, Admin.

1109304110.content: Well, thanks for saving my life, Kuninotokotachi. And all thanks to Gaea for not wanting me just yet.

1109304112.content: You know... Sounds like you don't have many good memories of Mumei.

1109304113.content: Yeah. After all, they're just a bunch of killers with no real home to speak of. Frankly, they're just tools in the Sasanami Five's toolbox. Well-trained tools, but tools nevertheless.

1109304114.content: For them, sentiment and goodwill toward others are things that only get in the way of their survival.

1109304115.content: But... I did have a very good friend there.

1109304116.content: Are they called "Yuzu" or something? I thought I heard you say that name.

1109304117.content: That's right. But don't tell anyone about this, please. Even Tsukuyomi doesn't know about Yuzu.

1109304118.content: And that's the person who managed to break out of the cordon and attack me?

1109304120.content: ...That explains why you got hurt. And why you placed your hand over my mouth and let them escape.

1109304121.content: Please just indulge me this time.

1109304122.content: Kuninotokotachi rises to her feet, smoothly peels off the armor on her body, then walks over to the floor-to-ceiling window. She sits down.

1109304123.content: I sense that the time for questions is over, though I believe that Kuninotokotachi will tell me more when the time is right.

1109304124.content: You know, we should really attend a festival together one day.

1109304125.content: I'll tell you then why I love going to festivals so much.

1109304128.content: Come sit with me. The moon looks beautiful tonight.

1109304129.content: Although I get the feeling that my lady ninja friend is once again up to no good, I walk over to her nevertheless.

1109304130.content: It's getting really late now, Admin.

1109304132.content: Are you still going back to Ain Soph tonight?

1109304135.content: I'm just a poor salaried worker after all.

1109304136.content: Salaried workers have to rest, too.

1109304137.content: I might be a bit silly at times, but I assure you that I take life very seriously.

1109304138.content: If things get too tough, it's a good idea to slow down a little and be good to yourself.

1109304139.content: I mean, isn't it great to be here looking at the moon with me right now?

1109304141.content: I foresee a mountain of work waiting for me when I get back to Aether Gazer HQ tomorrow.

1109304142.content: But just as I'm about to stand up, Kuninotokotachi gently tugs at my sleeve, as if something wicked is on her mind.

1109304143.content: And just like the last time, the lights go out all of a sudden.

1109304144.content: I find myself pressed against the window by the white-haired ninja in front of me, her hands gently pressing on my shoulders.

1109304145.content: Her face, lit by the moonlight outside, betrays the tiniest hint of a smile.

1109304146.content: She lifts my collar with her index finger, the tip of which then gently brushes against my neck.

1109304147.content: I forbid you to leave, Admin.

1109304148.content: And now, I have a new "assignment" for you tonight...

1109304149.content: I expect you to be hard at work till daybreak!

1107001001.content: After my work of visiting Xu Heng is done, I lie down in the grass amid the mountains for a rest. A crisp breeze blows by, rustling the bamboo leaves and lulling me into slumber...

1107001002.content: According to the map, the chest should be here.

1107001003.content: Could someone have beat me to it?

1107001004.content: Last time, it said in "Prime Codex" that there should be an automated defense array where the chest is, so I'd better proceed with caution... Huh?!

1107001005.content: I'm woken from my dream when someone steps on my arm and stumbles toward me.

1107001007.content: I open my eyes just in time to see her bracing herself as her Tenblaze comes right for me.

1107001012.content: Just as Jinwu swings Tenblaze as an afterthought, your head just happens to hurtle into Tenblaze. Your vision instantly goes dark.

1107001013.content: Just as Jinwu swings Tenblaze as an afterthought, you shift your body in the nick of time. In doing so, however, you twist your neck too far and collide with a gnarled tree. Your vision instantly goes dark.

1107001017.content: #{nickname}#, you're finally awake! Are you feeling any better?

1107001018.content: I just found somewhere else to sleep... I guess.

1107001019.content: Oh?! #{nickname}#, don't tell me you've been secretly practicing the Iron Skull Technique when I'm not around!

1107001021.content: That reminds me, it's been a long time since we last saw each other! Did you ever find Nian's master after Awakening Day?

1107001022.content: After I returned to Xu Heng, I defeated many Yaoguai underlings. Then, after several twists and turns, I finally found the person who could purify Nian!

1107001024.content: I performed just as well as Sun Chaser in "Prime Codex!"

1107001025.content: When did that character appear in "Prime Codex?"

1107001026.content: Sun Chaser appears in later issues as the protagonist's most important companion! Eh? You're a fan of "Prime Codex" too, #{nickname}#?

1107001027.content: I read all the manga you sent me before, I've just been too busy to ask for the sequels. Is that... a new poster for "Prime Codex" on the coffee table? Issue 21 is out already?

1107001028.content: Yeah! "Prime Codex" issue 21 is an anniversary special edition issue, I couldn't not get it! Apparently, rare merch will be given out after the signing event!

1107001029.content: Hold on, your face... is getting a little close. You can just bring the poster over.

1107001030.content: There's a pre-sale launch event on May 9th? That's tomorrow...

1107001031.content: Would you like to go with me, Administrator? It's very close to Ruomu Palace, and we can get an autograph from Star, the author!

1107001032.content: Elbows on the edge of the bed and her face cupped in her hands, her earnest eyes blink up at me.

1107001033.content: Do you have tickets for the event?

1107001034.content: Mm-hm, of course I do! But I only have one.

1107001037.content: But isn't money a little tight right now?

1107001039.content: Where did this chest come from? ...You know conjuration?

1107001040.content: Hehehe. This is my most crucial loot today—the "Prime Codex" mystery merch chest!

1107001041.content: According to official sources, there's a 1% chance of getting a ticket to the new issue signing event!

1107001043.content: 1%, 99%—as long as it's not 0%, the possibilities are endless!

1107001044.content: I guess you're not wrong... How is there that much stuff in there?

1107001045.content: A chibi figurine of the main character, "Huffy!"

1107001048.content: It's just like opening a blind box.

1107001052.content: Administrator, get a load of this!

1107001055.content: An all-you-can-eat voucher for two at "Prime Codex's" co-branded themed restaurant!

1107001061.content: It's a pre-sale launch event ticket!

1107001064.content: Even with just a 1% chance, you still got it. No way anyone's that lucky...

1107001066.content: Indeed, I'll have to say something to Star tomorrow.

1107001067.content: But Administrator—if we go tomorrow, we'll have to get in line around 4:00 AM!

1107001068.content: Looks like we don't have much time.

1107001069.content: I'm off to bed then! Don't forget to wake me up when it's time!

1107001071.content: A second later, Jinwu is fast asleep against the edge of the bed. I give her face a poke, but she just mumbles some slurred dream-babble. Not sure whether to laugh or cry, I gently place the blanket over her.

1107001073.content: I try to rouse Jinwu. She grabs onto my arm and mutters something incomprehensible. I lean in a little closer to her.

1107001078.content: Who's there? I, Huffy Jinwu, am here! Who dares disturb the peace in Gaea?!

1107001079.content: ...Huh? Oh! It's you, Administrator. Something about your face... looks off?

1107001080.content: Um, I just wanted to tell you that it's already 4:30 AM.

1107001081.content: Then we'd better get going! Oh, but wait—how did those bite marks get on your arm?

1107001082.content: It's 4:30 AM, and it's still dark out. We're hurriedly making our way to the "Prime Codex" issue 21 signing event site, but before we even get there, we see a long line of people stretching out along the street.

1107001084.content: It's actually not so bad this time. When the last issue of "Prime Codex" was released, I had to get in line all the way at the end of the street... Brrr, it sure is chilly!

1107001085.content: You haven't eaten anything yet, right, Administrator? Here, I'll share some of my bear cookies with you.

1107001086.content: Huh? When did you bring these?

1107001087.content: Hehe, when you've attended as many "Prime Codex" signing events as me, you learn a thing or two!

1107001088.content: As time inches along, the sky turns from dim and muddled to bright and soft, and store shutters large and small rise up like the morning sun.

1107001089.content: We've been standing in line for hours. I can barely feel my legs anymore.

1107001090.content: I still haven't eaten breakfast. I wouldn't have come if I'd known I'd be waiting for this long... Whoops! Sorry, did I step on your foot?

1107001091.content: Aah! It's fine. I heard there are barely any spots left anyway. Let's go, before I get heatstroke.

1107001092.content: The sun's out! Are you hot, Jinwu?

1107001093.content: Yeah, the sun feels great! I wonder how long until...

1107001094.content: We're at the entrance. Surely it won't be long now?

1107001095.content: Oooooh! It's almost our turn, Administrator!

1107001098.content: Haven't you been looking forward to this for a while? You should go first.

1107001099.content: But this is your first time! After waiting this long, you've gotta go first! Come on, now! Go, go, go!

1107001100.content: Good morning! "Huff huff—Can we repel the enemy outside the besieged city?"

1107001104.content: All signed, many thanks for your support.

1107001105.content: Completely bewildered, I emerge and recount my confusing exchange with Star to Jinwu. She thinks for a moment with her hand on her hip, then suddenly blinks.

1107001106.content: No, Administrator! You're supposed to say, "With the Yaoguai banished, we may return in peace!" It's the most famous line in issue 20!

1107001107.content: How do you... say that without missing a beat?

1107001108.content: Whoever's lucky enough to get the last copy at the signing event gets the chance to answer Star's special code! If they get it right, they can get the rare "Huffy Hula Hoop" merch! Huh? Hang on, does that mean...

1107001110.content: As soon as the words come out of my mouth, the event staff begin dispersing the crowd. Those who bought the manga cheerfully skip away, while those who didn't get their chance sigh listlessly as they leave. Facing Jinwu, who's still looking back, I decide to...

1107001112.content: Huh? No, no, you don't have to do that, Administrator. You keep it. I'll get my own copy later.

1107001113.content: But you earned this copy. You should have it.

1107001114.content: I'm just happy that we got to go out together!

1107001115.content: I can get a manga any time, but the same can't be said of seeing friends! ...Huh? Over there, is that...

1107001117.content: #{nickname}#, would you like some cotton candy?

1107001119.content: I am hungry, but it looks like it's surrounded by kids. Maybe we...

1107001120.content: Then let's be kids for a bit today!

1107001121.content: She smiles as she hands me the cotton candy. The glow of the twilight descends upon her like a troupe of frolicking fairies.

1107001122.content: I take the elevator back to the room. The noise of the endless traffic outside bursts into the empty room through the window. I pat the dust off my coat and sit vacantly in front of the chair. The grayness of the room tells me that life has once again begun its dull, relentless revolution. The only luster in the room seems to come from the pink cotton candy on the table.

1107001123.content: Suddenly, a ding from my phone breaks the silence and alerts me of an incoming message.

1107001124.content: "#{nickname}#, 'Prime Codex' is holding a new 'Yaoguai Hunt' event! The Yaoguai will appear in Gaea in different forms, such as signboards, stickers, hot air balloons, and even dolls! Wanna take part in the event together?"

1107002001.content: Greetings, passengers! Amid the jubilation that can be heard on board, our journey is now coming to an end. Train 8754 will soon be arriving at the final station...

1107002002.content: After finishing the day's work, I take the train back to the hotel. I accidentally overslept, and when we reach the terminal station, I emerge and let out a worn-out sigh. As the crowd behind me recedes into the distance, cool light pours over me from between the mountains, casting a long, lonely shadow from my feet.

1107002003.content: The frigid wind penetrates my bones through my flimsy clothing, and hunger hangs heavily in my stomach like a huge stone as the scene before my eyes flickers.

1107002004.content: I walk forward dejectedly for a while before abruptly losing my footing and hurtling from a precipice. I'm instantly swallowed up by darkness.

1107002005.content: Suddenly, a ding from my phone breaks the silence and alerts me of an incoming message.

1107002006.content: "Administrator! We've already gathered 80 Yaoguai clues! We're way in the lead in the rankings! Just one more until we get the final prize!"

1107002013.content: I was so worried about you!

1107002015.content: I was just setting up the "Huffy Fixed Heaven Array" when I heard a bang! Then, out of nowhere, you fell from the sky and landed smack dab in the middle of it...

1107002016.content: I'm so hungry I feel delirious... I can't believe I just fell like that.

1107002017.content: Here, have some skewers and water!

1107002019.content: Hehe, looks like what Xihe said was right.

1107002021.content: Xihe said that as long as you're thinking about someone, they'll appear! I was just thinking about—

1107002024.content: I'm fine, you... What were you doing before I arrived? I think I heard you say something about a "Huffy Fixed Heaven Array?"

1107002025.content: Based on the information I found online, I deduced that the clue for the last Yaoguai is nearby!

1107002026.content: So, I set up camp here and have been waiting for the Yaoguai to appear! I was thinking and thinking, and then...

1107002027.content: Sure enough, I sensed the presence of a Yaoguai!

1107002028.content: Uh, so, you mean you were actually thinking about the Yaoguai this whole time?

1107002029.content: Yeah! According to official sources, the 81st Yaoguai appears at random in Xu Heng. But based on what happens in "Prime Codex" issue 21, I surmised that recreating the Huffy Fixed Heaven Array here could summon the Yaoguai!

1107002031.content: Hm? Were you going to say something, #{nickname}#?

1107002032.content: No, it's nothing. Did you make this fire? And are those... my clothes hanging over it?

1107002033.content: Yup! When you fell, you rolled into the river and your clothes got all wet. I happened to pack the Sun Chaser costume in my bag, so I changed your clothes for you! What do you think? Does it fit?

1107002035.content: Relax, I didn't touch anything in your pockets!

1107002036.content: Um... I don't think my pockets are the issue here...

1107002037.content: Suddenly, a deafening roar sounds in the distance. Jinwu swiftly rises, Tenblaze glinting in her hands under the sunlight.

1107002038.content: I had a feeling that the last Yaoguai would turn up nearby! Now we just need to find it, and first place is as good as ours!

1107002039.content: You wait here, Administrator. I'll be back as soon as I find that Yaoguai.

1107002040.content: These mountain paths are so craggy, are you sure you don't want me to come with you?

1107002041.content: I'll be fine on my own! I know this terrain very well...

1107002042.content: Just as Jinwu says this, she runs back, stumbles, then disappears into the heat shimmer with a thump. I run over to where I heard her scream and see a gloomy, intricate-looking cavern system.

1107002046.content: I've fallen into a dreadful place... It's pitch-black, and the smell down here is definitely not normal!

1107002047.content: There are too many entrances into this cave. I can't tell where you are.

1107002048.content: I'm not getting any signal down here, so I'm not sure where I am exactly either, but... I can hear wind coming in from the right...

1107002049.content: It's too dark in here. I can't get my bearings! I need to find a light source...

1107002050.content: I can see some light! Let me think for a bit so I can work out what direction I'm in.

1107002051.content: I can't see you. Can you describe your surroundings a little?

1107002052.content: There's an odd-looking stalactite here. It looks like an upside-down duck!

1107002053.content: I'm coming down, I can see a big stalactite—Huh? What? An upside-down duck?

1107002054.content: Can you give me a little more detail? Or a direction? I'm currently southeast.

1107002055.content: Hm, I see. I'm northwest right now. Wait there a minute, #{nickname}#. I'm coming to meet you!

1107002058.content: Phew, it was just a tree branch...

1107002059.content: Don't worry, I'm headed in your direction now. I'm marking the rocks on my way so that we can easily find the exit.

1107002060.content: Okay! I'm walking towards you now, #{nickname}#.

1107002065.content: I can feel the air getting wetter as I make my way further into the cave. Descending deeper with my hand against the rocky wall, I suddenly slip and tumble uncontrollably to the cave floor.

1107002069.content: It's okay, it's just a scratch. Huh? Blood?

1107002070.content: Let me help you with that.

1107002071.content: She nimbly rips the hem from her skirt and gets to work tying the yellowish cloth around my forehead. Her fingertips gently glide across my cheeks, leaving behind a faint fragrance.

1107002074.content: Seems like you're pretty good at dressing wounds.

1107002075.content: To safeguard peace in Gaea, I often get into scraps with Yaoguai goons that turn bloody. After dressing my own wounds so many times, I eventually got pretty good at it!

1107002076.content: #{nickname}#, your face... seems a little hot. Are you not feeling well?

1107002079.content: It's alright, I just need to sit down for a little.

1107002081.content: Jinwu sits next to me, listlessly humming a tune from Xu Heng while fiddling with the ends of her hair. She suddenly looks at me, and I can't help but shift my gaze straight ahead.

1107002082.content: Huh? Is that your Tenblaze standing there up ahead?

1107002083.content: Yep! I used Tenblaze's shadow to work out the direction of the sun!

1107002084.content: Is it just me, or are you... really good at wilderness survival?

1107002085.content: Hehe, I watched a lot of wilderness survival programs before I came down from the mountain, so I guess you could say I was well-prepared!

1107002086.content: Descending from the mountain and outdoor survival... I can't tell whether your skill points allocation is lopsided or not...

1107002087.content: #{nickname}#, did you hear a spooky sound just now?

1107002088.content: I did, it's the same as the one I heard when we were on the mountain.

1107002091.content: I'm okay now, but hang on...

1107002092.content: Look over there, up ahead. Something doesn't seem right.

1107002093.content: There's a group of black things flying right towards us?!

1107003002.content: They must have been drawn over by the scent of my blood.

1107003005.content: Puny bats, how dare you try and snack on a wounded person right in front of me! Take this—Samādhi Fireflow!

1107003006.content: I feel like even I'm gonna get cooked...

1107003007.content: Heh, that's what happens when you underestimate me... #{nickname}#, do you need to rest a little while longer?

1107003011.content: There's blood coming from your wound.

1107003012.content: She slowly fixes her gaze on me, her eyes glinting with concern.

1107003013.content: That sound is getting closer and closer. We should go investigate it. If it's a Visbane, I think...

1107003014.content: Right, I'm walking in front this time!

1107003015.content: Have you noticed, #{nickname}#? This is a lot like a scene in "Prime Codex!"

1107003016.content: I remember there was a storyline in "Prime Codex" where Huffy and Sun Chaser fall into a cave...

1107003017.content: Suddenly, she stops and solemnly places her hands on my shoulders. When our eyes meet, I see my slightly apprehensive expression reflected in her bright eyes.

1107003019.content: From this day forward, let's always fight side by side! You'll have no stronger force backing you!

1107003020.content: Haven't... we always fought side by side?

1107003021.content: Aw, come on, #{nickname}#! That's a line from "Prime Codex!" I used to always want that kind of relationship!

1107003025.content: That doesn't seem very like you.

1107003026.content: That's because I've already met a companion just like in "Prime Codex"—someone who has my back while I have theirs, through thick and thin!

1107003027.content: Hehe, actually... Master once said to me that I would meet my "destiny" on my journey! I never imagined I would really meet them!

1107003029.content: I don't think I've ever heard you mention them before.

1107003032.content: Who better to call my "destiny" than you? I can't think of anyone!

1107003033.content: It's even more fitting now that you're wearing the Sun Chaser costume! Wait a second... Haven't we been here before?

1107003034.content: You're right, we just passed through here.

1107003035.content: We've been following the marks I made earlier ever since we climbed up from the lower level. Yet somehow, we've ended up right back where we started.

1107003037.content: It's easy to lose your sense of direction after being in a dark place for so long.

1107003038.content: If only I could turn on my flashlight... But my phone's dead.

1107003042.content: You can use Tenblaze as a torch?

1107003043.content: Hehe, Tenblaze isn't just there for me in battle, but in life, too!

1107003044.content: The darkness of the cavern now dissipated by the fire's light, the details of our surroundings gradually come into view, and my thinking grows clearer along with it.

1107003045.content: Phew, I've finally got my bearings back. We should be heading left next.

1107003047.content: Is that the upside-down duck-looking stalactite you mentioned before?

1107003048.content: Yes! Though, now I think it looks more like an upside-down pigeon...

1107003049.content: We'll have to climb up from here... No, wait, it'll be too slippery with all that moss on the rocks. There's nowhere to get a good grip.

1107003051.content: Huh? When did you get up there?

1107003052.content: I found a tree trunk growing out of a crack in the rock on one side, and I got up that way!

1107003054.content: Thank you... Whoops, sorry, I stepped on you.

1107003055.content: It's fine! But what's this brook doing here? I wasn't expecting that.

1107003056.content: Also, #{nickname}#... isn't this exit too high up? How did you get down then?

1107003057.content: I used a vine, but it snapped as I was sliding down. Looking at how long it is now... I think we'd need a ladder to reach it.

1107003058.content: Jinwu, can you check your phone to see if you're getting a signal?

1107003059.content: Let me see... It's weak, but I am getting one. I sent a message requesting help, but it didn't go through.

1107003061.content: I'll help you up first to see if you can reach it.

1107003064.content: I didn't mean hang on me... What are you, a koala?

1107003066.content: Can you reach it standing on my shoulders?

1107003067.content: Mm-hm! I've got it. But this vine looks weird, I've never seen one like it before...

1107003070.content: The vine snaps in Jinwu's hand, and she falls backward with a thud. I instinctively go to catch her, and—sploosh! The two of us fall into the brook.

1107003072.content: Maybe you could get off me first...

1107003075.content: Let's give it a few more tries while we still can.

1107003076.content: Jinwu nods her head dutifully. We try a few more times, only to discover that if the vines aren't thorny, they're too thin. The repeated failures start to put a downer on things.
