1107003077.content: I've tried sending out multiple SOS messages, but they either get stuck sending or don't send at all. This is getting difficult.

1107003081.content: Based on my many years of wilderness survival experience, these are definitely fresh, tasty mushrooms that we can cook with!

1107003082.content: Aren't you being a little too optimistic? You're not the teeniest bit worried that we won't get out of here?

1107003084.content: We've tried all the usual methods, and now it's time for a midway rest.

1107003085.content: Besides, you're not looking too good, and we need a new plan... and we'll only be able to figure out what that new plan is when we're back at 100%!

1107003086.content: Also, it's dinner time now! So, we have to eat something, obviously!

1107003087.content: I barely blinked, and... you've already made a fire.

1107003088.content: Heh, food comes first! Here, take a skewer...

1107003092.content: Soon we'll be able to see a sky full of stars!

1107003093.content: Stars? I usually never notice them... Huh? What are you drawing with Tenblaze?

1107003094.content: The array to summon the 81st Yaoguai! I spent ages studying how to do it on all the major websites!

1107003095.content: You're already getting esoteric on me? Uh, wait, actually... is that Astral Arcanum?

1107003096.content: This pattern... Is that the same array from when I fell down the mountain?

1107003099.content: This mushroom skewer is really good.

1107003101.content: Look, Administrator! Up in the sky!

1107003103.content: What's that flying up in the air?

1107004001.content: A Yaoguai? It looks... like an airship?

1107004003.content: I remember you saying before that you collected 80, now we've got them all.

1107004004.content: But my phone's not getting any signal, I can't upload a picture of it... Aw...

1107004005.content: Our top priority is still finding a way out of this cave.

1107004007.content: It seems like... the Yaoguai is flying down towards us?

1107004008.content: It doesn't just "seem like" it is...

1107004009.content: I can't believe your Huffy Fixed Heaven Array actually summoned the Yaoguai... Your hard work paid off after all...

1107004010.content: As the roaring sound draws closer, the airship with the image of a Yaoguai on it lands right next to the mouth of the cave. A rope comes wiggling down, followed by a person holding a camera on their shoulder.

1107004011.content: Hello, everyone! I'm finally getting up close and personal with this Huffy Fixed Heaven Array, and I couldn't be more excited! What a heartfelt gift from a fan on the 21-week anniversary of "Prime Codex!"

1107004012.content: Wow! Are you also a "Prime Codex" fan?

1107004014.content: Holy cow! Did you guys make this array?

1107004016.content: Whoops, sorry! I'll move my lens back.

1107004018.content: Hey, guys! I'm your host of the "Huffy's Adventure!" I'm coming to all of you watching in Xu Heng live from the Yaoguai Hunt event! Say "hi" to everyone, you two!

1107004019.content: Hi, everyone! Uh, wait a sec...

1107004020.content: You're livestreaming to all of Xu Heng right now?

1107004022.content: This is an exclusive "Prime Codex" variety show—"Huffy's Adventure!" This is so exciting, #{nickname}#!

1107004023.content: I know, please stop bouncing all over me...

1107004024.content: Let's get a selfie! One, two, three... Cheese!

1107004025.content: And now I've been photographed... If Ver and the others see this...

1107004027.content: This is a lucky viewer gift from us at "Huffy's Adventure," please accept it!

1107004028.content: Is this the rare merch from the "Prime Codex" issue 21 signing event—the Huffy Hula Hoop?

1107004029.content: Why is that name so hard to say...

1107004030.content: #{nickname}#, we got it! The lucky gift from the issue 21 signing event!

1107004031.content: Many thanks to you two for sending us this "Prime Codex" blessing! As for you all watching at home, we're off to our next stop...

1107004033.content: Excuse me, but could we use your rope to get out of here?

1107004035.content: I climb up the rope first. As it wobbles precariously, I look back at Jinwu...

1107004036.content: Phew, we're finally getting out of here! Jinwu, give me your hand.

1107004038.content: Oh, wow! It looks like you guys have been stuck here for a while! There's one thing I find strange, though—even if you were preparing this surprise, surely you wouldn't need to come here to do it?

1107004039.content: I actually wanted to take part in the Yaoguai Hunt! But I accidentally fell into this cave in the middle of it...

1107004040.content: Oh, so that's what happened... Sounds absolutely thrilling! Good thing you two are okay. How many have you collected so far?

1107004042.content: What? 80! Could you be the legendary Sun Chaser's Sidekicks in first place?

1107004043.content: Sun Chaser's Sidekicks? Jinwu, did you change our team name to something weird when I wasn't paying attention...?

1107004046.content: Phew, good thing you grabbed the Huffy Hullabaloo. Otherwise...

1107004047.content: Thank you, #{nickname}#! But it's actually called the Huffy Hula Hoop!

1107004048.content: They should really come up with a less clunky name...

1107004051.content: Hey, guys! It's already time for our Yaoguai Hunt half-time count! Let's flip on the big screen and get a look at the current rankings, shall we?

1107004052.content: You set that up fast. Huh? It's a virtual screen, and it's remote?

1107004053.content: Let's once again invite Star to click on the big screen!

1107004054.content: Looking at this flashing screen is making me so anxious, my heart's pounding out of my chest... No one's gotten all 81 Yaoguai yet, right?

1107004055.content: I doubt we'll be that unlucky. Think about it, we even got the entry ticket with nothing but a 1% chance of success, so...

1107004056.content: There it is! That smooth background track means that someone's collected all 81 Yaoguai!

1107004058.content: Should I not have said anything?

1107004061.content: The Sun Chaser's Sidekicks! Please join me in congratulating them!

1107004064.content: Oooooh! We must have gotten signal again after getting out of the cave!

1107004066.content: What an exhilarating moment! The Sun Chaser's Sidekicks are actually here with us right now! Let's get a good look at our two buddies!

1107004067.content: Dude, are you trying to film my pores?

1107004070.content: I know, I know! Please stop spinning me... at this speed...

1107004072.content:
I slowly open my eyes and am greeted by a rich aroma wafting towards me.
I see a huge bookcase in front of me stacked full of shonen manga with various covers and merch, and there's a "Prime Codex" poster taped to the wall. I reach for the photo at the head of the bed...

1107004073.content: Huh? This photo looks like... Jinwu when she was little?

1107004074.content: Ah! You weren't supposed to see that, #{nickname}#...

1107004075.content: Whoa, when did you come in? Alright, alright, here, you can have the photo.

1107004076.content: Here, I brought you some Eight Treasures Congee.

1107004077.content: Thank you, it's delicious... But is that really what you looked like when you were little?

1107004078.content: #{nickname}#! I... I don't wanna talk about it.

1107004079.content: Whoa, Jinwu, why are your ears so red?

1107004080.content: They're not... It's... It's just the red lighting!

1107004081.content: Um... There's actually something I wanted to talk to you about, #{nickname}#...

1107004083.content: Our team won the prize, right? I was thinking about the prize money...

1107004084.content: You did the majority of the work. That prize money is yours.

1107004085.content: I can't accept that! You're my most important companion after all, #{nickname}#! If I were to do something with it, I'd need you to agree to it first!

1107004086.content: From your tone, it sounds like you'd like to make some sort of investment?

1107004088.content: We could give the money to the Xu Heng Orphanage.

1107004089.content: It'll be winter soon, so I was thinking we could purchase a heating unit for them...

1107004091.content: But if there was something else you wanted to do with it, #{nickname}#, that's fine too, of course...

1107004092.content: Huh? You're okay with my idea?

1107004094.content: That's the Sun Chaser I know! The best companion there is!

1107004096.content: That reminds me, I wanted to tell you that this Yaoguai Hunt prize also comes with two 7-day Xu Heng Wonders gift certificates! Food and accommodation included!

1107004097.content: If you have time, let's go together!

1107004099.content: I may still have some work to take care of.

1107004100.content: Oh... that's okay. Next time then...

1107004101.content: But I'm taking some time off towards the end of next month. Let's go then.

1107004103.content: Hey... Get off me... Were you a koala in your last life or something?

1107004105.content: As night falls, our exciting adventure comes to an end. But our story is only just beginning...

1106701001.content: A breeze blew through the spacious streets, bringing with it a familiar scent of lily of the valley.

1106701002.content: It'd been a while since I was last in Omorfies. On the telephone, Shu went over the mission with me again.

1106701003.content: I reiterate, we must get our hands on the custom artwork no later than two weeks from now.

1106701004.content: All this just to pick up a piece of art?

1106701005.content: Admin, this is for the promotional event that Tyr is organizing. We have to take it seriously. Aether Gazer's image is on the line.

1106701006.content: Tyr asked Hades to commission this piece from a famous artist. I've heard this artist is quite particular. If you don't show up in person to pick up your artwork, they consider it a great offense.

1106701007.content: What kind of egomaniac are we dealing with here?

1106701008.content: Please don't say that when you meet them, Admin.

1106701010.content: As I got off the call, I suddenly noticed two little girls staring at me. I immediately recognized them by their distinctive maid outfits.

1106701012.content: I think you're in trouble this time, Admin.

1106701013.content: I would have to agree with you, Leuce.

1106701015.content: Your job is to welcome the guest. What's all this prattle?

1106701016.content: Hades appeared behind Leuce and Mintha, like a parent who had arrived just in time to scold a misbehaving child. I could see her usual laidback smile on her face.

1106701017.content: I was just on my way to see you.

1106701018.content: Ah, but you're the guest here. Shu told me you were coming.

1106701019.content: The artist's studio is right around the corner. I can take you there now.

1106701020.content: Um... I have a few questions...

1106701021.content: I'm guessing they're about our artist?

1106701022.content: That's right! I hear that they're... rather particular. I suppose I have to be on my best behavior with them?

1106701024.content: Hades pursed her lips, as if she were stifling a chuckle. It seemed that she'd suddenly recalled an incident that she couldn't speak about.

1106701025.content: That artist can seem rather aloof, yes. But I can offer you a few tips if you'd like, Admin.

1106701027.content: First of all, don't try to contradict what he says, unless you are ready for a scathing comeback.

1106701029.content: Also, he's a little... lax about his personal grooming. But that's most artists for you. Just ignore it.

1106701031.content: Finally, keep all commentary on sculpture to yourself when you're with him.

1106701033.content: A familiar face suddenly appeared in my mind's eye. It was a face that matched Hades' description, and explained Shu's concerns, even.

1106701035.content: Ah. Looks like I can skip the introductions.

1106701036.content: I followed Hades to Oceanus' studio, where I saw the man himself for the first time in a long while.

1106701037.content: Just like when we first met in Omorfies, Oceanus hardly stirred when his guests arrived. Instead, he continued staring at a half-carved piece of stone in front of him.

1106701038.content: The ground around him was littered with broken stone. It was obvious that our sculptor had not one, but several pieces of work that did not pass muster with him.

1106701039.content: However, upon closer inspection, I noticed that his top was buttoned wrong, and that there were takeout boxes strewn across the table near his workbench. It was hard to imagine how such a slovenly person could have such exacting standards.

1106701041.content: It's rude to disturb artists who are deep in their work. Don't you understand something as simple as this, oh visitor from Ain Soph?

1106701042.content: Is that any way to speak to paying customers...?

1106701043.content: Hades silenced me with a look, and I had no choice but to try out her first tip.

1106701044.content: I remember this chunk of stone looking exactly the same yesterday, so I don't think you can blame your lack of progress on having visitors...

1106701045.content: Unlike certain other people who just sit on their hands all day, at least I'm actually making some artistic progress.

1106701046.content: Quite the tongue you have on you.

1106701047.content: Let's save the bickering for the next time we have tea. The Administrator would like to talk business with you today.

1106701048.content: I always remember the things I agree to do.

1106701049.content: Oceanus pointed to his work schedule, which was on a wall.

1106701050.content: I squinted my eyes and searched the schedule for a long time before I found the Aether Gazer job at the end of what was an extremely long list of tasks.

1106701051.content: Could I ask how long it takes for you to create a sculpture, Oceanus?

1106701052.content: Here's a hint: he's been staring at this piece of stone for almost a week now.

1106701053.content: I won't make my deadline then!

1106701054.content: Do you think it'd be possible to bring forward the Aether Gazer project? It'd be great if you could deliver the finished product within the next two weeks...

1106701055.content: What do you think I am? An assembly-line worker?!

1106701057.content: Hades, what about the thing I asked you to do?

1106701059.content: A word with you please, Admin.

1106701060.content: Hades took me aside and looked at me with a strange expression on her face.

1106701061.content: Oceanus has been trying to create his magnum opus lately. But as you can see, Admin, he's run into a bit of artist's block, if you will.

1106701063.content: Well, seeing how the Aether Gazer job is so low on his list... Looks like Shu is going to be disappointed.

1106701066.content: My old friend here is a profoundly gifted sculptor. When things are going smoothly for him, he can even complete over a dozen sculptures in a matter of a few days. So I think what we need to do now is find a way to get him "unstuck."

1106701067.content: Okay, I'm listening. What should we do?

1106701068.content: Well, first we should talk about what sent Oceanus into this spiral. Not long ago, Enlil was sent abroad to be the curator for an art exhibition, and it'll be quite some time before he'll be back.

1106701070.content: It all dawned on me then. On my previous trip to Omorfies, Enlil had told me that Oceanus had rather "specific needs" in his daily life.

1106701071.content: The misbuttoned shirt, the garbage that was just lying around... Everything suddenly made sense.

1106701072.content: He wasn't this bad before Director Everard introduced Enlil to him.

1106701073.content: And now, after spending all this time with Enlil, he can't even do his day job right unless Enlil's around... Tsk.

1106701074.content: So... do we try to get Enlil back, then?

1106701075.content: Absolutely not. This trip is a rare learning opportunity for him.

1106701077.content: The simplest way is to get someone to stand in for Enlil as Oceanus' housekeeper... And you'll be here for the next two weeks and have nothing on hand until you take delivery of the artwork, am I right Admin?

1106701078.content: It was at that moment I understood the odd look on Hades' face.

1106701079.content: You want me to be Oceanus' housekeeper? You should know better than me how challenging that job is.

1106701080.content: Of course. I agreed to find him a stand-in to repay a favor. I've been searching fruitlessly for the past two weeks. It's a real headache.

1106701081.content: And so you're just gonna drop this hot potato in my lap?

1106701082.content: Oh, don't say that. You want to get your artwork as soon as possible too, don't you Administrator?

1106701084.content: I immediately recalled Shu's serious face, and hesitated for a moment. But there was something in Hades' smile that made me do a double take.

1106701085.content: Hades, did you commission the Aether Gazer job after you promised Oceanus that you'd find him a housekeeper?

1106701087.content: You planned all of this, didn't you? So that I would help you repay your debt.

1106701088.content: I knew the Administrator would find out.

1106701089.content: I knew you were right, Leuce.

1106701090.content: So, I have no choice but to be Oceanus' stand-in housekeeper if I want him to get his head on straight and complete my task, is that right?

1106701091.content: Come on, Administrator. Really, you ought to be thanking me for persuading an artist like Oceanus to create artwork for you...

1106701092.content: Besides, I don't think you have enough time to get another artist now.

1106701093.content: Hades flashed a smile that was impossible to refuse.

1106701095.content: You're a responsible one indeed, Administrator!

1106701097.content: Don't be so glum. You just need to learn the right ways to deal with this curmudgeon. I can give you some tips.

1106701099.content: First: Don't be afraid to talk back. Do not fear his acid tongue.

1106701100.content: Second: Don't let him get away with not taking care of himself.

1106701101.content: Third: Speak your mind when it comes to art. He may mock you, but you must not show any weakness.

1106701102.content: Aren't these... the total opposite of the "tips" you gave me earlier?

1106701103.content: Of course! That's because you aren't just a guest anymore, you're going to be his housekeeper.

1106701104.content: If I follow these three tips of yours... Are you trying to make my life miserable or his?

1106701105.content: Well, that depends on which one of you wins.

1106701106.content: After some discussion with Oceanus, Hades left. I was now alone with Oceanus in his studio.

1106701108.content: Oceanus suddenly took out a little booklet and gave it to me.

1106701110.content: Can't you read the title on the cover?

1106701111.content: I looked down, and the cover read, "Housekeeper's Handbook." Judging from the elegant handwriting, it was obviously the work of Enlil.

1106701112.content: I opened the booklet to find myself looking at a wall of text, and I began to regret my decision.

1106702001.content: I reluctantly crawled out of bed after Enlil's alarm went off for the second time. I was on my way to the bathroom when I encountered Oceanus, who stood in my way.

1106702003.content: I... I would really like to know why Enlil set the alarm for so early. It's a good half an hour earlier than when most people get up.

1106702004.content: Oceanus looked at me, expressionless, as if I had just asked a dumb question.

1106702005.content: To an artist who expends a lot of their energy on artistic creation, a nutritious and delicious breakfast is essential.

1106702006.content: So you want me to make breakfast for you? You could just say that, you know.

1106702008.content: Oceanus turned around and walked into the studio as soon as he was done speaking to me. I hesitated for a moment, then suddenly remembered Enlil's handbook, and hurried to the kitchen.

1106702009.content: I brought breakfast to the table after hastily preparing it according to the instructions in the handbook. It was also then that Oceanus came to the table, his misbuttoned shirt visible from a mile away.

1106702010.content: The nerve-wracking delivery process finally began. Oceanus first cut off a piece of the omelet, then put it into his mouth.

1106702012.content: Please do not waste ingredients like this.

1106702013.content: Hey. Surely it can't be that bad?

1106702014.content: Oceanus took a sip of the warm milk.

1106702015.content: Do you think that heating up milk is just like boiling water?

1106702016.content: But I prepared the milk according to the instructions in the handbook!

1106702017.content: Oceanus took no heed of my explanation. He gently wiped his mouth with a napkin, and ended the meal that had not yet even begun.

1106702019.content: Why don't you try cooking for yourself before you judge my culinary skills...

1106702020.content: Oceanus suddenly stood up and walked straight into his studio.

1106702022.content: A moment later, Oceanus walked out of his studio again, and looked at me sternly.

1106702023.content: It's been some time since the plants outside were pruned. The very sight of them is severely cramping my creative impulse. Shouldn't you have noticed that by now, housekeeper?

1106702025.content: But I bit my tongue in the end.

1106702026.content: Let me get this straight: are you telling me things like that really affect your creative process?

1106702027.content: That's exactly what I'm telling you. Now, you'll only be wasting more of my time that could otherwise be spent working if you keep dragging your feet.

1106702029.content: I found myself a pair of pruning shears and a ladder, and started gardening for the first time in my life.

1106702030.content: I plunged myself into the job after a cursory glance at the instructions in the handbook, eventually producing a result that looked pretty good to my eyes.

1106702031.content: Oceanus was already standing in front of the window, seemingly ready to inspect the results of my work. His placid face was obscured by the shadows cast by the plants, and still showed no expression.

1106702033.content: Hey. I spent quite a lot of time on this! At least tell me why you've failed me, oh great artist!

1106702034.content: Hmph. Do housekeepers know nothing but how to argue these days?

1106702035.content: Oceanus drew the curtains closed right after this proclamation, as if to hide my unsatisfactory work from his sight.

1106702036.content: Although I'd prepared myself mentally a bit before taking the role as his housekeeper, I now understood more clearly why Oceanus had trouble hiring one.

1106702037.content: I spent the rest of the morning doing boring housework. Then, just before midday, Oceanus suddenly emerged from his studio and broke the silence.

1106702038.content: Do you know how to drive a horse-drawn carriage?

1106702039.content: Is that part of a housekeeper's required skillset, too?

1106702040.content: But of course, I soon found myself in the driver's seat of a carriage, because it turned out that the handbook did contain instructions on how to drive one.

1106702042.content: We're going to the stone market in the east of the city.

1106702043.content: Really? Are you finally going to resume your work?

1106702044.content: Why else would I need to buy stone? To build a wall?

1106702045.content: Why did I even bother asking...

1106702046.content: It was only after I nervously took hold of the reins that I suddenly realized I had a very serious problem on my hands.

1106702047.content: Surely... you can't learn to drive a carriage simply by reading a handbook...?

1106702048.content: And who takes horse-drawn carriages these days, anyway?! Why couldn't we have just taken a taxi?

1106702050.content: Yes, you know, the kind you can call these days using a mobile app.

1106702052.content: Don't tell me you... have no idea how to use modern means of transport?

1106702053.content: I must remind you that you've already wasted a good half-hour of my time.

1106702055.content: I tentatively tugged at the reins to get the horses to start moving.

1106702056.content: However, I soon learned that I couldn't control the steering as I wished. So, instead of merging into the next lane, the horses ended up trotting across the road and stopping in front of a grocer's to snack on the fruit and vegetables placed outside. Needless to say, this caused several collisions along the way.

1106702057.content: Your task was not to feed the horses.

1106702058.content: That comment isn't exactly the most helpful at this moment!

1106702059.content: The drivers involved in the collision, the grocer, and even frightened passers-by gathered around to berate the reckless carriage driver—that is, me.

1106702060.content: Oceanus sat nonchalantly in the carriage, as if he was not involved at all.

1106702063.content: That's right. You've given me a fail three times. What now? Are you gonna fire me, oh great artist?

1106702064.content: Surely you don't think there's someone else out there who's willing to be your housekeeper, do you?

1106702067.content: Now I get why Enlil went to that exhibition! It was to get away from you!

1106702068.content: The comment came out of me before I realized what I was saying. However, as I looked back over the preceding half-day, I became increasingly convinced I was right.

1106702069.content: In fact, I bet only someone like Enlil would be able to put up with being your housekeeper for as long as he did!

1106702070.content: As soon as I said it, I felt a tinge of regret. No matter how aggravating Oceanus might be, it was much too harsh.

1106702071.content: However, Oceanus, who always had a sharp tongue, did not bite back. Instead, he got out of the carriage and started addressing the agitated crowd.

1106702073.content: I'll pay for all the damage caused. Please, let us pass for now.

1106702074.content: Of course, Senator. No problem at all!

1106702075.content: After smoothing things over with his personal prestige, Oceanus looked over to me.

1106702076.content: You can walk home. I'll let you know about your employment later.

1106702077.content: Looks like he's given up on my carriage-driving skills entirely...

1106702078.content: Now that I no longer had to go to the stone materials market, I returned to Oceanus' residence, where with much resignation I started on the simplest housekeeping task again: cleaning the rooms.

1106702079.content: Upon his return, Oceanus sat in his studio and stared at the stone with an empty expression on his face. I thought for a while, and finally decided to call Hades.

1106702080.content: I give up. Could we try to get someone else to do the commission? I don't think we need someone this famous.

1106702081.content: Are you giving up on the first day? That's a little disappointing, Administrator.

1106702082.content: He's "failed" me three times in a row now. He probably hates me. Staying on will just be a waste of time...

1106702083.content: Administrator, don't take that curmudgeon's unforgiving words to heart. He's a real stickler for rules. If you've been failed three times in a row, it only means that you didn't meet his standards, not that he has anything against you.

1106702084.content: But who in the world could meet his "standards"...? Besides, he probably won't want to keep me after what I said.

1106702086.content: I told him Enlil left to get away from him.

1106702087.content: Haha! Looks like... you haven't done your research about your subject, Administrator.

1106702089.content: Take a look at the pile of letters in the hall when you clean the rooms. There's something you need to see.

1106702090.content: I walked down the stairs, feeling rather unsure about what Hades just said. I found a pile of correspondence on the table in the center of the hall. Among the letters was a reply from Stellaris Academy.

1106702091.content: "...the Academy is in agreement with your suggestion, and will hence formally appoint Enlil as exhibition curator..."

1106702092.content: What?! Oceanus was the one who arranged Enlil's job?

1106702093.content: You should go have a chat with him one-on-one. It's the best way for you to understand him better.

1106702095.content: Administrator, remember the three tips I gave you. Always be proactive in your dealings with him, even if that means a potential confrontation.

1106702096.content: And so, with much trepidation and some confusion, I entered Oceanus' studio with the letter in hand.

1106702097.content: Are you done cleaning the rooms already? Do you need me to tell you that the assessment criteria for room cleanliness have nothing to do with speed?

1106702098.content: Were you the one who arranged for Enlil to curate the exhibition?

1106702099.content: Housekeeping duties do not include the reading of the employer's correspondence, I believe.

1106702100.content: However, the housekeeper's duties do include tidying up the mail, and it so happened that the letter was left there after being opened. It appears that the employer has a bad habit when it comes to the handling of his personal mail.

1106702101.content: If arguing with the employer were part of the housekeeper's responsibilities, I'd be more than happy to give you a passing grade.

1106702102.content: It's just that the housekeeper appears to be slightly better than the employer in this respect. After all, the employer is so lacking in communication skills that he doesn't even dare to explicitly express his concern for his juniors.

1106702103.content: "Concern for..."? What makes you say that?

1106702104.content: Enlil is more than qualified for this job, and everything was done by the book. You talk as if I engaged in some backdoor dealings to make the appointment happen.

1106702105.content: Oceanus remained indifferent and serious, as if he'd not made a conscious decision to help Enlil at the price of his own ease and comfort, but simply did what was natural and "by the book."

1106702106.content: His attitude made me feel inexplicably ashamed for coming with the specific intention of arguing with him.

1106702107.content: Seems that I did really misunderstand you... I'm sorry for what I said before.

1106702110.content: With perhaps courage that I'd just gleaned from the preceding conversation, I became determined to make full use of Hades' advice.

1106702111.content: (Clears throat) Mr. Oceanus, I hereby apply to re-take the housekeeping challenges that I failed.

1106702112.content: You did so badly the first time around. Why should I give you another chance?

1106702113.content: I took another look at Enlil's handbook, and discovered that I missed out on a number of details previously.

1106702114.content: For example, for the omelet, I should've made sure that the salt was well stirred into the beaten egg. Just weighing out the salt and throwing it onto the egg in the pan was not enough. And I should've heated up the milk in advance so that it'd have cooled to the right temperature by the time it was served at the table.

1106702115.content: Enlil also wrote that the plants close to the studio windows have to be pruned to allow light to fully enter the studio space, unimpeded, for you to do your work...

1106702116.content: I don't think you were trying to make my life difficult on purpose. I truly believe I can meet your standards if I put my mind to it.

1106702118.content: This time, I finally saw a slight change in Oceanus' indifferent expression, though it soon disappeared.

1106702119.content: That's a pretty good summary. But a fail is a fail.

1106702120.content: You're right. It's true that a broken statue cannot be put together again. But that doesn't mean you should never work on another piece of stone.

1106702122.content: Oceanus was about to speak, and then stopped himself. It seemed that he wasn't expecting such a strong pushback, and I could already see in his eyes that he agreed with what I just said.

1106702123.content: Well, I'll give your appeal a pass at the very least, Administrator.

1106702124.content: But I'll reserve judgment until you can actually do what you say.

1106702125.content: I'll take that as a yes. Good night, Mr. Oceanus.

1106702126.content: I bowed respectfully and closed the door behind me. Oceanus stood silently where he was, but made no protest as I left.

1106703001.content: A few days later, I was finally able to prepare a breakfast that was good enough for Oceanus to "patiently" finish.

1106703003.content: Strictly speaking, you have indeed shown improvement. But not enough to ask for praise yet.

1106703004.content: Yes, and thank goodness my standards aren't as exacting as yours, Mr. Oceanus. And well done, sir, we only have to re-button two buttons today...

1106703006.content: Oceanus eventually redid his shirt buttons without a word.

1106703007.content: I seem to have finally found a way to get along with Oceanus and get the housekeeping work in this huge mansion going again.

1106703008.content: Oceanus was also gradually pushing through his creative block. The piece of stone that he had been staring at for many days was beginning to take shape.

1106703009.content: However, there was still no news on when Aether Gazer's commission would finally be ready.

1106703010.content: Are there any sculptures you're particularly fond of?

1106703011.content: Oceanus' query, which had come out of the blue, caused me to look up from my task of sweeping up the stone debris from the floor.

1106703012.content: Um... I like the one you're going to create for Aether Gazer.

1106703013.content: (Scoffs) If you could stop being glib for a minute, Administrator, you might just help me save a little time.

1106703014.content: Can't you name even one example?

1106703015.content: I don't know very much about sculptures... and if I were to simply name a famous work everyone knows you'd just say that I was making a half-hearted attempt, am I right?

1106703016.content: Well, you've got a bit of self-awareness at least.

1106703018.content: Get the carriage ready. We're going to Stellaris Academy. I need some references.

1106703019.content: Oceanus got on his feet and put on his coat, unfortunately once again fastening one of his buttons wrong.

1106703020.content: Not bad, Mr. Oceanus. Just one button this time. You're improving too.

1106703022.content: After a few days of practice, I was finally able to get the carriage horses to stay in the right lane on the roads. And that was good enough, since Oceanus' residence was just a stone's throw from Stellaris Academy.

1106703023.content: Just waltzing straight into my office again, eh, Cadyllon?

1106703024.content: Seems that you've decided I'm the only person qualified to deal with you, Senator.

1106703025.content: You have to brush up on your jibes a little, my old friend.

1106703026.content: Haha! And you have to brush up on your shirt butto—Huh. None of them misbuttoned today. Is Enlil back?

1106703027.content: The director, who'd been busy verbally sparring with Oceanus, finally noticed me, and a look of understanding came over him.

1106703028.content: Unlike you, I don't have time to waste. So let's get down to business. I need to visit the Stellaris Temple. For my work.

1106703029.content: I know that it can be inspiring to look at other works. But getting access to the Temple is... challenging.

1106703030.content: How about this—We happen to be holding the judging for a sculpture competition on campus today. How about you serve as one of our judges? Maybe you'll find inspiration in the youngsters' works.

1106703031.content: I'm sure our students will be thrilled to have the Third Senator of the Astral Council look at their works.

1106703032.content: It usually takes at least a week's notice to get a Senator to serve as a judge. This is just an excuse, isn't it?

1106703033.content: (Coughs) In that case, please come back regarding your request in a month's time.

1106703035.content: Oceanus glanced at me through the corner of his eye, and then, for some reason, he relented.

1106703036.content: And if I say yes to the judging...?

1106703037.content: I'll only need a day to sort things out.

1106703038.content: That's rather blatant of you, don't you think?

1106703039.content: I followed Oceanus to the judging venue, but not without some misgivings on my part.

1106703040.content: The students had long since arrived and set out a dizzying array of sculptures, some lifelike, others with distinctive designs.

1106703041.content: It's Cadyllon! Is the Third Senator actually going to judge our works?

1106703042.content: Yikes. I'd have spent more time on mine had I known...

1106703043.content: Oceanus' arrival caused quite a stir among the students. However, the sight of his stern demeanor soon silenced them.

1106703044.content: Are there any works here that you like?

1106703045.content: Huh? I'm not the judge here, am I?

1106703046.content: Of course not. I'm just searching for inspiration from another perspective.

1106703047.content: You artists really are wired differently... Fine. Anything to help you get inspiration.

1106703048.content: I looked at each artwork carefully, and thought for quite a while before I settled on the work I thought was best.

1106703049.content: This one, with the eagle reaching its claws toward the rabbit. It's really lifelike. Not bad, eh?

1106703050.content: But why leave such a large supporting structure on the eagle's back? It looks like the kind of frame you'd use to mount an animal specimen... But of course, animal specimens are "lifelike," too, I suppose.

1106703051.content: Oh... What about this? I think there's great drama here between the two fighting swordsmen! I can even imagine what the two of them are going to do next.

1106703052.content: Why does the swordsman on the left only have four fingers? Either the artist is a greenhorn who hasn't paid attention to the basic details, or they used someone missing a digit as their model.

1106703053.content: Uh... How about this one? The sculpture with a bunch of faces on it. The expressions are impressive, aren't they? It looks like they could break out in tears or laughter at any moment.

1106703054.content: It's just faces? Is this meant to be a painting or a sculpture? I feel like the artist might be better off switching to canvas instead.

1106703055.content: All three students involved lowered their heads. Indeed, not everyone is equipped to take Oceanus' scathing critiques.

1106703056.content: You set me up there, didn't you? Of course I don't have the same critical eye as a great artist!

1106703057.content: Administrator, there's nothing wrong with my approach. It is a must to avoid letting emotions come into play when critiquing art.

1106703058.content: Oceanus' words were as harsh as ever. However, his face also bore its typical calm and grave expression, as if he was really serious about the grand cause of "art criticism."

1106703059.content: I could not for the life of me understand his attitude toward art.

1106703060.content: Senator! I'd like to request a critique of my work.

1106703061.content: A brash student had come forward, eyes brimming with confidence. Just what was he going to show the judges?

1106703062.content: You can dispense with the request. Just place the artwork here.

1106703063.content: I look forward to hearing your critique!

1106703064.content: I turned to look in the direction the student was pointing. At first glance, I had no idea what I was looking at. The work had an odd form, as it was made up of cubic stones of various sizes. It was as if I was looking at a pile of discarded stone.

1106703067.content: With all due respect, judging from what they said just now, I'm afraid our guest has only a superficial understanding of art, and any comment they have can only be shallow and ignorant.

1106703068.content: Postmodern works such as mine are not for people who don't understand art. Only someone like you, Senator, would be capable of understanding them!

1106703069.content: I decided to hold my peace, even though I'd been interrupted. The student's assessment of my capabilities might have been harsh, but to be honest Oceanus probably thought the same way.

1106703070.content: The other students, seeing this scene, also fell silent, for fear that their understanding of this "work" would also be harshly criticized by Oceanus.

1106703071.content: However, I sensed a disturbance in Oceanus' originally calm face, as if a storm was coming.

1106703072.content: Quite rude, don't you think, to bring a pile of debris like this before a Senator.

1106703075.content: I know that you're just using the term "postmodern" to describe this pile of scrap to sound sophisticated.

1106703076.content: But first of all, the central tenets of postmodernism are the deconstruction and critique of classical representations and an abstract expression of reality.

1106703077.content: However, I see neither the long shadow of the classics nor any reflection of reality in this pile of debris. Here, I see only arbitrariness, confusion, and opportunism. I see more artistic value in a pile of bricks discarded by wall builders than in this.

1106703078.content: More importantly, one of the core ideas of postmodernism is the dismantling of dogmas, including those that posit any real boundary between "art" and "non-art." So how can you actually claim that someone who "doesn't understand art" is not qualified to evaluate your work?

1106703079.content: By this point, the student was fully deflated, the confidence in his eyes long gone. The other students looked at each other in silence. Then, Oceanus unleashed the finishing blow.

1106703080.content: Only in the Dark Ages when the right to speak about art was monopolized and the market was flooded with poor-quality work would this kind of thing be called "art" and put on sale to fleece the unwitting consumer.

1106703082.content: The student picked up his work and left without a word. Oceanus, who had been very stern just a moment ago, became as placid as still water again and continued with the judging process.

1106703083.content: On the way back, I held the reins in silence for a long time before finally plucking up the courage to ask my question.

1106703085.content: Are you questioning my evaluation of that student's work? I was correct.

1106703086.content: Of course, I wouldn't dare to question a great artist like yourself. But back there it sounded like you were standing up for me even though I clearly knew nothing about art. Wouldn't that affect your reputation?

1106703087.content: Oceanus, unable to understand my concern, sat in silence for a moment.

1106703088.content: Let me put it this way: I included your comments on those three works as part of my overall evaluation.

1106703089.content: Huh? But am I qualified to comment on art?

1106703090.content: The evaluation of art requires multiple perspectives and different forms of knowledge... What is not required, is "qualification."

1106703091.content: Everyone reacts differently to the same work of art due to their individual backgrounds and sense of aesthetics. However, all these reactions are what a work of art should have.

1106703092.content: Historically, so-called artistic treasures are loved by the masses, not kept locked up in vaults as playthings of the wealthy.

1106703093.content: We happened to pass through an intersection right at that moment. A statue of Ardisis stood before us, looking down tenderly on passersby. Oceanus looked back at it, the same tenderness shining in his eyes.

1106703094.content: This was what my old friend believed in, and it was this belief that brought us out of the Dark Ages.

1106703095.content: I wasn't standing up for you. I was simply critiquing someone who was trampling on that belief.

1106703096.content: I suddenly understood why Hades had given me that third tip. Oceanus had invited me to share my thoughts not out of mockery, but out of respect.

1106703098.content: ...The carriage is drifting to the side. Fail!

1106703099.content: Couldn't you just say something nice for once?

1106703100.content: The horses in front of me neighed, and I soon steered them back to the center of the lane and continued on down the street.

1106704001.content: As I approached the end of my mission, the sounds of chiseling from the studio became increasingly frequent.

1106704002.content: On several occasions, I wanted to ask Oceanus to confirm the date of delivery. But every time I walked to the door of the studio and saw Oceanus absorbed in his work, I would step back without a word and return to my housekeeping work instead.

1106704004.content: Hello. This is the residence of the Astral Council's Senator Cadyllon. What can I do for you?

1106704005.content: I see that you've settled into your role nicely, Administrator.

1106704007.content: I wanted to check on the progress of the commission. I'm the middleman here after all, so I want to make sure that things are going smoothly.

1106704008.content: It's a little late for that now, don't you think? He's still working on that magnum opus of his.

1106704009.content: What? You mean to say that all your efforts at housekeeping haven't paid off? Could I have made a mistake...?

1106704010.content: No, your initial impulses were right...

1106704011.content: As I thought back to the sound of chiseling coming from the studio these days, an inexplicable sense of accomplishment came over me.

1106704012.content: My housekeeping has had quite the impact.

1106704013.content: Oh? Guess I don't need to worry, then.

1106704014.content: No, no, I still think you should try and get in touch with another artist. I have to bring back an artwork no matter what.

1106704015.content: I don't want to disturb Oceanus.

1106704016.content: There's only one day left to the deadline. We're not going to be able to get anyone else.

1106704017.content: I'll have to face the music, then.

1106704018.content: But at least it wasn't a total loss on your part, since you got to witness the making of a masterpiece.

1106704019.content: As I got off the call, I realized that Oceanus was in the hall as well. He seemed to have overheard our conversation.

1106704020.content: Ah... Don't worry about that... I didn't want to interrupt your flow...

1106704021.content: I asked you to get me some literary and historical references on a subject of your choice. Have you done that?

1106704023.content: Bring them to the studio at once.

1106704024.content: I watched Oceanus turn around and leave, and for a brief moment, I asked myself if my decision was actually worth it.

1106704025.content: The final day of the mission finally arrived. I packed my bags and went to the studio to say goodbye to Oceanus.

1106704026.content: It looked like Oceanus hadn't slept all night. There were dark circles under his eyes, and fine stone debris was scattered around the soles of his feet.

1106704027.content: And standing in front of him, taking up all his attention, was a completed sculpture. High on a platform, above the ruins, a boy and a girl stood side by side, hand in hand with their swords held high.

1106704028.content: Light and shadow, the dynamic relationship, the faces, and even the supporting structures were all handled to perfection. It was as if divine power would descend from the heavens in the very next moment to help our protagonists overcome whatever predicament they were facing.

1106704029.content: Although clearly the sculpture could not move, it felt like I was looking at a scene that had appeared in my dreams so many times before.

1106704033.content: You're just in time. Let's talk about art, one last time—this sculpture, actually.

1106704034.content: Oceanus' rather sudden suggestion took me aback. However, it was impossible to say no as I looked at his serious demeanor, so full of focus.

1106704035.content: Alright, then. This work feels... very familiar.

1106704036.content: It's as if I'm looking at a dream I had as a child. A dream about how a young man and a young woman came together to save the world.

1106704037.content: Each time, I would feel both hope and despair, just before I awoke from my dream in fright. What I'm looking at is that moment frozen in time.

1106704038.content: Oceanus remained silent for a while, and finally, a rare smile appeared on his face.

1106704041.content: I think of my work as being divided into two categories: the ones that I use to express myself, and the ones I create for my friends.

1106704042.content: With the works in the latter category, I try to make tangible my friends' thoughts and give form to their wishes. These are far more challenging to create than works of pure self-expression.

1106704043.content: Heroic dreams, thoughts of crisis, faith and hope... These are the things I gathered from you.

1106704044.content: I thought back to the day Oceanus asked me to pick out some artworks and books that I liked, and the time he asked me to comment on my favorite artworks...

1106704045.content: Are you saying that... this sculpture is for me?

1106704046.content: Why do you look so surprised? Aren't you here to take delivery of a custom artwork? Here, you have it just on time.

1106704047.content: So these past few days... but since when did you...?

1106704048.content: To be specific, since the time you made your first passable breakfast. I always repay my favors.

1106704049.content: Although Oceanus gave me what he thought was an answer quickly enough, I didn't forget the most crucial question.

1106704051.content: Oceanus fell silent all of a sudden.

1106704054.content: Oceanus didn't deny my query, and finally, he was saved by a sudden growl from his stomach.

1106704055.content: My train doesn't leave till the afternoon. As your housekeeper, I guess I'm obliged to make you one last breakfast.

1106704057.content: Tyr's exhibition turned out to be a huge success, and the sculpture in particular was a hit with most visitors.

1106704058.content: Amazing... I can't believe they convinced Oceanus to do this...

1106704059.content: This must be worth a lot of money.

1106704060.content: (Coughs) Don't even think about it. This is an important asset for Aether Gazer.

1106704061.content: Yeah. Looks like it symbolizes Aether Gazer's spirit of enterprise!

1106704062.content: Is that how you see it? Mind you, if you misinterpret the work of a great artist... you'll just look silly.

1106704063.content: Did I not understand it right?

1106704064.content: Everyone turned toward me. They were curious to know from the person who had brought back the work.

1106704065.content: Mmm... Everyone has the right to react to an artwork in their own way.

1106704066.content: Huh? Where did you learn that line from?!

1106704067.content: I gave a slight smile, but said nothing more.

1106704068.content: The audience gathered around the sculpture and continued to express their opinions one after another. However, no one had noticed the tiny line engraved in the corner of the sculpture's base. It read, "For a friend. In memory of a partnership that was generally worth commemorating."

1106801001.content: Following the conclusion of the first Salon, our journey in Omorfies is also nearing its end.

1106801002.content: But Ver and I don't intend to waste this rare opportunity for a vacation, so we're going to do some sightseeing here before it's time to head back.

1106801003.content: Ah... I thought we'd be able to enjoy the Ardisis Ceremony from up close, but we ran into trouble with the Visbanes again. It was quite the saga.

1106801004.content: Yes, but the Salon was very atmospheric, so the trip was well worth it.

1106801005.content: We should thank President Hades for his hospitality. The spit roast he served that afternoon wasn't something I'll soon forget!

1106801006.content: ...Ver, you really haven't changed a bit.

1106801008.content: What's the plan now, Administrator? There's still a couple of days until we have to head back, so there's plenty of time for sightseeing.

1106801009.content: Plan? Nothing specific, really. I'll probably just walk around and do some souvenir shopping.

1106801010.content: I pause to think before answering.

1106801011.content: Looks like you haven't done your homework, Administrator. Here, this sightseeing guide is from Hera. It'll serve you well!

1106801012.content: Huh? Ver, aren't you coming with me?

1106801013.content: I'm heading to Liberty Grill... Oh, it's a barbecue restaurant. It's a quite far away, so I'll catch up with you later.

1106801014.content: If you're worried about getting lost, you should set out from Stellaris Academy. You can have breakfast there while figuring out your route.

1106801015.content: I hear there's a long queue at the restaurant, so I'm heading off. Bye-bye!

1106801016.content: I was just going to take a walk, but there's so many places I could go... It's really hard to decide.

1106801017.content: I'd better take a look at that sightseeing guide.

1106801018.content: "Stellaris Academy is the political and intellectual hub of the city. The famous Democritus Boulevard and the three other main thoroughfares all pass by its entrance, making it the heart of the city's transport network."

1106801019.content: "The Academy's restaurant features a varied menu and is subsidized by the Council, making the prices affordable. It is open year-round to students, tourists, and local residents alike."

1106801020.content: So, Ver was right. Stellaris Academy is a great place to start. That restaurant sounds really good too. Alright, it's decided!

1106801021.content: I reach Stellaris Academy's restaurant and join the queue. While waiting in line, I check out the menu above the counter.

1106801022.content: Coffee, orange juice, hot chocolate... The potato pancake sounds pretty good. Uh-oh, it's almost my turn. I'd better pick something...

1106801023.content: Enlil, I'll have a plate of spaghetti and a slice of cheese pizza please!

1106801024.content: I'll have the cheese pizza too, Enlil. Oh, and two cups of coffee with extra sugar.

1106801025.content: Got it. The pizza sauces are over here. Next, please.

1106801026.content: Hello, I'd like a... Huh? Is it Enlil?

1106801027.content: Hm? Aren't you Ain Soph's guest? We attended that televised speech together at the Ceremonial Square. I was in charge of the teleprompter, and you were directing...

1106801028.content: That's right. We also met once at Stellaris Temple.

1106801030.content: I'm studying sculpture at the Academy. This is my part-time job.

1106801031.content: Enlil is the star server of the restaurant. He makes the best coffee, pasta, and pizza!

1106801032.content: Getting breakfast made by Enlil really brightens my mood.

1106801033.content: As they speak, the students all look at Enlil with great affection.

1106801035.content: But Stellaris Academy is quite academically challenging, isn't it? And you need to prepare for the Art Association professional exam. I thought everyone would be studying like heads off like Ron...

1106801036.content: You're right, but part-time work is a part of my studies as well.

1106801037.content: I've heard others address you as "Administrator" before. If you don't mind, I'll address you that way too... By the way, aren't you staying at the Society of Muses? What brings you to the Academy?

1106801038.content: Oh, I wanted to do some sightseeing before heading back, and I decided to start from here.

1106801039.content: I see. In that case, Administrator, would like to order one of Omorfies's local specialties?

1106801040.content: That would be great. I've been staring at this menu, but I just don't know what to pick...

1106801041.content: After a while, Stellaris Academy's signature dishes, as recommended by Enlil, begin to arrive. The aroma is so fragrant that I can't resist digging in immediately.

1106801042.content: This rice dish is delicious. Is there fish in it?

1106801043.content: That's fried rice with basil and seafood. It's got squid, shrimp, and various shellfish from the nearby port. The ingredients vary depending on each day's catch.

1106801044.content: I see. And what about this vegetable dish? I see tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, and...

1106801045.content: And garlic, bay leaves, marjoram, and other spices. The locals call it rosemary stir-fry.

1106801046.content: Wow! It's so rich, like a melted Mont Blanc cake.

1106801047.content: I try a bowl of rice porridge and can't help but praise its captivating aroma.

1106801048.content: Our chickpea and chestnut porridge is very popular. Making it requires constant stirring, so patience is a must.

1106801049.content: If you still have room for more, you should try our desserts. I recommend the angel lamb honey puffs.

1106801050.content: Of course! I always have room for dessert. Hm? This lamb looks familiar. I'm pretty sure... No, I'm certain I've seen it before...

1106801051.content: The picture of the angel lamb honey puff on the menu looks awfully familiar to me.

1106801052.content: Ah, its design was inspired by Oneiroi's lamb, Drowsie.

1106801053.content: Drowsie's really cute, so we decided to model this dessert after it.

1106801055.content: I saw a lamb plushy that looked just like this puff at the Society of Muses, with a girl sleeping on it.

1106801056.content: By the way, Enlil, you're involved in the cooking too, right? I see that most of the dishes are cooked to order.

1106801057.content: Yep. The waitstaff take turns preparing meals in three shifts. People always ask for my breakfasts, so I haven't taken the other shifts yet.

1106801058.content: So, you're a skilled sculptor and also a great cook. I guess that's an example of skill transference...

1106801059.content: Ha-ha, I appreciate the compliment, but sculpting and making breakfast are two entirely different things.

1106801060.content: It's just that I often cook for my father, so I'm quite used to it.

1106801061.content: Can I ask you some questions?

1106801063.content: Mr. Oceanus, your father, is an acclaimed artist in Omorfies, isn't he?

1106801064.content: He must have a considerable income. And he's a member of the Astral Council, so...

1106801065.content: I understand. You're wondering why I have a part-time job.

1106801066.content: Yeah... I guess the tuition fees at Stellaris Academy are really high. It is a top academic institution after all. If you include the additional costs of schooling...

1106801067.content: Ha-ha, no, this isn't about the tuition fees.

1106801068.content: I'm working at the restaurant as part of the Academy's community service course.

1106801069.content: Is that a course where students work jobs, then write reports about their experience?

1106801070.content: Pretty much. Although the Academy specializes in arts education, it also encourages students to have varied experiences, including practical labor.

1106801071.content: The community service course offers five annual credits, which can be earned by performing services for the Academy. I chose to work at the restaurant.

1106801072.content: Sounds like the Academy's graduation requirements are pretty strict. Not only must you have artistic talent, but also diligence and grit. I'm impressed.

1106801073.content: How long will you work part-time here for?

1106801074.content: According to the course requirements, I was supposed to finish yesterday.

1106801075.content: Huh? Then, why did you come today?

1106801076.content: The breakfasts we serve here are always sumptuous. After all, you need a good start to a good day of work. A delicious breakfast puts you in the right mood to study.

1106801077.content: The longer I work at the restaurant, the more I understand how much everyone depends on our breakfasts.

1106801078.content: When I thought about all those hungry people, I found myself returning to the restaurant...

1106801080.content: Hm... If I was a student here, I'd definitely look forward to this breakfast every day.

1106801081.content: Tasting the angel lamb honey puff that Enlil recommended, I can't help but praise him.

1106801082.content: Thank you for the kind words. Praise like that is what keeps me working this job.

1106801083.content: Breakfast time is almost over. Are you off to class, Enlil?

1106801084.content: Stellaris Temple is under renovation, so our observation and study programs have been put on hold... Actually, I'm thinking about how to use this time to earn some extra credits.

1106801085.content: After scratching his chin in contemplation, Enlil turns to me with shining eyes.

1106801086.content: What is it? Is there something on my face?

1106801087.content: Is it because of the way I've been gobbling down this delicious food? I start to reach for a napkin, when...

1106801088.content: A pair of warm hands grabs my fingertips. I lift my head to meet Enlil's gleaming eyes.

1106801090.content: According to the rules, students can earn extra community service credits by showing visitors around campus.

1106801092.content: Yeah. That's because the economy of Omorfies is highly dependent on tourism.

1106801093.content: Administrator, you said you wanted to do some sightseeing. Perhaps you could use a tour guide?

1106801094.content: Enlil's suggestion comes as a pleasant surprise. In any case, who could refuse such a kind offer?

1106801095.content: I would love to have a guided tour.

1106801096.content: Then, how about I show you around after I finish my shift?

1106802001.content: Enlil takes me to the school's sculpture gallery.

1106802002.content: Unlike the elegant and prestigious style of the Society of Muses, the sculptures here seem to emphasize the inclusiveness and vitality of art, creating a sense of intimacy.

1106802003.content: Just then, I run into a small problem.

1106802004.content: Today is open day at the Department of Sculpture, and they're running a special sculpture workshop for visitors.

1106802005.content: Sculpture is my major. How about we try it together?

1106802006.content: Ah, of course... Though, Enlil, could you remind me the names of the sculpturing tools?

1106802007.content: I remember that this is called a gouge, and this one I think is a veiner. There's a dozen others I don't really recognize.

1106802009.content: This one is a modeling chisel, this is a spatula, and those are scrapers, saws, and coloring brushes...

1106802010.content: H-Hold on, I don't think I can remember all that at once...

1106802011.content: I frantically search for my planner to take notes. Watching me, Enlil smiles warmly.

1106802013.content: This one with a wider blade is called a modeling chisel. It's used to shape the surface of the sculpture...

1106802014.content: Enlil patiently introduces each tool in the studio.

1106802015.content: It's so complicated... If only each tool had a number. Do you use have to use all these tools for school, Enlil?

1106802016.content: These tools are better suited to beginners. If you major in sculpture, the standards are higher, so you're going to be using between 40 to 50 kinds of tools.

1106802017.content: Huh? That's so many! It's hard to even memorize their names and uses... If I were to study at Stellaris Academy, I'd probably flunk out before the mid-terms.

1106802018.content: Actually, you don't have to remember every one. Sculptures have a sort of vitality to them. You can tell what they're supposed to look like by feeling the material with your hands, or even just imagining it in your head.

1106802019.content: All we need to do is shape the material to release the sculpture's vitality. It's more like a process of restoration than creation.

1106802020.content: What a fascinating perspective. It elevates art to the realm of philosophy. You are so sophisticated, Enlil...

1106802021.content: Oh, no. I'm just repeating what Father told me, ha-ha...

1106802022.content: So confident in his explanations just moments before, Enlil now bashfully scratches his cheek.

1106802023.content: (So, that's the face he makes when someone praises him for his specialty...)

1106802024.content: If not for my father's tutelage, I would still be an amateur in the arts.

1106802025.content: My first sculpture to earn full marks in the academy, "Luna the Light Sleeper," was completed under Father's guidance.

1106802026.content: To commemorate it, I named one of my chisels "Luna."

1106802027.content: Naming a chisel... That's the sort of thing a master of his craft would do. Does every one of your sculpting tools have a name?

1106802028.content: Only a few. Otherwise, it's easy to get them mixed up. The only one with a special name aside from "Luna" is "Offbeat."

1106802030.content: Ha-ha, that's because it's from when I first started sculpting. Back then, my works were always somewhat unsatisfactory. Sometimes they looked too stiff, and sometimes the proportions were off. They always differed a bit from what I had envisioned.

1106802031.content: One day, I finally created a satisfactory piece, and I asked Father to critique it. He said, "Everything is good, but it's a bit offbeat aesthetically."

1106802032.content: Those words left a deep impression on me, so I eventually named my chisel "Offbeat."

1106802033.content: Mr. Oceanus certainly is a strict teacher.

1106802034.content: Shouldn't a teacher be extra patient with a beginner to encourage their interest in the arts?

1106802035.content: I used to wonder about that too. But father once told me—

1106802036.content: "Patience and tolerance cannot undo the marks carved by a chisel, nor do they offer you a second chance to sculpt a better self."

1106802038.content: As he repeats Oceanus's words, Enlil puts on a solemn expression and voice.

1106802040.content: Perhaps my absent-minded expression caught Enlil's attention.

1106802041.content: No, I was just thinking... You really have a lot of respect for Mr. Oceanus.

1106802042.content: I do. The more time I spend with my father, the more I appreciate his artistic talent and the strict demands he places on himself.

1106802043.content: Of course, I also understand that his lifestyle is quite exceptional... in a manner of speaking.

1106802044.content: Enlil glances away, the corner of his lips curling into a wry smile.

1106802045.content: Ahem, I've drifted off-topic. Anyway, the reason my father is so emotionally distant is because he lives life with the same uncompromising attitude he has toward art.

1106802046.content: Furthermore, artistic creation requires self-criticism and doubt. That's the only way one can progress.

1106802047.content: In the sculpture department, it's not uncommon for students to destroy and redo their graduation projects from scratch. They either smash them or burn them...

1106802048.content: If you take a look in the dumpsters here on the night before final submissions, you'll find lots of "severed limbs" and even "heads."

1106802049.content: ...That sounds like a good place for a dare.

1106802050.content: How about I show you next time?

1106802052.content: I'm surprised that the star student Enlil would make a suggestion like that.

1106802053.content: But don't the graduation pieces take a long time to make? It seems a shame to just throw them away like that.

1106802054.content: While it's painful to discard them, it's all in the name of artistic perfection, so it's worth it in that sense. What do you think, Administrator.

1106802056.content: Before I can think of an answer, the formally dressed teaching assistant notices us and walks over.

1106802057.content: Hello. Is this your first time here?

1106802059.content: There's no specific theme for this sculpting workshop. If you don't have any ideas, you can try pulling a random theme from the raffle box.

1106802060.content: Raffle box? Thanks, I'll give it a try.

1106802061.content: I hope you have a fun and productive time.

1106802062.content: I unfold the paper slip and see my assigned topic: "Gift."

1106802063.content: "Gift?" That's a little abstract. After all, there are many things that can be offered as gifts.

1106802064.content: Yeah. Do you have any ideas, Enlil?

1106802065.content: If I did, I wouldn't be facing such a dilemma right now.

1106802067.content: Ah, right, I haven't told you about this yet...

1106802068.content: Actually, I want to prepare a gift for my father after this semester ends. I'm just not sure what to give him.

1106802069.content: It's as if this little slip of paper could hear my frustrations...

1106802070.content: Hm... You're right. What kind of gift would a great artist like Mr. Oceanus like? A world-famous painting? A sports car? Or a legendary lost artifact?

1106802071.content: I'm afraid all those things are way beyond my means.

1106802072.content: Ah, sorry, I spoke without thinking.

1106802073.content: It's okay. I know you were just kidding.

1106802074.content: But... I don't think my father would like any of those.

1106802075.content: Is that so... This really is a tough problem.

1106802076.content: It's okay. Let's continue with the sculpting workshop. First, you need to envision the rough outline of the object, then determine its scope...

1106802077.content: Although I couldn't help Enlil with his conundrum, he smiles warmly and goes back to teaching me how to sculpt.

1106802078.content: If it's your first time, you should make an outline with a liner pen first, then use a chisel to remove the excess plaster.

1106802079.content: Next, we should fix the general shape. Have you decided what you want to sculpt?

1106802080.content: Strangely, the moment Enlil asks that question, I receive a sudden spark of inspiration.

1106802081.content: The image of a glimmering flower takes shape in my mind.

1106802082.content: I've decided. Give me some time. This shouldn't take too long.

1106802083.content: After picking up the tools, I realize that converting the image in my mind into a tangible shape with the chisel is an incredibly engrossing task.

1106802084.content: Actually, you don't have to remember every one. Sculptures have a sort of vitality to them. You can tell what they're supposed to look like by feeling the material with your hands, or even just imagining it in your head.

1106802085.content: "All we need to do is shape the material to release the sculpture's vitality. It's more like a process of restoration than creation."

1106802086.content: I lose track of time. Enlil tells me I have been sculpting for two hours.

1106802087.content: So, your sculpture is a flower?

1106802088.content: That's right, it's a sunflower. It always grows toward the sunlight, casting its shadow behind it. It's a flower that's full of vitality.

1106802089.content: A sunflower? Those are rare in the Stellaris archipelago. I've only ever seen them in the botanical encyclopedia at the library.

1106802090.content: Say, do they really always grow towards the sun?

1106802091.content: Enlil asks this like a curious child seeing a fossil specimen for the first time.

1106802092.content: Technically speaking, they stop turning toward the sun after they bloom.

1106802094.content: Yeah. In Ain Soph, sunflowers are both ornamental plants and crops. The seeds they produce can be roasted and eaten as snacks.

1106802095.content: For the first time today, I'm the one explaining things to Enlil. I can't help but feel a little pleased with myself.

1106802096.content: It really is a sprightly flower. Can I take a closer look?

1106802097.content: Of course. It's a gift for you, after all.

1106802098.content: From the moment I drew the paper slip that said "Gift," I already knew who my sculpture would be for, even if I didn't know what to sculpt yet.

1106802100.content: Yep, to thank you for today.

1106802101.content: I hope you can become like this sunflower, always facing the sun, and paying no heed to the voices of doubt behind you.

1106802102.content: Thank you. It's a wonderful gift.

1106802103.content: You don't have to thank me. After all, if not for your help, this gift would never have come into existence!

1106802104.content: Watching Enlil blissfully hold the sunflower sculpture in his arms, I start to feel a bit embarrassed.

1106803001.content: By the time the sculpting workshop is over, it is almost noon. Despite the filling breakfast I had, my stomach begins to rumble.

1106803003.content: Ha-ha, I guess you heard that... My stomach seems to be protesting.

1106803004.content: Let's find somewhere for lunch. What are you in the mood for?

1106803005.content: Well, the dishes you recommended at the Academy restaurant were all really good...

1106803006.content: "The scenery at the start may be beautiful, but the next stop on the journey is even more incredible." The dean says that at the graduation ceremony every year.

1106803007.content: You mean... we should go and eat somewhere outside?

1106803008.content: I realize that I'm slowly getting used to Enlil's philosophical manner of speaking.

1106803009.content: I don't mind, but I don't know any restaurants in Omorfies, so you decide where.

1106803010.content: Enlil, would you mind leading the way?

1106803012.content: I ask Enlil a question with mock solemnity. Following my lead, he replies with a gentlemanly air.

1106803014.content: After that, Enlil and I make eye contact and burst into laughter simultaneously.

1106803016.content: Enlil clears his throat and puts on a serious face, but a smile still lingers on his lips.

1106803017.content: Right, just past the art gallery is Stellaris Academy's shopping street. I suppose you haven't properly explored Omorfies yet, have you?

1106803018.content: Yeah. The only other place I've visited is Democritus Boulevard. I haven't had the chance to go anywhere else.

1106803019.content: Democritus Boulevard has fantastic architecture and a bustling environment, but the Academy's shopping street has unique goods that can't be found anywhere else. I think you'll like it there.

1106803020.content: The Stellaris Academy shopping street? Is it outside the campus? I looked over the map several times but didn't notice it.

1106803021.content: Back in the day, it used to be a marketplace for antiques and old art, and was frequented by scholars and collectors.

1106803022.content: Now, it's become a proper shopping street. It got its name due to its proximity to the Academy.

1106803023.content: It's amazing how quickly Omorfies is developing. Ah, my stomach is rumbling again...

1106803024.content: Let's get going, then. It's only a ten-minute walk from here.

1106803025.content: I tried lamb chops in Ain Soph, but the ones from Omorfies really are different. Apollo wasn't exaggerating at all.

1106803026.content: I'm glad that they're to your liking... Ah...

1106803027.content: What's up? Are you tired, Enlil?

1106803028.content: I voice my question as I look at Enlil, who is absentmindedly biting his spoon.

1106803029.content: Ah, sorry! I was just wondering if we could add this "cream planet pudding" to our menu at the Academy...

1106803030.content: It's this shop's specialty dessert, right? I doubt the owner is going to just tell you the recipe.

1106803031.content: Yeah, so I'll have to figure it out myself.

1106803032.content: As Enlil speaks, he shovels a spoonful of pudding into his mouth. He looks like he's trying to decipher the pudding's secrets with his tastebuds.

1106803034.content: I don't know. The flavor might come out completely different when I try making it.

1106803035.content: But... this pudding really is delicious! Administrator, you've gotta try it too.

1106803037.content: As he speaks, Enlil pushes the remaining pudding to my side of the table. I look at the half-eaten dessert with some hesitation, but Enlil is watching me with expectant eyes.

1106803038.content: I know what those eyes are saying: "Please try it!"

1106803040.content: Facing the pure enthusiasm in Enlil's gaze, I no longer have any reason to hesitate.

1106803042.content: Right? Ah, I'm sorry. I'm feeling pleased even though I didn't make it...

1106803043.content: It's fine. Who wouldn't be pleased with making a great recommendation?

1106803044.content: True... But it'd be great if I could recreate this flavor for everyone at the Academy.

1106803045.content: I look at Enlil who has fallen into contemplation again, and discreetly...

1106803047.content: After a sumptuous lunch, I take the opportunity to buy some souvenirs at the many shops on the street.

1106803048.content: Olive oil for cooking. This sea salt is for Ver. And I can put this boat model made of seashells in my room...

1106803049.content: There's also a key-chain for Shu, a dreamcatcher for Zenkibo, and this white conch shell, which I bet Poseidon will like.

1106803050.content: That covers everyone. I also bought chocolate, cream mochi, and fruit candies as snacks for our return journey.

1106803051.content: I end up buying a lot. Thankfully, everything is pretty affordable.

1106803052.content: I was right. You've taken quite a liking to the goods here, Administrator.

1106803053.content: I don't often come to Omorfies, and the goods here are priced fairly... What are you going to buy, Enlil?

1106803054.content: I'm thinking about what to give my father.

1106803055.content: No wonder you've been looking at the window displays so closely. You're still thinking about his present.

1106803056.content: Mr. Oceanus is a man of refined taste. He probably won't like such ordinary things. How about this pair of sunglasses?

1106803057.content: "Designer-made glasses crafted with the latest in optical technology..." Sounds like something Mr. Oceanus would like.

1106803058.content: It's probably an exaggeration. Besides, Father wears glasses when he goes out. Sunglasses wouldn't be very practical for him.

1106803059.content: Well, if we're talking practical, we'll need something he can use regularly. How about this cologne? It has an intriguing name—"Midnight Snowfall." Sounds very artistic.

1106803060.content: Ha-ha, that's a good name. But knowing Father, there's a good chance he'll mistake it for disinfectant and spray it around the living room, or confuse it with a plant mister.

1106803061.content: Eh? Is it that he doesn't like cologne?

1106803062.content: No, he's just careless. He often mixes up various bottles and jars. He's too lazy to read the labels, so he just uses them arbitrarily.

1106803063.content: I guess Mr. Oceanus wouldn't care about something like cologne...

1106803064.content: Wait, how about this belt? It looks unassuming but sturdy. It's just that the price...

1106803065.content: Um, one zero, two zeros, three zeros...

1106803066.content: It's a good suggestion, Administrator, but this is far too expensive for me.

1106803067.content: Oh, sorry. I should have checked the price first.

1106803068.content: With your part-time wages, you'd have to save up for a long time to afford this.

1106803069.content: The Academy gives us a pretty generous stipend for part-time work. Together with my scholarships, I actually receive a considerable sum.

1106803070.content: Are you putting it all into your savings?

1106803071.content: No, I use it for something more important.

1106803072.content: Something more important... You mean travelling? Or perhaps collecting valuable artworks? Surely it isn't commercial investment?
