1106803073.content: Your imagination is quite something, Administrator. I don't have too much interest in commerce, art collecting, or travel.

1106803074.content: Actually, I donate the money to the local orphanage in support of their daily operations.

1106803076.content: Do you remember what Lord Hades said, that I was adopted by my father?

1106803077.content: I do remember him mentioning that...

1106803078.content: Before I was adopted, I spent my childhood in an orphanage.

1106803079.content: Is it the one you're donating to?

1106803080.content: Yes. Having experienced that sort of life myself, I want to make things better for the children there.

1106803081.content: Aside from providing food and shelter, I'd like to enable them to join art classes without having to worry about the cost of the materials.

1106803082.content: I see. You want to teach the children to use art as a way of dealing with their emotional problems. That's very meaningful.

1106803083.content: Enlil, tell me what I can do. I want to help too!

1106803084.content: You're too kind. If it isn't too much trouble, could you help me buy some daily necessities for the orphanage?

1106803085.content: Of course. What do they need?

1106803086.content: The children gave me this wish list the last time I tutored them.

1106803087.content: Enlil gives me a piece of paper with several lines of crooked writing on it. Each line is marked with a name.

1106803088.content: Let me see... Lucia's wish is for "a chocolate-covered pancake to share with friends on my birthday."

1106803089.content: Derian would like to "eat a big slice of cream cake."

1106803090.content: This one says, "The oatmeal and dried fruits Enlil brought last time were really delicious. I hope I can have them again."

1106803091.content: Hm, easy enough. I shouldn't have any trouble finding these. Let's go!

1106803092.content: Although I said "I shouldn't have any trouble," the wish list is quite long, and I end up spending a lot of money.

1106803093.content: I already bought some of the items on the list while souvenir shopping. I should put them in the package as well.

1106803094.content: It takes about two hours to reach the orphanage by bus and then on foot. It'll probably be dark by the time I get back.

1106803095.content: If I had the time, I'd love to visit the orphanage with you. But it looks like I'll have to send these items via courier.

1106803096.content: Thank you, Administrator. You must be tired after all that shopping.

1106803097.content: A little, but thinking of the children's smiles makes it feel worthwhile.

1106803098.content: Come to think of it, everything the kids put on the wish list was food, right?

1106803099.content: Mr. Ardisis once said, "Art is born of the soul's yearning for beauty, but food is our most direct path to happiness."

1106803100.content: Makes sense... Delicious food can even make adults happy, let alone children.

1106803101.content: The breakfast, Omorfies lamb chops, and cream planet pudding I had today all made me very happy.

1106803102.content: Mr. Oceanus probably likes good food too, right?

1106803103.content: Administrator, do you mean to say...

1106803104.content: Aren't you struggling to think of a suitable gift for Mr. Oceanus?

1106803106.content: The answer is... in the parcel we just mailed.

1106803107.content: Are you saying I should invest in a courier company as a surprise gift for Father?

1106803108.content: The courier industry in Omorfies does seem to have good prospects for development. Let me write up a budget...

1106803109.content: No, that's not what I meant! I'm talking about things you can eat, like what the children wrote on their wish list.

1106803111.content: Yeah! You're good at cooking, aren't you? You could prepare a special dish, or something else that Mr. Oceanus would like.

1106803112.content: That would be easy, but Father often comes home at irregular hours due to his Council work.

1106803113.content: He rarely gets to eat a freshly cooked meal. It's always food that's gone cold and been reheated multiple times.

1106803114.content: I've got an idea! Enlil, would you mind going back to the shopping street with me?

1106803115.content: Of course. If you've got a good idea, I'm all ears.

1106804001.content: On the way back to the shopping street, Enlil and I start talking about Mr. Oceanus again.

1106804002.content: As a result, my impression of him changes from "great artist" to "absentminded and sloppy."

1106804003.content: He-He really blew up the microwave?

1106804004.content: Yep. I was preparing for mid-terms, so I wasn't home for several days. I guess Father got hungry, so he tried heating up a tuna rice ball in the microwave, but he put it in on a metal plate.

1106804005.content: The explosion must have been quite spectacular. It took me a long time to clean up the mess. After that, Father never set foot in the kitchen again.

1106804006.content: Listening to Enlil calmly recount this hair-raising story, I can't help but feel sympathy for him. He is too young to bear so many responsibilities.

1106804007.content: Don't look at me like that, Administrator. It's not so bad once you get used to it.

1106804008.content: I don't feel like that's the sort of thing one should get used to...

1106804009.content: Eventually, I tried to make him packed lunches, but according to this colleagues at the Council, my father never heated them up. He would even insist that they were special dishes that were meant to be eaten cold.

1106804010.content: So, you're always looking after Mr. Oceanus at home? That sounds pretty tough on you...

1106804011.content: Having housework to do in addition to studies and a part-time job...

1106804012.content: "There's no such thing as a free lunch." It is a hectic life, but I find it fulfilling.

1106804014.content: Not at all. There are lots of people who work way harder than I do. By the way, Administrator, have you ever seen Stellaris Academy at four in the morning?

1106804015.content: N-No, I can't say I have...

1106804016.content: I guess not. You've only been here for a few days after all.

1106804017.content: What's so special about Stellaris Academy at four in the morning? Do you have a headless knight who emerged from a painting? A ghost lurking in the gallery perhaps?

1106804018.content: You've got quite an active imagination, Administrator, but it's nothing so scary. There's just some students who study until four o'clock every day.

1106804019.content: Oh, that sounds even scarier than a ghost.

1106804020.content: Ha... I've lost count of how many knowing smiles I've exchanged with Enlil today.

1106804021.content: By the way, Administrator, can you tell me about what your gift idea?

1106804023.content: Mr. Oceanus shouldn't be eating cold lunches, but he doesn't like using microwaves. That makes you worry about his diet, right?

1106804024.content: Yeah. For the sake of his health, I want him to eat hot food, but I can't be watching over him all the time.

1106804025.content: What we need is something that heats up food quickly. And it should be so easy to use that it's foolproof.

1106804026.content: Welcome to the electronics section. How can I help you today?

1106804027.content: Hello. I'm looking for a lunchbox with an automatic heating function.

1106804028.content: This smart lunchbox with an in-built heater is just what you're looking for.

1106804029.content: So, if I put food in here, I can warm it up at any time even after it goes cold, right?

1106804030.content: Yes. And this lunchbox uses the latest chip technology, so it weighs only 650g, which isn't too heavy for daily use.

1106804031.content: Is it complicated to use? Um, for example, could an accident happen if someone with poor life skills uses it?

1106804032.content: (Mr. Oceanus... You shouldn't cause your son this much worry.)

1106804033.content: The lunchbox has a button that you press once to start heating. It's really easy to use. It's also fitted with an insulation layer that keeps the temperature within a safe range, so it's perfectly safe.

1106804034.content: This lunchbox is lightweight, insulated, and has a smart heating function. Plus, it's safe. It's definitely a better gift than a microwave.

1106804035.content: With this, Mr. Oceanus can enjoy a hot lunch whether he's at home or at work.

1106804036.content: This... ought to be perfect for Father. Thank you for the idea, Administrator!

1106804037.content: Hello, please wrap this up for me!

1106804039.content: As the clerk skillfully wraps the lunchbox, Enlil's expression changes from bright to gloomy.

1106804041.content: This smart lunchbox has all the features we need, but it's ordinary design may not satisfy my father's discerning taste.

1106804042.content: If I give it to him as it is, I'm afraid it'll end up gathering dust in a corner before long.

1106804043.content: I'd like to spruce it up a little to make it a more fitting gift.

1106804044.content: Would you mind helping me, Administrator?

1106804045.content: Sure. I'll do whatever I can.

1106804046.content: I blurt out my answer without thinking.

1106804047.content: First, remove the screws, dismantle the outer cover, and remove the inner lining.

1106804048.content: Phew, we managed to remove it without affecting the electrical components. What's next?

1106804049.content: Well done. Next, I need to make a new cover, then reassemble the lunchbox.

1106804050.content: Are you going to start from scratch? It's going to take a long time if you do that.

1106804051.content: No, nothing so complicated. I have a wooden carving from before that should be just the right size. I just need to modify it a little.

1106804052.content: Wow, these delicate ripples really accentuate the texture of the wood.

1106804053.content: Does it really need more embellishment? It looks pretty good to me already.

1106804054.content: Don't you remember our conversation this morning? Artistic creation requires self-criticism and doubt.

1106804056.content: Hearing Enlil speak in such a serious tone, I find myself apologizing without thinking.

1106804057.content: Ah, don't mind it. I shouldn't have spoken so harshly.

1106804059.content: Well, I hope his artistic genius has rubbed off on me too.

1106804063.content: It should fit the lunchbox now, but we forgot about these...

1106804064.content: These screws were used to secure the lunchbox's internal components. How do we insert them now?

1106804065.content: Use a micro drill to create holes in the wooden case. We should be able to insert the screws then.

1106804066.content: You're so knowledgeable, Enlil. I'm starting to suspect that Stellaris Academy has a secret elite program to cultivate well-rounded students just like you.

1106804068.content: Please hold the inner lining while I mark the positions for the screw holes.

1106804069.content: The lunchbox is finished! The heating function works fine, so the electrical components should be undamaged.

1106804070.content: I'm sure Mr. Oceanus will like this gift.

1106804072.content: My day of sightseeing in Omorfies is almost over. I reluctantly say farewell to Enlil at the Academy gates.

1106804073.content: What a fun-filled day! I'll never forget this day.

1106804074.content: Remembering isn't enough. Your sculpting skills will get rusty if you don't practice regularly.

1106804075.content: Um... I'll practice if I have time.

1106804077.content: Enlil, I'll send you a postcard when I return to Ain Soph.

1106804078.content: I'll send you one too, Administrator.

1106804079.content: By the way, when you have time, please send me your review of today's tour. It can be in physical or digital format. My contact details are—

1106804081.content: I have a bad feeling about this.

1106804082.content: It'll serve as proof that I performed tour guide duties for the Academy. The course requires a 3,000-word review from the visitor before it will grant a credit.

1106804085.content: Seeing the imploring look on Enlil's face, I don't have the heart to refuse. Looks like I'll be staying up late tonight...

1106804086.content: But the thought of being able to stay in touch with Enlil somewhat lightens my mood.

1109401002.content: "The black cat. It brought the sick girl some berries and a blanket..."

1109401003.content: "Yes, the black cat wanted to take the little girl to a gathering of animals. You have a good memory, Helena."

1109401005.content: "But things weren't going to be so easy. The evil witch had cast a spell on the entrance to the meeting place!"

1109401006.content: "Try as she might, from afternoon to night, the little girl couldn't find a way into the wonderland."

1109401008.content: "Nope. The black cat found her a magic dress. Look, Helena, it's this dress."

1109401009.content: "Once she put it on, the little girl could exchange bodies with the black cat!"

1109401010.content: "Hence, the little girl managed to join the forest gathering and spend a happy evening with the animals."

1109401011.content: "However, when she was on the way home... Huh?"

1109401012.content: Sorry, the next part seems different from what I remember. Shall we continue another time?

1109401014.content: I shouldn't wish for anything because I don't have the right to—Father's actions proved this to me.

1109401015.content: So, even a simple desire like "wanting to know the next part of the story" isn't allowed.

1109401016.content: I want to go back to sleep. Can I?

1109401019.content: Vena lifts tiny Helena and carries her back to her room, then plants a goodnight kiss on her forehead.

1109401022.content: Lord Mimir, why the sudden interest in fairy tales? And why did you tell logistics to order so many fairy-tale books?

1109401023.content: It wasn't me. It was Shu. The purchase order is just over there. Take a look for yourself.

1109401024.content: Engrossed, Mimir doesn't even bother to look up from his book.

1109401025.content: Let's see. The Cat in the Forest, tents, bedding... Were these supplies donated by Aether Gazer?

1109401026.content: But aren't you a little too old for fairy tales, Lord Mimir?

1109401027.content: Pfft, you shouldn't be so complacent. Reading builds knowledge, and knowledge is good for your... How do you say it? Authoritarian skills?

1109401028.content: You mean leadership skills, right? I'm afraid you're the only one who thinks so, Lord Mimir...

1109401029.content: As I chat with Mimir, the office door opens.

1109401030.content: The first thing that comes into view is a strange and imposing black coffin.

1109401031.content: And it belongs to someone I'm all too familiar with...

1109401033.content: The silver-haired girl speaks softly and slowly as she combs through her memories.

1109401034.content: Good morning, Hel. What can I do for you?

1109401035.content: Hel pulls out a storage device from her pocket.

1109401037.content: I see. Are you here to submit your battle report?

1109401038.content: Hel nods, and I access the record terminal on my desk.

1109401039.content: Let's start with the attendance records, then... Um, Hel?

1109401040.content: I turn around and notice Hel looking at the book of fairy tales in my hands.

1109401041.content: When I call out to her, the silver-haired girl looks up and meets my gaze before nodding slightly.

1109401043.content: I insert the storage device, and a series of neatly arranged yet unusual numbers appear.

1109401044.content: Unlike the narrative reports submitted by other Modifiers, the information in Hel's report is so abstract that I can't help but furrow my brow.

1109401046.content: Hel blinks her violet eyes and stares at me with a confused expression that matches mine.

1109401052.content: Things are getting awkward. I'm about to ask for Mimir's opinion when I suddenly hear a harsh voice.

1109401053.content: You can't even decipher that? I'm shocked to be witnessing such incompetence.

1109401054.content: That's why I said you shouldn't be so complacent, rookie. Look who's in trouble now?

1109401056.content: A rookie, huh? Makes sense, I guess. This one still has a lot to learn.

1109401057.content: Indeed. Coffin, pass me the coolant.

1109401058.content: For some reason, the coffin obeys Mimir, stretching out a mechanical arm and handing him the coolant.

1109401059.content: In return for the coolant, I'll give you a—*burp*—tip.

1109401060.content: Hel's missions are mostly issued by Shu. You should ask Shu if you can't figure it out.

1109401061.content: Before that, however, you should try making yourself useful.

1109401062.content: For example, you should give Miss Hel a glass of water, like how I gave your teacher a drink.

1109401063.content: Get moving! Get Hel some water, rookie!

1109401064.content: I quietly turn around and walk over to the water dispenser to get Hel a cup of water.

1109401066.content: I'm about to open my mouth to follow Hel and say, "Mimir, be quiet." But, knowing the hell Mimir would unleash, I decide to hold my peace.

1109401067.content: When did this obnoxious cat and long-winded coffin become so close...

1109401070.content: Shu appears at the door. I walk over and explain the situation to her.

1109401071.content: Shu, it looks like I'm going to need your help.

1109401072.content: Hm, I understand. I'll explain the General Office's protocol for liaising with special teams later. For now, watch my demonstration.

1109401073.content: Shu walks straight to my desk and has the storage device connected to Mimir. Then, she deftly picks up the record terminal and places it inside Ganglati.

1109401074.content: Hel's access key—that is to say, Ganglati itself—generates and stores all of Hel's operation records. All you have to do is make a copy and organize those records like I just did.

1109401075.content: Mimir's eyes glow blue as it begins transmitting data. Everyone in the room suddenly falls silent.

1109401076.content: It's going to take some time to finish copying the data. Administrator, could you step outside for a moment? I'd like to have a word with you.

1109401077.content: I follow Shu some distance down the corridor.

1109401078.content: I wanted to ask if you could act as liaison to the Undertaker Squad from now on.

1109401079.content: With Hel? But she usually works alone, right?

1109401080.content: Exactly. She rarely gets the opportunity to socialize with others.

1109401081.content: I think you can help her change.

1109401082.content: Suddenly, the office door opens, and I see Hel leaving the room from the corner of my eye.

1109401083.content: I turn to look at Hel and realize she is staring right at me.

1109401084.content: I'll try. But... Shu, could you tell me more about this book?

1109401085.content: During lunchtime, I don't stay in the restaurant for too long.

1109401086.content: Maybe it's because of the verbal bombardment I got from Mimir and Ganglati, but I really want to have a solitary lunch on my office balcony.

1109401087.content: The elevator quickly brings me to my office's floor, and I head through the automatic doors to the balcony, where I can enjoy the warm sunlight and gentle breeze.

1109401088.content: Forgive me for saying this, Miss Hel, but I think you're in need of help right now.

1109401089.content: But someone already got here before me.

1109401090.content: I do not feel lonely, Ganglati.

1109401091.content: But sociological studies show that most humans require a sense of belonging, which they get by acquiring companions they call "family."

1109401092.content: Currently, I am not advanced enough to analyze the human psyche. But you...

1109401094.content: The girl interrupts the black coffin, then bites into a red bean bun and starts chewing.

1109401095.content: I have long forgotten the social norms that people abide by.

1109401096.content: Those who do not follow social norms will be ostracized by society. That is how humans have always functioned.

1109401098.content: Then, why don't you ask someone else to help you remember those norms?

1109401100.content: For example, someone like your Administrator, who has been standing over there for quite a while.

1109401101.content: The temperamental coffin suddenly mentions my name, forcing me to wave awkwardly in response.

1109401102.content: At the same time, Hel finally notices my presence, seeming somewhat annoyed.

1109401104.content: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to eavesdrop.

1109401105.content: I lift my lunch bag and give it a shake by way of explanation.

1109401106.content: Ganglati, why didn't you tell me earlier?

1109401107.content:
My apologies, but my threat detection system is bound to your consciousness. Since you do not perceive the #{nickname}# as a threat, I did not think to intervene.
Should I reclassify the #{nickname}# as a threat?

1109401108.content: No. But always tell me next time. Do not forget.

1109401109.content: Can I sit here? If I'm bothering you, I can go somewhere else...

1109401111.content: Hel shifts over to the right, gesturing for me to sit on her left.

1109401113.content: I place my food and drink to the side and slightly adjust my posture.

1109401117.content: Uh... You mean what Ganglati said about you needing help?

1109401118.content: "I'm shocked to be witnessing such incompetence."

1109401121.content: Hel's unexpected imitation act was a bit of a shock, causing me to spit my drink all over Ganglati.

1109401122.content: You require some training in manners. I must warn you...

1109401123.content: I'm sorry... Let me wipe it off.

1109401126.content: Nothing... Do you normally do impressions of Ganglati like that?

1109401127.content: No. I did it to explain what I meant.

1109401128.content: I see... Well, Ganglati's up there with Mimir when it comes to criticizing people's faults.

1109401130.content: No. I'm quite used to it, actually. Sometimes I don't hear Lord Mimir's criticism for days and I feel like a part of my life is missing.

1109401132.content: Yes, I found a way to deal with the criticism. It's like how you got used to being alone.

1109401134.content: Administrator, what did you and Shu talk about just now?

1109401135.content: We were talking about you. And... Shu hopes that I can change you.

1109401136.content: What about me needs to change?

1109401138.content: I think you're fine the way you are.

1109401140.content: Oh, Hel, I have something for you.

1109401141.content: I pass Aether Gazer's charity fundraising plan and a book of fairy tales to Hel.

1109401143.content: Shu said that there's going to be a fundraising interview at the reconstruction area in two weeks. Aether Gazer will be participating, and these are some of the resources we'll be using.

1109401145.content: Yes, Vina is there too. Wanna come?

1109401149.content: Your Administrator seems to have sipped from your drink by mistake.

1109401151.content: You were so engrossed in your conversation with the Administrator that I thought it unnecessary to inform you.

1109401152.content: You do desire "companions" after all, don't you, Miss Hel?

1109401153.content: ...You are forbidden from speaking until dinner!

1109402001.content: Dazzling lights flash as camera shutters click incessantly.

1109402002.content: Hel and I are surrounded by reporters on the path by the orphanage in Duskfall Area.

1109402003.content: Miss, were you raised in Duskfall Area's orphanage? Could you tell us more about your schedule for today?

1109402004.content: Sorry to bother you, but experts are saying this is the first corporate social responsibility project being undertaken in Ain Soph. What are Aether Gazer's plans?

1109402005.content: Hello! Can you tell us more about your company's plans after the merger with the Valleyrand Group?

1109402006.content: (It's supposed to be a charity event, but no one seems to be concerned about that...)

1109402008.content: Hel lets out a long yawn beside me. I quickly turn sideways so she doesn't get caught on camera.

1109402009.content: Luckily, Hel wasn't allowed to bring her access key today. Otherwise, Ganglati would probably get into a huge argument with the reporters and make the headlines again...

1109402010.content: Sorry, I will brief you on Aether Gazer's plans for the charity event later. Please wait here for a moment. I'll be right back.

1109402011.content: With that, I grab Hel's hand and escape the crowd.

1109402014.content: Not briefing the reporters. The mission description mentioned a speech. You didn't give one.

1109402015.content: I'll go back later to do it. It's just that you didn't seem to be having a good time.

1109402016.content: If you're bored, why don't you visit your sister? You haven't seen her in a long time.

1109402017.content: ...You don't have to worry about me.

1109402018.content: "I noticed everything, Miss Hel. That was your third yawn of the day. You absolutely do not have to speak to those wastrels."

1109402019.content: I do an impression of Ganglati's voice, placing emphasis on the word "wastrels."

1109402020.content: I hear a soft chuckle, and the corners of Hel's lips curl upwards. She's smiling.

1109402021.content: But the smile fades quickly, like ripples on the water.

1109402022.content: Administrator, why did you imitate Ganglati?

1109402023.content: I just thought that's what Ganglati would say if he were here today.

1109402025.content: Yes. They remind me of... people from my past.

1109402026.content: Hel had previously sought the help of reporters when she ran away from her adoptive father.

1109402027.content: However, the reporters merely feigned concern while pursuing their own selfish agendas.

1109402029.content: You don't have to understand them.

1109402031.content: Not everyone is worth understanding, Hel.

1109402032.content: No one needs to understand hypocrisy and malice.

1109402033.content: Instead of replying, Hel gazes off into the distance. as if lost in thought.

1109402035.content: A sign saying "Reconstruction Area E" appears before us.

1109402036.content: Vina should be living here. Go on ahead. Don't wait for me.

1109402038.content: Thanks for keeping me company, Hel. I'll be back once I'm done with the reporters.

1109402039.content: Although the Administrator told her not to wait, the girl does not move for a long time.

1109402040.content: I'll just... wait a little longer.

1109402041.content: Gazing at the Administrator walking away, she fails to notice a thin young girl running toward her.

1109402044.content: Giving the speech and handling the reporters' questions take much longer than expected, and it's already noon when I get back.

1109402045.content: I catch sight of the girls in the distance, each holding a bag, and decide to say hi.

1109402046.content: Hello, Vina. I'm #{nickname}#. I'm a friend of your sister's.

1109402047.content: CORG should have removed Vina's memories of what happened in Duskfall Area, so I tried introducing myself as someone she could trust. However...

1109402048.content: That's something a kidnapper would say.

1109402049.content: She doesn't seem to trust me.

1109402050.content: Huh? Well... Would you like some of this? Your sister asked me to get it for you.

1109402051.content: I pull a piece of cake out of my pocket while signaling to Hel to say something on my behalf.

1109402052.content: ...You sound even more like a kidnapper now, Administrator.

1109402053.content: Hehe, just kidding! Hel's already told me all about you, #{nickname}#.

1109402054.content:
Shucks, you shouldn't scare me like that, Vina.
By the way, what's in those bags?

1109402056.content: Vina wants to eat kelp noodles.

1109402057.content: Hel, you can make kelp noodles? I can't wait to try.

1109402058.content: Hel nods slightly, and a hint of pride shows on her face.

1109402059.content: The girls are bringing the ingredients to the camp. I plan on following them, but suddenly receive a call on my comms device.

1109402060.content: Sorry, I have to take a call... Vina, shouldn't you watch the pot while you're cooking?

1109402062.content: Hello... Yes, I'm Aether Gazer's liaison for this charity event...

1109402064.content: Administrator, the liquid in the pot has turned black.

1109402067.content: Regarding our visit to the reconstruction area today...

1109402068.content: Hel runs over to me again.

1109402069.content: Administrator, the dough is sticking to the pot.

1109402072.content: Yes, including the fairy tale books, Aether Gazer will be donating...

1109402074.content: (Why is she calling me Administrator too?) Add... Ugh, what is this?

1109402075.content: Vina's cry draws my attention. I turn to look at how our lunch is coming along, but all I see is a mysterious gray lump.

1109402076.content: Wrapped around the lump of dough are countless strands of kelp that resemble blood vessels and glow strangely.

1109402077.content: Hel raises a large bag of flour, and Vina lifts a huge ladle of water, both intending to add more to the mix.

1109402080.content: When I make kelp noodles, Ganglati usually helps me measure the amount of flour and water required.

1109402081.content: Don't worry about it... I'll discard the failed dish. I should have come back earlier, so it's my fault too.

1109402082.content: Do you have any more flour and kelp?

1109402084.content: They shake their heads in unison.

1109402085.content: With these ingredients... Why don't we try making dessert? Like lava cakes?

1109402087.content: They nod their heads in unison.

1109402088.content: Is there anything else you want, Hel?

1109402090.content: Then, what about a kelp salad? Vina, could you bring me two cartons of milk?

1109402093.content: I learned how to make this from a friend in Aether Gazer. If you want, I can teach it to you next time.

1109402095.content: Come to think of it, this is a pretty large orphanage. Why are you the only one here, Vina?

1109402096.content: Because everyone else went outside to play today.

1109402097.content: I see. But you always choose to wait here for Hel instead.

1109402098.content: Vina... has always been waiting for me?

1109402099.content: Hehe! Can we all go visit the commercial district in the afternoon?

1109402100.content: I heard that many sellers from all over the city have set up shop there for the charity event.

1109402101.content: Thus, Hel and I accept Vina's suggestion.

1109402102.content: Though in ruins just a few months before, Duskfall Area's scars seem to have been completely covered up by Ain Soph's atmosphere of flourishing commerce.

1109402103.content: Even Hel, who dislikes crowds, ends up stopping outside a fashion boutique for a long time.

1109402104.content: She is staring at a dress adorned with white roses and a black gauze hem that sets off the striking silver of its bodice. It is like a rose blooming amid thorns, unraveling the mysteries of the night.

1109402105.content: What are you looking at, Hel? Oh, the label...

1109402106.content: "Elegance should be answered with elegance, and beauty should be exchanged for beauty."

1109402108.content: The girl recites the slogan absent-mindedly. The small boutique is full of customers, and Hel seems hesitant to enter.

1109402110.content: As I push open the boutique's door for Hel, I sense something warm in my other palm. Hel has taken my hand.

1109402112.content: Oh! You're the eighteenth young lady to inquire about this dress today.

1109402113.content: Hel hasn't finished her question when the shop clerk interrupts her with a smile.

1109402114.content: I regret to inform you that the dress is not for sale.

1109402115.content: The clerk smiles with pride as she looks at the dress, as if she had made it herself.

1109402117.content: Yes. It's by a famous designer, and it's here on display in support of the charity event.

1109402118.content: But that's not what its label seems to say.

1109402119.content: Indeed not! Those words were written by the designer, and they contain the secret to obtaining the dress.

1109402120.content: Looking at the second half of the slogan, we probably have to exchange something for it, right?

1109402121.content: Almost, but not quite. Maybe you should consider the first half too?

1109402122.content: You know what the designer wants, don't you?

1109402123.content: A proud and peculiar smile appears on the clerk's face.

1109402124.content: I'm sorry, but that will remain a business secret until the charity event is over. I can't tell you anything.

1109402125.content: That's sneaky! The dress won't be available after the charity event ends!

1109402126.content: We start wracking our brains to solve the riddle, but none of us can figure out the answer.

1109402127.content: Hel seems disappointed when we leave the boutique, so I can take her to a few more shops.

1109402128.content: However, nothing else seems to catch her eye and, before we know it, night has fallen.

1109402129.content: The streetlights flicker to life amid the cool evening breeze. The crowds begin to subside, and Duskfall Area returns to its former likeness.

1109402130.content: The moon signals nightfall in the city, yet also illuminates three figures on their way home.

1109402131.content: Don't feel bad, Hel. Let's go look at other dresses tomorrow, okay?

1109402132.content: If I were the store manager and saw the way you spent all afternoon guessing, I would have just told you the answer to the riddle.

1109402133.content: Fashion designers sure are a prideful bunch. The manager doesn't know how to appreciate a kindred spirit.

1109402135.content: It refers to a story from Xu Heng District about a musician and a critic who admired each other.

1109402137.content: They were just very dear to each other.

1109402139.content: A bell rings from a chapel in the distance of the Duskfall Area as we walk Vina back to the reconstruction area, indicating that our day is about to end.

1109402140.content: What? Is it already time to say goodbye?

1109402141.content: Um... I forgot to mention something. The orphanage is organizing a field trip two days from now. Would you like to join us, Hel?

1109402142.content: Hel turns toward me, as if seeking my approval.

1109402143.content: I don't have any issues if you need to apply for a change in your schedule...

1109402144.content: No, I can't on that day. Let's go on a trip another time with just the two of us, Vina.

1109402146.content: I don't like big groups either, so I would love if it's just you and me!

1109402147.content: Mm. I'll come and visit you again, Vina.

1109402149.content: I'll be waiting, just like today!

1109402151.content: Vina seems slightly hesitant after her pinky promise with Hel. She keeps looking at Hel, then at me.

1109402152.content: Is there anything else you want?

1109402153.content: Um... I want Hel to come to my room to give me a goodnight kiss.

1109402154.content: And to tell me a story... just like before.

1109402156.content: But, Vina... I'm not very good at telling stories.

1109402158.content: Hel flips open the book she received from me, titled The Cat in the Forest.

1109402160.content:
Vina: "On the way home, the little girl's father—oh, he's a hunter too—met the black cat that was using the girl's body."

Hel: "Upon recognizing its true identity, he fired at it without hesitating."

Vina: "How could he? That's his daughter..."

Me: "He was blinded by his hatred for the black cat."

Me: "And he... subconsciously believed that his daughter was why the witch had cursed him."

Vina: "Ugh! I hate him! Only an idiot would blame his misfortunes on his loved ones..."

1109402166.content:
Hel: "However, the witch's curse was also a protective blessing."

Hel: "The bullets heading toward the black cat all turned round and went toward the hunter instead."

Vina: "Hmph! I don't care about that stinking hunter! The black cat is going to die if the curse isn't lifted."

Me: "Originally, all the black cat needed to do was return to the banquet and exchange bodies with the little girl again. Then, the curse would return to the girl."

Vina: "But the way things are going... Either the black cat or the little girl is going to sacrifice themself for the other."

Me: "No. In the end, the black cat took the curse upon itself and was reborn under a silent night."

1109402172.content:
Me: It's said that cats have nine lives, after all.

Me: "And the girl at the forest gathering brought the black cat, which had now lost its memory, back into the wonderland."

Vina: Did they become best friends again?

Hel: Yes, inseparable.

Vina: Oh...

Hel: What is it, Vina?

1109402178.content:
Vina: Hmm, does the cat scratch people?

Me: Nope. It is a gentle and lonely child.

Vina: Great! I want to keep a cat too, if I get the chance...

Me: And to try on the magic dress again?

Vina: No, I want a cat. The dress suits Hel better! I want Hel to wear it!

Hel: ...

1109402184.content:
Me: Vina... You seem pretty excited. Will you be able to fall asleep?

Vina: Oh... It's usually Hel who tells me bedtime stories... I don't understand a lot of what she says, so I keep asking questions until I get sleepy.
Hel: Sorry.

Vina: Ah! Don't apologize! Your stories are great too! I-I remember all the stories you tell me!

Me: Would you like to hear another story, Vina?

Vina: Yes!

1109402190.content: Hel and I tell Vina more stories until she is finally content, and falls asleep with a goodnight kiss from Hel.

1109402191.content: On our taxi ride home, we see dazzling fireworks light up the distant sky. It seems the charity event's fireworks show has begun.

1109402193.content: All fireworks fade in the end, but if we don't summon the courage to light them, we will never witness their beauty.

1109403001.content: On this sunny morning, Shu is teaching me how to command the Undertaker Squad in the training room.

1109403002.content: These are some things you must remember when the Undertaker Squad is out on a mission. Do you have any questions?

1109403004.content: Really? I heard that, since visiting Vina, Hel has locked herself in her room when she's not on missions.

1109403005.content: But we shouldn't interfere with a Mod's personal time...

1109403006.content: You need to be more proactive, rookie. What did the coffin call you again? "Incompetent?" You shouldn't give it any further reason to insult you.

1109403007.content:
... Alright.
(Why am I feeling that Lord Mimir is trying to win some strange competition with Ganglati...)

1109403008.content: According to the schedule, today should be Hel's day off.

1109403009.content: I knock on Hel's door, and she opens it gently from within. A small, haggard face emerges from the crack.

1109403012.content: Nothing in particular... But you look terrible...

1109403015.content: The dark circles under her bloodshot eyes seem to say otherwise.

1109403016.content: Are you not feeling well, Hel? I'll take you to the infirmary...

1109403018.content: Upon entering Hel's room, a large pile of sharp metal waste comes into view.

1109403019.content: Oh, Miss Hel's Administrator. You've come at just the right time.

1109403020.content: Ganglati has taken the form of a huge workbench, its four arms holding tight to two tattered sheets of paper.

1109403021.content: Come and help Miss Hel with her work.

1109403022.content: I look at the shabby sheet of paper on the left...

1109403023.content: Is that... a rabbit with butterfly wings?

1109403025.content: This schematic has a BunBun logo... Are you working on something for the Cryptics? But manufacturing is usually Nuadha's responsibility.

1109403026.content: I look to the right and see an illustration of a familiar dress.

1109403027.content: This design... It's the dress we saw at Duskfall Area, right?

1109403028.content: Administrator, you really ought to think of something. Hel has been overworking herself over the last few days.

1109403029.content: If it's too tiring, I can ask Ookuninushi for help...

1109403031.content: Hel resolutely spreads her arms and obstructs my path.

1109403032.content: But you need to take care of your health...

1109403034.content: Hel reaffirms her stand, then closes her eyes as if she's made her final decision.

1109403037.content: Miss Hel plans to exchange this for that designer's dress.

1109403041.content: I kept it because it's cute.

1109403042.content: So, it's just one of Ookuninushi's rejected ideas...

1109403044.content: Hel gently lifts a cushion to conceal her blushing face.

1109403046.content: With pleasure. When Hel was little, her older sister would often tell her the story of a black cat.

1109403047.content: This black cat could bear sickness and pain on behalf of its owner.

1109403048.content: It could also fulfill its owner's wishes. Whatever its owner wanted, from fresh fruit to magical remedies and even dazzling dresses, the cat could provide.

1109403049.content: In the story, there is a dress that allows the girl to transform into the black cat and avoid her cruel father. And Miss Hel has always wished she could have that dress.

1109403050.content: I think I get it now...

1109403051.content: Hel takes out the fairy-tale book I gave her on the balcony the other day and flips to a certain page.

1109403052.content: Just as I thought. It's the same bedtime story we told Vina that night...

1109403055.content: No... What I mean is, I feel like we're being watched...

1109403057.content: Hel pulls the pillow from her face and looks outside...

1109403059.content: Zenkibo make a devilish face at us before running off.

1109403061.content: I don't know what embellishments Zenkibo added to his story, but by noon, all of Division Nine had heard of it.

1109403062.content: And Hel locked herself in her room once again, unwilling to take even a single step outside.

1109403063.content: At noon, I plan on apologizing to Hel, but receive an unexpected call.

1109403065.content: It's been a while, Administrator. I hear a young Modifier is very interested in "Whisper of the Night."

1109403066.content: Hera? How come even you know?

1109403067.content: What do you mean, "even you know?" I also know that little Miss Hel spent an entire afternoon at my shop trying to solve the riddle.

1109403068.content: Your shop? Wait, are you saying the boutique we visited that day is...

1109403069.content: Hmph! I have better things to do than help some investors with their promotional event. I just thought that it's about time Ain Soph's Duskfall Area got some artistic flair.

1109403070.content: So, what do you think of the "Whisper of the Night?"

1109403073.content: "Elegance should be answered with elegance." Since she's got such good taste, I don't mind telling her the solution.

1109403074.content: Help me tell Miss Hel that there are still ten more days before the charity event ends. Before those ten days are up, I want an artwork that is real, artistic, commercial, and philanthropic in exchange for the dress.

1109403076.content: When Hera hangs up, I breathe a sigh of relief, grab some snacks from my office, and head toward Hel's room.

1109403077.content: A work of art that's real, artistic, commercial, and philanthropic...

1109403078.content: Seated by my side, Hel mutters as she tries to think.

1109403080.content: Things that exist in reality are real.

1109403082.content: Artistic items produce an aesthetic effect on the viewer after 1.793 seconds of observation.

1109403083.content: It's something that depends on the viewer's acuity.

1109403086.content: Don't worry. Let's brainstorm it together.

1109403087.content: If I may interject, I do think that I perfectly fulfill all five of Hera's criteria.

1109403088.content: Technically speaking, perhaps... But I don't think Hera would appreciate receiving you as a gift...

1109403089.content: Maybe we can give her the butterfly BunBun Hel chose at the start?

1109403091.content: Hel nods absent-mindedly and throws away the packaging of the fruit jelly she just ate. Once again, her gaze falls on my pocket.

1109403093.content: I pass her a few more jellies.

1109403095.content: You really like sweets, don't you?

1109403096.content: I feel like I'm feeding an adorable little animal... But she's probably just hungry because she skipped lunch.

1109403097.content: Miss Hel, the excessive intake of calories and sugar is harmful to your health.

1109403099.content: No... Ganglati is right. If you're still hungry, how about we go to the restaurant together?

1109403100.content: Mm, I'd like a lava cake... Yawn...

1109403101.content: But lava cakes are high in calories and sugar too...

1109403102.content: You know, you're not alone in liking sweets.

1109403103.content: Do other people like sweets too?

1109403104.content: Let me think. Ver and Osiris should like them... The Cryptics are prone to mental fatigue, so they probably like sweets too...

1109403106.content: I'll teach you how to make them one day.

1109403108.content: Administrator, please tell me the recipe now so I can record it for Miss Hel.

1109403109.content: Thus, I gave Hel the recipe.

1109403112.content: Hel has fallen into a peaceful sleep. Perhaps the stress and fatigue have finally hit her.

1109403113.content: I tuck Hel in, close the door, and leave.

1109403114.content: While on my way to the restaurant to buy some lava cakes, I run into Zenkibo.

1109403115.content: Huh? Administrator? Are you sure you have time to be eating cakes?

1109403116.content: Oh, these are snacks for Hel...

1109403118.content: Zenkibo grabs the cakes and puts them aside.

1109403119.content: The dress! If you don't go get it now, someone else is going to take it!

1109403120.content: But they said it's a designer item that's not for sale...

1109403121.content: Not for sale... Oh... You really shouldn't believe the lies of adults!

1109403122.content: They all talk about "art" and other highfalutin ideals, but most of them are just looking to sell for a higher price.

1109403123.content: No... I don't know about other people, but Hera isn't the type to just sell off her work...

1109403124.content: Hera? The dress you want was made by Hera?

1109403125.content: Yes. With her in charge, we should still have plenty of time...

1109403126.content: Wrong! That makes things even worse, Administrator!

1109403127.content: Both you and Hel have jobs, right? What do you think will happen to the dress if no one brings something Hera will accept?

1109403128.content: Hera will keep it, I guess...

1109403129.content: You're totally wrong! It's definitely going to be auctioned off!

1109403130.content: Anyway, if you need something that Hera will accept in exchange for that dress, just you and Hel aren't going to cut it.

1109403131.content: Do you know Hel that well, Zenkibo?

1109403132.content: Of course! I also often think about how I can prank the entire world!

1109403133.content: That's a pretty weird reason to empathize with someone... You should probably just forget it...

1109403134.content: If many people work hard together, they can make dreams and miracles come true. Think of someone who can help.

1109403136.content: In front of you! I'm right here, aren't I?

1109403137.content: But of course... I'm going to need a favor in return...

1109403138.content: Zenkibo pinches a stack of apology letters between her fingers and looks sheepishly at me while sending various signals with her eyes.

1109403139.content: You want me to help you write your apology letters? Hey, it was you who sneaked into the communications department, messed up all those devices and spilled Miss Shu's coffee just to play pranks on Hel...

1109403140.content: Yes... But Goki and I will help you in return!

1109403142.content: Five for Shu... And three each to the other divisions for using their audio equipment without permission...

1109403144.content: Please, Administrator! Help me with this, and I promise I'll make what you asked!

1109403145.content: Very well. But you'd better not try to play any pranks, unless you want to write an apology letter to Omorfies too.

1109403148.content: Butterfly BunBun? Oh, that one. It was cut due to a lack of funding. I don't even have the schematics for it anymore.

1109403149.content: It pleases me to know there's someone beside the Cryptics who can understand me, Administrator.

1109403150.content: Make? I can make anything, but I will need funds. The more funding I get, the better the production process will go.

1109403151.content: An artwork? That could be difficult... But I'll give it my best!

1109403152.content: I've got to go to the medical bay for a check-up. Hel, could you watch the kitty for me?

1109403153.content: You mean... a handicraft? Sure! I'm glad to do it if it'll help Miss Hel.

1109403154.content: I don't need anything in return... Well, if you could help me get a lectureship at the new aquarium, that would be great!

1109403155.content: Hel emerges from around a turn in the corridor.

1109403158.content: Smiling sweetly, she bends down to gently stroke its head.

1109404001.content: As I was saying, it's like this... How can you not tell what it is?

1109404002.content: It's an especially noisy morning today, as the appointed day with Hera has arrived.

1109404003.content: I've tried my best, but the object you made cannot be identified, Zenkibo. It doesn't match anything in my database. Maybe you should try harder.

1109404004.content: Even the cat doesn't recognize it, Zenki.

1109404006.content: It's a flying dog! A flying dog! These are its wings, and that's the head... And it has a rabbit's ears and tail...

1109404008.content: Scan complete. It is an inorganic object, Miss Hel.

1109404009.content: You're the inorganic object, stupid coffin!

1109404010.content: Oh, one more thing. It can split itself into eight dogs like this! Ah! It broke...

1109404011.content: If we submit Zenki's item to Hera, she'll probably kill us.

1109404013.content: Well, whatever. Making it was much more fun than writing apology letters!

1109404015.content: Sorry, but mine's no good either. I've been so busy that I couldn't finish it in time.

1109404016.content: Luckily, Zenkibo reminded me that I don't have to do this alone, so I asked the others for help.

1109404017.content: And I did manage to put together a stage where you can all display your items.

1109404018.content: I push the stage before them. It is surrounded by railings and has a watchtower and a radar on either side.

1109404019.content: Clouds are the main feature of the backdrop, with the watchtower and radar bridging the sky and ocean.

1109404020.content: There's also space and supports in the middle where Poseidon and the others can display their works.

1109404022.content: Our creations look gorgeous all together like this, but this stage...

1109404023.content: It's a replica of Aether Gazer's balcony. It's a great place for rest and relaxation when you're exhausted.

1109404025.content: Hel silently puts the items everyone made into a storage crate.

1109404026.content: But will Hera accept our creations?

1109404027.content: Hence, Hel and I pay a visit to Hera's lodgings with the works that everyone made.

1109404029.content: When Hera speaks, the atmosphere suddenly grows tense. All we can do is wait silently for her verdict.

1109404033.content: Do you know the story of The Cat in the Forest?

1109404034.content: Yes, it was the first fairy tale that I ever read.

1109404035.content: If the black cat knew the hunter would kill it after it swapped bodies, why did it risk its life to find the little girl's dress?

1109404036.content: Is it only because it grew up with the girl and became part of her family?

1109404037.content: I don't think the cat was motivated by the mere idea of family. If it did, it would only be acting out of a sense of moral obligation.

1109404038.content: The true answer is that the black cat believed it was more qualified than the hunter to be the little girl's family.

1109404039.content: And it was willing to give its life to prove that.

1109404040.content: I see. I've been searching for that answer for a long time. Thank you.

1109404041.content: I hope you find a black cat of your own soon, Hel.

1109404042.content: Thank you, Lady Hera. You are just as beautiful as I imagined.

1109404043.content: Then, head on over to Duskfall Area and get your beloved dress.

1109404044.content: Quickly, Hel grabs my hand and dashes toward the subway station.

1109404045.content: Oh? I see even the elegant Lady Hera has a childish side to her.

1109404046.content: I suppose. I wouldn't call these things cheap, but I'm not particularly interested in them either.

1109404047.content: But don't you think it's just like Aether Gazer? Lively dolphins, fluttering butterflies, and a calm and peculiar rabbit... They're just like all the strange characters they have over there.

1109404048.content: Moreover, her earnest pursuit of beauty is itself quite beautiful. In that sense, the purpose of my creation has been achieved.

1109404049.content: After arriving at the boutique in Duskfall Area, Hel asks the clerk to pack up the dress after trying it on quickly.

1109404050.content: On the way back to Aether Gazer, Hel and I stop by the orphanage to visit Vina.

1109404051.content: Hmm... It seems to be missing a little something when Hel wears it.

1109404053.content: Of course I know that! I'm talking about the dress.

1109404054.content: You're just jealous that the adults have a reason to be proud.

1109404055.content: I'm not... You're a really annoying umbrella...

1109404056.content: For portability and to keep a low profile, Hel had Ganglati take the form of an umbrella.

1109404057.content: Tch. I was only telling the truth. Besides, I did save your life once. Some people can be so ungrateful...

1109404058.content: What are you trying to say?

1109404063.content: Mm. You have a good eye.

1109404064.content: But maybe there are too many plant motifs on it. It makes the dress look a bit dull. Maybe adding some animal designs would improve it.

1109404065.content: Y-Yeah! That's what I meant too!

1109404067.content: Hel quickly glances at the illustration again, then stares at her reflection in the mirror, lost in thought.

1109404068.content: It was lunchtime when we returned to Aether Gazer. Hel wanted to put the dress in her room, so I made a short stop at my office.

1109404069.content: Admin, you're back! How'd it go? Did you get the dress?

1109404070.content: Thanks to all of you, everything went well.

1109404071.content: What's this, Admin? Why is there a black ball in your drawer?

1109404072.content: It's supposed to be a black cat... I was going to present it to Hera too, but I couldn't finish it in time.

1109404073.content: There really isn't a jot of artistic talent in you, rookie.

1109404074.content: If you'd stopped pestering me for coolant while I was working, I would have finished it long ago...

1109404075.content: In the middle of our conversation, someone pushes open the office door.

1109404076.content: A sweet fragrance permeates the air. Hel stands at the door, holding a plate of cakes.

1109404077.content: I tried making lava cakes. Try them.

1109404081.content: Hel? You mean our Hel, whom I never ever see at the restaurant?

1109404082.content: Zenkibo gives Hel a look-over and even pinches her cheek.

1109404083.content: Actually, Hel has always been an adorable girl. It's just that you never noticed.

1109404085.content: What was Hel like before, Admin?

1109404088.content: Why don't you do the honors, Administrator?

1109404091.content: Hel stabs a piece of cake with her fork and shoves it into my mouth before I can say another word.

1109404093.content: After that, everyone starts discussing what happened in Duskfall Area.

1109404094.content: Shu said that, thanks to this charity event, quite a few Ain Soph developers are building new facilities in Duskfall Area.

1109404095.content: Yes. I think the developers intend to rebuild it from the ground up.

1109404096.content: And that means... Hel, that graveyard will no longer exist in two months.

1109404098.content: Hel is visibly saddened by the news.

1109404099.content: It is unavoidable. Shoots of happiness must begin to grow while the embers of sorrow still burn.

1109404100.content: A cruel father, a gentle sister. Will those memories grow distant from her?

1109404101.content: One thing is certain. The Duskfall Area that Hel knows is never coming back.

1109404102.content: Ah... I hope they don't do anything stupid. I still haven't visited Duskfall Area with the captain.

1109404103.content: And that's exactly why the reconstruction of Duskfall Area has been going so quickly.

1109404104.content: I'm fine... Don't worry about me.

1109404105.content: Hel forces a smile, but everyone knows how she really feels.

1109404106.content: Right as I'm about to console Hel, the office's alarm clock starts sounding.

1109404107.content: Oh, Admin! I've got a lecture to give at Valleyrand Aquarium today. I should get going!

1109404108.content: Oh, right! It's assembly time! I'm going to meet the captain!

1109404109.content: One by one, everyone leaves my office to get on with their busy afternoons.

1109404111.content: Hel walks over to me and carefully picks up the black cat I made as if it were a real cat, then looks up to me and asks for it.

1109404113.content: But if you like it, why don't you give me a few days to finish up its tail?

1109404116.content: Our eyes meet, and we fall into an awkward silence, just like on that afternoon a few days ago.

1109404119.content: Duskfall Area will be completely rebuilt soon. Should we pay a visit to some old friends?

1109404121.content: Administrator, I don't have anyone like that.

1109404124.content: But I still want to take a look.

1109404125.content: Well, let me know if you need any help.

1109404128.content: Could you accompany me to visit my sister's grave?

1109404129.content: Of course, but I've got to finish this afternoon's work first.

1109404131.content: After that, Hel and I visit the graveyard again.

1109404132.content: Hel stands silently before her sister's grave, biting her lips and squeezing my hand.

1109404133.content: It is already bedtime by the time we return, but I find myself unable to sleep.

1109404135.content: Is it because I'm not used to her being candid? It feels like something is different now.

1109404136.content: Is she so taciturn because she doesn't want others to see her worry?

1109404137.content: I hope you can get used to Aether Gazer in the way you find most comfortable.

1109404138.content: She's been trying hard to get along with everyone and to remove the mask she always used to wear.

1109404139.content: Could you accompany me to visit my sister's grave?

1109404140.content: Am I... forcing her to put the mask back on?

1109404141.content: It is a humid night, and the buildings outside the window are shrouded in mist.

1109404142.content: ...Just like the Quakes incident three months ago.

1109404143.content: In a daze, I suddenly find myself standing in the middle of a graveyard, having been turned into a black cat.

1109404144.content: I can't believe what is happening. I look around, only to see a man with a scarred face smiling hideously at me.

1109404145.content: He has already fired his pitch-black rifle, the deafening roar of its gunfire indicating its lethality.

1109404146.content: The bullet grazes me and sends up a cloud of dust.

1109404147.content: My wound burns, but the cold continues to seep under my skin. Instinctively, I break into a run.

1109404149.content: I want to cry for help, but I find myself unable to make a sound.

1109404150.content: Damn animal! You want to protect her, don't you? I'm going to kill you then!

1109404151.content: I can hear the hunter shout from behind me. But just as he's about to shoot, I am lifted by a pair of warm and gentle hands.

1109404153.content: The last thing I see is Hel putting me into her sleeve and facing the dark muzzle of the rifle alone.

1109404155.content: I gasp for air. My heart throbs with pain, as if the rifle wound were still on my chest.

1109404157.content: Should I go look for Hel? At this time of night?

1109404158.content: I think back to how Hel protected me in the dream. She is the only person who can comfort me now.

1109404159.content: "Gotta make sure she's safe." I hear a voice inside me saying.

1109404160.content: At that moment, I hear a familiar voice coming from outside my room.

1109404162.content: With movements as graceful as a cat prowling at night, the silver-haired girl sits down beside me.

1109404163.content: You forgot to close your door.

1109404164.content: Sorry, I was lying in bed and must have drifted off...

1109404165.content: You don't have to get up. I've already closed it for you.

1109404166.content: You're covered in sweat. Can't sleep?

1109404167.content: I nod. Hel takes a handkerchief from her pocket and gently wipes away my perspiration.

1109404169.content: Not really. My thoughts were just running wild.

1109404170.content: What's bothering you? Can you tell me?

1109404171.content: I lean closer and open my mouth, but words fail me.

1109404173.content: ...You're wearing your new dress. It does seem different.

1109404175.content: Hel turns gently to the side and leans closer as she speaks.

1109404176.content: Under the silver moonlight, I see my unfinished black cat.

1109404179.content:
Well, I didn't expect you to wear it...
But it looks good on you. Wait, am I dreaming...?

1109404180.content: Speaking of which, why did you...

1109404182.content: Hel holds a finger to her lips, then gestures for me to close my eyes.

1109404183.content: Then, I feel an almost imperceptible touch on my forehead.

1109404184.content: It's not a dream, #{nickname}#. I'm right here.

1109404185.content: I'll always be here, if it makes you feel at ease...

1104201001.content: After visiting the Salon, we decide to stay a couple of extra days in Omorfies to take in some more of the local scenery.

1104201002.content: However, Ver receives a notification from the Overture Squad and left to go back to Ain Soph yesterday. Once I finish packing, I also go to say goodbye to Hades, president of the Society of Muses.

1104201003.content: That's me pretty much packed up, and I've just finished writing up the investigation report. I don't think I've missed anything.

1104201004.content: I guess I should go and say bye to Hades. She must be very busy though, I haven't seen her at the Society for days.

1104201005.content: Should I ask Mintha and Leuce first? They should be arou... Oh, Miss Mintha?

1104201007.content: My apologies, Miss Leuce. I'm always getting you two confused...

1104201008.content: Mintha is here. You can't have a good eye for details, Administrator, if you still can't tell the difference between us.

1104201009.content: I'm sorry. I promise it won't happen again.

1104201010.content: I'll remember now. Miss Leuce's horns are pointing up, and Miss Mintha's horns are pointing down.

1104201011.content: It'll be easier to tell us apart based on our clothes. My apron is black and Leuce's is white.

1104201012.content: Maybe the Administrator is just not smart enough to remember all that.

1104201013.content: Leuce, maybe you can drop that "maybe" in the beginning.

1104201014.content: You're right. I guess stupidity is the only explanation for it, then.

1104201016.content: Anyway, what I wanted to ask you two is whether Lady Hades is around at all? I'd like to say goodbye to her before I leave.

1104201017.content: Lady Hades is currently having her breakfast. Follow me. Except...

1104201019.content: What Leuce wants to say is that, please don't take it to heart if Lady Hades says anything strange.

1104201020.content: Yes, that's what I wanted to say. Mintha summed it up perfectly.

1104201022.content: Oh, you're leaving us so soon? Can't you stay for a few more days?

1104201023.content: I would have loved to have stayed longer in Omorfies, but I'm afraid duty calls.

1104201024.content: There are so many skilled individuals in Aether Gazer, surely it wouldn't matter if I borrowed you for a couple of days more? I'm sure Shu would be able to delegate your tasks to someone else.

1104201025.content: Haha, except it doesn't look good if I'm always passing my work on to someone else. Especially for a newcomer like me.

1104201026.content: That's a shame. In two days' time I'll be much less busy and I was hoping I could... turn you into a puppet.

1104201028.content: Yes. You have such a fascinating bone structure, and your skin is as smooth as porcelain. You'd make an excellent puppet. Heeheehee...

1104201030.content: I can't tell if Hades is joking or not, and start breaking out in a cold sweat. I even bow to her involuntarily.

1104201031.content: What Lady Hades means is that she would like to build a puppet in your image, Administrator. Isn't that right?

1104201032.content: Exactly, Leuce. You're right as always.

1104201034.content: Don't worry, Administrator. The proportion of your limbs is entirely unsuitable to turn you into an actual puppet.

1104201035.content: Besides, nobody would want to buy that. We wouldn't even be able to recoup the cost of the strings.

1104201037.content: Don't get me wrong, I don't want to be turned into a puppet. But being told that I wouldn't sell for much even if I were... Well, that feels even worse somehow.

1104201038.content: Heehee, you two are hilarious. You're joking around with the Administrator even more than I am.

1104201040.content: Shouldn't you be apologizing to our guest instead of me?

1104201041.content: I'm very sorry, Administrator. That was wrong of me. Please don't punish Leuce by making her drive out the mice that have invaded the mansion. She's terrified of mice.

1104201042.content: I'm very sorry, Administrator. That was wrong of me. Please don't punish Mintha by making her drive out the mice that have invaded the mansion. She's terrified of mice.

1104201043.content: It's okay, I didn't really believe you. Why would you think I'd want to punish you?

1104201044.content: Anyway, thank you for everything these past few days. This is probably the nicest place I've ever stayed in my whole life.

1104201045.content: And all of the meals I've had here at the Society have been amazing, the local scenery is stunning, and I saw so many beautiful works on display in the Salon.

1104201046.content: It's been well worth the journey!

1104201047.content: I'm very happy to hear that. You're welcome to come back to the Society of Muses any time, Administrator.

1104201048.content: My only regret is how busy I've been this entire time. Next time I'll definitely make sure I turn you into an ADORABLE puppet.

1104201049.content: Ha... ha... You mean a puppet that looks like me, right? Right?

1104201050.content: Hades is grinning but doesn't answer, and once again I begin to wonder whether she is actually joking or not.

1104201051.content: Heehee, just looking at your face is giving me inspiration...

1104201052.content: She traces a cold finger around my jawline, as her red eyes seem to swallow me whole.

1104201053.content: Such a pity I have all this work to do for the Society... Mintha, Leuce, would you please accompany the Administrator to the photon rail station?

1104201054.content: Sigh, I wanted to skip this next meeting, but old Oceanus said, "A just process ensures just results." Which basically means I have to go.

1104201056.content: Hades sighs sadly, whereas I, who has just been frozen in fear by the gaze of those red eyes, breathe a sigh of relief.

1104201058.content: Er... Just, thanks to you and the Society of Muses for your hospitality.

1104201059.content: Don't mention it. Until next time, Administrator.

1104201060.content: Your luggage is ready, Administrator. Shall we get going?

1104201061.content: We should get going. But first, the Administrator needs to choose a suitable mode of transportation.

1104201062.content: Don't you think driving is the best way to get to the photon rail station?

1104201063.content: They both address me directly, but ignore everything I say in response.

1104201064.content: Can either one of you drive?

1104201066.content: The Society used to have its own car, but last time I took it out to drive Miss Oneiroi to school, I broke the speed limit and had my license revoked.

1104201067.content: That's understandable, speeding can be very dangerous. How about you then, Miss Mintha?

1104201069.content: Wow, you even drive as dangerously as each other...

1104201070.content: But Mintha and I are excellent drivers. If you don't mind the fact we don't have valid licenses...

1104201071.content: Wait, isn't there any other way to get to the station?

1104201073.content: The photon rail station is quite far away on foot, but luckily we have enough time and it passes quickly enough with Mintha and Leuce as company.

1104201074.content: In fact, they turn out to be much chattier than I expected...

1104201075.content: So Lady Hades once owned her own puppet store? I thought puppets were just a hobby of hers.

1104201076.content: Before the founding of the Association for the Appraisal of Unconventional Art, we lived in a place called the Puppet Society and Lady Hades was the president.

1104201077.content: I remember hearing there was a puppet craze in Omorfies a long time ago. I didn't realize Lady Hades had any involvement in it.

1104201078.content: Stop being such a blabbermouth, Leuce.

1104201079.content: Lady Hades' past is also part of Omorfies' history. It doesn't matter if I tell the Administrator.

1104201080.content: It's our duty to teach guests about the history of the Society of Muses.

1104201081.content: Lady Hades is truly an impressive woman. She both runs the Society of Muses and is a senator in the Astral Council, and somehow still has time to be a skilled puppeteer.

1104201082.content: I bet most people would struggle just to do one of those things.

1104201083.content: And that's not all. In her spare time, Lady Hades also helps Miss Oneiroi with her homework.

1104201085.content: Miss Oneiroi is furthering her studies, but she spends most of her time asleep. You can imagine how much coursework has piled up for her by the end of term.

1104201086.content: Because her modules are different each semester, Mintha and I aren't able to help out much. So Lady Hades helps her, too.

1104201087.content: Okay Leuce, you definitely shouldn't have told the Administrator that.

1104201088.content: It's fine, Mintha. The Administrator is going back today, and I trust them to keep this a secret. Besides, Lady Hades has bigger problems to deal with right now.

1104201090.content: Not long ago, some senator's adopted son sent him some clothes made from Shashvat fabric, which Lady Hades happened to see.

1104201091.content: So she went out and bought a ton of clothes made from the same stuff.

1104201092.content: I didn't say anything, but I knew exactly what she was thinking. Dressing that old dinosaur up in Shashvat isn't going to do anything, only... Hnmph!

1104201093.content: Leuce is interrupted by Mintha quickly covering her mouth with her hand.

1104201094.content: Stop being such a blabbermouth, Leuce.

1104201095.content: I'm sorry, it's my fault for being nosey. Don't blame Miss Leuce.

1104201096.content: I think chatting should stay within the boundaries of day-to-day life, and should not extend to private matters.

1104201099.content: I agree. As I'm sure Miss Leuce does too, so I think you can let her go now.

1104201100.content: Hearing my plea, Mintha finally releases Leuce and puts an end to the awkward situation.

1104201101.content: Let us chat about what kind of work you two do on an average day.

1104201102.content: The day-to-day upkeep of the Society of Muses, looking after Miss Oneiroi, and the occasional assessment for the Association for the Appraisal of Unconventional Art.

1104201103.content: Assessments? Are they like written exams?

1104201104.content: No, they are face-to-face appraisals carried out by me and Leuce. If the candidate's art style is distinctive enough and bears sufficient artistic merit, then we'll award them with an Artist Badge.

1104201105.content: But we haven't done an assessment for ages now. It's a shame, I enjoy meeting all the interesting candidates. Like the one who ate spaghetti through their nose...

1104201106.content: Leuce, that was a form of artistic expression and was to be taken seriously. It wasn't polite of you to laugh out loud like you did.

1104201107.content: I understand. I'll be more serious next time.

1104201108.content: It sounds like you both have a lot of unexpected fun in your lives.

1104201109.content: Fun? There have been more fun performances than someone eating spaghetti through their nose.

1104201110.content: Performances? You mean, like dramatic plays?

1104201112.content: Performances given by the two of us.

1104201113.content: Lady Hera said that the scale and form were more like a sitcom than a serious drama.

1104201114.content: ...If Lady Hera was giving her opinion, it must have been a pretty important performance.

1104201115.content: Would you like to see it, Administrator?

1104201117.content: No sooner had I agreed than the "sitcom" performance begins. Mintha and Leuce are the sole cast members, and the entire thing lasts no more than five minutes.

1104201118.content: To be perfectly frank, I don't quite understand what it is I'm watching, but I'm left with the vague feeling that they're confused and helpless.

1104201119.content: Sis, sis, has Master abandoned us?

1104201120.content: Sis, sis, Master is just playing hide-and-seek with us. We just need to wait patiently for Master to find us.

1104201121.content: Ah, okay. But sis, I think my timer module is broken. Listen.

1104201123.content: Leuce, who is playing the younger sister, raps her knuckles against her head to make the sound.

1104201124.content: Don't worry, sis. Master will fix it.

1104201125.content: Really? He didn't look too happy the last time he had to replace our parts.

1104201126.content: I heard him mutter words like "trash" and "junk". Was he talking about you or me?

1104201127.content: I promise you, he definitely wasn't talking about you.

1104201128.content: I promise you, if we just wait here quietly, we'll been found sooner or later.

1104201129.content: Okay. As long as you're here with me, I don't care about broken parts.

1104201130.content: It's just a bit of noise. I can handle it.

1104201132.content: So, Administrator? What did you think?

1104201133.content: I think something bad must have happened to the two sisters...

1104201134.content: Their "master" was a horrible person who'd betrayed them.

1104201135.content: You're our first ever assessor, Administrator, so your opinion is very important to us. Leuce, maybe you should write it down.

1104202001.content: After the brief performance, we continue on our way to the photon rail station, but I continue to have this nagging feeling in my mind.

1104202002.content: Was that script a pure work of fiction? Or is it something that actually happened to Mintha and Leuce?

1104202003.content: Were they acting out their own personal experience?

1104202006.content: Oh, it's nothing. Here, let me carry the suitcase.

1104202007.content: I shouldn't expect you and Miss Leuce to wheel it the entire way to the station.

1104202008.content: It's no bother, puppets are capable of lifting much heavier weights than humans can. This might as well be empty, as far as we're concerned.

1104202009.content: And, given your physical strength, I fear we wouldn't make it to the station in time if you were carrying the luggage.

1104202011.content: Lady Hades' instructions were to "escort the guest to the photon rail station." If you're crushed by your own suitcase on the way, then we will be unable to complete the task assigned to us.

1104202013.content: H-haha... It's my fault for buying so many souvenirs.

1104202014.content: It's fine. Leuce and I are the Top Maids the puppet master has ever produced.

1104202015.content: We could even carry you to the photon rail station with no trouble whatsoever.

1104202016.content: Oh, there's no need for that...

1104202017.content: As we chat, we spot by the side of the road that a family appear to be moving home. All manner of personal belongings are being thrown into cardboard boxes lined up along the courtyard wall.

1104202018.content: An old puppet lies quietly among the chaos, catching our eye.

1104202019.content: Is the original owner throwing that puppet away?

1104202020.content: People who throw out their puppets are the worst.

1104202021.content: Regardless of whether or not they're throwing it out, leaving a beloved possession here among all the newspapers, cans, and old tablecloths is very inconsiderate.

1104202022.content: They are probably a piece of trash themselves.

1104202023.content: Unfeeling, selfish, stingy, fickle. I pray that bad things happen to him.

1104202024.content: I'm sorry, I hope I didn't speak out of turn... Maybe they're just leaving the puppet here for now and will pick it up again later.

1104202026.content: Oh, okay, I understand now. Puppets should never be abandoned.

1104202027.content: I do hope you truly believe that, Administrator.

1104202028.content: If not, you'll be the next person I wish misfortune upon.

1104202029.content: Of course I understand. I'm on your side!

1104202030.content: Okay, Leuce. You can take the Administrator off your prayer list.

1104202031.content: Okay, Mintha. I won't pray for the Administrator.

1104202032.content: I still have the feeling that something's wrong, but... Forget it.

1104202033.content: You're both very lucky, you know.

1104202035.content: Well, what I mean is... Most people only care about having the shiniest, newest stuff. This puppet was probably loved once, but now it's just been thrown out with the trash. It sounds cruel, but it happens all the time.

1104202036.content: But Lady Hades loves all puppets equally.

1104202037.content: She would never do something like that to one of her puppets.

1104202039.content: The maid sisters both tilt their heads in the same direction, as though sizing up a particularly strange object.

1104202041.content: If you believe that Leuce and I are lucky, it means that you don't know anything. What's lucky is being able to live a carefree life in blissful ignorance.

1104202044.content: It's obvious that the Administrator doesn't really understand our lives at all.

1104202045.content: Do not believe for a second that Leuce and I don't live in constant fear of abandonment.

1104202046.content: The situation is much more complicated than you could imagine.

1104202047.content: Oh really? So does that mean, in that performance you just gave me...

1104202048.content: Perhaps it's too difficult to explain. Would you like to watch it again?

1104202050.content: With my departure time drawing ever nearer, the second showing of the maids' play begins. However, I notice subtle differences in this performance compared to the last one.

1104202051.content: This time, Mintha and Leuce accompany their performance with a hand puppet. They say this is because a third person has now appeared in the story.
