1104202054.content: But I can really feel my stomach rumbling. Sis, do you think a passing human could have infected me with their hunger?

1104202055.content: Of course not. Hunger isn't some disease you can catch. I promise you, that's not what's going on.

1104202058.content: But sis, I can feel my body gradually getting heavier and heavier. And when I close my eyes, it's almost as though there's someone beckoning to me.

1104202059.content: They're telling me to go to sleep, that there are beautiful dreams hidden inside all puppets' minds.

1104202061.content: Really? But the voice in my head is telling me to come into the dream with them, and to bring you along as well.

1104202062.content: That's just the noise from your broken timer module, remember?

1104202063.content: Right. It feels like time is passing so slowly without my module.

1104202064.content: As long as I know the time you'll be okay, sis.

1104202065.content: (Is this the psychological journey that every puppet goes through when it's thrown away?)

1104202066.content: (If these two sisters can still talk and interact, then that one we saw earlier...)

1104202067.content: I look over at the old puppet lying in the trash heap.

1104202069.content: Who do these two cute little lambs belong to?

1104202070.content: We're playing hide-and-seek with our master. But our hiding place is too good, and he might not be able to find us.

1104202071.content: You are very well hidden indeed... Haha, you must be very determined to win!

1104202072.content: You must have been here for a very long time already. Why don't you come home with me? It'll at least be warmer there.

1104202073.content: Sis said that puppets can't get cold.

1104202074.content: That may be true, but you're both shivering. What a pair of stubborn little lambs you are!

1104202075.content: We're not shivering. Our joints haven't been greased in a while and they're starting to seize up, that's all.

1104202076.content: Of course. But if you stay out here in the wind and the rain for too long, your joints will start to rust and then no amount of grease will be able to fix you.

1104202077.content: ...But Master is coming to find us.

1104202078.content: Sis, that "da-da, da-da" sound in my head is starting again.

1104202079.content: Yes, even I can hear it. I believe it's caused by a malfunctioning timer module. Little lamb, can you tell me what time and date it is right now?

1104202080.content: The time is now... 514 past midnight on Novanuary 39th...

1104202082.content: Yes, your timer module is definitely broken. Luckily, it's not too late for me to fix it.

1104202083.content: Can you fix puppets? Can you fix my sister?

1104202084.content: Sis, we don't have any money to pay the repair bills.

1104202085.content: I'll think of something. Don't you worry yourself about that.

1104202086.content: You two truly are devoted to each other. But when did I say anything about repair bills?

1104202087.content: But how else are we meant to repay you?

1104202088.content: Let me see... How about, once I've fixed you both, you come and live with me as my maids?

1104202089.content: Both? But I'm the only one that's broken.

1104202090.content: Your sister looks fine on the outside, but any professional can see that her bionic system is malfunctioning. Probably due to water damage.

1104202091.content: If we don't fix her, pretty soon she'll lose the ability to speak. Not even to you.

1104202092.content: Please, you have to fix her! I'll be your maid! Da-da! Da-da!

1104202093.content: The puppet played by Leuce becomes so emotional that the mechanical sound of her malfunctioning starts up again.

1104202094.content: There's nothing wrong with me. Please, fix my sister first.

1104202095.content: Alright. You know, I would have fixed you both up without you playing out this sad story in front of me.

1104202096.content: Thank you. And all you want in return is for us to be your maids?

1104202097.content: Don't think being a maid is an easy job. Yes you'll be required to clean and make coffee, but if you're interested I can also teach you to do much more.

1104202098.content: Cooking, etiquette, how to appreciate the arts, self-defense... I can teach you a lot, as long as you're willing to learn.

1104202099.content: Are puppets even capable of learning these things?

1104202100.content: If anyone else were your teacher, I wouldn't bet on it. But lucky for you, you've met me—perhaps the most talented puppeteer who's ever lived. So...

1104202101.content: If anyone can train you up to the best maids the world's ever seen, it's me.

1104202102.content: (It might just be a hand puppet talking, but its mannerisms and voice are still exactly the same as Hades'...)

1104202103.content: You are a good person. Please allow me to express my gratitude...

1104202104.content: A loud "da-da" rings out, and Leuce's character drops her head and stops moving. She must have suffered a major malfunction.

1104202106.content: Don't worry, her sensors have crashed because of the timer module, that's all.

1104202107.content: You should try and stop moving and talking now, too. Once we get back, I'll give you both a comprehensive inspection.

1104202108.content: The hand puppet representing Hades looks over both of the puppets with great care and attention, almost as though she's giving them a medical exam.

1104202109.content: The younger one's joints are severely worn, the timer module has snapped off and its fragments are lodged in her skull.

1104202110.content: The older one is only suffering from issues with her bionics system, but it's quite a tricky case. What's more, she's been built with old-gen high-density parts.

1104202111.content: Those will be hard to find, even on the black market...

1104202112.content: If you need to scrap us, can you at least make sure we both stay together?

1104202113.content: I'm sorry for all the trouble we've caused. It can't be easy dealing with two broken-down puppets.

1104202114.content: But I thought we had a deal? I'm going to fix you, and you're going to be my maids.

1104202115.content: You're both so cute, there's not a chance in hell I'd dream of scrapping you.

1104202116.content: Thank you so much. If you can fix my sister, I'll be the most loyal maid you could ever imagine. I'll do whatever you ask of me without question.

1104202117.content: Heehee, I dare say your sister would say exactly the same thing if she were awake.

1104202118.content: You could make a start now and get me a coffee? Milk, no sugar. I'll fix your sister in the meantime.

1104202120.content: Thanks to the hard work of the "Hades" hand puppet, Leuce regains consciousness.

1104202121.content: I think I had a very strange dream... Hey, sis, I can't hear that noise in my head anymore!

1104202122.content: I erased them for you. My poor little lost lamb, don't you want to thank me?

1104202124.content: Actions speak louder than words, my little lamb. Didn't you say you'd be willing to be my maid if I repaired you? That you'd stay here for as long as it takes to repay me for saving your life?

1104202127.content: The sitcom once again draws to a close.

1104202129.content: I can feel a wave of emotion surging through my chest.

1104202130.content: So everything in your sitcom was real? All of this really happened to you, Miss Mintha and Miss Leuce?

1104202131.content: You were abandoned by your former owner, and were left waiting in the cold for him to return until you were taken in by Lady Hades and turned into maids for the Society of Muses.

1104202132.content: Lady Hades fixed you, and taught you many new skills including how to fight.

1104202133.content: I thought you'd been with the society ever since you were born. I'm sorry if I ever said anything to upset you.

1104202134.content: If I'd known all this before, I wouldn't have called you "lucky."

1104202135.content: I didn't stop to consider your past, and for that I'm very sorry.

1104202136.content: We never said this is what happened to us.

1104202137.content: Back then, Lady Hades was the only person in Omorfies skilled enough to build self-aware autonomous puppets.

1104202138.content: So yes, even though we were discarded before meeting Lady Hades, we have no memory of it.

1104202140.content: The Administrator can't even distinguish between fantasy and reality. How "lucky" you are to live such a carefree life.

1104202141.content: But the Administrator is emotional—look, there are tears. That means we put on a very good show.

1104202142.content: We're certain to win an award at the next New Moon festival.

1104202144.content: Even though I feel there's more to it than that, Mintha and Leuce are insisting that it's a work of pure fiction, so I decide to press no further.

1104202145.content: Nevertheless, I quietly make a decision to myself.

1104202146.content: We should get going if you don't want to miss the photon rail.

1104202148.content: To the maids' surprise, I go over and ring the doorbell of the house.

1104203001.content: Puppets are commodities, and are therefore destined to one day lose their value and be disposed of. But we shouldn't think of it as an inevitability.

1104203002.content: That's why I decided to knock on these people's door and ask them what they're doing with the discarded puppet outside.

1104203003.content: I'm sorry to bother you, I was just wondering what you were planning on doing with everything you've put out in boxes on the street here.

1104203004.content: It's just that I would like to purchase that puppet from you. How much would you want for it?

1104203005.content: I'll transfer the money into your account immediately. The puppet? I want to add it to my collection as a souvenir of my vacation here.

1104203006.content: After a quick negotiation, I bought the puppet for just over its scrap price. Strangely enough, its owner was quite friendly and not the type of person I'd imagined would callously throw a puppet away.

1104203007.content: Did you just buy that old puppet, Administrator?

1104203008.content: He said the previous tenant had just left it there, but now they're renovating the house there's no more space for it. That's why it was outside.

1104203009.content: What a kind soul you are, Administrator.

1104203010.content: It was the right thing to do. It might not be as advanced as you two are, but it's still a self-aware puppet that deserves to be treated with respect.

1104203011.content: At the very least, it should be given a better home than a dumpster or workshop. That shouldn't be what every puppet is destined for.

1104203012.content: Very well said, Administrator, but I'm afraid that we're now going to miss your scheduled photon rail.

1104203013.content: It's partly our fault too—those performances took up a lot of time. And given that we're traveling on foot as well, we should have realized that it would take longer than usual...

1104203014.content: It doesn't matter. If I can't make it home today, we might as well head back to the Society of Muses.

1104203015.content: Anyway, this puppet is pretty beat up and it's beyond my skill to fix. Maybe Lady Hades will be able to help.

1104203016.content: There's no need to bother her. We can take care of that.

1104203017.content: Yes, we'd be glad to help you, Administrator.

1104203018.content: This is a toolbox for repairing puppets, and most of the materials inside were selected by Lady Hades according to traditional restoration techniques. They are already quite rare on the market, so please handle them with care, Administrator.

1104203019.content: Thank you, but where am I supposed to get all of those things from?

1104203020.content: We can start with a soft brush to clean the surfaces, especially around the joints. Administrator, can you do that? Make sure you're gentle, though.

1104203021.content: Once the puppet is clean, we'll be able to better see what needs repairing. If it's just a matter of superficial scratches, all we need to do is to polish the area.

1104203022.content: If there are holes, they'll need to be filled with a special material made by Lady Hades herself, like this, and then polished and painted to regain its original color.

1104203023.content: Okay, well let's start off with the cleaning then!

1104203024.content: Based on my experience, I would estimate that a puppet of this size will take two and a half hours to clean.

1104203025.content: What? Just to clean it?? Not even including any potential repair work? That's much longer than I'd have said.

1104203026.content: You must be patient. Now this puppet belongs to you, its destiny has become intertwined with your own.

1104203027.content: You are now responsible for this puppet until the very end. Repairs are only one aspect of it.

1104203028.content: This all sounds very arcane... Fine, let's at least try to get it cleaned up today.

1104203029.content: What follows next can only be described as "hard labor." The puppet is actually a very intricate structure, and far more difficult to clean than I'd anticipated.

1104203030.content: Administrator, here's a nice cup of hot coffee for you.

1104203031.content: Thank you, Miss Mintha. Could you find another brush for me, please? I think I was pressing too hard just now and snapped it.

1104203033.content: Administrator, here's a cake fresh out the oven for you.

1104203034.content: Miss Leuce, would you mind fetching me some glue? I accidentally pulled some of the puppet's eyelashes off.

1104203036.content: I thought you said it was just the eyelashes? Looks like you've disconnected the entire eye.

1104203037.content: I just wanted to take them off so I could wipe them clean properly. I didn't realize the eye would come out with them...

1104203038.content: It's okay, I can put it back in for you... And voilà!

1104203039.content: Miss Leuce, your maneuver on this is really impressive.

1104203041.content: Here are some manuals that might help you repair the puppet. You should read them if you get a chance.

1104203042.content: "The Complete Guide to Puppet Use and Repair." It looks very technical, and very thick! Are you sure I can read this all in one night?

1104203043.content: Learning has no limits. Besides, the chapter on puppet repair is only pages 1500-2200, so you only need to read that section.

1104203044.content: It can't have been easy carrying such a heavy book all the way from the library.

1104203045.content: That's why you're the one who's going to be taking it back.

1104203047.content: It takes most of the day, but the puppet is finally clean.

1104203048.content: I slump over and rest my forehead on "The Complete Guide to Puppet Use and Repair," when what appears to be a bookmark catches my eye.

1104203050.content: They initially look like doodles, but they're very weird. There are three little people dancing, two sitting listening to a teacher, and this one... Are they supposed to be flying a kite?

1104203051.content: I don't have time for this, I need to fix the puppet before I leave tomorrow.

1104203052.content: I don't know how long I'm there for, but when I look up I see that nighttime has engulfed the Society of Muses.

1104203053.content: I rub my eyes and reach up to stretch, when my hands suddenly brush against something soft.

1104203054.content: It takes a few seconds for my brain to register what it is, and when I turn my head to check...

1104204003.content: I apologize profusely, unsure whether the face in front of me is being friendly or threatening. Lady Hades doesn't appear to be listening, however.

1104204004.content: Did the little lamb that was supposed to go back to Ain Soph get itself lost?

1104204005.content: Or was it enjoying all that green grass along the way, and realized it didn't actually want to leave?

1104204006.content: Don't laugh at me, but... on the way to the photon rail station, we came across this family moving house and I ended up buying an old puppet from them because they were going to throw it out.

1104204007.content: Oh really? Is it a collector's piece?

1104204008.content: No, it's just a normal puppet. But I couldn't bring myself to leave it there, so I knocked on the door and offered to pay for it.

1104204009.content: However, it's pretty badly damaged and in need of repair. I've been working on it all day, and the time must have gotten away from me.

1104204010.content: So much effort for a discarded puppet.

1104204011.content: I do hope you didn't let Mintha and Leuce influence you in any way.

1104204012.content: Of course not! I guarantee it. Although it did all start when they performed their sitcom for me...

1104204013.content: Oh? Was it the show they wanted to submit to the New Moon? I didn't realize they were handing out sneak previews.

1104204014.content: So I wouldn't say they influenced me exactly... But they did get me thinking about how sad it must be for puppets that have been abandoned.

1104204015.content: Well, that sitcom is an adaptation of their own experience. It's only natural you'd find it moving.

1104204016.content: So it was real? But they told me they have no memories from before you found them.

1104204019.content: Everything they know about their past before coming here is what I've told them.

1104204020.content: But why would you do that?

1104204021.content: Why would Lady Hades, who loves puppets so much, tell them such a sad story?

1104204022.content: Just because I'm their owner doesn't mean I have the right to conceal their past from them.

1104204023.content: Besides, they asked me. It was like when a child asks their parents where babies come from.

1104204024.content: I chose to be honest with them. That way, I was able to be there for them as they confronted and accepted this part of their past.

1104204026.content: I don't know what to say. Hades looks at me and smiles playfully.

1104204027.content: Anyway, I'm impressed at how much of this puppet you've been able to restore. Have you ever studied the art of puppet making, Administrator?

1104204028.content: No, never. A lot of this is thanks to Miss Mintha and Miss Leuce.

1104204029.content: I would never have been able to do this without their help.

1104204030.content: Interesting. A complete puppetry novice trying to fix up an old puppet just to spare it its fate of the scrapheap.

1104204031.content: Now it'll have a brighter future.

1104204032.content: There aren't many people who care about the future of puppets.

1104204033.content: Oh, Miss Leuce mentioned something about it. That's why it's on my mind.

1104204035.content: She said, now this puppet belongs to me, our destinies are intertwined and I should be responsible for it until the very end.

1104204036.content: I think Leuce wanted to say that the puppet has formed a bond with you.

1104204037.content: Ah, that's a much easier way to put it.

1104204038.content: Haha. As a puppet maker myself, it's only natural to empathize with your creations.

1104204039.content: But I form my bonds with my puppets much earlier than you have here, Administrator. For me, it starts while they're still a blueprint and a pile of components on the workbench.

1104204040.content: Do you also have that kind of bond with Miss Mintha and Miss Leuce?

1104204041.content: ...I think my bond with Mintha and Leuce goes even deeper than that.

1104204042.content: I felt so sorry for them as I was watching their play. I didn't know their past was so traumatic.

1104204043.content: And that's why I wanted to buy this one. I wanted it to have a better life.

1104204044.content: Your behavior is as understandable as ever, Administrator.

1104204046.content: As a reward for your good deed, I'll help you fix this puppet.

1104204047.content: Really? Oh, thank you, Lady Hades!

1104204048.content: Miss Mintha and Miss Leuce showed me how to clean it, but if you could restore its appearance and fix the broken parts I would be so grateful!

1104204049.content: Hmm, I can't say this is the best cleaning job I've ever seen.

1104204050.content: I mean, it was my first time...

1104204051.content: With Lady Hades' help, the work goes much faster and we're even done before dinner.

1104204052.content: It's then that Lady Hades notices all the doodles on the desk. She takes the drawings and examines them closely, her eyes softening.

1104204053.content: Where did you find these, Administrator?

1104204054.content: Oh, those? They were inside "The Complete Guide to Puppet Use and Repair." I thought they were bookmarks at first.

1104204055.content: I think Mintha and Leuce must have drawn these when they first arrived at the Society.

1104204056.content: Was that when you were head of the Puppet Society?

1104204057.content: Yes. You three did have a nice long chat on the way to the station, didn't you?

1104204058.content: I didn't understand what the drawings are meant to represent. What's the meaning behind these three dancing people?

1104204059.content: That's Mintha, Leuce and me having a snowball fight.

1104204060.content: Oh, so is this Miss Mintha and Miss Leuce listening to one of your lessons?

1104204061.content: This is when Mintha and Leuce were being retrained. They started off as high-level self-aware puppets, but their combat performance was far behind that of the Modifiers.

1104204062.content: So I blessed them with the Divine Power of my Access Key and replaced their internal drives to give them a greater capacity to think and learn, and for their minds to grow over time.

1104204063.content: Ah, so they remember those times?

1104204064.content: And this last one is the three of you flying a kite?

1104204065.content: Oneiroi is the one flying the kite, and that's Drowsie holding the string. The two chasing behind are Mintha and Leuce. You can probably guess who's the one sitting off in the distance with a cup of coffee.

1104204066.content: You, Oneiroi, Miss Mintha and Miss Leuce seem like you're all one big family.

1104204067.content: Yes! I remember this man in glasses once said that family is an essential component of happiness.

1104204068.content: I don't necessarily want to agree with his ideas, but I must admit he's onto something.

1104204070.content: You also need to consider how you're going to keep your puppet in a good condition. After all, you're unlikely to ever have another opportunity to work with a skilled puppet master.

1104204071.content: Yes. I will take good care of her. She won't be abandoned again.

1104204072.content: Heh heh. That's the spirit, isn't it? Well, now I'm more convinced that it is really a bad idea to let you go so easily...

1104204073.content: Lady Hades, please don't say something like that...

1104204074.content: I can't tell if that smile on her face is a playful or a genuine one. I step back rather clumsily, but a few strings, thin yet tough like steel wires, come out of nowhere and caught me in my waist. I can't move a bit now.

1104204075.content: (Shoot. Now I've really become a puppet of hers...)

1104204076.content: However, I suppose you won't have much time to spend with your puppet once you get back. Am I right?

1104204078.content: Heh heh, where's all that determination gone now? Alright, I guess we will just have to...

1104204079.content: Your midnight snack is ready, Lady Hades.

1104204080.content: Mintha enters the room while I am nervously waiting for Hades to continue.

1104204081.content: Thank you, Mintha. Oneiroi must still be dreaming. Bring the food over here and the four of us can eat together.

1104204083.content: Before we eat, let me return "The Complete Guide to Puppet Use and Repair" to the library.

1104204085.content: No no, I'm happy to do it!

1104204086.content: Are you sure you don't need my help, Administrator?

1104204087.content: It's fine, it's only a book. I can manage.

1104204089.content: With tremendous effort, I finally manage to heave the weighty tome back onto its shelf in the library.

1104204090.content: When I get back, the table is full of steaming hot food. Hades, Mintha, Leuce and I take our seats and tuck in.

1104204091.content: Admin, you have repaired a puppet on your own for the first time. Good job. But I'm sure you understand it better now that healing the scars deep within a puppet's heart is not something that only takes you a day or two to finish.

1104204092.content: That's why I have a special gift I'd like to give to you.

1104204093.content: You're not saying that you want to turn me into a puppet and keep it yourself?

1104204095.content: Heehee, of course I'm not going to let such a good idea slide, but it's not something I'm going to obsess over. No, the gift I wanted to give you is this...

1104204096.content: Like a magician, Hades suddenly conjures up a puppet from behind her back. Its facial features are incredible lifelike, its clothes immaculate. It looks exactly the same as Hades herself.

1104204097.content: A little something to remember me by.

1104204098.content: Hades' puppet doppelganger sits down on her lap, and looks me up and down with the same cunning gaze as her creator.

1104204099.content: Mintha, isn't this the commemorative puppet Lady Hades made when the Puppet Society transformed into the Association for the Appraisal of Unconventional Art?

1104204100.content: This is the one and only puppet in the whole world. Administrator, you are really lucky to have it.

1104204101.content: You hear that, Admin? It's a special gift.

1104204104.content: It is meant to keep your repaired puppet company. But if you ever find yourself missing me or Omorfies after you return, you can speak to her. And if you ever get lonely, I give you permission to cuddle her as you fall asleep.

1104204106.content: Plenty of people go to sleep with a puppet, but this one looks so much like Hades that just the thought alone makes me feel embarrassed.

1104204107.content: Of course. This is my gift to you, which means she belongs to you now. Don't forget that her destiny is now tied up with yours.

910401001.content: System status is normal, 280,000 stream processors online... Conditions met. The Mimir system has authorized the shifting survey, Administrator.

910401002.content: Right... and what's the goal of this experiment again?

910401003.content: The same as the 17th experiment: to attempt to fix the Anchor to a more complete section of the World Line. The Mimir system will take care of the rest.

910401004.content: We've only increased the Anchor's stability. Its functionality is unchanged.

910401006.content: I'm not convinced that Admin can wrap that simple mind around all the contingencies.

910401008.content: Hmph... Point is, don't hang around just to satisfy your own curiosity like last time.

910401009.content: I'll... BunBun-0 will worry about you.

910401010.content: ...What's there to be worried about? Isn't the survey pretty much like having a dream? Just wake me up if there's a problem.

910401011.content: I said it would FEEL like a dream, but it's not actually that simple. Your brain will be occupied by a rapidly processing stream of information.

910401012.content: If you wake up midway, the information overload could scramble your cognition, cause temporary amnesia, or even leave you in a vegetative state...

910401013.content: Yikes... Can I request ten times the life insurance?

910401014.content: That way, even if I end up a vegetable...

910401015.content: Before I can finish my sentence, Ookuninushi covers a hand over my mouth and shoves me into the survey chamber.

910401016.content: Enough doom and gloom... Let's begin the experiment.

910401018.content: A huge column of light bores through my vision. Countless dazzling energies visible to the naked eye flow around it.

910401019.content: Idealbild... No matter how many times I see it, it always blows me away.

910401020.content: Time is ticking. After a brief moment's reverence, I focus my consciousness quickly downwards in search of a World Line fragment not yet swallowed up by the massive vortex.

910401021.content: Before long, the sheen of a fairly complete crystal pillar catches my eye—Not yet buried by Gaea, it's a section of the World Line that never existed.

910401022.content: Looks complete, more complete than any other I've seen!

910401024.content: Without hesitation, I launch the Anchor's targeting program. There's a brief vibration, then a crisp sound echoes in my mind.

910401025.content: Looks like it worked... Huh? Why am I... Uh oh...

910401026.content: Like a clumsy angler being yanked into the water by some gigantic creature, a heavy pulling sensation immediately drags me down...

910401027.content: What's going on? We've lost Admin's signal again...

910401028.content: What? Did our beacon pattern recognition stop working? What about the Anchor?

910401029.content: The Anchor is secure. The Mimir system is preparing to lock on to the World Line.

910401030.content: Strange... The indicators show that Administrator has entered a REM sleep... but securing the Anchor was supposed to induce a deep sleep state.

910401031.content: Hm... Assuming everything's okay, Admin must have gotten distracted by something shiny again. I'll recheck the tracking system.

910401032.content: Silly Admin, always making us worry.

910401033.content: Ookuninushi shakes her head. She takes a long look at the survey chamber, then turns to leave. All they can do now is wait for its occupant to wake up.

910401037.content: Looking into her faintly glowing golden eyes, I return to my senses. It then occurs to me that I'm in a completely unfamiliar place.

910401038.content: It's a lavishly decorated yacht, and Odin is seated at a bar in front of me. She gently sways the glass in her hand and seems to smile.

910401041.content: Without saying another word, she gets up and walks over to me. She produces a letter and places it in my hand.

910401042.content: It's a VIP invitation to the Valleyrand's yacht, the Twilight Pearl. There aren't that many rules here. Anything you'd like, we've got it.

910401043.content: I've even managed to get Gengchen to come tonight. Exciting, no? I picked out a nice outfit for her, I think you'll like it too.

910401045.content: Before I can completely react, I feel a light touch on my cheek. When I look back up, Odin is gone.

910401046.content: All I hear is a somehow encouraging voice in the air.

910401048.content: What's going on...? Who am I? Where am I? What am I supposed to be doing?

910401049.content: As if in answer to this disconcerting situation, the rhythmic cadence of high heels approaches from a nearby stairs.

910402001.content: I'm usually too busy to go anywhere for fun.

910402002.content: I'm just taking a little break to attend this "yacht meeting." If I don't hear from the others by the end of the night, I'll head back to work.

910402004.content: An old friend, and a few associates.

910402005.content: Odin said she'd contacted them a while ago, yet we're the only ones who showed up...

910402006.content: Gengchen chats casually with me as if we've long been good friends.

910402007.content: It takes a while before I'm finally certain that I followed the Anchor into this unknown World Line. And here, all is calm. Turing never attacked, and there was no crisis either...

910402008.content: A faint scent seems to be drifting towards me, clearing my head.

910402010.content: Oh, um... I just didn't expect to see you here...

910402011.content: Is that so? She told me you invited me here tonight, though she didn't say why.

910402012.content: We haven't seen each other in a long time. Of course, as soon as I arrived, she dragged me off to talk about some business. I'm sure you've gotten sick of waiting around.

910402014.content: Fortunately, the night is still young. We still have some time to unwind.

910402015.content: It's not every day that we get a break like this. Want to walk on the deck with me?

910402016.content: I look around the luxury yacht. It's equipped with everything from medical equipment to entertainment hardware. Valleyrand's designers sure didn't waste their budget on anything dull.

910402017.content: Sure, I haven't had the chance to get a good look around yet.

910402018.content: As Gengchen and I head for the deck, I notice that her pace is much slower than usual. She occasionally lifts the hem of her dress, as if afraid to get it dirty.

910402019.content: Is all this tip-toeing really necessary?

910402020.content: Well, it's Odin's dress. I rarely wear formal attire like this, so I'm not really used to it.

910402021.content: She looks down, examining the intricate ornamentation on her gown, then turns from side to side, giving me a look at the design from each angle.

910402024.content: Ahem... What I think isn't important. What do you think?

910402025.content: I don't know much about clothing design, but it seems quite refined. I imagine it's only for very important occasions.

910402026.content: As for me... I rarely get such opportunities.

910402027.content: The rarer the experience, the more it should be savored.

910402028.content: I think Odin must have invited you here so you could relax a little—you know, to step back from the grindstone and enjoy some much-needed R&R, to live a little...

910402029.content: As I ramble on, Gengchen looks at me with those blue eyes and seems to smile.

910402031.content: We walk to the deck together. An attendant comes over and passes us drinks. We continue strolling along the ship's rail.

910402032.content: Time passes gently between our softly spoken words and the changing view. This trip and the company seem too extravagant to speak of, but since we're already here...

910402034.content: As the yacht sails over the white waves, we walk together toward a faraway land painted to life by the sea and the wind.

910403001.content: After feeling like I'm hurtling through a tunnel made of erratic mosaics, it's several minutes before my vision clears and I feel firmly grounded in reality again.

910403003.content: Admin, how many fingers am I holding up?

910403004.content: Three... I'm fine. And I want no more weird tests on me...

910403005.content: Certain that nothing's changed since I began the shifting survey, I breathe a sigh of relief. I sit up, and a cardstock invitation falls from the folds of my clothing.

910403006.content: The moment my eyes land on the card, memories that had faded away with the lost World Line begin to resurface.

910403007.content: Odin's words, Gengchen's smile, looking at the sea from the deck, the sound of the wind and the waves...

910403008.content: I give a condensed account of what happened in my dream, but they don't look the least bit surprised.

910403009.content: Heimdall withdraws the invitation from the instrument at her side, skimming the test report as she does so.

910403010.content: It's identical to any ordinary matter found on the Surface Layer. It was probably materialized from the last remaining data in your memory by the survey equipment during the Anchor retrieval process.

910403011.content: As far as we're concerned, the people and things in other World Lines shouldn't exist...

910403013.content: They still don't exist. Like I said, what was materialized was "the last remaining data in your memory." The human brain can't actually process that much information instantaneously. Something the size of this envelope is probably the limit.

910403014.content: I nod my head, unable to help but lament despite the inevitability of this answer.

910403015.content: Head in the clouds again, Admin?

910403017.content: But if you look at it that way, then it really is just like having a dream...

910403018.content: Heimdall passes me the envelope, and I accept it with mixed feelings. Rather than fade away, the memories that never happened left by the world that never existed only grow clearer.

910403019.content: This letter doesn't have much research value. If you like, you could wrap it up and keep it in your personal storage as a memento.

910403020.content: After all, you're the only one who remembers what you saw and did during the shifting survey.

910403021.content: Heimdall and Ookuninushi leave. I sit for a while in the lab. The sense of dislocation from crossing World Lines gradually dissipates, leaving only a hint of nostalgia to sink in.

910403022.content: I wonder if in the next survey... I'll see that place again?

1102701001.content: Upon returning from their combat operations on the island, the members of the Winter Squad are given a welcome leave of absence.

1102701002.content: We're told it's for rest and recuperation, but I prefer to think of it as a vacation—what can be better than whiling away the stifling summer days reading and playing video games in a nice, air-conditioned room?

1102701003.content: The island's mysterious jungle and the shadow of the Siren mirage begin to fade from memory, until they're nothing more than yet another entry in the combat log.

1102701004.content: Yawn... Finally it's evening. It must be cool enough to go outside by now. I think a quick stroll will do me some good.

1102701005.content: As I step outside, I see two shadowy figures emerge at the end of the corridor. The one in front is moving extremely quickly, leaving the one behind to stumble clumsily behind as they're dragged forward.

1102701007.content: Master's not here, but can't you just... can't you just obey me for once? St-stop!

1102701008.content: The girl grips the leash tightly and digs her heels into the floor, and is finally able to get the pet dog to stop. I finally recognize Leviathan, and wave at her.

1102701009.content: Good evening, Leviathan. Taking the dog out for a walk?

1102701010.content: Oh, hi Admin. This is Fenrir, Master's husky. You must have seen him before.

1102701013.content: I was about to take Fenrir out for his walk, but he's been pretty naughty lately. He likes running off, and it's really hard to stop him because he's so strong.

1102701015.content: Stop complaining, I know you're only taking advantage of me because I'm weak. If I was healthy, I'd be able to deal with you...

1102701016.content: It might be due to her frustration with Fenrir, but as Leviathan talks she suddenly bursts into tears, which roll down her cheeks like pearls from a snapped necklace. I can't help but feel a bit awkward.

1102701017.content: Leviathan is usually so full of energy and doesn't let anything get to her. I don't think I've ever seen her cry.

1102701018.content: Hey hey, why the tears? Here, I've got some tissue.

1102701019.content: Maybe there's a reason why Fenrir doesn't want to go outside? I'm sure he's not being a pain on purpose—dogs aren't that smart, right?

1102701020.content: I just want to look after him, but he keeps getting angry with me. Bad dog, no more treats for you. Wahhh...

1102701021.content: As Leviathan continues to wail, I kneel down to get eye-level with Fenrir and try to find a way to communicate with him.

1102701022.content: Fenrir, dyu wanna go out for walkies? If not, Leviathan and I will just take you back.

1102701024.content: Did he understand me? Fenrir suddenly turns around and starts walking towards the exit. Leviathan's tears turn into a smile, and she extends a hand to invite me along.

1102701025.content: You should come with us, Admin!

1102701026.content: We're just going to go around the park then come back, it won't take long. Please!

1102701027.content: Of course I'll come with you—as long as you promise there'll be no more tears.

1102701029.content: There's hardly anyone here. Fenrir, come here boy! You should stay close too, Admin, so we don't get spotted.

1102701030.content: It is very quiet here, but I don't understand why we're sneaking around and whispering...

1102701031.content: Because of the other people in the park. Last time I brought Fenrir here, everyone thought I was a kid and kept saying, "Oh, what's a little girl like you doing with a big dog like that?"

1102701032.content: They've actually been reported multiple times because it's "dangerous." I was even chased by park security once.

1102701033.content: Since then, Master has been the one who's taken him out for walks.

1102701034.content: Leviathan seems to relax now that she's told me. She sits on a bench, and Fenrir comes over to lie at her feet, whimpering softly.

1102701035.content: Speaking of your master, it's been a while since I've since Vidar. Is she okay?

1102701036.content: The Cryptics are saying that's she's not doing so well. When I've been to visit, I've only been able to speak with her through the door for a couple of minutes. I don't know how long she'll be like this for.

1102701037.content: What do you mean? Is Vidar sick?

1102701038.content: I'm sorry, Leviathan, I should have realized sooner...

1102701039.content: You don't have to apologize, Admin. It's not like it's your fault.

1102701040.content: So you've been to the Cryptics for help?

1102701041.content: They said her condition's complicated, and they can't guarantee she'll ever get better.

1102701042.content: You two used to live in the polar ice plains. Could it be linked to the change in surroundings?

1102701043.content: But if that was the case, then you'd be sick too...

1102701044.content: I don't know, but it is true that her health started going downhill once we'd moved to Aether Gazer.

1102701045.content: She instinctively relies on it being cold. Once her body temperature reaches a certain warmth, she falls into this weakened state where she's unable to do anything.

1102701046.content: Her hyperthermia gets worse if she overuses her Divine Power or stays too long in a warm place, and this affects her movement. She dreads the summer. Wahhh...

1102701047.content: I thought you promised me no more tears?

1102701049.content: I didn't mean to cry, but I can't help it when I think about how Master has to stay in a cold room to recover, unable to go out or take Fenrir on walks.

1102701050.content: I'm sure the Cryptics will think of something to help her. Vidar will get better, you'll see.

1102701051.content: Until then, you need to look after yourself and Fenrir. Don't give Vidar extra reasons to worry.

1102701052.content: That goes to you too, Fenrir. Stop causing trouble for Leviathan.

1102701054.content: Fenrir sits next to Leviathan and nuzzles her leg.

1102701056.content: That's Fenrir's way of saying sorry to you.

1102701059.content: Oh, I know what I have to do! If I can get Fenrir to like me, it'll be so much easier for me to look after him!

1102701061.content: Now, is there anything else we can do for Vidar while we're waiting for the Cryptics to find a cure for her? I think she'd appreciate any help she can get.

1102701062.content: Yeah there is... Ookuninushi told me once that Countertide Whalesong could be useful in curing her hyperthermia.

1102701063.content: Countertide Whalesong? Isn't that your Access Key?

1102701064.content: Yes, the new one I found on the island. Ookuninushi is currently running a data analysis on it in the lab.

1102701066.content: I'm not sure, but it seemed to when I was fighting Siren in the depths.

1102701067.content: When Siren's consciousness was shattered, I was also hit by the wave of Bane Energy. Something that strong should have broken every bone in my body.

1102701068.content: But when I saw you on the search and rescue ship, you didn't look like you'd be affected by Bane Energy at all.

1102701069.content: That's why I think the Divine Power in that Access Key must have healed me somehow. And if it can do that, then surely it can take care of Master's hyperthermia no problem.

1102701070.content: As Leviathan and I chat, her communicator starts to beep.

1102701072.content: Sorry boy, looks like we're going to have to cut your walk short today.

1102701074.content: What's that? You don't mind? Why, thank you, Fenrir!

1102701075.content: Judging from his wagging tail, Fenrir doesn't seem to mind at all.

1102701077.content: Get home safe. Actually, on second thoughts, let me come with you. You never know, you might need my help with something.

1102701078.content: Really? I don't want to drag you from your work.

1102701079.content: It's okay, I'm not that busy anyway.

1102701080.content: Thanks, I really appreciate it. Let's go!

1102701081.content: Leviathan and I walk Fenrir to the Cryptics laboratory.

1102701082.content: Woah, is this Ookuninushi's lab? I've not seen any of this stuff before. Oooh, look at that cute toy bunny!

1102701084.content: That's not a toy, it's a new AGI Mecha model called BunBun-0. It's one of Ookuninushi's most famous inventions.

1102701085.content: Oh, I see. Does that means there's also a BunBun-1, BunBun-2 and BunBun-3?

1102701086.content: Yes, and they all provide vital support on the battlefield.

1102701087.content: Leviathan? You're later than scheduled, but still within an acceptable range. At least I'll still be able to go home at a regular time.

1102701089.content: I know about Vidar's condition, and thought I'd come to see if there was anything I could do to help.

1102701090.content: I see. Okay, both of you, follow me please.

1102701091.content: After some brief formalities, Ookuninushi gestures for us to come and see the Countertide Whalesong. The umbrella-shaped Access Key is secured to a workbench, opposite which is the key's Dream Projection as processed by the data converter.

1102701092.content: The projection is nothing more than the deep blue of the ocean depths, the only movement the passing of an occasional fish. After a few minutes of calm, a mechanical sea beast appears in the Dream Projection.

1102701094.content: We meet again, Candidate. Concept modification: my name is Labbi, not Tabbi.

1102701097.content: I'm sorry, Labbi. I'll remember your name from now on!

1102701098.content: But what are you doing here? In the Aether Gazer lab, I mean.

1102701099.content: I am the consciousness appended to the Countertide Whalesong. Objectively speaking, I can manifest anywhere the Access Key is.

1102701100.content: While I was examining this Access Key that Leviathan brought back, I discovered that it contained a consciousness that can communicate directly with humans. However, only someone it calls the "Candidate" can activate it.

1102701101.content: The Candidate? That's what Labbi called me before.

1102701102.content: According to my system parameters, my mission is to guide the Candidate with access rights to the Countertide Whalesong. Any problems encountered by the Candidate must be resolved immediately.

1102701103.content: All this talk of "Candidates" is making my head spin.

1102701104.content: Labbi, just tell us what you're capable of. We want to know the precise functionality of the Countertide Whalesong, since we didn't have time to figure it out during the underwater battle.

1102701105.content: Response to question: the Countertide Whalesong Access Key possesses 165 functions, which can be generally divided into three main categories based on the Candidate's requirements.

1102701106.content: All eyes are on Labbi in anticipation of the information it's about to divulge. However, it's as this precise moment that the machine's voice begins malfunctioning, and it just keeps repeating the same phrase over and over again.

1102701107.content: Based on the Candidate's requirements... based on the Candidate's requirements...

1102701108.content: Let me think. Based on the Divine Power fluctuations I've observed around the Access Key, and the partial information just provided to us by Labbi, I surmise that the Countertide Whalesong has three main types of function.

1102701109.content: These are offensive attack, defensive buffer, and restorative healing. All three require the deployment of water power, in a similar way to Poseidon's Access Key.

1102701110.content: Restorative healing? Do you mean this Access Key has the ability to heal Mods?

1102701111.content: How can you use this function, Labbi? Labbi?

1102701112.content: Retrieving Access Key user guide for the Candidate... Candidate is unauthorized to access this function.

1102701113.content: Huh? Why? I need this information to heal my master.

1102701114.content: Labbi, can you please explain why this function is restricted?

1102701115.content: According to my data model, the Candidate does not meet the performance criteria to access complete functionality.

1102701116.content: Performance criteria... Does that just mean Leviathan isn't strong enough yet?

1102701117.content: Affirmative. The Candidate's performance requires improvement measures in a number of different areas. Until such criteria are met, the restorative healing function shall be unavailable for use unless the Candidate is in mortal danger.

1102701118.content: So I own the Countertide Whalesong but can't use all of its powers?

1102701120.content: This must be some kind of joke! If you're lying to me, I swear I'm going to cut you up and serve you as sashimi!

1102701121.content: Labbi is an Artificial Intelligence entity. The Candidate cannot threaten me.

1102701122.content: Ookuninushi and I are somewhat taken aback by Leviathan's outburst. After a few seconds, Ookuninushi breaks the stunned silence.

1102701123.content: You say the restorative healing is unavailable for use, which means that, to unlock it, Leviathan simply needs to work hard and meet these performance criteria.

1102701124.content: How are these so-called performance criteria determined, Labbi?

1102701125.content: The concept behind the creation of the Countertide Whalesong is "to be as fearless, tolerant, and connected as the ocean."

1102701126.content: If the Candidate can comprehend and demonstrate these qualities, their affinity with the Access Key will increase and certain functions will unlock.

1102701127.content: What does that mean, "comprehend and demonstrate these qualities?" I need to be fearless, tolerant, and connected?

1102701128.content: I am unable to answer that question.

1102701129.content: Do you have any ideas, Ookuninushi?

1102701130.content: I'm afraid my work here as a researcher is done. It's up to you to find the answer to that question.

1102701131.content: However, given the extent of Labbi's intelligence, it might be worth uploading it into an AGI Mecha like BunBun-0. This would make it fully portable.

1102701132.content: If you can take it with you, it'll probably help you find the answers you're looking for.

1102702001.content: Ookuninushi has helped us a great deal, but we're still yet to solve the riddle of the Countertide Whalesong. Leviathan and I certainly don't have the slightest clue of where to start.

1102702002.content: Oh, hey Admin! How are you feeling? Back in tip-top shape?

1102702003.content: Good afternoon, Ver. I'm feeling fully rested and recovered, thanks. How about you?

1102702004.content: Oh I'm fine, that Bane Energy barely left a scratch on me.

1102702005.content: This is the first meal I've had since the end of my recovery period, and I fully plan on eating all the barbecue meat the doctors said I couldn't have before!

1102702006.content: I'm glad to see you haven't lost your appetite for barbecue! Don't you ever fancy trying something different for a change, though?

1102702007.content: Maybe next time. Your appetite has clearly grown, Admin... Are you really going to eat all of that?

1102702008.content: Huh? Oh no, this isn't all for me. The pizza and the sandwich are for Leviathan.

1102702009.content: We had quite a tricky problem to deal with this morning, and we haven't made much headway unfortunately. I think Leviathan is a bit disappointed, so I thought I'd get her some food to cheer her up.

1102702010.content: Leviathan? She was in here just before you arrived.

1102702011.content: Leviathan was here in the restaurant?

1102702012.content: Yeah, she asked for a tub of ice cubes and a salad, and then left.

1102702013.content: Ice cubes? Salad? That's a bit of a weird thing to have for lunch...

1102702014.content: I've still got a bit of time before I need to get back to the squad. Shall I come and see Leviathan with you?

1102702015.content: No it's alright, you stay and finish your lunch. I'll let you know if I need any help.

1102702016.content: Leviathan, are you in your room? I've brought you some lunch—barbecue chicken pizza and a pulled pork sandwich. Shall I bring them in?

1102702017.content: Admin... Er, I've eaten already. Thanks for thinking of me, though.

1102702018.content: Leviathan's voice sounds odd, as though she has something in her mouth. I gently try the door, and find it's unlocked.

1102702020.content: Leviathan is sitting there with a giant bowl piled high with ice cubes and a few vegetable leaves sandwiched in the middle.

1102702021.content: She's devouring this ice cube tower bit by bit, so much so that I can feel the chill coming out of her mouth when she speaks.

1102702022.content: Leviathan, what on earth are you doing? Put the ice cube down, you're going to give yourself an upset stomach.

1102702023.content: No, I'm okay! This is how I can save Master.

1102702024.content: She starts choking on an ice cube, and is forced to thump her chest a couple of times to make the coughing stop.

1102702026.content: Honestly, I'm fine, Admin. I grew up in the polar regions, we're used to eating ice cubes. We even fall asleep holding them against us.

1102702027.content: A-as long as it can help Master...

1102702028.content: What do you mean? How can ice cubes help cure Vidar's hyperthermia?

1102702029.content: No, this doesn't have anything to do with the hyperthermia. I'm trying to unlock the Access Key.

1102702030.content: I thought the Countertide Whalesong was all about being fearless and tolerant? What has that got to do with eating ice cubes?

1102702031.content: If you want to become fearless, you should probably start with overcoming the thing that scares you the most, right?

1102702032.content: That makes sense. And the thing that scares you the most... is ice cubes?

1102702033.content: Of course! I hate the feeling of being surrounded by snow and ice, especially in the polar region...

1102702034.content: It's impossible to hunt, it's impossible to start a fire, and if you sit still for too long you just freeze over.

1102702035.content: I used to hate bad weather. If we couldn't find enough food to eat, we'd mix chunks of ice into whatever we had, or eat moss we'd dig up from under the snow. We'd even be attacked by penguins on occasion...

1102702036.content: Master once said, "Those who lose their companions in the snow are doomed to become ice statues." I don't want to turn into an ice statue, and from then on I promised never to leave Master's side.

1102702037.content: You're afraid of going back to your old life, and this is what you're doing to overcome your fear and become as fearless as the ocean?

1102702038.content: That was my thinking, but there's nowhere in Aether Gazer with snow samples from Jokurr, so I'm using ice cubes instead. And there's no moss, so I'm making do with lettuce leaves...

1102702039.content: Ignoring the fact that what you're doing might be very bad for your health, do you really think this is the way to meet Labbi's performance criteria?

1102702040.content: Leviathan pulls a seal-shaped AGI Mecha from the bookcase, and gently pats its head. Ookuninushi claims it was developed using Labbi's intelligence.

1102702041.content: (That was a smart idea by Ookuninushi. Walking around with a new Access Key for everyone to see would have caused quite the stir.)

1102702042.content: Labbi, how close am I now to unlocking the Access Key?

1102702043.content: Response: The Candidate's progress towards Access Key activation is currently at 3%.

1102702044.content: Only 3%?! If I eat any more of these ice cubes, I'm going to freeze!

1102702045.content: I am unable to answer that question.

1102702046.content: I don't think you're going about this the right way. Or, we're misunderstanding what the Access Key expects from us.

1102702047.content: I do have another idea, but I'll need your help...

1102702049.content: I'll tell you the exact details later. First, let's get to the aquarium and find somewhere to hide!

1102702050.content: Wait wait wait! At least tell me what we're going to the aquarium for!

1102702051.content: It's the middle of the night before Leviathan and I get back to Aether Gazer.

1102702052.content: I thought you had some brilliant plan—not that you wanted to go and beat up some penguins. That was incredibly foolish of you!

1102702053.content: I thought that I'd get over my fear of penguins by defeating them in battle, but all I did was get the both of us caught and scolded by the aquarium security guard.

1102702054.content: If the ice in their enclosure hadn't been so slippery, I would have won instead of just falling over all the time!

1102702055.content: But the penguins in the aquarium weren't the same species as the ones that attacked in the polar region, were they?

1102702056.content: Sigh, a penguin's a penguin, isn't it? Labbi, how close am I now to unlocking the Access Key functions?

1102702057.content: Response: The Candidate's progress towards Access Key activation is currently at 15%.

1102702058.content: 15%... Still a long way to go. I'll never cure Master at this rate!

1102702059.content: I think slow progress is to be expected when it's just the two of us. I remember Ookuninushi made lots of notes about the Access Key—maybe there'll be something useful in there?

1102702060.content: Does that mean you want us to go back to the Cryptics' lab?

1102702061.content: No, I've thought of someone better: Poseidon.

1102702062.content: Is that the lady who's obsessed with the ocean? I remember she gave me a dolphin plushie once, and one to Master too.

1102702063.content: That's probably her. Poseidon's Divine Power is very closely linked to the ocean, and she's very skilled in the use of the Tidal Song and Arctic Abyss Access Keys.

1102702064.content: Since it sounds like the Countertide Whalesong might possess a similar kind of Divine Power, I figured Poseidon's experience might come in handy here.

1102702065.content: Well, what are we waiting for?

1102702066.content: Let me see who this is.

1102702068.content: Hi Poseidon! What are you doing here?

1102702069.content: I'm handing out flyers for the Ocean Conservation Society. I usually do it during the day, but it's been too hot lately so I've been waiting until the evening. I've actually just finished.

1102702070.content: Tell you what, I've still got some flyers left. Admin, Leviathan, would you like to protect the oceans with me?

1102702071.content: Poseidon hands us each a flyer, which says EVENT RECRUITMENT at the top in big letters.

1102702072.content: It must take a lot of effort to protect the maritime ecosystems, Poseidon.

1102702073.content: I enjoy it. How about you two, what are you still doing up at this hour? Leviathan, your face is all red and swollen—did something happen to you?

1102702074.content: We need your help, Poseidon. It's for my master. Please!

1102702075.content: For your master? What's happened to Vidar?

1102702076.content: We explain the entire situation to Poseidon. She thinks for a minute, then asks if she can see the AGI Mecha being used to house Labbi.

1102702077.content: Is this the advanced AI that was attached to the Countertide Whalesong Access Key?

1102702079.content: Since the Candidate needs to change in order to pass the AI's assessment, Labbi's instructions will be particularly important.

1102702080.content: You said the founding concept of the Access Key was to be "fearless and tolerant"—does that mean Leviathan merely needs to demonstrate courage and open-mindedness at the same time?

1102702082.content: Can Leviathan meet the "fearless" criterion by overcoming her own fears?

1102702083.content: Only partly. To fully meet the criterion, the Candidate must be perceived to have a true heart.

1102702084.content: A true heart... I think I get it. It sounds like this task isn't something you can set out to do—it's something you need to wait for.

1102702085.content: So what Leviathan was doing before wasn't completely in vain, it's just she was going about it the wrong way?

1102702086.content: Labbi made it sound like Leviathan needs to demonstrate true fearlessness during an emergency or something.

1102702088.content: I knew Poseidon would find a way. I feel like we're getting somewhere!

1102702089.content: But where are we going to go where there could be an emergency?

1102702090.content: Maybe you could give me a hand? Tomorrow afternoon the Ocean Conservation Society is going to be holding a small support rally. Maybe your contribution toward protecting the ocean will be what Labbi is looking for.

1102702091.content: That's fine with me. Admin, will you be free too?

1102702092.content: Of course. I'll see you there.

1102703001.content: The next afternoon, Leviathan and I arrive at the location early to meet Poseidon. There are already a lot of ocean activists around, handing out flyers and promoting their cause to passers-by.

1102703002.content: Are these all members of the Ocean Conservation Society? Kudos to them for coming out on a hot day like this.

1102703003.content: I really admire what Poseidon's doing here. The ocean needs all the support it can get.

1102703004.content: Let's go do our part! Have you seen Poseidon anywhere?

1102703005.content: I'll go and ask one of the kids handing out flyers.

1102703006.content: Hello. Sorry to bother you, but do you know Poseidon?

1102703007.content: Of course! She's vice-president of our Ocean Conservation Society.

1102703008.content: Oh, I didn't know she was the vice-president!

1102703009.content: Yeah, her focus is on marine science research. She's been instrumental in getting the society to where it is today.

1102703010.content: Allow me to introduce myself. I'm Thain and I'm a new volunteer with the society. I'm currently studying marine biology at college in the city.

1102703011.content: My name's Leviathan, and this is...

1102703012.content: Nice to meet you Thain, I'm #{nickname}#. Is there anything we can do to help out here?

1102703013.content: A commotion suddenly breaks out in the crowd. The hum of an engine can be heard in the distance, and the obvious sound of a ship about to dock.

1102703014.content: They're here! Surround them, make sure they don't get away!

1102703016.content: It's a private fishing boat that we always see in the waters around here. It's unregistered and unlicensed, so there's definitely something fishy about it, if you'll pardon the pun.

1102703017.content: Some of the local fishermen claim that they sneak out at night to illegally fish blue sturgeon, then sell the fish at inflated prices on the black market. It's been going on for months now, apparently. I hate them!

1102703018.content: Blue sturgeon... I seem to remember they were placed on the Ain Soph endangered animals list a couple of years back. So they're catching and selling a protected species?

1102703019.content: Yep. The blue sturgeon are on the verge of going extinct, and if they're fished any more they're going to be wiped out! We have to stop these guys!

1102703020.content: What a terrible thing to do for money! Let me handle this, there's no way they're gonna get away from me!

1102703021.content: The second the fishing boat docks, it is surrounded by members of the Ocean Conservation Society. The poachers onboard look at each other and refuse to disembark. The situation is at an impasse.

1102703022.content: Release the blue sturgeon! Protect our environment!

1102703023.content: How can you sleep at night knowing you're fishing illegally and destroying the ecosystem?

1102703024.content: Release the blue sturgeon, you bastards!

1102703025.content: Blue sturgeon? Release them? In your dreams. Now be a good little girl and run off, before I give you a taste of this harpoon.

1102703026.content: What do we do, boss? There's too many people here, and surely you're not gonna fire that thing into the crowd—we'd get arrested for sure!

1102703027.content: I'll tell you what we're gonna do—restart the engine, turn this thing around and we'll find somewhere else to dock. What a mess!

1102703028.content: Guys, I think they're turning around. They're going to leave!

1102703029.content: Dammit, we can't let them get away! At least not without releasing the fish back into the ocean!

1102703031.content: Just as the boat is about to leave, Thain jumps up the side of the boat. His fellow society members gather underneath and push him up until he's on board.

1102703032.content: Seems we've got ourselves a stowaway, boys. Get me my harpoon!

1102703033.content: Boss, you can't do that, you'll kill him! And then we'll all get sent to the slammer!

1102703034.content: Get lost, I'm the boss around here! Fire the harpoon!

1102703035.content: Just as Thain is getting to his feet, he sees the gleaming harpoon arrow shooting straight towards his head. Screams erupt from the watching crowd.

1102703037.content: Just as the situation seemed hopeless, Leviathan activates her Sacred Anchor Access Key. A giant anchor drops down from midair, knocking the harpoon onto the beach before smashing through the ship's steering gear. The hull begins to tilt to one side.

1102703038.content: NOOO! My ship! Harpoon! Get my harpoon!

1102703039.content: The poacher is dripping in sweat as he desperately tries to locate the harpoon trigger, but then everything goes dark as Leviathan smashes the Sacred Anchor directly into the deck in front of him.

1102703040.content: So you're the bastard who fired the harpoon, huh? Let me show you how mad it makes me when criminals attack unarmed civilians...

1102703041.content: P-please sp-spare me! I won't do it again, I promise! Take all the blue sturgeon, I don't care. Just please don't kill me!

1102703042.content: I wasn't going to kill you, idiot. Not everyone is as despicable as you, you know.

1102703043.content: We're just going to wait here for the police to arrive. They'll know how to handle you, and they've got sooooo many witnesses. You guys are finished!

1102703044.content: I manage to scramble up on the deck while Leviathan is talking to the poachers.

1102703046.content: Don't worry about me, Admin. As if I can't handle a handful of dumb poachers!

1102703047.content: That was really dangerous. Thank you...

1102703048.content: Don't mention it. It's what we're here for.

1102703049.content: Do you want me to call the police, Admin?

1102703050.content: Let Thain and his friends do it. We should keep watch over the poachers to make sure they don't get away.

1102703051.content: We also need to make sure they release the blue sturgeon before the police arrive.

1102703053.content: Admin and I will do a quick head count to make sure not a single poacher gets away.

1102703054.content: All of the poachers on board are quickly dealt with thanks to Leviathan. Poseidon arrives not long after, and together with other society members they ensure the blue sturgeon are released back into the ocean.

1102703055.content: One, two, three... seven, eight... huh?

1102703057.content: There should be nine people on board, but one person's missing.

1102703058.content: I don't see how anyone could have gotten away—the Ocean Conservation Society has the ship surrounded. He must be hiding somewhere on board.

1102703059.content: I've already checked on deck, the engine room, and the bridge. The cargo hold is the only place left.

1102703060.content: As she opens the door to the hold, she is almost knocked off her feet by the man who comes charging out.

1102703061.content: He's clutching a large box to his chest and sprints off as fast as he can. However, he doesn't get far before he trips over the harpoon rope. He crashes to the deck, cutting his leg on the harpoon.

1102703062.content: The contents of the box spill across the floor, and mostly comprise of rare shells and pearls. The man gingerly attempts to hide it behind his back, and I suddenly recognize him as the one who'd tried to stop the captain from firing the harpoon.

1102703063.content: Please, at least let me send some of this home to my family. Then I won't care if I go to jail!

1102703064.content: I collected all of this myself from diving. It's not dirty, I promise! If it gets confiscated from me, then it's all over.

1102703065.content: I have a seven-year-old daughter, and she's real sick. This is her only hope of getting treatment. Please, it's the only reason I agreed to come on this boat. I'm begging you!

1102703066.content: The color drains from the man's face as Leviathan strides over to him, and tears begin to well up in his eyes. Yet he continues to hold the box tightly behind him, like a dying adventurer clasping onto his last treasure.

1102703067.content: Leviathan walks up to him, then extends her hand to offer him a band-aid. The man stares at her in utter disbelief.

1102703068.content: You might have had a good reason, but that's still no excuse to break the law. You did something bad, and you must bear the consequences of your actions.

1102703069.content: I'll make sure these make their way to your family. I won't tell anyone.

1102703070.content: For your daughter's sake, we'll be willing to testify in your defense in court, and we'll tell everyone that you tried to stop your boss firing the harpoon. Whether or not that'll help reduce your sentence is up to the judge to decide.

1102703072.content: Don't thank me, just promise me you'll never do anything like this again. Get yourself a legitimate job, and be there for your family. If you don't, well... My anchor isn't exactly vegetarian, you know.

1102703073.content: I'll change, I promise, I'll be a new man... Thank you, kind stranger.

1102703075.content: Poseidon comes running over to us, followed closely by Thain and a group of police officers.

1102703076.content: After watching to make sure every single poacher is handcuffed and escorted off the boat, Leviathan and I finally breathe a sigh of relief.

1102703078.content: It's fine, everything worked out for the best and nobody got hurt.

1102703079.content: How did I do just now, Admin? Not too bad, huh?

1102703080.content: You did great. I shudder to think about what would have happened if you hadn't had stepped in.

1102703081.content: But I'm surprised you let that poacher go and are helping get those shells back to his family.

1102703082.content: The old me would have trussed him up good and handed him to the cops myself.

1102703083.content: But his story made me realize that not all poachers are necessarily as evil as the captain. A lot of them are simply poor, desperate people.

1102703084.content: So I listened to my gut and forgave him. But now I think about it, I'm not sure I made the right choice...

1102703085.content: Don't doubt yourself, Leviathan. You did good.

1102703086.content: Dealing with criminals isn't the same as dealing with Visbanes. The latter doesn't involve any emotion, but dealing with other people requires a certain amount of understanding and compassion.

1102703087.content: I am about to continue when Leviathan's backpack begins to beep. She opens it and takes out Labbi.

1102703088.content: Update: The Candidate's progress towards Access Key activation is currently at 72%.

1102703089.content: That's awesome! I've unlocked so much!

1102703090.content: That must be because you put yourself in danger to protect others, and the Access Key recognizes that.

1102703091.content: You were fearless in protecting others, but also demonstrated lenience to the poacher who's had a difficult life.

1102703092.content: I'm sure this incident has gone a long way in proving you're both fearless and tolerant, Leviathan.

1102703094.content: Yes, but don't forget there was a third component if you want to unlock the Access Key's full potential—you need to be "connected."

1102703095.content: How hard can that be? I'll pass the rest of the test easily, and then I'll be able to heal Master!

1102704001.content: Once the blue sturgeon had been sorted out, Leviathan and I went to visit the poacher's family and give his daughter the rare shells and pearls. We also gave them donations raised by the Ocean Conservation Society for extra financial support.

1102704002.content: Poseidon is the one who really deserves all the credit. The shells and pearls alone wouldn't have gotten enough money to cover all the medical fees.

1102704003.content: You're right. Thanks for your help, Poseidon, and to all the members of the Ocean Conservation Society for their generosity.

1102704004.content: Generosity is one of our society's mottos, as preserving the beauty of our world's oceans requires people to be generous with their time, money, and spirit. If we can spread hope, then one day all of that goodwill shall be repaid to the world.

1102704005.content: I want to join your society too! I can help you punish those who destroy the environment, and send the criminals to jail!

1102704006.content: Although it's easy for you to take out a few poachers with Sacred Anchor, but remember that the more witnesses there, the easier it'll be for you to accidentally cause trouble for Aether Gazer...

1102704007.content: Are you worried about Thain, Admin? Don't worry about him, I've already contacted CORG and they assure me none of the eye witnesses will remember seeing the Access Key.

1102704008.content: You've thought of everything, Poseidon. I'm relieved we don't have to worry about maintaining Aether Gazer's secrecy.

1102704009.content: Maybe you can help us with the last part of the Countertide Whalesong's test, Poseidon. It's about being as "connected" as the ocean—how do you think I can demonstrate that?

1102704010.content: Hmm, I'm not sure what it means, to be honest. It must mean being connected to people, to humanity, in which case I would say your most obvious target is Vidar.

1102704011.content: I reckon you should try and "connect" to Vidar first. You both seem very close, so it shouldn't be a problem for you.

1102704012.content: That's a good idea! It just so happens I was going to visit her today as well!

1102704013.content: Can we come as well? You won't be jealous if we visit Vidar with you?

1102704014.content: Of course not! You've both helped me so much, I would be honored if you would accompany me.

1102704015.content: Since you put it that way, I'll be glad to come.

1102704016.content: Just as Poseidon and I are preparing to head off with Leviathan, we suddenly hear the voice of Zenkibo.

1102704017.content: Well if it isn't Admin, Poseidon, and the green-eyed monster! What are you all up to?

1102704018.content: Who are you calling a green-eyed monster?!

1102704019.content: Woah, stop taking things so personally. I never said you were the green-eyed monster.

1102704020.content: I see you still enjoy teasing people as much as ever, Zenkibo.

1102704021.content: We're about to go and visit Vidar. She's not allowed outside due to her hyperthermia.

1102704022.content: Oh really? Are you sure Leviathan isn't just gonna bolt the door and not let you in?

1102704023.content: Of course not! I invited them to accompany me.

1102704024.content: Oh really? Ooh, I just forgot I have something to do. Laters!

1102704025.content: Zenkibo rushes out of the break room, but I didn't like the sly smile she had on her lips as she left.

1102704026.content: We follow Leviathan to Vidar's room, where I'm surprised to see a crowd of people waiting outside.

1102704027.content: Ver, Shu, Ookuninushi, Hodur and Baldr from the Special Task Force, and people from other departments whose names I can't even remember, all seem to be here to visit Vidar.

1102704028.content: And pretty much all of them have brought a gift of some kind—flowers, cake, fruit—but Leviathan plants herself steadfastly outside Vidar's room and refuses to let anyone pass.

1102704029.content: Master can't have this many visitors! And she doesn't need flowers or cake, those will only make her worse!

1102704030.content: But Zenkibo messaged us to say that Vidar is in critical condition, and that we should come visit before it's too late...

1102704031.content: No, that's just her idea of a practical joke!

1102704032.content: Poseidon and I push our way through the crowd to get to the door, and try to tell everyone the whole story. Leviathan is furious, although she still looks like a fluffy tiger cub.

1102704033.content: We all look at each other in confusion, until the door to Vidar's room suddenly opens.

1102704034.content: Are you all here to see me? Leviathan, why aren't you letting anyone in?

1102704035.content: No, Master, they're only here because Zenkibo pranked them. They all thought you were about to die, and I'm trying to tell them the truth.

1102704036.content: I see... But if this many people went to the effort of coming to see me, we should be thanking them instead of driving them away, no?

1102704037.content: B-but I didn't want them all to disturb you, Master. You should be resting up. I'm here to safeguard you, because I want you to get better.

1102704039.content: Ah, I understand now... I know what you're thinking, Leviathan.

1102704041.content: Crushed under the weight of repressed emotions, Leviathan finally breaks down and sinks into her master's arms. Vidar strokes her to console her.

1102704042.content: Didn't you promise me you'd stay strong? I distinctly remember you saying you'd handle everything by yourself in my absence.

1102704043.content: I was scared I'd lose you. You told me once that all those who lose their companions are doomed to become ice statues, remember?

1102704044.content: As long as you have Admin and your friends here, you will always have companions with you.

1102704046.content: Leviathan looks at me, then turns her gaze to everyone else gathered here. She lowers her head in silence, then looks up with renewed vigor.

1102704047.content: I'm sorry I let my emotions run away with me, Miss Shu. I promise I'll work on it before my next assignment!

1102704048.content: It happens to all of us. There's no need to beat yourself up about it.

1102704049.content: I need to apologize to you too, Ver. I shouldn't take my anger out on my squad mates.

1102704050.content: I wasn't even really sure what was wrong with Vidar, so I really only came here to snoop. You shouldn't blame yourself, Leviathan.

1102704051.content: But here I am, and I even brought some home-made ice cream with me. I heard you like it cold, Master Vidar, hee hee.

1102704053.content: Leviathan apologizes to each visitor in turn, and promises to return their kindness once Vidar is better. Before long, the corridor quietens back down.

1102704054.content: Still the jealous type, I see!

1102704055.content: Not anymore! I used to think that Master only belonged to me, but I'm an adult now and adults shouldn't be jealous.

1102704058.content: Happy for me? But there's nothing to be happy about, I haven't managed to cure you...

1102704059.content: Update: The Candidate's progress towards Access Key activation has reached 100%. Full Countertide Whalesong functionality unlocked.

1102704060.content: What? But I didn't even do anything.

1102704061.content: I think you just passed the human connection test.
