1102704062.content: If I'm not mistaken, the Access Key has rewarded you for allowing everyone to visit Vidar.

1102704063.content: Regardless of the reason, the Access Key is fully unlocked! You can now use it to heal Vidar.

1102704065.content: Following Labbi's update, Leviathan once again activates the Countertide Whalesong and uses its restorative healing function to treat Vidar's illness. The room fills with a soft, blue light.

1102704066.content: As the light condenses around Vidar, she opens her eyes and her body visibly relaxes.

1102704068.content: It doesn't feel like my blood is boiling in my veins anymore. I feel so much better. Thank you, Leviathan.

1102704069.content: Excellent! And now you're feeling better, we can both take Fenrir for walks again!

1102704070.content: This is great, Admin! Thank you so much!

1102704071.content: I don't know what you're thanking me for. This is all down to you.

1102704072.content: I try to calm down the excited Leviathan as she rushes toward me for a hug.

1102704073.content: How did you get it to work, Leviathan?

1102704074.content: Well, first I ate some ice cubes with lettuce, then I went to beat up a penguin at the aquarium... And then a ton more stuff!

1102704075.content: Master, you haven't eaten for ages. I'll go buy you some ice cream! Well, it's not ice cream as such, I mean it tastes like ice cream but it looks like milk and smells like tea...

1102704076.content: Oh yeah, it's called milk tea, that's it! You haven't tried before, but I know you'll like it! Admin, can you order it for us? I'll transfer the money to you later!

1102704077.content: Sure! Do you want one or two?

1102704078.content: Let me count... Oh I'm too excited, just get fifty!

1102704080.content: Well it's not just for me and Master! I want to get one for you, and Poseidon, and everyone else who came here today!

1102704081.content: I want to celebrate Master's recovery with all of you!

1108101002.content: I lean against the back of my chair and stretch out my tired body.

1108101003.content: Long day, Admin! I've got the data here all sorted.

1108101004.content: Thanks, Skadi. And I'm sorry that you're here doing this with me during your time off.

1108101005.content: Not a problem at all. My Access Key and Snowflake 2 are both in maintenance anyway. It's not like I can do anything about either of them.

1108101006.content: Without missing a beat, the girl with the light purple hair reassures me with a thumbs-up.

1108101009.content: Is exploring the open sea really that dangerous?

1108101010.content: Looks like I may have to reassess the use environment.

1108101011.content: I can see the Cryptics getting all caught up in the problem.

1108101012.content: Thankfully I had you here to help me. If I had to do this all by myself, I wouldn't be taking a day off for a while.

1108101013.content: I ought to thank you for your support. Let's celebrate!

1108101015.content: Are you asking me on a date, Admin?

1108101018.content: Your words of thanks are good enough for me.

1108101019.content: Besides, I'm not even sure how to answer your question. It's been way too long since I've had a day out.

1108101020.content: I once saw this film called... "Treasure Hunters"! It's a story about a team that goes on an adventure together. I thought it was a fun one!

1108101021.content: Let me take a look... Oh. That film's from two years ago.

1108101022.content: See what I mean...? How about you decide, Admin?

1108101023.content: Well then, it's almost mealtime anyway. How about we go to that new buffet restaurant...

1108101024.content: What are we waiting for? Come on, let's go!

1108101025.content: I am pushed out of the door by an eager Skadi before I even finish my sentence.

1108101026.content: The door opens, and I am greeted by a gentle breeze on my face. Skadi casually extends her arms for a stretch, and the golden rays of the setting sun dance upon her hair.

1108101028.content: Nothing much. I was just thinking that you're always so full of energy.

1108101029.content: Heh, I can't help myself! It's just so good to feel the evening breeze. Can't waste what the sea gave us, am I right?

1108101030.content: Um, the evening breeze actually blows from the land to the sea...

1108101031.content: It ain't evening yet! Dusk, dusk is what we're in now!

1108101032.content: Then, as if to prove me wrong, she skips over to me and starts to blow a "sea breeze" into my face.

1108101033.content: Ten minutes later. We are seated inside a restaurant that's a little on the ritzy side.

1108101034.content: Here we are! I've only seen this restaurant online before. Is this your first time here too, Admin?

1108101035.content: Yeah. I hear that it's real popular, but I had no idea that it'd be so fancy.

1108101036.content: It does seem a little much. Shall we head to a more... normal restaurant then?

1108101037.content: Hahaha, come on, there's a first time for everything. The experience is what matters!

1108101038.content: You never know what you'll find if you're open to new experiences. Who knows, this may become your new favorite restaurant, Admin.

1108101039.content: Well, I'll have to go hustling with Apollo if that's the case, then.

1108101040.content: Alright. I think I'm gonna get me a seafood platter here!

1108101041.content: Skadi rises to her feet rather dramatically, as if she is making a sort of declaration, and then looks me squarely in the eye.

1108101042.content: So, Admin. Where do I place my order?

1108101044.content: As I return to our table with my meal, I see Skadi scribbling something into a notebook. Several platefuls of food are growing cold in front of her.

1108101045.content: Then, as if she's noticed that I'm coming, she stops writing and pushes her leather-bound notebook to the side.

1108101046.content: I've been waiting for you, Admin. Come on, let's dig in!

1108101047.content: Are you sure that's not too much food?

1108101048.content: Well, wouldn't you want to try everything the first time you hit a buffet line, Admin?

1108101049.content: Yeah, you're absolutely right. My bad.

1108101050.content: I didn't realize you hadn't been to a buffet dinner before, Skadi.

1108101051.content: Hehe. Well, I'm at sea most of the time, aren't I? Not many chances to check out places on terra firma.

1108101052.content: So I hear about all these things, but I rarely have the chance to check them out.

1108101053.content: Look at this sashimi for example. I've wanted to try this since I read about it in a magazine! Good thing they serve it here.

1108101054.content: Skadi starts sampling her plates one by one with her eyes closed, like some sort of master gourmet. Very soon, a gleam appears in her eye, the kind of gleam seen only in comics.

1108101055.content: You have got to try this, Admin! It's really good!

1108101057.content: I hurriedly take over the sashimi-laden fork Skadi has handed me. This gives her the space to pick up the leather-bound notebook again.

1108101058.content: She flips through the pages of her notebook, finds what she's looking for, then scribbles a few words in it. She then puts her hands together, looking rather pleased with herself, and places the notebook aside.

1108101059.content: Skadi, I've been meaning to ask. What's that for?

1108101061.content: Hmm, how do I put this... Think of it as my secret to enjoying life. Hehe.

1108101063.content: Admin, you've got to eat up and finish that fish! Don't let something so tasty go to waste!

1108101064.content: Take it easy, I will. Hey, you don't have to lift my arm— The fork! THE FORK! It's gonna poke my face!

1108101065.content: Ugh. I'm so full. I can't eat any more.

1108101066.content: That's because you tried everything. Hmm... It feels great, though. To have tasted so many yummy things in one go.

1108101067.content: Barring something unexpected, it's not likely that you'll see me at a buffet line again anytime soon.

1108101068.content: Hahaha! But this is quite the first experience, isn't it? A fancy restaurant, a buffet, and a close-to-bursting belly?

1108101070.content: Skadi is rudely interrupted by the sound of her communication device.

1108101072.content: Huh? Can't agree on it, you say?

1108101073.content: I got it. I'm on my way over.

1108101074.content: I'm so sorry, Admin. They seem to have run into some sort of snag with the maintenance over at the Cryptics. I've got to head over now.

1108101075.content: Don't worry about it, Skadi, you go ahead. I'll take care of things around here.

1108101076.content: Thanks, Admin. I had a great time today!

1108101077.content: Skadi darts out of the restaurant and into the night.

1108101078.content: There's so much food left... Huh?

1108101079.content: Sitting rather unobtrusively at the side of the dining table is Skadi's leather-bound notebook. Looking at it reminds me of something.

1108101082.content: So you asked me here this time of the day because you and Ookuninushi can't agree on "this"...?

1108101083.content: Once again, I'd like to state for the record that the idea to install a BunBun fishing net on Snowflake 2 is an excellent one.

1108101084.content: I disagree. The research expense aside, can you explain to me in detail how that thing would work?

1108101085.content: Put it on the Waverender, then.

1108101086.content: It's not about where you put it!

1108101088.content: All of a sudden, Skadi reaches for the two of them and grabs them together in a bear hug.

1108101089.content: I should take the invention and both of you out to sea. That should be quite the experience!

1108101091.content: Hehe, and that's one more item on the list. I got to write it down.

1108101093.content: Oh no... My to-do book, it's missing.

1108102002.content: Hmm, so you're telling me, you wanted to return my notebook yesterday, but you didn't know where I was, so you decided to take the notebook back with you...?

1108102003.content: And then you, as you say, "felt a breeze" and "became curious," and then "saw a little of what's inside by accident"...?

1108102004.content: Yes, that's about right... I'm so sorry. I shouldn't have taken a peek. That's private stuff. I'm ready to be punished however you like.

1108102009.content: I look over at Skadi, and my eyes are greeted by her bright smiling face.

1108102010.content: I'm not mad at you. I'm not sure what you're apologizing for.

1108102011.content: I should be thanking you, Admin. I really thought last night that I'd lost my to-do book for good!

1108102012.content: Nothing in that book's a secret, anyway. It's just a bunch of things I hope to do someday.

1108102013.content: But yesterday you said that they were secrets...

1108102014.content: Air of mystery, Admin, air of mystery! And we were in the right setting for that, too!

1108102015.content: Was that one of your to-dos too?

1108102016.content: That's right! You can take another look at it now if you want, Admin.

1108102018.content: I've got to admit, she's piqued my curiosity. After all, just from that quick glance yesterday, I could tell there’s an endless list in there.

1108102019.content: Without waiting for my reply, Skadi plops herself down right next to me and holds her open notebook in front of me.

1108102020.content: She is so close to me, I can vaguely smell the fragrance of her hair. It's just like feeling a warm sea breeze. That distracts me for a moment.

1108102021.content: Aren't you going to take a look, Admin?

1108102022.content: Ah, yes, my bad. Let's see!

1108102023.content:
No. 71: Take part in a fishing competition. Check!

Saw on a flyer that there was a competition on, and since I had some time today I decided to sign up!

At first, I didn't get a single bite, and then I switched to another bait and ended up hooking a bunch of crabs! One of them was bigger than my hat! That one took me and the others quite a while to reel in.

Now I finally understand why my father would go fishing with his friends for the entire day! It really is fun.

Unfortunately, we had to catch at least one fish to qualify for the rankings... But I can leave that for next time!

No. 72: Become champion at a fishing competition... Okay, that's a work in progress!

...

1108102030.content:
No. 209: Try a buffet meal. Check!

Heard about this buffet restaurant over at the port. They told me that it's been packed lately. Gonna give it a try sometime.

Never thought I would go to this place with Admin. What a pleasant surprise!

All that yummy stuff... So hard to make choices. I really should skip a meal or two before the next time I visit...

And I really must thank Administrator properly sometime. I wish I could share with the Admin the happiness I'm feeling right now.

...

1108102037.content: I see that you've raised your hand, Admin. Good, ask away!

1108102038.content: Why did you start this notebook? Also, you seem to have left a space empty on the first page...

1108102040.content: What about we make a little trade? And that'd work as a little punishment for you, too—Help me work on my to-do list today!

1108102041.content: Wait... What? Hold on a sec!

1108102042.content: Before I can formulate a reply, Skadi is already dragging me by the hand out of Aether Gazer's doors.

1108102043.content: That's a garden eel isn't it, Admin?

1108102044.content: I hear that there's a trend lately where people imitate its movements. It does wriggle pretty cutely, doesn't it?

1108102045.content: I’m gonna give it a try as well! How about you join me, Admin?

1108102047.content: I remember there used to be a model shop around here... Looks like it's no longer in business.

1108102048.content: I had my eye on this model ship here when I was a kid... I was hoping to come back for it...

1108102050.content: Well, I don't always get to check off my to-dos. But it's okay. I'm sure I'll find it someday!

1108102051.content: Let's go, Admin. To the next spot!

1108102053.content: I didn't expect camping out in a city park to feel so good.

1108102054.content: Skadi shifts her limbs a little more and lays down in the middle of the inviting lawn.

1108102055.content: I keep thinking about what happened on the island. Skadi, you must have gone camping a lot before... So why is this even a to-do for you?

1108102056.content: Well, it's not just about camping, but camping out in a city park! I've never done that before!

1108102057.content: It's nice and warm out here, and it's breezy, too. It's a completely different experience from camping out on the island.

1108102058.content: I've always been wanting to do this!

1108102059.content: Then, as if to underline her statement, Skadi rolls indulgently on the sunny lawn, then gets up and seats herself next to me.

1108102060.content: And with you here, Admin, I call that a bonus!

1108102061.content: Oh, before I forget: I should really write down here that I've managed to check off quite a few things together with #{nickname}#.

1108102062.content: But those are all such minor, trivial things.

1108102064.content: Skadi puts down her pen and looks at me with great earnestness.

1108102065.content: I don't agree with you at all. While we may be talking about things that happen all the time, that doesn't mean that we shouldn't experience them with all of our heart.

1108102066.content: A fascinating species of fish you've never seen before at the aquarium, the first bite into an ice cream cone, and that suprisingly mind-soothing feeling when lying down on the grass... My point is, you can't say whether something's "trivial" or "not worth doing" if you've never experienced it for yourself.

1108102067.content: Surely you haven't camped out in a city park before either, Admin?

1108102068.content: Yeah, I've only seen that in videos. I've never quite understood why anyone would want to do that in the city before this.

1108102069.content: And how do you feel about it now?

1108102070.content: Honestly... I feel relaxed. Relaxed and calm.

1108102071.content: Skadi gazes at me with her eyes made of pure blue, and smiles in satisfaction. Then, she takes her pen again as she speaks.

1108102072.content: #{nickname}#, you asked me earlier why I got myself the book. The reason's quite simple actually.

1108102073.content: What I want to do is to create more stories, stories of my own. So I write down whatever idea strikes me, and then find a way to realize it.

1108102075.content: Yeah, just like my father. He'd tell me all these stories every time he returned from a voyage, stories about everything and anything, from a single drift bottle to a massive storm.

1108102076.content: I guess that's how I became interested in the blue world of the sea myself.

1108102077.content: Since then, I've been wanting to experience everything that is interesting. I want to turn all these to-dos of mine into stories of my very own.

1108102078.content: You know, wouldn't it be cool to have someone, just one person, uncover a new experience and discover something that makes them happy after hearing my stories?

1108102079.content: I suppose just like how the engine drives the boat forward, my to-dos, my wishes, are what drive me.

1108102080.content: Somehow all of a sudden, it feels like the sunlight coming from Skadi's direction has become more dazzling.

1108102081.content: Incredible, Skadi. I've never thought of that before.

1108102082.content: Hehe, I'm sure you'll come to feel the same way, Admin!

1108102083.content: Alright, I'm done writing. Let's head to our next stop!

1108102086.content: Ten minutes later. Skadi and I are walking down a road along the coast.

1108102088.content: Hmm, let me see. Oh, we're at the bathing beach.

1108102089.content: "Bathing beach"? What's that, and how is it different from a regular beach?

1108102090.content: Well, I can't quite put my finger on it, but there are lots of activities to do here besides swimming. You see that hut over there? You can get food there, as well. It's a great place to spend some time with your friends.

1108102091.content: What did you just say, Admin?

1108102092.content: Um... "It's a great place to spend some time with your friends"...?

1108102096.content: "There are lots of activities to do besides swimming"...?

1108102099.content: Skadi suddenly takes me by the hand again and starts running towards the beach.

1108102101.content: Unfortunately, the bathing beach is closed.

1108102102.content: Looks like we're too late... I'm sorry, Skadi. I didn't think you'd be interested in coming here.

1108102103.content: Well, actually, even though I'm on the water most of the time, there isn't much opportunity for me to really have fun in the water.

1108102104.content: Looks like we'll have to come back another time...

1108102105.content: Hmm? I sense relief in your voice, Admin.

1108102106.content: Uh, no, not at all! You heard me wrong. Besides, we don't have our swimming gear with us anyway. They'd turn us away, you know.

1108102107.content: Swimming gear, huh... Yeah. I don't think I have a swimsuit yet.

1108102108.content: I guess we'll just have to come back next—

1108102109.content: I know! I'll put this down on my to-do list! Admin, let's go shopping for a swimsuit tomorrow!

1108102111.content: And for your second question, Admin. Don't you want to know the answer to that?

1108102113.content: Hehe. Then you'll have to keep me company a little while longer, Admin!

1108102114.content: Skadi, with her hands behind her back, walks ahead of me with light, brisk steps. A few strands of her hair are dancing in the gentle sea breeze, and her shadow is long from the setting sun.

1108102115.content: For one moment, that shadow feels so close at my fingertips, but the next second so far away and illusory. I speed up in big strides and catch up with her, and the two of us walk side by side.

1108103003.content: Um... What is this? "Matters regarding cooperation with CORG"...

1108103004.content: Why's there so much work coming in out of the blue?

1108103005.content: That's probably because you were out all day yesterday, Admin.

1108103006.content: That was all because of you, Skadi! And it's our day off!

1108103007.content: Admin, you've got to push through... That research budget review has to be completed today.

1108103008.content: Can't I have a few more days, Ookuninushi?

1108103009.content: No, because we have to start working on the BunBun fishing net immediately. That'll help us deal with all kinds of contingencies.

1108103010.content: Oh, by the way, Skadi. Just to let you know, the maintenance should be wrapped up by tomorrow.

1108103011.content: Really? Sounds like my break has come to an end. Hehe, I wonder if I still have the time to...

1108103012.content: For some reason, I spot a tone of regret in Skadi's voice, which reminds me of her slightly bereft air when we parted yesterday.

1108103014.content: Huh? What are you talking about, Admin?

1108103015.content: I mean the beach! We still have time!

1108103016.content: Skadi looks at me, a bit shocked, and then starts laughing out loud.

1108103017.content: Hahahahaha! What's the sudden hurry? And don't you still have work to do?

1108103019.content: Don't worry. We'll find a time.

1108103021.content: Sorry to interrupt! Oh hey, Skadi's here too!

1108103022.content: Our conversation is cut short by two voices from the doorway.

1108103023.content: Oh hello, Vidar. Hi, Leviathan. What brings you here?

1108103024.content: Oh! We came to request leave to head outside Aether Gazer. Although I did try telling Master that we don't really have to...

1108103025.content: This is... a non-combat related request.

1108103026.content: Yes, that's it. I suppose this is not a good time for you now, is it Admin?

1108103027.content: Well, as you can see, the work's piling up.

1108103028.content: But it doesn't matter if you don't put in the request. It's never been mandatory, anyway. Are you off to have some fun?

1108103029.content: Yes, we're going to the beachfront mall!

1108103033.content: Could you do me a favor in that case?

1108103034.content: I heave a sigh of relief as I watch the trio leave.

1108103035.content: Fancy you palming off your mission to the Winter Squad, Admin...

1108103036.content: And whose fault is that, exactly?

1108103038.content: Vidar and Leviathan agreed to take Skadi swimsuit shopping, but it never occurred to me that this could be the biggest mistake I’ve made today.

1108103039.content: I finish my work a little earlier than scheduled so that I can check on Skadi, just in case. And just as I am about to do so, I receive a message on my communicator.

1108103044.content: Glacier Age! Oh my gosh... Admin, finally!

1108103045.content: What happened to you? I thought the three of you were attacked or something. And... why are you hiding out in here?

1108103046.content: Is it safe out there now? Have Vidar and Leviathan left???

1108103047.content: Um... Yeah, they're not here. Did you lose each other?

1108103049.content: I hear the lock turn with a clink. Skadi cautiously pokes her head out through the slightly ajar door.

1108103050.content: Admin, listen to me! Yes, we did come to shop for swimsuits, and no, we weren't attacked, but...

1108103052.content: Skadi, what do you think of this suit?

1108103053.content: Um... Isn't it a little skimpy?

1108103054.content: Not at all! This was what we wore when we went exploring at Jokurr.

1108103055.content: You stay cool in this, so it's really comfy.

1108103056.content: Yes, this looks right for summer, but... I'm not sure if I can wear this out.

1108103057.content: All you need is practice! Learn from my Master, Skadi!

1108103059.content: Look, there are more designs here. They're even better for the hot weather! You should try all of them... Hey, where are you going? You're still in the suit!!!

1108103060.content: Skadi lets out a sigh, then looks up again to check her surroundings.

1108103061.content: I'm sorry. I didn't expect things to turn out like this.

1108103062.content: Yeah. I know Leviathan isn't trying to tease me or anything, but I've got to hide from them now.

1108103063.content: You're the only one who can help me now, Admin.

1108103064.content: Leave it to me. Now what we need—

1108103067.content: Before I realize the situation, Skadi has pulled me into the room with her.

1108103068.content: Although the suit Skadi is wearing seems rather common in design with all these ruffles, its cut is far from modest. I am about to say something when Skadi places her index finger to my lips.

1108103070.content: Hmm, that's strange. She's not here, either. And was that Admin...?

1108103071.content: Shouldn't Admin be back at the office?

1108103072.content: Indeed. Let's keep looking for Skadi then!

1108103073.content: We hold our breaths until we can no longer hear the voices of either one of them.

1108103074.content: Phew, that was close. Looks like we're stuck here for now.

1108103076.content: We've got to think of a way out... Skadi?

1108103080.content: I'm sorry! I'll get out now!

1108103081.content: Fortunately, our little brouhaha doesn't draw any unwanted attention from anyone else in the store, and soon we manage to regain our usual way of talking.

1108103082.content: Anyways, Admin, would you choose a suit for me, please?

1108103083.content: I don't think I can get my clothes back in this.

1108103084.content: Got it. Anything in particular you'd like?

1108103085.content: Just choose something that looks good to you. I'm fine with anything as long as I can bring myself to wear it.

1108103087.content: Ah, Admin, so this is the style you're into. Huh...

1108103088.content: You don't like it? I thought you'd prefer something like this.

1108103089.content: No, no, I'm very happy with it! I've not worn anything in the schoolgirl style before. Thanks, #{nickname}#.

1108103090.content: I know this sounds a bit cheesy, but it feels like it gets easier to check off my wishlist whenever I'm with you.

1108103091.content: Oh yes, I remember now. It's No. 55, isn't it? Which—

1108103092.content: That's right, Admin! I can't believe you remember that!

1108103093.content: I'm very happy to have tried it. Maybe once I put it on, I can be like that character in "Treasure Hunters" who ends up finding the treasure...

1108103094.content: That would make one hell of a story if we write it down. Anyways, thank goodness we've achieved our objective now.

1108103095.content: Clearly Skadi disagrees with my assessment, for she forcefully yanks the fitting room curtains to the side.

1108103096.content: Admin, don't think you're getting off so easy now. This is just the start!

1108103097.content: We've got so much more to do!

1108103099.content: Let's go! To the beach, quick!!!

1108103100.content: Skadi grabs me by the hand and takes off for the sea, headlong towards the setting sun, leaving all doubts and uncertainty we may have had behind.

1108103101.content: Hey, we've got to pay for the suit first!

1108104001.content: Wow, looks like we made it!

1108104002.content: Next time... if we're running... just give me a few secs to prepare.

1108104003.content: Woohoo! Beach! Sea! Here I come!!!

1108104004.content: The sun is already low in the afternoon sky by the time Skadi emerges from the mall with her purchase. Thankfully, the bathing beach is just minutes away, and we are there in no time.

1108104005.content: Skadi gleefully runs towards the shimmering beach with her arms thrust high. She starts dancing a little jig as she reaches the sand.

1108104006.content: Ow, ow, ow, the sand's so hot, ow...

1108104007.content: Admin, why are you standing there? Come on over here!

1108104008.content: It feels really good down here on the sand!

1108104009.content: You're just saying that to make me go down there!

1108104010.content: Hehe. Just come on down now!

1108104011.content: Wait, wait, wait, don't— Ugh, the sand is scorching hot...

1108104012.content: Like that, Skadi's little jig becomes a pas de deux. It is some time before we eventually get used to the heat at our feet.

1108104014.content: I see some really yummy-looking food I wanna try over there at Casa del Mare, but I want to go swimming as well...

1108104015.content: Well, since we're here, why not do both?

1108104016.content: Um, but we don't have much time...

1108104017.content: Skadi, the experience is what matters, remember?

1108104018.content: Yeah, you're right. Besides, it's not every day that I have Admin along with me, is it?

1108104020.content: Nothing! Let's get ourselves some of that shaved ice! It's on my to-do list too, it's Number...

1108104022.content: Our eyes meet, and we smile at each other. Then, we spend some time taking a look around at all the stalls at Casa del Mare.

1108104023.content: Indeed, I should have gone for Tutti Frutti instead.

1108104024.content: But you got the special flavor that one can only get here, Skadi. So it's still worth trying.

1108104025.content: I agree with you, but... chocolate on shaved ice is a terrible pairing. It's like...

1108104026.content: Then, suddenly, Skadi scoops up the concoction with her spoon and sends it into my mouth. The taste is like something created by a mischievous ancient god.

1108104028.content: Right? I wasn't sure how to describe it. I figured that it'd be quicker for you to have a taste!

1108104029.content: I’ve seen tons of people lining up here from the sea, and I finally got the chance to try it out today! It's... not what I imagined it to be though, hehe...

1108104030.content: Oh, do you pass by this place a lot, Skadi?

1108104031.content: Once in a while, yeah. But I'm usually on some errand, so I haven't had the time to check things out here.

1108104032.content: Is that so? I’m sorry that you experienced something not so great on a day off like this...

1108104033.content: Don't say that, Admin. It's like being at sea: It can't always be smooth-sailing.

1108104034.content: And we won't have a catch every time. But that's okay. If you focus too much on the outcome, you'll end up missing out the fun that comes with the journey.

1108104035.content: We've got to experience all kinds of things for ourselves on the way to fulfilling our dreams, no matter if the outcome is good or bad. I mean, don't you think it's like bumping into an unexpected treasure along the sailing route? I quite enjoy it, personally.

1108104036.content: If you really do feel badly though, why don't you share your Tutti Frutti shaved ice with me, Admin?

1108104037.content: And this is how we end up splitting each other's shaved ice desserts.

1108104038.content: Alright, now that we've had something sweet, it's time to move it while we still can!

1108104039.content: Come on, Admin. Let's go swimming!

1108104041.content: Ahahahaha! Sorry, Admin, but if only you could see your face right now.

1108104042.content: Let me guess: You don't know how to swim, do you?

1108104044.content: That's alright! I can teach you!

1108104045.content: Looks like they're renting kickboards over there. You can use one of those to stay afloat.

1108104046.content: Besides, it'd be more fun if you join me, Admin.

1108104047.content: But... I didn't bring my swimming gear.

1108104048.content: Don't worry about that. I bought you something to wear back at the mall just now! And I got Lord Mimir to tell me your measurements, too.

1108104050.content: Skadi holds up the shopping bag in her hand, and soon enough I am swayed by her repeated apologies and impassioned pleading. The suit fits me surprisingly well—I wonder what else Mimir has told her. And soon enough, I find myself standing next to Skadi at the water's edge.

1108104051.content: No, I can't. I just can't.

1108104052.content: How do you know if you won't try? Come, one step into the water at a time.

1108104053.content: Every great legend begins with the courageous first step of the protagonist! You can do this, Admin.

1108104054.content: And even if you stumble, I'll be here to catch you!

1108104055.content: Skadi jauntily launches herself into the waves, then turns around and extends an arm out to me.

1108104056.content: She looks intently at me, clear-eyed and determined. That's a confidence booster, alright.

1108104058.content: Alright, that's the way! Now hold your kickboard with both hands, and imagine that you're floating in the air...

1108104059.content: Perhaps Skadi's zest and energy have somehow exerted an effect on me. Things are actually going quite smoothly after that first step.

1108104060.content: Thanks to that, and Skadi's step-by-step instruction, I am soon merrily kicking away with the help of the kickboard.

1108104061.content: Who knows, Admin? Maybe we'll find that you actually have a gift for this.

1108104062.content: I guess that's when you open the chocolate box of life, right?

1108104063.content: See? Swimming isn't that hard, is it?

1108104065.content: Well, that's bold of you! Let's race each other to the shore, then! Loser buys dinner!

1108104067.content: However, that burst of confidence on my part does not last long. I am soon seized by a cramp in my leg and begin to sink into the deep...

1108104068.content: I try to reach for the kickboard that I've lost hold of, but I cannot seem to find the strength to do so. As I look at Skadi swimming away from me, all I can do is squeeze out a few syllables as the seawater starts to fill my mouth.

1108104070.content: The water engulfs me. And just when everything starts to blur, I see the vague outline of a person's arm stretched out towards me.

1108104071.content: As I slowly regain consciousness, I become aware of Skadi calling me anxiously.

1108104073.content: Admin! Are you okay??? Can you hear me???

1108104075.content: Oh good, you can hear me! Are you hurt?

1108104076.content: Why does it feel like I've had this conversation before... I'm good.

1108104077.content: Phew. Good. You gave me quite the scare there.

1108104078.content: I swear, my heart was in my mouth when I turned back and couldn't find you! All these thoughts were running through my head...

1108104080.content: As Skadi relieves all at once, her emotions seem to get the best of her.

1108104081.content: Hey, hey, hush, everything's okay now. Look at me. I'm fine, aren't I?

1108104082.content: Besides, you don't have to feel sorry, Skadi. I was the one who wanted to race, remember? Plus, you're the one who saved me...

1108104083.content: You're lucky I heard you, Admin. If I hadn't...

1108104086.content: You told me you'd catch me if I stumble, remember? I trust you, Skadi. You caught hold of me and you never let go after that.

1108104087.content: I was just acting out of instinct. I...

1108104088.content: Skadi suddenly pulls back her hand, as if she's trying to hide something. But then, she decides otherwise and puts it back on my kickboard to hold it up.

1108104089.content: Anyway, I'm alright now, Skadi. Will you continue to teach me?

1108104091.content: I'm sorry, I got a little too excited just now. I promise I won't let go of you this time!

1108104092.content: But our lesson ends once we reach the shore. You've had enough exercise for today, Admin.

1108104093.content: Admin, your arms and legs have to work together! Try again!

1108104094.content: Hey! Did you just launch a sneak attack on me?

1108104095.content: Don't think that I won't fight back!!!

1108104096.content: And so, what started as a swimming lesson turns into a water fight that lasts all the way till the last rays of the sun disappear beneath the horizon.

1108104097.content: Skadi and I are seated on a bench by the beach, watching the last light fade into night while the water slowly retreats from us.

1108104098.content: Ha, this is great! It's been a while since I've had so much fun.

1108104099.content: I was hoping to help you master that swim stroke though, Admin. Definitely wasn't expecting the lesson to end that way.

1108104100.content: It's not a bad thing to relax once in a while. Look at you, all that time on the water and yet so little time to enjoy it.

1108104101.content: Oh, is that why you decided to get all splashy on me, #{nickname}#?

1108104102.content: Alright, you've held up your end of the deal. I'll tell you the secret, Admin.

1108104103.content: Actually, I've left the first to-do item blank for a very simple reason: I still don't know what it should be.

1108104105.content: This No. 1 to-do item is special. Every time I open up my notebook, I hope it can remind me of the direction I should be heading, like a beacon. If possible, I want it to be something that's kinda hard to achieve.

1108104106.content: I'm not sure if this makes sense to you, but I hope that my No. 1 to-do will lead me to experience my best story to date.

1108104107.content: I wasn't sure what it should be, so I left it blank.

1108104108.content: But thanks to you, Admin, I think I am now.

1108104110.content: Skadi does not reply. Instead, she takes out her leather-bound notebook and starts scribbling earnestly in it. Then, she hands the notebook over to me.

1108104112.content: Ta da! This is the most appropriate to-do I can think of!

1108104113.content: I wish to go adventuring with #{nickname}# a hundred times! Hmm... Or maybe a thousand?

1108104114.content: If it's with you, maybe... No, no, definitely! We'll definitely go through some great stories.

1108104115.content: I'd love to! But I don't think I can find the time to go out to sea for that long...

1108104116.content: Adventuring doesn't necessarily mean going out to sea, Admin.

1108104117.content: Didn't we have a great experience today, for example?

1108104118.content: Yeah... But as to those successful adventures, shouldn't there be a treasure waiting for you somewhere? I don't think we found even a sea shell today...

1108104119.content: What in the world are you talking about, Admin? I already have the best treasure! Hehe.

1108104120.content: I'll remember every single moment of today. I'll remember it even when I sail to the very end of the world.

1108104123.content: Skadi scoots even closer to me, erasing whatever's left of the distance between us. She leans into my ear, and I can hear her breathing interspersed with her whispered words.

1108104124.content: So, Admin... What do you think of that swimsuit, by the way?

1108104125.content: Oh, that... Um... I think it's pretty! And it looks great on you!

1108104127.content: (Coughs)... Never mind! It's nothing. Let's go! I've got to prepare for my sailing tomorrow!

1108104128.content: Are you leaving tomorrow, too? It feels like I won't see you again for a long time.

1108104129.content: Aw, are you feeling lonely already, Admin?

1108104131.content: All of a sudden, the girl bounces into action and starts running along the sand. Then, just as suddenly as she started, she stops and turns around.

1108104132.content: Admin, since I still have some time, why don't we go on our next adventure now?

1108104133.content: She says with a smile, dazzling like how the sunlight dances on the water.

123011001.content: A squirrel scurries along a branch, lured toward something. There's not enough light under the canopy of the trees for it to see what's ahead, but instinct still drives it onwards.

123011002.content: It only knows there's something there that is more tempting than food. It feels like the forest itself is calling, beckoning all creatures further in.

123011003.content: And then, a human voice is heard on the forest breeze. The squirrel freezes.

123011005.content: Fools! This is important. You should have informed me earlier.

123011006.content: The god can save us. They can also take revenge.

123011007.content: The sacrifice must not escape this time.

123011008.content: The voice fades and the squirrel moves forward again, cautiously at first. Normally, it would have fled by now. But today is different. Today, it is forced to move onward, answering the forest's call.

123011009.content: As are all the other creatures in the forest.

123011010.content: The order is passed on among the Izuru guards, quickly but quietly, with each spreading the word before hurrying to their posts. Soon, the Izuru Family guards are on high alert and more ready for action than on any normal day.

123011011.content: By which time, the two visitors—the cause of the alarm—have already been seated in the reception hall, waiting for Lord Izuru Masayoshi to speak.

123011012.content: I'm sure you have both read my letter. The situation is grave. I had no choice but to call a meeting of the five families and invite you both here.

123011013.content: My Lord, if the five families are to meet... shouldn't the Miyahebi and Sanzaru be represented?

123011014.content: We have no other options. The Izuru, the Akishika, and the Karasugo have to meet first.

123011015.content: The Miyahebi have recently suffered a great tragedy and are unable to contribute. But thanks to the marriage between the Miyahebi and the Izuru family, I can represent their interests.

123011016.content: As for the Sanzaru... they are, of course, great explorers of the sea. No member of the family has returned, or even been heard of, for many years. We cannot await their return.

123011017.content: Then you represent two families and, as Prime Lord, enjoy the deciding vote. It seems the Izuru Family will be making the decisions.

123011018.content: Lord Karasugo, I do understand your concerns. But our meeting today is not intended to reallocate power between the Sasanami Five.

123011019.content: It is to respond to a common threat.

123011020.content: Izuru Masayoshi speaks sincerely, but also forcefully. Karasugo Sendo falls silent.

123011022.content: Earlier today, I received a report from a forest patrol. Hordes of oddly behaving beasts have been spotted in the forests around Shimogyou.

123011024.content: I have examined the images included in the report. It is, I have concluded, accurate.

123011025.content: Given the troubles your own family faced not long ago, Lady Akishika, I am sure you understand what this means better than I do.

123011026.content: A warning of the Night Parade of the Beasts...

123011028.content: It is... a calamity, brought about by crazed animals. Uncontrollable and a threat to all Sasanami.

123011029.content: It is odd I have never heard of such a grave threat before.

123011030.content: Lord Karasugo, our five families have our origins in an ancient legend. We all have secrets that we prefer to keep to ourselves. I myself only learned of the Night Parade because I am a friend of the Lady of Akishika. But on this occasion...

123011031.content: I understand, Prime Lord. This time the beasts have appeared outside of Akishika territory, so the Akishika can no longer regard this as a private matter.

123011033.content: Investigators dispatched have been lost. All of them.

123011035.content: The last Night Parade of the Beasts occurred on Akishika territory and, fortunately, Lady Akishika acted decisively. The problem was dealt with in its early stages, and the people were saved from harm.

123011036.content: But in this case, the beasts have been found deep in the forest and we do not know where they are coming from. It is impossible to say how many there are. It may be that the situation is already beyond our control. We must decide on a course of—

123011037.content: The Akishika can deal with the situation like the last time.

123011038.content: Akishika Himiko interrupts, her sudden and firm statement surprising the usually imperturbable Izuru Masayoshi.

123011039.content: I do not doubt the determination of the Akishika. But as I have said, it may not be possible for us to control the situation. We must plan for that eventuality.

123011041.content: This could be regarded as "unusual circumstances," as defined in the Cross-Regional Treaty. As such, we could request help from CORG. We should also evacuate the residents of Shimogyou and reinforce Kamigyou.

123011042.content: Abandon Shimogyou? Do we even have time for an evacuation?

123011043.content: As the Prime Lord, my duty is to save as many people as I can.

123011045.content: What if the Akishika could set up defenses in Shimogyou before the first wave of beasts appeared, and successfully repel that wave?

123011047.content: My plan is to set up defensive lines outside populated areas. That would reduce panic among the people and maintain order. In addition, it would buy us time for you, Prime Lord, to request assistance from CORG. With that, I am sure we'd be able to bring things to a most satisfactory conclusion.

123011048.content: Lady Akishika, now you are just being idealistic. Remember that you shall be responsible for your words.

123011049.content: I understand your concerns, Prime Lord. But I ask that you permit Akishika forces to enter Shimogyou.

123011050.content: Lady Akishika, I cannot permit such risks to be taken.

123011051.content: If we abandon Shimogyou so quickly, who will trust us to defend Sasanami?

123011053.content: Prime Lord, our options are clear. Let us vote and decide between them.

123011054.content: Despite knowing the Prime Lord can easily block her plan, Akishika Himiko remains as open and sincere as ever. If anything, it is the Prime Lord himself who looks to be wavering.

123011055.content: Lady Akishika, I cannot grant you all the forces of the five families. We must spare a part of them to defend Kamigyou.

123011056.content: I understand. The Akishika guards alone can take good care of Shimogyou.

123011057.content: That will leave the Izuru and Karasugo forces to guard Kamigyou... Lady Akishika, we are agreed.

123011059.content: With the Prime Lord on her side, there is no need for Akishika Himiko to ask the question. But she does, and she asks genuinely. Karasugo Sendo has remained largely silent but has no choice now other than to respond.

123011060.content: I wish you happy hunting, Lady Akishika.

123011061.content: The formalities of the meeting of the five families over, Karasugo Sendo stands and leaves, his face blank.

123011063.content: You must have something important to say to me, calling me that.

123011065.content: Does the Prime Lord still doubt my abilities?

123011066.content: I simply do not wish to see another promising young... Never mind. If you need arms, supplies, anything... just ask.

123011067.content: I am grateful, but I have two more important requests to make.

123011069.content: The origin of the beasts is related to an Akishika family matter. We have more than just the beasts to deal with. I hope the Prime Lord can grant us the freedoms we will need.

123011070.content: You may do as you see fit.

123011071.content: Thank you, Prime Lord. And I also ask that you do not inform CORG of what we are doing.

123011073.content: Those beasts are... supernatural. CORG has always tried to prevent humans coming into direct contact with such things. Obtaining their permission for our current course of action would be... problematic.

123011074.content: Do as you must. I will take full responsibility.

123011075.content: Akishika Himiko bows slightly in her chair and, having paid all her respects, stands and leaves.

123011076.content: A figure vaults nimbly across the wall surrounding the Akishika compound and disappears amongst the buildings of Kamigyou, no more noticed than a leaf drifting to the ground.

123011077.content: Except... That leaf is seen, by one whose gaze is as sharp as a bolt of lightning.

123011078.content: A clash of swords. Suddenly heard, suddenly gone.

123011079.content: The wall-vaulter is trapped in a narrow alley. The pursuer, seeing her quarry has no route for escape, pauses the attack.

123011080.content: You fight well. But don't make me take out the other sword. Neither of us wants to attract attention. Correct?

123011081.content: What were you doing in the Akishika compound?

123011082.content: The intruder hides in the shadows. All that can be seen is a pair of wary eyes, meeting Tsukuyomi's gaze.

123011083.content: So, there are already eyes on the Akishika place... I guess everyone involved is a little on edge.

123011085.content: Tsukuyomi eases her sword from its scabbard. Just an inch, to let those electric flickers show.

123011087.content: That is not an answer to my question.

123011088.content: After a long silence, the intruder looks once more at Tsukuyomi.

123011089.content: I just wanted to give Lady Akishika another option.

123011091.content: The intruder suddenly becomes a blur, as if reflected in a shattered mirror. By the time Tsukuyomi's blade reaches them, they have disappeared.

123011094.content: Headquarters, this is Tsukuyomi. The target is using some kind of sensory manipulation technique. Requesting tech support.

123011095.content: Sensory manipulation? Never heard of that before. Sounds like our lead got away, right?

123011096.content: The voice coming from the terminal is familiar but unexpected. Tsukuyomi freezes.

123011097.content: Odin? I thought this was Shu's line.

123011098.content: I had Shu issue you with the updated terminal, but from now on we'll be working together. Just the two of us. Nobody else in the loop.

123011099.content: That's different. Has there been some new intel?

123011100.content: As perceptive as ever, I see.

123011101.content: Given what our intel is telling us currently, "sensory manipulation" is only the start of the target's skillset. So to be on the safe side, I'll be your handler from now on. Any comms come directly to me.

123011103.content: I'll be instructing you on how to stay on your target. And I'm temporarily relieving you of command of Pheasant Squad and putting you under my direct command.

123011105.content: You've been with them long enough. Still don't think they can cope without you?

123011106.content: Right. I shouldn't have asked that...

123011107.content: It's okay. Anyway, we seniors have got our own problems to deal with...

123011109.content: Sorry. Even I have my moments.

123011110.content: The good news is that there's more than enough danger for everyone in Sasanami right now. Soon enough, the squad will be far too busy to worry about trivial matters like your whereabouts.

123011111.content: Ah, humor. Just what I needed.

123011112.content: I assume you wouldn't like to hang around chatting with a boring boss.

123011114.content: Listen... You already know this, but here's a reminder. Take care out there. Don't push your luck.

123011115.content: Tsukuyomi pauses a moment. Odin rarely worries. Her warning indicates that this mission may be much more dangerous than anticipated.

123011117.content: The call ends and Tsukuyomi flies off into the buildings of Kamigyou.

123011118.content: Relax. I'll protect you no matter what!

123011119.content: It's a deal. When you need me, I'll be there.

123011120.content: Admin, do you think the humans of Gaea really need to face up to their fates? Or can they just live happily, but in ignorance?

123011121.content: Perhaps it's best someone else make that decision for them.

123011122.content: A bright light pierces the dark dream. I instinctively lift a hand to block the light, and try to open my eyes.

123011123.content: I look to the side. The door I've come to know so well is still closed. I give a short sigh.

123011124.content: Shu moves her fingers from the light switch and comes to my side.

123011125.content: This is the fourth day. You can't keep sleeping in the hall, surely.

123011126.content: Has it been four days? Anyway, they still say they can't open the door to Ver's ward yet. I'm going to wait until they can. I thought I'd have seen her by now, though.

123011127.content: Admin, I can imagine how you're feeling. But this is a CORG unit. You can't just move in.

123011128.content: I'm not going to leave Ver here alone.

123011129.content: I'm sure the CORG medics have already told you, but she needs the equipment here. That means we have to let CORG handle her treatment.

123011130.content: Odin has briefed me the situation and I've confirmed with CORG that they'll have their best people looking after Ver.

123011131.content: Once she's stable and can be transfered out of here, I'll get her back to Aether Gazer, as soon as possible.

123011133.content: The hall falls silent again, the only sound the regular beeping of a monitor somewhere. We both seem to be considering what to say next.

123011134.content: Do you want to come and talk about what happened in Xu Heng some time?

123011135.content: Images flash across my mind. Scenes of relaxation. Of crisis. Of pain and regret... And then they all merge together.

123011136.content: You don't have to if you don't feel like talking. Sometimes, we need to give ourselves time... to move on.

123011137.content: But that's not going to happen if you just sit here. Admin, I need you to pull yourself together. Despite all the changes, despite everything that's happened... we still have a job to do.

123011138.content: I mull those words over. The concern Shu feels, the comfort she offers. Suddenly, I feel ashamed of how I'm wallowing in my sadness.

123011139.content: I'm also aware that on any other occasion, Shu would have expressed herself much more harshly. But she didn't.

123011141.content: We have to go, Admin. There's a new mission.

123011143.content: My gaze falls on that door one more time.

123011144.content: I'm still worried... I should let her rest. (Options)

123011145.content: Ver's still asleep. There's nothing we can do here.

123011146.content: Let her rest. All we can do is count on CORG now.

123011147.content: You're right... I'm sorry. I just keep thinking about her.

123011149.content: Thinking about it... Admin, this will be your first mission without Ver, won't it?

123011151.content: You can finish the mission and then come back to tell her all about it.

123011153.content: The visitors leave. The hall regains its mysterious silence once more.

123011154.content: Behind that door, Ver lies quietly in a custom-made pod.

123011155.content: Unable to react to anything that is happening nearby, she seems to be trapped in an endless dream...

123011156.content: Heimdall has a ton of data laid out on the holographic screen and is using all those numbers and figures to help me understand the gravity of the situation.

123011157.content: The sample data from Sasanami shows that the Bane Energy level in the woods of Shimogyou has far exceeded the normal range. Our monitoring station in Sasanami has also detected a high number of Bane Energy signals lately.

123011158.content: If the data is correct, we're looking at a massive swarm of Visbanes in the woods of Sasanami, far too many for our Modifiers there to deal with.

123011159.content: Where are they coming from? Quakes?

123011160.content: No... the Bane Energy is not coming from the Source Layer. It's fundamentally different from what we see with Quakes. We'll have to perform a field survey to find out the source.

123011161.content: I guess that's what you need me for?

123011162.content: Pheasant Squad is in place and awaiting orders. Once you're there you can join up and start the investigation. But...

123011163.content: There's a doubt in Shu's eyes. A doubt you don't expect to see in someone usually so decisive.

123011164.content: Tsukuyomi has been assigned to a top-secret mission, so she's not with the squad, and won't be there for the survey.

123011165.content: A team without a leader... it'll be tricky.

123011166.content: The good news is that we haven't got any reports of Visbanes attacking locals. We still have time.

123011167.content: The authorities in Sasanami have requested CORG assistence and the Quake Damage Control Department is getting troops ready for transport. We'll work on plans for any Visbane incursions.

123011168.content: But Photon Rail capacity is limited, so full deployment is going to take time. Ideally, we'll finish the investigation before they're in place and figure out how to stall for time. That'll make what comes next much easier.

123011170.content: Also, the Quake Damage Control people have reached out to ask if they can join the mission. So Pheasant Squad won't be entirely alone.

123011171.content: Working with the Quake Damage Control Department... Can we trust them?

123011172.content: Let's just say... proceed with caution, Admin.

123011173.content: Got it. How many people are they sending?

123011176.content: And in the meeting room, I see who that "one" is.

123011177.content: Our guest has made herself comfortable on the table, a spot clearly not intended for guests. She stretches, reminding me of a lioness settling down to enjoy the sun. She seems oblivious to the surprised looks Shu and I are giving her.

123011178.content: This is Sekhmet, squad captain of the CORG Quake Damage Control Department.

123011182.content: I have to say, you're a little disappointing. Not at all what I imagined after reading our file on you.

123011184.content: You must be disappointed too, though? I'm sure you were hoping for a replacement for that awesome partner of yours. So I guess we're both in the same boat there.

123011186.content: Dear guest, there's a sofa for you to sit on. And...

123011187.content: I know. Don't worry. I'm not here to psychoanalyze my new partner.

123011188.content: Well, as you are being so "understanding", I don't think we need to waste more time on inconsequential matters. Let's just get to the briefing now.

123011189.content: I completely agree. But I like to be high up, so I'll skip the sofa. Thanks, though.

123011190.content: Shu, normally so calm, is clenching her fists. But she's a professional and quickly masters herself.

123011191.content: According to the file sent over from the Quake Damage Control Department, you're also a Mod?

123011192.content: Yes. If your elevator hadn't been too small for my Access Key, you wouldn't have needed to ask.

123011193.content: Then you'll understand, I'm sure, that Mod teams work differently from human agents. If we are to work together, we need a clear chain of command.

123011194.content: I thought you'd bring that up. But it's not important. The Admin here can have full command authority. As long as I can have as much leave as I want.

123011196.content: You know, if I find a pleasant pool at a cute hot springs hotel and want to spend a night there, or something like that, I wouldn't want to bother Admin by asking for permission.

123011198.content: No. All movements by squad members will be approved by the squad commander. That is essential for a successful mission.

123011199.content: How rigid... Are you sure you aren't taking your anger at CORG out on me?

123011200.content: Captain, I'm sure CORG has briefed you well on the current situation.

123011201.content: What is about to happen in Sasanami is no ordinary Quake. This mission involves unpredictable threats. I do not think it would be wise for you to go wandering off on your own.

123011202.content: Hmm... Well, I hope you and I get along then, Admin.

123011203.content: Now that we've made that clear... briefing over.

123011204.content: As we leave, I struggle to put my thoughts into words.

123011205.content: Admin, you're leaving for Sasanami soon. If you have any questions, now's the time.

123011206.content: Why is it so important that I'm in command?

123011207.content: Both Aether Gazer and CORG are dedicated to fighting the Visbanes. But we are different organizations with differing aims.

123011208.content: Given everything that's happened before... The situation in Sasanami does not look good. We must take the initiative.

123011209.content: But... She's an experienced squad leader and a Mod. Maybe she is better suited to the job than I am. And maybe that's why she was acting so rude? Because she doesn't respect my authority?

123011210.content: What makes you think that, Admin?

123011211.content: I guess because... Well, I can't forget that I'm only human.

123011212.content: Shu stops and turns to me, her face stern.

123011213.content: You've been on a hundred missions since joining us at Aether Gazer, Admin. And you've always been indispensable to the success of those missions. I don't think there's any need to revisit this.

123011214.content: Shu places a hand on my shoulder. It's a warm gesture, but firm.

123011215.content: Admin, Aether Gazer is relying on you. Get it done.

123021001.content: I leave the Sasanami Photon Rail station and look up once again into the towering buildings of Kamigyou. I know I was here only recently, but it feels as if it was a lifetime ago.

123021002.content: You've been through a lot. It won't feel the same.

123021004.content: How did you know what I was thinking?

123021005.content: Because it's written all over your face.

123021006.content: She's been like this the whole journey. Just as I'm wondering what, if anything, I can do about it, I'm saved by two familiar figures.

123021007.content: Admin, Buzenbo Tengu of Pheasant Squad reporting!

123021008.content: Buzenbo, anyone would think you'd never met Admin before. We're old friends, remember?

123021010.content: As mentioned in our comms, this is Sekhmet, a squad captain from CORG's Quake Damage Control Department.

123021011.content: Oh, an outsider, eh? That's going to make things awkward.

123021012.content: Kuninotokotachi looks Sekhmet up and down, a playful smile on her face.

123021013.content: So, Admin, how about you let me give her an... initiation?

123021014.content: Ahem. Kuninotokotachi, please treat our partner with respect.

123021015.content: Sekhmet seems unsure how to react to Kuninotokotachi's teasing. She sniffs the air and suddenly, a look of disgust appears on her face. It's as if she's smelt something intolerable. She takes several steps back.

123021016.content: What a stench... Don't get too close!

123021017.content: I stare on in disbelief. Kuninotokotachi continues smiling, but it's a smile now confined to her lips. Her eyes are grim and full of threat.

123021018.content: Admin, according to the briefing, this is a dangerous mission. So it's not impossible someone might, y'know, sort of die out there, right?

123021020.content: The squad discipline is collapsing within less than five minutes after my arrival. Thankfully, Buzenbo manages to defuse the rapidly escalating situation.

123021021.content: Admin, the intel we've received indicates the Visbane signals are coming from an unpopulated area deep in the mountains.

123021022.content: It's not the kind of territory you want to be in after dark. I suggest we get moving stat. Hopefully we can have everything wrapped up before nightfall.

123021024.content: Kuninotokotachi finally decides to ignore Sekhmet, rather than glare daggers at her. Sekhmet still looks disgusted.

123021025.content: I look off at the mountain ridge in the distance, feeling not so optimistic about this trip already.

123022001.content: I've examined the corpses we've gathered. The lines on their skin look very similar to those on Visbanes, but their organs seem unaffected. That's very different from the Source Layer Visbanes.

123022003.content: There's no shortage of cases of conversion by Encroacher Type Visbanes.

123022004.content: But a single Encroacher can't convert so many animals in such a short time... Surely there can't be thousands of Encroachers hiding in the forest?

123022005.content: And we haven't seen any, have we?

123022006.content: We look back down the path we came by. It's scattered with corpses of those beasts—but no sign of any Encroachers.

123022007.content: I gaze through the trees, confused, trying to see what might be hiding there. I can't spot anything of use—just Sekhmet, lounging against a tree trunk as if she isn't even part of our team.

123022009.content: Thoughts? If a little one couldn't do it, there must be a big one somewhere.

123022014.content: Some kind of advanced Encroacher Type, able to convert large numbers of animals at once? You'd expect something like that to have a stronger Bane Energy signal, but the monitoring station hasn't picked up anything matching that.

123022015.content: Girl, I'm sure you're great at memorizing the manual and doing exactly what it tells you.

123022016.content: But when things get freaky, you gotta think freaky. Understand?

123022018.content: Don't sweat it, Buzenbo. Not understanding means you've got a brain.

123022019.content: Doesn't matter if it's a crowd of small ones or a single giant one. We've got to find the source first.

123022021.content: Attaboy. You're starting to act like a commander, Admin.

123022022.content: The squad sets off again, moving ever deeper into the ever-darker forest.

123022023.content: And maybe I'm imagining things, but it feels as if every beast, every bird, every insect is watching us, acting in unison as one giant forest organism tracking our every move.

123031001.content: The forest grows denser around us. The shadows make it harder to perceive the passage of time, and it isn't until we pass a clearing and have to shade our eyes from the sun that I realize it's already noon.

123031002.content: We've come way further into the forest, yet there's no sign of any of those weird Visbeasts.

123031003.content: Visbeasts. I like it. So where are they all? The briefing made it sound like the place was crawling with 'em.

123031004.content: Check for nearby Bane Energy signals.

123031006.content: Those portable ones have limited range, though. We need to scan a wider area.

123031007.content: Mimir, can you access Bane Energy data from the monitoring station?

123031008.content: Hmm. The data transfer seems rather slow today. Just when was the last time maintenance made an appearance here?

123031009.content: Mimir's lights flicker, but the full dataset doesn't come through.

123031010.content: What's up, little one? No signal?

123031011.content: Watch your tone! Transferring data. Transferring...

123031013.content: Mimir gives off an odd burst of static and then falls silent. We're still staring at the device when we hear someone calling from some distance away.

123031015.content: I see Sekhmet, shouting at us and holding a terminal. I can't help but start to have doubts about her professionalism.

123031016.content: Captain, you're not so far away. I can just hear you. There's no need to use the terminal!

123031017.content: You can just hear me? So your terminal didn't ring?

123031018.content: I'm about to give her a dressing down, but what she says makes me realize something.

123031019.content: Could this be some kind of electromagnetic dead zone? Perhaps because of all the Bane Energy?

123031020.content: I don't think it could be any more obvious.

123031021.content: Think about it. There must be some kind of huge Encroacher, like I said, but also able to suppress electromagnetic signals. That would explain why the monitoring station didn't detect it.

123031022.content: That would be a real threat. So how do we find it?

123031023.content: How should I know? I'm just trying to prove that I'm right.

123031024.content: Suddenly, I remember I was about to give Sekhmet a talking-to.

123031025.content: I've got an idea. Why don't we hang Miss CORG from a tree and see if anything comes out to eat her?

123031027.content: Don't you think it's odd, Admin?

123031028.content: Buzenbo, yet again, gets us focused on our mission once more.

123031029.content: If there is a huge Encroacher out here somewhere, why has it let us get so far into the forest? What's it up to?

123031030.content: I don't like enemies I can't understand.

123031031.content: The squad falls silent. The forest too is tranquil. But I can sense danger out there in the trees.

123031032.content: We need to turn back. Get out of the dead zone and report in to HQ.

123031034.content: The call for aid shatters the forest peace. Buzenbo and Kuninotokotachi, already on edge, whip out their weapons.

123031036.content: There shouldn't be anyone here. The forest is supposed to be off limits.

123031037.content: Plenty of people in Shimogyou come up here hunting. They could have been here since before the warnings were issued.

123031038.content: Yeah. Let's check it out first. Stay frosty.

123031039.content: We weave our way around several huge trees and, in among some dense brush, find an injured man. Sure enough, it's a commoner from Shimogyou, with a large basket full of his haul.

123031041.content: We're a rescue team sent in to help. What happened?

123031042.content: I was out hunting when these weird animals attacked me. I have been hiding in here since then. I didn't think I was going to make it...

123031043.content: Don't worry. We're about to head back. We can take you with us.

123031044.content: Thanks—No! Not now. My daughter's still in there. We were together, but we got split up when we were attacked. Maybe she's still alive... you've got to help her if you can.

123031046.content: Just as I'm considering how to respond, a razor-sharp hook slashes through the air beside me to lodge in the tree above the injured man's head. An inch closer and it would have killed him.

123031048.content: Tut tut. You're a terrible liar.

123031050.content: Inventing a "daughter" to get our sympathy is the right choice, but you messed up big time. You forgot to make sure the second lie matches up with the first one.

123031051.content: Any father in your situation would, on seeing rescuers arrive, beg us to go and find his daughter first. Not drop it into conversation later.

123031052.content: Buzenbo, Kuninotokotachi and I all back away.

123031053.content: Hah. I lured you this far. Good enough!

123031054.content: Countless pairs of red eyes appear in the forest gloom, surrounding us. There's no way out.

123031055.content: Then, from the depths of the forest, comes the gentle cry of a deer. As if acting on orders, the Visbeasts concealed in the trees charge, a black tide flowing onto the green.

123031056.content: The "injured" man sneers as he steps backwards. The beasts rush past him, parting to avoid him. And as they pass, he disappears amidst the shadows of the trees.

123031057.content: A human in league with the Visbanes? A rare find.

123031058.content: Sekhmet charges off in pursuit of our deceiver.

123031060.content: Admin, this is a trap. We need to get out of here!

123031061.content: You're right, we've got our own problems now.

123032001.content: Countless fallen Visbeasts lie scattered at our feet, but there's still no gap for us to escape through. They keep coming at us in an endless horde.

123032002.content: Until a powerful and bone-chilling wind rises from the forest.

123032003.content: By the time the crystals of ice recede, there's a small mountain of Visbeast corpses to climb over on our way out. The other Visbeasts are even too shaken to give chase.

123032004.content: Brrr. Cold! Kuramitsuha, at your service. If you would be so kind as to introduce yourselves...

123032005.content: What are you doing here, troublemaker?

123032008.content: A Shimogyou thug. But a Mod, all the same. I tried to recruit her for the Pheasant Squad once.

123032009.content: Thug? I'm a Ninkyoumon, or "unconventional warrior" to you. Unconventional, maybe, but a warrior for sure!

123032010.content: Then thank you, Ninkyoumon, for your help. We're on our way out of here. Will you accompany us?

123032011.content: Kuramitsuha looks at me and her eyes narrow.

123032012.content: It looks like you're in charge. And a human, too!

123032016.content: This isn't the time to discuss this further. The Visbeasts are closing in again.

123032017.content: No time for chit-chat. Stick close if you want to get out of here.

123041001.content: The horde screams past below our feet. Up in the treetops, we sigh with relief.

123041002.content: Admin, we're out of the dead zone. Terminals have signal again.

123041004.content: There's no sign of her. She could still be in the dead zone.

123041005.content: Why did she have to go off in a moment like this...?

123041006.content: Don't worry your pretty little head. She's a CORG ace, remember? She'll make it out, alive and annoying.

123041008.content: Kuramitsuha suddenly leaps up to the very top of the tree and looks proudly down at us.

123041009.content: Brrr. Cold! I told you already, stick with me and you won't go wrong!

123041010.content: Hey, you didn't answer my question. What are you doing here?

123041011.content: Oh, you'd like to purchase some intel? Well, in exchange, perhaps you could help me find work for some Shimogyou kids I know?

123041012.content: You asked the same thing when I was trying to recruit you. I got them all jobs only to find you gone without a trace.

123041013.content: You know, that attitude of yours makes you hard to work with.

123041014.content: Everyone in Shimogyou knows you can't be trusted.

123041015.content: The stampede below roars onwards as Kuninotokotachi and Kuramitsuha bicker. In fact, it seems to be getting louder. I jump to my feet, realizing something. Something horrible.

123041016.content: Off in the distance, I can see the forest canopy swaying, as if a wave is passing over a sea of green. Startled birds scatter.

123041017.content: Mimir, I need you to access Bane Energy data from the monitoring station again.

123041018.content: Just a sec. The network's finally better now... Data transfer complete. Generating holographic image...

123041019.content: A radar map forms in front of me. The countless red dots are almost a sheet of crimson, a tide rushing over the land. And that tide is flowing, at full speed, toward Shimogyou.

123041020.content: When did they flock together like that?

123041021.content: It must have been while we were in the dead zone. There's a large-scale incursion underway, right now!

123041022.content: We need to inform the Quake Damage Control Department. They need to set up defenses and start evacuations, ASAP!

123041023.content: It won't do much good. Their forces can't get here in time and they don't have enough people on the ground here in Sasanami.

123041024.content: I clench my fist, staring at the mass of Bane Energy signals on the holographic map.

123041027.content: Ahem. Allow me to explain what I'm doing here. Free of charge, this time.

123041028.content: Lady Akishika sent me into the forest to rescue stragglers and surveil the—Visbeasts, you called them? And also to make preparations for her plan in Shimogyou.

123041030.content: Sure do! They've sent every soldier they have to Shimogyou.

123041034.content: Hey, my buddy Admin here is no ordinary human. And you must have learned about the Visbanes when you awakened. Surely you can understand what's going to happen to any humans who face off against Visbanes?

123041035.content: Wiping their memories is not even a major problem now. Without Quake Damage Control Department's technology, a human army going up against a Visbane horde is going to get slaughtered!

123041036.content: Hmm. You'll need to discuss that with my employer. I'm just here to get my word done, and get paid for it.

123041037.content: And anyway, what other choice is there?

123041038.content: Buzenbo and Kuninotokotachi both turn to look at me. I know I have an important decision to make.

123041039.content: There's no other option. Ninkyoumon, can you take us to this Lady Akishika, as soon as possible? I have to see her before those Visbeasts get to Shimogyou.

123041040.content: Hmm. As you have been kind enough to give me my proper title, I will. But like I said, stick close!

123051001.content: Did you see that? What is it?

123051002.content: Some kind of wild animal? Just run!

123051003.content: One group of Visbeasts are far ahead of the horde, forming a vanguard and approaching the outskirts of Shimogyou. Panicked locals flee toward the city, but find the roads blocked.

123051005.content: I suspect someone has set a tollgate up ahead and is charging for entry to the city.

123051007.content: Welcome to Shimogyou. I do hope you enjoy our local customs.

123051008.content: We can enjoy your Shimogyou "customs" anytime, troublemaker. But this isn't a leisure trip, is it?

123051009.content: Relax, this won't delay us. We can take to the rooftops.

123051010.content: The point of this mission is to protect the locals. We can't just ignore this, surely?

123051012.content: Kuramitsuha looks at me in surprise. It's clear protecting locals isn't on her to-do list for the day.

123051015.content: Kuramitsuha looks unwilling, but she hops up onto a rooftop and is soon in front of one of the barriers.

123051016.content: I see from your tattoos that the Kiwamikawagumi has control of this road. Might I have a word?

123051017.content: The hoodlums standing guard look at each other, then one man steps forward from the rear. He looks at Kuramitsuha, irritated.

123051018.content: Do the Kiwamikawagumi really need to send their second in command to run a backstreet shakedown?

123051019.content: Oh, it's you, Ninkyoumon. Let her through, lads, no charge. We'll call it a favor. Safe travels.

123051020.content: Favor declined. Let's not forget that you couldn't get any money out of me anyway.

123051021.content: We were being so polite, and now you've ruined it. What do you want?

123051022.content: Could you remove the roadblock? That, we could call a favor.

123051023.content: The lads need to make some coin. I can't stop them earning a living.

123051024.content: I don't want to ruin your business. Perhaps we can compromise. Move your operation, say, a few miles backwards. Then keep on charging tolls. How about it?

123051025.content: If we do that, everyone behind you will make it into the city and stay there. So who'll pay our toll?

123051026.content: Ah. I was hoping to avoid this.

123051027.content: Kuramitsuha whips out her naginata and a chill wind starts to swirl.

123051028.content: Brrr. Cold! Fight me all at once, you still won't win. So clear the way and make it easy for everyone.

123051029.content: Tut tut. Honorable Ninkyoumon, you are a powerful figure in Shimogyou. You know as well as we do, this isn't about who is stronger. It is about who is crueler.

123051030.content: Kiwamikawa Fujio gestures to his men, who quickly draw their own weapons—some even wield black-market firearms. But they don't aim at Kuramitsuha. They take aim at the locals gathered behind her.

123051032.content: I heard tell you are working for the Akishika. That explains why you are trying to help these people—after all, among the five families, the Akishika are the most concerned for the welfare of the ordinary folk.

123051033.content: If you wish to fight us, we cannot win. But I am sure you do not wish any innocents to be harmed.

123051034.content: The situation is unbearably tense. Kuramitsuha, standing at the very center of the storm, looks strangely unconcerned.

123051035.content: If we're going to fight, we'll just have to regard anyone who fails to flee in time as unfortunate.

123051036.content: The coldness coming from her naginata intensifies. Kiwamikawa Fujio is taken aback by her response.

123051037.content: You don't care if this is going to hurt these innocent people?

123051039.content: Kuramitsuha doesn't even hesitate before responding.
