123051040.content: After a brief pause, Kiwamikawa Fujio seems to see something in Kuramitsuha that leads him to a decision. He gestures for his men to lower their weapons.

123051041.content: Alright. Seems like you're the crueler one, after all.

123051043.content: The hoodlums glance at each other before hurrying to follow their boss's order. The crowds waiting to pass are finally able to proceed.

123051044.content: The confrontation has ended well, but I'm shocked by the risk that Kuramitsuha was willing to take.

123051045.content: Ninkyoumon, would you really have let them attack the civilians?

123051046.content: Of course... not! C'mon, Admin, surely now's not the time to start worrying about being honest?

123051047.content: You'll get used to it, Admin. If her lips are moving, assume she's lying.

123051048.content: There was no need to worry, Admin. I was ready to intervene and stop any actions that would have breached Aether Gazer regulations.

123051050.content: Oh, never mind that. Look, the Akishika mustering ground is up ahead...

123051052.content: Buzenbo, always on alert, calls out. I follow her gaze and soon see the problem. A group of Visbeasts have reached the city.

123051053.content: The main horde of Visbeasts is still behind us. This is a small vanguard group. But the roadblock has held the locals back and now they have little chance of escape.

123051054.content: Just in the couple of seconds when I'm staring shocked, unsure what to do, a blast of artillery fire explodes in the Visbeasts' direction. The flames temporarily halt their attack.

123051055.content: A squad of soldiers appears, maintaining a disciplined formation as it pushes through the tide of fleeing locals, moving toward the attacking Visbeasts.

123051056.content: This area is temporarily under emergency Akishika control. Please leave!

123051058.content: Human soldiers can't handle this alone. Help them!

123052001.content: It's a short but intense engagement. In the end, the Visbeasts are wiped out.

123052002.content: But the roar of the main horde, still distant, can be heard now. It's a terrifying sound that reminds us the situation is only going to get worse.

123052004.content: Relax, Buzenbo. The Quake Damage Control Department handles memory wipes. We need to stay on mission.

123052005.content: That said... How come these soldiers knew how to fight Visbanes?

123052007.content: A squad of soldiers lined up nearby breaks into cheers as a young woman in military gear approaches, accompanied by two officers.

123052008.content: She catches my eye for a minute, and I feel as if I'm being bathed in a bright warm light. It leaves me dazed for a moment.

123052009.content: I assume these are the Aether Gazer guests Mitsy spoke of in her messages.

123052011.content: Akishika Himiko, Lady Akishika. In the flesh.

123052013.content: Yes. A lovely name, isn't it?

123052014.content: Sorry. I didn't mean to cause offense.

123052015.content: You didn't. I would like to thank you. Our counter-attack would not have succeeded without your help.

123052016.content: We were glad to help. But I must point out that raising an army to fight these... beasts, whatever they are, without consulting Aether Gazer and CORG, is extremely unwise.

123052017.content: Similarly, sending a team into the wilds of Sasanami, without consulting any of the five families, is also most unwise.

123052018.content: Akishika Himiko, confident and composed, easily rebuts my criticism. I cannot deny she has a point.

123052019.content: There is some time before the main horde reaches us, but less than I would like. I think we have some urgent matters to discuss, yes?

123052021.content: But before that, shouldn't you introduce yourself?

123052023.content: Well, now we know each other's names. It's a good start, at least.

123061001.content: As the Visbeast horde grows closer, the atmosphere outside the city of Shimogyou grows ever more tense. The first Akishika forces are arriving, along with their supplies. It looks as if they're planning to build some serious fortifications here.

123061002.content: Akishika Himiko's personal guard have screened off a section of the street to create a temporary command post. It's a rare island of calm in a sea of noise and activity.

123061003.content: And as the two of us sit there, I start to calm down.

123061004.content: So that is the current situation.

123061005.content: I understand. Admin, I am authorizing you to cooperate with our local partner, subject to certain confidentiality restrictions. I'll work things out with CORG.

123061006.content: Shu is talking rapidly, clearly aware the situation here allows for no delay. She's doing everything she can to save me time.

123061008.content: Closing communication session... Remember to put in a request to upgrade my comms module the next time we chat!

123061009.content: Aether Gazer rules must be very strict, if you need to check in with your superiors even when time is as pressing as today.

123061010.content: It's important and necessary. I hope you can understand.

123061011.content: Hmm. Spoken like a true leader. Should I call you Admin, like your squad does?

123061012.content: Uh... Then what should I call you? Lady Akishika? Or General?

123061013.content: If you're asking me... just call me Himiko.

123061015.content: I don't think we have the time to worry about what is and isn't appropriate, Admin.

123061016.content: Very well, Himiko. What do you know about our enemy?

123061019.content: Do not forget, Admin, I have a Mod for a friend. I know everything a Mod can know about fighting Visbanes.

123061020.content: Ah, the Ninkyoumon... I see Shu's confidentiality concerns came too late. So your soldiers—

123061021.content: My soldiers, naturally, need to understand their enemies, too.

123061023.content: Himiko gives a gentle smile. My nerves, by now stretched to breaking point, relax a little.

123061024.content: As far as they know, their enemy is a strange kind of beast, and killing them requires certain techniques. They know those techniques, no more.

123061025.content: It's still risky, Himiko. I need to make clear that you and your soldiers will need to undergo memory wipes once the Visbeast crisis is under control.

123061026.content: She falls silent for a moment before responding.

123061027.content: It's a strange world, isn't it? Why can't humanity be allowed to make the decisions that determine its fate?

123061028.content: But very well. I understand. Can we get to the details of this operation?

123061029.content: I recommend you transfer some forces to my command, to work with my squad and delay the horde. Your remaining soldiers can speed up the evacuation of Shimogyou and get everyone to Kamigyou, which will be easier to defend.

123061030.content: Impossible. Shimogyou is much larger than Kamigyou and much more... disorganized. A full evacuation will take much more time than you think.

123061031.content: Moreover, the oncoming horde represents only a fraction of what we have to deal with. We cannot risk getting pinned down by the first wave and finding ourselves unable to respond when further waves attack.

123061033.content: Put your squad of Mods under my command. With your team and Mitsy helping, I am confident we can wipe out the first wave. Then we will have time to finish the defensive engineering works between Shimogyou and the surrounding forests.

123061034.content: That will allow us to hold Shimogyou in its entirety, until the Quake Damage Control Department arrives.

123061036.content: She places a map of Shimogyou on the table and traces a line across it with her finger.

123061037.content: The residents of this area, the outskirts of the city, have already moved inside. So this will, for now, be where we make our stand.

123061038.content: Even a well-trained regular army would struggle to stop a full-on frontal assault by Visbeasts en masse. Ranged attacks would be too spread out across such a large area. All it would take was a small group of them slipping through to break the line completely.

123061039.content: So we will lure them into the city. The streets will act as ready-made choke points, the Visbeasts being divided up across numerous narrow alleyways. We'll concentrate our firepower at specific points and create kill-zones, taking them out in large numbers.

123061040.content: Once this first wave is fully committed to its attack, my forces outside the city will erect a temporary barrier to cut off their retreat. That barrier will also act as the first stage of a more substantial construction to be built later.

123061041.content: I pause to consider the plan.

123061042.content: Let me remind you once more, Admin, that we have no time to waste.

123061043.content: Allowing them within the city is ridiculous. But even ignoring that... Himiko, I'm sure you know that ordinary weapons will be useless against this enemy?

123061044.content: But these aren't ordinary Visbanes, are they? Visbeasts, remember?

123061045.content: I recall Buzenbo's examination of those we killed in the forest.

123061046.content: As you're aware, the Visbeasts are ordinary animals which have somehow been mutated. They retain their original internal organs. We carried out experiments soon after discovering the new threat and found that human weapons do work.

123061047.content: The last piece of the puzzle is in place, and Akishika Himiko's million-to-one shot is starting to look like it might just work.

123061048.content: It sounds as if you've been planning for this for some time.

123061049.content: If I had sat and waited for help, Shimogyou would have fallen by now.

123061050.content: True. But even so... it's risky.

123061051.content: Remember, Admin, that you are here to help me. Our success is assured!

123061052.content: She looks into my eyes. It's a kindly gaze, and a persuasive one. It seems to give me a courage which feels both familiar and novel at the same time.

123061054.content: I leave the tent and find Buzenbo and Kuninotokotachi, clearly waiting for instructions.

123061055.content: We will give the Akishika operation full support.

123061056.content: Right... I trust your judgement, Admin.

123061057.content: You were only in there a few minutes! How persuasive can that woman be?

123061058.content: Kuninotokotachi, I gave you an order! Let's go get prepared!

123062001.content: The sounds of battle rage on, the dust hangs in the air, Visbeast corpses litter the ground. As far as the eye can reach, the metal skeleton of a defensive city wall has taken shape and is rapidly being built out into a solid barrier.

123062002.content: The horde of Visbeasts has been eliminated.

123062003.content: The human soldiers really did it. They held the city.

123062004.content: Oh, nothing to do with us working ourselves to death?

123062006.content: Buzenbo, sometimes I wonder which side you're on...

123062008.content: Kuninotokotachi and I follow Buzenbo's gaze. We see a firing position. And further down the street, another one. And behind that... still another.

123062009.content: Akishika Himiko has set up a layered defense. If one falls, the second becomes the new front line. And so on.

123062010.content: There's little doubt the first line would have been overrun without our help. But the soldiers there stuck to their positions.

123062011.content: Even without our support, the horde would have been stopped. But they'd have reached—I don't know. The third line? Fourth?

123062012.content: The Akishika are known for their military leadership, but I didn't realize they were this good. That Himiko is something else.

123062013.content: A squad of soldiers approach and bow respectfully to us, before getting back to clearing the street.

123062014.content: She sure is. Not many humans could do so well.

123062015.content: With a whirl of her blade, Himiko decapitates a Visbeast which slipped through the defenses. She notices Kuramitsuha leaning idly against a wall, enjoying the show, and gives her a smile.

123062016.content: Perhaps you'd like to join me? We've got a street to defend here.

123062017.content: The street is no concern of mine. Unless I see you are in danger... I'll keep loafing.

123062018.content: Himiko doesn't seem surprised by Kuramitsuha's attitude and lets the matter drop. But she changes the subject—

123062019.content: Mitsy, did you deliberately give away details of our operation? And then brought the outsiders here?

123062020.content: Of course... I did. As you know, Himiko, our deal requires me to be honest with you.

123062021.content: But you knew we were trying to hide our operation from CORG, didn't you? So why bring them here?

123062022.content: I thought you might appreciate the help, Himiko.

123062023.content: This might mean more hinderance than help.

123062024.content: I'm not working for you for the money. Okay, not only the money. I saw a friend in trouble and arranged some help. I'm not sure I like being talked to like an underperforming employee.

123062025.content: Hmm. I have to admit, you did bring us an excellent commander for this fight.

123062026.content: Sounds like you've already made friends with the Administrator, then?

123062027.content: Already? I guess it's more like a "finally".

123062028.content: I'm not sure I understand what you mean... Anyway, your friend is my friend, too!

123062029.content: The noise of the battle finally fades, the dust finally settles. The streets of Shimogyou start to look normal again, and people just have a new topic to discuss. It seems life has not changed much after all of this.

123071001.content: Shu gazes at the comms screen. She looks, even by her very high standards of graveness, very grave.

123071002.content: She's spoken with the director of the Quake Damage Control Department a number of times in the past. But she's still anxious about this call.

123071003.content: Mr. Izuru, you've been carrying out your own operation in Sasanami without informing us. Are you aware of the problems this has caused for our agents?

123071004.content: Director, as the Prime Lord I have to put the people of Sasanami first. It is only natural that I have plans in place for when we cannot rely on CORG assistance.

123071005.content: I see you don't understand the gravity of the situation. When you requested aid we carried out an assessment, based on your information, and assigned a coding of D8!

123071006.content: And a D8 code must be handled by CORG personnel, and only CORG personnel. Understand?

123071007.content: I am of course aware of CORG's rules for handling inter-regional incidents. But if you'll forgive me for being frank, it is only the decisive actions of the Akishika that have prevented significant losses here in Sasanami, while your CORG reinforcements are still queuing up to get on a train!

123071008.content: You cannot hope to be this lucky every time. The next time you take matters into your own hands you may find you are left holding nothing. All Sasanami could be lost!

123071010.content: Shu's arrival helps calm a confrontation that has been going on for some time. Kamau's microphone picks up the sound of water being gulped down, as if he's preparing for the next round of argument.

123071011.content: Mr. Izuru, first allow me to thank you for your prompt cooperation. We've received word that the defensive lines are secure. We hope you will be able to hold out and await our assistance, rather than engaging in proactive operations. This is, after all, a D8.

123071013.content: Very well. I think the views of CORG and Aether Gazer have been made clear. I'm sure we'll be in touch in the very near future.

123071014.content: Izuru Masayoshi signs off. Kamau's avatar starts flashing again.

123071015.content: You are too soft on them. Who knows what kind of chaos they'll unleash over there!

123071016.content: Director, perhaps rather than complaining about Mr. Izuru, our time would be better spent discussing why your operative ignored orders and went rogue?

123071019.content: My operative can look after herself and does not need your concern! And I will take full responsibility for any consequences of her actions.

123071020.content: That is reassuring. I think we can set that matter aside for now. To get back to our main topic... We need to adjust our plans to account for current circumstances.

123071021.content: The large-scale Visbane incursion came much sooner than we anticipated. There are likely to be further attacks before CORG forces can arrive. We need to give serious thought to permitting the Sasanami authorities to act independently.

123071024.content: The first wave of beasts—which is what Sasanami thinks it's fighting, mutant animals—started when our investigation team was stuck deep in the mountains. That cannot be a coincidence.

123071025.content: Normal Quakes are random, aimless. In this case, things were different. This was a targeted and directed attack on the city.

123071026.content: Shu falls silent and somehow manages to look even graver than before.

123071027.content: You think there's a Cognizant at work?

123071028.content: That's not even the worst possibility. I'm sure your own people are sending back the same intel as mine—there was a human helping the Visbanes.

123071030.content: And it's been confirmed this was not a Visbane masquerading as a human. It was an honest-to-goodness human collaborator. Correct?

123071032.content: Yes. In Sasanami. In the Miyahebi family.

123071033.content: Now it looks like the Akishika have a similar problem. I've never liked the way the people of Sasanami cling to their superstitions about mountain deities and suchlike. But I didn't realize they'd go this far.

123071034.content: Tell your people not to trust in any temporary alliances they might form there. As for everything else, we'll proceed according to your discussion with the Prime Lord. For now.

123071035.content: Shu falls silent again. But not for long.

123071036.content: I will take this into account. One more thing, however. You need to speed up the troop transfer.

123071037.content: Don't push me, damnit. I'm doing all I can. We're seeing things we never expected. We can't leave things in the hands of amateurs for any longer than necessary.

123071038.content: I've already had a fight with the Photon Rail people. They've diverted some capacity from Shashvat and Neuhansa towards Sasanami. We'll be in place by dawn tomorrow.

123071039.content: I just hope nobody screws it all up before then.

123071040.content: The Akishika soldiers have rushed modular constructions to the outskirts of the city and built an impressive defensive wall. Now, they dangle from ropes hanging over the wall's edge, installing weaponry.

123071041.content: I put my terminal away, Shu's orders still ringing in my ears. It takes me a while to decide what to do, then I walk towards Akishika Himiko.

123071042.content: So, Admin, I suppose our superiors have made up their minds?

123071043.content: Uh... Yeah. Aether Gazer and the Quake Damage Control Department have agreed to leave the Akishika in charge of defending Shimogyou.

123071044.content: There's also some good news. CORG is moving faster and will have their army here in Sasanami by dawn tomorrow.

123071045.content: That is a relief. I didn't expect them to be so reasonable. Or maybe they just do the right thing when there are no other choices left?

123071046.content: There's something I need to make clear again. When the Quake Damage Control Department gets here, they're going to prioritize memory wipes.

123071047.content: This again? Are you so keen for me to forget you?

123071049.content: Then I can do no more than express my profound regrets and complete understanding.

123071050.content: That would be best. For everyone.

123071053.content: I'm sorry, Mod teams tend to work in secret.

123071054.content: I had a feeling you'd say that...

123071055.content: There's a flash of disappointment in her eyes, but it's gone in a moment and replaced with that usual spark.

123071056.content: In that case... It's a race! Let's see who saves the world first!

123071057.content: Her enthusiasm is infectious and for a moment I forget Shu's warnings. I take Himiko's offered hand and shake it.

123071059.content: Life in Shimogyou gets back to normal, the vast majority of citizens unaware of how close they came to disaster. The streets are full of locals discussing recent events or staring out at the new wall.

123071060.content: Luckily, Shimogyou has always been a diverse place and the Pheasant Squad, now reunited, goes unnoticed through the crowds.

123071061.content: So everyone's clear on the situation?

123071062.content: I have to agree with HQ's assessment.

123071063.content: Best to be cautious, given what happened with the Miyahebi. But I can't help feeling things are more complicated this time.

123071064.content: Yeah. Prep for another trip into the mountains. We'll need to slip away quietly from that wall.

123071065.content: What? Already? C'mon, everything's calm for now... And I just saw this super-cute little bar I wanted to check out.

123071066.content: I think you already checked it out, booze-breath.

123071067.content: Ah, Admin. To really know a place, you have to take your friends there.

123071068.content: We haven't got time for this. We have no idea when the next Visbeast wave will hit, so we need to move fast. Once we're back in the mountains we'll figure out how to find Sekhmet and then continue our investigation.

123071069.content: The crazy CORG lady? Wouldn't it be better to concentrate on the investigation?

123071070.content: She's a member of our squad, on paper at least. And as squad leader...

123071071.content: And as squad leader, Admin, your priority has to be completion of our mission. Now how long is it going to take to find one tiny person in that great big forest? I mean, we're not exactly going to bump right into her at some random corner, are we?

123071072.content: If you ask me, we should let CORG's Sasanami branch go look for her...

123071073.content: The three of us turn a corner and stop in surprise.

123071074.content: There's a noodle joint in front of us. And in front of the windows, sitting on a tall stool, is Sekhmet. She's slurping from a bowl of noodles when she sees us.

123071077.content: Don't "hey, it's you guys" us! We were just about to form a search party!

123071078.content: Yeah. I was just wondering where we might find your cold dead corpse.

123071079.content: Sekhmet puts her bowl down and glares at Kuninotokotachi. But she doesn't seem annoyed.

123071080.content: You still stink. Stay away from me.

123071081.content: Kuninotokotachi draws her Chidori. Buzenbo and I struggle to hold her back.

123071082.content: Captain, let me remind you of something. If you continue to disregard orders I will have to report you. And CORG will be responsible for the consequences of your actions.

123071083.content: A powerful and justified warning. But I don't feel you delivered it with enough confidence.

123071084.content: What if I see things differently. What if past events have left you with a legacy of self-distrust. What if I actually have good reason to act independently. Deep down, that's what you're thinking. But you feel a need to give me a dressing down, which I do not take seriously, thus further undermining your authority as squad leader.

123071085.content: I... But... Is that the case here?

123071087.content: So what good reason did you have for running off?

123071088.content: What good reason could there be? She just went after that human, that's all.

123071089.content: Initially, yes. I gave chase in the heat of the moment. But in retrospect, it turns out I had good reason for doing so.

123071090.content: I'm furrowing my brow as I try and figure out this twisted logic when Sekhmet pulls out a scrap of cloth and places it on the table.

123071092.content: Did you find it on the human collaborator?

123071093.content: He wasn't exactly a master of disguise. He had his normal clothes underneath. I spotted this.

123071094.content: I pick it up and look at the crest.

123071095.content: Did you bring him back with you?

123071096.content: Why do you ask? Got something on your mind?

123071097.content: The Akishika just repelled the Visbeast attack. They... I can't see they have any reason to help the Visbanes. It could be a false flag. I need to interrogate this man face to face.

123071098.content: An entirely reasonable wish. Unfortunately, he is currently fertilizing the forest.

123071100.content: I didn't do what you think I did. Gaea only allows Mods to make necessary interventions in human activity. Using our powers to kill someone would not be permitted.

123071101.content: I caught him and applied some necessary interrogation techniques. But before I could learn anything, he was devoured by some kind of fungus grown out of his body. It left him hollowed out like a cocoon.

123071102.content: There was nothing left but what remained of his clothes.

123071104.content: What do you want, a detailed description of the process?

123071106.content: But yes, mushrooms. With a very strong Bane Energy signal. Which makes me so very curious about what powers the big bad Visbane behind all this possesses.

123071107.content: But that's not important right now. Look at the crest. Maybe it is a false flag, but why against the Akishika, who has just fighted off the Visbanes?

123071108.content: Why would someone try to create that impression? It's a lead in our investigation, at least.

123071109.content: Thank you for your help. I'll form my own conclusions.

123071111.content: Sure. Although... Can I take some leave?

123071113.content: I saw this lovely hot springs inn on my way here. I thought I might—

123071114.content: I thought you were joking about that.

123071115.content: What? Joke? At such a serious meeting? I've just escaped, solo, from the depths of a mountain forest. I think a bit of rest and relaxation seems reasonable.

123071116.content: I spend some time trying to put a sentence together, but I can't find one that will stop Sekhmet doing exactly what she wants.

123071117.content: Go then. It might be easier for both of us.

123071119.content: With that, she leaves, as if our investigation is of no concern at all to her. Thankfully, this helps Kuninotokotachi calm down.

123071120.content: The Akishika soldiers stopped the Visbeasts and we're doing our investigation. I don't see why we need any CORG captains hanging around.

123071121.content: So how about this—we forget she ever existed and get on with our mission?

123071123.content: I clutch that piece of cloth.

123071124.content: We need to find whatever is behind the Visbeast incursion. Once we find that, everything else will fall into place.

123071125.content: So first, we need to get over that wall unnoticed.

123071126.content: As we're prepping to head out, a series of blasts comes from the wall.

123072001.content: They ran off into Shimogyou, darn it. I only caught these ones.

123072002.content: As long as we've got some of them. Let's ask some questions.

123072004.content: One of the attackers pulls out a concealed bomb. But before it detonates, a blade flashes—Buzenbo, as alert as ever, sends the explosive device flying.

123072007.content: Kuninotokotachi has barely finished her sentence when the attackers start to writhe. Countless bizarre-looking mushrooms sprout from their flesh. Soon, the attackers are motionless, frozen in mid-contortion.

123072008.content: Looks like they're on the same team as that guy up in the mountains.

123072009.content: Crazy CORG lady wasn't lying, I guess.

123072010.content: I recall what Sekhmet told us. Holding my breath, I tear a piece of clothing from one of the corpses. Sure enough, I see the Akishika crest.

123072011.content: Someone's sounded the alarm. Akishika soldiers are heading this way.

123072012.content: Let's get out of here. Quietly.

123072013.content: Akishika Himiko orders her troops to seal off the scene. Then her eyes fall upon the twisted corpses.

123072015.content: My Lady, the attackers were stopped before they could do too much damage. Repairs won't take long.

123072017.content: Not yet. But... on their clothes...

123072018.content: I know. Keep it quiet. I'm dealing with it.

123072020.content: The winding streets of Shimogyou make for excellent cover. A squad of three can easily merge with the crowd and become, in effect, invisible.

123072021.content: I know why you're avoiding the Akishika woman, Admin. But we can't spend all day on a walking tour of Shimogyou, can we?

123072022.content: We need to track down the attackers who escaped into the city, or stick to the original plan and get into the mountains.

123072023.content: I know. Problem is, the two things are both important.

123072024.content: Humans collaborating with Visbanes... Shu made very clear how serious that could be.

123072025.content: You think it could be the Miyahebi all over again?

123072026.content: I can't say for sure. If we go hunt the attackers first, maybe we will miss something in the mountains. What if that's exactly the enemy's plan? And if we go looking for the root cause of all this in the mountains, then...

123072027.content: I fall silent, and neither of the other two says anything. We just look at each other.

123072029.content: We should split up. Admin, send me into the mountains. You and Kuninotokotachi keep looking for the attackers. It makes sense—I can move faster alone up there.

123072030.content: Don't be stupid. Remember the dead zone there? If you go solo you'll be completely alone. No calling for backup.

123072032.content: I know you don't like it, Admin. But you know it's what my master would do. She'd send herself, too.

123072033.content: She's not here, though. So you need to send me. I hope you can understand why I want to do it, Admin.

123072034.content: Buzenbo is resolute and I cannot refuse her request. Her determination isn't borne of stubbornness, instead, it comes from a confidence arising from countless hours of training and experience. It is reassuring.

123072035.content: Remember, Buzenbo, I just need to know what's going on up there. Find out and get back, quick as you can.

123072037.content: Buzenbo doesn't bother with a long goodbye. She leaps up to the rooftops and sprints off, mountainward.

123072038.content: She... I guess I spend so much time with her I didn't notice how much she's been growing.

123072039.content: C'mon, Kuninotokotachi. We can't waste any time either.

123081001.content: The quickly built wall forms a solid barrier, blocking the view of the distant mountains, and also any threat coming from that direction.

123081002.content: The citizens of Shimogyou crowd together, gazing at the wall that now protects them, each with their own understanding.

123081003.content: Where's that wall come from? How do we get into the mountains now?

123081004.content: It's to stop those animals, buddy. They made an announcement about animals going mad and attacking the city. Deadly if you run into them.

123081006.content: I heard these strange omens tell us the Deer God has been offended.

123081007.content: The Deer God? I heard tell he was offended months back. Don't recall anything happening then...

123081008.content: Not then, maybe. But it's happening now, isn't it? Didn't you see the slaughtered beasts? No ordinary animals, were they? They were servants of the Deer God, that's what they say.

123081009.content: Servants of a god? Killed that easily?

123081010.content: Show some respect. You'll pay if you offend the gods.

123081011.content: There's been talk that the Deer God has appeared. Certainly looks like something's afoot. We should all watch our mouths.

123081012.content: Most of the listeners agree with that. But there is one younger voice of disagreement.

123081013.content: Those monsters were no match for Akishika soldiers! Let the Deer God himself come. We'll send him running!

123081014.content: Hold your tongue! We shouldn't concern ourselves with Akishika business.

123081015.content: And that was only the first wave! A buddy of mine's a soldier, he says the worst is yet to come.

123081018.content: I just hope the Akishika fix it all, fast. Where am I going to get wood if I can't get out of the city?

123081019.content: The locals have livings to make and can't stop to chat for long. The group soon disperses, lost in the flow of people through the streets. But their words linger on in my ears.

123081020.content: Were they talking about a "Deer God", Kuninotokotachi?

123081022.content: Do you think the Deer God had something to do with this? Like what happened at the Miyahebi? Or maybe all five of the gods...

123081023.content: Kuninotokotachi raises a hand subconsciously to her left eye, then suddenly turns serious.

123081024.content: Tsukuyomi and I have been thinking about that. That's what got my eye. A Visbane thought to be the Monkey God.

123081026.content: But the Sanzaru hadn't been seen in Sasanami for ages. They were off in some secret hideaway. So there was no lead to follow there.

123081027.content: We looked into the Akishika, the Karasugo, and the Izuru. Got some info, but nothing of value.

123081028.content: As far as they were concerned, they said, the five deities of Sasanami are just legends, good for promoting unity among the clan, but nothing more.

123081029.content: Of course, they were probably lying. But poking around in the secrets of powerful human families would have been problematic. You know Aether Gazer always has to keep a low profile. So the investigation into the deities got shelved.

123081030.content: There could be a link between the Deer God and the Visbeasts, I guess. It could be a place to start.

123081031.content: As for powerful human families... Well, we've got CORG behind us now, right?

123081032.content: Gee, that's exactly the kind of brainpower I need from my superior officer, Admin.

123081033.content: Anyway, during that investigation I did learn a few things unusual about the Deer God.

123081034.content: Over time, worship of the other four of Sasanami's gods has decreased, becoming limited to the associated family. But the Deer God is still worshipped among the common folk, especially in Shimogyou.

123081036.content: Who knows? Religions can grow into any form, right? Maybe the Deer God has some special significance for them.

123081037.content: But even the believers don't take it very seriously now. I guess one day even worship of the Deer God will fade in history, like with the other four.

123081038.content: So the Deer God is the Akishika's household deity? We need to find out more. Do you know anyone here who might be able to help us?

123081039.content: Oh, too easy. We'll grab any old person we spot.

123081040.content: Kuninotokotachi looks about and points out an old man having a nap on a streetside bench.

123081042.content: Hello, sir. Could we ask you some questions about the Deer God?

123081043.content: The old man starts at mention of the Deer God and raises a shaky head.

123081044.content: The Deer God? I told 'em... All this trouble, it's got to be... They didn't show respect!

123081045.content: I.... Could you tell us about worship of the Deer God?

123081047.content: To tell you the whole story, we need to start... to start with the legend.

123081048.content: The old man takes out a bottle of water and then takes a long sip. It's as if he's warning us to settle in for a long story.

123081049.content: Admin, are you sure about this? We don't have much time.

123081051.content: The old man puts down the water and, with a great sense of ceremony, clears his throat. His expression worshipful and devout, he starts to talk.

123081052.content: Ah, the legend of the Deer God. It starts in the mountain forest. Centuries ago, they say, the Deer God refused his place in the Great Temple and chose to live in the mountains.

123081053.content: At the time, the mountain folk deeply respected the forest. They cut no more wood and hunted no more animals than were needed to provide sustenance. They lived in harmony with nature.

123081054.content: But they were attacked by an evil spirit.

123081055.content: That spirit did not respect the forest. With a wave of its hand it felled ancient trees and slaughtered birds and beasts. It was a curse on the people and the mountain alike.

123081056.content: A figure flits between the trees and, before the leaves have finished rustling, disappears into the deep green forest.

123081057.content: Buzenbo speeds up, not even stopping to deal with the stray Visbeasts roaming her path. She has her communicator on and listens to the static as she moves. When the static stops, she halts for a moment.

123091001.content: With the Bane Energy detector of no use, Buzenbo has to use her powers of observation to track her prey. It takes time, but she finds it.

123091002.content: The forest canopy is no longer green. It is a ceiling of black, blotting out the sky, creating a gloomy hideaway.

123091004.content: It is not a Visbeast, but a group of oddly dressed humans. They are clearly some religious fanatics, angered by the intrusion of an outsider.

123091005.content: A blasphemer! How dare you set foot here... don't let her get away!

123091008.content: As if recalling some unpleasant memory, Buzenbo unsheathes her blade slightly. Her vision sharpens, now as keen as the edge of her weapon.

123091009.content: Your god is exactly what I'm looking for.

123092001.content: Slashes of light cut through the gloom. In moments, Buzenbo easily slices through the line of devotees and Visbeasts and makes her way further into the forest dark.

123092002.content: And then, as her field of view opens up, she feels a suffocating sense of oppression. It takes all her strength to remain upright. Her eyes widen at what she sees ahead.

123092003.content: You have gone too far, blasphemer!

123092005.content: A huge statue sits silent and motionless, covered with moss and mud, yet somehow seems alive. Huge numbers of animals cluster around it, as if gathered to worship.

123092006.content: Buzenbo gazes at it and feels as if she looks at the forest itself. At every tree, every bird, every beast.

123092007.content: Great spirit, forgive my failings... Pray, send your divine punishment upon this blasphemer.

123092008.content: A red light glows in the eyes of the statue and the nearby animals immediately start to transform. A new Visbeast horde is taking shape!

123092009.content: Buzenbo knows she is in grave danger. Trying her best to remain calm, she quickly observes the statue's head once more—a pair of deer horns. Here in Sasanami, that can mean only one thing.

123092010.content: The Deer God. And his believers.

123092011.content: Buzenbo lowers her gaze, looking at the grass and stones at the base of the statue. At first glance, it looks like a random arrangement, but she soon realizes that isn't the case.

123092013.content: Buzenbo pulls out her equipment and makes sure she gets a record of everything she sees.

123092014.content: Suddenly, the huge statue moves, shaking the mud from its body, coming to life. The Visbeasts surrounding it howl as one, a terrifying sound, and stampede off.

123092016.content: She doesn't need to think long to realize how bad this is. That huge Visbane is clearly the source of the comms dead zone. If it goes with the horde, people won't be able to know a thing of what's coming.

123092017.content: Buzenbo doesn't hesitate. She turns to sprint down the path she came on, leaving the devotees behind.

123092018.content: The divine punishment has started! Sacrifices will be taken!

123092019.content: Buzenbo runs as fast as she possibly can. She's got vital intel and she needs to report in, immediately.

123092020.content: But it feels as if the forest is pressing in, threatening her, and the screams chasing her are getting closer. She hears something. Something... whispering.

123092022.content: The evil spirit could not escape, though. The mountain is the Deer God. The Deer God is the mountain, the trees, the birds, the beasts.

123092023.content: No matter how the spirit screamed, its cries were drowned out by the vast silence of the Deer God's forest.

123092024.content: And unable to escape, the spirit was turned to dust and dirt.

123092025.content: After that, the Deer God and the mountain folk reached an accord. The Deer God would imprison the evil spirit, and the mountain folk would make regular offerings.

123092026.content: But the kindness of a god has a price. Anyone who broke with that accord would wither like autumn grass or rot like old wood.

123092027.content: So don't delay your sacrifices, or... (Coughs)

123092028.content: The old man's tale is interrupted by a coughing fit. He takes another sip of water, soothing his throat.

123092029.content: The Deer God sounds like... an environmental activist?

123092030.content: I mull over everything the old man has told us and try to pick out the bits that might help.

123092031.content: What sacrifices does the Deer God require?

123092032.content: (Coughs) Just go. Go and you will see what the Deer God wants.

123092034.content: I told you. The Deer God is the mountain, the mountain is the Deer God.

123092035.content: The old man starts to mumble to himself. It's clear that he isn't going to be able to give us a clear answer, or any more help.

123092036.content: We walk away and find a quiet corner to talk in.

123092037.content: The Deer God is the mountain? I guess that evil spirit might be a Visbane? And people stopped making sacrifices, so the Deer God released it? No, it just doesn't make sense.

123092038.content: It just sounds like any old legend. Full of all the usual legendy stuff.

123092039.content: An agreement to make sacrifices, and to be punished if you don't... It's hard to believe a belief like that would last long among the common folks. But what if there really was some benefit behind it?

123092040.content: And if the Deer God really is a Visbane, then it could prove its power to them by creating some "supernatural" effects.

123092041.content: That's not possible. Any kind of effect impacting on a significant number of people would be picked up by CORG in no time.

123092042.content: So what are the other possibilities?

123092043.content: Kuninotokotachi and I both fall silent. Suddenly, an idea comes to my mind.

123092044.content: Could someone have been constantly preaching the Deer God's religion?

123092046.content: Maybe someone's sending out preachers, trying to convert people in Shimogyou to the Deer God. I'm sure they could win lots of people if they have the resources. That would ensure the Deer God maintains his influence.

123092047.content: Plus, it would be considered normal human activity. As long as the group keeps a low-profile, it's unlikely to come to CORG's attention.

123092048.content: It sounds like you're talking about the Akishika, Admin.

123092050.content: The Akishika have been associated with the Deer God since the very start of the legends. Nobody else can claim to be as close to the Deer God, and if anyone has the resources—well, who else could it be?

123092051.content: So the guy in the forest who lured us into a Visbane ambush, and the people who tried to blow a hole in the wall...

123092052.content: Kuninotokotachi looks at me, feeling uncomfortable to say that name out loud.

123092053.content: If the Deer God is behind the Visbeast attacks... It all fits.

123092054.content: The Akishika worship the Deer God, and use that authority to rule over Shimogyou. But the faith is on the wane. So they work with the Deer God to start the Visbeast attacks and threat the locals. But...

123092055.content: I recall the time I spent with Akishika Himiko. The idea that her family is behind it all makes logical sense. But it just can't be her...

123092056.content: Still, the Akishika repelled the Visbeast attack. There has to be some other explanation, Admin.

123092057.content: Kuninotokotachi seems to notice my discomfort and offers me a way out.

123092059.content: Her encouragement somehow helps me think more clearly.

123092060.content: Yes. There could be someone pretending to be the Akishika.

123092061.content: Framing the Akishika would distract the big family from fighting the Visbeasts. And by pretending to be the Akishika, the culprits could manipulate believers in the Deer God into working for them.

123092063.content: For now, we still don't have enough info to say which assumption is right. But we know what we need to do next.

123092064.content: Yeah. Track down the Deer God's preachers here in Shimogyou.

123092065.content: Let me think... We need to find a Deer God believer and see if they've met any preacher types claiming to be Akishika. Then we just pull on that thread...

123092066.content: There's no time to waste. That old man might know something, let's ask him.

123092067.content: But when we turn the corner, all we see is an empty bench.

123092068.content: Has he gone already? I didn't think his legs could take him somewhere else that fast.

123092069.content: It's alright. Let's just find someone else.

123092071.content: Kuninotokotachi's tone makes it clear something's amiss. I look around, wary, and see a gang of thugs.

123092072.content: Haven't seen you two before. I guess you won't know the local rules. Let me educate you a little.

123092073.content: They give us a glimpse of the illegal firearms they carry concealed under their clothes.

123101001.content: I know Shimogyou's a rough place, but when did it get this bad?

123101003.content: Yeah, but it's a bit corny—Listen up! The Akishika soldiers are round the corner. You might want to run.

123101004.content: Was I not clear? Pay up.

123101006.content: To our surprise, the thugs don't seem scared of the Akishika soldiers. Just as I'm unsure what to do, and the gang getting impatient, a group of little kids arrive, each carrying a basket of flowers. They mob the thugs.

123101007.content: The children are dressed in rags—flower-sellers trying to earn a living, forced to try their luck with anyone still on the street, regardless of the danger.

123101009.content: Promise you, mister, all the pretty girls love a flower.

123101010.content: Where'd you brats come from. Scram! Can't you see I'm busy?

123101011.content: Get in my way and you'll end up at the slave market!

123101012.content: The children seem to smell the danger. Within seconds, they've disappeared down a dark alley.

123101013.content: And no more stalling from you, either!

123101014.content: Easy, easy! I'm sure we can all come to an amicable agreement. Fighting's just going to upset the neighbors.

123101015.content: A young girl leaps nimbly down from a rooftop, landing in front of the thugs' leader.

123101017.content: Admin of Aether Gazer, it would be better if you let me negotiate our local Shimogyou customs.

123101019.content: I see you've heard of me. I am no other. The guaranteed genuine Ninkyoumon.

123101020.content: The thugs look at each other.

123101021.content: You really want to stick up for these two?

123101022.content: Wouldn't say that. I'm just helping a friend.

123101023.content: They're not frequent visitors to Shimogyou, so I'm sure you can forgive them for not knowing the rules. Or perhaps I could pay on their behalf?

123101024.content: Yeah... Thing is, I've heard of you. So I don't trust a word you say.

123101025.content: But you would trust hard cash, yes?

123101026.content: Kuramitsuha is already handing over a wad of paper notes. The thugs stare in shock for a moment before grabbing the money and counting it. I notice they hold it up to the light to check if it's real.

123101027.content: And now you have your money, sirs, perhaps we can talk about those rules?

123101028.content: Rules? Sure. The rules say those two can go.

123101029.content: Hey, boss, they gotta have more money on 'em. What say we change the rules? We ain't scared, are we?

123101030.content: Watch your mouth! I'm not scared of anyone, even the Kiwamikawagumi. But this freak's different. Don't get her riled.

123101031.content: The head of the gang looks nervously at Kuramitsuha.

123101034.content: The thugs disappear into the distance, leaving Kuninotokotachi and I staring at Kuramitsuha.

123101035.content: So much for the famed Ninkyoumon of Shimogyou. What happened to upholding justice and sending the bad guys home with bruises and brown trousers?

123101036.content: How come you just paid them and let them go?

123101037.content: Oh, I paid them with their own money.

123101039.content: Kuramitsuha snaps her fingers and a dozen or more little heads poke out from the surrounding alleyways, cautiously watching us. It seems she has a team of adorable helpers on call.

123101041.content: I'm not a fan of avoidable fights. The naginata makes everything so cold, you see. So I gave my Ninja Irregulars a job.

123101042.content: I had them snatch every penny they could find in the thugs' pockets. The major part to buy them off, and the coins as wages for the kids.

123101043.content: I taught them all these skills, of course. They are all apprentices of mine.

123101044.content: She snaps her fingers again and the little heads withdraw as fast as they appeared.

123101045.content: Hah. I bet you're leading innocent children astray.

123101046.content: Not at all. Every one of my Irregulars dreams of fighting for justice. All I do is help them find injustices to practice on.

123101048.content: So why are you helping us?

123101049.content: C'mon, Admin. Don't act like we're strangers. Himiko is my friend. She's decided you are her friend. That makes you my friend too.

123101050.content: And I'm always happy to help a friend. With or without instruction from Himiko.

123101051.content: Himiko has decided I'm her friend? Since when...

123101052.content: I recall saying goodbye to Akishika Himiko. I remember she did seem to look at me with an unusual kindness in her eyes, but I'm not sure why.

123101053.content: This cloud of suspicion will continue to hang over the head of the Akishika family until I figure out the truth in Sasanami. Of that, I'm sure.

123101056.content: Kuramitsuha suddenly comes close, then starts to walk around me as if she's examining an exhibit in a museum.

123101057.content: You certainly are a fascinating specimen, human!

123101058.content: Hey, are you trying to flirt with Admin? Because if so, your technique needs work.

123101059.content: Just at this point, we hear shouting off in the distance.

123101060.content: Ah, I guess they've discovered my little trick... Fear not, I know the perfect place for a game of hide-and-seek.

123101061.content: A few minutes later, the thugs pass by, cursing and entirely unaware we're just on the other side of the wall.

123101062.content: I don't think they are from Kiwamikawagumi, but they're brave enough to shake people down on their turf. Unusual...

123101063.content: We don't have time to worry about that.

123101064.content: So, Admin, what are you here in Shimogyou for?

123101065.content: You call me Admin like we've been working together for years...

123101066.content: Don't overthink. It's just easier to say than Administrator. So, Admin, what are you here in Shimogyou for?

123101067.content: Kuramitsuha disregards my attempt to change the topic. She looks at me, curious.

123101068.content: Her eyes are hard to read, yet unguarded and clear, a look that makes it hard to see her as an enemy. It reminds me of the look Akishika Himiko gave me as we parted.

123101072.content: She's a Mod. We could use the help.

123101073.content: Yeah, I know she's a Mod, obviously. It's just...

123101074.content: Well, if I'm not welcome, perhaps I don't want to work with you.

123101075.content: What if we're investigating something that affects the Akishika? The family's reputation and its safety?

123101076.content: Kuramitsuha's smile fades and her face becomes uncharacteristically serious.

123101077.content: I suspect there are people masquerading as Akishika to both help the Visbanes attack and manipulate worshipers of the Deer God.

123101078.content: We need to find them as soon as we can. Otherwise, the defense of the city, and your Lady Akishika, are all in danger.

123101079.content: There's a long pause and then a long sigh.

123101080.content: This is exactly what I was afraid of...

123101081.content: I will do you this favor. What's the plan?

123101082.content: We need to find a Deer God believer and ask them about any preachers claiming to be an Akishika.

123101083.content: You've really come to the right person...

123101084.content: Kuramitsuha calls up an Irregular and talks to the child for a while.

123101085.content: For something like this, we need people in the know. The kid has given us a name.

123101086.content: Then there's a chance we might figure it out! And if we do... I'll repay you, somehow.

123101087.content: Such kindness, Admin. It warms my heart, it truly does.

123101089.content: No time to waste. Just like last time—stick close!

123101090.content: Kuninotokotachi watches a full-of-energy Kuramitsuha walk off, and then sidles up to me.

123101091.content: You sure this isn't going to be a problem?

123101092.content: Our target is here in Shimogyou, so we need someone who knows the lie of the land. We just lost time dealing with that gang. We can't let that keep happening.

123101093.content: But you know she's close to Lady Akishika, don't you? That makes her a suspect, too. There's still so much we can't be sure of.

123101094.content: Kuninotokotachi, think it through. If Lady Akishika is working with the Visbanes, do you really think she's going to tell her Mod buddy the whole story?

123101096.content: I believe Kuramitsuha and us are on the same side in this investigation. And I only told her one of our theories. The one she's more likely to accept.

123101097.content: Kuninotokotachi finally seems convinced. But she's still worried.

123101098.content: Okay. But don't expect too much from her. She's unreliable.

123101099.content: We've barely started moving when we come across an angry mob. Their leader, though, seems calm.

123101100.content: Ah, I was wondering when the Kiwamikawagumi would turn up. Collecting tuition fees too?

123101101.content: How does anyone here get any work done...

123101102.content: I wouldn't ask an honored guest such as yourself for a penny. But if I might ask what business you are on?

123101103.content: Kiwamikawa Fujio is all smiles. But Kuninotokotachi and I are not convinced.

123101104.content: He's got to be planning to get money out of us, after what happened earlier.

123101105.content: No doubt. But he's not an easy one to fool. Time to play hardball?

123101107.content: Kuramitsuha suddenly draws her weapon, forcing Kiwamikawa Fujio and his men backwards. Kuninotokotachi and I seize our chance and flee.

123101108.content: You've got some thugs muscling in on your patch. Suggest you deal with them first.

123101109.content: Kiwamikawa Fujio's men make to give chase, but for some reason, he stops them.

123101111.content: We search the streets until Kuramitsuha finally spots someone—a pot-bellied policeman.

123101112.content: Afternoon, officer. Out looking for bribes?

123101113.content: You... What are you playing at?

123101114.content: I see you aren't denying the bribes bit.

123101115.content: Blackmailing me again? You almost got me caught last time...

123101116.content: If I said no, would you believe me?

123101117.content: Just tell me what you want. Looking for more juvenile thieves, are you?

123101118.content: Oh, my Irregulars are back on the straight and narrow now. Actually, officer, I have a more interesting favor to ask.

123101119.content: I'm looking for some religious types. Preachers.

123101120.content: Are you kidding me? Shimogyou's crawling with them. Like bugs on a summer tree.

123101121.content: I want the ones who pretend to be Akishika while doing it. Not too many would dare do that, I guess?

123101122.content: The cop is clearly shocked, and unsettled.

123101125.content: Okay, fine. I know someone. A... middleman, of sorts. This is the address.

123101126.content: We head to the address and immediately spot a garishly dressed man.

123101127.content: So, turns out you're the "middleman" we're looking for.

123101128.content: What are you doing here? I run a legitimate business. Nothing for you to concern yourself with.

123101129.content: Do you really think I don't know what you're up to?

123101130.content: Sure, I'm a matchmaker. I introduce people to new friends, that's all.

123101131.content: If you're feeling lonely, you come to me and I match you up with a companion. I charge a reasonable fee. Is that illegal?

123101134.content: We're not here about your business. Need to ask you a few questions, though.

123101136.content: Well, I suppose I could ask the police for help.

123101137.content: You can't threaten me with the cops. I'm all paid up this month.

123101138.content: What if you aren't? The cops work on a bonus system here. I know it just as well as you do.

123101139.content: Maybe you forgot what a good month you'd had and handed over a little less than you should. And if the police found out... Well, they'd have to enforce the law, wouldn't they?

123101142.content: Tch. Fine, ask your stupid questions.

123101143.content: Has anyone come to you asking for help finding believers for the Deer God? Someone claiming to be an Akishika?

123101145.content: Easy, easy. No need to answer so quickly. Take a moment and think about who you want to annoy. Them, or the police?

123101146.content: I mean, doing business in Shimogyou... It's all about choosing your enemies.

123101147.content: Listen, I gotta be clear. I didn't meet with any Akishika bigwigs.

123101148.content: I just got a request from colleagues. It said if I could gather up believers by the name of Akishika, someone would pay me a pretty penny.

123101149.content: Whoever it was, they were cautious. Never met them in person. Had me drop the recruits in a certain area and leave. Said they'd be picked up.

123101153.content: Kuramitsuha seems uncertain. It's a new look for her.

123101155.content: Not at all. But 2nd Chome is... big. We're going to have to ask around. Leave it with me.

123102001.content: The attackers are clearly part of the same group that sabotaged the wall, and they have the same technique for avoiding our questions. Before we can learn anything, they're consumed by an outbreak of mushrooms.

123102002.content: Oh, c'mon. I barely even touched them.

123102003.content: Brrr. Cold! What's with all the mushrooms?

123102004.content: Kuramitsuha notices the Akishika crests on their clothes and frowns.

123102006.content: I look in the direction Kuninotokotachi is pointing. A dozen or more suspicious looking figures disappear around a corner.

123102007.content: Kuninotokotachi and Kuramitsuha sprint after them, but it's too late. The streets of Shimogyou might as well be a labyrinth. Lose sight of your prey for a moment and they're gone.

123102008.content: Excuse me, did any of you happen to see a group of people run past? They were dressed odd.

123102009.content: The passersby turn to look when Kuninotokotachi shouts her question, but soon avert their gazes when they see Kuramitsuha is standing with her.

123102011.content: Kuninotokotachi and I both notice how strange the locals act when Kuramitsuha is nearby. However, Kuramitsuha herself seems entirely unbothered.

123102012.content: Was it a trick? They let us catch a few as bait, so the others could get away?

123102013.content: Fantastic analysis. Perhaps just a teeny-tiny bit late though?

123102014.content: I really thought we were making progress...

123102015.content: Time is ticking away and our hopes of finding the target are fading.

123102016.content: Don't give up. I'll use my connections. Finding a mob of suss-looking runners won't be hard.

123102017.content: She snaps her fingers again and immediately there are small heads popping out from over rooftops and behind walls.

123102018.content: Do you have any other "connections"? This is dangerous business, you can't put children at risk.

123102021.content: The Irregulars won't fail us! We need to catch them. (Option)

123102022.content: Kuramitsuha magics up a comms terminal from nowhere.

123102023.content: All forces, mobilize. This is a big one—the future of Shimogyou is at stake!

123112001.content: I run to the intersection and arrive just before collapsing. But there's no message of the Irregular we were expecting to receive.

123112003.content: Nothing but static. Kuramitsuha tightens her grip on the terminal.

123112005.content: That kid... Hey, have you seen a bunch of weird-looking folk with a kid?

123112006.content: Kuninotokotachi is losing patience with the indifferent passersby, and it shows in her tone. But nevertheless, they hurry off, as if being near us will bring them bad luck.

123112008.content: The voice is quiet and tremulous. We turn to find where it's coming from—a young boy is peering around a corner, looking guilty.

123112010.content: I was on my way but my poppa caught me. He's going out drinking today so I have to take care of the store for him. I snuck out again and... got here.

123112011.content: Ah, great. I think it's time to give up.

123112012.content: Despite what she says, I notice Kuninotokotachi giving a quiet sigh of relief. The boy is safe, at least.

123112015.content: Jirou reluctantly emerges from behind the wall. He tries to hide it, but we can see some fresh wounds on his arm.

123112016.content: Didn't get that by falling over, did you?

123112017.content: There's anger in Kuramitsuha's eyes. Jirou's about to try to explain when a man, clearly drunk, appears down the street. He starts yelling at Jirou as he approaches.

123112020.content: Even Kuninotokotachi frowns at the stink of booze coming from the new arrival.

123112021.content: Hey, that's close enough. One more step and who knows what my naginata will do.

123112022.content: The man seems to sober up fifty percent in a split second and he stops, making sure to be a naginata-length clear of Kuramitsuha.

123112024.content: I told you to watch the store, little brat. Snuck out to play with this troublemaker, I see.

123112025.content: Jirou is helping me with a mission to protect Shimogyou. Which I think is slightly more important than wasting his life in your counterfeit goods store.

123112026.content: I haven't got time for your crazy talk. Come here, boy.

123112028.content: You don't want to? Just you wait. You have to come home sometime, and when you do...

123112029.content: An arc of light slashes out and comes to rest at Jirou's father's throat, where it sucks the warmth from the air.

123112030.content: The chill of the blade helps the man sober up the other fifty percent left. He yelps and falls backwards.

123112031.content: Let me say it again. I don't care what you think about me. But if you hurt anyone I care about, there will be consequences. Bad ones.

123112032.content: She's raising her voice, as if she's not only talking to one drunken father. The locals nearby hear her and move even further away.

123112033.content: Jirou's father looks at us in shock for a moment, apparently too scared to talk. He struggles back to his feet.

123112035.content: What? Why are you both looking at me like that? I thought we were in a hurry. I had to give him a fright or we'd have been here all day.

123112036.content: That Divine Grace chill your Access Key gives off... It wasn't you that turned it off, was it?

123112038.content: I saw what happened. Your Access Key's Divine Grace disappeared. There's only one explanation for that—Gaea revoked your powers at that moment.

123112039.content: In most cases, Gaea lets us use our powers freely for necessary interventions in human activities. Unless you use them with... deadly intent.

123112040.content: Hmm. Guess I'll have to learn karate.

123112042.content: Of course... I am. C'mon, I know how to control myself. I'm surprised you couldn't tell I was pretending. But it had to be realistic, or we'd still be arguing with that good-for-nothing boozehound.

123112043.content: Well, he's run off. So why don't you tell us how we're going to find the people we're looking for now?

123112044.content: You're the one who said it wouldn't be a problem, remember?

123112046.content: Kuramitsuha uses her terminal to talk to a few of the Irregulars, but there's no good news.

123112047.content: Seems like they realized they were being followed. They gave the Irregulars the slip.

123112048.content: So where do we start all over again now?

123112050.content: Relax. The Irregulars and I will regroup and start a fresh search. We'll find them this time, I promise!

123112051.content: Listen, troublemaker. Admin and I are up against the clock here.

123112052.content: I notice that even while she's arguing with Kuninotokotachi, Kuramitsuha's gaze keeps moving towards the wounds and cuts on Jirou. I pull Kuninotokotachi aside.

123112053.content: Take a rest. There's nothing we can do now anyway.

123112055.content: Hey, these Irregulars of yours. They must have a base to rest and everything, right?

123112057.content: Deep in the twisting alleyways of the city, the kids have put together a crude shelter as a secret hideaway.

123112058.content: I don't know if she's being cautious or if she's sick and tired of talking to Kuramitsuha, but Kuninotokotachi insists on standing watch at the entrance. I stay inside, watching Kuramitsuha tend to Jirou's arm.

123112059.content: I thought I taught you how to defend yourself? How come the old drunk managed to do this to you?

123112062.content: Kuramitsuha doesn't say anything else. She simply applies a band-aid to each wound.

123112063.content: Is that why the kids do this? Because their parents are all...

123112064.content: The Ninja Irregulars follow me, obviously, because I am a great Ninkyoumon.

123112066.content: But sure, in a place like Shimogyou, you do get a lot of delinquent parents. Losers who assume their children will carry on the family tradition and be losers too. But I see things differently.

123112067.content: So I made them a promise. I'm helping the Ninja Irregulars earn enough money to go to school in Kamigyou.

123112068.content: If doing this means I make a few parents angry, so be it. It's all part of my fight for justice!

123112069.content: She's clearly excited by her plans, but it's also obvious there's something she's not telling me.

123112070.content: Ninkyoumon, 2nd Chome is an important place for you, isn't it?

123112071.content: This is where I grew up, before I awakened. Everyone knows me here.

123112072.content: Huh? But everyone here seems to avoid you? What's the story?

123112073.content: Well... I mean, a bad reputation is still a reputation. So I wasn't lying when I said I have one.

123112074.content: That's not what I'm talking about. It's obvious there's a lot of crime here. Someone like you, a hero who protects the ordinary people, should be welcomed.

123112075.content: She realizes I'm not going to give up the line of questioning and falls silent for a while.

123112076.content: A hero... Admin, do you know why I decided to do this?

123112077.content: When I first awakened, I had no idea what Gaea or the Visbanes were. But I had this sense of a duty to protect people. Of a mission to save the world.

123112078.content: That's what heroes do, right? Protect people, save the world.

123112080.content: So that's what I became. I wiped out any Visbanes that turned up here in Shimogyou, fought crime, all that! But then the locals started to avoid me.

123112083.content: I'd catch a trader selling dangerous goods and the police would just roll their eyes at me.

123112084.content: Once, I needed someone, just one person, to stop a purse-snatcher getting away. You know what happened? An old lady got in my way and claimed I'd knocked her over. She even wanted me to pay her medical bills. Nobody spoke up for me.

123112085.content: And when I chased off a gang collecting protection money, the locals invited them back in the next day. They even complained about me, as if I was the one plaguing the neighborhood.

123112086.content: And so the people I thought I knew best never talk to me anymore.

123112087.content: I feel like I should say something in response, but I realize that I can't fully explain the reasons behind all those tales of "misfortune", either. So I stay quiet.

123112088.content: I figured out that if you want to be a hero in Shimogyou, you need to learn how to lie and intimidate.

123112089.content: But doesn't that make people like you even less?

123112090.content: They didn't like me anyway. And it makes my job easier.

123112091.content: But... Is that really what you want?

123112092.content: She doesn't reply immediately. She seems to be giving the question some serious thought.

123112093.content: Why do Mods want to save the world? To protect humanity. But it seems like the humans aren't even aware we're doing it. Like they won't even know the world's been saved.

123112094.content: What's the point of being a hero if the people you're being a hero for don't know?

123112095.content: Something Odin once said comes back to mind, and for a moment I'm unable to deny what Kuramitsuha says. And when I do think of something to say, it seems kind of weak.

123112096.content: Not all humans are like that. And there are other reasons for making sure the humans don't know about the Visbanes...

123112097.content: Maybe. But right now, Admin, I don't care about any humans apart from you, Himiko, and the Irregulars.

123112099.content: Of course! Like I said, you're a fascinating specimen.

123112100.content: What if I used to be one of those ordinary people on the street?

123112101.content: Kuramitsuha seems want to say something, but she pauses. It's clear she can't understand why I asked that question.

123112102.content: Had a good rest, troublemaker? Trouble's coming.

123112103.content: Kuramitsuha and I look towards the "base" entrance. I see a familiar face.

123112104.content: I think it's time to discuss a partnership, Ninkyoumon.

123121001.content: A familiar face, but not a friendly one. Kuramitsuha and Kuninotokotachi both stand ready for a fight.

123121003.content: Since Day One. What, you thought you could use Kiwamikawagumi territory without us knowing about it? We just let you play your games, that's all.

123121005.content: Kiwamikawa Fujio takes out a cigarette. He notices the children behind Kuramitsuha, and puts it away.

123121006.content: How about we find somewhere for the grown-ups to talk?

123121007.content: Kiwamikawa Fujio simply walks off, out of sight of the kids, leaving us looking at each other, puzzled.

123121008.content: We find him sitting at a table outside a restaurant. There's a wall of Kiwamikawagumi members, all in suits and leather shoes, making sure nobody interrupts us.

123121009.content: You know you'll never get any money out of me. Why keep trying?

123121010.content: Like I tried to tell you, I want to discuss a partnership.

123121011.content: He puts that cigarette into his mouth.

123121012.content: My two friends here aren't the kind of people who work with gangs.

123121013.content: Gangs? That's not the right term. We're... mediators. Debt consultants. Providers of intelligence. Lenders at slightly-higher-than-average interest rates. Oh, and we hold stakes in a number of gaming parlors.

123121015.content: Regardless. If you happened to be looking for a bunch of Deer God preachers here in Shimogyou... we'd be good people to work with.

123121017.content: You really need to ask? When we decide how much of a bonus that cop gets? When the "matchmaker" needs our permission to work?

123121018.content: The Kiwamikawagumi is the biggest clearing house for info. It's obvious. Got to admit, I don't know why you didn't just come to us first.

123121019.content: You think I just got off the Photon Rail? I know what working with you guys means. It means I end up working FOR you.

123121020.content: I'll take that as a compliment on our business acumen. But as things stand, you don't have any other choices. Do you?

123121021.content: Kuninotokotachi and I glance at each other.

123121022.content: Don't worry, Admin. I'll keep my promises. I just need...

123121023.content: You just need to keep talking to the locals here in 2nd Chome? That's your problem, right there. You could knock on every single door and you won't find one person willing to help you.

123121024.content: Everyone in 2nd Chome—no, everyone in Shimogyou—hates you.

123121025.content: I see Kuramitsuha's grip on her naginata tighten.

123121026.content: Don't get mad. It's a compliment, too. Honest.

123121027.content: Remember you and I had that falling-out about a year since? You beat up one of our men who was charging protection money, then the locals invited him back in, and you ended up kicked out of the neighborhood?

123121029.content: It's simple. As soon as you announced that there was no longer under Kiwamikawagumi's "protection", every street thug and housebreaker in the city moved in. Some locals who lived there were even delinquents themselves. That's not something you can stop when there's only one of you.

123121030.content: The only reason Kamigyou is so bright and shiny is because all the dirt and scum stay here in Shimogyou. The people who live here don't want justice. They want order. Even if it's a rough and ready kind of order.

123121031.content: People like that don't want some oddball hero saving them. They want what they know. They want "mediators", like us.

123121032.content: Kuramitsuha's still clenching her naginata. But she hasn't jabbed it at anyone's throat. So far.

123121034.content: If you want to make a deal with us, what's your price?

123121037.content: I can see Kuramitsuha is still struggling with her own thoughts, so I take over negotiations with the second-in-command.

123121038.content: Very well. The price is all the service fees we lost when you messed with our tollgate. Money up front, then you get your info.

123121039.content: Sounds greedy. And what do you mean, service fees? Don't tell me you really think you were providing a service there...

123121040.content: Once we'd got everyone inside the city, we were going to convert the tollgate into a barricade to stop the monsters. So yeah, we were providing a service.

123121041.content: Kuninotokotachi, in a rare moment of agreement with Kuramitsuha, now has her hand on her weapon too. The situation has suddenly become very tense, but I can see Kiwamikawa Fujio is sure of himself.

123121042.content: That's no small sum. If you want money up front, you're going to need to prove you've got the info we need.

123121043.content: Smart. I see why you're in charge.

123121044.content: Let me blather on a little more. If you're right and someone is pretending to be an Akishika bigwig to recruit Deer God believers, they wouldn't do it personally. They'd have agents here in Shimogyou.

123121045.content: And if you want to find the head honcho, you need to find that agent. Not run around asking everyone you happen to meet.

123121046.content: And you know who those agents are?

123121047.content: They are people who know Shimogyou well and have a certain amount of authority. But easier to control than organizations like Kiwamikawagumi. In fact, you ran into them just recently.

123121048.content: Those thugs who tried to shake us down? (Option)

123121050.content: We sure went the long way around.

123121051.content: Good. I thought you'd need more hints.

123121052.content: Kiwamikawagumi is well-known in Shimogyou. Those thugs had to know they were on your turf. If they were willing to risk angering you like that, that means... They think they've got backing from someone even more powerful.

123121053.content: Yeah, they started off on the down-low, recruiting believers anonymously through middlemen. Trouble is, people like that make a little money and they all start to think the same thing—they want to take over. So they started working on our turf.

123121054.content: We ran into them a few times and figured out who they were. They were working for some Deer God priests, claiming to be Akishika.

123121055.content: What are we still waiting for, Admin? Let's find those thugs now!

123121057.content: We've made too much noise already. They'll have been warned by whoever's running the operation and gone into hiding.

123121058.content: Oh, it's so much easier dealing with smart people. Anyway, that's what you're buying. The location of their hidey-hole.

123121059.content: Kiwamikawa Fujio gestures for one of his men to place a map on the table. We're handed an account book and Kuninotokotachi looks at the figure at the bottom.

123121060.content: This isn't a trade. It's robbery.

123121062.content: Hmph. A dignified robbery is still a robbery!

123121063.content: Kuninotokotachi, could we get the money from CORG?

123121064.content: Realizing she might be able to play a trick on an old foe, Kuninotokotachi suddenly changes her attitude.

123121065.content: Sure. Essential funding for mission requirements.

123121066.content: We transfer the funds and Kiwamikawa Fujio stubs his cigarette out on the map, over a pachinko parlor.

123121067.content: A pachinko parlor's a smart place to hide. But those amateurs roughed up the boss a few times and thought they owned the place. They never thought to ask who the boss's boss was.

123121068.content: I've made arrangements. They won't get away. As for how you get the answers you need... I'll leave that to your discretion.

123121069.content: We make our way there as fast as we can. Kuramitsuha still doesn't say a word.

123121070.content: You should have joined Pheasant Squad when I tried to recruit you, troublemaker. Would have made things much easier.

123121071.content: Mods dealing with humans always ends in trouble. Except with our Admin, of course. So, maybe give it a second thought?

123121072.content: Kuramitsuha can tell Kuninotokotachi is trying to comfort her. She looks a little happier now.

123121073.content: I respectfully decline. I'd miss the freedom I enjoy here.

123121074.content: I thought you hated the place.

123121076.content: You've got a friend here, don't you, Ninkyoumon? (Option)

123121077.content: She looks at me in surprise.

123121078.content: You only agreed to help us because you're worried about your friend, Himiko. It wasn't really anything to do with being a Mod and having to save the world.

123121079.content: I'm glad to see Kuramitsuha's old grin return.

123121080.content: Admin, I knew you are the type of human I like!

123121081.content: It won't look good if you two fight against humans here. Leave that to me.

123121082.content: The deadbeats and good-for-nothings of Shimogyou all love a pachinko parlor. But the arrival of an unexpected guest soon spoils their fun.
