123121083.content: So, long story short—I have questions.

123121084.content: You again? You stole my money then used it to buy me off. What's next?

123121085.content: Time is short, so I'll give you two options. One, tell me what I want to know. Two, I make you tell me what I want to know.

123121087.content: The thugs gather around, all with weapons drawn. But none of them seem willing to get close to the young woman.

123121088.content: Hmm. You should have worn warmer clothes.

123121089.content: A cold wind rises, leaving a frost on every surface. In moments, her opponents are rolling on the floor, crying in agony as they clutch frostbitten limbs.

123121090.content: Kuramitsuha takes a seat on a bench outside the parlor. The head thug has fallen to his knees in fear. He thinks he might make a run for it, but gives up when shot by a cold glance from Kuramitsuha.

123121092.content: Brrr. Cold! Like I said, I'm asking the questions.

123121094.content: Was any of your income here in Shimogyou not declared to the authorities?

123121095.content: Huh? We're meant to declare income?

123121096.content: From now, yes! The Akishika have sent me to remind you of this.

123121097.content: What? They just told us to find them believers, that's all...

123121098.content: Then he seems to realize something. He shakes his head so fast it looks like it might fly off.

123121099.content: No, no! I mean, what could the Akishika have to do with us? Nothing at all, nothing!

123121100.content: Oh, that really is a relief to hear. I've been hearing you were working with the Akishika and that made me worried about stealing money from you...

123121101.content: But if you have nothing to do with the family... Hand over the rest of your cash and get out of my sight.

123121102.content: Hey! You can't just steal from us like this!

123121103.content: A strand of ice crystals forms on the ground and grows onto the man's heel. He yelps in pain.

123121104.content: You're nothing. A nobody. You can't beat me. Haven't you heard of who I am and what I do? Pay up and clear off. And better luck with the rest of your life.

123121105.content: It seems that the thought of losing money to Kuramitsuha is more painful than the thought of losing a limb to frostbite. The thug gives up the info he tried to conceal earlier.

123121106.content: W-Wait! You touch me and the Akishika will come for you!

123121107.content: Call for the soldiers if you dare. I can't beat you, but I'd like to see you take them on!

123121108.content: I'm not stupid. Why would I want to fight soldiers? Wouldn't matter if you have an Akishika patron or not, I'd end up arrested.

123121109.content: But thanks for the reminder. There are soldiers nearby and being arrested isn't on my to-do list. I'd better shut you up, for good.

123121110.content: The ice on the man's heel extends by another inch. He screams in pain again.

123121111.content: Hold on! I'm not kidding! I'm with the Akishika!

123121112.content: Oh, and I'm meant to just believe you?

123121113.content: Go to 1st Crome if you don't believe me, to the Guild Hall. My patron is holding a meeting there. You can ask him yourself!

123121114.content: The fear of death finally wins out. Kuramitsuha gets the information she needs.

123121116.content: Kuninotokotachi and I have been observing from a safe distance. We watch as Kuramitsuha saunters back toward us and wonder what we're meant to say.

123121117.content: When are they going to let us official Mods do our job like that?

123121118.content: Everyone here's going to have their memories wiped when Quake Damage Control gets here, anyway.

123121119.content: Got a place. Now we just need to find the phony Akishika and give them a beating?

123121120.content: I doubt it'll be that simple. If they're holding a meeting, there will be lots of their devotees there. If they can be manipulated into turning against us, we'll face a much bigger fight than a few pachinko parlor punks.

123121121.content: Yeah. Morons can be harder to deal with.

123121122.content: Hey, Ninkyoumon. You're friends with Lady Akishika. Is there any way we can tell who's Akishika and who isn't?

123121124.content: They can't have fooled so many people just using the family crest. They must have something else, some more powerful way of convincing people they are Akishika.

123121125.content: Is there anything the Akishika use to identify themselves? Something that could be faked?

123121126.content: There is, as it happens. The Akishika is a military family, and they've always used means of identification to ensure those powers aren't misused.

123121127.content: Every prominent member of the family carries a talisman in the shape of an antler. Those are made from a special material which can withstand high temperatures.

123121128.content: The appearance of those seals is common knowledge, so you could fake one easily. But only a real one will withstand heat.

123121130.content: But it works. Nobody has ever figured out how to come up with a fake that will survive a fire.

123121131.content: If these phony preachers wanted to convince people they're Akishika, that's what they'd use. If we can demonstrate to their believers that their talismans are fake, they might even come over to our side and help us catch them!

123121133.content: Yeah... There is one more thing.

123121135.content: You're friends with Himiko now. So stop calling her Lady Akishika. Use her name.

123121136.content: Kuramitsuha clearly takes this very seriously—more seriously, perhaps, than the mission we're on.

123122001.content: It's a bloody battle, but we break through their lines. Kuninotokotachi's sharp eyes immediately spot an antler talisman worn by the cult leader and pulls it off.

123122002.content: How dare you disrespect the Deer God. Grab them!

123122004.content: Do you all believe everything he says?

123122005.content: There's a brazier in the center of the room, for use in the ceremonies. Kuninotokotachi throws the talisman into the flames, where it burns brightly.

123122006.content: Did he claim to be Akishika? A Deer God priest? Then let me ask you, is that a genuine talisman?

123122007.content: That talisman is still burning. The believers all see it and calm down.

123122008.content: What are you trying to prove?

123122010.content: It was you who sent people to help the Visbanes attack the city and sabotage the city wall. You had them wear the Akishika crest to try and frame Himiko, who was doing everything she could to protect her people.

123122011.content: And you pretended to be Akishika here, to manipulate honest believers into working for your evil plans!

123122013.content: The priest doesn't sound like a faker who's been exposed. He remains sure of himself, as if everything I've said is no more than a joke.

123122014.content: Still don't want to admit what you've done?

123122015.content: Let me respond to your foolish accusations. We wear the Akishika crest because we are proud to be servants of their god. The crest is a symbol gifted to us by that god!

123122016.content: And I did not manipulate these believers. I simply revealed the lies others have told them!

123122018.content: As the priest's crazed tirade comes to an end, the flames engulfing the talisman fade. A top protective layer has burned away, but the talisman itself still glints in the light of the fire.

123122022.content: The worshippers turn to us, fury in their eyes. But they hesitate when seeing the weapons in Kuramitsuha and Kuninotokotachi's hands.

123122023.content: I surely don't remember this being part of the plan.

123122024.content: Kuramitsuha looks as if she's thought of something, but she doesn't speak.

123122025.content: C'mon, troublemaker! Any other ideas for proving this guy's a knock-off Akishika?

123122026.content: Uh, well... Let's just fight! We're Mods. If we show what we can do, we're going to look way more godlike than that phony.

123122028.content: Suddenly, Kuramitsuha brandishes her naginata and a trail of crystals forms, heading towards the priest.

123122029.content: Unconcerned, the priest raises his staff. Several vines sprout from the floor and shatter the crystals.

123122031.content: You should not have underestimated my power.

123122032.content: The priest glares at us and the air in the hall turns, unexpectedly, heavy and oppressive. It's as if there's a presence within him, looking out at us through his eyes.

123122036.content: The worshippers watching become crazed, heeding the priest's order this time. Several of them rush forward to grab me by all four limbs. I'm carried into the mob, leaving Kuninotokotachi and Kuramitsuha behind.

123122037.content: Oh, you go for the easy targets, huh?

123122039.content: The two attack in tandem, but those vines sprout once more, too fast and too powerful for even a Mod to resist. They are trapped.

123122040.content: I see a moment of panic in Kuramitsuha's eyes as she watches me be carried off. It's as if the scene brings some unpleasant memory to her mind.

123122042.content: And then a bag is pulled over my head and everything goes black. The noise of the mob fades.

123122043.content: After a full day of work, the wall surrounding Shimogyou is now as heavily armed as any fortress. But Akishika Himiko shows no sign of relaxing as she looks out towards the mountains.

123122044.content: Everything seems as quiet as usual out there. It's the quiet that worries her. She furrows her brow. A soldier arrives, interrupting her thoughts.

123122045.content: My Lady, the investigation you ordered... We've found something.

123122047.content: I took a squad to check up on all Akishika warehouses and found a lot of goods have gone missing. It's a similar story with the accounts—money's gone, and we don't know where to.

123122048.content: The family members who should have been responsible refused to answer our questions. We looked into their comms logs and found they've all been in touch with the same mysterious organization.

123122049.content: This was my fault. I've never been good at the domestic stuff.

123122050.content: She looks down at the scrap of cloth she holds. The family crest it bears seems to be burning itself into her eyes.

123122051.content: I should have known there would be a family reunion one day...

123122053.content: Pass the word. All talismans are now invalid, on my orders. Future orders will be delivered by me, personally, and me alone.

123122055.content: The soldier leaves and Himiko looks back at the mountains, more worried than before. A flock of birds circle over the wall, chirping and calling to each other. It sounds as if they're a single organism muttering to itself.

123122057.content: She grabs the hilt of her weapon, making an effort to resist a strange, restless feeling in her body.

123122058.content: Is that you? Of course. Why else would they come back?

123122059.content: She reaches into her clothes and pulls out a transparent container. Inside, a black flame flickers.

123122060.content: Do your worst. This will be the last time.

123122061.content: Off in the mountain forest, something moves, sending flocks of birds into the darkness of the night.

123431001.content: I wake up, unsure of how long I was out cold. All is dark—if there is any light, the bag over my head blocks it.

123431002.content: I didn't expect that, to be honest. You are a human, weak and incapable. Yet you dare to defy a god?

123431004.content: You still don't believe what we said? We are the true Akishika, servants of the Deer God.

123431005.content: It's the same tale as before. I let him wait before responding.

123431007.content: Don't worry. We won't dispose of you like an ordinary blasphemer. We have something special in mind for you.

123431008.content: An unbeliever with such rare physique... A very fortunate find, indeed.

123431009.content: Just tell me what you want!

123431010.content: You may be able to set my clan free. ...Prepare the spores!

123431011.content: A fog, something that smells of fresh-cut vegetation, seeps into the bag. The world seems to spin and I feel myself absorbed into some other, greater, being.

123431012.content: I'm running through a forest. Then standing under a blazing sun. Then thrown into a vast and silent space.

123431013.content: I'm fixed by a gaze which leaves me suffocating and immobile. I look up and finally see what is watching me.

123431016.content: I sense something in the darkness. A huge hand, reaching out to grab me. But before it can reach me something stops it, some other formless presence. The hand can advance no further.

123431018.content: The Deer God gives a howl of pain and, to my surprise, fear. I feel as if my head is spinning and I stagger, almost falling to the ground. But someone catches me.

123431020.content: A temporary command post. Bad dream?

123431022.content: Save you? You turned up to volunteer, remember? Like everyone else.

123431023.content: Mitsy, help this newcomer wake up. Fully. We're about to move out.

123431024.content: Hey, be nicer. The rookie just called me "Ninkyoumon"! I like this one.

123431025.content: I look around and see we're in some quiet alley in Shimogyou. There's lots of people here, all armed.

123431026.content: As far as I can tell, it's all very real. But my recent experiences leave me doubtful. Am I dreaming?

123431028.content: I look around again, more carefully this time. It's a blazing hot day. Not the same season as I remembered.

123431030.content: June 2nd. Don't worry, you came here on the right day.

123431032.content: 2315, of course. What's wrong? You had a nap, that's all. You weren't in a coma.

123431033.content: It's the right year, but two months early. Time travel?

123431034.content: My mutterings are overheard by the mission leader. The young officer, clad in her military uniform, comes to stand before me once more.

123431035.content: You seem to have some concerns, my friend?

123431037.content: How dare you address our Lady like that?

123431039.content: No matter. I have a pretty name and I'm tired of having "ma'am" yelled at me all day.

123431041.content: Himiko turns to me again, that familiar smile of hers on her lips. It's a look that reassures me, just like it did the first time we met.

123431042.content: You know my name, so we can't be strangers. But you don't look as if you've come to join my rebellion. Have we met somewhere?

123431043.content: I want to explain, but how? I think back to our investigation and realize that I can't tell the whole story here.

123431044.content: Uh... Of course I've heard of you, Lady Akishika.

123431045.content: Everyone nearby looks at me, surprised.

123431046.content: I thought you said our friend didn't look ready to follow your lead, Himiko? Yet they've already appointed you Lady Akishika! Haha!

123431048.content: The question sparks a chaotic debate. Himiko waves a hand to silence it and everyone stops talking.

123431049.content: You seem... lost. Shall we assume that is what you are? A lost traveler?

123431051.content: I'm not going to ask about your past. We all have our secrets, after all. I'll give you two options, and you can make your own choice like everyone who turns up here.

123431052.content: Follow me and fight for my cause. Or leave and return to whatever life you have before. What is it to be?

123431053.content: It's clear she's offering me a genuine choice, and this helps ease my earlier panic. I put aside my worries about having traveled through time and think about what I should do.

123431054.content: The operation Himiko is about to launch may bring me closer to the truth behind the events I've been investigating. And that means there's only one choice I can make.

123431055.content: Sorry if I was rude. I'm here to help, like everyone else.

123431056.content: Very well. Let's introduce ourselves, then.

123431058.content: Could I ask what the plan is?

123431059.content: We figured it out since long ago. Attack the Photon Rail station and get Himiko out of Sasanami.

123431061.content: The ma'am has been taking good care of us, so we'll look after her, too. We will not let her be executed for such a ridiculous crime. Defying the gods? C'mon! It's the 24th century!

123431062.content: If the Akishika won't listen to reason, we have no choice but to rebel.

123431063.content: Instantly, everyone else in earshot shouts agreement. But Himiko remains quiet.

123431064.content: Apologies. I need to make some last-minute changes to my orders.

123431065.content: We have a new target. We're heading to the mountain forest, where the Akishika used to live. We'll find the Deer God's altar and destroy it.

123431067.content: Himiko, my getting you out of there was no easy task. Do you really need to go back?

123431068.content: Because if you go back, you...

123431069.content: Mitsy, you know what they're planning. Can you let that happen?

123431070.content: It's not the same for you!

123431071.content: That so-called Deer God isn't some statue that just sits there. It's something humans can't defeat. Those who worship it are already lost!

123431072.content: No. Humans too can defeat it.

123431073.content: There's a determination in Himiko's eyes. It's a look that stops even Kuramitsuha from arguing further.

123431074.content: I'm done running. I'm not leaving my family and my soldiers to a bunch of cowardly devotees. I'm going to end this nonsense.

123431075.content: And I only need to do one simple thing. Defeat their god.

123431077.content: Despite all the speeches, it's clear the rebels still have an instinctive fear of the deities of legend.

123431078.content: That's why I'm going to prove we can.

123431079.content: I gaze at her in amazement. Where does all that courage come from?

123431080.content: She's leading an army, almost entirely made up of humans, against a Visbane threat. But she's so courageous I find myself unable to try and stop her.

123431081.content: In response, everyone in the crowd raises their weapons. Including a still unhappy Kuramitsuha.

123432001.content: With the sound of another gunshot, one more Visbeast falls.

123432002.content: You seem to know well how to deal with these monsters. You've given us good advice on tactics, and you're a crack shot yourself.

123432003.content: Oh, I... I've done a bit of hunting before, nothing more.

123432004.content: By now, I've seen for myself what a talented commander Himiko is. Her praise even makes me feel a little bit embarrassed.

123432005.content: The assault has gone smoothly and we can afford a brief moment of rest. I take the opportunity to talk with her.

123432006.content: Um... Can I call you Himiko?

123432007.content: I thought I already gave you that permission. I don't like being called "ma'am" all the time.

123432008.content: Okay. Himiko, the god you need to defeat... It's the Akishika's Deer God, right?

123432009.content: That's what they call it, yes.

123432010.content: But in the legends, the Deer God protects the mountain folk of Sasanami.

123432011.content: So are the legends wrong? Is the Deer God actually... an evil god? But if that's the case, why would the Akishika worship him and help him cause harm?

123432013.content: Faith in the Deer God was distorted from the very beginning.

123432014.content: The legends say that the five families each came to an agreement with one of the five mountain deities. The Akishika did as well.

123432015.content: Worshipping the Deer God brought the Akishika great honor, status, and power. That came at a price.

123432016.content: However, their fear of the god made them think that was a price worth paying.

123432018.content: Perhaps that will help you understand why I am rebelling against my family.

123432019.content: So a part of the Akishika people are working for an evil god, and other Akishika are rebelling?

123432020.content: I guess you can say that, yes. Although I'm not sure I count as an Akishika any longer. I'm acting on my own, not representing my family.

123432021.content: She looks out into the forest, a lonesome look in her eyes. I can't imagine how alone, how isolated, she'd been feeling within her family, before deciding to do this.

123432022.content: You'll be able to represent your family one day.

123432023.content: Feeling like I have a better grasp of what's happening now, I say that almost instinctively.

123432024.content: Yeah, I remember you appointing me Lady Akishika.

123432025.content: I'm confident you will be. And... I think you should be.

123432026.content: Perhaps you can prove that humans aren't all just disinterested observers.

123432028.content: Himiko seems to understand the part I can't say out loud. She walks off to the front of the lines.

123432029.content: Our target is just ahead. Prepare to attack!

123442003.content: Do you have any idea what you scum have done?

123442004.content: I have ended something that should have ended long ago. Your god is defeated.

123442006.content: Are you truly so naive as to think you can escape your fate?

123442007.content: Sacrifices must be made... must be...

123442008.content: The statue on the altar suddenly collapses. My consciousness fades into the void. The scene of victory blurs.

123442010.content: I feel as if my mind is being torn in two. Everything I can see recedes.

123442011.content: And suddenly, I realize I've been inside the Deer God's mind the whole time.

123442014.content: I awake with a start, feeling as if I've emerged from the ocean depths.

123442015.content: How is this possible? Do we have more spores?

123442016.content: No. That was the last of them.

123442017.content: Is there anything else we can use?

123442018.content: I open my eyes to find the bag has been removed from my head. We're in an alleyway, surrounded by low walls. This must be the devotees' secret base.

123442019.content: Everything I learned during my trance rushes back to me.

123442020.content: What did you do to me?

123442021.content: The Deer God has rejected you.

123442022.content: But your god is already dead.

123442023.content: Hah. Such arrogance, to think humans can kill a god. Your punishment will come, sooner or later.

123442025.content: This one will serve as a hostage when we deal with the rebel. Tie them up and have the exits watched!

123442026.content: The head of the cultists seems a little disappointed.

123442027.content: It seems this mission must be carried out by an Akishika.

123451001.content: As night falls, the streets of Shimogyou become busier and brightly lit, the smell of booze wafting out from the taverns. The crowds and the numerous darker alleyways make it almost impossible to look for someone here.

123451002.content: Those devotees are like pebbles scattered on the ocean floor.

123451003.content: I checked again, but there's no signal from Admin's locator. They must be blocking it.

123451004.content: The Ninja Irregulars spotted them as they ran off, but they split up and we have no way of knowing which group had Admin.

123451005.content: Dammit. I can't believe they kidnapped Admin from under the noses of two Mods!

123451006.content: Kuninotokotachi looks helplessly at Kuramitsuha, then asks the question that's been worrying her for quite some time.

123451009.content: I can't believe the Akishika would... but maybe it makes sense?

123451010.content: You must have noticed, too, that those vines that stopped us had the same Bane Energy as the Visbeasts in the forest?

123451011.content: The big Visbane hiding in the forest causing that Visbeast horde has to be the same thing as the Deer God these Akishika worship! So Lady Akishika...

123451013.content: And they were exiled ages ago...

123451014.content: Kuninotokotachi is surprised by Kuramitsuha's response, but takes a moment to calm down before continuing.

123451015.content: You're hiding things from me, troublemaker. And you're not even making jokes about it, which means it's serious.

123451016.content: Your Lady Akishika hasn't held that position for very long, right?

123451017.content: Yes. She came to it... quickly. Soldiers loyal to her deposed the existing family heads and put her in charge.

123451019.content: You've seen what they were like. Not everyone in the family agreed with what they were doing. I'm sure you can understand why Himiko did that.

123451020.content: How did they manage to keep such a big change secret?

123451021.content: The new Prime Lord gave her his full support. And with good reason.

123451022.content: It was a huge change, so the Prime Lord suggested she keep quiet about what was happening. Then, when the time was right, all could be made public and any consequent issues dealt with.

123451023.content: When Himiko took over, the previous incumbents were quietly exiled to a remote part of Sasanami. Looks like they decided to come back...

123451024.content: You are saying that they are the "genuine" Akishika?

123451025.content: There's no time to argue about that!

123451026.content: Kuninotokotachi can tell she still isn't getting the whole story. But just as she's about to keep pressing, a young kid runs up to Kuramitsuha and whispers something in her ear.

123451027.content: Some of those Deer God worshippers slipped up and let the Ninja Irregulars follow them to a hiding place. We'll start there!

123451028.content: We've got to find Admin first!

123452003.content: The captives convulse with pain and curl up. Within seconds, there's nothing left but mushrooms.

123452005.content: I think they let us find these ones to distract us. They won't lead us to the big fish.

123452006.content: Maybe the locals can... No. Do we need to ask the gangsters for help again?

123452007.content: If you'll forgive me for being direct—the Kiwamikawagumi have already played us once. Let's not give them another opportunity.

123452009.content: Look at what happened. Kiwamikawa Fujio couldn't be sure that gang of thugs really had Akishika backing. So rather than tackle them and risk offending powerful people, he got us to do it for him. And we paid him for the privilege.

123452010.content: He'll have people watching us, so he'll know there really are Akishika people behind all this. So he's not going to help us against them.

123452011.content: Kuninotokotachi opens her mouth, but decides to save her energy, rather than spit out the curse words she's thinking of.

123452012.content: I see what you mean. We did their work and paid them for it. So, any other ideas?

123452013.content: Kuramitsuha furrows her brow. Suddenly, a signal flare appears in the air over a nearby street. Kuninotokotachi notices that it's a very particular color.

123452016.content: Realization dawns on Kuninotokotachi's face. She knows exactly what's happened and she's furious about it.

123452017.content: I'd rather not say. But let's go!

123461001.content: I manage to fumble my fingers over the knots holding me tight, trying to untie them.

123461002.content: Looks like you've been trained in escapology. But not very well.

123461003.content: I know that voice. It's a familiar and annoying one. Before I can figure out where it's coming from, a face—also familiar and annoying—appears in front of me. It's upside down.

123461005.content: Imagine, your target has been operating for years and has an army of fanatical devotees. One day, you break in with a couple of heavily armed sidekicks. What would they do?

123461006.content: Uh... They whisk the ringleaders away to a secret location and use that army of cultists to stall their enemy?

123461007.content: Correct. Now, let's see what else we can deduce. This group worships a Visbane and is delighted to find that one of the investigation team is a human—some kind of special human magnet that attracts the Visbanes. So, next?

123461008.content: They'll capture that special human as an offering to their god?

123461009.content: Correct again. And, as I'm sure you have guessed, that would be done by the head honchos in the organization.

123461011.content: Not exactly. It was a back-up plan for use if your attack on the enemy headquarters went badly.

123461012.content: Given that we knew their deity has some kind of electromagnetic blocking ability, I tagged you with a CORG fluorescent spray that only shows up when I use a special detector.

123461013.content: And it turns out "better safe than sorry" was the right approach.

123461014.content: Okay, we'll deal with the using-me-as-bait thing later. You've obviously been planning this. So why pretend you're going for a hot springs spa day and ditch us to work solo?

123461015.content: Well, that was due to some basic psychological profiling. Neither of your little pheasants would have approved of Plan B.

123461016.content: Anyway, I wasn't pretending. I had a lovely time at the hot springs inn. What was I going to do, hang around waiting for you to mess up?

123461017.content: Just hurry up and untie me.

123461018.content: Not so fast. You need to be bait a little longer.

123461019.content: The plan is to round up all the escaped ringleaders, but ideally the human authorities will do the job for us. And thankfully, the Quake Damage Control Department has a few special agents in position and awaiting orders.

123461020.content: Sekhmet disappears back the way she came, onto the rooftops. A few moments later I hear a signal flare being fired.

123461022.content: These jokers still need you, so stick around and try to drag things out until the CORG agents turn up!

123461023.content: A signal flare? Now the bad guys know you're here!

123461024.content: Do try and keep up. Something's blocked EM signals, remember? The signal flare wasn't my first choice.

123461025.content: Just you wait! When we get home I'm putting a formal complaint into CORG!

123461026.content: That's it. Angry, not scared. Hold on to that.

123461027.content: There's a commotion on the other side of the wall. Sekhmet, of course, is soon safe in her rooftop hiding place.

123461028.content: I watch and grit my teeth as the devotees run toward me.

123462001.content: There are two flashes of cold light and the wall blocking my view collapses. Kuramitsuha and Kuninotokotachi rush in, side by side.

123462004.content: The ringleaders are nearby! Don't let them get away!

123462005.content: Kuramitsuha is still coming towards me. Didn't she hear my instructions?

123462006.content: What did they do to you?

123462007.content: Relax. Whatever they tried, it didn't work.

123462008.content: The guilt in Kuramitsuha's eyes eases off. With a slash of her naginata she cuts my bonds.

123462009.content: The well-trained CORG agents soon bring the fight to an end. And this time, almost all the cultists are detained.

123462010.content: Hmph. Should have known crazy CORG lady was up to something.

123462011.content: Sekhmet ignores Kuninotokotachi and keeps checking over the detained cultists.

123462012.content: Are you sure you aren't hurt, Admin?

123462013.content: I count four limbs and no heavily bleeding wounds. Phew. Guess I got all worried for nothing.

123462014.content: I'm not hurt, but they used some kind of "spore" on me. It—

123462015.content: Technically, it's a kind of Bane Energy powder, containing corrosive Bane Energy, which can be "seeded" into humans. It probably comes from the big Encroacher we think is out there somewhere.

123462016.content: Sekhmet interrupts and we all turn to look at her. I realize the cult leaders are all kneeling in front of her, dazed. They giggle foolishly now and then, looking like puppets dangling on a string.

123462017.content: It's that powder that causes the mushroom infestations whenever we catch one of them, I think.

123462018.content: But it looks like you have some kind of resistance to that type of Bane Energy, so you're safe.

123462019.content: But we can't let that happen to the ringleaders!

123462020.content: Relax. I've made sure of it.

123462021.content: The powder creates some kind of link between the consciousness of the infected human and the Encroacher Visbane. The big guy senses they've been caught and triggers the powder, which turns them into mushroom farms.

123462022.content: But I used hypnosis on them. As far as they know, they haven't even been caught. So they can't tip off the Encroacher.

123462023.content: You put them in a trance?

123462024.content: Yeah, but don't get the wrong idea. Genuine human technology, nothing to do with Mod powers. And highly effective, too.

123462025.content: And I should mention that our guests will automatically answer any question put to them now, which should mean our investigation finally makes a little progress.

123462026.content: You're kinda scary, you know. Hey, you in the middle. What's the absolute last thing you want to tell me?

123462029.content: Having a subject admit something embarrassing is an effective way of checking hypnosis has worked. Unless I was the one you were trying to embarrass?

123462031.content: I look at the dazed cult leaders and wonder which of dozens of questions I should ask first. I try to think it through calmly and come up with the one that seems most important.

123462032.content: The Deer God is still alive, right?

123462033.content: The god... cannot be killed. Kill the god... the god reawakens.

123462034.content: Everyone on the scene is transfixed by the answer. Even Kuramitsuha, who had seemed disinterested.

123462035.content: And the Deer God created the Visbeast horde, yes?

123462036.content: Yes. The Deer God's... divine punishment.

123462037.content: You're clearly not trained to do this. You need to ask very specific questions. If your questions are too broad, you only get vague answers.

123462038.content: The Deer God. We knew it was him all the time, right?

123462039.content: So this is my theory—the big Encroacher we think is out there somewhere is the "Deer God" they worship. The legends don't tell us the truth, and the Deer God is not some supernatural source of justice.

123462040.content: You surely didn't work all that out from those answers?

123462041.content: When they infected me with the spores, I seemed to travel three months back in time.

123462042.content: If you're right and the spores create a link between the carrier and the Encroacher Visbane, then I guess I was seeing its memories of what happened back then.

123462043.content: I saw how it tried to create a Visbeast horde. And I saw how our Ninkyoumon and Himiko defeated it...

123462044.content: Everyone turns to stare at Kuramitsuha, each with a different look in their eyes.

123462045.content: If you have data on a successful operation against the target, perhaps you could share it? Might be useful for future engagements.

123462046.content: Kuramitsuha's expression changes for a moment, but before any of us can figure out what she's thinking, she recovers.

123462049.content: Admin, everything you're saying, spores, linked consciousnesses... they might just be a hallucination. Things you've imagined while under the influence of the spores.

123462050.content: If you put it like that...

123462051.content: Anyway, I'm glad we were able to get you back safe and sound, Admin.

123462052.content: Sine we've caught the people plotting against Himiko, It's time for me to say goodbye.

123462053.content: Why would you leave now? Shimogyou won't be safe until the Deer God is taken care of!

123462054.content: Kuramitsuha is already walking off, but my words stop her in her tracks.

123462055.content: It's like you said. I only agreed to help you because I was worried about my friend, Himiko.

123462056.content: It was true then. It's still true now.

123462057.content: The safety of Shimogyou isn't the most important thing for me.

123462058.content: She doesn't give me a chance to ask what she means. A second later she's on the rooftops, disappearing into the dark.

123462060.content: Why even ask? It's obvious. You don't need my advanced psychology qualifications to see that.

123462061.content: But I've never seen her like that before. Normally, she'd just... y'know, lie.

123462062.content: Sekhmet doesn't seem concerned about Kuramitsuha's behavior. She continues interrogating her hypnotized captives, until she learns something that worries her.

123462064.content: We haven't got the head honcho. There's someone in charge of these guys.

123462065.content: We knew there were humans at work here. My original plan was to grab these guys, delaying the next Visbeast wave. That would give the army time to get here and we could go deal with the Encroacher.

123462066.content: But if we haven't caught the main collaborator... All of our time here in Shimogyou has been wasted, and the city is still in grave danger.

123462067.content: But we haven't seen any signs of a second wave. And the sentries on the wall haven't sounded the alarm.

123462068.content: Stop acting like you know what you're doing, crazy lady. Admin's ahead of you—we sent Buzenbo into the mountains earlier. We've got it all covered.

123462069.content: If anything's going on up there, she'll give us a heads-up.

123462070.content: Sekhmet just looks at us both, letting us figure out for ourselves how bad the situation is.

123462071.content: Kuninotokotachi, we haven't heard from Buzenbo, have we?

123462072.content: She pulls out her terminal and tries to reach Buzenbo. There's no response.

123462074.content: So, the good news is that nobody on the wall has sounded the alarm. That means the threat is still some distance away.

123462076.content: Buzenbo must be trapped in that comms dead zone around the Deer God, or she'd have been in touch.

123462077.content: Is that what we're calling the Encroacher now? The Deer God?

123462078.content: This is no time to argue over terminology!

123462079.content: I try to calm down and think about our next steps.

123462080.content: I think we can be sure that the "Deer God" is actually our target, a big Encroacher—or very likely a Cognizant. And I am convinced Himiko and the Akishika forces are on our side.

123462081.content: Our job now is to locate the Deer God and either wipe it out or pin it down, stat. We're going to find Buzenbo!

123471001.content: Buzenbo is doing everything she can to escape from the comms dead zone the Deer God creates, but she still hasn't got far away enough.

123471002.content: Why are you still running, mouse? Just let us catch you.

123471003.content: Buzenbo finds her way blocked yet again. Previously she'd just speed up and keep running onwards. This time, she needs to stop for a brief rest.

123471004.content: It seems like you've got eyes all over the forest...

123471005.content: It's not too late to repent, blasphemer! The Deer God has you in his grasp and there is no escape. Struggle all you want.

123471006.content: Nor should you hope for help. Divine punishment is on its way to Shimogyou. Those you call friends are about to suffer for their sins, too!

123471007.content: Something in the devotee's crazed tirade causes Buzenbo to narrow her eyes.

123471008.content: Your god has finally had enough of me wasting his time, right?

123471009.content: The cultist starts to panic as Buzenbo grasps the hilt of her weapon.

123471010.content: You... You must accept your punishment!

123471011.content: No matter how far I travel, the dead zone is always around, so the Visbane has been moving with me.

123471012.content: But if it's planning to attack Shimogyou, it will have to let me go.

123471013.content: And that means you're the last people I need to defeat.

123471014.content: She can see from his expression that she's right, but her opponent doesn't back down.

123471015.content: Look at you, all battered and bruised. Why so sure you'll defeat us?

123471016.content: The Deer God's follower brandishes a staff, and countless pairs of glowing red eyes appear in the trees behind.

123471017.content: Buzenbo draws her blade. She knows the Deer God will have sent a powerful force in hope of dealing her a final knockout blow. She also knows she has no time to waste.

123472002.content: Mimir's announcement stops us in our tracks. We all look to see who the call is coming from.

123472004.content: I guess I won't need my worst-case-scenario plans.

123472006.content: I accept the call and hear Buzenbo's voice, weary but urgent, come through the speaker.

123472007.content: Admin, things are getting serious. I'll start at the top.

123472008.content: Item one—the second wave is approaching Shimogyou. Our target Visbane is moving with the horde, so they're covered by the dead zone. That means you won't get any advanced warnings from the monitoring posts, they can't pick up the Bane Energy.

123472010.content: I tracked them long enough to be able to figure out where they're heading. If you can train the guns on the city walls on to that path, you should be able to hold them off for a while and gain some time.

123472011.content: I'm going to transfer data on their track to Lord Mimir. Get that info to the wall, as soon as you can!

123472013.content: My question causes Buzenbo to pause a moment, as if she's just realized that this so should have been included in her report, and that the answer is important to me.

123472014.content: I ran into a few problems, but I'm not hurt badly. I can continue with the next stage of my operation.

123472017.content: Both Kuninotokotachi and I roll our eyes at Sekhmet's comment.

123472018.content: Buzenbo, the next stage of your operation is to get back here. And don't get into any fights if you can avoid them.

123472019.content: Send the data to Mimir immediately. We'll take it from there.

123472020.content: Got it, but there's something else. Item two—I found a few weird things up here that I can't really explain. I'll include the relevant data.

123472021.content: You can explain more when we see you. Remember, I want you back here.

123472022.content: I hang up and finally feel some tension leave my body. Mimir's data transfer light starts to flicker, while Sekhmet pulls out a miniature computer and starts to connect to the Mimir network.

123472023.content: Do we have time for this, crazy lady?

123472024.content: If your Mod colleague took the time to send us this info at a moment like this, she must think it's important. Perhaps because we'll need it to make the right decisions.

123472026.content: Sekhmet gasps in surprise. I look at her screen and see a picture of a statue of the Deer God.

123472027.content: So we were right. The Deer God and our Visbane target are the same thing.

123472028.content: I think we already knew that. You're missing the important bit.

123472029.content: Sekhmet zooms in on the photo, on the ground around the statue.

123472031.content: I've read a bit about folk customs here in Sasanami. Arcane circles like this are only used in a unique kind of ritual, correct?

123472033.content: The Akishika have been sacrificing people to the Deer God?

123472035.content: No wonder Himiko rebelled against her family.

123472036.content: Just as I'm thinking everything now makes sense, Sekhmet seems to find something to worry about.

123472037.content: So they're willing to make human sacrifices. But what for?

123472038.content: Status? The Akishika rely more on the common folk than the other four families. Carrying out barbaric rituals like that won't make them more popular.

123472039.content: It's just Visbanes manipulating humans. Does it need to be more complicated than that?

123472040.content: It's a theory that might satisfy an incurious superior officer, I guess.

123472041.content: What about the people we caught? Did they say anything about this circle?

123472042.content: No, which means the information is only known to those at the top of the organization... It's something they want to keep secret.

123472043.content: If I might make a suggestion, Mission Commander Sir, I think we should split up. You and whats-her-name get the data on the Visbane movements to the wall. I'll see what I can find out about this arcane circle.

123472044.content: So there's a Visbane horde about to attack the city... and you want to go solo again?

123472045.content: That's not a very considerate way of looking at it.

123472047.content: Hmph. And I thought you'd finally got used to my scent after sticking around for a while.

123472048.content: Hmm. Now you mention it... that's another reason I want to work solo.

123472049.content: Okay. Let us know if anything goes wrong. We'll make sure CORG gets your corpse back.

123472050.content: Sekhmet ignores the barb and looks at me.

123472051.content: On this occasion... I'll assume you know what you're doing.

123472052.content: That's one of the things I like about humans. They can learn.

123472053.content: Sekhmet does not sound like a subordinate asking for approval from a superior. It's more like she's a teacher, and I'm the student who has finally come up with the right answer.

123472054.content: But before I can comment on her attitude problem, she's up on the rooftops and soon nowhere to be seen.

123472055.content: If only we had the time for a Sekhmet roast...

123481001.content: When she thinks of their first encounter, Kuramitsuha always remembers the fireworks blooming across the Shimogyou sky.

123481002.content: Akishika Himiko's face had suddenly appeared against that background. In her memory, it seems to cause ripples in the sky. As if a fawn had set a single hoof in an icy pool.

123481003.content: I'm Akishika Himiko, head of the Akishika guard. Honored to meet you.

123481006.content: Yeah, whatever. You can find another target. You won't get anything out of me.

123481008.content: C'mon, it's page one of the Shimogyou Con Artist Handbook. First, introduce yourself.

123481010.content: The look on Akishika Himiko's face—the look of a conscientious student—gets Kuramitsuha's attention. She stops trying to look past her to see the fireworks. At this point, Kuramitsuha notices that her new acquaintance is, in fact, accompanied by a contingent of soldiers.

123481012.content: Why would I arrest a hero of Shimogyou?

123481013.content: Oh? I bet that's not what your snitch called me.

123481014.content: It's as if something has struck a raw nerve with Kuramitsuha. She suddenly feels the urge to talk more, half-complaining, half-sharing.

123481015.content: Let me tell you a secret. That "Deer God" you worship is a kind of monster, called "Visbane". And all those monsters coming out of the forest and attacking people are its children.

123481017.content: One day, a long time ago, I suddenly realized a whole lot of things. One of them was that it's my mission to protect humanity by wiping out those monsters.

123481018.content: But the humans I protect don't understand. They think I'm causing all the problems by angering the gods. They think I'm the monster, and so they avoid me.

123481019.content: The only people who believe in me are a bunch of kids.

123481020.content: So, what's the point of protecting humanity?

123481021.content: The Akishika soldiers start to discuss. They clearly think Kuramitsuha is some crazy weirdo. But Akishika Himiko herself is thinking over what she says.

123481022.content: So, and with all due respect, you aren't human?

123481024.content: Because I do not fear you. I'm tough too.

123481025.content: Look, what do you want with me?

123481026.content: I'm a hero of Shimogyou, just like you. And we have the same mission. Protecting humanity.

123481027.content: So, I thought I'd come and make friends.

123481028.content: Kuramitsuha looks at the young warrior in surprise. She seems more vivid than her surroundings. A splash of color in a monochrome scene.

123481029.content: And what makes you think I want that too?

123481030.content: I admit, we will need to put a few conditions in place.

123481031.content: For example, I hear high praise of your skill at deceit, which... isn't good. If you want to be my friend, I will need you to promise not to lie to me.

123481032.content: Kuramitsuha doesn't deny the accusation. Somehow, Akishika Himiko's direct manner makes her feel closer to her. It's as if they're already old friends.

123481033.content: Two years after that first meeting, Kuramitsuha and her only friend save humanity.

123481034.content: Again, they meet under a firework-lit summer sky, each with different thoughts.

123481035.content: Why the long face? You've got the Prime Lord's approval and you're now Lady Akishika.

123481036.content: But we didn't really kill the Deer God, did we, Mitsy?

123481037.content: I cannot tell you lies. No, we didn't.

123481038.content: When we were mopping up, our soldiers realized the fragments of the statue had been spirited away. And the forest patrol is reporting rumors of strange beasts attacking locals.

123481039.content: Himiko, I did tell you. Humans can't beat Visbanes. I'm a Mod and I'm not even sure I could beat that Deer God.

123481040.content: I know I'm not a very experienced Mod. But I could tell that the Deer God is much more than that statue. There's no chance we killed the god just by destroying it.

123481041.content: Then we'll have to keep trying. If you'll help me, Mitsy...

123481042.content: I respectfully decline. I don't want to see you waste your life on some hopeless undertaking...

123481043.content: You know what the Akishika used to sacrifice, right? Living people. And that's going to continue unless we do something to stop it.

123481045.content: It's a calm response. As if Kuramitsuha knew how this conversation would play out.

123481046.content: Mitsy, I care. And I'm your friend.

123481048.content: Himiko gazes off into the distance, the rainbow colors of the fireworks glinting in her eyes.

123481049.content: I swear, as an Akishika, that I will end this tragedy and protect my people.

123481051.content: Despite knowing that Himiko would do this, Kuramitsuha still finds herself becoming upset. She might pride herself on being a master of deception, but now? Now, her every thought is plain to see on her face.

123481052.content: Why don't you just run? You know I've done everything I can...

123481053.content: And where could I run to, with this blood running in my veins?

123481054.content: Kuramitsuha doesn't respond and the two watch the fireworks in silence. The colors and patterns fill the sky.

123481057.content: True. But what's the alternative, for a firework, other than a moment of glory? Stay safe in the warehouse, until damp and mold get you? And then you're nothing.

123481059.content: I've made my decision. I will have my moment. I will be the hero that saves the world.

123481060.content: I will not let the damp and mold get me. I will bloom and shine. Even if very briefly.

123481061.content: And I hope you'll be there to see it, Mitsy. I hope, that when I figure out how to have that moment of glory, you are by my side.

123481062.content: There's a long silence until Kuramitsuha finally gives her response.

123481064.content: Kuramitsuha knows she has made a promise. And she hates breaking promises.

123481065.content: Perhaps it's because she remembers how many lies she's told. When she says something she means, she wants to make it count.

123481066.content: Kuramitsuha skims over the rooftops, the words she just heard ringing in her ears.

123481067.content: It's something she didn't want to acknowledge at first, even when she saw the Visbeast horde. But there's no more denying it. The Deer God is back, and the happy times she dreamed of are going to be much shorter than she hoped.

123481068.content: I remember my promise, Himiko. But...

123481069.content: With a spurt of speed, Kuramitsuha disappears into the night.

123491001.content: Himiko looks at the black flame flickering in its transparent prison and recalls the conversation at the Akishika mansion several days previously.

123491002.content: The visitor hides in the shadows, unwilling to be seen.

123491003.content: I didn't get a chance to see your face, my guest. But I did see you are a warrior and you carry a sword.

123491004.content: I, too, am a warrior. Since our weapons remain sheathed, I suppose that you are here to talk, not to fight.

123491006.content: You can start with the most important part. Then I can decide on whether I need to sound the alarm or not.

123491007.content: I have a mission from my employer. To kill the Deer God.

123491009.content: But I soon discovered that to complete this mission, I would have to kill you.

123491011.content: I have heard tell of your achievements. It seems there are still some Akishika who are unwilling to accept a cursed fate.

123491014.content: The visitor raises their head, in what seems to be an attempt to look serious.

123491015.content: I wish to give you a choice. A choice I think you've long hoped for.

123491016.content: The visitor removes something from a pocket. It's a black flame, contained in an exquisitely made transparent container.

123491017.content: With this, you will be able to kill the Deer God once and for all.

123491018.content: Akishika Himiko looks at the dancing flame. Her eyes, once so calm, betray her surprise.

123491019.content: You know what it means to me if what you say is true. Correct?

123491020.content: Yes. You can choose to take it. Or you can choose to have me chased off, leaving you to the fate your family has left you with.

123491021.content: That is the choice I offer you.

123491022.content: Akishika Himiko replies with a long silence. But in the end, she loosens her grip on the hilt of her blade.

123491023.content: Leave it here. You may go.

123491024.content: An evening breeze wakes Himiko from her reverie. She takes the container and looks at the mountain forest again.

123491025.content: The woods are as quiet as ever. But she can sense something. Something wicked and coming this way.

123491027.content: She notices the guard's awkward expression and the little girl by his side. She can see exactly what has happened.

123491028.content: It's late to be sneaking out of the city, child.

123491029.content: It's going to rain tomorrow. That means there won't be any big beetles to catch.

123491030.content: What if the Deer God's monsters get you?

123491031.content: I'm not scared! All the boys say that even the Deer God is scared of you, Miss Akishika.

123491032.content: Haha. Would your mom and pop get angry if they heard you talk like that?

123491033.content: My pop hasn't worshipped the Deer God since ages ago. Two years. And he's made lots of money all the same.

123491035.content: Himiko isn't talking to the girl as the leader of the Akishika family. She seems more like a big sister.

123491036.content: If I promise you that after tonight, you can go and play in the forest whenever you want, even if I'm not here, and you won't have to worry about monsters anymore...

123491037.content: In return, do you promise to be a good girl and go home?

123491038.content: The girl knows that adults often tell kids what they want to hear, to make them be quiet or go away. But this time... She looks wide-eyed at Himiko.

123491039.content: Akishika Himiko seems entirely sincere. The girl gives her a long hard stare, trying to decide if this is a promise she can rely on. It seems so.

123491040.content: Hmm. Miss Akishika could never lie! I know it!

123491041.content: Himiko watches as the guard leads the girl back into the city and the warmth in her eyes fades. The commander of the Akishika forces is back.

123491042.content: Is there still no word from the monitoring stations CORG helped us build?

123491043.content: No, no reports of enemy movements. Looks like it might be a quiet ni—

123491044.content: And before he can finish, Himiko's weapon is drawn and a Visbeast, leaping at the soldier from behind, falls to the ground dead.

123491047.content: The sound of intermittent cannon fire is heard from elsewhere on the wall. The attackers are individual Visbeasts, easily repelled by heavy fire. But she's on edge now, because she knows this is the forerunner of a much bigger onslaught.

123491048.content: Tell the artillery to save their energy. Their fire is more effective at long range. Let the rifles take care of the lone wolves.

123491050.content: Still nothing from the monitoring posts? We need to degrade their forces before they reach the city walls!

123491052.content: Himiko's terminal sounds. She looks at the number calling—it's one she added only recently—and answers.

123491053.content: Admin, would I be correct in saying you're about to warn me of a Visbeast horde which has managed to evade our monitoring systems?

123491055.content: Just a few running ahead of the pack. The horde itself isn't here yet.

123491057.content: I'll keep it short. The Deer God is with the horde, creating an EM dead zone. The monitoring stations won't be able to pick anything up.

123491059.content: Luckily, I've got data on the horde's route, you should have it already. Fire everything you've got in their path and we can pin them down.

123491060.content: And then we'll send in the Mods and...

123491062.content: I hang up and almost immediately hear the sounds of massed artillery fire from the direction of the wall.

123491063.content: She really is amazing. You've got to think she's kind of hot, right? I mean, even I—

123491064.content: You can do whatever you want once this is over.

123491066.content: Despite the teasing, Kuninotokotachi isn't slowing down. I know she's trying to help me relax. Because, like me, she knows we've got one hell of a battle ahead.

123491067.content: That said, being decisive is one thing. But Himiko didn't sound surprised to hear the Deer God is coming. That means...

123491068.content: I guess what I saw under the influence of the spores was real.

123491069.content: So our Lady Akishika does have a way to defeat the Deer God?

123491070.content: But will the same thing happen again this time?

123491072.content: Her yelled warning interrupts my thoughts. Kuninotokotachi quickly repels the attack from the shadows, but we see a dozen or more devotees appear on the rooftops to either side of us.

123491073.content: These guys again? Didn't we catch 'em all last time?

123491074.content: I guess these are the head honchos Sekhmet said slipped away.

123491075.content: The High Priest has ordered these two blasphemers not be allowed to pass!

123491076.content: The cultists brandish their staffs. In the alleyways around us, pairs of glowing red eyes appear.

123492001.content: The cannons on the city wall are roaring, and the explosions in the target area light up the night sky.

123492002.content: Himiko can't see the Visbeasts being blown to pieces by the attack, but she can tell from the number of them reaching the wall that the main force has been stopped. The route data from Buzenbo was accurate.

123492003.content: But she's still worried. The situation at the city wall remains perilous.

123492004.content: Are the guns on the southern wall all firing?

123492005.content: We sent some extra soldiers over, to fill the gap, but...

123492006.content: Don't dillydally. If you've got something to say, spit it out.

123492007.content: As you can see, my Lady, our artillery is firing at full speed. But some of the monsters are still getting past the bombardment and reaching the wall.

123492008.content: If we were talking about ordinary animals, we'd be confident to fight them off... But something's directing their attacks. They're quietly climbing up the wall and targeting the soldiers working the artillery.

123492009.content: And others are slipping across, going into the city, looking for locals to attack. That forces us to take men off the wall...

123492010.content: If they keep this up, our defenses won't hold.

123492011.content: Pass the word—I'm canceling the curfew. I want every able-bodied citizen of Shimogyou armed and on the streets, taking out those attackers. Our soldiers will focus on holding the wall. We can't keep dividing our forces.

123492012.content: But... how are ordinary people going to fight those monsters, my Lady?

123492013.content: When it comes to fighting those monsters, we're all ordinary people. Including you and me.

123492015.content: The soldier rushes off. Not long after, everything goes quiet and Himiko senses a nearby threat. She tightens her hand on the hilt.

123492017.content: Still fighting, Himiko? Or should I call you... Lady Akishika?

123492018.content: An old man emerges, relaxed, from the shadows. He wears the robe of a Deer God cultist.

123492019.content: How have you been since we last met, Uncle. Or should I call you... High Priest?

123492020.content: I see your infiltration of Shimogyou is thorough enough, or you wouldn't have been able to get so close to me.

123492021.content: Some nearby meddlers have been... dealt with. And your lackeys are busy fleeing divine punishment. It's time to give up.

123492022.content: Repent, Himiko, and accept your fate. It is the only way to save Sasanami and all in it.

123492023.content: I stopped believing in the fate my family intended for me when I learned the truth.

123492024.content: The people of Sasanami will be saved, but not because of cowards who would slaughter them for their own selfish interests.

123492025.content: Slaughter? No, sacrifice. A great sacrifice!

123492026.content: And as for being selfish... The Akishika have never shirked the great duties they bear.

123492027.content: Until you. You are the true coward. It is you who turned your back on your calling!

123492028.content: The priest seems righteously indignant, as if he has justice on his side and his niece is an unrepentant sinner.

123492029.content: Akishika Himiko, if you had accepted your fate and served as a sacrifice, none of this would have come to pass!

123492030.content: There's a moment of hesitation in Himiko's eyes. It doesn't last long.

123492031.content: As I said. I don't believe you.

123492032.content: I'm not a little girl anymore, Uncle. I'm not the orphan who did what her family told her.

123492033.content: And if you want to give me any more advice, you'll need to get it past my blade.

123492034.content: The priest's gaze falls to Himiko's weapon. He steps back.

123492035.content: You are my brother's daughter, I see. Always fighting. It seems I will not get you to the altar easily. In one piece, at least.

123492036.content: But you have the same obvious weakness that my brother did. You care too much about the common scum.

123492037.content: He gestures and one of his followers brings a little girl forward. The cultist is already holding a knife to the girl's neck. A mere twitch of the hand will be enough to slice her throat open.

123492039.content: Himiko immediately recognizes the child she was speaking to earlier. Her anger is clear to see.

123492040.content: Akishika Hisahide! You would threaten a child?

123492041.content: Her loss will be of no consequence, if it helps us calm the fury of the Deer God.

123492042.content: The question is... Will you allow her to die for the sake of your principles?

123492043.content: As his question ends, there's a cold flash of light. Himiko has drawn her weapon and in an eyeblink crosses the gap between them.

123492044.content: Her blade drives into the cultist's shoulder with surgical precision. The dagger falls to the ground before the little girl is harmed.

123492045.content: But at the same moment, the High Priest raises his staff and countless vines sprout from the ground, enveloping Himiko and holding her immobile.

123492047.content: Feel the power of the Deer God. There will be no escape this time!

123492048.content: The priest speaks with fear, almost imperceptible, in his voice, for Himiko still holds her blade.

123492049.content: Think how different things would be if you had struck at my heart, rather than saving the girl. As I said, niece, your weakness is so obvious.

123492051.content: Wow. Scary look. But what of it... I will grant your wish. It makes no difference for the ceremony we are about to hold.

123492053.content: The girl seems to want to do something, but Himiko's look makes it clear she should be running. She turns and flees helter-skelter for home.

123492055.content: The vines twisting around Himiko continue to grow, until she is completely contained in an impenetrable cage.

123501001.content: We deal with the last cultist blocking our way and make it to the forest. The sound of artillery fire from that direction is deafening and Kuninotokotachi and I have to shout to make ourselves heard.

123501002.content: This is a pain. Mod fighting styles aren't designed to be used on humans.

123501003.content: I think there are some at the wall as well. They must be planning to sabotage it.

123501004.content: I'm sure Lady Akishika knew that before we did. We can let the humans deal with the other humans.

123501005.content: We need to be dealing with the big guy coming our w—Admin!

123501006.content: She sees a pair of red eyes in the shadows behind me. A Visbane lurking there has spotted me and pounces.

123501007.content: But before Kuninotokotachi can move, a shiny blade slashes out and my attacker falls dead.

123501009.content: You're back, at last. Come here, girl. Hug time.

123501011.content: Finally. I'm so glad you're safe.

123501012.content: Buzenbo listens to our warm welcomes and gives a moment's thought to what she should do. Naturally, she chooses the most logical option and starts to make her report.

123501013.content: I confirmed on my way that the bulk of the Visbeast horde had been stopped in its tracks by the artillery fire. We're safe here, for now.

123501015.content: However, that Deer God is still approaching the city wall. The bombardment is slowing it to a crawl, but human weapons aren't going to kill it.

123501016.content: And I don't believe the walls will stop it.

123501017.content: Should we take the initiative and stop it?

123501018.content: It won't be easy. Given all the trouble it's caused us, I think the Deer God is an even tougher foe than the Snake God was. After what happened with the Miyahebi, and with Tsukuyomi not here to help... charging in is just going to make things worse.

123501019.content: I look at my squad and can't help but pause. It's just me and two Mods.

123501020.content: At its current speed, can we be sure it won't reach the city wall before dawn?

123501021.content: Hmm... as long as the artillery keeps firing, yes.

123501022.content: So in the end, the success of our mission lies in the hands of those human soldiers.

123501023.content: With Himiko in charge, I think we're good.

123501024.content: Hey, Admin, since when have you and Lady Akishika been on first name terms?

123501026.content: So, our job now is to help the local soldiers slow down the Deer God. But...

123501027.content: As if to prove Murphy's Law, the artillery on the nearby part of the city wall falls silent. The once deafening booms and blasts quickly fade.

123501028.content: But that noise is soon replaced. A chilling chorus of Visbeast howls comes from the depths of the forest.

123501029.content: As long as the arty keeps firing, you said?

123501031.content: Several signal flares arc upwards over the city wall, illuminating the night sky. Someone is calling a meeting.

123501032.content: Those are coming from the Akishika temporary command post.

123501033.content: I whip out my comms terminal and try to reach Himiko. No response.

123501034.content: I was ready for something like this. Still doesn't feel good.

123501036.content: In one direction, a missing Akishika Himiko. In the other, a Visbeast horde now no longer under bombardment and making full speed for the city. Both Buzenbo and Kuninotokotachi look at me, waiting for me to tell them how we're going to choose.

123501037.content: I freeze for a moment. It's a shock to have such an important decision land in my lap.

123501038.content: Perhaps it's best someone else makes that decision for them.

123501039.content: Admin, we don't have time for this!

123501040.content: I snap out of it, thanks to Kuninotokotachi, and pull myself together.

123501041.content: First... We head for the command post. Find Himiko and figure out what's going on.

123501042.content: Could be a rough road back, Admin.

123501043.content: I follow Kuninotokotachi's gaze. The dark of night is pierced by the glow of countless pairs of red eyes.

123501044.content: The Visbeast vanguard is coming our way. The Deer God is watching us, somehow.

123501045.content: Birds circle in the sky above, quietly watching as the Visbeasts surround us.

123501046.content: Don't fight if you can avoid it. We need to get back!

123502001.content: The square below the wall is so brightly illuminated it might as well be noon.

123502002.content: Locals have been gathering here since the curfew was canceled. But instead of being met by Akishika Himiko and told how they are going to fight off the Visbeasts, they find a group of Deer God cultists.

123502003.content: They've erected a platform below the city wall, as if they're about to hold some kind of ritual.

123502005.content: Yes, sir. We took control of the main fire-control system.

123502006.content: Unfortunately, the officers no longer recognize the talisman you provided. We had to be... firm.

123502007.content: Both the soldiers and the commoners are going to be problems for us, until the ritual starts.

123502008.content: Do not worry. I can deal with them. The blasphemers?

123502009.content: We failed to stop them. But the Deer God is now dealing with them. They will not be able to reach us in the near future.

123502010.content: Very good. Is the arcane circle ready?

123502011.content: Yes, but... We have been unable to reach one of the priests responsible for the circle.

123502012.content: What else could they have to do, at this time?

123502013.content: There's no time to find them, though. I will fill in, personally.

123502015.content: The follower leaves, and Akishika Hisahide looks at the people gathering at the platform.

123502016.content: Bring the offering. It is time for the believers to hear their god.

123502017.content: We manage to give our pursuers the slip for a while and come to a high point in the landscape.

123502018.content: It's weird, but... is it just me or are those things becoming more... Visbanic?

123502019.content: You're right. They retain much less organic material than the ones we encountered earlier.

123502020.content: It might mean that the Deer God's powers are increasing.

123502021.content: If there is any more delay, restarting the bombardment may not be enough to stop it.

123502022.content: What is that Lady Akishika playing at?

123502023.content: I look towards the command post and see that some kind of platform has been constructed.

123502024.content: It's those crazies again. What are they doing now?

123511001.content: The vines hold Himiko to a stake in the center of the platform. She looks like a saint to be sacrificed.

123511002.content: Isn't that Lady Akishika? Why's she tied up?

123511003.content: Look at them up there. Aren't they priests of the Deer God?

123511004.content: So the army did anger the Deer God?

123511006.content: Akishika Hisahide comes to the front of the platform and looks down his nose at the commoners gathered below, as if he is the representative of some higher power.

123511008.content: There's a special power to his voice. It reaches far and wide and soon everyone on the square is quiet.

123511009.content: You are right. That is Lady Akishika here on the altar.

123511010.content: You have looked up to her. Trusted her. You thought that under her leadership you could rebel against your god and yet still look forward to a bright future.

123511011.content: But, unfortunately, it is my duty as a servant of that god to reveal that she has lied to you!

123511012.content: The spectators glance at each other. Akishika Hisahide raises his voice even more.

123511013.content: The horde of monsters attacking Shimogyou as we speak is a divine punishment, caused by Akishika Himiko's betrayals!

123511014.content: And in less than half an hour, the fury of the Deer God will lay waste to all Shimogyou!

123511016.content: General Akishika led us to victory against the monsters once! She can do it again!

123511017.content: Who even are you? Let General Akishika go!

123511018.content: The soldiers on the square raise their weapons. But they can't act without putting their general at risk.

123511019.content: Ha. Those who insist on defying the gods cannot succeed for long. I am here to tell you that Akishika Himiko's heretical plans have failed!

123511020.content: The High Priest waves his staff and packs of terrifying beasts emerge from the shadows, advancing towards the crowds.

123511022.content: How did they get into the city?

123511024.content: As he calls out, the monsters stop in their tracks.

123511025.content: Do they do what he says?

123511026.content: Is he really a servant of the Deer God?

123511027.content: The Deer God is not a cruel god. He can be kind. If you are willing to make atonement for your sins of the past, there will be no punishment.

123511028.content: But there is only one way to atone. Sacrifice Akishika Himiko to the Deer God!

123511029.content: The crowd erupts, but the monsters start moving forward again and the dissenters soon fall silent.

123511030.content: You can only be saved by completing this sacrifice!

123511032.content: It's taken her a long time, but Himiko has managed to chew through the vines closest to her mouth. And the first thing she does is call, as loudly as she can, to the commoners and soldiers around the platform.

123511033.content: He is no servant of any god, and those are nothing more than common animals turned into monsters. There is no Divine Power at work here. Fight them and they will die!

123511035.content: There's a moment of shock before several soldiers raise their guns and take aim. They shoot and a number of the strange animals fall to the ground.

123511036.content: Body shots! Aim for the vital organs!

123511038.content: Er... if we kill them, will something bad happen to us? You know, like divine punishment...

123511039.content: Who is watching her!? Shut her up!

123511040.content: The tide seems to be turning, until everyone in the crowd feels a change in the atmosphere. There's something oppressive and suffocating in the air. A huge flock of birds appears in the sky, circling until it seems there's a giant eye looking down at the crowd.

123511042.content: A voice, deep and booming, echoes in the ears of everyone present. It seems to come from the ground and the sky at once.

123511043.content: The Deer God... The Deer God is with us!

123511044.content: The monsters which were shot get unsteadily to their feet. A black ooze fills their wounds and they are soon back in their original state.

123511046.content: They can't be killed! They're monsters!

123511048.content: Present your sacrifice and the Deer God will forgive you!

123511050.content: The monsters push forward again, leaving those who shot at them fallen in pools of blood. Everyone else steps backwards as they lay down their weapons.

123511054.content: We're moving as fast as we possibly can, and are still too far away.

123511055.content: Over the crowd, I see several of the Deer God's cultists draw what look like instruments of torture and move towards Himiko.

123511057.content: The crowd gathers around the platform. They echo the call—"Present the sacrifice"—but there is no bloodlust in their eyes. Only fear.

123511059.content: We're going to be too late!

123511060.content: There is a sudden blast of cold from where the crowd stands and a huge commotion. I stand gazing at the platform in shock.

123511061.content: Brrr. Cold! Looks like I should have arrived earlier.

123511062.content: Behind her lie the dozens of frostbitten cultists she had to deal with to squeeze through the crowd.

123511064.content: The nearby spectators echo the call and there is soon a stand-off. Alongside the shouts of "blasphemer" from the cultists, there is no shortage of ordinary insults being thrown at Kuramitsuha, borne of long-held anger.

123511065.content: Kuramitsuha's gaze falls on Akishika Himiko up on the platform and she sees the new wounds her friend carries.

123511066.content: Yes, I know. You hate me.

123512001.content: The frost swirling around her naginata blasts out. Kuramitsuha's ferocious attack doesn't stop until she's right under the platform. A group of ordinary people stand there, weapons held in shaking hands.

123512002.content: At Akishika Hisahide's urging, they twist their faces into angry scowls and charge at her.

123512003.content: I really have tried to practice self-control, but I just can't get the hang of dealing out appropriate levels of violence.

123512005.content: She casts her naginata to one side and clenches her fists.

123512007.content: Still playing the hero? Can't you ever stop?

123512009.content: Couldn't you just leave us in peace this one time?

123512011.content: Himiko watches on as Kuramitsuha defeats everyone who stands in her way with bare hands. By the time she reaches her friend's side, those hands are bruised and bleeding.

123512013.content: Kuramitsuha summons her naginata back to her side and slashes through the vines holding Himiko in place. And the first thing she does when she has finally freed her friend is... ask her a serious question.

123512014.content: Himiko, did you know? About the Deer God reawakening and his followers coming back?

123512015.content: Yes, I was looking into it...

123512016.content: Why didn't you tell me? You know we—

123512017.content: Kuramitsuha stops. She's remembering that promise.

123512018.content: Because I didn't want to lie to you, Mitsy. Or to make you sad.

123512019.content: So, you've figured out how to set off those fireworks, right?

123512021.content: Kuramitsuha's hands fall to her side for a moment, looking frustrated. Then she tightens her grip on her naginata again.

123512022.content: Himiko, I basically do not care if these people live or die. If grabbing you and slashing my way through every one of them solved everything, I'd do it. Wouldn't even hesitate.

123512023.content: But... if saving them is your firework display and the only thing you want to do, I won't stand in your way.

123512024.content: I won't have any regrets. I won't... I won't feel sad. But let me keep my promise and be there to watch the show.

123512025.content: From now, until the very end, I will be your naginata!

123512026.content: For a moment, Himiko doesn't know what to say in response. Then she sees the determination in Kuramitsuha's eyes and realizes she doesn't need to say a word.

123512028.content: Himiko is still recovering from her imprisonment, so Kuramitsuha supports her as they jump from the platform, back the way she came.

123512029.content: Come back, fool! If the sacrifice isn't made on time...

123512030.content: The monsters suddenly become wilder, no longer responding to the High Priest's orders. They run off, tracking Kuramitsuha and attacking anyone they encounter on the way. The crowd falls into chaos.
