123512031.content: The fury of the Deer God is upon us...

123521001.content: A swarm of Visbeasts are clambering over the city wall and into Shimogyou. The locals flee in panic.

123521002.content: They moved much faster than I anticipated once the bombardment ended.

123521003.content: Was that the troublemaker? Such fierce attacks... Where did the two of them go? I can't see anything with all these people in the way.

123521004.content: We need to reach Lady Akishika!

123521006.content: Everyone on the square is fleeing in panic, with Visbeasts snapping at their heels. My Pheasant Squad is on one side of that river of terrified people, Himiko and Kuramitsuha are on the other. There's no way we can reach them.

123521007.content: I'm calling Himiko. After a few seconds that feel like hours, she picks up.

123521009.content: Sounds like you've made it back, too.

123521010.content: She sounds drained and I find myself more worried about her than I should be.

123521011.content: Just focus on keeping yourself safe. We'll figure out how to meet up with you and then we can figure out what to do next.

123521012.content: There's no time. The cultists have sabotaged our command and control systems and detained my key officers. I need to show up personally and rally some troops.

123521013.content: There are too many Visbeasts now for human soldiers to deal with. I recommend we focus on restarting the bombardment.

123521014.content: Won't be that easy. They sent people to take over the fire-control system when they took me.

123521015.content: Are you planning to take it back?

123521016.content: No. I won't be able to get enough people together at this moment. We need to make sure the civilians get clear first.

123521017.content: It might be a bit late for—

123521019.content: Send a squad strong enough to attack and capture the High Priest. Then force him to give the order to restart the bombardment.

123521020.content: Even in the midst of all this chaos, she can come up with a plan like that. It's both bold and carefully calculated.

123521021.content: Can I trust you with that, Admin?

123522002.content: Give the order. Tell your people to restart the bombardment.

123522003.content: You don't understand. Even if I do let you play with your little toys, it won't change a thing. And if we do not make the sacrifice soon...

123522004.content: Oh, please, keep rambling on. I have a few torture techniques I'm just dying to try out.

123522007.content: I wish Sekhmet was here. She's better at this kind of thing.

123522008.content: Yeah, but I don't think we can rely on that madwoman turning up. What if we tell his cultists we'll kill him if they don't do what we want?

123522009.content: Kuninotokotachi is about to run with that plan when a call comes in.

123522010.content: Mission Commander Sir, I have vital intel.

123522011.content: You sure choose your moments. Do you have any idea what we're dealing with here?

123522012.content: Wait, let me listen... Panic is spreading. Visbanes are attacking the city wall. Oh, and the arty is taking a break.

123522013.content: Overall, as I expected. If it can go wrong, it has.

123522014.content: Yeah, so let's hope your intel is worth our time.

123522015.content: It is. While the cultists were all running around getting ready, I borrowed one of their priests and managed to get some key info. You remember the arcane circle, right?

123522017.content: Have you figured out how they use it to summon the Deer God?

123522018.content: You've got it the wrong way round. They use the circle to contain the Deer God.

123522019.content: I'm not sure we have time for your jokes.

123522020.content: I've also tracked down one of their bases. There's plenty of evidence here to support my theory. I take full responsibility for any consequences if I'm wrong.

123522021.content: All along, they've been trying to maintain a temporary seal that was placed on the Deer God. But they didn't have the most crucial material they needed, and the seal has continued to weaken. You've probably noticed the Deer God becoming stronger as that's happened.

123522022.content: But that means we should be helping them? If we can reinforce the seal, our problems are over.

123522023.content: That's a possible course of action. But remember what I said? There's something crucial we need.

123522024.content: Do we have to build an arcane circle, too?

123522025.content: No, that's just symbolic. Decoration, almost. I think you can guess what the missing ingredient is.

123522027.content: In technical terms, soul data. And not just any soul data.

123522028.content: The Akishika seem to have mastered some technique using soul data to place a temporary seal on the Deer God, and even remove some of his powers. It's like... caging a wild beast.

123522029.content: If you think Admin's going to approve a human sacrifice, you really are crazy.

123522030.content: And anyway, both Aether Gazer and CORG want to eliminate the threat permanently. What do you think we're going to do, keep making human sacrifices like those crazies?

123522031.content: You've been AWOL all this time and that's the only info you've found? Nothing useful, like, I don't know, how to kill the thing?

123522032.content: That... There's a way to do it. In theory.

123522033.content: For some reason, she doesn't elaborate. And before I can say anything else, we lose the signal.

123522034.content: It's the Deer God's dead zone. It's close!

123522035.content: How far away is the big guy?

123522036.content: How can you still not realize? We must make the sacrifice, or...

123522037.content: Shut it, you old fool. If you hadn't wanted a tamed monster, none of this would have happened.

123522039.content: What do you think we did? Kept it tied up, like a guard dog? To protect our riches and intimidate the people?

123522041.content: Didn't you do that, and turn it into a religion? Lying to people, using them as sacrifices?

123522042.content: The Akishika too were sacrificed. And not once did we complain!

123522044.content: It is... It is the fate of the Akishika family.

123522045.content: The Akishika rose to join the Sasanami Five by learning how to control the Deer God. But maintaining that control became the family's duty.

123522046.content: And so, the Deer God cursed the Akishika bloodline.

123522047.content: Many of us were sacrificed before my ancestors realized that the Deer God would never be completely controlled, no matter how many were offered.

123522048.content: Its powers have long permeated the very land on which the Akishika live. It might sleep, and regular sacrifices might prevent it from waking. But at most, the seal can only hold for twenty years or so.

123522049.content: And at that time, an Akishika must be sacrificed to the Deer God to reinforce the seal and send it to sleep once more.

123522050.content: To fail would mean catastrophe for all Sasanami. As we now see.

123522052.content: Each time the seal is reinforced, the next sacrifice is chosen. Himiko's fate has been determined since the very moment of her birth.

123522053.content: There's nothing I can say to that. All the information I have is pointing me towards a single answer. An answer I cannot accept.

123522054.content: Admin, we don't have time for his prattle.

123522055.content: It's all excuses. They could have asked for help at any point. We'd have dealt with this Deer God once and for all.

123522056.content: So why didn't they? Because sacrificing people and maintaining that so-called seal was the only way they got to act as the Deer God's representative and enjoy all that power!

123522057.content: You think you can kill the Deer God? Hahaha...

123522058.content: It's a crazed and desperate laugh.

123522059.content: You think we didn't try? Blasphemers like you have come before, imagining they could defeat a god.

123522060.content: You mean Mods? Mods fought the Deer God?

123522062.content: They met an end fitting for evil spirits. You'll recall the legend, I'm sure.

123522063.content: A sudden roar tears through the sky.

123522064.content: The Deer God has appeared, on top of a wall that should be unclimbable, gazing down on the people below as they scurry to safety.

123522066.content: The air seems to change, becoming oppressive and somehow angry.

123522067.content: Nothing can be heard over the sounds of screaming. Soldiers who had formed up into small squads scatter again. Nobody dares stand against the Deer God. Nobody even dares run.

123522068.content: Many in the crowd fall to their knees, praying that abasement will earn the Deer God's mercy.

123522069.content: Defy a god? How foolish can you be, Himiko?

123522070.content: See how humans act when faced with the power of a god. How cowardly and small they are.

123522071.content: It is a blessing to be able to win a little peace, at the cost of only a little blood.

123522072.content: Take me, if you will, Deer God! I volunteer!

123522073.content: And if you accept this humble offering, I pray that you extend even a moment of mercy, so that Himiko may reconsider her choices and accept her fate!

123522074.content: And with that, he pulls out a knife from nowhere and stabs himself. He dies there, kneeling in a pool of his own blood, a devout and humble believer.

123522076.content: Admin, something's wrong with the Deer God!

123522077.content: The Deer God roars from atop the wall and a shockwave of Bane Energy engulfs everything.

123531001.content: It's the middle of the night, but Shu is still at her desk. That means she's among the first to hear the bad news from CORG.

123531004.content: Take a look at the images my agent has sent back. The attacks were caused by a Cognizant. Something with more Bane Energy than even the Snake God we encountered previously.

123531005.content: And this time it's the Deer God...

123531006.content: If the Sasanami authorities had followed our orders and evacuated as many as they could to Kamigyou, we wouldn't be in this situation.

123531007.content: And we can conclude that the advance team's mission has failed.

123531008.content: Director, complaining isn't going to solve anything. It never does.

123531010.content: Plan B is to use Shimogyou as a crumple zone, to keep Kamigyou safe until morning. Then when our forces arrive we'll clear up the whole damned mess.

123531011.content: If Sasanami's leaders survive, we'll be able to rebuild.

123531012.content: Have you considered the consequences of that course of action?

123531013.content: There's no need to overreact. The Quake Damage Control Department has dealt with this kind of situation many times.

123531014.content: Trying to find a perfect plan just makes things worse in the end. Controlling the scope of destruction requires decisiveness about what is to be sacrificed.

123531015.content: Forgive me, but I cannot imagine the Aether Gazer component of the advance team is going to find that acceptable.

123531016.content: They will not be able to change anything.

123531017.content: The reports from the front are clear. This Cognizant has a particular type of Bane corruption ability. It has implanted itself in the environmental data for the Sasanami Surface Layer. There is no quick way to eliminate it. It may not even be possible to do so.

123531018.content: Even an all-out attack will still give its Visbeast hordes the time to destroy Shimogyou.

123531019.content: There is no point in our suffering more casualties for that!

123531020.content: Shu's response comes only after a long pause.

123531023.content: It is best if someone else makes the decision for them.

123531024.content: All is dark and silent. Then a huge noise and a sudden awakening.

123531025.content: You're awake? I fixed you up, for now, but remember to drop in to a hospital and get your brain checked over.

123531027.content: You weren't too close to the shockwave. Otherwise, you'd be dead already.

123531028.content: Maybe work on the bedside manner, crazy lady?

123531029.content: The first thing I do is look into the distance—almost the entire length of the wall has fallen and the Visbanes are pouring in. We're in a quiet corner, an oasis in the chaos, and so far unnoticed by our foes.

123531030.content: The "Deer God" stands on a section of the wall. He writhes and struggles, as if he's trying to get rid of something.

123531032.content: Seems the High Priest did us a favor before he died. His soul data reinforced the seal.

123531033.content: Unfortunately, it wasn't the right soul data. It'll hold for another ten minutes, maybe, but no more.

123531034.content: Then we need to do something!

123531035.content: I notice both Kuninotokotachi and Buzenbo look grim.

123531036.content: Thing is, you missed an important call while you were out cold.

123531037.content: Our superiors have been in touch with new orders. Our mission has failed. The new mission is to get out of Shimogyou and help defend Kamigyou.

123531038.content: But why... We can still turn things around here, can't we? If we give it all we've got?

123531039.content: You mean extend the seal's hold on the Deer God? Sure, if we have the right soul data...

123531040.content: I can't sacrifice anyone's life just to bolster a seal that's doomed to fail anyway. Our job is to wipe out that Visbane, once and for all!

123531041.content: Kill the Deer God? Well, like I said earlier, it can be done. In theory.

123531042.content: But to do that, there's a heck of a price to pay. Are you sure you are ready for this?

123531043.content: I can't even reply. I feel utterly helpless.

123531044.content: Sekhmet points a finger and, poking my head round the rocks that block my view, I see Himiko and Kuramitsuha have joined us.

123531045.content: Himiko is in cover, but looking out at the battlefield in front of her. Kuramitsuha stands beside her, hand on her naginata.

123531046.content: They got us here, to safety. Your friend, right? We need to know what they're thinking.

123531048.content: The walk takes a few seconds and seems long enough to cover half a world. By the time I've reached Himiko, I've considered a thousand options and compared them a million times. Then discarded them all.

123531049.content: I'm sorry, Admin. We've met twice now and I never seem to be ready for a proper reception.

123531050.content: If I can get the artillery back up and firing quickly enough...

123531051.content: It won't help. The Deer God got here much faster than we'd expected. The only thing that matters now is how we are going to deal with it.

123531052.content: There's a lot you haven't told me, isn't there?

123531053.content: Himiko pauses, giving very careful thought to her next words.

123531054.content: After our first attack against the Deer God, it turned out Mitsy and I hadn't really killed it. So I locked myself up in the family library, looking for ways to finish it off.

123531055.content: The Deer God is like a fungus, something that can subdivide endlessly. It gives off spores which embed themselves in plants and can give it control over animals. Plus, it can spread in the soil.

123531056.content: My earliest ancestors found a way, using human sacrifices, to stop the spread of the fungus for a certain amount of time, keeping it within a certain range. To seal it off.

123531057.content: And so they made regular human sacrifices. The Deer God's influence was limited to a specific area, where we, the Akishika, established our initial territory.

123531058.content: But they soon found the Deer God wanted to escape. The fungus in the soil started to change. Some became a fungal core with certain level of intelligence, some became a kind of... body. And so the Deer God had a conscious incarnation which could walk among us.

123531059.content: It planned to launch an attack on those who kept it captive, and destroy the remaining seal.

123531060.content: Nothing my ancestors tried worked. There was no way to stop the process. But they did find a way to control it. When that incarnation of the Deer God starts to form, the fungal core can be implanted into a human body.

123531061.content: That person becomes a living container, sealing the fungal core from the outside world. The mind and body of the Deer God can no longer be reunited.

123531062.content: But only the Akishika have the ability to contain the fungal core. And so it is us who must serve.

123531063.content: And what better choice than me? My parents died when I was young and I was raised by the priests.

123531064.content: Himiko's voice remains calm, despite the horror of the tale.

123531065.content: So... Does doing that mean the Deer God will be stopped?

123531066.content: There is one final and crucial step.

123531067.content: The physical form of the Deer God still takes shape, only it lacks awareness. It still retains its instincts, though, so it attacks, trying to recover its mind and become whole again.

123531068.content: But, if the container—the person in whom the fungal core is embedded—is sacrificed, the Deer God's mind disperses and its body hibernates. Until the next time...

123531069.content: So all those sacrifices were made... just to continue the cycle? And lead to yet more sacrifices?

123531070.content: My ancestors did everything they could to try and break the cycle. But in the end, I guess they gave up, and ended up regarding the being they had imprisoned as a type of god.

123531071.content: They worshipped it. They sacrificed to it. By my uncle's generation, there was no thought of resistance.

123531072.content: It takes me a few attempts, but I finally manage to ask the big question.

123531073.content: Is there any way to kill the Deer God?

123531074.content: The good news is, yes. I've found a way.

123531075.content: She gives me a reassuring smile, as if she's trying to comfort me. But it just makes my heart sink further.

123531077.content: Imagine there's a special kind of fire. Something that can burn through the fungus in moments and kill the Deer God once and for all.

123531078.content: But lighting that fire requires a special kind of spark.

123531079.content: Himiko pauses for a moment. She looks at me and I see her realize how I'm feeling.

123531080.content: Don't be like that, Admin. I'm a container for the Deer God's conciousness. If we're going to kill the Deer God, I don't get to walk away.

123531081.content: It's not... it's not something I can be rational about.

123531082.content: I try to work out the pros and cons, logically. But all I can see is Himiko, when we first met, when we fought side by side in the forest.

123531083.content: Himiko, you don't have to do this.

123531084.content: And I'm sure our Ninkyoumon doesn't want you to do it either, right?

123531085.content: I look to Kuramitsuha for help, but she just stands there, clenching her naginata in silence. There's a look of grim determination on her face.

123531086.content: We... We can wait for the Quake Damage Control Department people to get here. They're professionals. They have the numbers. They'll think of something.

123531087.content: And what about my people, here, now?

123531088.content: She asks the questions calmly, but every syllable is given full weight.

123531089.content: Someone's already made the decision for them!

123531090.content: I don't know why I say it, but I can't help myself.

123531091.content: I remember watching Ver collapse in front of me. I remember my conversation with Odin. I remember how helpless I once felt.

123531092.content: In this world, we—we humans—are protected. And not knowing we are protected is a great blessing. We don't need to decide how this catastrophe should end.

123531093.content: No matter what you try, in the end you'll realize that the most you can do is protect those close to you. And that's enough.

123531094.content: Himiko, we're... we're friends, aren't we?

123531095.content: I don't want to lose any more friends. I want to protect them. And only them, if that's all I can do.

123531096.content: I'm ready to be told I'm being irresponsible. To be told I'm neglecting my duties. To keep arguing. I'm ready for her response.

123531097.content: But all she does is turn and look at the chaos before her.

123531098.content: She sees a land where the beings known as human have two choices. To humble themselves in worship, or to flee in fear. There is no place for courage, no talk of resistance. It is the darkest night, devoid of even a glimmer of light.

123531099.content: Perhaps humans really are powerless. Plant a seed of terror, and desperation will soon sprout.

123531100.content: Even my soldiers, the soldiers I put through rigorous training, have scattered and fled at the sight of the Deer God.

123531101.content: I once felt that hopelessness. When I learned the truth about the Deer God, I thought I had no choice but to accept my fate as a sacrificial offering.

123531102.content: But later, someone gave me the courage to resist. Do you know who that was, Admin?

123531103.content: Himiko looks at me with kindness. I'm just confused.

123531106.content: When the Prime Lord was giving me his approval for my rebellion, he told me of your great feats with the Miyahebi.

123531107.content: Can humans be brave enough to fight the Visbanes? Can they join that war and become its heroes?

123531108.content: Admin, your courage in the past showed me the answer to those questions. Yes, they can.

123531109.content: I stand silent, in shock. I feel something stir within me. Something I thought I had lost.

123531111.content: Humanity can be great. Light a candle of courage and it will ignite a vast land of hope.

123531112.content: Now, I want to pass that candle on to you.

123531113.content: I want you to take your squad, and Mitsy. Fight the Deer God head-on and buy me the time I need.

123531114.content: Watch, Admin, as your friend becomes a hero.

123531118.content: The Deer God has broken free of what held him. With a roar, it gives the summons to a final battle.

123532001.content: With artillery support and a coordinated attack by three Mods, a gap opens up in the Visbeast horde.

123532002.content: A blade of light slices across the sky, trailing flames in its wake, and drives directly into the Deer God's heart.

123532003.content: Akishika Himiko becomes the spark igniting a dark fire, which spreads to consume the Deer God.

123532007.content: The Deer God's Bane Energy is collapsing!

123532012.content: What started as a tiny flame is now a raging wildfire. It consumes the giant form of the Deer God, which collapses and soon every Visbeast in Shimogyou is caught in that furious fire and burned.

123532015.content: The General... Take up your weapons! Fight back!

123532016.content: Once again, human voices ring out loud and proud. But in the center of the battlefield, all remains silent.

123532017.content: ... It's odd. I can feel my senses fading out...

123532018.content: I can't see anything, I think. I can hear a little...

123532019.content: I rushed to Himiko, my whole body shaking. She sees me and forces a smile.

123532022.content: Then I won our race. I saved the world first.

123532023.content: I have so much to say, but it all sticks in my throat. As tears well up in my eyes, I realize how I should say goodbye.

123532024.content: Himiko, I'm going to break the rules and tell you a secret.

123532025.content: In this world, when a human dies, they have their memories removed and are sent to the next Cycle, to live another life.

123532026.content: So I guess you're just getting a fresh start.

123532028.content: There's an unusual flash of light in Himiko's unfocused eyes. She seems to have understood.

123532029.content: And even if we don't remember each other, we'll be friends when we meet again, won't we?

123532031.content: She tries to smile in answer, but is overcome by a coughing fit.

123532032.content: Even... Even talking feels hard now.

123532033.content: Don't talk if you're tired, Himiko. Get some rest. You've earned it.

123532034.content: Himiko turns toward Kuramitsuha. She doesn't have much strength left.

123532035.content: Mitsy, I can't stop worrying about you.

123532036.content: Don't be sad. Remember, we agreed, didn't we?

123532039.content: I can't lie to you. You know that.

123532040.content: And as if that was her last concern, Akishika Himiko lets her eyes close.

123532041.content: A tear falls from Kuramitsuha's cheek. We know that promise to not be sad is one she could never hope to keep.

123532042.content: Day is dawning, and the night of chaos is finally over. Everyone around us looks dazed, as if wondering if the nightmare they have woken from is real or not.

123532043.content: We stand in silence and watch, as the hero who saved the world leaves us forever.

123541001.content: The sun starts to rise, and the long-awaited CORG forces finally turn up and take over.

123541002.content: It seems that headquarters has kept them updated on everything that's happened. They set to work wiping memories, grumbling about how difficult the task is, but carrying it out efficiently all the same.

123541003.content: Kuninotokotachi clambers over some ruins and finds, in a corner under the city wall, Sekhmet having a nap.

123541004.content: You got all the artillery firing, single-handed. Impressive work, crazy lady.

123541005.content: Let me guess... Our superiors want us to continue to coordinate our two organizations' work. But your Mission Commander Sir is unable to fulfill this task immediately, because reasons. So you have had no choice but to come and update me.

123541006.content: You guess right. So get to work.

123541007.content: We've had a tough night. How about I catch up on some sleep?

123541008.content: I'd rather get this over with. Then I can forget you exist.

123541009.content: Hmm. Could you back off a bit? You're too close.

123541010.content: Hey, let me ask you something. What is this smell I have that you hate so much? It's the booze, right?

123541011.content: Oh, a flash of self-awareness. How precious.

123541012.content: I hate the smell of it. So hop back a couple of steps.

123541013.content: This time, Kuninotokotachi doesn't get angry.

123541016.content: People who hate drinking and people who love drinking have something in common. They both have stories to tell.

123541017.content: So why don't I see if I can guess what your story is?

123541019.content: Sekhmet is, unusually for her, surprised.

123541020.content: I was talking with the Quake Damage Control people who just arrived. It turns out you didn't tell your boss about the possibility of sacrificing Lady Akishika to keep the Deer God under control. How come?

123541021.content: Sekhmet looks off into the distance and thinks for a moment.

123541022.content: Humans are impressive, in their way. When faced with disaster, there's always someone amongst them who's capable of making the right choices.

123541023.content: And I think they have the right to do that. To make the choice.

123541026.content: Sekhmet has leaned back against the wall and closed her eyes. How does she manage to fall asleep during a conversation like that?

123541027.content: Oh, one more thing. We had to request some mission funding from CORG, so we put it under your name. Don't forget to sign off on it when you get a chance.

123541028.content: Sekhmet opens her eyes again and checks her terminal, scrolling through all the notifications she hasn't had time to read.

123541029.content: How much did you guys spend? I hope it was worth the bawling out I just got.

123541030.content: I'll let you get your beauty sleep. I can see you need it.

123541031.content: Kuninotokotachi turns and leaves, a smirk on her face.

123541032.content: Shu gives a quiet sigh as Kuninotokotachi finishes making her report.

123541034.content: No major cause for concern, and doing much better than I might have expected. It's just... mourning a friend is going to take time.

123541035.content: Of course. Kuninotokotachi, you take charge of the handover for now. Judging by the intel we have available at the moment, the crisis in Sasanami is far from over. We're going to need to keep working with CORG.

123541036.content: I've discussed this with CORG. Admin will continue to act as mission commander. A mission update will be sent to your terminals.

123541038.content: Also, I'll do everything I can to ensure CORG helps rebuild Shimogyou and implements Lady Akishika's last wishes. Pass that on too.

123541039.content: Yeah. It's the least we can do.

123541040.content: It's been a long time since I last saw Izuru Masayoshi. He's looking much older. After a long silence, he speaks.

123541041.content: I should have seen this coming. But I couldn't have stopped her, any more than you could.

123541042.content: I've instructed my guard to ensure her possessions are properly taken care of.

123541043.content: But you aren't here for that. Something about your mission?

123541044.content: I mull my words over for a while before speaking.

123541045.content: Prime Lord, sir. Himiko told me that you gave her your backing, in secret, for her rebellion against her family. So you knew the truth of the Deer God?

123541047.content: I always thought the deities of Sasanami were no more than legends, until what happened with the Miyahebi... And then I used my status as head of the Izuru family to consult some long-forbidden writings and discovered that things were not as simple as I had assumed.

123541048.content: Subsequently, I may have ignored some of your warnings and continued to investigate in secret. And that was when I learned a few things about the Deer God.

123541049.content: Himiko was an outstanding young woman. I did not wish to see her repeat Syuu's mistakes. But I never imagined fate would be so cruel...

123541050.content: I see... These matters are highly confidential. The Quake Damage Control Department has special measures to handle them. I hope you can understand.

123541051.content: The Sasanami authorities will accept any measures covered by our Cross-Regional Treaty.

123541052.content: There is something else I would like to show you. Something I hope will aid your investigation.

123541054.content: Izuru Masayoshi places an exquisitely made transparent container on the desk.

123541055.content: My soldiers found this amongst her things. The craftsmanship is quite unique and, unless I am not mistaken, must originate with the Karasugo.

123541057.content: When Himiko overthrew the heads of her family, I personally arranged exile for them, in a remote location.

123541058.content: But, as we know, they secretly returned to Shimogyou. Only the Karasugo, who have control of the smuggling routes, could have arranged such a thing.

123541060.content: There is a conspiracy afoot, across all Sasanami, involving our five deities. And someone is working in the shadows to keep that conspiracy alive.

123541061.content: As the Prime Lord it is my duty to get to the bottom of this, in order to ensure the safety of Sasanami. But I cannot touch the Karasugo.

123541063.content: Izuru Masayoshi's tone suddenly becomes grave.

123541064.content: The second daughter of the last Lord Karasugo is today Child of Heaven.

123541066.content: The Child of Heaven is the basis for harmony between the Sasanami Five. The pillar on which the safety of Sasanami rests. I cannot disturb that.

123541067.content: And so... I very much hope we can work together again.

123541068.content: Do not worry, Prime Lord. We still have work to do here in Sasanami.

123541069.content: I clench my fists. Yes, I still have things to do here. Important things.

123541070.content: Order has been restored to the streets, and apart from the towering city wall in the distance, all seems more or less back to normal in Shimogyou.

123541071.content: I found her, Admin. Took me a while to track her down, though.

123541073.content: Absolutely fine—from the outside. Our troublemaker wandered off first thing this morning without saying a word. Says she's okay, but she's fooling herself.

123541074.content: I wouldn't worry too much. She's tough. She can look after herself.

123541075.content: I know. But I've got a few things I need to tell her.

123541076.content: Ah, private business, huh? Anyway, I had to ask an old friend to lead the way for us...

123541077.content: I look in the direction she's pointing and see Kiwamikawa Fujio lounging on a streetside bench. He's covered in wounds. It's clear he didn't come willingly.

123541079.content: Don't blame the lady. In my line of work, you've got to take the rough with the smooth. Last time I got one over on you. This time, you're getting one over on me. It's all in the game.

123541080.content: Anyway, a few of my men spotted her while they were out for a stroll. I'll show you.

123541082.content: What am I, some kind of money-grubbing miser? Some things you don't charge for. How about we consider this a free gift, as a token of gratitude for your earlier purchases.

123541083.content: In the busy city streets, Kuramitsuha has found a quiet corner to be in. She's still persona non grata with the locals, and now there's even fewer people willing to be with her.

123541084.content: I watch from afar. It's like a painting, but a painting that's missing something.

123541085.content: Kuninotokotachi stops. She knows I need to go on alone.

123541086.content: I knew you'd come looking for me.

123541087.content: It seemed like you knew what Himiko was going to do.

123541088.content: Yeah. She told me three months ago. I watched her follow through on that decision, step by step. And when it was time for me to decide to let her do it or not... what right would I have had to stop her?

123541089.content: Maybe it's what Gaea intended for me. To be here, alone. Friendless.

123541090.content: You'll have friends. You already do.

123541091.content: She doesn't say anything. She just looks at me, as if that's something she's long wanted to hear, but doesn't dare to admit it.

123541092.content: Strictly speaking, I never replied to your invitation, Ninkyoumon. Perhaps because at the time I hadn't found my courage.

123541093.content: I clench my fists, trying to cling on to Himiko's parting gift.

123541094.content: Ninkyoumon, if you met another human who was determined to save the world... would you be their friend?

123541095.content: Again, she doesn't reply for a long time, until it seems she acknowledges something held deep within her heart, something which allows her to answer.

123541096.content: I would. I would never have been friends with Himiko if she wasn't that kind of person...

123541097.content: I won't say no if I meet someone like her!

123541098.content: We share a knowing smile. There's no more to say. Kuramitsuha's fireworks continue to fly skywards. It's not the season for fireworks, and they're not even that impressive. But she keeps setting them off.

1105501002.content: The Sasanami observation tower construction project cannot be delayed! Our people are already on their way. We ask for your cooperation in this matter!

1105501003.content: It's CORG's unauthorized operations that are holding up our work!

1105501004.content: Grow a spine! Those crooks won't buy that!

1105501005.content: Please! Do you know what those "simple, honest people" will do to you?

1105501007.content: This debate has already gone on for seven hours. I bury my face in my hands, overcome at last by exhaustion.

1105501008.content: (Yawn) It's the perfect time for a scenic getaway, and we're stuck in this little room listening to them go on and on...

1105501010.content: An alert tone sounds from the comms terminal like a spirit from beyond the grave. Looking at the 70-page meeting minutes sent from HQ, I let out a long sigh.

1105501011.content: Aw, chin up, Admin. You've got me here to stick this out with you. I'd say that shows more professionalism than a certain lazybones who gave us the slip this morning.

1105501012.content: True, though I never expected Sekhmet to join us.

1105501013.content: Just as I mention her name, a communication request from Sekhmet comes through on the comms terminal.

1105501015.content: Sekhmet shrugs and turns the comms screen to one side.

1105501016.content: A few CORG employees are gathered around a vehicle. Next to them, a girl in handcuffs with tape over her mouth twists and struggles.

1105501017.content: You'd better get here in the next five minutes.

1105501018.content: Seeing Sekhmet's stony face in the distance, I walk up to her and ask what's going on.

1105501019.content: What happened? If I didn't know any better, I'd think you were a kidnapper.

1105501021.content: I've identified the cause. Someone tampered with the vehicle's energy tank in the hopes of stealing and selling its contents.

1105501022.content: Sekhmet casts a cold glance at the thief in custody. I instantly understand the situation.

1105501024.content: This is the shared property of Aether Gazer and CORG. It's up to you to administrate, Administrator.

1105501026.content: But I suggest you think about why our superiors have been locking horns for the last seven hours. Making an example of the thief won't get the observation tower built.

1105501027.content: Well then, did those seven hours give you any brilliant ideas?

1105501028.content: It's a local matter. It should be left to the people of Sasanami.

1105501029.content: You think the Akishika will handle this mess?

1105501030.content: There's one person who might be able to.

1105501031.content: Provided that you leave the girl to me.

1105501032.content: Ignoring Sekhmet's frown, I approach the girl huddled in the corner like a small animal and tear the tape from her face.

1105501036.content: Don't worry, I'm not gonna hurt you. If you agree to do something for me, I'll let you go.

1105501037.content: What do you want me to do...?

1105501039.content: Ten minutes later, she's brought me to a clean-looking building.

1105501040.content: The Akishika game parlor... Never been here before.

1105501041.content: It's not a big place by any means. Checking each room, I quickly find that cavalier figure, her hands clasped around the back of her neck.

1105501044.content: The girl answers me listlessly. Then, seeing me and the girl beside me, she quickly straightens up.

1105501046.content: The timid girl ducks behind Kuramitsuha as if her life depends on it.

1105501047.content: What do you want, Aether Gazer...?

1105501048.content: That little girl stole something from me, so I came to find you.

1105501049.content: Kuramitsuha looks at the trembling girl. She pats her gently on the head, then looks back at me with that cynical expression.

1105501050.content: I see... Then please accept my apologies. Her name's Takada Asaki, and she's my assistant. Her eyesight's not great.

1105501052.content: Anyway, you'll be compensated in full.

1105501053.content: Do me a favor, Aether Gazer. Leave her out of it. I'll make it up to you on her behalf...

1105501054.content: Kuramitsuha reaches into her pocket, but it's obvious from her nonchalant movements that she's short on cash. All she can do is somewhat awkwardly turn her head away from me.

1105501055.content: I'm sorry, big sis... I'm really sorry...

1105501056.content: I came here looking for you, Kuramitsuha.

1105501057.content: Asaki, this is Himiko's honored guest. And a friend of mine.

1105501058.content: Kuramitsuha passes Asaki a cup of water and pats her head again.

1105501059.content: Don't steal from my friend next time, okay?

1105501063.content: Heh... I thought I'd have to stoop to stealing to repay you.

1105501065.content: Still, you shouldn't be teaching your followers to do that sort of thing.

1105501066.content: You were lucky it was me and not one of those thugs today. If they'd caught her, I doubt they would have let it slide.

1105501067.content: Maybe that's because you're easier to mess with... Hehe.

1105501068.content: Hey... Are you even listening to me?

1105501069.content: I am, I am... So, what did you want to see me about, Aether Gazer?

1105501072.content: I want you to join me for a meal.

1105501075.content: Kuramitsuha opens up her empty bag, giving it a few pats.

1105501076.content: Let me guess—You lost it all to those hustlers downstairs?

1105501077.content: Beats me! I swear it was full just a minute ago.

1105501078.content: I lost it all playing renju with those little stinkers.

1105501079.content: Maybe Asaki went after you to help get me some lunch money.

1105501080.content: Then it's a good thing she's a poor study, or I'd be in the same boat as you—"flat broke."

1105501082.content: Come on, let's go. You can pick the place.

1105501083.content: You know, in Shimogyou, treating someone to a meal after their underling robs you is a sign of weakness.

1105501084.content: In a street-side restaurant in Sasanami, Kuramitsuha pushes two plates of chilled meats to the side and sizes me up curiously.

1105501085.content: I can call you "boss" if you like. Also, what are you doing pushing those plates so far away? Do you not like cold food?

1105501087.content: Then why did you order these?

1105501088.content: How do I put this... I guess I figured you might like that sort of thing.

1105501089.content: We're in Sasanami. It'd be a shame to miss out on the local cuisine.

1105501090.content: I'm not missing out on anything, trust me... It's all cold and slimy... Ugh...

1105501091.content: Kuramitsuha waves off my comment, shaking her head.

1105501092.content: Have this instead then. You okay with spicy food?

1105501093.content: I push my bowl of spicy ramen over to her, then order another for myself.

1105501094.content: Hehe, okay. I'll help myself then, Aether Gazer.

1105501095.content: About that... I've been meaning to say, why don't you just call me #{nickname}#?

1105501097.content: Then how about I call you "Mitsy?"

1105501099.content: What should I call you then?

1105501101.content: I was kidding. Are you serious?!

1105501102.content: Why wouldn't I be? Unlike you, I don't have someone up top taking care of everything for me.

1105501103.content: ...You're not backing out of our arrangement, are you?

1105501105.content: Haha, I'm just messing with you. As long as it isn't some cringy nickname, you can call me whatever you'd like.

1105501106.content: Still, going back on your word is a big no-no...

1105502001.content: ...I'm not sure if I've ever gone back on my word before.

1105502002.content: The images of people who have gone through fire and water for their promises enter my mind—women holding long knives and swords...

1105502003.content: You won't make any friends being bashful. What's the problem?

1105502004.content: If you wanna prove that you're not a two-faced liar, why don't you ask your boss here to lend you an ear?

1105502005.content: Alright, I'll tell you. Can you help me figure out what to do... boss?

1105502007.content: I run her through CORG's plan to construct an observation tower in Sasanami.

1105502008.content: Huh? Why are you guys going to all this trouble to help those good-for-nothings and chumps?

1105502009.content: Well... it's not like you're out of options. The simplest would be for me to crush them all.

1105502010.content: That sounds like a suggestion a mobster would make...

1105502011.content: Violence is the only language some people understand. I'm not in the business of peaceful solutions.

1105502012.content: Oh my, don't tell me you're a herbivore, Aether Gazer? Hehe, no wonder you're trying to persuade them "gently..."

1105502013.content: ...You're right, I won't be able to solve this problem that way.

1105502014.content: See? Filth breeds flies. Your good will would be wasted on them.

1105502015.content: Perhaps my only recourse is to rely on the Great Ninkyoumon's expertise in human nature.

1105502017.content: I actually think you're quite the expert on human nature yourself, #{nickname}#.

1105502019.content: Well, you get me, at least. Hehe.

1105502020.content: Anyway, since you hold me in such high regard, #{nickname}#, I can't very well refuse you.

1105502021.content: However, understanding "human nature" and understanding "humanity" are two different things. So, I have one condition.

1105502023.content: You'll serve as my observation subject. Think of it as a temporary remedial class for me. What do you think?

1105502024.content: Kuramitsuha plans to convene the troublemakers in a few days. After taking me to say hello to Himiko, she has me stay in the Akishika game parlor.

1105502025.content: As night falls over Shimogyou, the city begins to stir. One after another, high rollers enter the game parlor to play fast and loose with their money.

1105502026.content: The smell of tobacco and alcohol fills the air of the dimly lit Shimogyou District. I walk through the lobby and make my way over to Kuramitsuha.

1105502027.content: Slacking on the job again, Mitsy?

1105502028.content: Huh? No, I'm not. I'm observing humanity.

1105502029.content: Besides, what's wrong with slacking off, #{nickname}#? Relax, live a little.

1105502030.content: You're right, you're right... The boss deserves a break now and then.

1105502031.content: Hey now, you're not calling me "boss" just because you want my help, are you?

1105502032.content: You get what I asked for?

1105502033.content: Here you are, your hot fruit juice.

1105502035.content: Every so often, a cheer or wail comes from the crowds behind us, the frenzy filling the air.

1105502036.content: But for the moment, this frenzy has nothing to do with Kuramitsuha and me.

1105502037.content: Kuramitsuha's eyes narrow as she chews on her straw.

1105502038.content: What...? Why are you staring at me like that?

1105502039.content: Nothing, I was just thinking that the boss looks kinda sweet sipping on her juice... like a little kid.

1105502041.content: Choking on her juice, Kuramitsuha stands up and asks me for a tissue.

1105502043.content: A man suddenly interjects into our conversation. He approaches us and hands us a few bills.

1105502044.content: Kuramitsuha lazily extends a hand to accept the money, then points in a direction. The man then blearily shuffles off.

1105502045.content: Noting a slight bulge in the man's cuffs, I frown.

1105502046.content: Mahjong! Riichi, one-shot, red dragon triplet, haneman.

1105502047.content: Mahjong! Riichi, all simples, no-points hand, one-point dora, mangan. Haha!

1105502048.content: The two gamblers' victory choruses continue to sound in rapid succession. Anyone can see that they're co-conspirators.

1105502049.content: Looks like someone's not playing by the rules of your game.

1105502052.content: Not my concern then. Just don't end up like them yourself, #{nickname}#.

1105502054.content: Looking up at a room on the second floor, Kuramitsuha grumbles and waves her hand dismissively.

1105502055.content: That reminds me, Asaki's here today too. I think she has something for you, wanna go see her together?

1105502056.content: If it's to make up for what happened before, there's really no need...

1105502059.content: What do you take my underling for?

1105502060.content: ...She's probably afraid of me. She might even see me as one of those thugs...

1105502061.content: A dense one, maybe. Come on, let's go!

1105502063.content: And just like that, Kuramitsuha shoves me into Asaki's room.

1105502065.content: What are you so nervous about, #{nickname}#? She's the one who started it.

1105502066.content: Well... if anything else happens, wouldn't it make things difficult for you?

1105502067.content: What are you talking about? The boss will resolve any conflicts that arise between her subordinates.

1105502069.content: Asaki hands me a small box. I open it. Inside is a king shogi piece with a fallen petal hanging from it.

1105502071.content: We all have them, big sis too. It's how we contact each other.

1105502072.content: Asaki shows me her own pawn shogi brooch.

1105502073.content: I see. You're a smart cookie, Asaki.

1105502074.content: Big sis taught me... She said it's how a lot of the grownups who play cards can tell who their people are...

1105502076.content: It's okay... It really wasn't a big deal.

1105502077.content: Alright! We're all friends now, got it?

1105502078.content: Isn't the brooch my underling made pretty, #{nickname}#?

1105502079.content: Kuramitsuha pats both our heads nonchalantly.

1105502080.content: Tch, why do I feel like I'm being treated like a little kid now...

1105502081.content: Alright then, now it's time for your remedial class. Asaki, bring me the mahjong set.

1105502082.content: Huh? Remedial class? Me? ...Did you say mahjong?

1105502083.content: Don't act so surprised, no better place to get to a crook than at the gambling table! And how are you gonna do that without even knowing how to play mahjong?

1105502084.content: Or do you think you're some sort of mahjong whiz, #{nickname}#?

1105502085.content: I think that only happens in comics...

1105502086.content: Fair enough. Teach away, Miss Mitsy.

1105502087.content: That's more like it. We'll start with the rules of the game.

1105502088.content: In mahjong, the first round is called East 1. The dealer position rotates counterclockwise each round, starting with the player in the eastern seat at the mahjong table. The dealer collects and pays out 1.5 times the chips. If the dealer can't serve as dealer again by the end, the game enters East 2, East 3, and East 4. These four rounds are called East rounds. Likewise, there are also South rounds, West rounds, and so on.

1105502089.content: The process beginning with the dealer and continuing until the next time the dealer plays a hand is called a rotation. There's also an early rotation, middle rotation, and late rotation based on the progress of the wait patterns. Gamblers call the mahjong chips "tembo." Each player starts out with 25,000 points, and the game ends when you lose them all.

1105502091.content: What's the matter, #{nickname}#? Not feeling well?

1105502092.content: Yeah, I didn't get much rest yesterday... Could I be excused for the afternoon?

1105502093.content: Pretending to be unwell, I make my move to leave.

1105502094.content: Let me take a look at you.

1105502097.content: Ow ow ow ow, let go of my ear!

1105502098.content: I'm seeing if I can rip it off.

1105502100.content: Stop it, please! It really hurts!

1105502101.content: Aw, I'm sorry. All better now?

1105502104.content: In the end, I only managed to learn the basic rules and the Tanyao hand that afternoon.

1105502105.content: You're the worst student I've ever had, #{nickname}#!

1105503001.content: There's always a restlessness in the air come morning in Shimogyou. What's making me feel restless isn't the sweltering heat, however, but the pressure of work and the gathering crowds.

1105503002.content: That and the pack of nasty-tempered, smack-talking hooligans that Kuramitsuha called to the parlor.

1105503003.content: Cutting a gallant figure, she shoots me a glance—our show is about to begin.

1105503004.content: The Akishika have gathered you all here today to make an important announcement...

1105503005.content: An announcement? You're holdin' up our games for this?

1105503006.content: Doing my best ruffian impression, I make a show of looking impatient.

1105503007.content: Kuramitsuha gives me a cold stare, as if she's about to lose her cool.

1105503008.content: An outsider from CORG wants me to get your thoughts on constructing an observation tower in your territory.

1105503009.content: CORG? Isn't that some kinda dog? And what observation tower? We need that like we need a hole in our heads!

1105503010.content: Ha! Who d'ya think ya are, kid? Comin' in here and askin' that...

1105503011.content: Heh, I'm sure you've all heard some of the rumors from Shimogyou.

1105503012.content: When things go south and you all get fed to the pigs, don't say I didn't warn you.

1105503013.content: That reminds me, you should all get a payout by then—unless you don't cooperate, that is.

1105503015.content: Just as he's about to fly off the handle, someone next to him holds him back by his clothing.

1105503017.content: Hehehe... Never look a gift horse in the mouth, right? Y'can have yer beef with CORG, but leave the money out of it.

1105503018.content: Get to the point—the payout! How much we talkin' here? You don't plan on keepin' it all for yourself, do ya?

1105503020.content: That's right! If you're offerin', how're you gonna guarantee we're all square?

1105503021.content: I could suggest everyone start beating each other's heads in, and the last one standing walks away with everything...

1105503023.content: Heh... You say you won't take it all for yourself, but what's to stop ya from swoopin' in and takin' it when the brawl's over?

1105503024.content: Good, now you know what CORG had in mind.

1105503025.content: Now that we're all clear on how a battle royale would turn out, I'll give it to you straight.

1105503026.content: Here's how it's gonna go... After the East round, winner gets 70 percent, runner-up gets 30 percent.

1105503027.content: Kuramitsuha sits in the east seat. Clasping her hands behind her head, she looks around the room defiantly.

1105503029.content: You think this is funny? This is your home turf, and the runner-up only gets 30 (Bleep!) percent?

1105503030.content: Hehehe... 30 percent's a little low. In the end, won't you still just...

1105503031.content: Guys, don't listen to her! She's...

1105503032.content: The crowd erupts into chaos. Kuramitsuha laughs coldly, then suddenly rises.

1105503033.content: Before I can make out what's going on, she has the hustler's hand pressed firmly against the mahjong table.

1105503034.content: Out of nowhere, a dagger has appeared in Kuramitsuha's hand. She flings its sheath from between her teeth.

1105503036.content: You don't wanna test my patience. I repeat: winner gets 70 percent, runner-up gets 30.

1105503037.content: The blade's edge glints coldly just inches from the hustler's wrist. Kuramitsuha's frigid gaze sweeps over the room.

1105503038.content: Sensing the danger, everyone is perfectly silent.

1105503043.content: Remembering that they were just discussing how to divvy up the profits, the crowd erupts once again, all vying for a seat at the table.

1105503044.content: Kuramitsuha watches them with a smirk on her face, as if they were a bunch of clowns. She then turns to me, looking pleased with herself.

1105503045.content: See, #{nickname}#? The infighting's started all by itself.

1105503047.content: Finally, the rights to this game of dividends go to a beanpole named Yokoyama Shinnosuke and a butterball called Nakamura Hayato.

1105503049.content: My hand isn't great, I don't have any pairs or sequences. But there's no rush to get on the offensive in this round.

1105503051.content: After a few rotations, the beanpole to my right has grouped his tiles. Discarding an Eight of Bamboo, he declares his imminent winning set.

1105503052.content: My assistant's mentioned you before, Yokoyama Shinnosuke. In the parlor, you go by "Wind of Fortune."

1105503053.content: Judging from your purse, you've had some luck today, haven't you?

1105503055.content: Fearing whatever trick Kuramitsuha could be up to, Yokoyama Shinnosuke presses her to play her hand.

1105503056.content: Alright, alright. Hm... discarding this Six Man... shouldn't give anyone a winning hand.

1105503057.content: Mahjong! Riichi, one-shot, all simples, no-points hand, max-points mangan!

1105503059.content: Kuramitsuha doesn't seem the least bit concerned about giving her opponent an 8,000-point win.

1105503060.content: I thought the beanpole was just lucky, but by East 2, even I start to suspect something.

1105503061.content: When Yokoyama Shinnosuke declares Riichi, he quickly snatches up the tile. I zero in on his strange movements.

1105503062.content: Noticing this quirk, I quickly shoot Kuramitsuha a glance after focusing on defending and stalling his victory. But she just leans back in her chair, signaling for me not to worry.

1105503063.content: Ah... Doesn't seem like I'm having any luck.

1105503064.content: The second round ends, and my luck doesn't improve in the slightest. All I can do is place my hope in Kuramitsuha. She steadily taps a tile against the table, her cheek resting on her hand.

1105503065.content: Tch... Knock it off! You tryna gimme a headache or somethin'?!

1105503066.content: What happened to all that big talk from earlier? You finally seein' which way the wind's blowin'?

1105503067.content: Hey, hey, hey. Don't get all feisty with me now. The winner gets 70 percent, remember?

1105503068.content: In other words, if I stay in fourth, there'll be a 40 percent difference between you and "Wind of Fortune" here.

1105503069.content: The point difference isn't that big. Could be anyone's game at this stage.

1105503070.content: It never ends well for the guy who says somethin' like that at the table.

1105503071.content: Nakamura Hayato—or should I say "King of the Scales"—you didn't really enter my domain today just to play it coy?

1105503072.content: Heh... Big talk for somebody comin' in dead last...

1105503073.content: Between quips, Yokoyama plays a relatively safe West Wind.

1105503074.content: Mahjong. West Wind one-point dora, 2,900 points.

1105503076.content: Stunned, Yokoyama stares incredulously at the tile.

1105503077.content: S... Seriously, you pig? A West Wind pair wait?

1105503078.content: Come on, bro. It's East 3 now, just lemme have second place, okay?

1105503080.content: Nakamura looks at Yokoyama and gives him a smug grin.

1105503081.content: Maybe giving Nakamura a win with his discard threw Yokoyama off his game, because he has nothing to declare when East 3 starts.

1105503082.content: Taking over Yokoyama's winning streak with five repeat deals, Nakamura racks up several wins in a row, raking in everyone's tembo like a whale to krill. Everything seems to be coming up Nakamura now.

1105503084.content: *Sasanami Slang*, winning with such a trash hand...

1105503085.content: I finally end Nakamura's repeat dealer advantage with a modest 1,000-point win, but Kuramitsuha still looks as unconcerned as ever.

1105503086.content: She eats a daifuku while playing with her tiles, getting powdered sugar everywhere much to the disdain of onlookers.

1105503087.content: By the late rotation of East 4, Nakamura is in first with 62,300 points, I'm in second thanks to the slight advantage my Tanyao won me with 18,000 points, and Yokoyama is in third with 17,000 points.

1105503088.content: At the greatest disadvantage is Kuramitsuha, whose tembo add up to a measly 2,700 points.

1105503089.content: This is the best humanity can do, huh...?

1105503090.content: Heh, even a 2,700-point fish like you can sucker people into feelin' sorry for ya sometimes.

1105503091.content: Maybe you misunderstood me—Is this the best you two can do?

1105503092.content: Huh? Drop the act and the play already.

1105503093.content: You, "Wind of Fortune," are just a sad sack that relies on tile-swapping to play. But just tapping a tile on the table makes you break...

1105503094.content: And you, "King of the Scales"—you were just able to hold your own against me with a few tricks until a little daifuku sugar blinded you.

1105503095.content: Have you been looking at the backs of the tiles so much that you can't even see what's on the front? You dealt right into a winning hand with that Tanyao of yours...

1105503096.content: ...Unlike you two, my opponent really knows which way the wind's blowing.

1105503097.content: I'm bored. Come on, let's finish this.

1105503098.content: Sensing the danger in Kuramitsuha's words, Nakamura purses his lips together. Cautiously, he plays a White Dragon tile already played by the rest of us.

1105503100.content: Kuramitsuha sneers, cavalierly pushes away her hand, and gets up to leave, as if she'd never been on the ropes in the first place.

1105503101.content: Yokoyama and Nakamura's eyes open wide. Before they can even recover from the shock of having their tricks exposed, they see something that turns their world upside-down.

1105503103.content: Later, Kuramitsuha and I head to a restaurant in Shimogyou for a hot meal.

1105503104.content: Two pork ball skewers in hand, Kuramitsuha walks home beside me looking perfectly contented.

1105503105.content: Mitsy... You won, so how come I had to pay for the food?

1105503106.content: Hey, don't take me for some old sleazebag who invites all their goons to eat on their dime after winning a little cash.

1105503107.content: Surely being that stingy after a big win makes you worse than some old sleazebag.

1105503108.content: Kuramitsuha puffs out her cheeks and claps me heavily on the shoulder.

1105503109.content: Is that so... Well, eating with me is a rare honor. Besides, I was the one doing you a favor today.

1105503111.content: Hehe. Did you think we were done for by East 4, #{nickname}#?

1105503112.content: I never thought you'd manage a Thirteen Orphans at that point. How did you pull it off?

1105503113.content: ...Oh, that. I did it right under their noses, and they were none the wiser.

1105503114.content: Why? You wanna learn too, #{nickname}#? I could teach you...

1105503116.content: Anyway, treating me to a meal is a fair price, don't you think?

1105503118.content: Speaking of payment, Kuninotokotachi said that all five Sasanami families have asked you for help before... I'm a little curious as to how they paid you.

1105503119.content: Boxes filled with little blue crystal flowers.

1105503121.content: I'm kidding. All those guys ever talk about is stuff like "family" and "responsibility." They're no fun at all. I have no interest in helping them.

1105503122.content: The only people I've sincerely helped are you and Himiko.

1105503124.content: Of course, and you're pretty interesting for a human too... Ah... Ah-choo!

1105503125.content: You okay? You catch a cold?

1105503126.content: Nah, I'm just a little chilly. The wind in Shimogyou at night... is a little... Ah-CHOO!

1105503129.content: It's fine, really. I don't mind the cold. Here.

1105503130.content: O-Okay... So, #{nickname}#, are you gonna stay in the parlor a few more days?

1105503131.content: Things might be settled for the moment, but don't you think those guys will come looking for trouble?

1105503132.content: I could keep you safe for a while.

1105504001.content: On my last half-day of vacation before reporting back for duty, I decide to make some time to hang out with Miss Ninkyoumon.

1105504003.content: No... A double pawn checkmate is an illegal move in shogi. If anything, you lose, Mitsy.

1105504005.content: Who knew that Miss Ninkyoumon could be such a sore loser...

1105504010.content: Kuramitsuha suddenly stomps on my foot, making me cry out in pain.

1105504011.content: When I look back at the board, her pawn has mysteriously transformed into a dragon king.

1105504013.content: Who keeps nine dragon kings on them?!

1105504014.content: Hehe, don't get too caught up in the rules.

1105504015.content: White dragon cards are so rare, there are only four in all of Sasanami, but whoever has them will still bring them to play cards.

1105504018.content: Fine, fine, you win this time. But you still get a flick on the nose.

1105504020.content: I reach out and lightly touch her nose. She chuckles.

1105504021.content: Remembering her prank earlier, I can't help but poke her cheek instead.

1105504022.content: Hey, I never said you could poke my cheek...!

1105504025.content: That reminds me, it's a little noisy out there today... Is something happening?

1105504026.content: I look out the window and see a bustling crowd gathered near the city wall, pointing.

1105504027.content: Lemme think... Right, today's the day CORG completes the observation tower.

1105504029.content: Kuramitsuha seems to be caught a little off guard by this news.

1105504031.content: I see... Then, CORG won't make a show of it at all?

1105504033.content: You know, like fireworks... banners... or a tour or something.

1105504034.content: What do you think it is, a tourist attraction? Who knows what new problems that would stir up...

1105504037.content: I contact Sekhmet and ask for an access card to the observation tower for... final inspection purposes.

1105504038.content: The shiny new elevator carries us up. First the houses shrink, then the trees, until a landscape as far as the horizon stretches out before us.

1105504039.content: The elevator doors open abruptly, bringing a panoramic view of Shimogyou into view.

1105504040.content: A gentle breeze brushes over our faces. Kuramitsuha walks straight up to the railing and lightly hoists herself up on it.

1105504041.content: Careful, Mitsy. You wouldn't want to fall off.

1105504042.content: I know, I know. You coming or what?

1105504043.content: I walk over to her and brace my arms against the railing.

1105504044.content: The light of the golden sun is warm and bright. Tiny raindrops begin to fall from the sky, intermingling with the rays of light.

1105504045.content: It's beautiful! I don't think Shimogyou's ever looked prettier than this.

1105504046.content: But it also makes Shimogyou seem so far away. That doesn't bother you?

1105504047.content: It's fine! You're here with me, aren't you?

1105504048.content: That reminds me, I wanted to ask you something.

1105504049.content: Looking like she's suddenly remembered something, Kuramitsuha turns to face me.

1105504050.content: I can't stand those good-for-nothings in Shimogyou. There's no way I could protect people like that with my life.

1105504051.content: #{nickname}#, do you think that Modifiers... must protect humanity?

1105504052.content: I freeze for a moment, unable to answer at first. I begin to think about why she'd ask that.

1105504053.content: ...When I was in Xu Heng for work, a friend of mine said this:

1105504055.content: I believe in your strength, and that's why I trust you unconditionally.

1105504056.content: For that same reason, Aether Gazer chose Himiko instead of listening to CORG.

1105504057.content: Living free and strong, protecting who you want to protect... There's nothing wrong with that.

1105504058.content: Maybe you'll find humans somewhere in this world that are worthier of your protection.

1105504059.content: I see... If they're as fun as you, #{nickname}#, I'd give protecting them a shot.

1105504060.content: When you finish your business in Sasanami, I'd like to go see Xu Heng and Ain Soph.

1105504061.content: Xu Heng has the chili sauce and hot food you love, and the buildings in Ain Soph are even taller than the ones here. They're both worth visiting.

1105504062.content: In that case, we'll have to go together sometime!

1105504066.content: "What's on the other side of the sea?"

1105504067.content: Kuramitsuha turns to face the other side of the tower, then suddenly turns around and hands the candy apple to me.

1105504071.content: Hahaha, what are you getting all serious for?

1105504072.content: You asked the question... I'm giving a serious answer.

1105504073.content: Nooo, kids in Sasanami all used to ask their parents that question.

1105504074.content: I just thought "I should ask #{nickname}# the question as well", so I did.

1105504075.content: What do you think's over there, Mitsy?

1105504077.content: Promises are like boats at sea—they have an easier time reaching their destinations when the waters are calm.

1105504078.content: But it's much harder when it's stormy. If you're afraid your boat will sink, going to sea doesn't sound so great anymore.

1105504079.content: Still, as long as you can pull yourself back together, you'll be able to sail to the other side someday.

1105504080.content: So, I think the answer is courage.

1105504083.content: Why are we getting so philosophical?

1105504085.content: Whoa, look, #{nickname}#! A fish just jumped out of the water!

1105504087.content: It would be perfect for making seafood fried rice.

1105504088.content: Huh? You mean you were just excited to see food...? Also, wouldn't making sushi out of it make more sense in Sasanami?

1105504089.content: I don't want sushi! I want seafood fried rice! I'm all about cooked food, remember? Salmon's no exception!

1105504093.content: Kuramitsuha kicks up a fuss like a little kid, then suddenly staggers...

1105504096.content: Our arms wrapped around each other without thinking, Kuramitsuha and I stare at each other wide-eyed.

1105504097.content: Whew... L-Looks like your reflexes ain't half bad... I-I'm surprised you managed to catch me... Hehehe...

1105504098.content: Under my feverish scalp, all I can think of are two things: Not to let the girl in my arms fall, and to find a way to change the subject.

1105504099.content: At last, a flash of inspiration. I pull out the access card I borrowed from Sekhmet and hand it to Kuramitsuha.

1105504100.content: Here, take this. Th-Think of it as a gift.

1105504102.content: I'll go liaise with CORG... Wh-While you're still in Shimogyou, if you ever want to take in the view from above, you can come here.

910500002.content: The situation isn't looking good. Heterized beasts are pouring in from all over Madoiyama to launch an attack on Shimogyou.

910500003.content: We'll have to keep them away from the front for as long as we can until our fortifications there are complete.

910500004.content: Lady Akishika has ordered us to remain stationed here pending your instructions. We'll gradually advance from the mountain perimeter to take out the stragglers.

910501001.content: We've finally made contact. How is the operation progressing?

910501002.content: Thanks to #{nickname}#, everything is going according to plan. The fifth squad is advancing the front as we speak.

910501003.content: However, the mountain's complex terrain gives the fiends ample opportunity to ambush us. We've lost contact with the two reinforcement squads the Izuru Family sent.

910501004.content: There was a breach in the area they were stationed in, a horde of beasts could be headed for Shimogyou now.

910501005.content: The front can handle a horde or two breaking through the blockade. I'll dispatch another squad to reinforce it.

910501006.content: The other squad will advance in from the mountain perimeter to take out the stragglers. Please instruct the frontline troops to continue their advance.

910501007.content: Figured you'd have a knack for this, Administrator of Aether Gazer! Keep this up, and the blockade will be good to go.

910501008.content: I've received a report that a horde is rapidly closing in on your location!

910501009.content: It looks like they're planning to assemble for a siege. Under no circumstances can we allow—

910501011.content: The Bane Energy detector's also stopped working! Careful, everyone—we could be in for a tough battle up ahead.

910501012.content: Was that it? I expected more.

910501013.content: Don't let it go to your head, troublemaker. You'd be a goner if Buzenbo hadn't covered us.

910501014.content: I would've figured something out. Maybe if you hadn't gotten in my way, I could've taken that big guy out sooner.

910501015.content: Administrator, the Madoiyama barricade is finished. Let CORG handle its defense.

910501016.content: We're engaging the enemy at the front now, but we need reinforcements ASAP. As per Lady Akishika's orders, I've selected a group of elites from each squad to help you wrap up the next operation.

910501017.content: We can attack from the rear to break up the horde's formation.

910501018.content: There's no time to lose, let's roll out.

910502002.content: Sure we will. Of all the grouchy prisoners I've seen, you could rank in the top five—No, make that three.

910502003.content: Just you wait! Our god has already risen! Your efforts are futile!

910502004.content: Take him back to the camp. Lady Akishika will decide what should be done with him.

910502005.content: Administrator, the Deer God is leading the horde in an attack on the city. Should we go to the front?

910502006.content: I've just received a report that a group of Deer God cultists are now advancing on the city's western defenses. We might be able to flank them.

910502007.content: This will allow Lady Akishika to use the defensive artillery to ease the pressure on the front.

910502008.content: This is it! Launch the offensive!

910502009.content: Everyone, use the cover of the barrage to launch a general attack!

910502011.content: Let's show this so-called "god" what humanity is made of.

910502014.content: Do you have any idea what you scum have done?

910502015.content: I have ended something that should have ended long ago. Your god is defeated.

910502017.content: Impossible! How could a god fall to these simple-minded blasphemers?!

910502018.content: There was never any "god." Humanity's future has always been in our own hands.

910502019.content: It's over, the final Night Parade of the Beasts!

910502020.content: Defy a god? How foolish can you be, Himiko?

910502021.content: See how humans act when faced with the power of a god. How cowardly and small they are.

910502022.content: Damn it, is there no way to defeat the Deer God once and for all?

910502023.content: The battle isn't over yet, Administrator. There's still a way we can win.

910502024.content: I want you to take your squad, and Mitsy. Fight the Deer God head-on and buy me the time I need.

910502025.content: What started as a tiny flame is now a raging wildfire. It consumes the giant form of the Deer God, which collapses and soon every heterized beast in Shimogyou is caught in that furious fire and burned.

910502026.content: (Cough!) It's odd. I can feel my senses fading out...

910502027.content: I can't see anything, I think. I can hear a little.

910502030.content: Then I won our race. I saved the world first.

910303001.content: Ookuninushi is looking for me, so I proceed in the direction of the place marked on the map...

910303002.content: Is this the rendezvous point? Is this... a restaurant?

910303003.content: There you are. Let's head in.

910303004.content: Alright. Come to think of it, it seems unusual that you want to meet outside the office.

910303005.content: That should tell you how important the matter we have to discuss is.

910303006.content: But before we get down to business... What do you think of this place, Admin?

910303007.content: That's a pretty broad question, I'm not sure how to answer. At a glance, it looks like a restaurant well-located. The decor is pretty impressive, too. I'm guessing this place is popular.

910303008.content: Correct. This is a prime location to open a restaurant.

910303009.content: The decor is courtesy of our newest business partner,Tian Lu Traders. I'm rather pleased with the results myself.

910303010.content: It's in this prime location and environment... that the Cryptics plan to open a restaurant.

910303011.content: The Cryptics? Open a restaurant? Why? Wait... Don't tell me you plan on running some shady experiment here?

910303012.content: Not at all. I think it'll be a great way to raise research funds.

910303013.content: Shu is in charge of the Cryptics' budget, and you know how... austere she can be. So, I plan to run my own restaurant to pad out the budget.

910303015.content: Now for the important matter: Frankly, there's not enough of us in the Cryptics to manage everything by ourselves.

910303016.content: If you could help with the groceries and a few other tasks, that would be great... Of course, it might be difficult to do it all by yourself, so you could invite others to help you.

910303017.content: So... You want me to find people to run errands for you...

910303018.content: Well, it doesn't sound great when you say it like that... But yes, that's the gist.

910303019.content: Still, I'm sure you understand our predicament. I'll pay you for your troubles, of course. So, will you help?

910303020.content: ...Heh. I guess I don't have much of a choice.

910303021.content: Don't worry about paying me. I'll help you out... if you give me a permanent discount at this place.

910303022.content: Oh! Of course, have whatever you'd like on the house!

910303023.content: Alright, I'm counting on you, then.

910303024.content: And that's how we began running a restaurant together.

317011001.content: It was getting late. Izuru Masayoshi put down the official document he'd been looking at for a long time and went to the courtyard alone, hoping that the cool night breeze would help dispel his drowsiness.

317011002.content: However, he soon noticed something odd. All the Izuru guards who were supposed to be around the courtyard had disappeared, replaced by watchful eyes lurking in the shadows.

317011003.content: My Lord Karasugo, may I have the pleasure of your company?

317011004.content: A tall young man calmly emerged from the darkness and met Izuru Masayoshi's scrutinizing gaze head-on.

317011006.content: I wish I'd known you were visiting, Lord Karasugo. I'd have made the appropriate arrangements for you.

317011007.content: Let's not waste any time, sir. I'm aware that the Izuru guards conduct regular patrols, so I only have about a quarter of an hour before I'm discovered.

317011008.content: ...CORG has already summoned you. There must be a reason you've come to me in secret instead of accepting the investigation.

317011009.content: I'd advise you to think carefully before you act.

317011010.content: Think? I don't have time for that anymore.

317011011.content: I hope you can speak with CORG on my behalf, Prime Lord. I hope you can persuade them to call off the investigation into the Karasugo family.

317011012.content: I have no sway over CORG's decisions. Besides, this matter concerns the security of Sasanami.

317011013.content: It is precisely for the sake of Sasanami's security that the investigation must be stopped immediately!

317011014.content: The shadows around the two men started to close in, as if prompted by Karasugo Sendou's heightened emotions. They only stopped after Karasugo Sendou gestured at them.

317011015.content: I don't understand what you're trying to say... If you're facing some sort of problem, tell CORG. You can't possibly expect me to side with you just like that.

317011016.content: A flash of coldness appeared in Karasugo Sendou's eyes at Izuru Masayoshi's rejection.

317011017.content: So that's it. The Sanzaru, the Miyahebi, the Akishika... and now the Karasugo?

317011019.content: Even if I can't resolve the problem today, at least...

317011020.content: Karasugo Sendou finally gave the signal, and a dozen warriors who had been hiding in the dark suddenly rushed out, long swords in hands.

317011021.content: However, no sooner had they moved in on Izuru were they forced back by a wall of bullets. Karasugo Sendou, standing at the front, was shot immediately and fell to the ground. Two of his followers helped him back to his feet.

317011024.content: Karasugo Sendou's subordinates dragged him away, vanishing into the night.
