317011025.content: Izuru Masayoshi glanced at the alarm that was disguised as a bracelet on his wrist and breathed a sigh of relief. The bracelet was a secret security measure he'd adopted after the events at the Miyahebi compound.

317011027.content: There's no need to chase them. And don't breathe a word about what just happened to anyone. CORG doesn't need to hear about this.

317011029.content: Izuru Masayoshi looked in the direction Karasugo Sendou had fled, silent.

317011030.content: A distinct chill hung in the night air. Another long game of tag was at last coming to an end.

317011031.content: The loud clanging of weapons could be heard on the evening breeze once more, and this time, the two sides finally came face to face with each other.

317011032.content: You've got nowhere left to go now... So why are you keeping up this pointless fight?

317011033.content: Don't play dumb with me. You're a Modifier too, aren't you? What is the real reason you've been moving amongst the five families in secret like this?

317011034.content: Believe me, the less you know, the safer it is for the world outside.

317011036.content: Tsukuyomi very quickly caught on to what Kagutsuchi was implying. She looked around, her eyes growing keener by the second.

317011037.content: If I remember correctly, this place is inside the Karasugo mansion... The Karasugo have always been very private, and they never entertain outsiders. Just what is hidden deep within this mansion?

317011038.content: Looks like I'm just one step away from uncovering your plot!

317011039.content: And it's come to this way anyway... With all due respect, your investigation ends here.

317011040.content: Kagutsuchi suddenly tightened his grip on his blade and stepped in front of Tsukuyomi.

317011041.content: What's the point of keeping these things hidden?

317011042.content: The Karasugo family has a Crow God too, doesn't it?

317011043.content: The young man holding the blade hesitated, as if there was something he couldn't bring himself to say. Helplessness was written all over his face.

317011044.content: My apologies, but from the moment you started speculating, there was no way I could let you go, no matter how far from the truth you were.

317011045.content: The more you try to hide the truth, the sooner it'll all come out!!!

317011046.content: Lightning and flame lit up the sky simultaneously. The sound of weapons in violent conflict began to ring out again.

317012001.content: Tsukuyomi stabbed at Kagutsuchi, but she was yet again a little too late. Kagutsuchi had disappeared into the shadows once more.

317012003.content: Something felt off. Tsukuyomi touched her waist. It was only then she realized the communicator she'd been carrying was gone.

317012004.content: Was that why he didn't go through with that last attack when he could've...? Did he want the communicator so badly, he risked serious injury? Just what secret is being hidden here?

317012006.content: Tsukuyomi found herself suddenly transported to a strange space, where a mess of stairs and beams formed an inescapable barrier.

317012007.content: I've just received news that Kagutsuchi is hurt. However, his injuries aren't serious.

317012009.content: ...Are you trying to tell me I was rash?

317012010.content: We agreed that I'd decide our course of action.

317012011.content: Alright, but at least let me shoulder some of your burden!

317012012.content: Karasugo Sendou wasn't acting like the head of the family at all—In fact, what he'd just said sounded more like a plea. However, the young woman remained silent. It was some time before she finally responded.

317012014.content: For Karasugo Sendou, this was the most forceful rejection he could have received. He hesitated for a long time and finally decided not to press the issue.

317012015.content: I've said too much. I wish to be alone for a while.

317012017.content: And then only the delicate-looking young woman was left in the palatial room. She kept looking out the window, but she couldn't clearly see the exquisite courtyard garden outside. The oppressive gray skies overhead turned the floor-to-ceiling windows into dark mirrors that cut her off from the world.

317012018.content: Once more, a strange form took the place of her reflection in the mirror and confronted her.

317012019.content: There's an intruder? Has the world finally noticed what's going on in the Karasugo family?

317012020.content: You can stop struggling now, little girl. The game will be over once the world learns once more about that "idea" you Karasugo have been trying so hard to hide.

317012021.content: Such big talk for a prisoner. Silence.

317012022.content: Do you still think I'm trapped here by you? You may have faced me alone for many years, little girl, but you still think too highly of yourself.

317012023.content: And you think you can do something to me?

317012024.content: Come now, that's not how you ask someone for insight. Why not answer a question from me first? Tell me: In a world like this, what is a god?

317012026.content: Is a god someone who's able to control the minds of the people? Or is a god someone who connects all living things? Someone who is utterly carefree? Someone who has full control over life and death? Or, is it someone who will live forever?

317012027.content: Even if the superficial desires of mortals could give birth to infinite possibilities, they will still ultimately be trapped in those physical bodies that serve as the vehicles of the power. All you need is one wildfire to burn it all down.

317012028.content: After all, mortals are imperfect. Only by turning their various imagining of beauty into prayer and collecting those into a faith, are perfect gods born.

317012029.content: Therefore, gods are born from faith!

317012030.content: The being reflected in the floor-to-ceiling windows looked at the young woman. To its surprise, she remained as calm as ever.

317012031.content: It looks like you picked up on my hint.

317012032.content: I expected this outcome from the very moment the plan started. This is all a scheme on your part.

317012033.content: And what are you going to do about it, little girl?

317012034.content: The young woman was quiet. However, the being in the windows seemed to have sensed a hint of determination in her silence.

317012036.content: Why don't you answer one of my questions now?

317012037.content: Just who is the Crow God?

317012038.content: The being reflected in the windows paused. Though it appeared that this was a question it could readily answer, it chose to remain silent.

317012039.content: It was some time before it spoke again.

317012040.content: Have you thought about the price you'll have to pay, little girl?

317012041.content: It's been on my mind ever since I started playing this game.

317012042.content: It's time for us to get even, then.

317012043.content: The sky outside became increasingly gloomy. Miserable shadows intruded into the room and the rest of the mansion.

317012045.content: Huh? Wasn't that strange cordon already lifted? We need to make a living too, you know.

317012046.content: This has nothing to do with that. Take a good look at the sign—the land ahead belongs to the Karasugo family. Their mansion is right there. You sure that's where you want to get your lumber?

317012048.content: You should just go back the way you came.

317012049.content: Speaking of which, is it true that the Karasugo have a monster of their own?

317012051.content: Remember all of that strangeness that happened in Shimogyou a while ago? Some folks even said that they dreamed of a creature or something like that... They say it all has something to do with the Five Mountain Gods.

317012052.content: Don't they say that the Karasugo family serves a Crow God or something?

317012053.content: If I believed every single story I ever heard, I'd never leave my house, let alone do work as a forest ranger.

317012054.content: You have a point... Um, what is that?!

317012056.content: In the end, the ranger also stayed where he was. There, he saw with his very own eyes a shining creature in the sky above the Karasugo family mansion. Though it appeared humanoid, what it was exactly was unclear...

317012057.content: Shimogyou in late summer was a steaming cauldron as usual, but its streets were teeming with crowds anyway. The area had finally reopened after its sudden closure, and its residents found themselves drawn to the outdoor spaces there.

317012058.content: Sekhmet sat on a high chair outside a ramen shop, enjoying a bowl of noodles in what can only be described as an extremely uncouth manner. However, despite her look of indolence, her eyes were as sharp as those of a cat on the hunt.

317012059.content: From a seat not far from her, a fellow patron could be heard complaining to the shop owner.

317012060.content: I don't remember putting this on credit! Where did it come from?

317012061.content: Look here. That's your signature, isn't it?

317012062.content: Um... And... this. I don't remember this either. So strange...

317012063.content: Strangeness seems to be going around lately... Just remember to pay up.

317012064.content: ...They say all this weirdness has something to do with those mountain gods.

317012065.content: Why are you bringing up myths now?

317012066.content: Remember how the five families of Sasanami are each said to worship one of the mountain gods? And how those gods are probably real and extremely powerful? Come to think of it, maybe it was one of the gods who had these drinks.

317012067.content: ...Really? That's how you're trying to get out of this?

317012068.content: There's no other logical explanation for it! I don't remember any of this. There's no way I could've completely forgotten this even if I were drunk!

317012069.content: Well, no matter what happened—you're paying for it.

317012070.content: As the two continued wrangling, three agents from the Quake Damage Control Department suddenly arrived on the scene, seeming terribly out of place in their ominous-looking full-body armor.

317012071.content: The agents stood ramrod-straight and at attention, as if they were about to greet an esteemed superior.

317012072.content: Squad leaders F, H, and K of the Quake Damage Control Department Special Operations Team reporting, ma'am!

317012073.content: Not so loud. Those getups of yours are bad enough.

317012074.content: The local branch has ruffled quite a few feathers here in Shimogyou, with all the memory tracing work they've been doing. You're not going to make things any better while looking like that.

317012076.content: While Sekhmet was lecturing the trio, both the shop owner and the shop patrons had noticed the three agents and quickly shuffled away. Sekhmet's monitoring operation was over.

317012077.content: We can now clear memories from a selected period of time and perform rollbacks on the network systems. But for some reason, there are still some people in this era who like to write things down on paper, which means we have to check them one by one.

317012078.content: So this is what we're doing? Easy.

317012080.content: I bet they've got something exciting lined up for us, considering we're the Department's elites. Am I right, Captain?

317012082.content: Rebuffed, the two agents fell silent.

317012083.content: H, how many did you bring with you?

317012084.content: All personnel from Squads F, H, and K are present, ma'am!

317012085.content: I see that the Director spared no expense. But I remember asking for Jackal and Cat from the Egregious Crimes Department, too. Where are they?

317012089.content: Interesting reactions. Let me guess... You eavesdropped on the Director and that woman again?

317012090.content: You should've seen the Director. He was fuming. I was too scared to get a word in edgewise.

317012091.content: That director from the Egregious Crimes Department really is something. She turned our director down flat, then sat through all his yelling just to turn him down again without even hesitating...

317012092.content: And did she give a reason for saying no?

317012093.content: She claimed that it was "top secret."

317012094.content: ...Hmm, I get why the Director was so angry. Those two would've been perfect for this mission... Well, if the Director can't get us who we want, I'll just have to go to Aether Gazer and ask very nicely for more manpower.

317012095.content: The mission details are in your briefs. As the head of the Karasugo family has refused our summons, we'll have to conduct our investigation at the their mansion. You'll set off today.

317012096.content: Sasanami has already prepared the files we need for the investigation. If we're met with any resistance, we're permitted by CORG regulations to utilize any force necessary.

317012097.content: That's a lot of travel on the Photon Rail and whatnot...

317012098.content: I'm guessing you could use the overtime, though. I know it's not cheap, raising a family.

317012100.content: I'm not asking you to leave early just because I think the Karasugo will put up a fight. There's an even more important reason.

317012101.content: Only yesterday, a passerby witnessed a monster in the sky above the Karasugo mansion. Thankfully, we were able to get to him before he set off any rumors or panic.

317012102.content: A monster... Is this the "Crow God" mentioned in the intel?

317012103.content: It's possible. But all we know for sure is that the Karasugo family has been on the move since we started watching them more closely. Perhaps just like the Miyahebi, they've decided to summon their Crow God.

317012104.content: The Crow God... Isn't that a really powerful Visbane, Captain?

317012105.content: Your task is to find out more about the target. Also, it's stupid to go into a fight expecting your enemy to be all-powerful. Our mission is not for you to test those new weapons.

317012107.content: After making sure the two perpetually wearisome squad leaders fully understood the brief, Sekhmet looked over at the last one.

317012108.content: I can't leave with you, as I still have to liaise with Aether Gazer. You're in charge of all three squads once you're inside the Karasugo family mansion.

317012110.content: Sekhmet knew from Agent H's decisive response that she was right in choosing him.

317012112.content: Agent H did not respond as decisively to Sekhmet's dismissal, and his expression suddenly became much more serious.

317012113.content: I'm sorry, Captain, but "I'll see you later" is the only promise we agents of the Quake Damage Control Department cannot make. We have to treat every goodbye like it might be our last.

317012114.content: Sekhmet did not immediately respond to Agent H's abrupt statement.

317012115.content: ...Does he always have to be such a buzzkill?

317012116.content: Haven't you seen those posts on the company forum? What do they call this... "setting up a self-fulfilling prophecy?"

317012117.content: Heh. It's superstition, plain and simple.

317012118.content: Sekhmet coolly tidied up the table and went to pay her bill.

317012119.content: Judging from his psychological profile, he meant what he said. Indeed, the casualty rate has always been high for missions involving Visbanes.

317012120.content: Both Agent F and Agent K fell silent.

317012121.content: F, K, the two of you have probably wondered why we don't just have Modifiers take on dangerous jobs like this, right?

317012122.content: I mean, of course. Who wouldn't?

317012123.content: To be honest, I usually wonder what we humans would have to do to get a hold of that power for ourselves.

317012124.content: That's why I put Agent H in charge.

317012125.content: Agents F and K gave each other a bewildered look, unable to understand what Sekhmet was getting at. Thankfully, Sekhmet quickly let them off the hook by stepping forward to pat Agent H on the shoulder.

317012126.content: So, I'm counting on you to lead them. Also, you don't have to think of "see you later" as a promise, you know. It can be a blessing, understand?

317021002.content: ...Yes, it's true. We've checked, and we've been unable to reach any of them on the comms. I just sent you the last message we received from them...

317021003.content: Nobody's going to believe that without more evidence! You... Does Sekhmet know about this?

317021004.content: No. She's been at Aether Gazer the past few days.

317021005.content: Make sure the news doesn't get out. I'll take care of things here.

317021006.content: The peaceful atmosphere at Shimogyou made our R&R feel like a true vacation. We sat languidly outside a drinks store, looking like drifters.

317021007.content: So, we have to just wait for news from CORG now...?

317021008.content: HQ has reminded us that due to certain procedural breaches in the past, CORG specifically requested that the Quake Damage Control Department be allowed to complete their preliminary investigations before orders are given to the Modifier squad...

317021009.content: I know that. I was just grumbling.

317021010.content: I'm guessing this was because we made that snap decision to include the Akishika that one time?

317021011.content: Well, had we not done that, they might not have been able to clean up that mess in the end... Why are you so quiet, Admin?

317021012.content: Kuninotokotachi pulled me out of the deep thoughts I'd slipped into for a while.

317021013.content: Sorry. I was just thinking about the Five Mountain Gods.

317021015.content: Mmm, maybe. There's something I can't quite wrap my head around.

317021016.content: The two "gods" worshiped by the Miyahebi and Akishika turned out to be Visbanes. Which means the Karasugo's Crow God is probably a Visbane, too...

317021017.content: A logical conclusion. That's what our intelligence folks and CORG think as well.

317021018.content: But we'll only know just what sort of Visbane this Crow God is, and what it does to the Karasugo family, after we conduct a thorough investigation.

317021019.content: But has anyone thought about... how these "mountain gods" came to be sealed in the first place?

317021020.content: Legend has it they were sealed by the Madoiyama Ceremony...

317021021.content: Kuninotokotachi seemed to realize what a flimsy explanation that was.

317021022.content: Looking at Aether Gazer's internal files, I don't think there was any Modifier activity in Sasanami at that point in time. So, who suppressed these Cognizant Visbanes? Humans? Really?

317021023.content: I mean, just look at what happened with the Deer God and all the sacrifices that were made...

317021024.content: Kuninotokotachi, swayed by my argument, also fell into deep thought.

317021025.content: While I don't think we can put stock in those legends, just because something wasn't in Aether Gazer's files doesn't mean it didn't happen. Our job is to uncover the truth in these mysteries.

317021026.content: Heh, Buzenbo is right! Um... by the way, why do I feel like Buzenbo has been sounding more and more like Tsukuyomi these days?

317021027.content: This place you chose is run by crooks. Had I known earlier, I'd have helped you choose another place to meet.

317021028.content: We followed the direction of the shop owner's glare, and there we saw the Kuramitsuha we'd been waiting for for so long.

317021030.content: Not so fast, there. I haven't told you my final decision yet.

317021031.content: Still don't want to join the Pheasant Squad, Ninkyoumon?

317021032.content: I didn't say no. However, I have a condition: Aether Gazer will make arrangements for the Ninja Irregulars to go to school in Kamigyou.

317021033.content: Hey, hold on. Haven't I heard this before? What are we gonna do if you decide not to hold up your end of the bargain?

317021034.content: It won't happen again! You have my word!

317021035.content: Is it just me, or does that sound awfully familiar as well...?

317021036.content: I wouldn't lie to an Aether Gazer administrator.

317021037.content: Kuramitsuha glanced over at me, and in the brief moment we made eye contact, it felt like a lot was said between us.

317021039.content: ...Fine. At least we finally got one thing done here.

317021042.content: The atmosphere of amiable agreement was cut short by a rapid beeping. Judging by Mimir's serious tone, something major had occurred.

317021043.content: The Quake Damage Control Department has concluded its preliminary investigation.

317021044.content: Not the best time, is it... What about the Ninkyoumon...?

317021045.content: There's some paperwork to complete before our new Modifier can join us on our operations.

317021046.content: Paperwork?! What a pain. Count me out.

317021047.content: Let's skip all that, Admin. Just come to Shimogyou if you need anything. I'm always happy to help my friends!

317021048.content: Though the accommodations Izuru Masayoshi had arranged for us weren't exactly spacious, they were still private enough to conduct sensitive communications.

317021049.content: Mimir quickly established a connection, and Shu's voice came on the line once again, accompanied by a mission brief that popped up on the communicator. Shu dispensed with the niceties.

317021050.content: We've synced the intel from CORG. Here's the situation.

317021051.content: The Quake Damage Control Department has lost contact with all the agents it sent. We don't know why. And the only message the agents sent back was—

317021054.content: Not likely... CORG wouldn't have lost contact with all its agents if the Crow God had really been destroyed. On the other hand, had the Crow God been powerful enough to wipe out all of them, their last message would've been an SOS instead.

317021055.content: That's right. The only logical explanation is that the agents sent this final message before they took the Crow God along with them to their doom.

317021056.content: That's a little convenient, isn't it? Could it be that... they mistakenly thought they'd eliminated the Crow God, sent the message, and then...

317021057.content: Mmm. They'd have sent back more news if they could...

317021058.content: Shu, should we try to probe CORG further? If they're hiding something from us, things could end up going real bad for us out there real fast.

317021059.content: Those agents were the crème de la crème of the Quake Damage Control Department. Plus, you know what Director Kamau is like. There's no way they're hiding anything from us when it comes to a matter like this.

317021060.content: At the very least, we must verify this information. According to our original plan, you're to conduct an in-depth investigation into the Karasugo family.

317021061.content: However, keep this to yourselves. No one else can know right now, including other members of Aether Gazer. The mission brief assumes that the agents are dead, so you can operate on this assumption as well.

317021062.content: Isn't that a little hasty...? I mean, we literally have just one sentence and a lack of communication to go on...

317021063.content: This is a joint decision from Aether Gazer and CORG. Besides, this is related to another mission... Hold on.

317021064.content: Shu paused for a moment, as if she were listening to someone next to her.

317021066.content: We have an interest in this matter, too. It concerns a highly secret mission. Listen very carefully.

317021067.content: Tsukuyomi was sent on a mission by Odin, but now not even Odin can get in touch with her. This happened around the time CORG lost contact with their agents.

317021070.content: She was tasked with finding out more about the Five Mountain Gods of Sasanami. The last report we received from her contained intel that also pointed to the Karasugo. So, she was actually headed in the same direction as you, but...

317021072.content: Buzenbo's hand trembled, then fell heavily on the table. When we looked at her, we found she'd gone white. As if she realized she'd made a gaffe, she bit her lip gently and lowered her head.

317021073.content: Don't worry too much just yet, Buzenbo. We all know Tsukuyomi's capabilities. And just like those agents, losing contact doesn't necessarily mean that something bad's happened to her.

317021074.content: It's just that we don't have much information on hand now. Too much speculation will only complicate things. The first thing we have to do is to find out what's going on with the Karasugo family.

317021076.content: We can kill two birds with one stone.

317021077.content: Since we lost contact with the Karasugo, we know at the very least that there are secrets at play there. Naturally, they're also the ones most likely to have come in contact with those secrets. They may even have important clues about them.

317021078.content: We've got to tackle the Visbane problem first. But if, along the way, we discover clues about Tsukuyomi and the others, we should pursue those as well.

317021079.content: Still, we can't rule out the possibility that we're simply experiencing some kind of communication interference. If we just barge into the Karasugo mansion...

317021080.content: Mmm, the thought did cross my mind, so I asked the Cryptics to develop a specially modified component for Mimir, which should fend off every kind of communication interference we can think of.

317021081.content: We've sent the component to Sasanami through the Quake Damage Control Department. It should be in your hands soon. Think of it as insurance.

317021082.content: Good. At least that's one less thing to worry about.

317021083.content: Shu went through the mission details one by one, and we took notes carefully. However, as we reached the end, we felt like something was missing. We looked at each other in confusion.

317021084.content: Why wasn't Buzenbo given anything to do?

317021085.content: It's alright. Look at how I lost my composure after hearing the news about Master. I can't possibly go on a mission if I can't keep my emotions in check...

317021086.content: You've got it all wrong, Buzenbo. Tsukuyomi has always believed that you're capable of holding your own. You should believe in yourself too.

317021088.content: I have another task for you, actually. I need you to go to the imperial city in Kamigyou and wait for your orders there.

317021090.content: The Miyahebi, the Akishika, and now the Karasugo... It's increasingly clear that whatever's happening in Sasanami right now has to do with local politics. I don't think we should just focus on fighting Visbanes here.

317021091.content: The imperial city is the center of power in Sasanami. No matter who the mastermind here is, it's likely that the city is where the winner will be decided. So, I need someone to keep an eye on things there.

317021093.content: But there are only so many of us in the area. If we have to split up... Will we be getting any reinforcements?

317021094.content: No. I just sent another team to Xu Heng, and something's going on in Jokurr as well. I'll be heading out into the field myself soon.

317021095.content: Should you encounter any problems during the mission, you can get in touch with either the Command Room or CORG. After all, Sekhmet will be with you, so CORG should provide you with as much support as possible.

317021097.content: I turned my head to look at Buzenbo. She seemed to be feeling ambivalent.

317021098.content: ...There are some risks in solo missions. Which is why I made sure to talk to Tsukuyomi before making this decision.

317021100.content: "Buzenbo is good enough to hold her own now."

317021102.content: Buzenbo's eyes grew as large as saucers. Then, she slowly lowered her eyes as they started to glisten.

317021103.content: Tsukuyomi was actually supposed to give you this mission herself, as your captain and teacher.

317021104.content: She chose to entrust this to you knowing how dangerous Sasanami is right now. You are the secret weapon she left for the Administrator.

317021105.content: Your mission is to infiltrate the imperial city in Kamigyou and protect Izuru Masayoshi and the Child of Heaven. We think they may have a powerful enemy, though we're not sure yet who or what it is...

317021106.content: If it were Tsukuyomi giving you this mission, what would you say to her?

317021108.content: Mm-hmm. And that's exactly what she'd want to hear.

317021109.content: Well, now I can give you what Tsukuyomi left for you.

317021112.content: Understood. I won't let you down!

317021113.content: Seeing Buzenbo so determined, Kuninotokotachi and I felt no need to add to the conversation.

317021114.content: Admin, are you clear on your mission?

317021115.content: The brief seems straightforward enough. But I do have a question.

317021116.content: Not that I want to hide behind Odin's skirt, but... do you think she has the time to pop in and take a look at Sasanami?

317021117.content: Oh, that's right. I remember that the two of you returned to Aether Gazer together. Is she busy right now?

317021119.content: Shu was pulling back, but the general implications of the answer were clear to me.

317021120.content: I often got quite angry at her when I first took over Division Nine. She'd always disappear without saying a word, and she never helped out, even when we had a ton of work.

317021121.content: Later on, I came to better understand some of her actions... I know you only have my word to go on here, but we have to put our faith in Odin.

317021122.content: I'm aware there's a lot she doesn't tell us, but know that she wants to protect us more than anyone else.

317021123.content: I nodded at Shu and smiled at my slightly disappointed companions. Odin was the leader of Aether Gazer, after all, so it wasn't surprising that the Modifiers all looked up to her, different as they all were.

317021124.content: If she's still at Aether Gazer, tell her I said hello.

317021129.content:
I don't have any updates for you. But she should still be recovering...
Don't worry, CORG has promised to notify us if there are any changes in her vital signs.

317021130.content: I've passed on your care package and letter to CORG, too. She'll see them once she comes to.

317021132.content: You're our outstanding graduate now, Admin. I trust you'll make good decisions out there.

317021133.content:
Just relax and do what you've trained to do.
Come back safe and sound, everyone.

317021134.content: After the call was ended, Shu pressed a button on her desk, and the sound of wind outside the window could be heard in her office once again. She looked back at the person standing behind her, sighed, and shook her head slightly.

317021135.content: Are we sure about this? Things in Sasanami can't be as simple as they seem right now.

317021136.content: You just told everyone to trust me, and now you're questioning me too?

317021137.content: I'm used to you not bothering with what goes on around here. But why do I have to go to Jokurr now, of all times?

317021138.content: It hasn't been that long since the incident with the Akishika. We need someone here to liaise with CORG, send as much support as possible to Sasanami, and provide the Admin with as much help as we can.

317021139.content: And even if we do need someone to go to Jokurr, there's still Vidar and the others. I want—

317021141.content: Odin gently cut Shu off and pointed a finger at her own eyes.

317021142.content: It's not that we have to send someone to Jokurr. It's that we have to send you there.

317021143.content: That's as good as saying nothing at all... To put it bluntly, this wouldn't be the first time you've tried to pull a fast one on me with your powers of precognition.

317021144.content: Ha ha! Don't tell me you still remember that prank? It's been over a decade!

317021145.content: ...The Admin is right. Sasanami is shrouded in intrigue right now. If you have the time, at the very least you should make a trip there to find out what's going on. Then everyone will know what it is they have to do.

317021146.content: If I have the time. I'm leaving in 20 minutes.

317021147.content: Does this have something to do with Gengchen? Or Turing?

317021148.content: I'm not telling you, so don't ask. We've got a good thing going here now, don't we?

317021149.content: As for the Admin and everyone else, you don't have to worry. They'll get the help they need.

317021150.content: Odin took a quick look at the time, then produced a pouch from her pocket. She tossed it to Shu.

317021151.content: I know saying this is probably a waste of breath, but don't get distracted by what's going on in Sasanami.

317021152.content: The Jokurr mission is extremely important. It's alright if you don't quite understand the intel I've given you yet. You'll figure it out once you get there.

317021153.content: Component legality check complete. Downloading driver now... (Beep beep)... Download complete.

317021155.content: That's it? So we don't have to worry about the signal being blocked ever again?

317021156.content: Precisely. The component is capable of dealing with all communication failures in the Gaea framework.

317021158.content: (Beep beep)... I'm sorry, I just checked, and I'm afraid I can't share that info with you, as your intel security clearance level is lower than the set value.

317021160.content: Lord Mimir seems to have as many secrets as Odin does. We don't have time to worry about stuff like that.

317021162.content: Before we do, I think we should...

317021163.content: Now that I'd had the chance to think over our conversation with Shu, I had some misgivings.

317021164.content: Now that we know what Tsukuyomi was up to, I can't help but wonder... Kuninotokotachi, you know Tsukuyomi far better than I do. Any guesses as to what the secret mission Odin sent her on could be?

317021165.content: Hmm... Odin and I may be drinking buddies, but that doesn't mean I have any more insight into what she's thinking.

317021167.content: But, the captain did tell me something. She told me that she was investigating the Sasanami Five and the Five Mountain Gods behind them. Her mission might have something to do with that. It wouldn't be wrong to say we're converging on the same place.

317021168.content: What's so special about an investigation like this? Why the need to keep it secret from even other people within Aether Gazer?

317021169.content: Speaking of special, the captain once told me that she joined Aether Gazer because of a promise she made to Odin. Maybe that has something to do with this?

317021171.content: I have no idea. She never told me.

317021173.content: We all have our little secrets. Anyway, since we're going to look for the captain, we can ask her about it when we see her.

317021174.content: Kuninotokotachi might have been trying to comfort me, but just then I saw a trace of worry in her eyes.

317021175.content: We're talking about the captain here. Why haven't we heard from her? Just what could have happened to her?

317021176.content: What are you worrying about? Maybe she's just within range of a Visbane's EM silencing. AND my shiny new component is designed specifically to deal with this situation!

317021177.content: We're counting on you then, O Lord Mimir with the stratospheric clearance level!

317021178.content: Talking to Kuninotokotachi did not fully dispel my doubts, however. There were all these bits of information in my mind, all jumbled up. I'd have given up on making any decisions right then and there, had it not for the knowledge that the clock was ticking.

317021179.content: It's time we start planning our next steps.

317021181.content: Kuninotokotachi was looking at Buzenbo, who was sitting in a corner all by herself. She'd been staring at the box that had been delivered to her this entire time and had yet to open it.

317021182.content: Buzenbo, haven't you already made up your mind?

317021183.content: Mm-hmm. I just... didn't want to be too casual about this.

317021184.content: Buzenbo took a deep breath, as if she'd just completed another Zen practice, then opened the box...

317021185.content: Inside it was a brand-new set of armor and an eye-catching katana. The blade of the katana gave off a cherry-red glow that made it look awfully bewitching.

317021186.content: This katana... There's so much Divine Grace coming from it.

317021187.content: A stream of long-gone memories started to flood Buzenbo's mind as she gazed at the blade.

317021188.content: I remember that I carried this blade around with me until I was adopted.

317021190.content: There was also a note inside the box. Buzenbo opened it to find the delicate, yet vigorous, handwriting that she'd become very familiar with on the paper...

317021191.content:
Buzenbo, I'm sorry that I can't hand you this weapon myself. Back then, I had to put this away no matter how small the risk seemed.

But if you're reading this, then you already know how I feel about you having this. I'm sorry I can't tell you in person.

The name of this blade is "Sakuragiri." This was your original Access Key.

Even I was astonished by how bewitching this blade is the first time I saw it. It gives off a stream of Divine Grace that manifests as a cherry-red glow, which even humans can see with the naked eye.

But back then, you had not yet awakened, and you were close to losing your senses because of all that power.

That's why your adoptive father believed Sakuragiri to be a weapon of evil. And I had to check again and again to make sure that this wasn't a malfunctioning Access Key destined for the scrap heap.

I took Sakuragiri with me at the behest of your adoptive father. The Cryptics later studied it, and they made some shocking discoveries.

317021198.content:
It turned out there was a massive combat database left in the core of Sakuragiri. You could say that this sword was forged by countless battles, which have caused its Divine Grace to undergo a profound change.

Accept its Divine Grace, and you will become an executioner who will strike fear into all your enemies. But if you don't have what it takes to wield its power, you will instead be devoured and become part of this giant database.

I, too, found myself wavering and almost decided to put it away for good, as Ookuninushi suggested. But then I remembered that you, in your unawakened state, had managed to live with this blade for years.

Ultimately, I believe that this is the mission Gaea has arranged for you. I don't have the right to make your choice for you. I can only judge when you are ready to make it.

Nuadha has created a set of armor for Sakuragiri based on a design I asked Ookuninushi to draw up. It should allow you to control the Divine Grace from Sakuragiri more easily. However, whether you can truly control it is completely up to you.

But as I said before, if you're reading this letter, you know that I've already made my judgment.

You're good enough to hold your own now.

317021205.content: Buzenbo held a corner of the note tightly, then folded it solemnly and slipped it back in the envelope.

317021206.content: Sorry for taking so long, Admin. I'm ready now.

317021207.content: Now that you've read this letter, Buzenbo, I don't have to say anything more, right?

317021209.content: Seeing how determined Buzenbo was, I had no choice but to get ready myself, despite my questions and doubts.

317021210.content: Now, I want to pass that candle on to you.

317021214.content: I finally managed to extricate myself from my jumbled-up thoughts and set to organizing myself mentally.

317021215.content: Buzenbo, your mission has been clearly defined, so I won't repeat the details. Kuninotokotachi, we'll meet up with Sekhmet as planned. But before that, we should go to Shimogyou first.

317021217.content: Well, I can't just rely on others to make plans for me, can I?

317021218.content: From the looks of it, Kuramitsuha hadn't been expecting to see us a second time that day.

317021219.content: Looks like you're in a real hurry... Tell me, Aether Gazer administrator, what do you need from me?

317021222.content: I took out a note and handed it to Kuramitsuha with a grave expression on my face.

317021223.content: I'm going on a mission now, and there's a chance that you won't hear from me for a while. If and when something happens here in Sasanami, I hope you will follow the instructions in here.

317021224.content: What is this? Your bag of tricks?

317021225.content: Ninkyoumon, I'm not kidding around here. This is serious.

317021226.content: Kuramitsuha studied my expression. After a while, she finally nodded.

317031001.content: The legend of the Crow God...

317031002.content: No, that's not right. The Crow God doesn't have its own legend.

317031003.content: When the Five Gods were still walking the world, it was always more of a bit actor compared to the other gods. Then, after order was restored, the Karasugo family, which was supposed to serve it, never built a temple or monument for it.

317031004.content: The Crow God was never worshipped by the people the way the Deer God was. At one point, the Karasugo family even publicly stated that the Crow God was fictional, completely severing themselves from their clerical lineage, and instead relied on its businesses to maintain their family's status.

317031005.content: Ever since Karasugo Haruka, the second daughter of the previous head of the family, was selected as the Child of Heaven, the Karasugo family has retreated from public view, and information about them has become increasingly scarce.

317031006.content: Unlike the Deer God, the Crow God... seems to be a concept that has faded away entirely.

317031008.content: Sekhmet tried to recall the conversations she'd overheard from passers-by to flesh out the information on the Crow God.

317031009.content: Interested in these puppets? Choose one! The Snake God will keep you healthy, the Deer God will give you long life, the Monkey God will make you happy, and the Crane God will give you wealth!

317031010.content: The Crow God? I don't make those puppets, sorry. I've no idea what the Crow God blesses.

317031011.content: Blasphemy? Oh my! This is just for fun! Aren't the Five Mountain Gods just legends, anyway??

317031012.content: A book about the legends of Sasanami? There's plenty! Take your pick.

317031013.content: A book on the Crow God? There isn't a book that's solely about the Crow God. While the Izuru and Akishika have commissioned books about their respective gods, the Karasugo don't seem to care very much about this one.

317031014.content: Just think of the Crow God as... the one they needed to make five. You know how it is in books and movies: Sometimes they say "Deep Sea Seven" but they end up focusing on just a few of them...

317031015.content: My older brother once told me that while it's fine to get a tattoo of the snake, deer, and monkey, never get a tattoo of the crow, for the Crow God is the most useless of the Five Gods!

317031016.content: Don't do the crane, either! Imagine being stabbed in the back like that!

317031017.content: As all these voices overlapped in her head, Sekhmet struggled to find the one narrative thread that'd pull them all together.

317031018.content: Are they... deliberately keeping the Crow God out of the public eye?

317031019.content: Sekhmet's thoughts were suddenly interrupted by a conversation happening near her.

317031020.content: Have you heard? There really is a Visbane at the Karasugo's! It's their Crow God!

317031021.content: But the men HQ sent here have already taken care of the Crow God. Amazing.

317031022.content: But I heard that we lost all those men as well...?

317031023.content: That... can't be helped. That's just how life in the Quake Damage Control Department is. The more elite you are, the more often you put your life on the line!

317031024.content: So you're saying just stick to a desk job?

317031027.content: There were no traces of emotion in Sekhmet's eyes. She silently eyed an agent, who felt slight chills running down their spine.

317031028.content: Um... Memory wipes in this neighborhood are complete, ma'am! I... promise not to goof off like that ever again!

317031030.content: Sekhmet seemed to have thought of something. However, her communicator rang out just then, so she had to wave off her two skiving subordinates and get herself to somewhere quiet.

317031032.content: Director, that look of yours sure seems familiar. I'm guessing you have more bad news for me?

317031033.content: ... I can't keep anything from you, can I? You may as well brief me on the mission instead.

317031035.content: We just heard from Aether Gazer. They can't spare much manpower, and you may get only one Modifier for the mission.

317031037.content: Damn it, I just lost contact with three full squads here. Does Aether Gazer really think that sending just two Modifiers would solve the problem? And then there's that woman from the Egregious Crimes Department...

317031039.content: ...I thought you'd grumble about this at least.

317031040.content: Director, given how well you know me, I can't understand why you would expect me to do that.

317031041.content: The more logical explanation is that you're worried about my state of mind after hearing about the squads, but you're not sure how to console me, so you're hoping that I'll show my feelings first and make it easier for you.

317031042.content: And hoping that you would openly reveal your emotions was my mistake.

317031043.content: Kamau paused for a moment. When he started speaking again, his tone was much gentler.

317031044.content: Sekhmet, the agents of our department have always put their lives on the line, so I can't say this was wholly unexpected. However, we must find out what happened at the Karasugo mansion. The rest of us must remember our agents and what they've done for us!

317031045.content: Yes... And that's a very good reason for us to carry out this mission, despite the manpower issue. But you didn't have to explain that to me, Director.

317031046.content: I'm explaining it for my own benefit.

317031048.content: Before coming to this meeting point, I would never have expected that the path to the Karasugo family mansion would be hidden deep in the forest.

317031049.content: Do the five families all live this far from town?

317031050.content: Sasanami legend has it that the Sasanami Five are supposed to serve the mountain gods. That is why their family homes are often built far away from civilization.

317031051.content: Of course, they also have quarters in Kamigyou where they can conduct their business.

317031052.content: Deep in the woods is a pretty good place to hide a family secret, if you have one.

317031053.content: There's an exception, though: The Izuru main residence is located in Kamigyou.

317031055.content: According to the legends, the Crane God died at the hands of the other four gods before the Madoiyama Ceremony happened, so the Izuru family no longer had any clerical obligations. They were called to Kamigyou to serve the Child of Heaven instead.

317031056.content: No wonder the Izuru are so influential in Sasanami politics.

317031057.content: Not exactly. The Izuru only came to be so influential in Izuru Masayoshi's generation.

317031058.content: Kamigyou has always been jointly ruled by the Sasanami Five. Compared to the other four families, with their large land holdings outside of town and the power of the clerics, the Izuru were the runt of the litter for a long time.

317031059.content: What an interesting moment in history...

317031060.content: You can't possibly go on the mission looking like that.

317031061.content: A familiar voice was heard all of a sudden, and the keen Kuninotokotachi immediately threw out a kunai.

317031063.content: Sekhmet, holding the kunai she'd caught in one hand, emerged from her hiding place behind a tree trunk.

317031064.content: A rather decent response, I must say.

317031065.content: Sekhmet casually threw the kunai back to Kuninotokotachi, then looked the two of us up and down.

317031066.content: May I ask why Aether Gazer decided at the last minute to send fewer Modifiers for this mission?

317031067.content: We... have carefully considered various needs and believe our current personnel arrangement to be reasonable.

317031068.content: "Various needs," you say? It seems that you have no wish to explain the situation at all.

317031069.content: ... I know I can't fool you. I only ask for your understanding here.

317031070.content: Your caution is not surprising, given the current relationship between our organizations.

317031071.content: But I have to ask: Dear Administrator, this "personnel arrangement" you speak of wasn't a decision made by a commander at your rank, was it?

317031073.content: Looks like it really wasn't. This mission is definitely more complicated than I expected... Let's not waste any more time. We should go over the mission as soon as we can.

317031074.content: This time round, Sekhmet seemed to be rather impatient, quite unlike her usual cool and indifferent attitude. It was as if this particular mission was especially important to her.

317031075.content: Oh, I remember now. You and those missing agents...

317031076.content: That's right. I work directly with most of them. Also, I must advise you that it's difficult to produce the emotional reactions you desire by forcing yourself into interpersonal relationships you do not understand.

317031077.content: Admin, there's no use playing nice with this one.

317031078.content: Forget it, then... However, there is something we need to clarify regarding those agents... Sekhmet, what do you think of the message they sent back?

317031079.content: The most reasonable explanation is that the agents took the Crow God with them, but they managed to send the message just before their deaths.

317031080.content: Is that really the most logical explanation, though?

317031081.content: No, just a relatively logical one.

317031082.content: Our department is responsible for dealing with Visbanes specifically, and we've already formulated a robust set of standard operating procedures based on our past experiences. Maintaining communication is the most important principle for us.

317031083.content: Our agents have special means to ensure that no outsider can hijack their communicators and send false information.

317031084.content: In other words, as bizarre as the message "The Crow God has been destroyed" is, it must have been sent by one of our missing agents.

317031085.content: Could they have been influenced by someone else, though?

317031086.content: If we're to go down this path, my inference would be... they fell under the control of a being that has power over the mind, then sent back this strange message.

317031088.content: Then, what is the most likely thing this being could be?

317031090.content: That would mean that the message also came from the Crow God. In that case, we should analyze the reasons it'd want to send a note like that.

317031091.content: Might it be that it wants us to let down our guard and stop our investigation into the Karasugo family?

317031093.content: I immediately realized just how absurd this train of thought was.

317031094.content: Why would the Crow God draw attention to itself and the Karasugo like that...

317031095.content: We've been presuming that the Crow God is a Cognizant Visbane as powerful as the Snake God and the Deer God. It's unlikely, then, it'd do something so clumsy. After all, a message like that would only make us proceed more cautiously, just like we're doing now.

317031096.content: I did not say another word for a long time as I racked my brain for other possible explanations.

317031097.content: You first considered the security of communications during the mission, then made a preliminary guess about the level of threat the investigation's target would pose. Your abilities as a commander are admirable, Administrator.

317031099.content: Aren't you supposed to be a psychology whiz? Can't you tell that our Admin is trying to console you?

317031100.content: I can see that. However, I do think this time-wasting, meaningless course of action has undermined the Administrator's authority. Which is why I came up with two more logical explanations for your benefit.

317031101.content: Alright. I'll try to be a little more... logical from now on.

317031102.content: Sekhmet stared at me for a while, then appeared to think of something.

317031103.content: No, you don't have to do that, Administrator. Strictly speaking, letting emotions drive your behavior is not a shortcoming—It's what makes humans interesting.

317031104.content: So, I assume we're done going over the details and can start the investigation now?

317033001.content: Halt, all of you! My rifle bullet will be traveling at the speed of sound, so don't even think about reaching for your blades!

317033003.content: Captain! I didn't think you'd come so soon...

317033004.content: Sekhmet hesitated for a moment, and went on her guard again.

317033005.content: I need to verify your identity. Agent passphrase.

317033008.content: Sekhmet sighed, perhaps out of relief or in exasperation at her subordinate's performance.

317033009.content: K, I'll remind you again. You want language that's short, sweet, and easy to understand when engaging the enemy, not weapon parameters and stats.

317033011.content: This is great news. Maybe the others are fine too.

317033013.content: I've no idea... I got lost soon after we entered this place. However, I came across this note with instructions from H.

317033014.content: A note? Doesn't the Quake Damage Control Department use the most cutting-edge tech?

317033015.content: Of course! Our new communicators are actually on the quantum channels, but... I lost my communicator, and I don't know when that happened.

317033016.content: K, let me take a look at the note.

317033017.content: Sekhmet took the note and looked at it with a slight frown on her face.

317033018.content: Administrator, I suggest that we make it our priority to find the person who left this note.

317033020.content: K, come with us. That rifle of yours may come in handy now.

317032001.content: There's H! And F's there, too!

317032002.content: Agent K ran over with much joy as soon as she spotted her comrades. Agent H, however, remained standing where he was.

317032003.content: Hold on. Identity verification! Agent passphrase.

317032005.content: It's really you, Captain! I thought you'd still be at Aether Gazer...

317032006.content: You look to be your right mind. I asked for K's passphrase when we met up earlier, and she gave me the correct one.

317032007.content: I verified F's identity earlier, too. He's okay.

317032008.content: The tension finally eased after both parties completed the necessary verification process. Sekhmet seemed to have a lot she wanted to say, but in the end she chose the shortest utterance.

317032009.content: I now take back control of the mission.

317032011.content: It's bad enough that we have to chase down all those crazy people who are attacking everyone. I can't believe that I have to go through all this trouble when I see one of my own coworkers. What did I sign myself up for?

317032012.content: F, you've never disappointed in your operations assessments, so I'm going to act like you were just venting just now.

317032014.content: Why do you use letters for agent code names? It makes you sound like the military...

317032015.content: Oh, we used to have proper code names. Then F decided he wanted to be called "Father," and I sure as heck wasn't gonna call him that.

317032017.content: Why do all the agents working under this weirdo seem so... unprofessional?

317032018.content: The agents trained by our captain are highly professional. It's just that they're different from those dumb drones you've encountered.

317032019.content: "Dumb drones"? That definitely sounds like the CORG agents I've met so far.

317032020.content: However, even as she was lobbing her insult, Kuninotokotachi's gaze at the three agents began to soften.

317032021.content: Ah, well. An apple never falls far from the tree, as they say.

317032022.content: Sekhmet remained calm despite Kuninotokotachi's jabs.

317032023.content: We've found all three squad leaders. This is good news.

317032024.content: See? I told you we couldn't have lost all of them.

317032025.content: Lost all of us? We may have been separated from each other, but it was way too early to draw that conclusion.

317032026.content: But in the world outside, there had been no word from you for too long. The Quake Damage Control Department was ready to issue line-of-duty benefits to your families.

317032028.content: What #{nickname}# said is more or less correct.

317032029.content: Did we perform so poorly that HQ couldn't think of any other conclusion?!

317032030.content: Did I hear "line-of-duty benefits"? Could we hold off on sending back word until our families have received the money?

317032031.content: But on seeing the looks of disdain or disapproval on everyone around him, Agent F decided to shut his mouth.

317032032.content: Just know that HQ considered a myriad of factors before drawing this conclusion. Let's discuss this again later.

317032033.content: First, I need to know what you've found out so far.

317032034.content: Huh? We never had a chance to investigate. We were separated as soon as we entered the Karasugo mansion.

317032035.content: Why is everyone in the Quake Damage Control Department so lackadaisical? It's been a whole week since you people entered the place.

317032036.content: The three squad leaders looked utterly confused.

317032037.content: K did say I came earlier than she expected, and H thought I was still at Aether Gazer... Time count check: 87,633.

317032040.content: Are we really doing this? Well, let me think... It's 87,512 for me as well.

317032043.content: The Quake Damage Control Department often performs memory tracing work with the residents of Quake-affected neighborhoods. Simply put, we erase memories from a selected period of time.

317032044.content: Once in a while, errors are made during the operation, which will cause us to lose memories as well. So, we have a rule that we have to keep time by updating our count once every hour.

317032045.content: We then check this count at the end of missions. This way, we'll know who has lost their memories.

317032046.content: Why can't you just use a watch instead?

317032047.content: Electronic information can be rolled back and mechanical parts can jam up. This is an extreme method for extreme situations. There's no guarantee that a person who's lost their memories will still remember what time their watch is supposed to show, so we still need to perform the manual verification.

317032048.content: Sounds like your job truly isn't an easy one... So you're saying that they're all missing memories?

317032049.content: Judging by the count, we're missing more than five days' worth.

317032050.content: That's about right. Based on how they've acted since meeting up with us, they feel like they're only in the first two days of their investigation.

317032051.content: How did they lose their memories?

317032052.content: I'm unable to identify the reason...

317032053.content: And that's not the strangest thing. H, did you see the note you sent to the others?

317032054.content: Yes. Everyone should have a copy. Both F and I have one.

317032056.content: I ran into G and R on the way here, and they have the note as well. But something felt off about it, so I wanted to look for H. That's why we went our separate ways.

317032057.content: To be honest, once I saw the note, I realized that there might be something wrong with my memory because I didn't recall writing it... But it was definitely in my handwriting, and it contained the secret symbol that only the investigation team knows.

317032058.content: If it contains the symbol, we can rule out the possibility that it was written while you were under someone's control...

317032059.content: Our agents are highly competent. Other than old-timers like F, they would strictly abide by the instructions in your message after confirming you did send it. Well, what about you? What do you think of this?

317032060.content: Agent H didn't speak for a while. Obviously, he was also confused about the contents of the note.

317032061.content: I don't have a logical explanation for you. All I can do is to follow the instructions there myself.

317032062.content: Just like the captain said, the other agents will definitely do what this says. Now that I have lost my communicator, the fastest way I can rendezvous with them is to take the same actions.

317032063.content: I understand what you're saying. But if we don't know what was going through your mind when you wrote this, we'll be walking into things blind.

317032064.content: I'm sorry, but I've lost the relevant memories...

317032065.content: Just what exactly is written on that note?

317032066.content: Sekhmet passed the note in K's hand to Kuninotokotachi and me. The note had obviously been written in a hurry as it was written in brief points. But they were clear enough...

317032067.content:
1. The Crow God has been destroyed.

2. No need to call for reinforcements.

3. No one may leave the Karasugo mansion until the mission is complete.

4. Don't believe any of the Karasugo servants. Don't let a single one of them leave the mansion.

5. When in a hallway, never move in a direction that would take you out of the mansion.

6. The head of the Karasugo family is not Karasugo Sendou.

7. Locating Agent E is a priority. More instructions later.

8. If you encounter other agents, make sure they know the above instructions, too.

317032075.content: After reading the note, Kuninotokotachi and I fell silent for quite a while. I wanted to analyze it, but I wasn't sure where to start.

317032076.content: While the points written down were more or less clear, a couple of them were rather odd. Overall, there was no real logical thread linking them together.

317032077.content: More importantly, the very first point was the one that so befuddled us.

317032078.content: H, do you remember sending a message to HQ two days ago?

317032080.content: That's unfortunate. The very first point in this note was the message HQ received from your communicator two days ago.

317032082.content: That, and the fact that none of you could be reached on your comms for a long time, caused HQ to believe that you'd all perished.

317032083.content: ...I cannot speculate as to why I'd send a message like that. But it's very hard to tamper with the department's communications, and no one else can use my communicator.

317032084.content: Looks like this is another dead end, then...

317032085.content: Sekhmet retrieved the note and stared at it.

317032086.content: Just what has happened to the Karasugo?

317032087.content: The ones who are supposed to serve the Crow God say that it has awakened, and we must call for reinforcements. But the ones who are supposed to defeat the Crow God say that it has been destroyed, and reinforcements aren't needed.

317032088.content: And we have missing memories to boot...

317032089.content: Sekhmet did not respond to me. She continued staring at the note.

317032090.content: H, E is your tech. He should have the equipment we use for memory tracing and the mission recorder, no?

317032092.content: Sekhmet pondered for a moment, then put away the note.

317032093.content: Right now, only the sixth point makes sense. Find E. If his mission recorder is intact, we'll be able to learn what has happened in the past few days.

317032094.content: Do we really have to follow the instructions in the note? After all, H himself is saying that he doesn't remember writing it...

317032095.content: Hmm... We'll at least be able to find the others. It's also important to find everyone.

317032096.content: Where might E be? Any ideas?

317032097.content: We've already searched up and down this path. E is probably further inside the compound somewhere.

317032098.content: We'll keep pushing forward, then. What do you think of my suggested course of action, Administrator?

317032099.content: Are you just asking this to follow the protocol?

317032101.content: ...I approve of your idea. For now.

317041001.content: We didn't encounter any obstacles along the way, and soon we found ourselves in a courtyard on the inside of the Karasugo mansion.

317041002.content: The place was eerily empty. The groups of people who had blocked our path before had long since stopped appearing. It felt like we had arrived at a deserted fortress.

317041003.content: The Karasugo are one of the Sasanami Five. Surely, they have more warriors working for them than just the ones we saw earlier?

317041004.content: It's more likely that they're choosing not to meet us.

317041005.content: Captain, there's one of our people over there!

317041006.content: We looked over to where Agent K was pointing, just in time to see a Quake Damage Control Department agent rounding the corner up ahead.

317041007.content: And then.... both sides raised their weapons at the same time.

317041009.content: Keep your distance. Your agent passphrase!

317041015.content: Is there really a need for you folks to yell at each other after you take off those helmets? I mean, don't you recognize each others' faces?

317041016.content: Who are yo— The captain's here, too?

317041020.content: I wasn't expecting you to come to our aid so soon, Captain!

317041021.content: It's been a week since you set off on this mission. You're missing five days' worth of memories.

317041023.content: F said you're looking for E. Have you had any luck?

317041024.content: I am looking for E. How did F know that— Oh, you also have H's note, don't you? And that's how you guessed I'm looking for E, too?

317041025.content: What are you saying? You told me yourself that you were gonna look for E.

317041026.content: I told you that? But I haven't seen you since we entered the Karasugo compound!

317041027.content: Agent R's words made everyone do a double take.

317041028.content: That's impossible. G was there too... Where's G?

317041029.content: G? I haven't seen G, either.

317041031.content: This passphrase system of yours—you're sure it works?

317041032.content: Tension filled the air again. While everyone's grip on their weapons tightened, Sekhmet silently studied Agent R.

317041035.content: Everyone looked at each other in surprise, quickly realizing what had happened.

317041036.content: There's a difference of 2. R lost his memory again when he went to look for E... He was probably attacked by an enemy.

317041037.content: You're saying that the enemy has the ability to erase memories?

317041038.content: It's possible. But if losing his memory was the only thing that happened to R after encountering an enemy, he's gotten off very easy.

317041039.content: I don't think it's useful to guess what the enemy is up to by doing this. We should focus on looking for E, and see what crops up along the way.

317041040.content: Hold on, Administrator. Let's do a little thought experiment first.

317041042.content: Imagine you're on the sidewalk, and you come across a sign that says, "Go right."

317041043.content: Most people in that situation, having seen the red exclamation point on the sign, would simply do as they're told. But nothing happens, and they still have no idea why they had to go right.

317041044.content: Then, a rebellious boy comes along and decides to turn left instead. He steps on a broken manhole cover, and falls into the sewer.

317041045.content: ...Why couldn't the sign have just said, "Danger! Broken Manhole Cover"?

317041046.content: Maybe it was an attempt to cover up the laziness of government employees. Or perhaps the public funds meant for infrastructure repairs had been embezzled. So, we can only figure out the why, if we first determine the reason this sign was put up, am I right?

317041047.content: That's pretty much the situation we're in right now. R's story tells us that we won't learn anything more by following the sign. So, why not go the other way instead?

317041048.content: Wait, doesn't that mean we have to "step" on the "broken manhole cover"? Actively seek out danger?

317041049.content: The definition of an investigation, is to personally test out the likelihood of a variety of dangers, and then eliminate each one.

317041051.content: We'll choose one of them here, and then try to call for reinforcements.

317041053.content: What's the rush? The signals here are acting up a little. I'm gonna need some time to get a new link going...

317041054.content: I'd advise you not to do that.

317041056.content: Agent K had already raised her weapon and aimed it at the intruder. A young man had drawn near without us noticing, and he was looking at us with resignation in his eyes.

317041057.content: You people should never have been allowed to enter the Karasugo mansion in the first place. What on earth was she thinking...?

317041058.content: Who are you? And what do you want?

317041059.content: Just know that we shouldn't be enemies. Please give me your communicator... I hope for both our sakes that we can do this without the use of weapons.

317041062.content: Kagutsuchi drew his sword and made a polite gesture.

317041063.content: Is that Divine Grace? So he's a Modifier too...

317041064.content: Do your worst, Honorable Ninja. We've already stepped on that manhole cover, anyway.

317042001.content: Apologies for the offense. I must take my leave now.

317042003.content: It was odd that Kagutsuchi, who'd initiated the encounter, would suddenly want to retreat. His strange behavior immediately drew everyone's attention. But then, a hook suddenly shot out of nowhere.

317042005.content: Before I could grasp what was going on, Mimir was snatched away from me by a Karasugo minion who'd been lying in wait. After claiming what he was after, he immediately turned and fled..

317042009.content: If we go after him, we'll be moving away from the Karasugo mansion.

317042010.content: Kagutsuchi had fled in a direction that led out of the mansion. Soon, both he and his ally had disappeared around a corner of the hallway.

317042011.content: Are you talking about point number five? We've already disregarded one item. What's another one now?

317042012.content: We can't let them take Mimir!

317042014.content: Don't look at me. On this mission, the Administrator over there is my superior.

317042015.content: Kuninotokotachi and I had already rushed off. Sekhmet ordered her subordinates to keep up with us.

317042016.content: However, as soon as we stepped into the hallway, the view ahead us suddenly became distorted. It was as if the entire space was being twisted or distorted into another dimension.

317042018.content: I tried to grab hold of Kuninotokotachi's outstretched hand, but though we'd been standing near each other just before, now the distance between us had been amplified several times by the spatial distortion...

317042019.content: Finally, a dark curtain came down completely over my field of vision.

317051002.content: I did not hear Kuninotokotachi respond. A dim yellow light then replaced the darkness before my eyes, revealing a new space in front of me.

317051003.content: I saw staircases criss-crossing each other and endless rooms stacked one on top of another, but I did not see a way out.

317051005.content: Did you come from the outside? Do you know how we can leave this place?

317051006.content: A Karasugo servant suddenly appeared to one side of me. I immediately reached for my gun and pointed it at him.

317051008.content: Wait! I mean you no harm.

317051009.content: Indeed, he did not display any belligerence. In fact, he hadn't even drawn the katana at his waist.

317051010.content: I want to leave this place. Do you know how?

317051012.content: Then you... That's right, those people in the outside world sent you here to investigate the Karasugo family, didn't they? Do you have a communicator with you?

317051013.content: We must contact the outside world immediately. The Crow God has reawakened! It's too powerful, and the Karasugo can no longer keep it in check... We must let the outside world know and call for help!

317051014.content: ...I must first make sure that you aren't a threat to me, since I was just attacked by a Karasugo servant.

317051015.content: You were just attacked by a Karasugo servant? They must be from the other side! The side that's been led astray by the Crow God!

317051016.content: Are you telling me there are two factions among the Karasugo?

317051017.content: I mean you no harm. I promise.

317051018.content: The Karasugo minion then removed the blade on his waist and placed it on the ground.

317051019.content: We must call for help from the outside world immediately. Do you have a communicator?

317051020.content: I relented a little after seeing him lay his sword on the ground.

317051021.content: ...I'm sorry, but someone took my communicator.

317051022.content: I see. This is bad. This is really bad...

317051023.content: Um... You mentioned the Crow God just now. Could you tell me anything about it?

317051024.content: My question seemed to give the despondent Karasugo servant a small ray of hope.

317051025.content: Oh, yes, yes. I know a little. If we want to tackle that monster, we must let as many people as possible know about the Crow God—ARGH!

317051026.content: A long blade pierced the chest of the Karasugo family servant, killing him instantly. He had been killed by another Karasugo minion, who'd sneaked up on us from out of nowhere.

317051027.content: This is the end you get for betraying the Lord, misguided one!

317051028.content: What do you think you're doing?!

317051029.content: An outsider... What did he say to you! Speak!

317051030.content: Are the Karasugo really willing to do anything to cover up the secret of the Crow God?

317051031.content: The Crow God... You're not going to leave this place alive either!

317051032.content: The second Karasugo servant, whose blade was still wet with blood, raised his katana again, and I immediately fired my weapon at him, landing hits in both of his legs. However, this servant seemed to have turned into a fearless, ferocious beast, and he continued to lunge at me with his blade—

317051034.content: There was a flash of light, and I saw the blood-wet blade move past me. missing me by a hair's breadth.

317051035.content: As the flash faded, I looked in the direction of the voice and was surprised to see a young lady standing at a railing. The criss-crossing stairs stretched out infinitely behind her, like a door to another world that had brought her here.

317051036.content: The Karasugo servant who had been so close to taking my life had fallen to the ground and was attempting to get up. The young lady looked piteously at him.

317051038.content: I... I'm of no use now.

317051040.content: Then, without any warning, the Karasugo servant produced a dagger and killed himself on the spot. It was over before I could even take a single step towards him.

317051041.content: Damn it! The whole point of shooting at his legs was to spare his life...

317051042.content: It looked like the young lady had wanted to stop him too, though she didn't have the time get a word in either. After the servant passed, she silently withdrew her gaze and started to leave.

317051043.content: Encountering a strange girl in this strange environment was something that made me instinctively keep up my guard. However, there was no hint of danger from her at all, just a vague sense of mystery.

317051044.content: Remembering that she'd just saved me, I decided to take the risk in the end.

317051047.content: The young lady seemed rather reluctant to talk to a stranger.

317051050.content: Then do you know what happened in the Karasugo mansion? And anything about the Crow God?

317051051.content: The young woman still said nothing.

317051052.content: ...Please, if you can, answer my questions now. I'm... I'm an investigator sent by CORG. I can help you.

317051053.content: The young lady looked at me blankly and continued to ignore my questions.

317051054.content: She seemed like an anxious girl who was trapped in a busy social gathering, or like a little bird lingering on a branch. Either way, it looked like she would run away immediately if upset even slightly.

317051055.content: And so I tried to speak in a low voice.

317051056.content: Let's... start with the basics. I'm #{nickname}#. And you are?

317051058.content: The girl had stayed silent for a long time, then decided to leave. I could only sigh in resignation.

317051059.content: Anyway, thanks for the help just now.

317051060.content: As I spoke, I couldn't help but recall the times the Modifiers had protected me and kept me safe from harm.

317051061.content: I can't believe I had to be saved yet again...

317051062.content: The girl had been about to leave, but then she stopped for a moment and looked back over her shoulder at me.

317051065.content: In this world, the humans are the ones who are being protected. So what are you so unhappy about?

317051066.content: Nobody wants to watch the people they care about die for them!

317051067.content: I became rather agitated, perhaps because of what had happened recently, or perhaps because of the people who had left not so long ago.

317051068.content: I don't want to be the one who always needs to be the saved.

317051069.content: The young woman stared at me, as if she was struggling with something inside her.

317051070.content: Now I'm curious. Just how would someone like you meet their end, I wonder...?

317051071.content: ...Is that supposed to be a warning?

317051072.content: After a long silence, she finally looked directly into my eyes.

317051073.content: I can travel with you for a while. Until we get to a safe zone, that is.

317051074.content: Pardon me for asking, but may I know what changed your mind about me?

317051076.content: It seemed like the girl had plenty more to say, but apart from that one line, the remaining ten thousand things stayed hidden in her unfathomable gaze.

317051077.content: Very well. I'll need to get somewhere safe to contact Kuninotokotachi and the rest, anyway... Could I have your name, at least?

317052001.content: A flurry of lights flashed, and the Karasugo servants were defeated one by one, turning into flickering fragments that then floated away into the void.

317052004.content: I wasn't quite sure how to answer her question.

317052005.content: I actually specialize in commanding Modifiers in battle.

317052007.content: Senba looked at my serious expression like she wanted to laugh at my pompous introduction, but felt it inappropriate to do so. The sides of her mouth turned up into an unnatural, comical smile.

317052008.content: I'm going to ignore that. Why were those warriors after you?

317052009.content: The smile disappeared from Senba's face. She looked at me, expressionless, and did not reply.

317052010.content: It's likely that a Visbane has attacked the Karasugo compound. Since you're a Modifier, you should work with me.

317052011.content: So, could you please tell me what happened to those Karasugo minions and the Karasugo family?
