317052012.content: Senba cautiously took a step back, as if she was about to turn tail and run. There was no point in me continuing with my questions.

317052013.content: Very well. I've already experienced so many strange things here, anyway. You're just among them, I guess.

317052014.content: I should focus on finding a way to get to Kuninotokotachi and everyone else...

317052015.content: Senba continued looking at me. Then it seemed like her curiosity finally got the better of her, and for the first time, she initiated a conversation.

317052016.content: So, you... you know a lot about Modifiers?

317052017.content: Of course! You can ask me anything about them.

317052019.content: The question dumbfounded me for a moment. I looked at Senba, and I thought I saw a trace of longing in her eyes, as if she was seeking an answer in the affirmative.

317052020.content: "Understand" Modifiers? There's no such thing. In my opinion, "Modifiers" aren't all part of this great, undifferentiated mass, but instead each is an individual in their own right. Which means I can only understand them one by one.

317052021.content: So you mean, if you get to understand them one by one, you get to understand all of them?

317052022.content: Well... You can only understand another person if you make the effort to do so. "All of them" may be a bit of a stretch, but hang out with them long enough and surely...

317052023.content: I suddenly thought of Verthandi and how she was still lying in an unfamiliar medical facility somewhere.

317052024.content: But just understanding them is not enough.

317052025.content: Senba thought for a while, and ultimately seemed to accept my answer.

317052026.content: I believe you are a decent commander.

317052028.content: Do you seek to be understood by others, by any chance?

317052029.content: Senba's gaze grew cold, and she quickly stepped away from me.

317052030.content: I don't need to be understood by anyone.

317052031.content: Alright then... Well, I don't understand you at all right now. Strictly speaking, we are just traveling companions.

317052032.content: But at least while we're on the same road, let's try to get along.

317052033.content: Senba seemed to accept my suggestion, as she began to seriously think of a suitable way to interact with me.

317052034.content: Questioner. I will call you Questioner.

317052037.content: Or you could just call me "Admin."

317052039.content: Oh, no, no, "Admin" is not a job title here. It's just what the people around me call me... Um, I was just hoping we would feel a little more like friends that way?

317061001.content: The hallway was unusually quiet, but a sense of danger almost crackled in the air.

317061002.content: Every fiber of Kuninotokotachi's being was on high alert when she heard a strange sound coming from a door panel somewhere, and she sent the kunai in her hand flying out in response.

317061004.content: Sekhmet threw the kunai she'd caught in one hand back to Kuninotokotachi.

317061005.content: Why is it that you're always the first one I run into? Just my luck.

317061006.content: Unrestrained utterances of disdain can quickly set the boundaries of a new relationship. I do not oppose that.

317061007.content: I can't believe you're still jabbering away about that at a time like this. You could save us a lot of time by using fewer words.

317061008.content: Hey, do you have any thoughts on this current situation?

317061009.content: Oh? But you're going to trust your own judgment above all, no?

317061010.content: Stop spouting nonsense, you weirdo. My areas of expertise are special and covert ops. I know when to not let my emotions get the best of me.

317061011.content: If I want to find the Admin as soon as possible, I must also take your judgment of the situation into consideration.

317061012.content: Sekhmet was a little surprised to see that Kuninotokotachi's fists were tightly clenched.

317061013.content: Did you say "not let your emotions get the best of you"? I'm not sure I'm convinced... This Administrator must truly be important to the Aether Gazer Modifiers.

317061014.content: But I'm sorry: If we're talking about locating the Administrator, I don't have any good ideas right now.

317061016.content: I performed a test on my way here and I can confirm that this space is not in the Source Layer, so the methods commonly used by Modifiers to shuttle between spaces won't work here.

317061017.content: This also means that we can't use the communicator I have on me to contact the outside world. The smart terminal your Administrator brought probably could've solved this problem, but our opponents got to that before us.

317061018.content: Don't you have any good news to share at all?

317061019.content: This is a great way to structure a conversation. After I lay out the worst-case scenario, our subsequent discussions will be more uplifting in comparison.

317061020.content: You sure are taking your time with things... Your subordinates are somewhere out there too. Aren't you worried about them?

317061021.content: You truly are blessed, Honorable Ninja.

317061023.content: Your behavior at present shows that you've never experienced a permanent parting before. The mere loss of contact with your companions is enough to deeply unsettle you.

317061024.content: Such a low tolerance is only possible in those with sufficiently good past experiences.

317061025.content: Kuninotokotachi wanted to say something, but then she stopped herself. Instead, she flashed Sekhmet a self-deprecating smile.

317061026.content: So, there are times you get things wrong, after all.

317061028.content: Once we leave this dump, I'll drag you to my favorite drinking hole. You're in for a real good story.

317061029.content: But right now, we have other things to do.

317061030.content: ...Looks like you're ready to trust your own judgment now.

317061031.content: I have to, don't I? I mean, you may look wise, but you just said a bunch of nonsense.

317061032.content: So then, what do we do, exactly?

317061033.content: You just said it. Since we're not in the Source Layer, this must be another dimension created by the Crow God.

317061034.content: I've read about this in Aether Gazer's files, as we've defeated Visbanes with similar abilities before. The commonality in these situations is that these dimensions are actually rather small. They only look so big because of a visual trick that the Visbanes use.

317061035.content: If we can find a way to free ourselves from this trick and keep moving forward, we should be able to get to the edge of the dimension, even if we don't run into the others who're trapped here as well.

317062001.content: Our attackers are determined to kill. They'd be very happy to take their enemies down with themselves. Soon, these two factions will be down to their last men.

317062002.content: Kuninotokotachi squeezed her kunai tightly and finally found an opening. She pinned the hand of a Karasugo minion to the wall with one blow, saving another minion from him as a result.

317062003.content: These are the last two surviving Karasugo family servants. One from each side.

317062004.content: Thank you so much. Listen to me—

317062006.content: The attacking Karasugo minion suddenly gritted his teeth and let the kunai pierce through his palm, then raised his blade to land a heavy blow on his opponent...

317062007.content: The sound of a single gunshot rang out, and the attacker was killed instantly. By this point, Agent H had also managed to come to this spot.

317062012.content: You didn't have to kill him with that shot. All we needed to do was incapacitate him.

317062013.content: I understand what you're saying, Miss Modifier, but that's not necessary.

317062014.content: I also saw the Karasugo servants fighting each other on my way here. One side is more receptive to outsiders like us, while the other is focused on hunting down the ones who are friendly to us.

317062015.content: They're quite determined to achieve their goal and will do whatever it takes. Once they fail, they'll kill themselves on the spot.

317062016.content: Even if I hadn't killed him with that shot just now, it's very likely that neither of them would be saved in the end.

317062017.content: He is right. Thank you for your help.

317062018.content: H, don't holster that just yet.

317062019.content: Agent H immediately understood and raised his gun again, aiming it at the last surviving Karasugo family servant.

317062020.content: I have some questions for you. You're not to move an inch until I'm done with you.

317062021.content: I understand. I have many things to tell you too...

317062022.content: I'll ask the questions, and you'll answer. That's how it'll goes.

317062024.content: Has the Crow God been destroyed?

317062025.content: No! The Crow God now controls the entire Karasugo family! We can't fight it on our own... not even with you here! We need more reinforcements!

317062026.content: Are the strange things happening with the Karasugo due to the Crow God?

317062027.content: If you're asking me how powerful the Crow God is, I can only tell you that this is not all it's capable of. The minions that the Crow God summons, for example, are truly terrifying.

317062028.content: Where is the Crow God now?

317062029.content: It could be anywhere... We're all sitting ducks inside this trap of the Crow God's.

317062030.content: Who is the head of the Karasugo family?

317062031.content: The servant paused for a moment at Sekhmet's query.

317062032.content: How could you not know who the... Lord of the Karasugo family is?

317062033.content: That's right, I don't. Is there a problem?

317062034.content: Um... Of course, our Lord is Karasugo Sendou.

317062035.content: Sekhmet started at the servant's face, searching closely for the tiniest of clues.

317062036.content: You just told a lie. I'll give you one more chance: Tell me who the real head of the Karasugo family is.

317062037.content: No, I... I can't! I want to live!

317062038.content: The Karasugo minion suddenly became very afraid and suddenly got up to leave.

317062040.content: Agent H immediately raised his gun and fired, hitting the Karasugo servant in the left leg. The servant staggered, but continued to rush forward, gritting his teeth. Then, he lost his footing and fell from the edge of the platform.

317062042.content: No! You were supposed to interrogate him, not kill him!

317062043.content: Yes, and this shows that I was asking the right question.

317062044.content: Captain, were you trying to verify point number six in the note?

317062045.content: Are we seriously still talking about that note right now?

317062046.content: Have you tried putting together a jigsaw puzzle before, Honorable Ninja?

317062047.content: While two random pieces of a puzzle may not belong together, you still have to find a way to connect them so that you can complete the image.

317062048.content: I'm not listening to your drivel.

317062049.content: I'm sticking to my original plan. The most important thing now is to find the Admin.

317062050.content: I'm alright with that. Besides, if we run into more enemies, we may be able to learn more.

317071001.content: It seemed that there was no end to the criss-crossing stairs, which were somehow connected to each other end-to-end. I followed Senba for a long time, but still we did not reach a safe zone.

317071002.content: Although we hadn't encountered any enemies for a while, I'd reached my limit in some of my physiological indicators.

317071005.content: In a way, yes... Could we take a short break here?

317071006.content: What do you want to do?

317071007.content: I pulled out the emergency food rations that were in my backpack.

317071008.content: I have to eat. Eating is a core human behavior, though it's of course simulated by Gaea here.

317071009.content: Senba appeared interested in the food I'd retrieved from my backpack, and she stopped walking. I took that as a sign that she'd agreed to my request for a short break.

317071010.content: Is that coffee? Don't you have to grind the beans first?

317071011.content: This is canned coffee. Haven't you seen it before?

317071013.content: Senba stared at me in surprise as I pulled open the lid and took a drink of the coffee inside. She had obviously never seen coffee served this way before.

317071014.content: Ah, I suppose you do look like an upper-class lady who's spent most of her time at home. I'm guessing you've never seen something so plain before?

317071015.content: ...Are you trying to uncover clues to my identity?

317071017.content: Senba eyed me warily, like a wild cat wanting me to keep away. But, also like a cat, she was curious, and she kept looking at the can of coffee in my hand.

317071018.content: Do you want a try? I should have another can in my pack...

317071019.content: Hmm... I want the one that's in your hand.

317071021.content: If there was poison in it, you would be crippled by pain by now.

317071022.content: Huh?! That's a horrible accusation to lob at someone without proof!

317071023.content: As I was speaking, Senba snatched the can of coffee from my hand, sniffed at it, and took a sip. I did not have enough of my wits about me to stop her.

317071024.content: Doesn't that mean that we've indirectly...

317071026.content: I can't tell if you're being deliberately obtuse here. Shouldn't you care more about that than poison?

317071027.content: Senba clearly wasn't thinking about what I was implying. She tasted the coffee, then handed the can back to me in disappointment.

317071028.content: The coffee's cold. I don't like it.

317071029.content: I glanced at the faint lipstick mark at the mouth of the can. After some thought, I put it aside and opened another one.

317071030.content: I don't care that it's cold now. I have to stay alert no matter what.

317071031.content: So, you feel both hunger and fatigue? Humans have so many weaknesses.

317071032.content: Yes, but perhaps these "weaknesses" are proof that humans are, well, still human. Gaea wouldn't have retained these characteristics in us otherwise.

317071033.content: I just find it so troublesome. You're far too vulnerable here.

317071034.content: That one sip of canned coffee Senba took appeared to have exhausted her curiosity. She'd lost her interest in staying with me, and again seemed like a little bird ready to take off any minute.

317071035.content: But my deep hunger told me not to proceed any further, so I had to find another way to entice her to stay a while longer.

317071036.content: I also have some compressed rations here. I made them myself a few days ago, to suit the tastebuds of Modifiers. Do you want to give one a try?

317071037.content: To suit the tastebuds of Modifiers...?

317071038.content: Um... Some of my Modifier friends like this one very much.

317071039.content: Anyway, I'm not the only one who finds it quite delicious. Well, if you don't want any, I'll start first.

317071040.content: Although I'd managed to arouse Senba's curiosity once again, she simply stared at me. I decided to take a bite myself first.

317071041.content: You don't look like you're in pain...

317071043.content: Senba finally reached for the ration I was holding out to her and took a small bite. Just moments later, however, she suddenly froze.

317071045.content: I know. Compressed rations don't have the best texture.

317071046.content: Senba suddenly started to wolf down the ration, as if she'd finally tasted something she hadn't eaten in a long time.

317071047.content: Wow. I know it's not terrible, but...

317071048.content: Senba was silent for a long time after she finished the ration I gave her, like she was still mentally savoring it.

317071049.content: I've got quite a bit more here, if you want some more.

317071050.content: ...How did you make it taste like that?

317071051.content: That's what you want to know? There's no big secret. I've taken care of Modifiers from time to time, and their cooking skills are, well... less than desirable. So I usually end up cooking for them, and I learned from there.

317071052.content: You're an administrator. Why would you take care of them?

317071053.content: Oh, but I don't think of myself as their superior or anything.

317071054.content: To be honest, I still have no idea why Aether Gazer appointed me as an administrator. They didn't even issue a weapon to me at the beginning.

317071055.content: I watched those Modifiers engage in battle with Visbanes every day from the sidelines, wondering what I could do to help.

317071056.content: Senba did not say a word. She looked like she was thinking over what I'd just said.

317071059.content: For letting me taste this again.

317071061.content: I looked at the ration in my hand and started feeling a little emotional all of a sudden.

317071062.content: That's not anywhere near enough. I'd love to be able to really help them.

317071064.content: Senba looked at me, completely earnest.

317071066.content: Senba, I don't understand. Why are you suddenl—

317071067.content: Senba rose to her feet without a word. Obviously, she didn't want to explain herself. She looked at me like I was a stranger, as though we were meeting for the first time again.

317071068.content: Questioner, I'm taking you to a safe zone. Just stay behind me, please?

317071069.content: Isn't that what we already agreed on?

317071070.content: Senba looked at me with a serious expression on her face.

317071072.content: I wanted to say something, but I decided not to. I had no idea why Senba's attitude had changed, but I detected a trace of sadness in her eyes.

317071073.content: This sadness was hidden deep within those calm, quiet eyes. It may as well have been an iron door to Senba's mind, shutting me out from her thoughts.

317071074.content: Maybe when this is all over, I'll have a chance to understand you.

317071075.content: Senba lowered her eyes and rebuffed my suggestion again.

317071076.content: I don't need anyone to understand me.

317071077.content: In the end, I failed to break through the iron gate of sadness that had closed off Senba's inner world.

317071079.content: I hastily finished part of my rations, and then I was ready to commence the journey again.

317081001.content: The stairs continued to go on without end. Just as I was thinking I would never get out of this maze, there was a sudden burst of noisy footsteps in the hallway next door.

317081002.content: I hear other people, Senba. Should we go and ask them for help?

317081004.content: We can't just keeping walking like this, though.

317081006.content: If they get you, they'll cut and slice and dice you. It would make a mess. I would hate that.

317081007.content: Are you... trying to scare me?

317081009.content: What, are you mad that it didn't work?

317081011.content: I know it's risky, but right now the two of us are just flying blind. With any luck, we may meet someone who is willing to work with us.

317081013.content: Then what am I, chopped liver?

317081016.content: I wanted to press my case a little more, but Senba had already turned around and walked further into the maze. I had no choice but to run after her.

317081017.content: Senba, I know you were just attacked by those warriors, but I did meet one earlier who was willing to talk. It's just...

317081018.content: Maybe we could resolve some misunderstandings if you let me speak to any other warriors we meet first.

317081019.content: Senba suddenly stopped and looked at me angrily.

317081020.content: There's nobody who will work with me.

317081021.content: As I was wondering why Senba was being so resistant, the people in the hallway next to us noticed our presence, and they came over to us.

317081022.content: Are you from the outside world? Do you know how I can get out of here?

317081023.content: This question again... I take it you're from the faction that's willing to work with outsiders, then?

317081024.content: Of course! As long as we can get out of here as soon as possible!

317081025.content: Okay, just a moment. I don't yet know how we can get out of this space. But we should be able to find a way if we work together.

317081026.content: First and foremost, have you seen any CORG agents or a young female ninja, by any chance?

317081028.content: The Karasugo family servants had their eyes firmly fixed on Senba.

317081029.content: Wait, calm down! Listen to me. She's not the enemy. If you want to fight the Crow God, she can help.

317081030.content: Do you know what you're saying?! No... You must be on her side, too!

317081031.content: The Karasugo servants swiftly drew their blades. Colder than the blades was Senba's gaze, now reflected in the sharp metal.

317082001.content: The Karasugo minions who were not felled by Senba fled in utter desperation.

317082002.content: The gentle-looking woman who'd floated out of the mirror slowly leaned towards Senba, as if to embrace her, but just before making contact, she turned into shards of light that slowly dissipated.

317082003.content: We're not getting that close to other people again.

317082004.content: Senba looked at me, her face grave. I wasn't sure if that was a warning or a plea.

317082005.content: ...Those people must be from the side that opposes the Crow God. So why would they want to fight you?

317082006.content: It was at this point that a thought suddenly struck me, and I reflexively took a step back.

317082007.content: Senba, what are you hiding from me?

317082009.content: Senba was showing clear resistance, but I continued asking anyway.

317082010.content: Senba... are you from the pro-Crow God faction?

317082011.content: Senba hesitated for a long time before finally replying.

317082012.content: If that's what you want to think.

317082013.content: Bits and pieces of information flooded my mind, finally confirming that my speculation was truly possible. The knowledge of this possibility began to dictate my subsequent actions.

317082014.content: I subconsciously reached for my weapon, but then suddenly remembered how overwhelmingly Senba had dominated the fight just moments before. There seemed to be only one logical option for me.

317082015.content: I slowly backed away from her, then immediately ran towards a turn in the hall. Given the jumbled structure of the space, as long as I swiftly could get out of her sight, I'd have a chance to escape!

317082017.content: I heard a low murmur from Senba that sounded like a plea for me to stay, albeit a rather restrained plea.

317082018.content: I turned my head back, driven by some unknown force, only to see that Senba had taken only a glance towards me before looking away again.

317082019.content: She did not try to stop or attack me. She appeared to just silently accept what had happened, then turned around and walked away from me.

317082021.content: It hit me that not long ago, I had similar doubts about Himiko and kept my distance from her. By the time I finally understood her, it was too late.

317082022.content: Why does this feel so familiar?

317082023.content: This purely emotional voice finally overcome my logic. I stopped, braced myself, then ran in the direction Senba had gone in.

317082025.content: Senba turned around and looked at me, incredulous.

317082027.content: You didn't answer my question properly.

317082029.content: Afraid? Even if my guess is right, running away from you won't solve anything. So I've decided to hedge my bets instead.

317082030.content: What are you betting on here?

317082031.content: That I can come to understand you after all.

317082032.content: Senba looked at me, astonished. She wanted the wall between us to come back up, but she could not push away my determination.

317082033.content: I... I don't need anyone to understand me.

317082034.content: Senba, from our interactions, I'm now certain that you're an upper-class lady.

317082035.content: No matter how you try to hide it, I know there's something you're not telling me. As a leader of Modifiers, I'm obliged to understand and guide you.

317082036.content: And what if I turn out to be a bad person?

317082037.content: Remember what you said when we first met? "Do not harm the innocent"? You haven't hurt me all this time we've been traveling together, either. I don't care what other people say. I don't think you're a bad person.

317082038.content: The iron gate deep in Senba's eyes seemed to have opened a little, but then it immediately slammed shut again.

317082039.content: Are you really staking your safety on what you think?

317082040.content: Not just think, but feel. I'm going to be mocked by a certain captain at CORG for saying this, but as a human, I still believe in feelings.

317082041.content: Then, all of a sudden, Senba activated her Access Key again.

317082042.content: You should leave. Are you really sure that I won't harm you?

317082043.content: ...Like I said, I'm placing a bet here.

317082044.content: I looked at her in silence, refusing to reach for my weapon.

317082045.content: The shining blade stopped just short of my forehead. Senba stood there for a moment, not saying a word. Then she sheathed her Key.

317082046.content: I can't shake you off, can I. Hmph...

317082047.content: Looks like I've won the bet.

317082048.content: Senba fell silent again, this time for quite a while. At last, she seemed to accept that I was not going to leave her.

317082049.content: Let's keep going, then. Just... don't try to understand me anymore.

317082050.content: You're only making me more curious by saying that, Senba. How about we just keep talking a little?

317082053.content: And just like when we first met, Senba and I both accepted each other's company as we set off again.

317082054.content: I had no idea what the consequences of traveling with this potentially dangerous companion would be. But I knew I couldn't let her go off by herself.

317091001.content: Kuninotokotachi and her companions moved through the endless hallway for a long, long time. However, as they wanted to find their friends as soon as possible, no one suggested taking a break.

317091002.content: Then suddenly, Agent H stopped in his tracks and went on high alert.

317091003.content: There's a Karasugo family servant up ahead. Not sure if they're friend or foe.

317091004.content: Kuninotokotachi and Sekhmet followed Agent H's gaze and discovered the servant was in front of them, sitting upright but motionless against a wall. He was holding a knife in one hand, and there appeared to be something else in the other.

317091005.content: Hey! We're investigators from the outside world. Are you okay?

317091006.content: Agent H spoke in a loud voice, but was met with silence. Sekhmet suddenly took Agent H's rifle and fired several shots at the servant's legs, sending sawdust everywhere. However, he remained completely still.

317091008.content: ...Is this how CORG goes about its business?

317091009.content: If you have feedback, you're welcome to fill out our satisfaction survey.

317091010.content: Do you really have one? Then you can look forward to some fantastic comments from me.

317091011.content: The duo did not waste any time. Even as they bickered, they continued to approach the corpse with great caution. While there weren't any obvious external injuries on the body, they found the dead man's lips were chapped, and his eyes were sunken.

317091012.content: Looks like he starved to death here. Search him, H.

317091013.content: Agent H quickly searched the Karasugo servant's body. He came across a piece of paper balled up in his fist.

317091014.content: Now I wonder if any of the servants we saw earlier had notes hidden on them too...

317091015.content: Sekhmet opened up the piece of paper, allowing everyone to see the words upon it.

317091016.content:
To all of you brave warriors— There's been a catastrophic occurrence in the family, and there's no way of stopping it. The Crow God has awakened and is wreaking havoc on the house with its underlings.

Many of us have been deceived. Now, we have no choice but to fight each other. But even if you've managed to avoid your peers so far, do not allow yourself to become complacent.

The minions summoned by the Crow God are already in this maze and are waiting for the chance to kill us. I ran into a group of them but was unable to defeat them. Fortunately, I survived, and so I leave this letter in the hope that it will reach you all.

The minions summoned by the Crow God are ferocious and monstrous. They do not resemble humans or any beasts we know of. They seem to be... machines that spread fear everywhere.

Once you engage in battle with them, your mind will soon be disturbed, until you're unable to even swing your sword. Therefore, never get close to these machines. Instead, make your escape from here. Warn the outside world. Call for reinforcements!

317091021.content: Is the Crow God able to summon Visbanes? That's right, the fellow before said something about this, too. There should be the intel file on the Crow God right here.

317091022.content: Little wonder that the Crow God trapped him and left him here to die.

317091023.content: If the Crow God is summoning Visbanes, our squads should be able to handle them with the Divine Grace rounds we brought with us.

317091024.content: We've been quite lucky. We've not met even a single Visbane all this time we've been inside this dimension.

317091025.content: Then suddenly, they could hear a sound from a place down the hallway. It was like the sound of a staticky TV screen or a radio being tuned to different channels.

317091026.content: Without warning, several odd-looking Visbanes appeared in their path.

317091027.content: The "machines that spread fear everywhere"... Interesting. They look more or less like I thought they would.

317091028.content: So much for "we've not met even a single Visbane." You jinxed it.

317091029.content: The term "jinx" is a slander upon individuals with abilities of precognition.

317091030.content: Besides, doesn't it make sense to encounter a monster near a body that left a message alerting you to their presence? It's like coming across a cactus in the desert.

317091034.content: The strange Visbanes kept repeating certain phrases, as if they were reeling from a large amount of complicated information that had just been poured into their brains.

317091035.content: Captain, the enemy seems to have launched their attack!

317092001.content: Kuninotokotachi's kunai struck the last Visbane precisely. The strange beings were finally wiped out, taking that vexing noise with them.

317092002.content: There's nothing left for us to study now...

317092003.content: Well, if you aren't worried about your subordinates' brains turning into mush, I'm happy to save the next one for you.

317092004.content: Captain? Did I just hear gunshots?

317092005.content: The group's conversation was cut short by the intermittent sound of gunshots coming from deep down the hallway.

317092006.content: I couldn't hear those gunshots before because of those Visbanes. Now that I can, they sound like they're from the rifles issued to the department. I think those are our people!

317092007.content: The group quickly ran towards the sound of the gunfire. They came to a spot in the hallway that was strewn with the remains of Visbanes. There were also the bodies of more than a dozen Karasugo servants, who had been shot.

317092008.content: And the end of the hallway was the petite figure of Agent K, who earlier had been separated from the group.

317092013.content: Great to see the both of you, Captain and H!

317092014.content: With all these weird things happening, I'm beginning to come round to the way you people do things...

317092016.content: Wait a second. Did you take down all of these opponents by yourself?!

317092017.content: I almost ran out of ammo, even though I'd turned off full auto mode. If we use the more powerful .62 Divine Grace ammo next time, our attack should be even more effective.

317092018.content: Kuninotokotachi's jaw dropped in astonishment. In contrast, Sekhmet and Agent H appeared rather nonplussed about what K just said.

317092019.content: K, tell us what you've learned.

317092020.content: Understood... So I was on my own after I became separated from everyone. I found myself walking in circles in this area, and then I was attacked by some Karasugo servants who came out from nowhere.

317092021.content: And then those Visbanes also appeared. But fortunately, before this I'd run into someone who had been trapped here and passed away, and I managed to read the intel on those Visbanes that was in his hand.

317092022.content: That means we aren't the only ones in this situation...

317092023.content: It looks like you haven't drawn any conclusions yet. Let's take this formidable young lady with us and keep moving.

317103001.content: When it became clear that she was looking at a scene that was all too familiar, Sekhmet stopped everyone.

317103002.content: I'm sorry, Honorable Ninja, but I think we need a change of plans.

317103003.content: If the "change" you're talking about is to abandon the search for the Admin right now, you'd better have a really good reason.

317103004.content: Hmm... Change in emotions is within the expected range. Looks like this conversation is doable.

317103005.content: Sekhmet took out the piece of paper again and drew simple shapes on it with her fingernail.

317103006.content: I assure you that no matter how long we move in the direction you choose, we'll never reach the "edge," Honorable Ninja. This is why I've decided to change the plan.

317103007.content: Kuninotokotachi looked at the picture drawn by Sekhmet and quickly understood.

317103008.content: We've entered some sort of loop, then? Since when?

317103009.content: From the time we bashed our way through the filter.

317103010.content: Kuninotokotachi fell into deep thought at the word "filter."

317103011.content: Think about it. The area we passed through earlier—it's obvious now that it was a filter, no?

317103012.content: Let's assume that, as some of the Karasugo servants said, the cause of the family's problems is the reawakened Crow God, just like with the Snake God. But before it can make its plans come to fruition, the Crow God must first take control of the family that serves it.

317103013.content: Now, the Karasugo family has split into two factions, one of which has taken the Crow God's promises at face value and pledged allegiance to it. The other faction, however, has seen through its lies and is trying its hardest to contact the outside world for help.

317103014.content: So, the Crow God has used its powers to drag most of the Karasugo family into this space so it can filter through them.

317103015.content: Hmm. So those who choose to serve the Crow God will be able to pass through that area, while those who seek the help of the outside world will be funneled to a trap...

317103016.content: That's just the first level. The anti-Crow God individuals who are either powerful or intelligent enough, and who can overcome the trap or see through the prompts on the portal, will also be able to pass through that area.

317103017.content: We've already seen what happens to some of these folks. This loop is for them.

317103018.content: So, we'll die trapped in this loop? No way! I'd rather die battling a super powerful Visbane or something...

317103019.content: I don't see any of our people trapped here yet. That's good.

317103020.content: So you just said a whole bunch of things. But is there any way we can get out of this?

317103021.content: Sekhmet's eyes fell on Agent K.

317103022.content: K, you fought several of the Karasugo family's servants. Do you know which side they're on?

317103023.content: Which side? They started charging at me while I was looking at the piece of paper in the corpse's hand. So I'm guessing they're from the pro-Crow God faction?

317103024.content: There are pro-Crow God folks in this space too? But isn't this place meant to trap those who oppose it?

317103025.content: Perhaps it's because the intel their opponents have is so important, they have to destroy it themselves.

317103026.content: If we continue with this line of thought... Then they also must know a way to exit the loop.

317103027.content: But I already killed those people... Damn my muscle memory...!

317103028.content: Since we know that they're from the pro-Crow God faction, we also know that they must be using a secret passage to enter and exit the loop. There must be some mechanism to access this passage, then.

317103030.content: Sekhmet replied confidently before Kuninotokotachi could even utter another doubt.

317103032.content: ...The ridiculous thing here is, you're actually right most of the time.

317103033.content: H, K, prepare to search around us.

317102001.content: The encounter did not last very long. Together, the two Modifiers and two CORG agents made quick work of their ambushers, and soon these Karasugo servants turned to another option—to ensure that none of them would survive.

317102002.content: Ugh! I was already holding back!

317102003.content: They knew that we were holding back, too. That's why they acted so quickly.

317102004.content: No time to waste on them now. Now that we've broken free of the loop, we must go look for the Admin!

317102005.content: Considering what happened before, do you really think that we can find the Administrator by just blindly plodding ahead, Honorable Ninja?

317102006.content: Kuninotokotachi clenched her fists, then reluctantly relaxed them after a moment.

317102007.content: What do you say we do, then?

317102008.content: I've long heard about the professionalism of Aether Gazer Modifiers when on missions. We don't need to spend too much time arguing, it seems.

317102009.content: You just wasted time to say that.

317102010.content: Sekhmet looked back on the space the group had just emerged from, as if she was searching for some kind of pattern.

317102011.content: This space was carefully designed to filter, imprison, and ambush...

317102012.content: You don't have to remind me just how dangerous a predicament the Admin could be in right now.

317102013.content: Focus, Honorable Ninja. On what's important.

317102014.content: So far, we've not seen the Crow God in action yet. It's been using its minions and traps to deal with the problems it can't see.

317102016.content: My conclusion is the result of experimentation. If the Crow God has the ability to take action, it would have opened the door for its minions itself, without needing to leave behind a mechanism that can be used by outsiders.

317102017.content: So you were rolling the dice back then.

317102018.content: I was testing the hypothesis formed by my intuition.

317102019.content: It's possible that the Crow God simply doesn't want to waste its time on matters that his minions can handle. But look at how it can only trap the opponents its minions can't handle in the loop. It can't even deal with the intel they're carrying on their persons.

317102020.content: This Crow God you're describing sounds like something that's been locked up in a cage...

317102021.content: Or more accurately, its abilities have been restrained. Again, the case of the Deer God showed us that it's possible. We can infer that the Sasanami Five all have ways to keep the mountain gods they worship in check.

317102022.content: We can then infer that the Crow God has broken through some of the restraints that've been placed on it and regained certain abilities, including the ability to create this dimension.

317102023.content: And in this dimension, it can set certain rules. However, since it hasn't regained all of its abilities, there are many situations in which it cannot take action.

317102024.content: Do you mean to say that it can only act in the most critical of times?

317102025.content: You've finally come to the important part, Honorable Ninja.

317102026.content: We've tried to break a number of the "rules" so far. If we attempt to contact the outside world, the Crow God's minions will try to stop us. If we want to leave the mansion, we'll be dragged into a different space. If we choose the wrong door, we'll encounter an ambush.

317102027.content: But there is only one hidden rule that may be absolutely fatal, and it's likely a rule that the Crow God has to personally uphold using its limited power. That is, you must not try to figure out the identity of the Karasugo family's head.

317102028.content: Everyone immediately thought back to the strange behavior of that Karasugo family servant. They all seemed to understand something, though their brows remained furrowed.

317102029.content: Isn't Karasugo Sendou the Lord of the Karasugo family?

317102030.content: Point number six: "The head of the Karasugo family is not Karasugo Sendou"...

317102031.content: H, I think you wrote it this way on purpose. Not only to remind the people who would come after you, but also to avoid drawing the Crow God's attacks.

317102032.content: But so what if Karasugo Sendou is not the head of the Karasugo family? Why would that matter to the Crow God? Surely, it could just have another puppet in the Karasugo family.

317102033.content: Why would the Crow God want to hide the identity of this puppet?

317102035.content: Before I arrived at the mansion, I looked into the Karasugo and found that most of the information about the Crow God had been erased.

317102036.content: I could find no writing on the miracles of the Crow God, no images, and nothing about its believers or worship ceremonies.

317102037.content: Then can it be that the Crow God's greatest weakness lies in having its true face revealed?

317102038.content: Hmm... If you're right, it means that the Crow God has taken on a new appearance, which the Karasugo servants know, and its physical body is rather weak.

317102039.content: As long as we can pinpoint this new identity... we'll be able to defeat the Crow God.

317102040.content: And this identity... is the actual head of the family.

317102041.content: Very astute, Honorable Ninja. As soon as we can figure out who controls this dimension, we'll know how to end this game.

317102042.content: So, how do we find this head of the family?

317102043.content: Look at how well-trained and quick-acting all of these Karasugo family servants are.

317102044.content: Hmm. So, if we want to find our people as soon as possible, we should make the same choices and decisions as they would...

317102045.content: No matter what they choose to do next, they'll always return to their master in the end.

317102046.content: So from now on, whatever choices we make here in this maze have to be the same as theirs.

317102047.content: The group quickly rounded the corner of the hallway. They did not see the two pairs of eyes hidden in the dark.

317102048.content: Did you hear what they said, sir?

317102050.content: Remember, we've been told that we can't trust anyone in this dimension. Because information is the most dangerous thing here.

317102051.content: We should continue trying to buy time and wait as instructed, then?

317102052.content: Kagutsuchi remained silent and slowly tightened his grip on the hilt of his blade.

317102053.content: If only everything could be like fishing. All you have to do there is to sit around and wait for good results. The world would be a much better place then...

317102055.content: We should split up right now. Don't send the communicator you snatched from the commander in for destruction just yet. Hide it somewhere safe as soon as possible.

317102057.content: After the Shadow Crow left, Kagutsuchi emerged from his hiding place and ran straight ahead, in the direction Kuninotokotachi and the others had gone.

317111001.content: I turned a corner. Just as I was thinking I was about to embark on another walk down yet another endless hallway, I heard the sound of a quarrel, which made me go on the alert.

317111002.content: A number of Karasugo servants were gathered at the landing of a staircase. They were holding one of their rivals captive and arguing about something.

317111003.content: Tie up his hands and feet. And remove that poison capsule from his mouth!

317111004.content: Too many of us have died already! We need all the manpower we can get!

317111005.content: No way! I'm not listening to any of your babble!

317111006.content: The rival bit down hard, but the person trying to stop him suddenly stuck four fingers into his mouth. The hand soon ran with blood, but the fingers stayed in, successfully preventing the man from biting down on the capsule.

317111008.content: Listen! The Crow God has taken control of the Karasugo family. If you continue to serve it, you'll only be helping evildoers!

317111009.content: The rival continued to put up a fierce struggle as he tried to back away from his would-be rescuer. However, because his hands, feet, and even his head were restrained, he found little success.

317111010.content: Look, we've been through so much together. Why can't you just listen to me now? Don't tell me... I know! The Crow God must have the ability to control human minds!

317111011.content: That's what happened to you! You need to come to your senses right now!

317111012.content: The would-be rescuer's analysis was quickly echoed by most of the others present, who quickly plunged into the task of convincing their rival.

317111014.content: Eventually, doubt and confusion appeared in the rival's eyes.

317111015.content: Am I... really under mind control?

317111017.content: Fantastic. Let's search this area again to see if there's anyone else being controlled by the Crow God. The more people we save, the better our chances of getting out will be!

317111018.content: Watching this scene from around the corner of the hall, I was gobsmacked.

317111019.content: They can be talked out of mind control?

317111021.content: It was the most sternly Senba had spoken to me since we met.

317111022.content: That... That's one of your people over there. Aren't you going to save him?

317111025.content: Senba turned and ran back into the darkness, to a spot where she couldn't be seen. She was like a cat whose owner had annoyed it and caused it to retreat into a box.

317111026.content: When I found her, her eyes were full of resentment.

317111027.content: I'm a horrible monster and I will eat you if you're not careful.

317111030.content: Alright, then. I confess that I'm a little wary of you.

317111031.content: That's what you should do. Be wary.

317111032.content: Senba said this without much emotion. She wasn't being caustic; instead she was giving me a reminder, even though I already knew that she wouldn't hurt me.

317111033.content: Senba, even if you are a horrible monster, I should at least get to know why I'm going to be eaten, right?

317111034.content: Monsters by nature want to eat people. That's what everyone thinks. Therefore, people are eaten by monsters.

317111035.content: That's a little hard to understand... But, if a person were saved by a monster, then that person wouldn't think like that, am I right?

317111036.content: "Saved by a monster"... What a strange idea.

317111037.content: Monsters will reach for you when you aren't paying attention and dice you up, making a mess everywhere...

317111038.content: Yes, yes, I understand. Why are you still trying to scare me like that?

317111039.content: Senba had calmed down a little. However, she suddenly gave me a very complicated look.

317111040.content: Just don't go near those people, Questioner.

317111041.content: ...I'm guessing you're not going to tell me why?

317111042.content: I don't want to... I can't.

317111043.content: Very well. I trust you. But I have no intention of leaving you here.

317111044.content: Those people are hostile to you and you don't want to be near them. That, I understand. But we can't keep hiding in this place. They'll find us eventually. We need to skirt around them and leave this area.

317111046.content: I wasn't sure how to answer her sudden query.

317111047.content: The most logical thing for me to do, with a girl I knew nothing about and who was possibly very dangerous, was to keep my distance from her.

317111048.content: But just like before, all of the emotions in my heart had come together to form this inexplicable driving force that stopped me from leaving.

317111049.content: I... don't trust you. Just like we talked about. I just want to... try and understand you.

317111050.content: I already told you: Don't try to understand me.

317111051.content: I will not make the same mistake again!

317111052.content: My memories of the events from not long ago suddenly came to mind. I couldn't stop myself from clutching at my chest, as though that would somehow lessen the pain there.

317111053.content: I won't worry incessantly until I have to resign myself to accepting the logical choice at the end. Not this time.

317111054.content: Maybe things would be different if I had tried to understand her earlier.

317111055.content: I blurted these words out. It was like they had been in my heart for quite a while, influencing my actions all this time.

317111056.content: Senba, one of the responsibilities of the Modifier's commander is to understand them. I may not look like it to you, but I know what I'm doing.

317111057.content: Senba was quiet for a long time. Then she finally looked at me again.

317111058.content: My promise hasn't changed. As long as you agree not to go near those people, I will handle everything else.

317111059.content: You can have whatever thoughts you want. But you must promise me that you'll stay behind me.

317112001.content: This time around, Senba's moves looked much cleaner and more intentional. Gone were the sense of restraint and the ire. The attackers quickly fell to the ground.

317112003.content: That should be the last of them around here...

317112004.content: However, Senba hadn't quite finish the job. A Karasugo servant who hadn't yet lost consciousness suddenly grabbed my leg and pleaded with me loudly.

317112005.content: Why are you with her? Are you under mind control too?

317112007.content: The Crow God is capable of controlling the minds of humans! Come to your senses!

317112009.content: I tried to break free from the other person's grip, but I lost my balance and fell. My vision went completely dark.

317112010.content: The Crow God is capable of mind control...

317112011.content: Is that what's happening to me...?

317112012.content: Just as these thoughts began to occur to me, I was overcome by a great dizzying sensation, as if something was truly trying to devour my mind.

317112013.content: But the dizziness disappeared as quickly as it came. I opened my eyes again.

317112015.content: I'm alright. Just a little dizzy. I can stand up myself.

317112017.content: Incredibly, Senba had a worried expression on her face. But this inadvertently exposed emotion disappeared in a flash.

317112018.content: Like I said. I hate to see humans die.

317121001.content: We turned a few corners, then came to an open space that seemed to be in another world altogether. And then, the light and various sounds faded away as Senba and I finally stopped inside a closed, silent room.

317121002.content: Here we are. A place with no one else.

317121004.content: We wait here for everything to end.

317121005.content: Senba, none of this will go away if we just wait. It's our mission to end all this!

317121007.content: Senba's eyes were hard as granite. There was no room for negotiations or appeals.

317121008.content: ...Senba, if this has been your intent all along, then I think it's time for me to say goodbye.

317121009.content: I'm sorry that I never got to understand you.

317121010.content: I turned around and walked back towards the hallway we had came from. But the door I'd come through had vanished, leaving only a wall in its place.

317121011.content: Stay here, Questioner. Just... stay here.

317121012.content: This time around, the emotion was clear in Senba's voice. I looked at the wall in front of me and slowly clenched my fists.

317121013.content: Senba, that door earlier... and this one now. You're the master of this dimension, aren't you?

317121014.content: ...If that's what you want to think.

317121015.content: Having arrived at this conclusion, I realized that being passive wasn't going to help now.

317121016.content: Senba! Every second we wait here, someone is going to die. I can't stand by and watch this happen! You must know the secret of this dimension. Why won't you tell me?

317121017.content: No matter what you're dealing with, if you don't talk about it, no one can help you!

317121018.content: Senba remained silent even as I became more agitated. There was an indescribable loneliness in her eyes, but she remained as quiet as ever.

317121019.content: Senba, after all we've been through together, surely we can... be considered companions by now?

317121020.content: Then do you still not trust me?

317121022.content: Senba's denial came swiftly and forcefully.

317121023.content: You just have to stay here, Questioner, and I promise you'll be saved.

317121024.content: Perhaps Senba had become too engrossed in her argument with me, for she failed to notice the spatial distortion that had appeared behind her. A strange-looking Visbane appeared from a space rift and quietly extended its tentacles towards her.

317121026.content: Almost instinctively, I pulled Senba behind me and quickly aimed my gun at the Visbane. But I was unable to stop it even after landing two direct hits on it. Then, all of a sudden, the Visbane let out a piercing cry that almost shattered my eardrums.

317121027.content: I had to cover my ears with my hands, and the Visbane took the opportunity to stab at me with more than a dozen tentacles. Although the clothing specially developed by the Cryptics provided me with some protection, the blows still left a number of wounds on my body.

317121029.content: There was a burst of bright light, and the tentacles of the Visbanes were all cut off at once.

317121030.content: Senba had activated her Access Key once again. She glared at the Visbanes that were still coming at us through the space rift.

317122001.content: In this fierce encounter, Senba wiped out our attackers in what must have been record time.

317122002.content: Did the Crow God summon these Visbanes?

317122003.content: Why did you do that? Didn't we agree that you would stay behind me?!

317122004.content: My thoughts were interrupted by Senba. Even after she'd confirmed I was fine, her emotions remained heightened.

317122005.content: They were going to ambush you. And I didn't have the time to—

317122006.content: Just do what we agreed on! Stay behind me!

317122007.content: Senba stared at me. Although her words were full of reproach, there was no trace of anger in her eyes. Instead, they were full of... fear.

317122008.content: The recent events seemed to have reminded her of a terrible experience.

317122010.content: Senba seemed to realize that she'd lost control of her emotions. It looked like she was about to offer an explanation, but at the last moment she held herself back.

317122011.content: She walked away from me and huddled in a corner, silently enduring a pain only she knew.

317122013.content: My eyes widened. I took a closer look at this mysterious person in front of me. Now, she just looked like a confused and helpless young girl.

317122014.content: I tried to stand closer to Senba, but stayed at a distance she'd be comfortable with.

317122015.content: Senba, I still don't believe that you're a bad person.

317122018.content: Alright, but at least let me shoulder some of your burden!

317122019.content: After hearing this, Senba was silent for a long time. But I never let my gaze leave her. I was going to keep knocking at the gate to Senba's heart until it opened again.

317122020.content: Questioner, do you want to hear a story?

317122022.content: ...A very long time ago, there was an island where a group of clever people lived. Though the islanders lived an idyllic life, they had to abide by these rules:

317122023.content: One, lies were prohibited, as they could be exploited by the god of evil. The crime of lying was punishable by death.

317122024.content: Two, the islanders were not allowed to look into bodies of water, or mirrors, for they could not learn the color of their eyes. This was because once a person knew their eye color, they would be killed by the god of evil the very next day.

317122025.content: The islanders followed the rules, and they lived a peaceful life until the god of evil lost his patience.

317122026.content: It decided to target the islanders who had red-colored eyes first. It created a sign that read, "There are people with red eyes on the island," and hung it on a young girl.

317122027.content: The girl went to the market, like she did every so often. There, she saw her friends and greeted her beloved elders, and thus she unknowingly spread the sign's message throughout the island.

317122028.content: Then, the god of evil made a declaration: After a certain period of time, it would take the lives of every single person with red eyes. This was their fate—there was no avoiding it.

317122029.content: The girl eventually discovered the sign, and she understood that if the god of evil succeeded this time, it would be able to get to the other islanders in the future.

317122030.content: She had to save everyone before the day that all of the red-eyed islanders would be killed.

317122031.content: At this point of the story, Senba fell silent, as though this open ending was the end of the story.

317122032.content: I... think I've heard this story before.

317122033.content: If there were a hundred islanders with red eyes on the island, they would all die a hundred and one days after this declaration was issued.

317122035.content: Sometimes I take walks over to the Cryptics, where a number of folks like to study subjects like this.

317122036.content: Assuming that the red-eyed islanders were all smart people and proficient in inductive reasoning, their fates would be sealed the moment they start thinking.

317122037.content: I see that there's a certain level of intelligence required of a Modifier commander, too.

317122038.content: I'll take that as a compliment...

317122039.content: It was at this point that I suddenly noticed a difference between the story Senba was telling and the version I'd heard: It was the girl who was trying to save the red-eyed islanders.

317122040.content: So how did the girl plan to save them?

317122041.content: Senba hugged her knees even more tightly.

317122043.content: Hmm... Ask everyone to stop thinking? No...

317122044.content: Humans will never stop thinking until the day they die.

317122045.content: That's true... Then she must've rallied everyone on the island to fight the god of evil. If it was targeting only the islanders with red eyes, it must be because he was afraid of the islanders coming together to rebel!

317122046.content: Starting with islanders of eye color was simply an experiment by the god of evil. It had even more to gain if the islanders revealed there were people with other eye colors during their interactions.

317122047.content: I was speechless. Although I racked my brain for a feasible course of action, I came up nothing.

317122049.content: Senba squeezed her knees tightly. It was quite some time before she looked at me again.

317122050.content: The girl claimed that she had written the sign herself. Then one morning, she sacrificed herself at the entrance to the market.

317122051.content: Like a mine exploding underwater, her answer sent powerful ripples through me.

317122053.content: The logic is perfect. Even if some people had already seen folks with red eyes on the island, they would not think that this was the color "red" being referred to on the sign. On the island, rules are more powerful than judgment.

317122054.content: That's not what I meant! What about the girl? Who's going to understand her point of view?

317122055.content: Senba remained calm in the face of my questions.

317122056.content: It'd have been a disaster for everyone on the island for the girl to be understood.

317122057.content: I did not speak for a long time. The more I tried to find other answers, the more rational Senba's solution seemed to me. It was like a steel nail embedded in my brain, one I could not remove.

317122058.content: I recalled all the warnings Senba had given me on the way here, and suddenly I got a very bad feeling.

317122059.content: That was just a story, right, Senba?

317122060.content: Senba hesitated for a while. In the end, she chose not to answer my question.

317122061.content: You didn't know about these monsters before, Questioner, but they still appeared here. That means the end is near.

317122062.content: ...Promise me, Questioner. Promise me you'll stay here and wait until it's all over. Please?

317122063.content: Having finished her story, Senba looked at me again. Her gaze had for some reason softened, and she seemed to have finally let some of her guard down.

317122064.content: Don't worry. I'll make sure that you at least will live, Questioner. Because... you're special.

317122065.content: You've never met my mama before, and yet you were able to make food that tastes exactly like what she used to make. You must care for the Modifiers around you in the same way my mama cared for me.

317122066.content: It's been a long time since I've tasted something like this.

317122067.content: For some reason, the tender look in Senba's eyes plunged me into panic.

317122068.content: Whatever you're thinking, Senba, we should slow down a little. Give me a little more info. I can help you!

317122070.content: The space suddenly changed again, and I fell into a boundless abyss.

317131001.content: In a corner that most people wouldn't notice, a relaxed Agent F was sitting up against the wall, holding his rifle in his arms and casually gnawing at a toothpick.

317131002.content: He could hear footsteps, the sound of weapons clanging, and belligerent yelling from just behind this wall. But Agent F didn't appear to care about any of that.

317131003.content: Over there, too! We must get every one of them!!!

317131004.content: Even if we all die, we must eliminate all traitors! Go!

317131005.content: Even if you all die...? Sheesh, just what kind of compensation package are these people getting???

317131006.content: The sound of a single gunshot finally cut short Agent F's little break. It was clearly the sound of the rifle issued to the Quake Damage Control Department.

317131007.content: Is that one of our people?

317131008.content: We must eliminate that outsider too. He has something he shouldn't have!

317131009.content: Even if we all die, we must stop him!

317131010.content: Really? That "even if we all die" spiel again? (Scoffs)

317131011.content: Agent F bit down clumsily on his toothpick to keep it in place, then deftly loaded his weapon before rushing out like the professional agent he was.

317131012.content: After a burst of intense gunfire, Agent F finally came to the side of his beleaguered colleague.

317131017.content: I knew it was you from the way you held your weapon, G. Did you go off to look for E?

317131019.content: Never mind that. Just know that we ran into each other earlier. The Visbanes here are capable of erasing memories, and it looks like they got to you.

317131021.content: C'mon, let's get out of here. I know a place where we can hang loose...

317131022.content: Agent F tried to help Agent G up, but he froze suddenly—there was a massive amount of blood that had gushed out from Agent G's abdomen, his hands still holding onto it tightly.

317131023.content: I don't have much time. You must hand this to the acting captain for me!

317131024.content: Agent G produced a blood-stained scroll, a tangible piece of intel that had been extremely rare in the Karasugo mansion up until now.

317131025.content: I'm not playing messenger for you! And don't you dare give up here! I'm not writing your KIA report for that measly amount of overtime pay when I get back!

317131027.content: Agent G no longer had the strength to hold up the scroll. He lowered his arms and leaned against the wall to catch his breath.

317131028.content: I can't carry you. And where in the world are the captain and the others? I can't exactly buy my way out of this, can I...

317131029.content: Despite his grumbling, Agent F reluctantly took Agent G's weapon and wedged its buttstock into his other shoulder, pointing it, along with his own, in the direction an enemy might attack.

317131030.content: Once they started to think and act like their pursuers, Kuninotokotachi and the others also started to progress much more quickly. They were eager to test their theories, and had no intention of stopping for a while.

317131031.content: Then, they heard a burst of gunfire coming from a distance away.

317131032.content: Captain, that's our people over there.

317131033.content: Hmm... and we may have casualties too.

317131034.content: That clearly sounds like one person firing with two weapons. So it follows that there is another person with them, who can't fire their own weapon for some reason.

317131035.content: Very sharp of you, young lady.

317131036.content: If they're our people, we must save them. The more of us we can get together now, the better.

317132001.content: The group moved quickly, aided by their Divine Grace rounds.

317132002.content: We're seeing more and more Visbanes now...

317132003.content: Sekhmet power-walked around a corner and right into Agent F.

317132007.content: The Captain's identity is good enough. I have someone here who needs help, and quick!

317132008.content: Kuninotokotachi and the others looked behind the highly agitated Agent F, and spotted the debilitated Agent G.

317141001.content: Sekhmet swiftly and expertly applied first aid to Agent G while everyone else looked on in concern. However, just as she was about to further treat the wound, Agent G stopped her.

317141002.content: Captain, surely you can tell by now that there's no saving me...

317141003.content: Just give me the morphine. That way, I'll be able to tell you what I need to.

317141004.content: Everyone looked at each other, and then at Sekhmet.

317141005.content: I don't need you to remind me.

317141006.content: In the end, Sekhmet undertook every first aid measure and treated Agent G's injuries as much as possible.

317141007.content: But she ultimately still reached for the needle full of morphine.

317141009.content: Agent G started speaking much more quickly after the injection. He was eager to explain many things, but was interrupted by Sekhmet.

317141010.content: You're not going to organize your thoughts properly like that. Just save your energy and focus on answering my questions.

317141012.content: Are you here on the mission to look for E?

317141013.content: Yes. But from what I can remember, I always seemed to get lost just when I was about to find E... Then F reminded me that it was possible my memory was wiped right before I was going to find E.

317141014.content: How did you get to this space?

317141015.content: At first, I carried out the instructions on the note. After being thwarted one too many times, however, I became suspicious, so I decided to look for H instead. I came upon this space when I was walking in the other direction through the hallway.

317141016.content: Hmm... And this? Where did you get this scroll from?

317141017.content: Soon after I entered this space, I saw a group of Karasugo family servants in a room. They had all sorts of papers and were working to destroy them.

317141018.content: They were destroying papers? No wonder we couldn't find anything on their persons...

317141019.content: Something told me that those items were very important, and I managed to snatch this scroll from their leader.

317141020.content: I might not have survived this long if I hadn't gotten lucky several times... But after seeing the contents of the scroll, I have zero regrets.

317141021.content: Sekhmet unrolled the scroll without a word.

317141022.content:
The Child of Heaven decrees:

My Lord Karasugo, on that day, a young witch caused chaos in the imperial city. Our soldiers had no real chance against the ferocious giant humanoid form she commanded, and your mother tragically perished as a result.

The villainous witch, who calls herself Izanami, received favors from the Karasugo clan, and yet she has now turned against her masters.

You are hereby commanded to seize the witch's weapon and capture her. You shall be free to deal with her as you see fit.

317141026.content: Izanami... You have to remember that name.

317141027.content: Izanami? A dead mother? This is the first time I'm hearing of this. Did the Karasugo intentionally hide this?

317141029.content: Agent G's head had drooped during this time. The sound of his breathing gradually faded. The end came to him calmly and peacefully.

317141030.content: A hush fell over the group. Although they'd already had several indications of just how dangerous this mission was, this was the first time they'd experienced the loss of a comrade during it.

317141031.content: Sekhmet removed Agent G's dog tag from his body and held it tightly in her fist.

317141032.content: G's actions were not in vain. Now we can start connecting the dots.

317141033.content: The reason the Quake Damage Control Department had moved the timeline forward on the Karasugo investigation was an eyewitness report of a shining, humanoid demon outside the Karasugo mansion.

317141034.content: The Karasugo must have fallen under the control of this witch Izanami around that time.

317141035.content: The fact that the Karasugo deliberately covered up the event described in the scroll and did not execute the witch Izanami in accordance with the order, can only mean one thing: This girl has a higher status and more power in the family than the Lord.

317141036.content: So, this Izanami is the Crow God?

317141037.content: That's the most logical explanation for now.

317141038.content: Then our target is this Izanami character!

317141039.content: That was a very crucial part of the puzzle, indeed. We now have a specific goal to work towards...

317141040.content: You should back off now. Please.

317141041.content: Everyone looked in the direction of the interloper's voice. Agent K immediately raised her weapon at Kagutsuchi.

317141042.content: You're only one step away from making a grave mistake. If push comes to shove, I promise I will do everything necessary to stop you.

317141043.content: Shut your trap. You should be speaking more kindly, since you're telling us "please."

317141044.content: Sekhmet's demeanor was that of a sullen lioness. Even as she spoke, her eyes never once left G's body.

317141045.content: You're the one asking us to do something. Shouldn't you be a little more earnest?

317141046.content: So things have come to this after all...

317142001.content: The young man wielding the katana was no match for the group. But this time, he did not choose to escape. Instead, he used his body to prevent the group from leaving.

317142002.content: This is so weird... You're holding back, but you're not running away either. Just what are you trying to do here?

317142003.content: Just wait, and everything will come to an end... Just wait with me here. That's all I ask.

317142004.content: Allow me to introduce myself. I was formerly a member of the Egregious Crimes Department, and my Access Key excels at breaking down any barriers or barricades a suspect has put up, be it concrete or steel—or even themselves.

317142005.content: You may take the fact that I have not yet unsheathed my Access Key as a sign of my restraint and courtesy.

317142006.content: ...If truly necessary, I can explain some of what is going on. But it must be to as few of you as possible. Preferably just the decision-maker in your group.

317142007.content: Are you trying to slow us down here?

317142008.content: It's not much use doing that, you know. After everything that's happened, the outside world is already starting to suspect there is a Crow God. And if they don't hear from us, they'll just send more people to investigate the Karasugo!

317142010.content: Kuninotokotachi's little speech seemed to have sparked a thought in Kagutsuchi.

317142011.content: All of this became inevitable when the outside world came to suspect...

317142012.content: The communicator that Sekhmet had on her, which had been silent since she entered the dimension, suddenly rang.

317142017.content: I won't go into detail, but it looks like some kind of upside-down room.

317142018.content: Are you in this dimension too? Did you move away from the Karasugo mansion?

317142019.content: I couldn't find E or H, and I had to try something... But don't worry, Captain, I've got quite a few of our people here with me!

317142021.content: Fantastic! We might have an even bigger group than you this time!

317142022.content: G is the most circumspect of us all. If even he risked going the other way because he couldn't find us, we can assume that everyone else did the same.

317142023.content: Which means that, given all the time that has passed, it's probable that most of our people are trapped in this dimension already.

317142024.content: R, how did you get your hands on a communicator?

317142025.content: Pure heckin' luck. There seems to be quite a few communicators lying around here and I picked one up by chance. But it looks like I can only contact other people who are in here as well. I've reached quite a few folks so far.

317142026.content: Oh, by the way Captain—and I've already told the others this—do not go near the Karasugo servants who serve the Crow God! The Crow God seems to be able to control the minds of humans, and this mind control is spread by those servants!

317142028.content: I only realized it was happening when I noticed it in the people around me. You can't do anything for them at all. Best thing you can do is tie them up and hope it will resolve itself once we get to the being behind all this.

317142029.content: I paid attention to the note, and thank goodness I did! I might have fallen under it myself otherwise. You must stay far, far away from the Karasugo servants!

317142030.content: I understand. Stand by in your current location for now.

317142032.content: After the call ended, Sekhmet stared off into space, as if she was examining a wall of clues that no one else could see.

317142033.content: You truly can start piecing the puzzle together much more quickly towards the end.

317142034.content: So, that Izanami character wants you to wait.

317142035.content: In a little more time, the faction loyal to the Lord will have either killed off or converted the opposing faction.

317142036.content: All information within the Karasugo family that is related to Izanami will also be destroyed, along with other important intel on the Crow God.

317142037.content: This is how she will take over the Karasugo and become the master behind the scenes once again.

317142038.content: Just what happened to you, Modifier? Were you deceived, or did you choose this path of self-destruction yourself?

317142039.content: Kagutsuchi's eyes were no longer hard with determination, but instead filled with an inexplicable sadness.

317142040.content: In the end, I'm just someone being used, though that's how things should've been to begin with...

317142041.content: Sekhmet stared into Kagutsuchi's eyes. Eventually, she came to the conclusion that he was telling the truth.

317142042.content: There's no point spending more time on him now. We more or less have all the facts now, don't we?

317142043.content: Sekhmet took out H's note again and looked at it. All but one of the points had been clarified or explained. There was only one piece of the puzzle left, an especial eyesore, like a missing piece smack dab in the center of the puzzle.

317142045.content: Unexpectedly, Sekhmet handed the note to Kagutsuchi.

317142046.content: You must know why my subordinate wrote this before he lost his memory.

317142047.content: Sekhmet did not specifically mention the first point on the note, as she wanted to see what information Kagutsuchi would offer up. However, after he read the note, the sadness in his eyes only intensified.

317142048.content: That your subordinate made a decision like this tells me that you have a group of very brave people working for you. They'll undoubtedly be able to resolve this crisis.

317142049.content: You're a professional and you're telling the truth, yet you're still hiding things.

317142050.content: You're a Modifier, and yet you work for a Cognizant Visbane. You'll be judged sooner or later—why not now?

317142051.content: There was a slight edge in Sekhmet's eyes, one that hinted at something deadly. Alarmed, Kuninotokotachi placed her hand on her weapon and readied herself to stop whatever Sekhmet was thinking of doing.

317142052.content: You're running out of time. The Crow God's plan is progressing as we speak.

317142053.content: Just as you imagined at the beginning, all the answers you want are at the finish line.

317142054.content: Sekhmet's communicator sounded once again, serving as a timely reminder.

317142055.content: H, F, K. I want you to stay here and make sure that he doesn't go anywhere. Honorable Ninja, let's go to the place where the Karasugo servants are gathering.

317142056.content: Did you just give me an easy task for once? Wow.

317142057.content: At least take me with you, Captain!

317142058.content: ...I'll take care of these two, ma'am.

317142059.content: Sekhmet patted Agent H on the shoulder. Then she moved past Kagutsuchi and ventured deeper into the hallway, with Kuninotokotachi following swiftly behind.

317142060.content: Hey, weird. Why are you hesitating at a time like this?

317142061.content: Because I'm not out here by myself this time, Honorable Ninja.

317142062.content: A call came in on the communicator. As soon as she connected it, Sekhmet smoothly slid into her role as commander.

317142063.content: It's from the same channel. Is this R?

317142064.content: Yes, Captain. I'm seeing several Karasugo servants all heading in one direction. Should we do something?

317142065.content: Follow them at a safe distance. Look out for a woman who can control a shining humanoid figure.

317142066.content: A woman who can control a shining humanoid figure...?

317142068.content: After giving her quick orders, Sekhmet cut the call and began sprinting down the hallway.

317151001.content: Some unknown amount of time later, the sound of conversation pulled me from that boundless abyss.

317151002.content: I was in a quiet room. Through a translucent screen partition, I saw Senba talking to someone.

317151004.content: It was Karasugo Sendou, the current Lord of the Karasugo family. I'd seen his picture in the intel provided by Izuru Masayoshi after the focus of the investigation had turned to the Sasanami Five.
