317171023.content: How many foes has she defeated here? Tsukuyomi cannot remember. Any normal person would be drained of all strength, yet she and Shinri stand as sharp and ready as ever, as if the battles just past were no more than a whetting of the blade.

317171024.content: Huge amounts of Bane Energy fill the vast space once more. It seems Tsukuyomi has more fighting to do. That hideous snake's head appears again, with poisonous words for her.

317171025.content: How dull. Am I to play with you again, toy?

317171026.content: So, this is how it turns out in the end...

317171027.content: No matter what kind of being lies behind all this, it cannot have any greater threats to throw at me.

317171028.content: Orochi the Snake God is angered by how calm Tsukuyomi remains.

317171029.content: You have had the last of my patience. You will die screaming in pain here, you arrogant worm!

317171030.content: Hearing that, Tsukuyomi allows herself a moment of anger.

317171031.content: Patience? I'm running low on that resource myself. Come, let me kill you again.

317172002.content: Orochi the Snake God falls with a resentful wail, just as happened at the Miyahebi Manor all those months earlier.

317172003.content: The space finally falls silent. No new enemies appear. Tsukuyomi scans the area, wary, as alert and ready as ever.

317172004.content: What is giving my opponents their power? Why am I constantly facing enemies I've already defeated?

317172005.content: Am I hallucinating? No. But something feels strange...

317172006.content: As she is thinking, a sinister voice sounds, as if the dimension itself is talking to her.

317172007.content: As you know, the Orochi you faced here was far more powerful than the Orochi you defeated at Miyahebi Manor. Yet still, it could not kill you. Terrifying...

317172008.content: Enemies always get stronger. But I've never seen why that should mean I consider losing.

317172009.content: I see. So you can imagine enemies stronger than you, but not an enemy you cannot conquer? People like you are such a pain...

317172010.content: Who are you, anyway? The Crow God?

317172011.content: Ah... Thanks to you, you crazy brat, that's a very difficult question to answer.

317172012.content: I'm amazed I have any sense of self left at all, after the pummeling you put me through.

317172013.content: Tsukuyomi has no time for such nonsense. She saves her breath, preferring instead to carefully examine the space she is in.

317172014.content: I see you're very good at concealing yourself.

317172015.content: Huh? That's what you're trying to do? Find me and kill me? I just wanted to talk, you know...

317172016.content: Just remember the longer we talk, the more of your weaknesses I'll identify.

317172017.content: Haha. That might be the case with an everyday enemy. But I'm... I'm something a little bit special.

317172018.content: Tsukuyomi tightens her grip on the hilt of her blade. But still she can't spot anything she could attack.

317172019.content: You haven't pecked. You haven't flapped off. What do you want?

317172020.content: Oh, how grateful I am you've finally decided to talk with me. It seems all that time I spent seizing control of this dimension was not wasted.

317172022.content: What I want is perfectly simple. I want you to consider a deal.

317172023.content: Hmph. Tread carefully, my feathered foe.

317172024.content: I know how it works. Visbanes, Mods, fight to the death, there can be only one, blah blah. But you didn't sign up with Aether Gazer because of a sudden urge to stab Visbanes, did you?

317172025.content: Perhaps you signed up to find a friend? To make up for some lack?

317172027.content: I know the girl's secrets now. All of them. It just so happens some of them are about you.

317172029.content: Excellent. It looks like we might be able to talk business.

317172030.content: It's ironic. The person with the answers you need was the most prominent in all Sasanami. Like the sun, perhaps. Blindingly obvious and almost completely ignored.

317172032.content: It's just like I said. Nobody would ever think to look directly at the sun.

317172033.content: Even if what you say is true... What could I do?

317172034.content: Well, that brings us to the actual content of our deal. By coincidence, this person is our common enemy. Although from your point of view, I suspect you'd like to deal with them even more urgently than you'd like to deal with me.

317172035.content: I can set you free to go and do that. In exchange, you will not interfere with anything I do with the Karasugo Family.

317172036.content: There is a long silence. It ends shortly after Tsukuyomi narrows her eyes.

317172037.content: You must know Aether Gazer cannot let things get worse with the Karasugo Family. Which means you're offering this deal as a delaying tactic.

317172038.content: But you think if we go and deal with who we have to deal with, that'll give you time to finish whatever it is you're working on, something which means you won't need to worry about an Aether Gazer attack. Am I right?

317172039.content: Hmm. I admit, it's not a great deal from Aether Gazer's point of view. But I'm not offering Aether Gazer a deal, am I? I'm talking to you. As I said, your goals and Aether Gazer's goals aren't necessarily the same, are they?

317172040.content: The only answer is Tsukuyomi's angry drawing of Shinri. The blade slashes towards the wall. The groove it carves soon fades, but not before the entire space flickers.

317172041.content: As I thought. You are using your own strength to maintain this dimension.

317172042.content: (Cough! Cough!) It seems our negotiations have failed. How annoying.

317172043.content: But no matter. It was just an idea I thought worth trying. Once my plans have succeeded, none of you will be of any import.

317172044.content: There is no need for me to continue wasting energy on maintaining this place. I'll leave you to wander the girl's maze. Until next time...

317172045.content: The sinister voice fades and immediately Tsukuyomi notices how the space is starting to change. At long last she sees a way out, a passageway that has formed at one side.

317172046.content: But it only leads to another space, more complex than the last. Stairs crisscross back and forth, and countless Visbanes, odd-looking and with murder in their eyes, await her.

317172048.content: She's starting to feel a little tired, but she draws her blade yet again. Her eyes are, as ever, as sharp as Shinri.

317181001.content: That familiar silhouette is the first thing Kagutsuchi sees on waking.

317181002.content: Did you save me? It's embarrassing, being forced to ask for your help...

317181003.content: Oh, I did think about selling you instead. At least then I wouldn't have been exposed.

317181004.content: I think the scariest thing about that is how calm you are when you say it... But you did help, didn't you?

317181005.content: You should have spoken to me in the first place.

317181006.content: I would have preferred to save myself the trouble. But there wasn't any time. She was about to get away with the Snake God Cinders.

317181008.content: I hadn't imagined she would already have found some way to resist Madoibi.

317181009.content: I see. Hmm... Then it seems I will have to act personally.

317181010.content: Kagutsuchi looks at Izanami's silhouette for a long time before finally continuing.

317181011.content: We agreed back at the beginning that I will respect you as my superior in front of the family. But we are both Mods and I want to make a suggestion. Ask for outside help. We do not need to save the world alone.

317181012.content: You know better than anyone why I decided not to contact any other Mods.

317181013.content: I do. But perhaps they would be able to...

317181014.content: And more importantly, I'm not trying to save the world. All I want is revenge. I will not stop until everyone I seek vengeance on is dead.

317181015.content: Mods seek justice and order. They are not my allies.

317181017.content: You are a back-up plan for use in extreme circumstances. We are parties to a deal, not an alliance.

317181018.content: Izanami's tone leaves little room for disagreement. But Kagutsuchi has not given up.

317181019.content: Who are you trying to convince? Yourself?

317181021.content: I know a little about how it feels to fail to protect someone you care about... Sometimes I envy you, you know? You still have enemies to focus your hatred on. That lets you forget your regrets. The mistakes you cannot change.

317181023.content: Maybe it's not vengeance you really want? Maybe you actually want to protect people. So that, this time at least, you won't have any regrets?

317181024.content: Izanami gives her answer more thought this time, but when it comes it is again definitive.

317181025.content: I have not changed my mind.

317181026.content: Ah. Then I will have to stick to our deal.

317181027.content: Denied again, Kagutsuchi sighs and then remains quiet.

317181028.content: Rest up. Its next target is very likely to be the Akishika. We cannot fail this time.

317181029.content: Izanami's words seem to summon Kagutsuchi back from a reverie. He looks around in surprise, finding himself still standing in the ring in the lobby.

317181030.content: It's as if he's just had a grand adventure. As if he's defeated powerful foes, forged alliances, traveled undercover throughout Sasanami, carried out secret plans... but it's all like a dream, fuzzy and forgotten as soon as he wakes.

317181033.content: A burly soldier yells at Kagutsuchi, bringing him back to reality.

317181034.content: Sharpen up! This is the first match. Fail it and you'll be peeling potatoes!

317181035.content: Kagutsuchi looks at his spotlit opponent and can't help tightening his grip on his weapon.

317181036.content: All I have to do is survive. Staying alive is good enough...

317182001.content: And he fights that way, conservatively, defensively, but still able to turn his opponents attacks with the necessary skill.

317182002.content: The fight goes on for so long the audience is starting to yawn and, finally, his opponent becomes irritated and impatient. He makes a rushed and rash attack and Kagutsuchi takes advantage. It's not a graceful victory, but it counts.

317182004.content: The overseer is clearly unimpressed with Kagutsuchi's style, but Kagutsuchi doesn't care. He leaves the ring and gives a long sigh, gazing down at his own hands.

317182006.content: You've passed. You can leave, but report back tomorrow!

317182009.content: In an infinity of dark and chaos, I suddenly sense something approaching. Something dangerous.

317182012.content: I automatically draw my gun but the screams of the Visbanes unsettle me, throwing my aim off. Then, at the crucial moment, I realize I have a sword at my waist.

317182015.content: The Visbanes are about to attack when the sword in my hand emits a burst of scorching Divine Grace and turns them all to ash.

317182016.content: I see Kagutsuchi left a rearguard...

317182017.content: Your immunity to mind rewrites makes you humans very dangerous...

317182019.content: Dammit. My powers in the Surface Layer are still limited...

317182020.content: But no matter. Sacrificing a pawn does not lose the game...

317182021.content: It's as if I can hear some kind of presence muttering to itself, but not clearly. When I come to my senses the Visbanes have all disappeared.

317182022.content: I touch the blade of the sword, but it almost burns me. I stare at it in confusion.

317182023.content: Is this all real? And this sword... I need to find the others!

317182024.content: This is no time to be staring at anything in confusion. I rush from the dead-end I'd been cornered in and immediately run into a burly Karasugo servant.

317182027.content: We're all enemies here. If you want to fight, head for the arena.

317182029.content: Where have you come from, know-nothing?

317182030.content: Another Karasugo servant notices my confusion and stands in my way.

317182031.content: Don't cause any trouble. You know the house rules are stricter during the Bladechoosing.

317182032.content: The Lord brings in lots of orphans to ensure they can find some suitable candidates. Some of them are going to be idiots. But I know this one. Leave them with me.

317182033.content: I should be training. I don't have time for this...

317182034.content: The aggressive Karasugo servant leaves, and I'm left staring at the one who helped me. I have a hundred questions to ask, but I don't get a chance...

317182037.content: Anyway, you're Admin, aren't you? I remember that's what your colleagues called you. I'm Shadow Crow, with Kagutsuchi!

317182039.content: Anyway, I know who you are. I'm the one who took your communicator.

317182041.content: Shhh! We can't talk here. Follow me.

317182042.content: Shadow Crow finds a quiet corner and seems to relax a little.

317182045.content: Give me Mi... Give me my communicator!

317182046.content: Keep your voice down! Relax, I didn't break it.

317182047.content: I hid it, on my Captain's orders. That's why I wasn't at the rallying point and missed out on getting my brain wrecked. So I'm very grateful to that communicator and I promise it's safe.

317182048.content: It sure has a mouth on it, though... It would be too obvious to carry it about in the real world, so I had to hide it somewhere safe.

317182050.content: I shift my bearing, trying to threaten him. So much had happened and my top priority now is to reach my team.

317182051.content: That's going to be hard. It's in the Crow's Nest, the highest part of the manor. It was already getting dangerous there when I left.

317182052.content: Anyway, I can see you haven't been affected by whatever's going on, so maybe we can work together.

317182053.content: What do you mean? What is going on?

317182054.content: Okay, we need to go back to some odd things happening with the Karasugo. When I came out of that weird dimension, I found they were holding a Bladechoosing.

317182056.content: It's a series of duels, started by the current Lord, Karasugo Sendou, I think to find the right person to wield a certain sword. There's one a week. Or there was, the last was four years ago and then duels like this were banned.

317182057.content: Have we gone back in time?

317182058.content: That's what I thought, until something even stranger happened.

317182059.content: I look in the direction Shadow Crow is pointing and am shocked to see agents from the Quake Damage Control Department moving about amongst the people there. In fact, there are more of them than Karasugo servants.

317182060.content: They say they are Mihakashisyuu, here to take part in the Bladechoosing.

317182061.content: You're kidding? Tell them to look at what they're wearing! Do they look like Karasugo soldiers?

317182062.content: Oh, I tried. They told me the Mihakashisyuu have two different uniforms and... they said everyone knew that.

317182064.content: Anyway, it's like they've all gone crazy. Or, more accurately, like someone has made them go crazy.

317182065.content: So I don't think it's time travel. It's more like a bunch of people have all gone mad and decided to play at Bladechoosing.

317182066.content: Could the Crow God have done this? You're a believer, so you'd know if it was possible, right?

317182067.content: I don't know what to even say. How can I believe in the Crow God when the Crow God is already dead?

317182069.content: Shadow Crow hesitates a moment, then seems to decide there's no point in trying to keep secrets from me.

317182070.content: The Crow God was killed during an internal family dispute four years ago. Everyone in the family is aware, but it's been kept secret from the outside world, because of how important the Mountain Gods are for Sasanami.

317182072.content: I feel like there has to be a logical answer, but I just can't make the connections. No matter how close I seem to be getting to the truth of what is happening, there's a final layer I can't uncover.

317182073.content: So far, you're the only person I've found who is still awake like me. My current orders didn't include anything about attacking you or your team, so I guess we're not enemies, at least?

317182074.content: So, do you want to think about partnering up? We need to figure out what's going on here.

317182075.content: If we're going to be partners, you need to get me my communicator.

317182076.content: Right now, I can't think of any way to get into the Crow's Nest. I can't fight past the people up there...

317182077.content: Then I don't see any need to keep talking to you...

317182078.content: I'm wondering what I should do next when Shadow Crow notices the sword I'm holding.

317182081.content: The Bladechoosing is intended to find someone to wield this sword. Four years ago, at the final Bladechoosing, it was Kagutsuchi, my Captain, who won the sword and killed the Crow God.

317182082.content: This sword belongs to your Captain?

317182083.content: Yes. Although during the Bladechoosing it should be on display at the arena.

317182084.content: I remember how that young Mod had given me the sword and I come up with a plan that might work.

317182085.content: Okay, no more talk. Take me to Kagutsuchi.

317182086.content: It seems likely the Crow's Nest is guarded by some kind of being under the power of the Crow God. It's too dangerous for the two of us alone.

317182087.content: If we can get this sword back to your Captain, we'll be able to fight our way into the Crow's Nest.

317182088.content: I'm not sure I understand, but it sounds like it might work! But you have to remember the Captain has been affected by whatever is going on.

317191001.content: Shadow Crow takes me to a deserted corner where we find the young Mod, Kagutsuchi.

317191003.content: Even his appearance seems to have suffered. His hair is a mess, his clothes are in disarray. But when I look into his ever-sorrowful eyes, I know this is the person I'm looking for.

317191004.content: Captain? Why are you calling me that? I'm the lowest ranked of all in the Bladechoosing. I'm not fit to be anyone's Captain.

317191005.content: See, it's like I said. The Captain's under the influence as well.

317191007.content: Sure. Everyone else is focused on the Bladechoosing. Anyone failing or not involved gets ignored. That's why it's so quiet here.

317191008.content: I don't know how the Captain ended up like this, but the other Mihakashisyuu definitely look down on him. Plus, there are another three here who just completely gave up.

317191009.content: Looking over Kagutsuchi's shoulder I see he's right. There are three Quake Damage Control Department agents here. Despite their helmets, they look familiar.

317191011.content: Do I know you? It's weird, I...

317191013.content: Taking part in the Bladechoosing. Although I have no idea why it's so important to me. Look at them all, running about trying to decide who gets to keep some sword. Don't they have jobs? Wives? Children?

317191014.content: I mean, I'm not scared of a fight. But I'm not going to fight for some sword.

317191015.content: I told the overseer that if the sword was made of something special, maybe they could melt it down and turn it into a rifle or something. That'd make it even more powerful, right? But they threw me out of the arena.

317191016.content: If they keep going to the end people are going to get badly hurt! It's not the kind of thing a modern society should allow.

317191017.content: Don't let anyone hear you say that. I'm not going to disagree with you, but if the overseer heard...

317191018.content: Quitting the competition is already a breach of the family rules. If you cause any more trouble they might put you in the ring and force you to fight to the death. Then there would be no escape.

317191019.content: Just focus on staying alive. There's nothing else we can do.

317191020.content: Just stop. You're depressing me with all your whining.

317191021.content: Although Kagutsuchi was clearly unhappy with the agents' attitudes, I was able to breathe a sigh of relief at last.

317191022.content: So it is you three! Where are Kuninotokotachi and Sekhmet?

317191024.content: Ah. Seems like you have been affected. Your minds have been rewritten, but you're actually CORG agents here to investigate the Karasugo. You were never Mihakashisyuu.

317191025.content: Right now, I need you to help me find Kuninotokotachi and the others.

317191026.content: The three agents look at each other. They clearly have no idea what I'm talking about.

317191027.content: How could we be CORG agents? The Karasugo took us in when we were kids.

317191028.content: Wow. They really did a number on you. Okay, I guess there's no point in trying to explain...

317191029.content: But it does seem like you know us. Why are you looking for us?

317191031.content: I can see the three agents aren't going to help with my predicament. I turn back to Kagutsuchi and try to figure out what I should say.

317191032.content: Thank you for your sword, it saved my life. But I'm not sure how much difference it's going to make.

317191033.content: That's... How did you get it? You need to give it back right now or...

317191035.content: How could it be? The way I'm fighting I'll be knocked out in the next round.

317191036.content: Admin, the Captain's been rewritten too.

317191037.content: So even Mods can't resist the Crow God's powers? Or is it because he lent me his Access Key?

317191038.content: Hey, what are you talking about? Isn't that the sword they give to the final champion? No wonder they're only displaying a box and not letting anyone look inside.

317191039.content: Shadow Crow suddenly moves to hide Ryugiri.

317191040.content: That's true, we shouldn't show it off. If anyone sees it and reports us...

317191041.content: Hey, watch your mouth. We're not snitches.

317191042.content: As it happens, I've got a better idea. So, my new old friend, it seems you've got the moves to steal the sword from the middle of the arena. Which means you've got the moves to get it out of the building.

317191043.content: So how about this. You get the sword out of here and we'll pretend we didn't see anything. Once you're clear we'll tell everyone the overseer has lost the prize sword. That'll mean nobody has to get hurt fighting.

317191044.content: It's useless. I already checked and the whole estate is sealed off for the Bladechoosing. It'd be easier to just stop the competition than escape with the sword.

317191046.content: I never stole the sword, and whoever is behind all this isn't going to let anyone get away so easily... But none of that matters.

317191047.content: I see Kagutsuchi has, as if it's his natural position, moved to stand behind the three agents. I gesture for them to move aside and try to give him Ryugiri again.

317191048.content: Kagutsuchi, I hope you will take this sword again and work with me. It would mean we can strike back!

317191049.content: I remember what you told me previously. We're not enemies, right?

317191050.content: Kagutsuchi glances at the sword before stepping back in alarm.

317191051.content: You need to hand it in. If you get caught they'll kill you.

317191052.content: Kagutsuchi, don't you want to change all this?

317191053.content: I just want to survive. Staying alive is good enough...

317191054.content: There's no fight left in Kagutsuchi's eyes and I can see any hopes I had for him are wasted. My hand and the sword it holds hover in midair. Do I keep waiting? Or give up?

317191055.content: From what I've seen, the rewriting process doesn't change anyone's basic personality. But is this what the Captain used to be like? How did he ever win the last Bladechoosing like this?

317191056.content: I ignore Shadow Crow's mutterings and press Ryugiri into Kagutsuchi's hand.

317191057.content: This is your sword. If you want to hand it in to the overseer, so be it. It's your call.

317191058.content: But is that really what you want to do?

317191059.content: What other option do I have?

317191060.content: Your other option is to change all this!

317191061.content: Kagutsuchi gazes down at Ryugiri and, eventually, lets me down.

317191062.content: I'm sorry. I just want to live.

317191063.content: I can't help but think of everything I've been through. Of the bitter sacrifices made. It makes me angry.

317191064.content: If anyone in this world wants no more than to survive then that's their choice. Sure, they can stand by and watch. They can leave their fate, the fate of the world, in the hands of others. They can let other people make the tough calls.

317191065.content: But personally, I don't think it's a life worth living!

317191066.content: My little speech gets everyone staring at me, each with their own different expression.

317191067.content: Finally, Kagutsuchi raises his face and I see... the same sorrowful look as always.

317191068.content: I have to live. I made a deal and I have to keep it.

317191069.content: I can't find any more words. I can see something in his eyes which speaks of a painful past, as if he's suffered as many losses as I have. Maybe more. That would explain the sadness that weighs him down.

317191071.content: I don't want to talk about it. I'm sorry, but I can't help you.

317191072.content: The look in his eyes rob me of any wish to keep on pushing him. I don't know what he's been through.

317191073.content: I think things over and, after a long while, come up with an idea which might mean he can help us.

317191074.content: There's no way I can force you to help us. But perhaps we could make a deal?

317191076.content: You want to survive the Bladechoosing, right? To do that, you need a better weapon and you need to know how to use it.

317191077.content: I've seen you fight with this sword. I can help you remember how to do it again. That means you'll survive the coming matches.

317191078.content: I don't remember using the sword. Anyway, I can't walk into the arena holding the prize sword.

317191080.content: Plan A had been to get Kagutsuchi to take the sword and then we'd storm the Crow's Nest. It seems Plan B has some flaws I'd overlooked.

317191081.content: I don't think it's a major problem. I've seen the swords the Mihakashisyuu are using and they're similar to this one in terms of construction and size. If you remove its most recognizable parts, the wrap and the guard, and replace them with something else, nobody is going to spot it.

317191082.content: How do you know so much about swordmaking?

317191083.content: It is weird. Honestly, I don't know how I know. But I know I want to help.

317191084.content: I don't know what you're trying to achieve, but it sounds like you might prevent a few injuries or deaths. So I'm in!

317191085.content: You mean, if it works the Bladechoosing will be canceled? I guess I can lend a hand too then.

317191086.content: I watch as the three agents move to my side and feel much more confident.

317191087.content: You know, I don't think you three have changed very much.

317191088.content: I look at Kagutsuchi again, hoping to see some change in his expression.

317191089.content: So what do you want me to do?

317191090.content: I sigh with relief again. My idea had worked. The thought of surviving is hugely important to Kagutsuchi and that made it the only thing powerful enough to snap him out of his funk.

317191091.content: That meant I could make a deal with him.

317191092.content: I want to get into the Crow's Nest. If you and me work together we should be able to handle the guards. We'll be working covertly, so nobody will know it's you.

317191093.content: If you have to get to the Crow's Nest then storming the place is going to be dangerous, no matter how you approach it. But I know a safer way we might be able to get in.

317191094.content: The final rounds of fighting in the Bladechoosing actually take place in an arena in the Crow's Nest. At that point, all competitors are allowed in. So maybe I can sneak you in.

317191095.content: That... might work. A frontal assault on the Crow's Nest could be problematic, after all.

317191096.content: The problem is, I can't guarantee I'll live long enough to reach that stage.

317191097.content: I can't understand why he was talking like that. It seems as if every fight, for him, was a life-or-death struggle. I don't know why he thinks like that, but I do know exactly how to deal with it.

317191098.content: I'm going to make sure you do.

317191100.content: Because we're making a deal, remember?

317191101.content: I notice Kagutsuchi's grip on Ryugiri tightens a little, and see some dark spots have appeared on his arm. I don't think anybody else has seen this yet.

317191102.content: I don't like to fight. But if I want to live, then I have to.

317191105.content: I take a moment to enjoy the sense of relief before turning back to Kagutsuchi.

317191106.content: You might not remember, but you once told me you hoped I'd bring about some changes. I think those changes might start now, with me returning your sword to you.

317192001.content: The new skills Kagutsuchi learns make him a much better fighter, but he's still too conservative. His opponent mistakes this for disdain, thinking Kagutsuchi is toying with him.

317192002.content: In the end, Kagutsuchi's enraged opponent launches a violent assault and, in doing so, reveals a fatal flaw.

317192004.content: The whole arena is watching him, including one pair of eyes observing from the highest stand.

317192006.content: I really thought shorty was a goner there.

317192007.content: Shows what you know. The Captain's going to win all the way to the end.

317192008.content: Oh yeah? I think you're talking nonsense!

317192009.content: Silence! The Lord is about to speak.

317192010.content: It seems Kagutsuchi's fight was the last of the current round. The overseer silences the crowd and all eyes turn to the highest stand.

317192011.content: There, they see Lord Karasugo Sendou. He looks a little tired, but stands as upright as ever, with all the authority and dignity of a lord.

317192013.content: On a gesture from their Lord, the servants help those so badly wounded they cannot leave under their own steam from the room.

317192014.content: I... I cannot say I envy you. You have made it through this vital stage and will move onward. But the fights to come will be even tougher.

317192015.content: Nobody talks. Even Shadow Crow, who has also made it through to the next stage, looks anxious. But Kagutsuchi shows no reaction.

317192016.content: I am grateful to each and every one of you. I do not want you to shed blood and risk your lives without knowing why. So, I am going to explain the true aim of the Bladechoosing.

317192017.content: As you all know, the stated intention of this event is to find someone worthy of a fine blade. But its true aim is to find a great warrior who can wield a divine weapon and, with it, slaughter great enemies of the Karasugo.

317192018.content: Those enemies are the gods worshipped by the five families!

317192019.content: It's a shocking revelation. Discussions break out in the crowd but a stern glare from Karasugo Sendou soon restores silence.

317192020.content: As the Karasugo ancestors told us, the so-called Mountain Gods are no more than evil spirits hiding behind made-up legends. If they are not destroyed then we Karasugo and all Sasanami will suffer a terrible fate, from which we will never recover.

317192021.content: It has taken me more than a decade to find a weapon able to kill those evil spirits. Now, finding the warrior to wield it will require sacrifices to be made. But these are necessary sacrifices.

317192022.content: The first to fall to this blade will be the Crow God, which has long troubled us Karasugo.

317192023.content: I'm left stunned by the Lord's speech. He is clearly anxious, but taking care to make his case well. I notice Kagutsuchi remains utterly calm.

317192024.content: Thank you. The sword and the skills you have taught me have been a great help. Although I still don't understand why they feel so familiar...

317192025.content: Kagutsuchi, aren't you surprised this was all about killing the Mountain Gods? Or did you know already?

317192026.content: I... I am only learning of this now. The family has always been forbidden from discussing the gods and we were barely aware of the Crow God.

317192027.content: Well, I guess everyone's aware of it now.

317192028.content: If the result of this Bladechoosing is the same as the one four years ago... I fear that means Captain Kagutsuchi will have to kill it again.

317192029.content: That can't be right. If the Crow God is already dead, what is he going to kill? Unless a new one has hatched...

317192030.content: I have no idea what you're talking about. But if I have to kill a god, then that's just another battle I will have to fight and survive, right?

317192031.content: I will be facing such battles every day from now on. All I can do is prepare for the next one.

317192032.content: There is no sign of timidity, of fear for his life, in his face. He just seems to have quietly accepted his fate.

317192033.content: I've only known the man for a few days. His past is, as far as I'm concerned, a complete blank. There's no way I can tell what's going on inside his head.

317192034.content: A battle to survive... Captain, is that what the Bladechoosing is? Is it so terrible?

317192036.content: Actually... When the Karasugo took me in, the Bladechoosings had already ended. Then the Captain took me on. I don't know much about it, just what I've heard people say.

317192037.content: Don't worry about it. Try and relax. Tomorrow, try to survive.

317192039.content: Kagutsuchi's attempt at reassurance has the opposite effect. Shadow Crow looks worried for a while, then seems to remember something.

317192040.content: Admin, you said it was the Crow God which was responsible for all this happening here. So if we help the Captain win the Bladechoosing and kill the Crow God... problem solved, right?

317192041.content: It might seem so. But if everyone is controlled by the Crow God and they're playing out the Bladechoosing of four years ago, then... isn't this all an act put on by the Crow God?

317192042.content: Why would the Crow God send someone to kill itself?

317192044.content: Our discussion doesn't help me to find any answers. If anything, it just leaves me with more questions. I don't know any more than I did when I first arrived here.

317192045.content: I try and think it all through and find the image of Senba appearing in my mind's eye. I think of the decisions she has made and, amongst all the confusion, I find something to cling on to.

317192046.content: Is a hanged man always a liar?

317192047.content: Both Kagutsuchi and Shadow Crow look at me in surprise, unsure of what I'm talking about. Agent K, who's been keeping watch, suddenly returns.

317192048.content: Hey, the overseer's coming this way!

317192049.content: We try to look natural. The overseer arrives with several Mihakashisyuu and a furious expression.

317192050.content: So, the first stage is over. The Karasugo can't afford to feed any hangers-on, so I'm looking for anyone who didn't make it through. And oh look, here you all are. Listen up!

317192051.content: You've got two options. One, sign up with a temporary security force and help us track down some troublemakers who have snuck in lately. Or you can work for those who did make it through, cooking, cleaning, all the bad jobs.

317192052.content: I'm about to speak when the overseer glares at me.

317192053.content: One look at you and I can see you're no fighter. We'll get you a mop and bucket.

317192054.content: Me too. I'll make a good servant.

317192056.content: I'd be an idiot to take the dangerous work. He hasn't even said he's paying us.

317192057.content: Agent F's whispered comment goes unnoticed by the overseer, who has already turned to Agent H and Agent K.

317192058.content: We only needed two servants, so the rest of you will work security. I'm sure you can manage to catch a few troublemakers. Okay, that's all settled. Go report for work.

317192059.content: Before he leaves, he looks at Kagutsuchi.

317192060.content: I thought it would be you doing the cleaning. I never expected you to make it through your first fight, even.

317192061.content: Look at you. You won and you still look miserable. You're hopeless.

317192062.content: Kagutsuchi doesn't respond and the overseer, bored, wanders off.

317192063.content: What's his problem? Captain, you can't let him talk to you like that!

317192064.content: I'm fighting one of his men tomorrow. I guess that got him riled up. Anyway, I'm not your Captain.

317192066.content: So, looks like we have to split up. Do we need to rethink the plan?

317192067.content: No. The more I learn about what's going on, the more I think we need to tread carefully. Being split up might present some opportunities.

317192068.content: We should all go and do the jobs we've been assigned to and see what we can learn. We can work on the plan later, once we've had a chance to swap intel.

317192069.content: You... You certainly talk like an officer.

317192070.content: Trust me, when this is all over you'll know why.

317192071.content: A guard escorts Agent F and I to the entrance to the dungeons.

317192072.content: There's a very dangerous prisoner locked up here. Your job is to look after her. Make her tea, bring her food, that kind of thing.

317192074.content: It isn't difficult. But I can't promise it isn't dangerous.

317192076.content: You heard about the Lord's mother suddenly dying a while ago?

317192077.content: A girl the Lord's family had taken in and raised as their own daughter turned out to be a witch. The Lord's mother was killed in the chaos she caused.

317192078.content: What should have been a happy occasion turned into a funeral.

317192079.content: A witch? What do you mean?

317192080.content: I heard she could even do witchcraft!

317192084.content: I should have known this wouldn't be easy.

317192085.content: As Agent F grumbles, I look inside the cell.

317192086.content: I've seen her like this before. Hiding in the corner, curled up, hugging her knees, helpless. But her eyes make it clear she wants nobody to come and comfort her.

317192089.content: She's not... Okay, I've got it. Look after the prisoner. I'll do a good job, I promise. Anything else?

317192090.content: You're keen. Just what I told you. Work hard, don't sneak off, and keep me informed if anything happens.

317192091.content: I don't like to hang around here if I don't have to.

317192092.content: With that, the guard hurries off. I pull the gun concealed in my jacket pocket and set it to silent before trying to blast the lock off the door. But whatever it's made of, it's too tough for even Cryptic tech to get through.

317192093.content: But I do get Senba's attention. She doesn't seem to know me, though.

317192095.content: I have so much to say I can't get the words out. I just sigh.

317192096.content: You're lucky. At least I know who you are.

317192097.content: You've mistaken me for someone else. Leave me alone.

317192098.content: I don't care if you're Senba or Izanami. It doesn't change what I need to do.

317192099.content: I'm going to save you this time, I promise!

317192100.content: It sounds as if I'm trying to convince myself. Myself, and many others.

317192101.content: I've got an odd feeling it's something I should have said a long time ago, but failed to. And ever since, I've regretted it.

317192102.content: Perhaps there is some justice to Gaea, the system that runs this world. Perhaps it's giving me one more chance.

317201001.content: In a corridor which seems to have no end, Kuninotokotachi and Buzenbo run side by side.

317201002.content: Where the heck is the exit?

317201003.content: If we keep going forward we'll just end up having to come back. My gut says left.

317201004.content: Your gut is never wrong. I'll trust you!

317201005.content: Kuninotokotachi, have you ever heard of the Karasugo's Bladechoosings?

317201007.content: It's something about choosing someone to wield a special sword. I think it might be relevant to our investigation.

317201008.content: I think we should take part and figure out what's going on.

317201009.content: Yes, we have to take part.

317201012.content: For some reason, a normal and logical conversation gradually becomes disjointed, until the two participants were repeating the same phrase, as if in a trance.

317201013.content: Kuninotokotachi doesn't notice anything is wrong. But the more she repeats the phrase, the more she comes to believe it.

317201015.content: A huge grappling hook flies towards them and pins Buzenbo to the wall. Kuninotokotachi, taken by surprise, instinctively draws her kunai and stabs it towards their attacker. She halts her attack before it lands.

317201016.content: You... I know you! Sekhmet? The crazy lady!

317201018.content: Sekhmet manages a friendly smile, despite the fact Kuninotokotachi's kunai has drawn blood from her neck.

317201019.content: What's with the attacking Buzenbo thing?

317201020.content: Interesting. Did our young warrior friend come here?

317201022.content: Kuninotokotachi looks back. There's a grappling hook embedded in the wall, but no sign of Buzenbo.

317201023.content: Am I hallucinating? The Crow God?

317201024.content: It's not a hallucination. It's more like something is rewriting your consciousness. Or your memories.

317201026.content: CORG has some references to powers like this, in top-secret files. There's nothing on where the ability comes from, but detailed descriptions of its effects.

317201027.content: The Crow God is able to wipe people's memories and influence their minds. So something like this... it's not too much of a stretch.

317201028.content: But fortunately for you, I was aware it might happen and set up some defenses in my subconscious. That meant I was able to resist.

317201029.content: Kuninotokotachi sheathes her kunai and rubs her still-dizzy head.

317201030.content: Thanks. I guess I owe you one.

317201031.content: So, did you pick up any intel while you were under?

317201033.content: Any info on what it tried to do to you could be valuable right now. What did it make you believe?

317201034.content: Kuninotokotachi tries to recall her conversation with the imaginary Buzenbo. But all her memories of it are fuzzy and fading, as if her brain is rejecting a foreign invader.

317201035.content: Okay, I know that face. It's the I-can't-help-you face.

317201036.content: We can't waste time worrying about it. Where's everyone else? Have we lost contact again?

317201038.content: When we defeated the Crow God, it set off some kind of wave. I guess it set some kind of trap and we fell into it.

317201039.content: Whatever way you look at it, it was a weird fight. I can't figure it out right now.

317201040.content: Just what powers does the Crow God have? Does it change our memories? Make us hallucinate? Summon Visbanes? Create alter-dimensions?

317201041.content: The space they are in seems to respond to Kuninotokotachi's questions. That hateful sound echoes in the corridor once more.

317201042.content: That type of Visbane again. Should have known.

317202001.content: Kuninotokotachi and Sekhmet get to the exit at full speed and just a moment too late.

317202002.content: The Visbanes have arranged their twisted forms into a solid and impenetrable wall, blocking the exit from the corridor. Sekhmet grasps her Access Key, but she's not happy about it.

317202003.content: This means trouble. Using it here...

317202004.content: Suddenly, several flashes of electric light pierce the Visbane blockade and it collapses.

317202005.content: As the ashes of countless Visbanes disperse, a familiar figure comes into view.

317211001.content: The long-awaited reunion takes Tsukuyomi by surprise, but despite that the first thing she thinks of is work.

317211002.content: So if you're here, I guess our enemies aren't working in secret anymore. They've got Aether Gazer's attention...

317211004.content: Kuninotokotachi walks up to Tsukuyomi and gives her a big hug, Tsukuyomi, always serious, makes it weird.

317211006.content: Same smell. Same feel. I think you're real, Captain.

317211008.content: I can guarantee, this isn't a hallucination. But I admire Pheasant Squad's innovative methods of identification.

317211009.content: Hush your nonsense. Captain, this is some crazy lady CORG have sent to work with us. She's some kind of Captain too.

317211010.content: I don't think crazy lady is accurate, but it's close enough for now. Call me Sekhmet, if you like. It's my name.

317211011.content: Released from Kuninotokotachi's embrace, Tsukuyomi is immediately alert and back on mission.

317211012.content: CORG and Aether Gazer are working together?

317211013.content: We don't have any other choice. The situation is too big for either org to handle alone.

317211014.content: So, the Five Mountain Gods are on the agenda at last...

317211015.content: Captain, we haven't seen you for ages. What have you been doing?

317211016.content: Tsukuyomi glances at Sekhmet and doesn't reply.

317211017.content: I think that look made it clear, but let me clarify. You still want to be careful about what intel we share, right?

317211018.content: It's a simple precaution. But these are special circumstances and if I deem it necessary I'll make my own decisions on what you need to know.

317211019.content: Hmm... You're certainly easier to talk with than the Honorable Ninja here.

317211020.content: Please, crazy lady, don't play your word games with our Captain. She isn't blessed with my levels of patience.

317211021.content: Kuninotokotachi, I need to know what intel you've already shared with CORG.

317211023.content: Kuninotokotachi does her best to report, starting with the Visbeast investigation and leading up to the Karasugo Family, but taking care to conceal any details CORG don't need to know.

317211024.content: The Miyahebi, the Akishika, and now the Karasugo...

317211025.content: I think my missing eye reminds us we can add the Sansaru to the list.

317211026.content: What about the Izuru? The Crane God is the only one of the five that legends tell us was killed long ago. So maybe whatever's happening, happened to the Izuru back then.

317211027.content: Five families, worshipping five evil gods. Sooner or later they all suffer. It could be.

317211028.content: No. I don't think we should look at each family separately.

317211029.content: Oh? Finally going to share some info?

317211030.content: Tsukuyomi sighs and seems to make a decision.

317211031.content: Controlling the powerful families is just a means the gods use to achieve their aims. What they're actually doing is fighting amongst themselves. At least, that's what my investigation suggests.

317211032.content: The legends have been embellished and exaggerated, but there are elements of fact still in there. For example, that the other gods ganged up to kill the Crane God.

317211033.content: As for what the gods are fighting over... I don't know yet.

317211034.content: Cognizant Visbanes fighting each other? What, the strongest survives?

317211035.content: It can't be so simple. But I do know that recent events in Sasanami are connected with their conflict. All the clues are now pointing towards the Karasugo Family.

317211036.content: I've been investigating undercover since the Miyahebi incident. I soon found out the Karasugo have been sending agents to work within the other families, but I don't know what for. I followed an unaffiliated Mod working for the Karasugo here and haven't been able to get away since.

317211037.content: An unaffiliated Mod. That young one? But why would the Crow God want to have a Mod working for it?

317211038.content: I can't draw any conclusions yet.

317211039.content: Tsukuyomi recalls what the mysterious voice told her and comes up with an even more worrying possibility. She doesn't mention it though. It's something that could turn all Sasanami upside down.

317211040.content: Regardless, we need to deal with the Karasugo first. That's the only way we'll get any more information.

317211041.content: Deal with the Karasugo Family... We thought we had the Crow God, but it escaped and now we're stuck here. What do we do now?

317211042.content: Have you seen the Crow God?

317211043.content: Yeah. Looked like a young girl. A little bit younger than Buzenbo.

317211045.content: I was trapped in some weird dimension and something I think was the Crow God talked to me. But I only heard a voice.

317211046.content: It wasn't a girl's voice. Didn't talk like a girl either. I think we must have met two different things.

317211048.content: Just as Kuninotokotachi and Tsukuyomi are pondering the problem, Sekhmet stops listening and starts talking.

317211049.content: What made you think the voice belonged to the Crow God?

317211050.content: It just seemed to be. It was able to control the structure of space and change the appearance of Visbanes. If it wasn't the Crow God, that just means we've got two powerful enemies to deal with instead of one.

317211052.content: Honorable Warrior, I'd like you to tell us what has happened while you've been trapped here. In detail, this time.

317211053.content: I can, but there's not a lot to tell.

317211054.content: Once I was trapped I assumed I'd come under immediate attack. But I didn't know what the Crow God would send against me, so all I could do was stay ready.

317211055.content: However, I did figure the Crow God would have similar powers to the Miyahebi's Snake God, so I prepared to fight the types of Visbanes we faced then. Sure enough, that was what turned up.

317211056.content: The fights weren't tough enough to cause me any trouble. I killed everything that came at me and got out.

317211057.content: I see. But the Visbanes we fought here were new types, ones we don't have on file.

317211058.content: Sekhmet falls silent while she considers Tsukuyomi's report.

317211059.content: Is there anything useful in there? I mean, I never actually came into contact with the Crow God.

317211060.content: Before Sekhmet can speak, the sound of distant gunfire interrupts their conversation.

317211063.content: They could be in trouble. If they're our people we need to help them, stat!

317212001.content: Kuninotokotachi and the others rush to the source of the gunshots, killing all Visbanes which stand in their way. They find a single agent holding out against attack.

317212002.content: Wait. Confirm your identity. The signal's poor.

317212005.content: Aw, just like old times. It's almost touching.

317212007.content: Sorry, Captain. I got separated again.

317212008.content: Everyone was heading for the rally point when I had the bright idea of going back to see if we'd missed anyone. Uh... then everyone disappeared.

317212009.content: No surprise there, you always were the one with all the ideas. You got lucky this time, though. It meant you missed out on the Crow God's parting gift.

317212011.content: Me... I'm fine. But look who I found.

317212012.content: Tsukuyomi and Kuninotokotachi follow Agent R's gaze. In an overlooked corner, an agent lies propped against the wall.

317212013.content: His head is slumped over, but he's still holding a gun loosely by his side. The pattern of the blood splattered across the wall behind him makes it clear he shot himself.

317212014.content: I checked his tags. It's Agent B. It's awful. I mean... I know he was always the jumpy one, but I can't imagine what would make him do this.

317212016.content: Sekhmet doesn't look at Agent B. It seems she's noticed something wrong with Agent R and, as she speaks, R slumps against the wall.

317212018.content: Agent R looks at the blood he's coughed up into his hand and his voice starts to shake. Sekhmet pulls out an emergency first aid kit and pulls her agent's hand away from his chest wound.

317212019.content: It's deep. Scary deep. For Agent R, it's a death sentence. It's hard to imagine how he's managed to hold on for this long.

317212020.content: Sorry for... going rogue... caused you trouble...

317212021.content: My mistake again... I thought... could cover it up...

317212022.content: At least... I did good this time, right?

317212024.content: As if setting down a burden, Agent R lets his body soften and he slides down the wall. Then, nothing.

317212025.content: Tsukuyomi and Kuninotokotachi glance at each other. Sekhmet, too, is silent. She removes Agent R's identity tag and then walks over to Agent B's corpse.

317212026.content: She checks his surroundings. There are a number of communicators piled up nearby.

317212028.content: The model is standard Quake Damage Control Department issue. All the ones the team had, I think.

317212029.content: But how come... they've all been shot?

317212031.content: The last thing Sekhmet finds is a piece of paper clutched in Agent B's other hand. She unfolds it and reads it. Whatever it is, it seems to comfort her.

317212032.content: Looks like this is the Crow God's final play.

317221002.content: Agent B discovered the Crow God's method of last resort.

317221003.content: If the spatial traps, the Visbane attacks, the mind rewriting... if all that fails to defeat us, it looks into our past. It makes our enemies and our friends appear to us. To confuse us and to turn us against each other.

317221004.content: This dimension is no more than the arena it gives us to fight in.

317221005.content: Both Kuninotokotachi and Tsukuyomi tighten their grips on their weapons.

317221007.content: Don't worry, I'm not questioning who you both are. The conjured-up images are still Visbane connections and us Mods can easily sense their Bane Energy.

317221008.content: Kuninotokotachi and Tsukuyomi glance at each other and relax a little.

317221009.content: If we can sense them, we can kill them.

317221010.content: But for ordinary people, there's no escape.

317221011.content: Sekhmet clenches a fist around Agent B's final message and then removes his dog tags.

317221012.content: So what conclusions can we reach now we have this new intel?

317221013.content: I need to run an experiment.

317221015.content: You will remember, Honorable Ninja, we passed a platform connected to a lot of portals. On those portals were the questions the Crow God uses to identify friends and foes.

317221016.content: If we can gather all that information, maybe we can use it to better understand the Crow God.

317221018.content: Then what are we waiting for?

317221019.content: But I need to remind you of something. You need to be prepared for the kind of enemies we're going to face.

317221020.content: The warning causes Tsukuyomi to pause for a moment before responding.

317222001.content: It really happened. Okay, crazy lady, what's next?

317222003.content: But we haven't been through all the portals.

317222004.content: I told a lie. Even if we got through every portal we wouldn't learn much new about the Crow God.

317222005.content: Agent B didn't leave any information about the Crow God in the note. I made up the story about the Crow God being able to make our friends appear. I guess I must be a good actor, because you both believed me.

317222006.content: You sure put the crazy in crazy lady.

317222007.content: But here's the thing. My lies came true.

317222009.content: So your friends didn't appear and fight you, because you knew it was all a lie?

317222011.content: So show us what your agent did tell you.

317222012.content: Sekhmet tosses Agent B's note to Tsukuyomi, who unfolds it. Tsukuyomi and Kuninotokotachi read it together. There's only one sentence.

317222013.content: "The Crow God has been destroyed. It must have been destroyed."

317222014.content: I really should have thought of this earlier. All along, my theories have been quickly confirmed. But what if that's what happening? Whatever we think is true, becomes true.

317222015.content: I finally understand what it was they were trying to tell me. It's something that could never be described directly.

317222016.content: So what conclusion have you reached?

317222017.content: It's too late. There's no point in trying to control the spread of information any longer. But at least I can explain the situation.

317222018.content: Sekhmet turns to look off into the distance, as if she's locked eyes with something in there.

317222019.content: The Crow God is some kind of meme monster.

317222021.content: We're used to killing our ordinary monsters with our ordinary methods. We use sharp objects and powerful forces to wipe out physical monsters, and that means most of the time we completely ignore the nature of our world.

317222022.content: Gaea is a virtual world, constructed from data. Our bodies? Data. Our memories? Data. Every bit of sensory input we get? Data. It's data all the way down.

317222023.content: If you think about it, interactions between different bits of data are, themselves, data. What if that data can then interact with other data?

317222024.content: I'm going to need specific examples.

317222025.content: If we learn the Crow God can summon up monsters... those monsters appear.

317222026.content: If you believe the Crow God can magic up your friends and make them fight you... your friends appear and fight you.

317222027.content: Any kind of power you believe the Crow God has, it gets. Over you, at least.

317222028.content: Both Kuninotokotachi and Tsukuyomi are too shocked to respond.

317222029.content: Our thoughts themselves are just data interacting. As soon as we learn of the idea of the Crow God and start thinking about it... it starts to evolve and there's no way of stopping it.

317222030.content: Our ideas are what gives it its power.

317222031.content: Wait a minute. Doesn't this mean we can imagine the Crow God as... as something weak and feeble. And then wipe it out?

317222032.content: I told you, it's already too late. It's a simple matter of numbers.

317222033.content: When the Crow God meme had only infected a small number of people, it was just a matter of how those people thought of it. But what happens when enough people are infected?

317222034.content: Once a sequence of infections is set up, the meme is constantly spreading and mutating and any one person's mind is unable to control it.

317222035.content: Both Tsukuyomi and Kuninotokotachi have the same terrifying idea at the same time.

317222036.content: So how do we fight it?

317222037.content: My agents already did the best possible.

317222039.content: Initially, I thought it was the Crow God that had wiped their memories. But now it seems more likely that they realized the memetic nature of the Crow God and wiped their own memories to dispose of it.

317222040.content: If that's the case, it explains why they left notes behind.

317222041.content: But is wiping their own memories enough? If you're right, and everyone's aware of the Mountain Gods and CORG and Aether Gazer have already fought the Snake God and the Deer God, then everyone's going to assume the Crow God is real too.

317222042.content: That's exactly what they did. The meme was already spreading when the investigation started.

317222043.content: That means... What happens if the meme infection reaches the Sephirah Zone or beyond?

317222044.content: Then I'm afraid the monster will launch an attack from the minds it has infected. That could drive the deviation rate high enough to force Gaea to reboot.

317222045.content: It's a possibility that leaves the three in a stunned silence.

317222046.content: But there's got to be something we can do?

317222047.content: My agents already did everything they could.

317222048.content: Sekhmet gestures to Agent B's note, and Tsukuyomi and Kuninotokotachi look at it again.

317222050.content: It was the only message they tried to get to the outside world. The next thing they did was destroy their own communicators.

317222051.content: They understood how the Quake Damage Control Department works. They knew the Director would issue a statement to shut down any rumors and ensure morale, then send me to investigate.

317222052.content: So the world would assume they had sacrificed themselves, but destroyed the Crow God. That would have limited the Crow God meme to people in the Karasugo family and a few others who knew the truth.

317222054.content: I just remembered something. When we were chasing the Crow God, right at the end the agents trapped in this dimension found communicators and we could all get in touch. So that must have been part of the Crow God's plan, right?

317222055.content: It meant its meme infected everyone.

317222056.content: No. There's something not quite right.

317222057.content: The Quake Damage Control Department has dealt with a few meme infections. From what we've learned, early-stage meme monsters are limited to the imaginations of the individuals they infect. They can't have any effect on reality.

317222058.content: They don't become autonomous until later, when the number of infections reaches some critical mass.

317222059.content: The manipulation of space and the provision of communicators so agents could talk to each other... that's obviously designed to ensure the number of infections reaches critical mass. But the Crow God itself couldn't have done it.

317222060.content: So we're back to having two enemies. The space-manipulator and the Crow God?

317222062.content: Now I know all this, I can see what that being I spoke to, the one I thought was the Crow God, was hinting at.

317222063.content: There is another being, the girl, which can control spatial structure. I guess that's the "Crow God" you ran into.

317222064.content: The real Karasugo Lord? That wasn't the Crow God itself?

317222065.content: Maybe the Crow God already has the entire Karasugo family under its control. It would make sense for the Karasugo Lord to be in its power.

317222068.content: I've looked into the history of the family. I found a lot of information about the Crow God has been destroyed, by the Karasugo themselves.

317222070.content: If the Karasugo were working for the Crow God, it'd be easy for them to encourage the spread of the legends and their own family history in order to get more people infected with the meme. But they did the exact opposite.

317222071.content: All the rules of this dimension seem to be working for the Crow God. But in some crucial aspects, not.

317222072.content: So many questions, so few answers. The three mull it all over for a while.

317222073.content: I think the first thing we need to do is agree our priority is fixing the problem, not investigating what's behind it.

317222074.content: In fact, investigating might mean things get so bad we can't fix them.

317222075.content: If we keep delaying, everyone will assume we've dropped off the grid and send more people to continue the investigation. That's just going to make matters worse.

317222077.content: Sekhmet is clearly deep in thought. It makes Kuninotokotachi nervous.

317222078.content: Enough cogitating. We need to figure out how to deal with the meme infection... Hey, will doing that just help the Crow God?

317222079.content: Honorable Agent, you said your people wiped their own memories. That means they have memory-wipe equipment, doesn't it?

317222081.content: The one in charge of all your gear? That Agent H thinks of everything.

317222082.content: But first, we need to figure out how to escape this dimension.

317222083.content: The three furrow their brows. Then, Sekhmet's communicator sounds.

317222085.content: Sekhmet glances at the screen and fails to suppress a smile.

317222086.content: Looks like your Admin hasn't dropped the ball.

317231001.content: The food has been sitting in her cell for so long it's no longer steaming. However, Izanami still shows no sign of touching it.

317231003.content: Take it away. I don't want it.

317231005.content: I know she's a Mod and that she won't starve if she doesn't eat. But she looks broken and that worries me.

317231006.content: It's okay, I understand. Girls your age are always skipping meals to keep their figures. But their parents do worry.

317231007.content: You're just a family retainer. I don't think you need to worry about me.

317231008.content: Ah, if I had a daughter... She'd be even meaner to me than you.

317231009.content: I'm a little surprised. I hadn't expected Agent F to be so caring.

317231010.content: Are you sure you don't have family, F?

317231011.content: As if. Why would I come to a place like this if I had a wife and kids at home? I'm not even getting overtime.

317231012.content: This seems to remind Agent F of something.

317231013.content: I'll tell you something. If I had a wife and kids...

317231014.content: Humans and their families. Such a waste of time.

317231015.content: The sudden statement leaves Agent F speechless. I can hear something in her voice, something hopeless and sad.

317231016.content: F, I need to discuss some confidential matters with Senba. Could you...

317231017.content: You want to talk to her alone? She's the witch who killed the Lord's mother, remember? If she loses her temper you might not be able to handle her.

317231018.content: What does she look like to you? A witch, or a girl?

317231019.content: The question makes the agent pause to think a moment.

317231020.content: Okay. I need some fresh air anyway.

317231021.content: With a knowing glance, Agent F leaves. I soon hear him and the guard laughing and joking outside. He's an expert at currying favor and I know the guard won't be paying any attention to what's happening in the cell.

317231022.content: Senba, you cared about the Lord's mother, didn't you?

317231024.content: You don't need to pretend. I saw you calling her Mother. I know family is important to you too.

317231025.content: Oh, you think you know me?

317231026.content: No, not at all. Your past is just getting more and more confusing.

317231027.content: But oddly enough, we don't always need to know someone to understand them.

317231028.content: What do you want from me?

317231029.content: It's like I said. I want to save you and get you out of here.

317231031.content: The idea seems to conjure up bad memories for her. Her eyes are no longer empty, but filled with tears and sadness. As if I've already saved her from something?

317231033.content: Because Senba once saved me. And nobody wants to always be the saved and never do the saving, right?

317231034.content: Izanami thinks for a while, her eyes drying as she does so.

317231035.content: It's strange. I have no idea who you are but I feel sure you're telling the truth.

317231036.content: It's because of what the Crow God has done. I'm not sure exactly what effects it has, but I do know one thing.

317231037.content: There's something deep inside us that stays constant. And that is the only thing in this whole manor we can trust.

317231038.content: So how do you plan to get me out of here?

317231039.content: The plan is to use the Bladechoosing as cover and get in touch with my team. Then we kill the Crow God once and for all. If we do that, we can get you out.

317231040.content: And once the Crow God is dead you'll be able to talk about whatever it is that's causing you so much pain, right?

317231041.content: Izanami thinks for a while before saying the words I hoped to hear.

317231044.content: I'm a little surprised, but she seems sincere. She pushes a hand through the slot in the cell door and waves it at me. She has to stretch, as she's so short.

317231047.content: I take Izanami's hand, cautiously. It's as cold and smooth as jade, but there's a touch of warmth there, right at the center of her palm.

317231048.content: If you're taking part in the Bladechoosing this will be very helpful.

317231049.content: When she releases my hand I see there's a new mark on my palm.

317231051.content: Remember, don't use it for too long. Once it's used up, it's gone. So end your fights as quick as you can.

317231052.content: She hasn't answered my question. She goes back to the corner she was hiding in, hugs her knees, and seems to fall into a deep sleep. It's as if our conversation has left her drained.

317231053.content: You still love riddles, I see.

317231054.content: I stand closer to the slot in the door and talk as softly as I can.

317231057.content: I wasn't expecting even that response. There's more I want to say but it seems better not to disturb her. I take my words and turn them into a smile.

317231058.content: Our patrol didn't find anything of note. Our fugitive is a tough customer. We forced him to appear once, but he soon got away.

317231059.content: He was carrying some kind of gun, something advanced. If we could get some firearms we'd have a better chance of grabbing him.

317231060.content: An armed fugitive? Weird, but nothing to do with us.

317231061.content: So, tell us about the witch.

317231062.content: She's not a witch. She's Senba!

317231063.content: Sorry... I have heard of her, though. There's the eldest brother, who's the Lord, and a younger girl who is Child of Heaven. And in the middle there's the adopted girl.

317231064.content: There was a rumor she disappeared after something happened. I never thought we'd find her in the dungeons.

317231065.content: How come you've never heard this before? The Lord told us all about it but made it clear we weren't to tell any outsiders.

317231066.content: Let's just say you've all got a few screws loose in your brains. I can't explain it, though, so assume I was talking nonsense.

317231067.content: I just thought of something else. Although the bodyguard unit I'm in is meant to be protecting the Lord, it seems like our Captain's orders are coming from someone else.

317231068.content: For a while there was a rumor circulating that the Lord wasn't the real Lord, that someone else holds the real power. That made me curious, so I followed our Captain and saw him talking to some young woman.

317231070.content: You mean Senba became the actual Lord of the Karasugo?

317231071.content: I can't be sure. I was too far away to see who the girl was. You'll need to ask our Captain.

317231072.content: Everyone turns to look at Kagutsuchi, who hasn't been taking part in the discussion. I'm surprised to see he's left Ryugiri sitting on the floor and is making something out of metal wire.

317231074.content: Yeah. Even though I got through to the next round none of the Mihakashisyuu want to practice with me. So I've got a little free time.

317231075.content: You must be a natural or something. That's incredible.

317231076.content: No, I just learned from a friend.

317231077.content: And with that, he pauses and stares at the hook in his hand, as if surprised.

317231078.content: Never mind that... Listen, do you know anything about the Karasugo's adopted daughter?

317231079.content: The one the Lord spoke to us about?

317231080.content: This isn't going anywhere... So, the plan remains the same. Figure out how to get into the Crow's Nest and find Mimir.

317231082.content: I try holding hands with Kagutsuchi and Shadow Crow, just like Izanami held hands with me. Both of them are left with that same mark.

317231084.content: Senba said it'll help us in the Bladechoosing. But we can't use it for very long.

317231086.content: Kagutsuchi stares at the mark, as if he's remembering something.

317231087.content: Does it remind you of something, Kagutsuchi?

317231089.content: Kagutsuchi lets his hand fall and I can't help but feel disappointed.

317231090.content: Shadow Crow, I've just had a thought. Do you think there's any way we could give people some kind of shock and snap them out of whatever the Crow God has done?

317231091.content: Hmm... It would need to be something powerful enough. But right now I think we should focus on getting through to the next round of the Bladechoosing.

317231092.content: I know, but it's dangerous and I'm worried about you all. If only there was another way.

317231093.content: No need to worry. If we find ourselves up against anyone too good, we can just quit and go home.

317231095.content: Kagutsuchi's sudden outburst has everyone staring in shock.

317231096.content: There's no way to quit once you enter the arena. We have to survive!

317231097.content: Captain... I'm going to do my best, but we're not talking about a fight to the death, are we?

317231098.content: Kagutsuchi doesn't reply. He just stares at that fishhook.

317231099.content: Once this next round is finished, the Bladechoosing will move to the Crow's Nest. Then I'll be able to figure out a way to get you in there.

317231100.content: But if you want to end all this, you need to move quickly.

317231102.content: He seems to take a moment to think over his reaction and the reasons for it. But I can see he's as confused as the rest of us.

317231103.content: I... I don't have any friends. I'm not used to dealing with so many people like this.

317231104.content: I'm not like you. I don't have any goals, I'm not working towards anything. I'm going to keep my side of our deal, and then...

317231105.content: Kagutsuchi, we can be your friends. If you'd like that?

317231106.content: I mean, we could be fighting side by side next, right?

317231107.content: I pick Ryugiri up and place it into Kagutsuchi's hand. There's a long pause before he tightens his grip on its hilt.

317231108.content: I will help you. But don't try to make friends.

317231109.content: The bell sounds to announce the next round of fights. Kagutsuchi takes his blade and walks off slowly. I watch as he goes and there's something familiar about his posture, about the set of his shoulders. But what do I know?

317231110.content: I'm worried about sending him off to fight in that state of mind. What happened to him? Does anyone know?

317231111.content: I have no idea. He rarely talks about his past and I can't imagine what would cause such a big change. He was the one who taught me to run away from any fight I couldn't win, but now...

317231112.content: Anyway, don't worry about it. I'm closer to him than anyone else. Leave him to me.

317231113.content: The lights in the arena brighten as the contestants enter.

317231114.content: Changes have been made since the last round. The ring is surrounded by a black barrier and there's a trench separating the spectators from the fighters. It's as if some unknown possibility needs to be guarded against.

317231116.content: Karasugo Sendou appears on a stand in a corner of the room. He gazes out at the Mihakashisyuu, grave and authoritative.

317231117.content: As I have told you, today's fights will be crueler. Sacrifices will be inevitable.

317231118.content: Such sacrifices have been made before, in previous Bladechoosings.

317231119.content: To end all this, we must find the final victor!

317231120.content: The Mihakashisyuu break out in cheers, welcoming the Lord's words.

317231121.content: If anything does go wrong, look to me for help.

317231122.content: I'm worried the overseer will set you up. If there's no other option I'll come in there and fight with you.

317231123.content: I'm really not your Captain, you know?

317231125.content: Kagutsuchi doesn't deny it. He doesn't seem used to arguing with people who insist on being kind to him. But there's a look of concern on his face now, as he looks towards the ring.

317232001.content: The fights start, the fights end, each more violent than any in the previous round. Almost all the losers die in agony, wrapped in dark flames.

317232002.content: And in some fights, even the winners suffer the same fate.

317232003.content: Kagutsuchi, victorious again in his match, looks at the mark on his palm. It's glowing, and the dark spots on his arms are throbbing painfully. As if he's suddenly remembered something, he runs from the ring. He knocks into the overseer, who is just about to declare his victory.

317232004.content: What the... Don't you know how this works!?

317232005.content: One of the overseer's best men just died fighting Kagutsuchi, but he manages to avoid completely losing his temper.

317232006.content: You really don't know anything, do you? All the contestants reaching this stage have to go through the same thing. I don't care if you're scared, it's too late to quit.

317232009.content: The overseer realizes the usually meek and mild Kagutsuchi is now brimming with anger and automatically steps aside to let him pass.

317232010.content: Kagutsuchi rushes to the rest area provided for the fighters and looks for someone amongst those who have survived. He soon finds Shadow Crow.

317232012.content: Captain! Phew... I was just worrying about you.

317232013.content: Listen, I think there's something up with that ring. The longer I spent in there, the more I felt like I was burning up from inside. That's what happened to my opponent. I think this is the only reason I survived.

317232014.content: Shadow Crow shows Kagutsuchi the mark on his own palm. It, too, is glowing.

317241001.content: Shadow Crow's story makes me think of that night. The night I will always regret.

317241003.content: Yeah. I don't know what it was. Is it part of the Bladechoosing? A test?

317241005.content: Kagutsuchi, silent until now, suddenly speaks. Everyone turns to look at him.

317241008.content: Kagutsuchi clutches his temples in pain.

317241009.content: What you said before, about our minds having been rewritten... Was that true?

317241010.content: Are you starting to realize something?

317241011.content: I constantly feel like I've forgotten something important. I try and remember but it's like walking into a brick wall. I can't break through it. I can recall fragments but nothing more.

317241012.content: The three agents with us look at each other. I can tell they have had the same experience.

317241013.content: Captain, maybe I can give you reminders. Like... You were Captain of the Lord's bodyguard. I was one of your men. Things like that.

317241014.content: Hmm. No. That's not what I need to remember...

317241015.content: The important things you can't remember are far in the past, right? That means none of us will know what they are. All you can do is try to figure then out.

317241016.content: How much can you recall? You mentioned Madoibi, for example. What's that?

317241019.content: I can't help but be disappointed. But I look at Kagutsuchi and see how confused and frustrated he is as he tries to remember. All I can do is accept that he's trying his best.

317241020.content: I can remember that the ring is made from some special material. And if you fight in there, you get burned by Madoibi fire. And the harder the fight is the more it affects you. Only the person who can resist it for the longest will survive.

317241021.content: What? So the only thing to do is to leave the ring as soon as you feel it happening? If we leave early, we should be okay, right? Winning isn't that important.
