317241022.content: I told you quitting isn't an option. That's the point of the Bladechoosing, to find people who can resist the Madoibi during combat. Nobody, winner or loser, is allowed to quit. Your opponent could commit suicide and the overseer would just send in someone new for you to fight.

317241023.content: Even if you try to run away, they've got the ring sealed off. There's no way out.

317241024.content: But isn't that a fight to the death!? They never told us about this before...

317241025.content: It also means many will be injured or killed. I can't let something like that go ahead...

317241026.content: Admin, can you really stop this if you get your hands on your communicator?

317241027.content: If I can get in touch with my team... Actually, no, it's more important to get in touch with the outside world. If I can get backup I'm sure we can sort this out.

317241028.content: Then let's come up with a plan, stat.

317241029.content: They've given me a pass which lets me into the Crow's Nest. I'm not sure how to make best use of it though...

317241030.content: That should be enough to get one of us past the guards. Then you can pretend you lost your pass and they'll probably let you in once they've checked you are who you say you are. That gets two of us in.

317241032.content: I've got a pass too. That means four of us can get in.

317241034.content: It sounds too dangerous. I'm out.

317241035.content: I'm in! Sounds like we're spies infiltrating an enemy base. Awesome.

317241036.content: So K and I will go in. We'll need help on the outside too, H, and I know I can trust you with that.

317241037.content: Like I said, you talk like an officer.

317241038.content: We get into the details of our infiltration plan, but Kagutsuchi's thoughts seem to be elsewhere.

317241039.content: Shadow Crow, if you want to help Admin you can just let them use your pass. You don't need to go in there.

317241040.content: No. I hid the communicator in the Crow's Nest and they won't be able to find it without me to take them there. Once we've got it we'll get out as soon as we can.

317241041.content: As long as that's all you do. Stay away from the Bladechoosing.

317241042.content: Don't worry, Captain, I'm not scared. Even if I need to fight, I've seen the Mihakashisyuu. They're no better than I am. And I've got this mark from Admin.

317241044.content: Absolutely. Saved my life. Do you have any idea how it works?

317241046.content: The others are too busy to notice I fall silent.

317241047.content: By the time I'm back in the dungeons, night is falling again.

317241048.content: Izanami is still curled up in the corner, looking as if she's not even a part of our world. I try to lighten my steps to avoid waking her, but she calls out to me.

317241050.content: Yeah. That thing you gave me was very useful. Thanks.

317241051.content: Keep fighting. Keep winning. Do what you need to do.

317241054.content: I was going to ask about that mark, but I suspect I won't get any answers.

317241055.content: Not that it matters. I found a way to avoid all the fighting. I'm going to sneak into the Crow's Nest and get my communicator back so I can get in touch with my team. We'll be able to get you out of here then. Whatever misunderstandings and confusions there have been can all be explained then.

317241056.content: That's why I came back. To tell you that.

317241057.content: With that said, and a little reluctantly, I turn to leave. I can hear Agent F outside chatting with the guard, and I know we don't have much time. This isn't a scheduled mealtime, after all.

317241059.content: I can hear the awkwardness in her voice. I guess Izanami isn't used to asking people to stay.

317241061.content: Kinda. I don't know how the operation will go.

317241062.content: I remove my gun from my jacket pocket and check the trigger and energy mag. I know I could need it when I'm face to face with a powerful Visbane.

317241063.content: Why would you do that? You don't need to.

317241064.content: I guess because it feels good to avoid all the waiting and praying.

317241067.content: I hide my gun again and do my best not to look back as I walk away.

317241069.content: Did she really say that? I turn my head in shock, but all I can see is the slot in the cell door.

317241070.content: I can't fool the guard anymore, pal. Time to go.

317241072.content: Don't worry. I'll keep an eye on things here while you're away.

317241073.content: I've always worried that Agent F might be lazy and unreliable. Now, I feel more confident.

317241074.content: Getting into the Crow's Nest is easier than expected. The guard checks our passes and lets Agent K and I in.

317241075.content: All that time prepping for an interrogation, wasted...

317241076.content: Let's just be glad we were lucky and get in there, quick. Going to be awkward if we're still here when Kagutsuchi and Shadow Crow turn up.

317241077.content: We need to find somewhere to hide until we can rendezvous.

317241078.content: They've built an arena in the Crow's Nest too? Wow, the Lord sure has opened his wallet.

317241079.content: There are too many people here. Shadow Crow's meeting place is in the outer corridor, it should be quieter there.

317241080.content: The rendezvous is a quiet corner, where Agent K and I can lean against a wall and relax.

317241081.content: And then Agent K does something which makes me tense up again. She pulls a pile of machine parts from a pocket and skillfully reassembles them into a standard-issue Quake Damage Control Department rifle.

317241082.content: This outfit's too warm, but it's great for smuggling weapons past guards.

317241084.content: My security job involved a lot of searching and it turns out there are guns like this scattered all over the place. Our boss wanted us to lock them all up, if you can believe that. No sense at all.

317241085.content: And given our mission today, I thought one might come in useful. So I broke it down and snuck it in.

317241086.content: I remember you scaring me by boasting about your muzzle speed when we first met. Guess I shouldn't be surprised. Just remember to keep it silenced.

317241087.content: I know. Uh... or I think I do.

317241088.content: You said something about our minds having been rewritten. So was I some kind of gunner previously? This baby feels much more natural to me than a blade.

317241089.content: You used to be... an outstanding CORG agent, I suspect.

317241090.content: An outstanding agent, huh? But all I can remember is growing up with the Karasugo Family. Never mind. As long as I've got a gun, I'm happy.

317241091.content: Two figures suddenly come round a corner and both Agent K and I flick our safeties off and reach for our triggers. Only when we recognize Kagutsuchi and Shadow Crow do we relax.

317241092.content: We need to move fast. When we told them we'd both lost our passes they decided to do a sweep for anyone who'd used them to sneak in. I didn't think they'd react so quickly.

317241094.content: You realize this is bad for us?

317241095.content: It should be okay. I... I think I can keep us safe. But... Let's just try not to get discovered.

317241096.content: At this point, Kagutsuchi seems to be fully committed to our criminal undertaking, but it's not something he's comfortable with.

317242001.content: We manage to get the guards to follow us—but as we turn a corner we run into another group of guards coming to investigate.

317242003.content: I flick my gun to stun and quickly send several guards to the floor.

317242004.content: Meanwhile, Agent K is handling the guards coming straight at us. She takes them out with a series of quick and accurate shots.

317242007.content: So these rifles have a stun setting? Awesome.

317242008.content: But Agent K and I have overlooked a blind spot. Several more guards are hiding around a corner behind us and, just as we're congratulating ourselves, they attack.

317242009.content: Several dark blades of light slash towards us but are soon cut short. Kagutsuchi reverses his weapon and uses the hilt to send the guards for a nap.

317242010.content: Hmm. I guess it's best to have some melee weapons around too. Could be useful in certain tactical situations.

317242011.content: Okay, we should be safe now.

317242012.content: Yeah, but not for long. There will be more guards coming after all that noise. Let's get out of the Crow's Nest and wait for Shadow Crow.

317242013.content: Kagutsuchi pauses for a moment and then gives me Ryugiri.

317242014.content: It's time to say farewell. Our deal is done and you should take the sword.

317242015.content: You... Surely you aren't going to join the Bladechoosing?

317242016.content: It'll be okay. I've been able to conceal my face and all the guards were unconscious before they got a look at me. Nobody's going to report me. I think...

317242017.content: I hesitate before sharing my opinion.

317242018.content: It'll be a massacre. Why not get out with us, while you still can?

317242019.content: I'll be able to call for help and everything that's happening here will stop. There's no need for more deaths in the meantime.

317242020.content: I don't want to stand in your way. All of this does need to stop, I agree.

317242022.content: I look at him in surprise and, as a wave of cheers comes from the arena, I realize what he's plotting.

317242023.content: You're going to win the Bladechoosing?

317242024.content: As soon as the right person is found, it'll end.

317242025.content: And once it's over, life can go on.

317242026.content: But that could be playing into the Crow God's hands!

317242027.content: As a Mihakashisyuu, my fate was never in my hands. The Crow God, the Karasugo... What difference does it make to me?

317242028.content: He sounds more resigned than determined, but there's no sign I can talk him out of it. He's made his mind up and nothing I can say will change that.

317242029.content: It's odd that someone like you would still hope for change.

317242031.content: There's no point in trying to explain. You don't know what future you is like.

317242032.content: I'm sorry. I still can't imagine who that person you talk about is.

317242033.content: I can remember a little. Just fragments. But when I try and put them together, I still feel my mission is to fight in the arena.

317242034.content: Then at least take Ryugiri with you. It's your sword.

317242035.content: You keep saying that and I keep feeling like it doesn't belong to me, like I can't make full use of its powers.

317242036.content: Just try to take it, please.

317242037.content: Once more, I pass Ryugiri to Kagutsuchi. He takes it reluctantly, not understanding why I'm so insistent.

317242038.content: I don't know what happened to you in the past. But I guess we all know how it feels to be troubled, right?

317242039.content: There's something I'd like to ask you. If you've done your best to make something happen and it hasn't worked out, what do you do? Do you regret the work already done, or do you work even harder to try and achieve your goal?

317242040.content: He doesn't reply, but I think I've reached him.

317242041.content: I'd choose the latter. And whether you want to live, or you want to bring about change... it doesn't make any difference to what you need to do, right?

317242042.content: And you only have the right to make that choice if you're holding that sword.

317242043.content: Kagutsuchi tightens his grip on Ryugiri and, at long last, meets my gaze.

317242045.content: We part ways at a corner of the corridor, each taking our chosen path.

317242046.content: And as we part, a few crow feathers float down from the ceiling. The black feathers glint in the light, as if they are the dark eyes of some presence.

317251001.content: Agent K and I rush back to our gang's usual place, but there's no sign of Shadow Crow yet.

317251002.content: This isn't right. We were the ones drawing fire. He should have been here first.

317251003.content: Keep your voice down. Everyone's on high alert for some reason.

317251004.content: We're going to look like idiots if we made all this noise for nothing.

317251005.content: A figure approaches, using the darkness to sneak up on us. Agent K immediately raises her rifle.

317251006.content: Friend! Friend! Don't point that thing at me!

317251007.content: I just took the girl some food. Not that she's eating any of it... Anyway, what news?

317251008.content: I look towards the Crow's Nest. There's still no sign of Shadow Crow and I can't help but feel apprehensive.

317251009.content: His name is called and Kagutsuchi once more takes the steps up to the ring.

317251010.content: He hasn't taken these steps before, yet they feel strangely familiar, as if he has walked them many times. And with each step, those fragments of memories reappear.

317251017.content: Finally, Kagutsuchi reaches the ring and prepares to fulfill the mission he has been given.

317251018.content: Must be your lucky day, punk. We just found a contestant in a prohibited area. The guards caught him and he got fighty. Now he's all beat up.

317251019.content: But we can't let contestants go to waste, and you're up next, so you get to fight him.

317251020.content: I'm sure you can handle him quickly, now he's been softened up for you. It's as good as a free pass to the next round!

317251021.content: As the overseer explains what's going on, Kagutsuchi gazes in shock and dismay at his opponent.

317251024.content: Kagutsuchi grasps the hilt of Ryugiri but makes no other movement.

317251025.content: Hey! Punish me however you want, but I'm done with this senseless slaughter. I resign!

317251026.content: Shadow Crow is clearly sincere, but his plea is met with nothing but laughter. He turns to run from the ring but seems to hit some kind of transparent wall. Whatever it's made of, it resists his attempts to hack through it without even a scratch.

317251027.content: And the Madoibi is starting to take effect. The marks on Kagutsuchi's arms start to throb with pain.

317251028.content: Shadow Crow finally stops trying to break out of the ring. He looks at his palm and sees the mark there is glowing but fading.

317251029.content: I told you not to come.

317251030.content: Captain, we were warned these marks wouldn't last long. Only one of us can get out of this ring alive.

317251031.content: I guess I'm lucky I'm facing you here, Captain. At least I can fulfill my promise to Admin.

317251032.content: Shadow Crow puts the bag he's been clutching to one side, allowing him to grip his blade with both hands.

317251033.content: I got the communicator but couldn't get out of the Crow's Nest. Once we're... Once we're done here, Captain, will you deliver it for me?

317251034.content: Like you always said, I have to follow through on my promises. Even if I'm a bit lazy in the process.

317251036.content: The scene in front of Kagutsuchi is becoming more and more familiar. It summons up disturbing memories, still vague, which leave him constantly reeling.

317253001.content: Shadow Crow's attacks are almost suicidal and no matter how careful Kagutsuchi is he can't help wounding his reluctant opponent.

317253002.content: Kagutsuchi feels the clash of the blades reverberating through his body and, finally, sees Shadow Crow fall to a grave wound. And it all feels so familiar.

317253007.content: The cheers from outside the ring are becoming impatient, and the dark marks on his arms are now agonizingly painful. It's all driving Kagutsuchi to deliver the final blow.

317253008.content: The dark flames reach his chest, burning there, scorching his flesh.

317253009.content: Shadow Crow lies on the ground, badly wounded. Kagutsuchi sees another figure overlaid there, someone from his past. It's as if there's a barrier he must cut through to continue moving forward.

317253013.content: It's just one more swing. Do it.

317253015.content: Why does he say that? He doesn't know himself. It's as if a phrase sunk deep in his mind has been washed up onto the shores of consciousness and become visible once more.

317253016.content: He looks at Shadow Crow as if he's looking at an old friend.

317253017.content: I know that I cannot change anything that has happened before. That is done. But if I had the choice again, I would not strike the blow.

317253018.content: That... It's the blow I will always regret.

317253019.content: And as if finally set free, as if he finally knows what to do, Kagutsuchi clenches the hilt of his blade.

317253020.content: Why did I wait so long to say that...

317253021.content: Suddenly, he turns and swings Ryugiri at the transparent barrier surrounding the ring. He gives it everything he's got, but can't make so much as a scratch.

317253022.content: He doesn't hesitate. He swings again and the impact almost throws Ryugiri from his grasp. Still the barrier remains untouched.

317253024.content: He raises his blade once more, but all goes dark around him. It's as if his own determination is pulling him down, into some illusion.

317253028.content: You seemed to refuse to be me again, but you have never struck with such intent before.

317253029.content: You are still rejecting the blade.

317253030.content: Kagutsuchi grips the dark sword tighter but does not speak.

317253031.content: Stop resisting. Become me. I once tried to be something different. You have seen the consequences of that attempt.

317253032.content: So be me once more and complete the mission assigned to you. This too will make the world a better place.

317253035.content: I want to create a world people can survive in without having to be victorious. Even if doing so requires me to be victorious.

317253036.content: The other Kagutsuchi is surprised, then gives an understanding smile.

317253038.content: It is clear from how Kagutsuchi holds Ryugiri that he has finally accepted the weapon as his own. Ignoring the pain, he uses the black flames burning from his hands to set the blade alight. His alter ego, meanwhile, draws a matching blade and waits.

317253039.content: Then the final victor will make the choice.

317252001.content: You must have withstood the Madoibi for several rounds of fighting even without help from my mark. So how come you ended up here fetching and carrying?

317252002.content: You know exactly why, yet you force me to remember. You are unkind.

317252003.content: Because of your friend? The one who died?

317252006.content: I used to be like him. Full of passion for life. I thought all I had to do was keep winning and then I could protect everything important to me.

317252007.content: I won that duel. But I lost everything I was trying to protect.

317252008.content: So that's it. And a warrior who doesn't know where to point their blade is useless.

317252009.content: You don't need to be mean about it, Miss Karasugo. Maybe I'm a warrior, maybe I'm useless. All I want to do now is fulfill the final promise I made to my friend and keep living. No more, no less.

317252010.content: You can't keep that promise any longer. The mark I gave you can delay the Madoibi corrosion, but not stop it. If it's not treated at the source you have no more than days left.

317252011.content: You want me to go back into the ring? But why? What would I be fighting for?

317252014.content: You don't need to worry about the future or fear failure. I'll tell you what to do and you do it. That's all.

317252015.content: And in exchange, I will stop your Madoibi corrosion getting worse. You'll be able to keep that promise, at least.

317252016.content: There's a long pause as Kagutsuchi thinks things over.

317252017.content: This isn't the best time to get thoughtful.

317252018.content: Think of it as reaffirming a decision.

317252019.content: Another Kagutsuchi appears, but he seems an alien presence in this particular memory. He looks more like an observer, a third party only here to watch.

317252020.content: After striking the final blow in that duel I lost all reason to fight. So I will accept your deal.

317252021.content: I'm just a failure trying to fool himself though, and this won't last. No true warrior can fight at their best when following another's orders.

317252022.content: It sounds like you've figured something out at last.

317252023.content: With some unexpected help, yes. A human. I watched as they strived and failed, yet decided to simply strive harder next time.

317252024.content: Maybe they can't repair all the damage. But they can stop things getting worse.

317252025.content: Izanami gazes at Kagutsuchi and sees he has made a decision, one that she will not be able to change.

317252026.content: This does not surprise me. Although I don't understand why you had to think for so long.

317252027.content: Izanami's form slowly fades out and leaves the two Kagutsuchis, each staring at the other.

317252028.content: Have you ever thought about what the future you have chosen will look like?

317252029.content: No. I just know I'm not scared of it any longer.

317252031.content: The fragments of Kagutsuchi's memory rearrange themselves over and over, until eventually they become complete and Kagutsuchi's consciousness is rebuilt.

317252032.content: The black marks on his arms no longer throb with pain and the burn of the Madoibi is now tamed. Dark flames spread from his arms to reach the tip of the blade.

317252034.content: With a single blow, that unbreakable barrier shatters and collapses.

317252035.content: When Shadow Crow, badly hurt, reappears in Kagutsuchi's line of vision, the rest of the arena has fallen into chaos.

317252036.content: The Lord said even the servants of the evil gods couldn't get through that barrier. How was he able to break it?

317252037.content: Don't just stand there. Those two contestants have broken the rules and besmirched the honor of the Bladechoosing! Arrest them and the Lord will pass judgement!

317252038.content: Amidst all the clamor, Shadow Crow raises his head once more, to look at Kagutsuchi.

317252042.content: Don't try to talk. You're hurt...

317252043.content: Kagutsuchi can't go on. Shadow Crow has spent too long in the ring and the Madoibi has reached his bones. Even without his wounds, there would be no chance of him walking out of the ring alive.

317252045.content: I've seen so many of my friends die since the Lord sealed off the manor... (Cough! Cough!)

317252046.content: You never said it, Captain, but I knew... we were in big trouble. (Cough! Cough!)

317252047.content: I'm just glad I... got to see you back to your old self again.

317252048.content: Those are the last words Shadow Crow can manage. With one final pleading glance, he passes the bag he was clutching so tight to Kagutsuchi.

317252049.content: There's sorrow in Kagutsuchi's eyes, but not for long. He has realized something: moving forward means accepting there will be losses along the way.

317252050.content: But that, he knows, is no reason to stop.

317252052.content: Shadow Crow nods and lies back down. The black flames consume him, turning him into ash on the air.

317252054.content: Kagutsuchi takes Shadow Crow's bag and weighs up the Mihakashisyuu charging towards him.

317252055.content: Bane Energy? Has everyone initially affected now been infected? Seems like it has reached critical mass.

317252056.content: Give yourself up, if you know what's good for you!

317252057.content: Kagutsuchi stands ready, hand on sword, as he looks at the furious overseer.

317252058.content: I'm very sorry for all that has happened to you. Unfortunately, I'm going to have to make things worse. It's a little bit personal now.

317252059.content: Kagutsuchi whips out his blade. Its dark tip flashes from weak point to weak point like some evil spirit and, before the ash has settled, Kagutsuchi is gone.

317252060.content: The momentary chaos in the arena is soon calmed and order restored. The duels continue.

317252061.content: Karasugo Sendou looks down on the ring from his stand, watching as his best soldiers fall one by one.

317252062.content: Lord! Guards have been sent to detain the escaped contestant. The Bladechoosing can continue.

317252063.content: Make sure he's taken alive. He was able to somehow shatter that barrier and... anyone who can withstand the Madoibi offers our family hope for the future.

317252065.content: The bodyguard leaves and Karasugo Sendou turns his gaze back to the ring.

317252066.content: Execute the witch. Eliminate the incarnation of the Crow God. Complete my family's mission...

317252067.content: Yes. All this must be done.

317252068.content: Have you really imprinted your desires onto all those within range? Such terrifying determination.

317252070.content: The being suddenly appearing in front of Karasugo Sendou is both elegant and demonic. The Karasugo Lord cannot help but feel scared.

317252072.content: Nobody answers his call and he realizes it never left his lips. His body remains fixed in place, motionless and silent.

317252073.content: The bodyguard standing nearby doesn't even react, as if unable to even see the new arrival.

317252074.content: You are the only one who can see me. Please, don't be scared. This has happened before.

317252075.content: The first piece of the image the girl drew has already been removed. And you are the second.

317252076.content: It has been four years, but I have use of you again.

317252077.content: We've been waiting for what feels like hours, but there's still no sign of Shadow Crow. I can sense that we've lost control of the situation.

317252078.content: This is no good. Something must have gone wrong. We can't just wait.

317252080.content: Admin, do you mean we need to head for the Crow's Nest?

317252081.content: Er... I can get us two more rifles. Maybe. I can try, at least.

317252083.content: The worst-case scenario is that we need to go in fighting, despite all the risks. After all...

317252085.content: We stand ready to fight. When I see who is approaching I'm a little surprised, but also feel that things had to be this way.

317252086.content: We're too likely to be found here. I know somewhere more secluded.

317252087.content: Kagutsuchi leads us to a quieter hiding place and we can finally take a moment to relax and let our nerves settle.

317252088.content: I think this is what you're looking for?

317252089.content: I take the bag Kagutsuchi passes to me and I hurry to open it. At long last, I see Mimir. He's hibernating, possibly to keep himself safe.

317252090.content: Thank you... What happened to Shadow Crow?

317252092.content: I look at the bag again and notice the bloodstains. They tell me all I need to know about Shadow Crow's absence. The three agents fall silent and I clench my fists.

317252093.content: Shadow Crow was not the first sacrifice in the fight to defeat the Crow God once and for all, nor will he be the last. We must continue, or those deaths will have no meaning.

317252094.content: I look up in surprise at the youth in front of me. It's a familiar face, but something's different.

317252095.content: Thanks to him, I am free of the Crow God's influence.

317252096.content: And I have revisited my choices.

317252097.content: I know you have many questions for me, but none of that is important right now.

317252098.content: I look back at the sleeping Mimir and nod my head gravely.

317252099.content: I use my access rights to cancel hibernation and Mimir gives a lengthy yawn, as if irritated at being woken early.

317252100.content: How dare you use your filthy hands to remove the best shield tech The Cryptics can invent? I'd be within my rights to counter-attack, you know!

317252103.content: Mimir calms down, seeming to sense from my tone that something important is going on.

317252104.content: I need to reach Kuninotokotachi and the others, as soon as possible. Problem is, they might be in a different dimension. Can you help?

317252105.content: I knew this would happen sooner or later... Okay, Rookie, give me your hand. The Cryptics require I use your access rights to unlock a secret comms protocol.

317261001.content: Whoops, the data's a bit messy. Bringing new module online... that's more like it.

317261002.content: The call connects and Tsukuyomi and Kuninotokotachi both turn to Sekhmet.

317261003.content: Hey, Admin. Long time no call me for help.

317261004.content: Wait, so the only comms terminal I could find in our private dataspace belongs to.. CORG? Hmm. That's less than ideal.

317261007.content: Before I answer that... Have you been in touch with the outside world?

317261008.content: Smart thinking, Sekhmet, I'm glad you read the instructions carefully. Item 2, do not call for reinforcements.

317261009.content: Admin, I hereby move you up a place or two in my league table of Aether Gazer personnel. But you need to remember that we can't contact the outside world.

317261010.content: It's rare for Sekhmet to use such an explicit warning tone and I understand this must be very important. So even though I've got my doubts, I answer in the affirmative.

317261012.content: Sounds like you've gone through a lot, Admin.

317261013.content: That all you've got, Sekhmet? I was expecting a more penetrating analysis.

317261014.content: I was thinking of doing one, but...

317261015.content: Sekhmet glances at Kuninotokotachi, waiting off to the side and dangerously impatient. She hands the communicator over.

317261016.content: So, crazy lady, you can read a room after all. Admin, you okay?

317261017.content: For now, sure. Where are you guys?

317261018.content: That's good. Hard to say where we are. Lost somewhere in a... mazespace? We need to regroup, stat!

317261019.content: I agree. But we can't seem to find a way now...

317261020.content: Kuninotokotachi falls silent. They're still trapped in that dimension and contact with me offers no more than temporary relief. There's no guarantee I'm going to be able to help them get out.

317261021.content: Okay, now we've got the necessary formalities out of the way, maybe we can let the technical staff take over?

317261022.content: Hmph. How do you manage to sound so polite yet be so punchable at the same time?

317261023.content: Despite the barb, Kuninotokotachi hands the communicator back to Sekhmet. It seems like they've been through enough together that they've formed some kind of tacit alliance.

317261024.content: I have tried to reach the outside world, but the dimension we're in is blocking the signal. But if your terminal can reach us here then it must be using a protocol that interfaces directly with low-level Gaea data?

317261025.content: Shu did mention that Mimir had been fitted with a new comms module.

317261026.content: Ahem! Do not divulge top-secret tech info.

317261027.content: If we're dealing with this level of tech I can understand why you want to be cautious. But I don't need to know how it works. I just need some parameters to work with.

317261029.content: For example, signal strength fluctuations during cross-dimensional comms.

317261031.content: It's easy to see this dimension is effectively a sandbox, cut off from both the Source Layer and the Surface Layer.

317261032.content: It can't extend in the same way as those two layers, so it has to be limited in size. But those inside it can be confused by the mazelike structure and that's why we can't find the edge of the space.

317261033.content: If we had some kind of external reference point, we could easily get to the edge.

317261034.content: Your comms signal is making use of Gaea's lowest-level dataflows, which means it isn't affected by this dimension. That makes it the ideal reference point. We need to find where the signal is strongest and break out there.

317261036.content: Hey, crazy lady, isn't that what I said way back when?

317261037.content: I carried out a professional interpretation of your individual reported experience and used it to develop a feasible solution.

317261039.content: I'll thank you if and when we get out of here.

317261040.content: So, Admin, I'm hoping that Mimir over there will permit us to open a two-way channel so we can send you a signal too. That will let us monitor signal intensity.

317261041.content: It's hard to keep a channel open like that. You'd better move quick.

317261042.content: Then let's get started. I'll have Mimir keep comms open.

317261043.content: The longer we wait the worse things could get... We've already got enough bad news over here, I would hate for you to...

317261045.content: Tsukuyomi's voice, suddenly sounding out over the communicator, ends my moment of anxiety and leaves me silent.

317261046.content: Admin, thank you for looking after Pheasant Squad for me.

317261047.content: But there's nothing to worry about now we're both here.

317261048.content: That's the best news I've heard in a long time. I'll wait to hear from you.

317262003.content: Now things get... crude. The data structure at the edges of the space is weak. Even a minor energy blast should be enough to crack it open, if delivered accurately enough.

317262005.content: Tsukuyomi unsheathes her blade and lands a blow exactly where Sekhmet is pointing. There's a sharp flash of electric light and the surrounding space starts to deform.

317262007.content: I watch as Kuninotokotachi and the others emerge from the rift. There's so much I want to say, and so little I can actually put into words.

317262008.content: They, meanwhile, look at the three agents and Kagutsuchi in surprise.

317262009.content: I know you've all got a lot to talk about and this is a safe space for that. But can I suggest we move fast?

317262010.content: You... You're that Mod. Okay, so whose side are you on?

317262011.content: The question forces Kagutsuchi to think for a moment.

317262012.content: It's like I said before. I don't think we're enemies.

317262013.content: Sekhmet looks into Kagutsuchi's eyes and soon reaches a conclusion.

317262014.content: He's not lying this time either.

317262015.content: In that case, the first thing we need to do is swap intel.

317262016.content: The conversation is intense. It adds to the mysteries we face, but also allows us to form new theories. We try our best to figure things out logically and come up with an explanation for everything that's happened.

317262017.content: A meme monster? Quake Damage Control Department? My real identity is constantly engaged in a life and death struggle? Can't believe it...

317262018.content: Initially, you didn't want to sign up for a combat posting, despite your outstanding skills meaning you were constantly being put forward for one. I had to persuade them to give you triple the usual salary to get you on board.
